reviews.text: I do not write reviews often but The Homestead was that good! Quality is the word that comes to mind when I think of this place. The staff were very polite, the atmosphere was perfect, and the food was great. I highly recommend you try Homestead if you are in the area!

Called in a pick up order for the Reuben, Homestead Stack on Ciabatta, and a gluten free cookie. Very reasonable prices and friendly staff. The Reuben is so good, they really stack the sauerkraut on there, and there is plenty of meat as well. The ciabatta roll was perfection, a little crunchy but soft and chewy on the inside. I will definitely be stopping by again, just wish it wasn't on the other side of town because it's the perfect quick lunch spot.

This place is so GOOD! My boyfriend and I love the Reuben sandwich. Everyone is so friendly. I love the little shop in the front and the cute eatery in the back. Everyone is so friendly and I love that you can call and place an order and pick up. Highly recommend this place!!!

Are there another 5 stars I can add? So many others have talked about the friendly service and delicious food. My story is a bit different, in the best possible way. I live in Seattle and was planning on visiting to celebrate birthdays with my parents who are turningg 92 and 94. COVID-19 changed my plans. I ordered  from Homestead via Grubhub since I couldn't travel to take my parents to dinner. Unfortunately Grubhub never showed up. When I called Homestead to explain the situation the manager of the West Lafayette store, Michelle stepped in. It was a Grubhub failure, in no way Homestead's fault.  That wasn't good enough for Michelle. After her long day at work Michelle called me to say she was going to personally deliver a meal to my parents, on her own time, in her personal vehicle. We are all facing a terrible situation with COVID, but this is a business managed by an individual with heart,  who cares about her customers on a personal.level. Also at her own expense, Michelle even brought flowers and a card when she delivered the meal (I didn't ask for that she just took it upon herself to do it). If I still lived in West Lafayette my family would be eating at Homestead every week. You will love the food, but even more importantly this is a business with heart. Thank you Michelle!!!

This place is such a nice addition to my hometown. So much so that I visited multiple times in my last trip home.

Breakfast sandwiches, donuts, snacks, sweets...everything I had there was amazing. 

Employees were so so welcoming, and they have some nice non-food items as well like candles and kitchen utensils that are great for gifts.

Just had their Oreo topped chocolate Bavarian cream filled donut and it was divine! I'm not a huge fan of super rich/creamy donuts but for some reason I just had a massive craving for one, and this totally hit the spot.

So glad I visited this place! This cafe bakes fresh bread but also has a bunch of other goodies for sale. There are candies and preserves in addition to a really great frozen and refrigerated selection. I bought amazing dinner rolls (super moist and fluffy!), cinnamon butter (LOVE), potato salad, peanut butter and M&M cookies, and some amazing cinnamon rolls. Everything was delicious! I'm looking forward to trying some of their soups, pies, and some of their other breads! Truly a gem! Staff were super friendly and there is plenty of parking in the lot.
Using non fresh egg is awful. This foam egg has no taste and ruined my breakfast.  Promoting fresh Hoosier food this is not it.

Recently married I am new to West Lafayette and my husband suggested we meet here for lunch. Oh my gosh--I could go on and on and ON about how delicious the food is here! We were waiting in line to pay so that gave us time to peruse the goods in the freezer--SCORE! I almost don't want to recommend the frosted cutout cookies for fear I will come to buy them and they will be sold out. There are also other freshly prepared frozen meals that I can't wait to try: biscuits and gravy? Yes!  There are no icky preservatives in the ingredients--tastes JUST LIKE what mom or grandma made. And I can't leave out that the place is CLEAN and the staff is attentive and friendly. Five plus stars.

This place is a serious gem!!!  We had coffee/breakfast, and then returned two hours later for lunch.  Everything here is homemade, and you can shop while you wait for your food.  Excellent 'take home' items in the refrigerated section.  And OMG....the pie.  I had two slices because I could not decide between the blueberry and strawberry-rhubarb.  Good luck deciding because you can't.  Best. Pie. Ever.

The Homestead is a great find! Happened to be in the area and this place popped up. The staff was friendly and attentive, and the atmosphere was great. The food was delicious to say the least! The grilled cheese on ciabatta was phenomenal, and the slice of apple crumb pie was a great end to a great meal. I will definitely come here again!

Stopped in for some breakfast sandwiches before the Purdue football game. Wanted something quick. My husband had the griller sandwich on cinnamon bread - I had a bite and it was a great combination!  I had the breakfast croissant with ham, egg and cheese. Also delicious. Prices were a little high - $8 for each sandwich but they were really good with quality ingredients. Place is very non-descript from the outside but super cute from the inside. Friendly staff, clean bathrooms and lots of frozen takeout options.

We found the Homestead in Remington while traveling the backroads of Indiana a year ago. When they told us they were opening a location in West Lafayette we knew we'd be dining there on our next visit. 

While the building isn't as charming or large as the one in Remington, the food is just as good. I had the Homestead Stack and my wife had half a grilled cheese sandwich and the chicken and rice soup. Wonderful. 

The staff was terrific and the prices very reasonable. I'll plan to try out their breakfast on my next visit.

Great place.  Wonderful staff.  Excellent sandwiches, breads, cakes, pies, cookies, frozen meats and prepared entrees.  Jams, jellies and delights of all sorts. We ordered Easter Dinner from The Homestead and everything was absolutely excellent. All hand made and super flavorful.  This place is a local treasure!

Not a huge selection of sandwiches but they are pretty great. Not a lot of sandwich options that aren't chains in greater Lafayette but this place was definitely worth it. Huge selection of baked goods and prepared food too.
Really good. I've had the Italian, Reuben, Homestead Stack, the Breakfast Griller and the English Muffin Sandwich. If I had to choose, I'd go with the Reuben or the English Muffin Sandwich.

Just do yourself a favor & order the coconut cream scone. You will NOT regret it! Also, their monster cookies are something else. And their cinnamon rolls... 
Okay, so yeah, maybe I DO love sweets. But doesn't that make this review even more special.. coming from someone who's very picky with her sweets?
No, but really, everything here is delicious, homemade, and the staff is super kind! Love the homey atmosphere too.

This is a wonderful restaurant where every meal is hand made! I wish they put their Boilermaker Chili on the menu all winter!! Topped with cheese, sour cream and DORITOS! yum yum yum!! Plus a BUNCH of goodies all around the store to buy! Secret gem of a place!!

I had a superb Reuben here for lunch, and could only finish half of it, as the portion size was very generous. 

The space is pretty extensively redecorated from the old bakery, and looks very fresh and inviting. I didn't have time to browse after lunch today, but definitely plan to come back and do so. In addition to breakfast, lunch, and fresh baked goods, they have an assortment of refrigerated items for sale. The staff were all very pleasant and prompt.
Excellent Ruben!  The sides could be a little bigger for the price,  but tasty none the less.

reviews.text:
We have always loved East End grill! This is the first time we have come in a while but they did not disappoint! I got the patemsan crusted Cod special with coconut corn & pineapple salsa and it was stellar! It was so good I forgot to take a picture at first. My hubby got the rib basket and it was just great comfort food like always! 
I had a horrible migraine and they allowed me to come in without a mask. My hubby wore one as required but I appreciate their willingness to allow me that mask exemption. 
They have a great side parking lot for parking.

Update for COVID. For picking up excellent food during the pandemic, East End has it wired. Order for a certain time on their website or on Toast, and when you get there the food is hot and ready, dropped into your car by the friendly, masked crew.

Same excellent quality as in the before times, and something tasty for everyone's taste! Still, by the way, the best burger in Tippecanoe county.

A restaurant that truly cares about the food. I was so amazed by how great the food and specialty drinks were. I'm excited to come back during patio season! I sat in the bar, and the service was wonderful. Very clean place.

Disappointing overall.
  So many good reviews but not what we experienced.
In fact, this was the most disappointing meal we've had in Lafayette.
The ribs were DRY - how do you dry out fatty pork ribs?  The taste was ok but they were almost inedible.
The Shrimp & Grits were terrible.  The grits were solid at room temperature, they use cheap shrimp which were over cooked, rubbery, and poorly seasoned.  The brown sauce/gravy on this dish was the only thing that saved it.
The Pork Belly egg rolls were very good, the drinks were also good, but the delivery was VERY slow.. 
 We could hear and see the martinis being shaken and then watched them sit  on the bar for several minutes.
 Same suspected for the food, based on the condition at the table, it had probably been sitting a while.
  We were so disappointed that we didn't order dessert and we didn't take our leftover food to the dogs. Such a shame.
 I hate to see a small town restaurant get a bad review, but considering it was our worst meal yet, it's within walking distance of our house and we won't probably be going back, they need to address these issues.

The food and service here were really great. The only complaint is that it was way too crowded for COVID. I think the tables were probably spaced just far enough apart to be compliant and it looked like they were at 100% capacity. That said, the food and service are 5 stars.  We had the filet, the Asian shrimp pasta, the Shrimp and Grits and the Trout special. We had a few modifications and they were very accommodating. Really enjoyed the meal!
Fantastic place to eat. Scott, the owner, knows his business well. The shrimp and grits are phenomenal and don't miss the truffle fries with garlic aioli.

We enjoyed our dinner tremendously . Fabulous food. Our server was a little Pompous which rubbed us just a little the wrong way telling us each entree how exactly the chef would make it with no exceptions. Example - said certain steak entree the chef would only prepare it medium rare or medium. I asked "what if I wanted it medium well?" And the answer was NO. I get it but there were several entrees like this presented to us how we could or could not have it. Ever heard of customer is always right? Outside of this slight pickiness the vibe was good and we loved the food just turn down the pompous deal a tad and it will be 100%. Will return and please known we did like our experience

On our way back from Chicago to Indy we were craving a continuation of the fabulous food of the city and decided to veer into Lafayette for a peek at the options. We ended up at East End Grill and immediate lived the interior, the friendly welcome and the menu options. The warm wood finishing a amid the steel helped with noise reduction and the variety of tables gave us an option near the window to enjoy the sunshine.

Our server was fabulous and explained several of the options even going so far as to consult with the kitchen as to how to turn some of the dishes vegan. Her sunny disposition and ease of service was a nice balm after the drive.

The mead spritzer I tried (we abandoned the vegan for vegetarian to try the mead) was delightful and refreshing. I loved the crispness and tart aftertaste.

However the delight was the Brussels sprouts appetizer with a hint of smoky flavor, perfect char on the veggies and a liberal portion of perfectly flavored hummus. This starter was a signal of the flavors to come, as my beet and arugula salad with orange, pepitas and balsamic was so fresh with sweetness and acid mixing perfectly. Then came the amazing, oh so perfect gnocchi. It was a butternut squash base which literally melted in your mouth with such depth of flavor I couldn't stop eating! The additions of capers, spinach and crispy crunch on the toppings just made the dish delightful. I have only had gnocchi this good one other time, and this lives in my tastebuds and dreams. Yum!!

We are already talking about when we will come back as this flavor is worth the drive! Plus an added bonus was a visit from the manager to say hi and check in on us. So amazing! If you haven't been then head on over as East End Grill is not to be missed!
Excellent bourbon drinks, and the food has always been spot on. Hanger steak for me, ribs for my wife at dinner. The burgers are killer for lunch.

My daughter and I recently took a day trip to check out Purdue. After, we stopped for lunch at the East End Grill. We're so happy we did! Josh was our attentive server who enthusiastically informed us that the restaurant makes everything from scratch with fresh ingredients. We decided to have a rather light lunch that we shared consisting of a delicious crab cake, side salad, and the house cut truffle fries with a garlic sauce that stole the show. Crisp, lightly flavored with truffle oil, and dusted with Parmesan cheese....these fries were the best I've had in many years and I consider myself a fry connoisseur. If you find yourself in downtown West Lafayette, make a point of stopping by this restaurant for the fries and friendly service.

One of the few places that does curbside. Their food is fantastic and they package well for transport! Thank you from those of us that are not able to go inside buildings due to medical issues. It's because of you I can enjoy food out!
Always delicious! We enjoy the modern atmosphere and it always reminds us of dining in a bigger city. Fresh menu items, new cocktails, and friendly staff keep us coming back.

We went during lunch and the menu was limited so, if you do see something on yelp that you are just dying to have, wait until dinner. 

Interior decor was absolutely gorgeous! Very well done. I was extremely impressed and the whole time we were eating, we were taking about the decor. So well done and I am applauding you!

Okay, so now on to the main point. FOOD. 

1/5 stars. The best thing we ate, was the truffle fries. And honestly if we got those to go and didn't eat anything else or if we weren't served, this would be a higher rated review. 
Those fries though...I would come back just for those. Hat is off to them for those god sends. 

We also ordered a salmon burger and a cheese burger. Both were terrible and we didn't even eat them. 

Service. -5/5 stars. Our server changed several times. I don't even know if we had a server. Maybe we came during a shift change, but nevertheless at the most, we should have had at max 2 servers. We had at least half a dozen. Step that up.

All in all, order a to go order of Truffle Fries, go inside to look at the beautifulness and leave.
One of my favorite places every time I go to Lafayette! Cozy and romantic with great food and great service!

This location has indoor and outdoor dining options. There are some great drinks here! I had the cornish hen as my entree and found it to be a bit bland. Otherwise, I would definitely recommend checking out the brews they have available or some of the specials for the day.

I had the pan seared salmon and it was the best meal of my life. Our waitress was incredibly professional and very timely. Out food came out perfectly and hot too (hot enough I burned my mouth on my potatoes).

Nice place for dinner when visiting Purdue. Cool vibe & atmosphere. Socially distanced tables and masks are required to enter.We had the rib basket and upgraded to truffle fries, both were so yummy. We also had the shrimp and grits, also very good. The grits were cooked perfectly. We shared the apple crumble for dessert, the perfect ending to a great meal.

Our server, Sheridan, was so sweet, attentive, and helpful. It was our first time and she really made it such a great experience. The drinks were delicious, I had the ribs and my boyfriend had the steak burger. Both were amazing, he really liked the mushrooms on the burger. Dessert was the peach cobbler which was HUGE. Wasn't the typical kind of cobbler I was picturing, but it was very good and again, massive. Definitely will be back!!
Their specials are really good. Love the fried pickles and the ranch dressing is homemade. Wonderful shakes also!

I had the 11 oz special New York strip with herb butter. It came with sautéd onions and blue cheese mashed potatoes and carrots.  I loved every bite of this. It was sooooo good!!!  Hubby had the 14 oz New York strip. He liked the steak but the sauce on it was more like a gravy which is ffine but he did not enjoy. He tried a bite of my steak and said mine was definitely better. His came with mashed potatoes and asparagus. For dessert we had the peach cobbler. It was very good. I had the paddington  drink, it was ok.

reviews.text: It was my first time here recently, and I was impressed! I tried the surf and turf special and it was delicious. Our server was super friendly as well. I thought it was a nice touch that they had a hand sanitizer on every table.

Call before you come if you're here for something specific. I saw a review about scallops which is why I visited. They did not have scallops on the menu tonight. I settled with the shrimp cocktail as an appetizer and crab cakes for my entree, they were good. Service was great at the bar and everything came out fast, I visited on a Thursday. Only giving this restaurant 4 stars due to a hair in my food. They were apologetic and prompt on getting my side remade. I'd come back again if they offer scallops!!

McGraw's has the potential to be special. But it's not. The setting, the building and the ambiance are all good. The food is just not good enough to be worthy of it becoming a favorite. Ribeyes are normally tender, mine wasn't. The add-on "mushrooms and onions" was 95% onions. Our server was very busy and I watched my beer sit at the bar for about 10 minutes...and most aggravating, I watched the bartender use a swizzle stick to stir up a head on it after it had dissipated. That's just tacky.  Prices are reasonable - maybe raise your steak prices a little and buy better beef?  A little effort is all it takes to go from meh to good in this case.

Excellent meal!  Placed at a table with a river view, we started with a pineapple martini and a glass of Malbec; the wine list is extensive, and there are multiple cocktails and beers to choose from.  For dinner, we ordered filet mignon and Chilean sea bass with lobster / cream sauce (nightly special).  Accompanying salads were fresh, and both of us had French onion soup as our side.  Soup was not too salty and had a good amount of cheese on top. Steak was prepared a perfect medium, and the sea bass was flaky enough to not use a fork.  We split a delicious crepe brûlée for dessert.  It's not the least expensive restaurant in town, but we'll definitely be back to try more of the menu.

Poor NYE planning and staffing is driving a lot of the rating. 

Had our party wait for our table while one was empty literally right in front of us. 
When we were finally seated it took 15 minutes to get anyone to even stop at our table!  And that was after we asked for help. 

Our server was very nice and apologetic. 

Food is just average.

Came here on a Tuesday night to celebrate a birthday.  Luckily I made reservations because by the time we left around 7 o'clock the place was completely full
Came here to celebrate a birthday and it was very pleasant and service was very friendly
The fall portion size of the onion strings appetizer is rather small although we were warned it was large we finished the entire order between two people
Be sure to ask your server for specials it may not be on the menu as there were some that night which was good to hear
we were seated right by the window which was nice as it has a view over the river and luckily it was very sunny that day
Parking is ample in their front parking lot
The food quality overall was quite good the crabcakes luckily were not full of fake filler or fake crab or breadcrumbs
The dessert options are plentiful and although we were full we ordered two
We ate one there and took one home to go and both were delicious

McGraw's is a solid destination choice for visiting parents of Purdue students.  It's a little too pretentious and costly to be a good date spot, and has somewhat of a down-homey vibe that does not match the imaginative and sophistication of the seafood-heavy menu.  

Decent seafood is an Indiana rarity, but this Marylander was not displeased.  Service was extremely competent which was a decided plus.  Be prepared to be separated from your money, but its easy to do worse in West Lafayette for food quality, drinks list, and atmosphere.

We found this gem last night after the Purdue/IU game.  Amazing location and setting, fun bar.....and some of the best food I've had in years.  I was pumped to see "Whole catfish" on the menu....You can rarely find whole catfish these days.   The asparagus, rice, and ribeye were all off the charts as well.......very flavorful.  This will become one of our regular establishments- worth every mile of the hour drive.   :)

My wife and I celebrated our 32nd anniversary with a trip here and enjoyed our time and meal. We started with a shrimp cocktail and cocktails. I had the Blood and Smoke...delicious...my wife had the Mojito again delicious. Totally recommend the bar menu, don't think you can go wrong. 

I ordered the fillet (8 oz) med rare. It was fantastic, slightly cooked above what I prefer but the taste was great.   My wife ordered the Walleye and we both enjoyed it. 

Service was great (Sarah). Overall experience was a good one.

Thank you for a wonderful evening. We came here almost 2 years ago after getting engaged and returned this time for our rehearsal dinner with our whole bridal party and families. 
We were looking for a quieter place we could have our whole group and enjoy a really nice dinner together. They perfectly accommodated our group of 28, the service, drinks, and food were perfect, 10/10.

First time. Lots to really like about McGraw's. Very good food, excellent service, neat spot on the river, cool old building. Our foursome had filet, beef tips, linguine, black and blue salad. Ahi tuna poke nachos. Loved it all. Agree with other reviews - steak are cooked at least one click more than your order. Definitely on our WL list. Also looks like good spot to eat at bar and watch sports on TV.

I lived in Lafayette for the first 24 of my life...how tonight was the first time I made it to McGraw's is beyond me!  My family and I took my dad out for an early Father's Day/Birthday dinner and it definitely did not disappoint.

Between us, we ordered calamari, Filet Mignon, prime rib, catfish, teriyaki beef tips, goat cheese mashed potatoes and Brussels sprout petals and everything was fantastic! 

Staff was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.  They were kind enough to take a family picture as well. 

Large windows allowed for a really nice view of the Wabash...as nice of a view as can be ;). Overall, we had a great time and will definitely be back again!
Last few visits haven't been as expected. Most recent visit food was just  average and dining room temp 85 degrees! Not exactly what we anticipated for expense.

For starters this restaurant is sooo ducked off in West Lafayette. Our Lyft driver missed it because it was so dark. They should definitely add some lighting outside. Our server was Tony, nothing short of amazing! He was funny kept the drinks coming, just an all around awesome server! The Calamari was BOMB!!! It was seasoned so well and fried perfectly, I could've ordered three more. My steak was a bit on the rare side but again tony was so great I couldn't complain. The steak was also a bit chewy, I wasn't a fan. My friend loved her burger and fries, she stated the pretzel bun was so soft and it didn't taste like a pretzel (she doesn't like pretzels) and even though the burger was cooked well done she said it was still soooo juicy! My other friend didn't quite like the crab cake (more cake than crab) we're lump crab cake eaters and it wasn't lump. The meal wasn't perfect but the experience was really really nice. I really enjoyed my birthday Thank you Tony!!!

I am remiss in not writing a review here a LONG time ago... We have been coming here since the late 80's when students at Purdue and it was Stiney's with the boat out front... 

There are many steak / seafood places in Central Indiana, but there are very few with the attention to food selection and preparation detail as McGraw's. From simply amazing cuts of beef like an amazing filet, ribeye and more (do not pass up the horseradish sauce that accompanies the ribeye). There is also a special cut off of a ribeye that is simply my go-to but is not on the menu. The catfish is just the same as Stiney's used to serve and a true calling card for this estabishment. The chef also brings in from time to time some of the best oysters from around the country and they DO NOT dissapoint (he was previously at a seafood place in LAF that had the best oysters in Central IN). Great appetizers as well with the Firecracker shrimp highly recommended. 

We are here often and it is a bit like our Cheers of Greater Lafayette. We haven't made a reservation in years and prefer to find a seat at the bar or one of the few bar-side tables. It has a casual vibe and is not pretentious, yet guests in jeans or their dress finest are both seen here nightly. The bar service is one of the best around as well, and Mike the head bar-keep knows what we want as soon as he sees us and never misses the mark. It is normal to see the owner most every night and he clears tables and pitches in no matter if he is in jeans or a tie. It is clear he treats his staff well, and the longevity of them speaks volumes. 

Yes we are very partial to McGraw's and yes we frequent it often. It is truly our type of place and there is no better place for us to spend an evening together for dinner or to just grab a drink and enjoy ourselves.

We called for a reservation in advance. We arrived on time. However, we waited for 20 minutes on seats with no one ever come and ask. I felt so disappointed about it. Maybe because I am an Asian? Idk but very angry.

Lovely little restaurant by the river. The serving staff was kind and the atmosphere very relaxing. My son's steak looked great and he said it was tasty. The charcuterie board was nice but not amazing. My husband had a fish dinner, he said he would order the filet mignon next time as it would better suit his taste. I ordered a French onion soup which I would not recommend but the strawberry and fennel salad was fresh. That's really about all I have for this restaurant.

I was visiting from Denver.  We have family around this area.  My food was very salty.  It's a bit pricey for a little above average food.  Intimate atmosphere.  Our server seemed forced to be nice.  Restroom near front entrance was gross.

I can't believe this isn't on the top ten list.

When traveling, I almost always look to avoid the chain restaurants and try to find an old-school simple, delicious restaurant. In West Lafayette, IN, the top choices included Logan's roadhouse, Outback and Mountain Jacks. McGraws sounded right in my wheelhouse but some of the reviews made me nervous. I went anyway and was extremely pleased. It has a nice ambience, the service was just right and the food was excellent.

I've heard many of my friends talk about McGraw's as one of the nicer restaurants in the Lafayette area, so my boyfriend and I decided to go there for dinner on the night before Valentine's Day.

If you have not been here before, I recommend using a GPS so you don't miss the turn into the restaurant, especially if you have a late night dinner reservation.

The restaurant interior is very nice. It has a very home-y feel. The bar is situated in the front of the restaurant, and towards the back is a nice dining area where windows are so you can see the view of the Wabash River.

We ordered two appetizers, the smoked salmon on wonton skins, and the calamari. They both came out very quickly, much to our surprise. The smoked salmon was very good, although I think that it was a bit difficult to eat as the crispy wonton skins would break apart as soon as you took the first bite. My favorite appetizer, however, was the calamari. It is quite a large plate, enough for two or even three people to share, but it was so good we ate the whole plate! The sweet and spicy sauce that comes with the calamari is also an excellent complement with the dish.

Not much longer after we finished devouring our appetizers, we got our entrees. I had ordered the ahi tuna dish, medium rare, that comes black pepper crusted atop a bed of spinach and slices of avocados. My boyfriend had ordered the ribeye steak, medium rare.

The tuna was cooked well, and tasted fresh to my surprise. My sides were linguini and steak cut fries. The linguini didn't have very much tomato sauce (which I enjoyed since I do not care for much sauce with my noodles), and the steak fries were crispy and not very oily like most fries tend to be.

The next time I go, however, I will order the ribeye. The few bites of the ribeye that I sampled were absolutely divine. The meat was a very good cut, tender, and had been seasoned and marinated well.

You would think that we were full after finishing al of our food, but in fact, we ordered two desserts! The chocolate lava cake and the raspberry cheesecake. We took them to go since the restaurant had closed, but even at home we were able to enjoy both desserts. Leave room for dessert, they are delicious!

For all the food we got (2 appetizers, 2 entrees, and 2 desserts), the total came to a little over $100, but for the quality of the food, service, and of course, the occasion, I was extremely satisfied.

I definitely would recommend this place to anyone celebrating any occasion, graduations, anniversaries, birthdays, or even just to treat themselves!

Oh, and on the way out, there is a step. Do not be fooled. There is a small sign, but you will be so full and wanting to sit down in the car and digest that you won't even notice it. I almost fell, but if I did fall, I would have fallen a happy customer.

reviews.text: Food was delicious, atmosphere modern, and service great.  Menu could use a little expansion but that may be due to current pandemic. The food options they had are very tasty.  I look forward to going back often

We are staying at the Union Club Hotel (beautifully remodeled) and decided to dine at the new restaurant here...so glad we did!  The ambience is great, and the food was spot-on delicious.  My son had the special of the night, an 8oz filet with crab and Hollandaise sauce.  He said it was excellent.  My daughter only had the French onion soup but declared it the best she has ever had.  I had the vegetarian wild mushroom bolognese which was plentiful and very yummy!  Our son is a sophomore at Purdue, and though Covid-19 will limit our travels here in the months ahead (from California) , when we do visit him, this will be a must!  Also, my prickly pear margarita was great, so I ordered it twice, so count on the cocktails hitting the spot as well! Yep

We've dined here a few times now. Enjoyed most dishes here. They have done a good job with the ambiance. 

The burrata app is great. We get it all the time. I've tried the scallops (4/5), chicken entree (5/5), salmon (4/5) and the filet (4/5).

As a Purdue student, all the way from undergrad to master's, it's a refreshing change of scenery to see a "gourmet" restaurant at Purdue.
However, that's just about it. The so called "American Wagyu" beef is probably raised in some random farm middle of the cornfields with no significant difference to the ones from Walmart.
The worst was yet to come. The spaghetti was so tangled up it was as thick as my index finger. The portions made me wonder if I have ordered from the kids menu... giving portions that match Michelin three star doesn't mean it make it so.
One star for the setup
one star for being an Purdue student
One star for fixing us with a new plate, which showed that they could do better
That's just about the limit of my generosity.

First time trying this newish spot in town. Placed an order online for pick-up. The place was bustling on a Saturday night. Loved the ambience - not too noisy, mood lighting, decor is gorgeous! The bar and restaurant area are separate. There is also a place to to grab coffee/snacks if that's all you're in the mood for.

We tried the following from their dinner menu:
1) Burrata Cheese with apricot mostarda, truffle honey, marcona almond, grilled rustic bread. The combination of the cheese + apricot is delicious!
2) Shoestring fries
3) Wild Mushroom Bolognese - I really enjoyed this dish. Not usually one to go for pasta, but this was definitely worth it. Very flavourful. 
4) Mille feuille - very tasty. The pastry was a little drier than what I'm used to, but I'd still recommend it. 

Portions are good. We shared the above between two people. 

The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because there aren't a lot (if at all any) vegetarian or vegan options on the menu, except for some salad and side items.
Very nice upscale restaurant.  Nice and quiet atmosphere,  Wagu hamburger was delicious and cooked perfectly paired nicely with the pommes fries.  Everything else was good.
Omg! The food is superb Servers are very attentive and polite. Brunch is amazing, I recommend the steak and eggs and their French Crepes.

Visited for Valentine's Day brunch. I noticed the restaurant after being at BoilerUp. Very beautiful setting for a date night, family dinner, or a special celebration. All drinks are made the BoilerUp bar ( corner of the restaurant). We had the Duck Confit Bowl and Bread Pudding French Toast, with bacon and a bowl of fruits. Let me start by saying that if you're a bacon person this was A1! Both dishes were amazing. Will be returning !

This was our first experience at this restaurant. We enjoyed the ambience and the great gathering table that we had for a family of six. I would tell you I was challenged a little bit by the wait time but when the food came out it was all fantastic. The hamburger was very big and the club sandwich was very generous. The quinoa cakes are fantastic and a must. The entire family was happy with their meals but I would say it may be a little pricey for breakfast foods.

Went here with my friends and was lucky enough to have Grace as our server! She was super friendly and knew the answers to all of the questions. I was deciding between two dishes and she helped me decide the braised beef. I'm so happy with that choice, it was delicious. Will definitely be coming back and will hope to have Grace as my server again!

I post a 4 star review with several service related concerns. I'm sure those will be addressed before my next visit. We were seated and remained at an empty table for roughly 10 minutes. When the sever arrived she explained that she hadn't been told she was seated. The other servers and manager need to be aware of the entire dining room experience. After a lengthy apology with many excuses, we ordered drinks and asked for glasses for the water bottle she had brought to the table. Sometime later she returned to let us know the bar was backed up and our drinks would be out soon. We ordered an appetizer and again asked for water glasses. Sometime about 20 minutes after being seated, we received glasses for the water with another excuse that they were out of clean glassware. Of course the dozens of clean glasses sitting on the tables around us might have been a suitable alternative. No manager ever approached the table which meant they either weren't aware of the botched greeting process or didn't think it important to address the situation. Our drinks arrived and we settled into the experience. I had a simple martini. Presentation is 10/10. We shared the escargot. The dish was piping hot but the escargot was a bit chewy. Probably overcooked but the flavors were great. I had the seared salmon with lentils. The salmon was a perfect mid rare, lentils slightly mushy but good flavor. The server didn't suggest a starter. Another guest had the burger and said it was great. We requested dessert menus from the server. After checking out the options, we settled on the bread pudding. As we placed our order, she let us know that they were out of bread pudding. Hopefully a lesson learned: tell your guests you don't have certain items before leaving a menu on the table. We had the key lime pie which was great! I applaud the staff knowing that they are all in the hospitality program and learning as they are in the job. However, the prices don't reflect a learning environment rather a fine dining experience. Managers, if still in the learning process, need to do a better job of coaching and following up with the guests throughout. Looking forward to great food and improved service in the future.

Refined dining experience ideal for the professor and family, well trained staff hosting menus from next door Leaps Coffee and Boiler Up Bar, well tailored menu infringing on the wall in substantial ways, and a classy atmosphere with all of the right touches to enhance the dining hour. Our group of 5 was treated very well and took to all three menus. I noticed the prices for breakfast entrees and cocktails are downtown Chicago - not a $10.00 easy going fillup for either beverages or eggs! If this was a big city establishment, it would fit right in. With amazing morning egg spots offering more value like Town & Gown and Sacred Grounds, I'm sadly not sure I'll be here often despite the ideal menu options, designer interior, and delightful fare. They need a proper discount for local Purdue alumni! We all did a smattering of options from crepes, duck, and quinoa, couldn't complain about flavors or presentation. Can highly recommend the drinks and quinoa cakes were excellent. Thankfully the best value here is Leaps Coffee and their in house mixes. Ask what they're making! I'll have to save up and come back for a special day.

Delicious food and great atmosphere. We had the crab croquettes which were superb! Then I had the halibut as my entree and... wow so many great flavors! Then we had the key lime pie for dessert which was deliciously light with bright flavors. We will definitely be back for more!

Loved the food so much that we ate here for both nights that we stayed at the Purdue Union hotel. Great food, friendly staff, and great ambiance. Will def dine here again the next time we visit our son.
Great place to eat and drink! Campbell the bartender make the best Bloody Mary's I've ever had. She's also a great server / bartender with a lot of knowledge on the restaurant.
Simply fantastic.  Great atmosphere, solid menu, and the food was as expected.   Escagot, steak tartare, ceasar salad, salmon, braised beef, key lime pie met those expectations.
What an amazing restaurant! This crab croquette is one of the most delicious things I've ever had. Our server Jessica was so kind, easy to understand and super helpful. Love this place.

LOVE LOVE 8ELEVEN! I've been here 4 times since it's opened and couldn't recommend it more. The atmosphere of fun and modern. The food is exquisite! My absolute favorites are the Crab Croquettes, Pear Margarita (had at a previous visit), Diver Scallops and Bread Pudding. Our waitress, Jessica, was so hospitable and took very good care of our table. I would come back again in a heartbeat.

We had an excellent dinner during move in weekend for Purdue. Our server, Hanna was the best. She even spent time giving us insights into the area. Food we had was fantastic and cooked perfectly.
We will definitely be back when we are in West Lafayette visiting our son.

Big fan of 8Eleven. We have been here several times. Excellent place to post up if you're pre-gaming. The bar appetizers are perfect. Very tasty. Try the duck spring rolls and sliders. Service is great here as well. The breakfast and dinner are both true 4 stars as well.

reviews.text:
We had such a wonderful birthday experience at Revolution Barbeque! Lafayette can sometimes feel like it's lacking in good, solid restaurants that know what they're doing, but I can say, whole-heartedly, that Revolution Barbeque has all the knowledge.

We sat-in the restaurant, despite their booming carry out service, and enjoyed our time with all of the other patrons. For a Thursday night, they were surprisingly busy! There is a main dining area and then a craft bar area to the other side of a bricked wall. We opted for the bar area which had some dimmer lighting and a moodier ambience. We were immediately greeted by the bartender and my partner ordered a special bourbon cocktail. Whoever made their cocktail menu definitely knows what they're doing, because you'd have assumed you were in Chicago or Nashville. A bit pricey for Lafayette standards when you're staring at the menu, but just bite the bullet and order the drink, because they're well worth it. Beautiful presentation and such a nice experience. I would say Revolution Barbeque would be a nice place to come and just have a drink, but... how could you resist NOT eating something?

The food came and we were so impressed. We had actually ordered 3 sides between the two of us, however they mixed up our orders with another tables and made good by correcting our order and providing us with an overall total of 5 different sides to try out! We had the mustard greens, the Mac and cheese, the baked beans, the slaw, and the potato salad. Now, I am probably the pickiest eater under the sun, but I can tell you, whoever is cooking this food knows how to make a damn good side. The sides with the waffle corn bread were outstanding. I mean, straight out of the south. And, at a BBQ place? To rave about their sides? That's saying something. I had never had mustard greens and they were stellar and something I'd eat any day. The baked beans were out of this world. The Mac and cheese was amazing. I don't know what was in the corn bread, but I can say it's safe to say that it should be illegal, because I'm sure it's highly addictive. 

I am not a meat person at all, however the BBQ was so rich in flavor and so finely crafted. I never eat an entire sandwich and I can say I downed mine within a couple minutes. Granted, it comes with a lot of meat, so I pushed a bit to the side! Now I have leftovers for this evening's meal. 

Such a nice experience for a birthday meal and such a nice addition to downtown Lafayette. They have the sweetest and funniest staff who help you pick everything you want, and they have incredible food with great drinks and a fun environment. If I could give 10 stars, I would.

We bought takeout here for lunch on a Friday in April 2021. We bought two brisket plates and each came with two sides plus cornbread. Our four sides were sweet potato fries, mac and cheese, baked beans, and coleslaw with vinaigrette. Everything was outstanding including the cornbread that comes in the shape of a waffle. Highly recommend this place. It will be a routine stop for us.

We ordered takeout and opted for the Friday special of the day, the Smokehouse Burger. It's a burger topped with pulled pork, cheese, onion and strawberry habanero sauce. The burger had a very generous amount of toppings, and the bun was homemade. It was a great combination of flavors! We loved the sauce, tasted like strawberries on the front end and then hit you with the heat. We opted for the creamy slaw and potato salad as our sides. The slaw was crunchy and not too sweet or soupy. The potato salad had a great texture and flavor. 

Service was quick and friendly. They had my order available to pickup in 10 minutes.

This was such a great find! My husband and I love barbecue and this restaurant totally nailed it. The interior of the restaurant is absolutely gorgeous with rich, brick walls. The bar looks super cool too!
We started with Whiskey + Cherry Coke and Winter Sangria slushees, and they were amazing! Wonderful flavors and the consistency was perfect.
For dinner, we shared one of their platters -- the pulled pork, but we also added the brisket to it. We got sides of potato salad and Mac n cheese. The platter came with Texas toast as well. Everything was DELICIOUS. The brisket and pork were more traditional -- slices of brisket and roughly pulled pork, which we really liked. The Mac n cheese was also....incredible. 
The meal came with four barbecue sauces -- the mustard and strawberry jalapeño were my favorites, and my husband was happy with their original. They also had a hot barbecue option!
The bartender was our server and he was very attentive, making sure that our needs were met throughout the meal. All in all, it was a great experience!

I want to share an experience to let you know the kind of people that own this business. Out front of the bar side door is a metal plate covering a chute the goes to the basement for deliveries. In September my family chose to go to Revolution for lunch. 5 of us. As we walked, my 70 year old mother hit the plate wrong and fell in to the chute, dropping 2 feet in to the ground, and seriously bruising her arm (which was x-rayed last month and STILL has a large lump under the skin). 

The bartender cam running out, and SAW my mother in the whole. The street crew doing maintenance across the street also saw, and two pedestrians came running to help her. The bartender went to get the owner. There were 6 eye witnesses. 

The female owner came out and looked at the plate and kept saying that "she just didn't see how that could possibly happen," and kept insinuating that this was my mother's fault that their pitfall in THEIR property was not secured. I have included pictures of the plate that were taken later that week when you can see they were attempting to fix it. This was one of the days of outdoor dining downtown, and there are no cones or anything marking this hazard. 

Unbeknownst to this woman I WORKED in this same building when it was another restaurant, and it was always a concern someone would be hurt on this plate. One person had fallen in before. 

The owner went about downplaying the incident, and saying she just didn't understand, and she would need to talk to her husband. We had to FORCE HER to take our number. 

Her husband never did show up. She never owned she was at fault (even after my mother said she would never press charges because her father had owned a small business). She didn't comp the lunch (which was marginal at best), she didn't comp half the lunch, she gave us three pieces of pie and never said another word. 

They never called to express concern, or follow up. She could have sued Revolution and the city, but she didn't. Even after two injuries that could have been very serious had she completely gone down the keg chute. These are not good people. Do not give them your money. You can make BBQ just as good at home and not give a profit to unkind people.

Exquisite urban environment with lots of space and very family oriented staff. My buddy and I tried out Revolution for the first time this week and overall had decent things to say. Thankful that the prices don't take advantage but noticed that my buddy's order of ribs surprisingly made it out of the kichen, extremely fatty and lacking flavor, required a lot more digging and scraping then restaurant ribs I have become used to that rather fall off the bone with a few pokes and nibbles. Surprisingly Cheddar's comes to mind as some of the best ribs in the area. He should have ordered the pork or copied me for briscut! My 8oz was tender, nicely seasoned, soft enough, quite generous with the sides too unlike *cough* the new Ripple place nextdoor *cough* - I made the silly rookie mistake of saying beans for a side meaning the green beans but ended up with the basic beans. Would have been fine but the heavy beans along with my wonderful thick chili made for rich sides, filling n all but I'll do the slaw next time. I sampled the potato salad, rave reviews easy! The bar area is a splendid mix of classy and neat, great specialty slushies for the refined adult still trying to grow up. Of course I got the whiskey root beer! So good! Stuff of pool parties in fancy beach houses, a good size too, overall fitting well with the meats. Ended with an apple pie because they were out of banana cream (weeping), crust was very crusty and filling quite sweet, still easy to eat. Despite the weird turnout with the ribs, we both agreed we will have to come back and sample more of the menu to make sure the ribs were not just a fluke.

Finally got to try Revolution BBQ! I came here for lunch with a friend. We had both heard great things and wanted to avoid the dinner rush. I've heard they can get super busy. Atmosphere is great! Lots of space in the building. Industrial feel and cool bar area. Menu is nice, with some delicious sounding appetizers and sides. I had the brisket taco, pork BBQ taco, Mac-n-cheese, and featured lemonade. Damn. The Mac-n-cheese was spot on. Tacos were very good, but I liked the pork one the best.

Sauces are tasty, but wanted more heat. Strawberry habanero is not spicy at all. My friend had the smoked chicken sandwich, sweet potato fries, and a bourbon pecan chocolate pie to go. She enjoyed her food. They make house buns for sandwiches! Overall, awesome experience. Highly recommend.

Stopped by this cute joint for dinner.  Shared a bbq plate with two sides and extra meet and it was plenty of food for two.  The brisket was moist and flavorful.  The cornbread was a little waffle.  There were many choices of bbq sauce the origami and hot were both good.  The Mac and cheese was amazing.  They also have a beer and a shot for $5.  How can you go wrong?

Lafayette is (surprisingly) full of good food, and the barbecue is no exception at Revolution. The food here is stupid good, especially the brisket and the pulled pork. Also be sure to give their drinks a go. Excellent staff, always clean, and quick service. I highly recommend.

The restaurant closes at 9, but the bar is open till midnight. If you're still hoping for a late night bite they feature "bar snacks" in the form of Tacos from 9-Midnight on Friday & Saturday. I've never had anything from here that I haven't liked and these tacos were fantastic. I ordered two, Mexican style (with pico and cheddar cheese), they hit the spot in the Goldilocks way- not too much, not too little, juuuust right. Service was friendly, accommodating to my questions and overall this is one of the best places in downtown!

Maybe my favorite place in Downtown Lafayette. 

Great Food, $5 dollar shot and beer combo, and great staff that won't give you the cold shoulder.

Stopped in during Lafayette Fresh Air Eats. Perfect weather, Great food, price a little higher ($28 for two sandwiches + drinks) but was justified by the quality of the food.  The portions of brisket and pulled pork were generous, and the sides of mustard greens and sweet potato fries were ample.  The meats were some of the best barbecue Lafayette has to offer, in my experience.  

I hope this place is around for a long time!

We went for a late lunch today and we were not disappointed! The restaurant was very spacious and clean. The girl working the counter was able to answer all our questions and made recommendations. The food was very good and full of flavor. There are several different bbq sauces to choose from. I can't wait to go back!

Sampled an assortment of sides with brisket. The brisket had big portions but seemed to be pretty fatty. All the sides were hearty and tasty. They were out of grits which I'd love to try! Another customer also recommended their tacos as best on their menu. It was extremely busy so takeout was 20+ minutes late. They did give out free bakery items for those waiting. Just order early for takeout :)

Just enjoyed another great meal at Revolution. We ordered the brisket and ribs.  Perfectly cooked.  All the sides we chose great as well. On our weekday schedule now.  Recommend highly.  Service is always good

We enjoyed our time here last night.  We sat outside and enjoyed the great weather while drinking their homemade strawberry lemonades.  Their brisket was delicious! You can pick a few different sauces with your meal-I tried their original bbq and peach mustard, both were sweeter than I expected but still yummy.  Their baked beans, potato salad, Mac n cheese, and homemade pickles were also great.  We will definitely be back!

Delicious food. Try the Duck!! Everything was perfect. Service was exceptional, and I would recommend this place for any smokehouse bbq expert--very family-friendly and a great selection of spirits. The Conguito Slushi is delicious.

More like 3.5! The food definitely wasn't bad by any means, just not really what I expect from a barbeque spot. (I'm from the Carolinas for reference) I do super appreciate the addition of outdoor seating and will almost certainly return to the bar once COVID dies down.
The smoked chicken was pretty good. Only complaint is that the house bbq sauce tasted extremely strongly of cumin? It wasn't like any bbq sauce I've ever had before.
The mustard greens were gritty. You really have to wash those suckers.
The cornbread was surprisingly good. It was definitely the best thing on my plate.

The service was excellent. Unfortunately the food wasn't. The place had come highly recommended. The pulled pork was almost entirely fat. The brisket was dry. Although it had good flavor and the bbq sauce was great. The highlight was the S'mores pie for dessert which shouldn't be the highlight for a BBQ joint. $45 for one meal, 2 soft drinks and 2 Desserts was a not a good value for mediocre food. I might try again but my wife won't.

Tonight my family are at Revolution barbecue and enjoyed every part of the experience. Their loaded tots were fresh and delicious, as were their house fried pickles. We tried each meat that was served in a taco and was thoroughly impressed by how fresh and delicious they tasted. We also had a blackberry chocolate pie and a salted caramel chocolate pie. Both were the perfect amount of sweetness and richness. We. And wait to come back and enjoy more of theirs fabulous entrees.

reviews.text:
Family ordered take out from here last night trying for the first time. Ordered online and got our order correct. For starters Pretzel Bread Sticks  with the white cheese were surprisingly good. Boom Boom Cauliflower was very good as well. Main Entrees: Hand Battered Chicken Tenders, CountryFried Chicken and the North Atlantic Fish were all really pretty good too! Wasn't sure when first looking at them as were pulling out of the bag but was pleasantly surprised. Everything tasted fresh and great flavor. Will say only downfalls we found was Mac and Cheese sides were really flavorless and tasted like plain noodles and the chocolate cake was very disappointing. Cheesecake was enjoyable though. 
Would definitely try again.

Very nice atmosphere and friendly staff. Service was quick, even when the restaurant was packed full of guests. I ordered the jerk chicken tacos. The plate itself was very appealing, flavor was there; although, the contents of the tacos were dry. Could have used some more sauce or more moist chicken. But would definitely return and probably order a different dish.

I never cared for Scotty's, so had higher hopes for the new Wolfie's. We try to give new places a couple of chances. And we will here, too. 

First off -- great customer service for takeout ordering. The woman taking our order was friendly and patient with questions. She was a bit unfamiliar with the menu, but we worked through it. And upon arrival, the food was ready and everything was there. So props for that. 

Do wish they had curbside pickup parking. Would make things much more convenient. 

Food wise -- the fried chicken and mashed potatoes with pepper gravy was really tasty. Five stars. And the coleslaw was really good, too. 

Sadly, the rest of the meal was less exciting. Shrimp tacos had plenty of shrimp, but it was not at all seasoned. There was an almost laughably small amount of avocado on each taco. Boom boom sauce was good, but the pico de gallo was overwhelmingly jalapeño. And that dominated every bit. It was like just eating a jalapeño straight with no flavor complexity at all. 

Similarly the jalapeño creamed corn (a fried chicken side) had no other flavor. The sweetness of the corn does not come through at all. Nothing but jalapeño. 

The Mac and cheese was dry and flavorless. It seemed like it might have a spicy kick to it, too? Or maybe our mouths were just burned by other dishes. Hard to say.

My burger was burnt tasting charred and crispy;  the Kale "salad" is actually a bad tasting pre-mixed slaw. Soda is flat.
We both left the restaurant feeling sick.
reviews.reviewerLocation: Central Oklahoma City, Oklahoma City, OK

reviews.text:
Tried Wolfies for takeout on a Thursday evening. We were going for a seafood theme seeing as how they have a bunch of seafood options. Calling in to put the order was easy. Food was ready in about 20 minutes. Wish they had curbside pickup. 
The food itself was decent. The blackened tilapia sandwich was good, with the boom boom sauce, but the fish and fries was not my favorite. On top of that, they separated the fish rather than leaving it whole. Definitely not a fan. Portion sizes were decent. Prices were okay but the food definitely didn't leave me wanting to come back for more.

First time inside a restaurant for two of us. Worried that sports bar atmosphere might equal boring food. Not so! Steak and shrimp perfect, salmon dish delicious, pan crusted chicken done just right! Generous sides included in very reasonable prices. Excellent server. We are not done with this restaurant!

Delicious food, great service, and welcoming atmosphere make this place a great new addition to Lafayette and West Lafayette. My burger was cooked perfectly and was excellent. The soy Brussel sprouts are delicious as well. My girlfriend said the pan crusted chicken was delicious too.

A decent replacement for the favorite area burger house called Scotty's we had for many years at this location. Wolfies offers an enticing menu with good options however prices and food size are not as ideal as Scotty's offered despite the extensive beverage options, fantastic service, and accommodating atmosphere with a dirty monotone color pallet covering the ceiling and bricks all over the walls. Our best part was the bang bang shrimp app! Super tasty and perfectly made, follows by the lesser dishes, my ahi tacos and my friend's buffalo wrap. Both well thought out, presenting solid appetizing flavors and smells, but ultimately not serving up a massive win to keep us out of other near by places like Town & Gown, The Pint, or Red Seven. My buddy wasn't a fan of the powerful wasabi in my tacos even though I loved it exactly for that! We both agreed the Buffalo wraps were small for the price and oddly (unlike my wasabi treated tacos) lacked the bite buffalo should have. The sides were very nice, mac and cheese and coleslaw did us both well. Our drinks were also fine however my cucumber gin and tonic blew the doors off the desserts and everything else we got alongside our main dishes. Speaking of desserts, I completely forget either of our dishes except by the photos it looks like we tried the cookie and monkey bread. I seem to recall they were both average. Overall this feels like a grown up Buffalo Wild Wings! A few hits but would be better having a good group to enjoy the game, know the best dishes before hand, and figure out what will get us full before assuming $14 tacos is a packed dinner meal.

We tried this place out on a weeknight.  Wife said her salmon was cooked to perfection. And the Brussels sprouts were great also.  Her broccoli was old and yellow tho.  I had crust pan chicken. It was ok but not anything special. Onion straws were my favorite. Mashed potatoes were average at best.  Overall. We probably won't b back .  Could have paid less with sirloin steak and such at Texas Roadhouse. But waitress was excellent help.
NEVER GET THE "NEW OLD FASHIONED". Other than that the food is great. Burgers are amazing, wings are awesome, and the meat falls right off the bone of the ribs.

We have been to wolfies in Indy quite a few times...the Geist location is great. This location...not really. Took over ten minutes to place a drink order. Food was just ok. I'm not impressed at all with this wolfies and probably won't go to this one again.

Had One of their signature fish dishes. The mashed potatoes were delicious and the fish was somewhat rubbery which would indicate that it wasn't fresh fish but frozen previously. The Decour inside the place is nice the staff was very friendly but I'll need to eat other food to decide whether not this place deserves a higher rating.
Great black and bleu burger! Cool atmosphere. Good service. I'll definitely be going back

This is located in what was formerly Scotties. The staff are prompt, there is indoor and outdoor dining, and the tables seem properly distanced or blocked off for social distancing.
The food is lacking. We got the soy brussell sprouts (way too salty), and other dishes that were unremarkable.

reviews.text:
Whenever I'm in the Lafayette area, I HAVE to go here to get the Duane Purvis burger and root beer. Its so good!! I wish they would open a location in Indy!!

The Duane Purvis burger is a burger with peanut butter. Do not be closed minded about this and just TRY it if you think it sounds gross. It is the best, and they load the peanut butter on there!! Wanna make it even better? Be like me and add an egg on there. It will make your soul and tastebuds happy. Don't forget the root beer- always have to buy a six pack from them as well!

The inside of the restaurant is pretty small and cramped, but they have added outside seating tents for COVID. So if you like having a little elbow room, maybe try sitting outside. Never had bad service here either!

I will give Triple X four stars because it's an iconic member of the Purdue landscape, a diners & drive in feature and a place with special memories.  The building is special because if
It's location, styling and age.  It's noting special.  Actually a lot of the memorabilia that was on the walls is now gone.

Non-breakfast items are interesting as many are named after famous Purdue alumni meal preferences.  I personally recommend the Duane Purvis - hamburger with peanut butter.  Sounds gross but it's delicious!!

On this occasion we went for breakfast.  My wife ordered the veggie omelet.  She was impressed with how many veggies were inside.  She said the hash browns were the best she has ever had.  She also ordered Triple X jam...a hand made jelly with a root beer taste...very unique!!

I ordered the ham and egg sandwich.  This sandwich featured real ham...no pieces of Canadian ham.  The sandwich was okay...nothing really special.  I also ordered the biscuits and gravy.  The biscuits are purchased but still soft and tasty.  The gravy is a bit thin without a distinctive taste.  The gravy does have a decent amount of sausage - about some in every forkful.  I put a decent amount of pepper on it to jack it up more...it just doesn't have a distinctive taste.

Triple X now takes credit cards. That is a positive change.  

They have made several covid changes.  They have plexiglass around the countertops.  QR code's are how you get your menu.  They installed outdoor tent seating and require two seats between cust Owens at the counter.

On the down side...they still require you to stand in line to pay inside the building.  There is no room to social distance here.  The cashier takes phone orders which backs up the customers trying to pay.  I was also disappointed that the waitress didn't wipe down the condiments and salt & pepper shakers after we were finished.

I can't believe I've been going here for 4 years without ever writing a review. With the Covid we had to sit outside this time. Because of that they are now taking credit card!  Usually cash only. I had the Boilermaker Pete this time. A triple cheese burger with onions. The wrapper was so soaked in grease, you could see the burger through the paper. That's a really good drive in burger. Had fries and a root beer with it.   If they served fried with the burger I would have given them 5 stars, but since the burger cost $10 without, they are getting only 4. 

A solid 4 bellies on my 5 belly scale.

I found Triple XXX by signing up for an Indiana tourism email with a link for 20 Destination Restaurants in Indiana. Also, Guy Fieri has visited Triple XXX on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives. There was plenty of intrigue.

The building is black and orange and the name very eye-catching if your mind is in the gutter. The name refers to the highest quality of root beer at what was once a thirst station found around the country in the early 20th century. Triple XXX is the last one standing and located very close to Purdue.

I ordered something unusual for me...a root beer! But I felt like I had to order one from here and it didn't disappoint. I have hated root beer most of my life but it has grown on me with this being the best I have had.  It just seemed to have a more fresh flavor.  I also went with the root beer float thar contained real ice cream for a solid win.

Besides root beer, Triple XXX is known for their burgers. Guy Fieri ate the Purvis which has peanut butter on it. That's not for me.  I went with Flash Gordon that had bacon, grilled onions, jalepenos, American cheese, jalepeno ketchup, and 4 sirloin patties!  The patties looked like McDonald's patties but they had a better quality of taste to them.  The menu states they put the meat in flour before cooking.  Curly fries were the perfect accompaniment. 

One destination restaurant down in Indiana and more to go!

Five in our party and here is what we ordered: bbq sandwich and fries, Albuquerque omelet, two orders of french toast, some pancake breakfast (I don't remember the name of) that consisted of two HUGE pancakes, two eggs, and bacon and two root beers. Bill was a very reasonably inexpensive $44.14 before tip for a truckload of food at a sit down establishment that is an icon. With two adults, two teenagers, and a preteen, we could spend close to that at a fast food chain. Food was great, especially the omelet, and the service was fast. Would definitely come here again. As out-of-towners, we were also very pleased with the parking situation. Only complaint was that the bbq sandwich seemed slightly on the small side.
Amazing local Student diner with the best meat/burger. The best Root Beer as it is old school made by pure Sugar cane.
Love this place!! It is a little small inside, but the service is great and the food is even better!

YUMMM!! This is the local greasy spoon for sure with local drive-in flare. Their sides are alright but the burgers and ROOT BEER are where it's at! Seriously, their root beer is a game-changer. Soooo delicious! There are indoor and outdoor seats available. I'd recommend going during the day when it isn't too crowded. Staff are so nice. The location also sells some swag in addition to food.

A West Lafayette tradition, I brought my friend since it's clearly "an experience". The staff was really accommodating and I appreciated the great service. Food was great and I'll be sure to come back to cross other burgers off my list!
Really good, highly recommend the omelets. They have some outdoor seating in personal tents that are fun and private.
The burgers were really good and the fries were nicely salted. The root beer was pretty good too and you can't beat it for the price! We will be back.

Was excited to try this place after seeing it was featured on food network, however I was super disappointed. I ordered a grilled cheese, and was surprised it ended up on a bun with minimal cheese. My husband ordered a burger, it was okay but super thin. We split curly fries and they were okay. My hash browns were supposed to come with sausage gravy, but they ended up "throwing out the rest" because they were closing in 15 minutes... 
overall not impressed. The place smelt like cleaning products and we felt rushed out.

Having to update, not fun! I want to recommend TripleXXX to everyone as THE option for easy going filling in the area. However it isn't worthy of the TV hype. Yes, might be just me: I bet what annoys me brings in the customers. But the breakfasts? Cracker Barrel minus value, an average mess of over processed ingredients just like the college kids make. I have noticed the chili is fantastic. Root beer? It's good. Service? It'll do. The burgers and experience are what get me hot under the snooty Purdue alumni collar. I should have a better undergrad diner! Nearly $10 for a burger with a lil cache of fries? Cash only? No rewards program? Cramped noisy space? 5 Guys right up the hill giving me way more food for my $10 with more space, modern payment options, excellent rewards app, this cannot just be me. I tried an off menu burger with pineapple on it. Fat slice of Hawaiian goodness is magic on beef no matter what you haters say about it also working on pizza. Months later, I still can't believe it was canned pineapple. Watery, mushy, so sad for a restaurant that showed off itself on TV to make Guy cry. OK I know, All Hail Purdue and Boilernation but really, this is my little opinion and ya'll (obviously) are gonna run past me and love this place for all its backwards charm. Allow me a rant because I want a worthy campus burger joint! Well we have it folks: The Tap right up on top of the hill is literally on top of XXX in every way, fantastic atmosphere, wonderful selection of brews (sorry kids 21+), beautiful burgers, pizzas, it's all there just like I dreamed XXX would be. Also Teay's River, best burger and draft selection in the area, take the whole family there, plenty of room. I wonder how long Triple XXX can last like this? Cash, no rewards app, cramped interior, bathroom for 1 mouse, ingredients better served at the Golden M right south, and not the value a diner should be - all these first world problems up against Teays, The Tap, Bru Burger, D.T. Kirbys, Wolfies, Big Woods, AJ's, Town & Gown, Christos, Harry's, Dog n Suds, and even Wendys. Most of those offer all the goods: rewards program, pay with plastic, plenty of space in a modern open atmosphere, superb menu of tasty original foods, and value.

Decent food, and an iconic location on campus. They're a bit of a tourist trap in my opinion, because of all of the fame and recognition they have (especially with the iconic Dine Ins episode with Fieri himself). But it's a place you definitely have to eat at once you're on campus.

This was my first visit to Triple XXX after hearing about it many years ago on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives! I would be lying if I told you that wasn't the main reason I stopped in while I was in the area. 

Overall the service was really good - I did have to wait a long time for my food (everyone around me arrived after me and was served well before me) - but that is the only drawback in terms of service! The menu has many options, however, if you are a vegetarian like me there are few choices - either a grilled cheese or something off of the breakfast menu. I ordered the veggie omelette with potatoes and toast. It was good, and I would order it again. The burgers (one of the things they are known for!) sounded amazing and smelled so good - I would recommend these to any of my non-vegetarian friends! 

The ambiance is very comfortable and the restaurant itself is very unique, but a diner feel that is hard to find these days. This restaurant is worth a visit; I will be back to try the rootbeer!

I am a big burger guy, so I was excited for the chance to try this during a quick visit to West Lafayette after seeing it on lots of Indy best burger lists and DDD. With the high expectations, I was honestly fairly disappointed. I will say I kept it with the original and did not get any of their specialty burgers, so that might have been where I went wrong. My cheese wasn't even barely melted. The sandwich was fairly small. The fries were just okay. I felt like I could've just went to McDonald's next door for a similar burger and probably cheaper. The staff was nice, but they were all cleaning and closing things up long before the restaurant actually closed, so that was disappointing, as well.

Stopped in Lafayette to visit our son at Purdue.  We were told it had a 30-minute wait however time passed quickly and we were not disappointed with their burgers and offerings It's a must stop when you're in Purdue.

Walked in here on a weeknight And not much is changed here in over three decades which is great. Please note this is a cash only place and there are limited car parking spots as well for the drive up.

This place is straightforward no nonsense classic menu for a diner that knows what it does right and it doesn't change a thing. It is great to see healthy mix of high school and college students constantly working here year-round.

This is a landmark in the community and he must stop. It was also featured on a Food Network TV show due to its popularity and high levels of loyalty from the students and the community.

If you're ever in West Lafayette you must go to Triple XXX! Look up on the hill off of 52 and Salisbury and you will see a bright orange and black striped building that's been around for 90 years! What a place to last 90 years and counting. It's not far from the Purdue campus either. They have a 90th Anniversary Celebration going on and the next drawing will be June 29th. September 29th & December 29th are the next drawings. One of the prizes is a $90 Triple XXX gift card! They were also featured on Diners, Drive-In's, and Dives! 

We were lucky and it wasn't crowded. They have counters with stools. No booths. If it's too crowded they have quite a few picnic tables outside. The service was prompt, fast, and friendly! The coffee came in a Triple XXX mug and was piping hot. The biscuits and gravy were excellent. Good prices and good food you can't beat that.

Great quick diner - staff friendly - root beer super good as were the biscuits and bacon.  Corned beef from a can :(, coffee was weak, waffle was good not great :+ country gravy is solid but chic fried steak was midline. - will go back but not tomorrow
