reviews.text: Easy spot for my favorite bar in lafayette, exquisite drink options and local brews, fantastic menu with value and original items, large indoor and outdoor area with simple atmosphere making good times easy. My buddy and I enjoyed the chicken strips and their original totchos - nachos but using tater tots instead of fries, a supreme idea! Major props for thinking outside the box and looking for a quality sour . I love a good sour and have a difficult time finding good ones anywhere. The Mad Dog apricot sour on tap was too good for words. The only issue we had was quite unique being a random locally produced video shown on three of the TV screens so we could not avoid it period it was extremely violent and brutally bloody, no ideal for keeping the appetite or making for an enjoyable dining experience. Both of us were rather distracted and put off our food by the horror. I personally am not a sports fan but I have never wished so much to see sports on the TVs! Hopefully when I come back on Fridays for the poutine it will be a more usual bar time which is exactly what this place should be and easily can be.

I'm an old Boilermaker so I remember slumming across the river to mix with the locals with a Pabst Blue Ribbon.  Now it carries a hip throw back Texan vibe with enough distance from Purdue that it's not ordinary. Margaritas are on tap delivering a suitable punch of flavor and buzz. The vegetarian tacos with beer battered avocados offered a healthy dose of crunchy and smooth. The basic burger is double stacked and buttered for a great point of difference. Enjoyed the spiced fries cooled by a wonderful screened in breeze.  All good for a slightly off-campus-diagonal-from-the-laundromat break from the norm. The staff hustles and that makes my German blood happy..

My husband really enjoyed their chips and queso that he had 2 orders. We also had their salsa, it had a real kick to it and tasted great. I had the steak tacos, they were ok. My husband had the cheeseburger and fries. The burger was nothing extraordinary but he really like their fries.

Traditionally I enjoy a good "dive bar" and this one fits the bill. It is just a few notches below a sports bar due to the taxidermies on the wall.
We stopped in on a Monday afternoon, around lunch time, specifically for the "in honor of the Kooler Keg" tenderloin. Man, was I woefully disappointed. The breading was not cracker crumb, but cornmeal. My tenderloin had hot spots in it, as it it was been cooked in oil after an order of jalapeño poppers. 
I had upgraded to onion rings but they were burnt. 
Sadly this was not the tenderloin I as searching for; a replacement for my beloved Kooler Keg.

Came here on 11/18 in the late evening with my father, who has a service dog (vest, license, tag, the whole nine yards). As he was walking to a table, an employee (red shirt white dude) who was obviously intoxicated walked up from behind, put his arm around him, and asked why he needed a service dog. We informed him it was not legal to ask this question, asked him to maintain social distancing, and walked away to a table. About 3 minutes later, a blonde female employee (not visibly drunk) and a man claiming to be the manager who was incredibly drunk came up (again not social distancing) and asked again why my father needed a service dog. Again, we informed them it was illegal to ask. The manager said it can't be illegal because he likes dogs and would not stop asking. After some back and forth, including both employees attempting to pet and interact with my fathers service dog, they moved on. There was apparently a drag show trivia night, during which dancers were not social distancing and repeatedly danced up to our table dispute us asking her not to. After the third time, when the dancer approached the service dog, my father left the building and we stayed to pay our tab for the three beers we were unable to drink. A fight (verbal, but escalated because of alcohol) broke out between a table of 20 something drunk women who did not like service animals and a table of kind middle aged onlookers telling them to knock it off. We flagged down three employees, including the manager, and asked for our bill. The manager, who was so drunk he was not able to make eye contact, informed us he could not hear us and asked to follow us outside. Outside, he demanded to know why my father needed a service dog. We informed him it was illegal to ask and said we would like to pay our bill and leave. He again said that it was okay because he likes dogs, demanded to know what my father's disability is, all the while yelling and invading our (two women) personal space. We asked him to please back away and to calm down, and in reply he moved closer and again demanded to know my fathers disabilities. Feeling threatened and not being permitted to pay our tab despite pleading to, we walked away. Very disappointed in the staff and general attitudes. I love(d) this establishment and was a pre-Covid regular, but will no longer be returning. I recommend you do the same.

The best part about Lafayette Indiana is the Sixth Street Dive. 

Sure there's Purdue, college sports, and other things around town. But THIS DIVE Y'ALL. This dive is the place to be. 

Aside from having all the beers and spirits you could want, the food is out of this world. I'm talking Mexican and TexMex food that would have you think you're miles away from the border. 

Pork Rinds so fresh and crispy, you'll wonder how you even ate the stuff in a bag. 

Poutine flavors so unique and flavorful, you'll be stalking the Dive's Facebook page to see what the next poutine combo will be. 

Brunch so bomb, you'll wake up on a Sunday to mosey in over to nosh on some Chilaquiles while sipping a delightful Bloody Mary. 

Run, don't walk, and get yourself the meal you deserve at Sixth Street Dive today! 

PRO TIP: if you like spicy, you want to try the house sauce ON EVERYTHING!

I cannot wait to work my way through this whole menu. Honestly, as a Texan living in Indiana, I love this place. It's so nice to find such delicious food that reminds me of home. Andrew was a great server and we had a great time. The fried avocado was phenomenal. Since it's a local place and not far from me, I anticipate being there with some regularity.

Four stars because of the wings!

Dropped by at somewhat of an odd lunch hour one Monday. We got their $12 wings (10 pieces) with Dive sauce and blue cheese as a side sauce. We also tried out their chicken burrito.

Now, the burrito was very disappointing. Just bland, and all the chicken seemed to have ended up on one side of the burrito. Will not be getting this again.

However, the wings were divine. In fact, a week later we went back to get more. The sauce has a unique taste (and you can get extra on the side). Very juicy. $12 is a little hefty for an appetizer but there's a good portion of wings and it can easily be shared between two. 

Try the wings :)

I was visiting my best friend from college and her family (December 2019). She wanted to do brunch here with her, her husband and me. I had never had it before so I was looking forward to trying it. We got seated as soon as we walked in. We got the Beignets and asked for all 3 sauces so I could try it since it was my first time. Apparently her daughter really likes the beignets, so they ordered an extra order to go for her to share with her mom. Then for my meal, I got the Chilaquiles. The staff were friendly. It wasn't very busy while we were there. The food was okay. I'm glad I experienced it since my friend and her daughter like their food, but I would probably want to go somewhere else next time I visit and we go out to eat.

I'll begin by saying that my wife and I argued over this review when I told her that I was hardly impressed after leaving here. Sure, the food was OK, but getting it (and drinks) was like an act of Congress. If I had my way, this place would barely get two stars. But, my wife made some points that were important for her, and she's also a tough customer. So here it goes...

There's a certain irony about this place naming and patterning itself after a Texas landmark -- the lack of service here.  Texas' motto is 'friendship,' and the word 'friendly' is derived from the same word (friend).  Service here on our visit was anything but friendly. In fact, our server barely came around ... and when she did, she quickly darted to the adjacent table (who had questions about a beer) in the middle of my father giving his order. It got to the point that the manager had to step in and take care of our table. Back to that in a minute...

This place is definitely divey, but not in a Sixth Street (Austin) type of way.  If you've been to Sixth Street, you know that the divey places are just that. But this place is more 'Disney' divey. No biggie. 

The food here is actually pretty good. The salsa was surprisingly Texas, as was the queso.  Though fried pork loin (the reason I came here) is hardly a Texas thing (we're a fried beef state), it was good ... served hot and fresh. But if you're looking for sweet tea -- also a Texas staple -- it ain't happening here. And if you get the same waitress we had the misfortune of having, she'll let you know that in a curt tone -- as if she's heard the question a thousand times and is tired of answering it.    

Want any salad dressing here other than ranch or bleu cheese? Forget it. The manager himself told us "We used to have other dressings but they didn't sell." So apparently, a couple of bucks worth of Italian or Thousand Island is too much for these folks.

Should you come here at least once? Perhaps. But don't expect good service ... even if you're a student who's looking to get his drunk on. That said, I'm willing to bet that there are other superior joints in West Lafayette, for food, drink and good times.  And the whole Texas thing here? Don't buy it. We're better than that.

I came here on a Sunday afternoon for a late lunch. Parking could be better, but luckily we found a spot around the corner. 

The menu looks pretty great I definitely want to come back and try more things because I couldn't decide what to get! Ultimately, I went with the fish n chips and my boyfriend got the fried chicken sandwich with tater tots. Both were delicious! I loved their homemade tarter sauce and their fries were better than average in my opinion! 

The only thing I had a problem with was the fact that my water tasted kind of sweet like fruit punch. I don't think my mason jar was fully clean. 

Other than that, I had a great time here! I like that it's 21+ and maybe I'll have a drink next time too.

Long time Dive fan. Great Texican food and they can explain the difference between Mexican and Texican. So it's like dinner and an education.  They  had a tamale special the other day. If you like tamales give them a try. Really good but I've got so many favorites on the menu it's tough to work into my rotation.

I suppose that Valentine's Day wasn't the best time to come to a place that calls itself a dive bar, but our experience was uneven this round. First the good - the beers on tap are exceptional. The "totchos" were a creative touch (think nachos, but with tater tots), and the wings were great (tasty, but advertised as "really hot", and actually quite mild). On the negative side, we ordered blackened chicken 'n chips, and got breaded instead. They were gracious about putting in another order for what we ordered immediately, and left the breaded chicken strips "to snack on" while they redid the order. Both were very tasty.

We didn't expect, and didn't appreciate, the abundance of naked women on the TV screens. The big bearded guy at the sound table in the fishnet stockings and a skirt was also kinda hard to ignore. The entertainment hadn't started when we left, so he may have been quite entertaining. But all around, the whole experience didn't make for a very relaxing, enjoyable evening (for us, at least), and we'll think twice about coming next time.
Once again, met and exceeded expectations.  Best burritos within 300 miles. Green sauce is bueno

I was sad but now I'm happy. I don't know if any place would fill the void that the chicken wings at Spurlocks created when they closed down, but the wings at 6th St dive come the closest; especially with their dive sauce. I've been here many times but never had the wings. Highly recommend!!

I've go here for take out food sometimes since it's in walking distance from my place. Many of the reviews rave about the great food here, but if says the food is just alright. I really like the fish from the fish and chips and their burgers and chicken sandwiches are ok for the price and speed. The tacos are not my favorite. My biggest complaint though is that the fries suck.  Never hot, kind of chewy and bland. They also host drag shows sometimes which is really not my scene. The building is spacious inside though and comfortable. It's a decent place to go for a late night hang out and drinks.

My latest obsession.  TRY.the.TENDERLOIN!  It's the best in Tippecanoe!  Period.  --Or rather,  EXCLAMATION!

This one takes the cake.  

The food emerging from this kitchen is fantastic.  Their steak tacos remind me of Mexico...  Love them!

There is nothing Dive-y about this place!!

Update:  a year later and this is still the best tenderloin I can find in this town! Keep it up folks!
Always love a dinner at this little gem, but decided to go for brunch... and YUM! so trendy & delish!
My fave fish and chips in town! Yummy tacos and good beers on tap too! I love meeting friends here, always a good time!

Went out for live music last night and decided to check it out here.   We used to come here all the time for live music at Clubhouse/Squirrel Cage. 

I can honestly say I can't remember the last time I was here on a Saturday night, 9pm-ish. 

The bar war was. There were lots of large groups out and this is before the music.  It was a good mix of people but there were a lot of 20-somethings.  

I'm not sure who the band was but it was just a guitar player and drummer.  I'm always a fan of bands being set up and soundchecking prior to when they are supposed to start, but this band didn't and that's for another review.  When we arrived, we couldn't tell if they were still having live music because there was nothing set up anywhere. The band could use a better PA system that is more conducive to being able to make out the words he is singing.  

We found seats against the back wall (where the TV for playing video games used to be) and were served promptly.  We ordered food and it was fantastic.  My wife got some stuffed avocado thing and I got a 'Hand-Spanked' burger with tots.   The burger was truly fantastic.  Very reminiscent of the ClubHouse and the portion of tots was more than I ended up eating.  

They always have a good beer selection and post the draft beer list on the back chalkboard.  I like to just see the taps with the handles to make a list but I know it is easier the way they do it.  

Only 'complaint' is that the Men's restroom could use some help.  One of the urinals was out of order and you can tell that it appears they don't put alot of effort into the restroom.  It could use some sprucing up to return it to how cool it was when they first remodeled it.  

I am interested in going back for more live music to see if the sound system other band's bring is any better.  May be a decent, but pricey, investment for The Dive to put their own system in.

reviews.text: This is another of our family favorites! We love the family atmosphere and the food! Cathy always greets me by name and asks about my family. The food is authentic and very reasonable. We are so blessed to have this option! They also have a lovely outdoor patio and a drive through.

I went here for an early lunch today and was blown away by every aspect of this restaurant. It was spotless & you could literally smell the cleaning products they used when you walk in the door. Obviously, with COVID, that's much appreciated. I ordered grape leaves (came with 2), a bowl of lemon rice soup, a side of falafel (came with 6) with tzatziki, and cheese pie. All of this, plus a 20% tip, was only $16!! I had maybe a couple of bites of the soup because I was already stuffed from everything else, but I couldn't recommend it enough. Soup- perfect. Cheese pie- best I've ever had. Tzatziki- delicious & homemade. Grape leaves- flavorful & tender. Falafel- not my favorite but I'm pretty picky when it comes to falafel. Would 100% eat here again. Customer service was great & they had my order ready FAST. Next time I want to try the spinach and cheese pie & see how it compares to the cheese pie.

Parthenon serves some of the best food you can get in West Lafayette for sure! When I used to work in the area I'd buy a stack of pita and a tub of hummus and be set for lunches for the week. The hummus is so light and fluffy- it's my favorite hummus! Their gyros are delicious and super filling.

Service is always friendly and quick. It's such a great little lunch spot; I recommend getting bite here if you're ever in the area.

Ordered dinner online on a Saturday. Ordering was quick but they wouldn't take payment over the phone. Used their drive through for pickup. The food was ok, but nothing really stood out. We ordered the Gyro sandwich with greek fries, feta plate, falafel sandwich with green bean side. Verdict: Maybe if you're really craving greek food.

Came here on a weeknight for dinner.

There is ample parking in the parking lot.  This resto is located in a strip mall and the last place I expected to find authentic Greek food. The owners are Greek the menu is authentic but limited. We ordered the Gyros platter and a salad.

Food came out quickly was hot and delicious this is the only place I have found in Indiana that serves mythos beer.   this beer is authentically Greek and even harder to locate in Chicago.

I would definitely come back and it is an order at the counter style with the food being delivered to your table.

Make the trek to this location for the only REAL Greek food left in this town. They even have a drive through, if you want to call ahead and take it home.

Atmosphere is low key and family friendly. Fun old photos on the walls. They do serve beer and wine, if that's your thing. 

The food is so good! Lemon rice soup is the best I have tried. It has a creamy texture, with a light bite of lemon. The gyro meat is homemade and so is the yogurt sauce! You really can beat it anywhere. Feta chucks on the salad are large, fresh and delicious. They have all of the other Greek favorites you might be looking for, including a sampler where you can try the classics! Try this place!

The food is good, but we decided to stop going here after the owner was really rude to us for no reason. The last time we were there he got angry at us because we didn't have a number on our table. Our cashier didn't give us one and we didn't think to ask (because we don't work there so how the hell are we supposed to know); we told him we didn't get a number and he angrily said "next time get a number!" WTF?! I don't need to be snapped at for no reason, so now we go to the other Greek place because those owners are really, really nice.
Best food from top to bottom of menu.  Gyros are great, but the salads and lemon soup, turkish coffee and desserts are outstanding. The feta plate is perfect!

I really like this place!  I took my daughter and her friend (both college students) here for lunch while I was visiting during the day.   The food was excellent and service was great.  Location is about a 10 minute drive from campus and easy to find!  I wouldn't hesitate to go back.  The ambience was a little sterile and bathrooms needed attended to otherwise I could give this place a 5-star.

Tried it for the first time, yesterday. I ordered gyros and fries. The meat was bland. The tzatziki also lacked flavor, as did the fries.

I would rather get my Greek grub elsewhere, across town.

I first started going to Parthenon at their old location (Chauncey Hill) just under 20 years ago and it is still a must-visit when I am back in the area.  Don't let the (new-ish) fast casual chain look fool you, this place is a long time family business that takes their food quality and consistency seriously, run by great people.

The gyros meat here is exceptional: plenty of lamb flavor, made in house (very rare, 99% of Greek/Med/etc restaurants serve mass-manufactured gyros from Kronos), sliced very thin, and always browned nicely.  The rest of the menu is mostly very good as well, but the gyros meat is the star for me.  I have been searching for something similar for 10+ years in the greater Los Angeles area and nothing is yet to compare.  Love this place!

Great food!  I have not once been disappointed by the quality and flavor.  I definitely enjoy coming here.  The star loss is for service.  I have not once been here where I received acceptable service.  The servers have always been short and borderline rude.  When you ask for an extra napkin (because all you get are those thin cheap napkins) and they look annoyed...that's not good.  Especially when you are one of three total tables sitting down.

I will continue coming here because the food is good and just hope the service gets better.
Great falafel but I can't stop thinking about their hummus and pita. It's was delicious.

The falafel sandwich was amazing. And even better, so was the staff. The owners were working the register and it was evident that they cared about their business and customers. They made polite conversation with everyone that walked in and several customers appeared to be regulars, as the staff knew their orders. It is nice to see a business with people who are passionate about the food and the people.

Fantastic authentic Greek diner! We had moussaka and a gyro, and started out with agelomena soup. Everything was tasty. This place is old school in the best way, reminding me of my earlier days at Greek diners in New Jersey. Satisfying!

We picked up takeout from here the other night. I had a chicken gyro and wasn't that impressed. The pita was fine, but the meat was a bit tough and fatty and tzatziki sauce was watery and clumpy. I much prefer both the chicken and tzatziki at Captain Gyro's. I did like that this sandwich came with cucumbers in addition to tomatoes and onions. We shared Greek fries. The fries themselves were pretty mediocre but I did like the feta and seasonings on top. The fries were about a dollar more than the online menu says, which always annoys me. My husband had the combo platter (which was expensive - $17 - but came with a lot of food) and he was more pleased with the food than I was.

This became my go-to place given that I live right down the street. I love their honey cake, falafel pita classic, and hummus appetizer (totally my go-tos). I've also had the Greek fries but they left much to be desired. To be fair this probably isn't where you should go and have fries, though. Now that I'm leaving the area for good, I will miss my frequent stops here on my way home.

My go to Greek place around Purdue.  Same as in the original location on Chauncey, now with a bit more flare and more "American" options.  Same classic, time-tested recipes.

At this occasion we had lemon rice soup, spinach pie, the Parthenon platter (a bit of everything), and Vilage chicken.  The service was prompt and friendly as always.  Food spot on.  Moist chicken, moussaka properly spiced, gyro meat moist and flavorful.  

Highly recommend this hidden gem to all Boilermakers... makes me want to go back to my college years!!  Such great memories!

Thank you Parthenon!

Finally a newer construction Greek grill and nor a Mexican. This place was a gem with Gyros and several variety of ethnic Greek dishes in a fast setting as there is a drive thru I believe here as well. The place is clean and you can walk up for refills and there seems ample seating in this strip mall location far from everything else in this area. Many college students make the trek here and few I would imagine would be disappointed by the quality of food

I've been going here since I was a student mumble mumble years ago.  I simply love their food.  Saganaki, house made gyros and sauce.  Better than your average gyro you get around Chicago.  Every time we head through the area we stop.

Photo of Town & Gown Bistro - West Lafayette, IN, United States. Yummy

reviews.text: Still the best ideal mix of value and quality I have ever found, updating my review since trying T&G over 20 times - tragic that some people have a minor issue with a dish and form an entire opinion for a restaurant. Sure the menu is small, location and atmosphere on a budget, and parking is awkward (was a coffee shop originally) - the thing is: we do this hold back with menus. We end up conflicted. One item jumps out and tempts but we normally play it safe and go for the burger or some familiar item right? But pasta sounds tasty, haven't had good pasta for a long time. Right?! We all do this game. Why? Because the typical corporate food disappoints us 80% of the time. This is why I love Town & Gown. I have been here so many times with many of my family, friends, friend's friends, and gone thru most of the menu, not one bad time yet. This is the restaurant that is all about trying pasta, salmon, lamb, and more! No more burgers and salads snickering at you because you picked the Reuben (so predictable). Never mind, bad example, the Reuben here is fantastic. But that pasta, salmon, appetizers, deserts - it's the classic French style proving the chef knows what he's doing. OK - the breakfast is overpriced (like most places) and if you have complaints (which obviously can happen we had a salad once with dry chicken) ask the staff to fix it! I always leave here wondering why people go to Longhorn, East End Grill, Bistro 501, and other high class restaurants. You'll spend at least $20 more and end up with way less food. I guess eating under a shiny chandelier is worth the extra money for some. For the rest of us, T&G is a breath of fresh air. It will be everything you hoped for. The desert is crazy good too! Cheesecake better than Cheesecake Factory and half the price! Tiramisu like a massive slab of chocolate concrete soaked in espresso drugs. Apple pie, no words for the apple pie. Chocolate cake ripe for gluten-free darkness. The dinner prices are double what they were a few years ago but even $15 for a large fancy Pacific fish is way cheap. I'm real glad to see a proper chef surviving amidst a nasty mix of cheap college feeders and corporate restaurants all throwing enough sodium in their food to fill your FDA daily dose. I've seen a lot of uncomfortable health articles on the issues of that excess processed sodium. Hope to see Town & Gown continue to show off what fresh ingredients and real food should taste like.

Being new in town, I was keen to try out a brunch place and this was recommended by a friend who used to live in the area. Got here around 1pm on a Sunday (we were a group of 6 with a dog). The waitress who initially served us seemed a bit frazzled and was slightly curt. We were asked to wait for about 5 minutes before a place outside became available.

The outdoor seating is really cute, lots of flowers and has a cozy feel. It definitely gets a little toasty but I'd highly recommend it, especially as I found that when waiting inside, the cooking/greasy smell from the kitchen wafts in and sticks to your hair and clothes. 

The guy who served us was very polite and friendly. They serve big, yummy cups of coffee (I loved their coffee). This is what we got:
1. Smoked salmon and croissant bennie: The smoked salmon was great. My only issue with this dish is that they pour hollandaise sauce over it as if it's gravy. Next time I'd just get this on the side so I can moderate how much I want over it. The hollandaise sauce was pretty decent, a little less thick than what I'm used to. The croissant bennie was yummy, but by the time you get through to it, it's completely soggy from all the hollandaise sauce. Eggs were perfectly done. 
2. T&G Reuben: Big portion. This was really yummy and well done. It comes with a side of their "home fries" which appear to be roast potatoes. The potatoes were well seasoned, but quite oily. 

Would I go back? Yes. I'd really like to try out their other brunch items and lunch/dinner menu.
Amazing and classy brunch spot. Probably one of the best in town for sure to get a good brunch! Drinks are unique and the coffee tastes rich and smooth like chocolate.

I really loved this place whenever I would go. My husband got the vegan plate which said had rice but it was just steamed vegetables and I got the penne marinara. The noodles seemed like a few days old and the sauce smelled like it was rotten.

Whether you are looking for a great breakfast, lunch or dinner, Town and Gown Bistro will meet your needs. They offer both in and outside dining. Their menu offers a great variety of options. 
For brunch, I love their Smoked Salmon and Croissant Benny. Also be sure to try the Blood Orange Mimosa or the St. Germain cocktail. 
For lunch and dinner, I would recommend their specials or salmon dishes. Their sandwich options are also really good. 
The only downside to this restaurant is their tiny parking lot. During peak hours it can be really hard to find parking so beware.

Parking was easy and spacious. The place had big sign on the front so finding it was not a problem. I ate with a large group of people and it took them pretty quick to sit us.

I ordered the first item on their menu which was a classic eggs, bacon and toast breakfast. On top of that, they also gave me a huge pancake that I did not finish. The food was okay and the servers were friendly.

We stopped here on a cross country family road trip. I had the grilled salmon salad, my husband had an omelette, and my teens had the Gypsy chicken and sweet and savory pork. The portions were generous, the food fresh and the plates had lots of fresh vegetables which are hard to find on a road trip. The patio was lovely, covered in flowers and welcoming to our two dogs. The service was attentive. A great place for brunch.

Free parking is available behind the building although rather limited. They have my favorite Eggs Benedict and also a good deal on 1 pancake if I'm branching out from my Eggs Benedict. The coffee drinks often come in fun mugs, and the list of coffee cocktails is very fun for a boozy brunch.

Hosted an event here. And the staff here were wonderful! They made reservations easy. They let me come in early and get setup. We never felt rushed or in a hurry. And our dedicated server Shelby was awesome! I don't know how she did it but she stayed on top of our orders and our drink refills and she was so terrific to work with. Everyone loved their meal. I had the salmon and it was delicious!! I mean. It was delicious.

Waited too long to go to a local place. Brunch was fantastic. Eating outside on a beautiful fall day made it better. Service was excellent.  Millie was a professional that was right there if you needed something. She checked on drink refills and how we were enjoying our food after we had time to actually try it.  Well managed, clean, a spacious parking lot.  Egg dish, omelette were perfectly cooked. Good coffee.  Homemade cornbeef hash with mushrooms, onions, cheese was memorable.  Perfect location on the edge of Purdue campus. Looking forward to trying lunch or dinner.

A classic brunch stop in West Lafayette! The prices are super reasonable and the pancakes are probably the best pancakes I've had in a long time. I can't comment on the dinner but I've been for breakfast quite a few times and I am never disappointed. The biggest let down I have is their limited "weekend brunch" menu. There are only a handful of options available on the weekends for brunch and after trying the dishes multiple times, I'm ready to change it up a bit. Other than that, the place is delicious!

I really want to like this place more, but have had some issues.  I like their menu.  I love all the salmon options they have for breakfast.  Their breakfast menu is more brunch-like in style.  There are very few places to brunch in Lafayette and West Lafayette and, those that do offer brunch, usually only do so on Sundays so I like the idea I can get a brunch quality meal any day of the week here.

Prices for food and drinks were reasonable.  My issue is that the food is inconsistent and not just between days where perhaps there may be a different chef, but on the very same day!  My first visit I ordered the smoked salmon eggs benedict and my friend ordered the homemade corned beef hash.  My eggs benedict arrived and they were SWIMMING in hollandaise sauce!  Now I though I loved hollandaise sauce, but there's certainly such thing as too much of a good thing.  You could barely even see my meal beneath all the sauce!  I couldn't taste anything but the sauce!  Yet I noticed other benedicts that same visit that other people ordered and they had a normal amount of sauce on them.

I tried my friend's homemade corned beef hash and it was delicious!  Lots of meat mixed with potatoes.  So, on my next visit, this is what I ordered.  Mine was nothing compared to hers though!  Whereas hers had lots of meat, mine was mostly potatoes.  I was very disappointed.

When running successful restaurant, the food must always be consistent.

The majority of the seating is upstairs.  I had wanted to take my father there, but will not because I do not think he could manage the staircase. The only options I see for downstairs seating is a patio (which would be fine in nice weather) or a couple of small tables just inside the front door where everyone checks in which doesn't look very cozy.  I'm not aware of more ample indoor seating downstairs.

First time here, so tried the breakfast menu on a Sunday morning while eating outside.  Food was good and plentiful.  We ordered a smoked salmon omelet with wheat toast and the Bistro Egg Round (with sausage).  Service was good - we will be back.

Very cute brunch spot near Purdue's campus. Ate here on a Sunday morning around 10am. Was seated right away on the patio. 

I ordered a latte and my sister and I split a #1 (two eggs, home fries, and a pancake) and an extra pancake. So much food we couldn't finish, but boy was it good. The home fries were super crispy and the pancake had so much flavor we didn't even add syrup. 

Total bill came out to be around $20. Great value. I will definitely come back!

I paid 50$ for breakfast and I'm not sure why. Mimosas by the pitcher were nice, but that's where it stopped. Fried potatoes were uncooked chunks. Omelette was nothing special. Pancake was good but definitely not worth 5$. Parking lot sucks. We will not be back .

Excellent food and wonderful service for our large group of 12! Olivia (sp?) was so patient with our five year old granddaughter as well our adult daughter with autism, and even got up on a chair (safely) to take a beautiful photo of our group. This is our younger daughter's Purdue graduation weekend and we're so glad we celebrated there!

First time here visiting for Purdue graduation and looking for a brunch spot. The reviews are mixed so we tried it out. We were able to get a seat right away but they seated 3 of us at a 2 top. My guests order biscuits and gravy with fried eggs, fried eggs bacon and pancakes, I had a corned beef omelette and home fries.
The gravy "an Indiana favorite" was a brownish color instead of white which is actually an Indiana tradition. Both orders of eggs were over medium but both were cooked over easy. The omelette was pretty good but the nature of filling the eggs rather than cooking the ingredients with the eggs left it a bit flavorless even with the addition of hollandaise. 
Servers all had stained untucked shirts which seemed a bit odd as a uniform.

This is my 3rd time at this restaurant for brunch. The quality of the food has been hit and miss, ranging from "not bad to mediocre". The reason for my visits were because there aren't that many brunch place near by campus. My major complain is the high price, typically $35-40 with order of two plates and soda/coffee drinks. 

Today, we ordered tax mex omelet and salmon croissant bennie. The food quality simply was not good enough for the price. The omelet's ingredient was sandwiched (not well mixed) meaning that all the spinach was jammed in the lower corner and each ingredient stacked next to each other. 

The croissant bennie was very very salty. Like I said, it's been hit and miss so far.

Town & Gown, I never got out of the car to try your food so I could write a proper review. All I did was circle around the parking lot hoping that someone would leave so I could grab their spot. I know that's a lousy reason to write a review, but I'm warning others you better have a Plan B because the parking here is terrible. We went with our Plan B. Sorry, maybe next time I can hit the parking lottery and write a real review. Until then, this is what you get.

I chose this place for the Tiramisu! I had looked through the pictures on Yelp and thought this would be great! We walked in and it was busy. The inside was nice. We should've waited for a seat upstairs. Instead they sat all 3 of us at a small round table up front by the door. I ordered the biscuits and gravy. The biscuits were good, but I don't like the brown kind of gravy. I like the standard white gravy. I didn't know it was the brown gravy if I had known I would've ordered something different. So, I ordered the tiramisu for dessert and it didn't look like what the other pictures on Yelp looked like. It looked like it was caked with chocolate sauce and cocoa powder. No, spoon imprint like the other pictures on Yelp. I've had tiramisu at other places this one had so much rum in it it wasn't good. It overpowered the entire dessert. The other food that had come out looked good and I've heard upstairs is more open and they have an open bar up there. I would try it again and order other items instead of the two I got.

reviews.text: Great authentic Korean food with lots of menu options. Service was great and plenty of tables to socially distance. Staff all wore masks.

We had Togo and picnic on one Saturday September 2020. We ordered various dishes. They were all good. This is the best Korean restaurant we visited in west Lafayette. The location is convenient. We ended up with leftover for the next day. This is a restaurant we will go back again.

First Korean spot I've tried in the greater Lafayette area and I was not disappointed. I haven't had the chance to visit the restaurant yet given the current COVID-19 situation, but we had food delivered via GrubHub. 

I'm a pescatarian so these are the dishes I tried:
- spicy pancakes: this is a staple Korean dish for (I get it pretty much every time I go out for Korean food). 5/5
- spicy squid: 5/5
- spicy seafood udon noodles: 3/5

We also got 2 small complimentary dishes: boiled broccoli with some pickled vegetables and a type of miso soup. Both were fantastic!

Although all the dishes we ordered were labelled as spicy, it's not an overbearing kind of heat. I felt it was just the right amount (for me personally). Portions are reasonable for the prices. They have a good variety of seafood, vegetarian and non-veg items on the menu. 

Will definitely be ordering from them again. Keep up the great work. 

On a side note: the reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because all the items were delivered in non-recyclable containers/plastic ware/ styrofoam packaging.

Came to visit my sister and her friends at Purdue and they picked this Korean restaurant to eat at! Kimchi is located right off the road, next to a gas station with the restaurant name in big letters.

Walking in around 2pm, there weren't many people so the atmosphere was quiet and nice. The interior was spacious and would be great for big parties (we comfortably sat 8 of our friends with us).

I had ordered the Korean cold noodles and the bowl was HUGE!! I had eaten a lot of KBBQ at a different restaurant the day before so I wanted something light to counterbalance all the meat. It was the perfect choice in my opinion. 

The broth was a good balance between refreshing and tangy and there were many noodles in my bowl - I was a happy camper. They also gave you two bottles of sauce and vinegar if you wanted to add a little bit more of each into your broth.

The waiter was very polite and very friendly - he made our experience great. Only downside about Kimchi is that it is a little pricy compared to other Korean restaurants I've been to. Overall, good experience and would come here next time I'm at Purdue!

My wife and I were in West Lafayette visiting our daughter, SIL and granddaughter and tried this place, which was new to me and my wife, but which my daughter and her family had patronized before. We ordered delivery, which arrived promptly and accurately via DoorDash, and were, with one exception, very pleased with our meal.

The one exception was the seafood yaki udon (you can get some Japanese food here as well as Korean). My wife didn't think this meal lived up to its picture on the restaurant webpage. On the other hand, she was VERY satisfied with the seafood pancake, and will not hesitate to order it again.

My daughter and I had the bulgogi, and we were also satisfied with that, me very much so. The meat was flavorful and juicy, and the portion was large enough for me to get two substantial dinners from it. (The leftover portion microwaved very nicely.) 

We also all shared an order of vegetarian dumplings, and even though I am not much one for vegetables, I found these quite tasty. 

I think the next time we eat from here (and there will certainly be a next time) I might like to try the Korean spicy pork, provided that it's not too spicy. It's the closest thing I could see on the menu that resembles Korean barbeque. It will be hard, however, to pass up the bulgogi.

The best korean food in West Lala, no doubt. I pretty much dine here every week. Both their food and service are amazing. I recommend getting their SEAFOOD PANCAKE (out of this world i tell you), SPICY SILKY TOFU BEEF SOUP, and KIMCHI FRIED RICE. Their servers are the nicest people in the world. They always assist us with smiles, also they are very attentive.

My new favorite korean restaurant! It's very clean and the server was really friendly.  It's too hot outside to try their soups but we went with bulgogi, chicken teriyaki, tofu teriyaki, seafood pancake, spring rolls, and the bulgogi stone bowl.  All were really delicious! We especially enjoyed the side dishes. 

I will be back to try other items on the menu!

Great take on a standard Korean restaurant. All of the standards are on the extensive menu. We had the bibbimbap and the spicy squid. Both were served nearly immediately. Everything we had was tasty, well presented and well prepared. Food was a little pricier than other comparable local Korean places, but no complaints.

Oh my YUM! A great little Korean spot open late enough to stop by after picking up the child from camp. 

We got the duk bok ki, mul neng myun, bibimbop and the bulgogi. All so delicious. And the service was so nice. 

The bathroom was clean. 
 I'm just very happy to have taken this little adventure. ^_~

BEST KOREAN JOINT IN INDIANA

Quality food served piping hot + Great Banchan with quick refills + reasonably priced! + Amazing hospitality + Super Clean $ spacious 

Authenticity you'd never expect randomly next to a gas station on a service road in central Indiana! Quality and service are so good and reasonably priced you can't believe it's real. Walking through the front door you wonder if you're in LA or the Midwest! I've backpacked Korea and lived in Los Angeles for 2 years & NYC for 2 years, this place for the dollar value is comparable to most casual K-Town joints, it's like a Midwest BCD. If you like korean food and you live in the Midwest, this is a MUST TRY.

What an awesome Korean restaurant at Purdue.  Great customer service-staff so friendly-service was fabulous.  The price and portion is good.  Most importantly, food was delicious.  We will definitely return when we are at Purdue.  Boiler up!

Considering out of nowhere in West Lafayette, it's better than what i expected.  I travel all over the US and I try to find korean restaurants wherever i'm on the road.
I initially went to Kimchi restaurant due to my daughter's craving for korean food when she checked in for the dormitory at purdue and i always go to the restaurant whenever i visit my daughter.
Their meat dishes are excellent and banchan's are really tasty too.
I'll post some photos when I visit there next time.

I have no idea how I have lived in Lafayette for so long and never come here. 

After hearing of Kimchi from a friend recently, I decided I had to check it out. I went for lunch a couple weeks ago, and wow, it's so cool to have a Korean joint here like this. I got the bulgogi, which I had never tried before anywhere.

It was soooo good. Very reasonably priced for a pretty massive portion. Everything also comes with some traditional sides. I really liked it. It was served piping hot, and the meat was incredibly tender. It had a strong umami flavor with the right amount of spice.

My friends were equally impressed. I tried each of their dishes and it was all fantastic.

Service was incredibly quick, and the interior was very nice.

Overall, I absolutely plan on returning.

We have been here two times now, shortly after visiting South Korea, and the food was very authentic to that experience.  Their small plates of complimentary pickled items (banchan) were good both times. Dinner was great, the bulgogi soup was quite savory, and the service is excellent, so tip these Purdue student servers well.  The lunch menu is different from the dinner menu.  We saw their bento box lunch come out and it looked good but we ordered Korean sushi (lunch only). These rolls come standard w filling of egg, pickled radish, spinach and spam.  You can get beef bulgogi instead of spam if you wish.  We also had spicy tofu soup which was spicy and delicious.

Mid -March update- the 19.00 whole mackeral was very good, fresh and meaty. I believe it was fresh, not frozen.  I've attached a picture.

Great food and excellent service.  Tofu soup has good flavor and spice.  Side dishes were ample.  Ddukbogi was nice and chewy.  Fried seaweed rolls were tasty treats.  Everyone in my party had great meals.

Went here with some friends early Sunday evening, and note that this place fills up fast! We all ordered the bibimbap and it was delicious in both volume and the amount of toppings (meat, eggs, veggies, etc). You can tell they make the dish in a traditional pot as it was even tastier to scrape the slightly charred (but not burnt) rice off the bottom and sites of the ginormous pot. The one star deduction is for the bulgogi flavor. I am use to the meat having more of a profile other than being soft/bland. Other than that, great food. Also tried the japchae, which could have been more for the price we paid but pretty tasty.
Affordable, authentic, and delicious is how I would describe Kimchi. We had the glass noodles, bone soup, and Bulgogi and they were all delicious.

Very very good!  We had the pot stickers and seaweed wraps for appetizers.  My son had the udon noodle bowl and I had the veggie bowl.  It was all delicious!  We will most definitely be back   We were there for my son's birthday and the only thing that I would suggest to this restaurant is to have some available desserts as they do not offer.
A smaller known dive here but the food is very good, although a bit pricy. Staff acts very professionally and is nice. However, the food is a bit pricy. 8/10, will go again soon.

I have eaten at this building many times over the years because it's been a lot of different restaurants. I hope this Korean restaurant stays! I went in at lunch and the food was delicious. I had the teriyaki tofu box and the seaweed rolls. I ordered the rolls out of curiosity and was very surprised at how good they were. The service was good. The atmosphere was very nice as well.

reviews.text: Amazing Irish recipes mean fine, tasty dining with great brews! Our party enjoyed dining on the outdoor patio which is partially sheltered.

We were taking Daughter 1 back for 2nd semester of sophomore year. It was cold and chilly out, so some warm stick-to-ribs food sounded good. It was a Saturday night, but we got right in and sat in the "patio" area.  The service was fine, but I could tell that it,might suffer on a busier night. I ordered a Smithmick's and settled in. The appetizer was the Pot of Gomd and came out pretty quickly. I had the fisherman's stew and we also had corn beef and cabbage as well as the patty melt sandwich and breaded tenderloin. Everything came out piping hot and was quite tasty. I would like to go back and try a few other good looking items.  One caution, if any is thr parking...not much.

I got fried fish tacos and they were amazing!! Mashed potatoes are also great! Next time, I'm excited to try the fish n chips. Our waiter was really nice, and I felt they did a great job spreading out tables for social distancing. I haven't dined in a lot during Covid, and so it was a relief to see them take precautions. The furniture is really unique here- I loved the style!

We've met friends here a couple of times for drinks and appetizers. For Celiacs, the menu is pretty limiting but the atmosphere is nice. 

Even pre-pandemic, the eastside location is quiet on weekdays nights so a good place to catch up and chat with friends. The decor is appealing and the staff is friendly and courteous. 

There are an okay amount of gluten-free drink selections but again the food  choices can definitely use an improvement. That said, after the pandemic ends, it's a place I'd stop by again for a drink with friends. But dinner will be served elsewhere.

Fun spot to have dinner with my favorite 
Boilermaker  We started with the Irish nachos, they were , the potatoes are cottage fries. I had the Ruben, it was ok, but too much bread. The Irish stew was very good and the fish and chip was fabulous
Of course, we had dessert...the shamrock pie & seasonal pumpkin cheesecake were delicious
An essential visit when you're in West Lafayette. The food is great and they have friendly service. My family loves to eat there whenever they can! The staff and owners are especially wonderful.

YUMMM!!!! This location is super close to Purdue campus and has the best outdoor patio in WL. With the colder weather approaching, I layered up pretty significantly and ate on their patio. The area is under a tent, heated SO well, and has fans going--in addition to some openings in the tent. I was super comfortable here, parking was easy, and the food was phenomenal! I had a nice beer and an amazing half-order of corned beef, mashed potatoes, and cabbage. Mind you, this was only a half-order and was quite the heap of delicious food! The meal also included a tasty slice of soda bread. I'll definitely be back!!

Friendly staff and nice sized portions! 
The fried fish was huge! Unfortunately it wasn't as flavorful as I would have liked. The batter needed more salt and seasoning. The stew and pots of gold were yummy!

Got some food hear the other day at really enjoyed it. We ordered the Shepard's Pie and the Fish and Chips. I was not that impressed with the Shepard's Pie. It came with the mashed potatoes mixed in as opposed to baked on top (like a pie crust). The fish and chips though we're fantastic. Not too battered and plenty of fish inside. The half order filled me up. Would definitely go back for that.

My daughter attends Purdue.  I am Irish.  It was a no brainer.   Amazing reuben sandwiches, banger sandwiches (winter special) and fish and chips.  For appetizers goat cheese fritters, fried pickles and the pots of gold.  All good.  Their Irish soda bread is some of the best I have had and I have had a lot!  Yum.  The atmosphere is fantastic and this and the West location.  Love the people, food, beer and atmosphere...never disappointed.  I keep saying I will have to try more places but cannot break the habit.  Thanks

The food here is fantastic. Everything I've tried has been great- fish and chips, corned beef Reuben, bangers and mash, fried pickles- all incredible. Great quality food, with indoor and outdoor seating, and a cozy and fun Irish pub theme. I definitely recommend! Next time I go, I want to try a dessert!

One of my fav dishes at an Irish pub is mussels. Since I wasn't very hungry, having driven all day, this sort ofmeal was perfect!  The sauce is creamier than the place in Ann Arbor, but still got soaked up by the bread. 

Trey was great!  I sat outside (sweating) but I avoid eating indoors these days.  The table spacing needs to be increased IMHO.  It wasn't busy that night, so only four other tables had guests. 

This is a comebackable place.
Love this place. All the food we ordered tasted good. We sat outdoor. Will go back again in the future. Fish and chip is a must. Parking is not an issue the time we went, early about 5pm.
We love going here, food is consistently great and service is too. Their fish and chips are 100%!

I can't believe that I've never reviewed this place before. The food, alcohol, and service are all good. The side room with the fireplace is nice on a chilly night. The menu covers Irish favorites like Guiness stew, Shepherd's pie, fish and chips, etc. but also has fish tacos, burgers, mussels, etc. Everything that I've eaten here has been good. 

On the down side, it is pretty noisy and, even with their overflow parking lot, parking sucks. 

Most recently, we hosted a party of 14 here. They were very accommodating and welcoming from the initial phone call. They put our group on the patio which has a roof, heaters, tent-like sides. The patio was quieter than inside and was warm even on a cold rainy night. Great service for a large party.

Stopped for dinner on Sunday night with my prospective Purdue student. He had the fish and chips it was such a plentiful serving that he couldn't eat it all. I had the open faced roast beef and it was delicious. Everything was delightfully presented. They do an excellent job with social distancing and safety.

Had a great dinner with great service and literally marveled at how affordable our bill was.  Will be back!

I need to be gluten free and they have a great allergy guidance sheet for those who need such information.  The specials were even marked on menu if they were GF or not!  I had the fisherman's shepherds pie and it was amazingly awesome comfort food.  A huge treat in my GF dining world of usual salads and plain dishes.  They have nice selection of hard coders as well.

Hubby got a Guinness and the Guinness stew which looked great and he finished and said was great as well.  Pub chips as an appetizer with very nice mustard dipping sauce.

Sorry no pictures-we dug I'm too quick!:-)
The food is always amazing and the wait staff on point. Yummy food and delicious libations, one of my fave places to go!

Passing through town and found this gem and tried it based on Yelp reviews and was not disappointed.  A couple of Harp lagers (on tap) and a couple of Rubens was all it took ... we were already planning our next trip before the check arrived.  Thanks Yelp and thanks Nine Irish Brothers.

One of my favorite restaurants in West Lafayette! It's family owned and it has one of the best fish and chips and pint of Guinness you can find in the country! The food is amazing. I would recommend the fish and chips, Reuben, shepherd's pie, and Pot of Gold's. 

Prices are a little bit more expensive than the rest of West Lafayette, but you are paying for quality. It has a big inside Irish pub feel and a back patio for those summer months. They have a good amount of TVs to watch sports too. Service has been adequate for every time I've went. Overall, I love this place!

reviews.text:
I went here 11/30 because it's a nice little meeting place between me in Indianapolis and my parents near Gary. We now plan to routinely come here. It was nice because we went during an off time and were able to sit inside to eat without a huge crowd. The beer was the usual big woods beer- I live and die by their cinnamon blonde. It tastes like a snickerdoodle beer and is incredible. My mom, a lifelong miller lite drinker loves their six foot blonde. And we had a sample of some of their spirits and they were incredible too. I spent way too much already or I would have gotten some of those to go. 

Their food is a smaller selection than the speedway or Nashville location but they still have some good stuff. I forgot to take photos but I got the grilled chicken sandwich (yum), my mom got the nachos and my dad got the wings. They both loved their meals too. Absolutely will be back. Especially if we ever get out of this pandemic.

5 stars for the beers
3 stars for the food (kind of pricey for bar food)
Averages out to 4 stars! 

We had dinner here while visiting Purdue for a tour. All in all the meal was good, but I felt the food was kind of pricey. We enjoyed: 

Side Greek salad (excellent taste and value)
Individual Margherita pizza (large portion for an individual but it was filling with the thicker style crust)
Candied bacon bomb burger with Parmesan truffle fries. It was very good but huge. Glad I shared this with my husband. Not sure it's a $15 burger, but it was tasty. 
Signature pulled pork sandwich - generous serving of pork. My son took half home. 

Tips: 
1-Upgrade to Parmesan truffle fries. They are fabulous and you will so glad you did. 
2-Sample some beers to get exactly what I want. We ended up loving the Java red.
3-Servings are large. Consider sharing. 
4-The manager greeted every table and I like that extra touch of service.

We've only ever done carryout here due to the pandemic. Both times the restaurant has been extremely busy (weekend nights) and the wait for pickup was 30-40 minutes. Both times, some part of our order was incorrect. They fixed things happily, but the rest of the order is sitting there getting cold while you're waiting for them to remake whatever was wrong. 

Wasn't impressed w the burger. Ordered med rare and it was well done. Bun was hard. But pizza is pretty good. Our favorite is the Homestead. And the cheesy bread is delicious, but not enough of it to justify the price. They must make their own Ranch cause it's interesting in a good way.

We came in on a Saturday afternoon for a quick lunch. The dining area and bar were mostly empty but started to fill up quick. The location is convenient to the campus and sparkling clean. We sat in the bar area. The bartender was responsible for tables, making drinks and carry out. She seemed to be overwhelmed a bit but did fine taking our order and delivering our food and drinks in a timely manner. I had a Greek salad with chicken. The lettuce was crispy and chicken was hot and juicy. Tomato slices were thick cut but soft and tasted close to the end of their time. The portion of black olives was insane unless olives are your favorite part of a salad. Dressing was good, served on the side and there was plenty. I also ordered the Parmesan truffle fries. Don't expect them to be super crispy but expect tons of flavor. They are really good! I think I'll try a sandwich next visit.

A decent replacement to the fantastic Stacked Pickle, tons of room, comfortable and easy going area, brews with unique and original flavors, menu is tidy but offers well thought out items and burgers to tingle the senses just reading the descriptions: "Candied Bacon Bomb" is something we never realized we wanted until now. We all went for burgers and two did brews. Enjoyed it all, no one had complaints, we miss Stacked Pickle for its amazing appetizers and creative burgers at a great value but this will do OK despite fierce competition. I personally take to Teay's River with it's massive menu and fresh drips. The Tap drowns everyone with an overwhelming beer list. Big Woods mixes those two together to boast on the campus vibes, easy parking, and Nashville inspired fare.

Very happy with the experience- went for lunch on a weekday and got to sit outside on a beautiful day. Service was prompt and waitress was great! Loved my side salad and burger. Portions were big! Restaurant was very clean. Will definitely be back again.

Was really excited to try this place as it looked like a nicer dinner place that campus needed. Unfortunately it fell short in most categories. For starters the service was very sub par. Drinks/beers were asked about and the explanation was less than what was actually written about them. The food tastes pretty good, but for ~12-15$ a plate I was thinking there would something memorable or even my medium rare burger being at least slightly pink. The beer and drinks were also quite good, but again 12-15$ for a specialty cocktail and 7$ for a pint should give you something that is high quality and unique. The ambiance also doesn't reflect what they're going for as it looks just like Stacked Pickle did (sports bar) but it's a brewery/distillery/cocktail bar. I would say you can do much better at LBC, Teays, The Bryant, or The tap for less money.

Compared to their other location in Nashville, IN, this place was a disappointment. They forgot every one of our breadsticks sauces, and the breadsticks themselves were not buttery. They were like papa johns, just triple the price. The pizzas were really good, though. I will come back when they have things figured out. Really pricey for what you get.

Went on a Saturday night with some friends. Thought it would be great to try out a newer place in town with a good looking menu. To our disappointment, the food was not that great and quite expensive. Drinks were okay, but most definitely not amazing. The server did not know the menu well and totally forgot about us at one point, and my burger was not cooked to the right temperature (asked for medium and got pretty much well done). The overall value of the experience was pretty low. Definitely hate that this is what replaced stacked pickle; I will not be returning.

Ordered carryout from here trying something different. Burgers were good and had that charbroiled taste. The wife enjoyed her chicken sandwich and said was pretty good as well. All tasted fresh a delicious. BBQ chicken and pulled pork pizza definitely different but pretty good. Will say when picked the carry out order up that they handed us the food in plastic carryout containers but was not in a bag to help keep warm so was a little cold when we got it home. Would still recommend and bet food would be even better dinning in.

Unusual location and facility but the food and drink were very good.  The burger was one of the best I ever had, fries were good, and wings were good - get the burger with the candied bacon.  The cookie desert was very good and the friend biscuits was also good - staff was friendly, informative, and attentive--would go back again.

A very open restaurant and bar design with ample seating (considering Covid) for patrons.  The decor theme matches the restaurant name and is quite fun and warm.  The service is pretty good, but did have to wait an hour for a table when quoted only fifteen minutes when we arrived.  I am understanding considering limitations with Covid but any other time could result in a lesser review.  The pizza is really good, and in all honesty, I prefer their cauliflower gluten free crust w toppings!  The nachos are good as well as other appetizers.  The beer selection helps make this an enjoyable experience.  I do hope they continue to improve service operations as Covid wanes in the future.  Give it a go!

We had lunch with the family on a Saturday afternoon (game day, but not busy).  Great beer selection from Quaff On (four 5oz samples, including seasonal selections ), and they provided free mini shots of their Hard Truth distillery whiskey (cinnamon, peanut butter and coconut) for us as a taste test (all very good).  Two of us ordered hand tossed pizzas (10 inch, also comes in 16 inch versions), and the others ordered burgers with regular and truffle fries.  Food was excellent!  We also had side Caesar and Greek salads, which were good size.  Menu is small; we also didn't have any appetizers, but the wings and nachos looked tasty.  It's a little pricey, but we'll definitely be back.
