reviews.text:
Okay. Here's the low down. This is probably THE BEST BURGER SPOT in ALL of Lafayette. The quality of service, the variety of options, the location, the venue itself, the price, all of it. You just have to go there to get the full effect. But here's my breakdown.

The good. 
- Bru Burger is located in downtown Lafayette right next to the train station and foot bridge into West Lafayette. It's an easy walk here after going to the Farmer's market downtown or if you're touring Purdue and want to walk over.
- It's easy on your wallet. You get what you pay for. Good food isn't (usually) cheap and cheap food isn't (usually) good. So yes, it's more expensive than McDonalds. That being said, you can get an artisan burger for $11-14. It's not going to break the bank like many other restaurants of the same caliber might.

The better.
- The service is good. Very good. Employees seem to enjoy their work, and are super friendly. They keep finding quality employees. The management doesn't seem very involved in a visible role (no one comes around asking how everything is, etc.), but your waiter or waitress takes such good care of you that it doesn't matter. And I'm sure management is doing their job well, albeit behind the scenes.
- The venue. It's trendy, modern, and fun. Their side patio is ideal for outdoor dining. The screen walls come down in the winter and its heated to provide excellent outdoor dining even in the cold. And nothing beats eating a Bru burger outside in the warm spring breeze.

The best.
- Yup. I saved the best for last: the food. 
- WOWZA. The burgers are delicious, and I've had nearly all of them (not at the same time). Not that hungry? Build your own starting with a "burger snack" base for the perfect miniature burger.
-The fries. Dining with a friend? Get the appetizer fries. It's like twice the cost as a side of fries for about 4 times the amount. Plus, it's served with their homemade black pepper mayo. I repeat for the people in the back...GET THE BLACK PEPPER MAYO.
- Get. The. Nachos. You'll thank me later. Especially if you're getting a takeout order, the pork nachos are the best thing on the menu. The queso, the pickled jalapeños, the pico, the seasoned pork, all of it. It'll blow your mind.

They have some locations in Indy which are also good, but the one here in Lafayette is my favorite. You won't be sorry you came here.

I ordered a Bru Hot Chicken and a garlic three cheese veggie burger from Bru yesterday. The food was hot and fresh and super delicious! We picked up the burgers and the take out was seamless with the staff wearing masks. Would definitely order again! Loved it!

We happened on this place 6 weeks ago when things were still very very quiet in Lafayette. Enjoyed our burger and beer so much that, coming through here again, I made a reservation for outside seating on a Saturday night. When we arrived it was MUCH busier - including a "packed" (by our new Covid parameters) indoors. The servers were so busy that at first I worried we would be forgotten. This was completely not the case! Though our server did take a few minutes to get to us (again because he was busy with others), our drink order came out VERY quickly and our food followed shortly. The fries were so crisp I had a hard time not eating them all immediately. Our two burgers (Mexicali and Greek Lamb) were done exactly as ordered and we got to sample 4 different beers including some local Indiana brews. I was so impressed with how the operation was run this night that I asked to speak to the manager to give my compliments. Since we are now driving between Atlanta and Minneapolis instead of flying, I anticipate that we will be in Lafayette again and when we are, I will look forward to another Burger & Beer meal!

Seriously the best burger you will have period.

This place is usually really busy (for good reason), so try to get a reservation beforehand. They employ a ton of staff so they keep up with the volume once you're in. The burgers are obviously the go to here and you really can't go wrong with any choice. I had the Patty Melt, which may seem a little underwhelming, but boy did it pack a ton of flavor. They cook your burger exactly how you want it too which is nice. The only flack is that the side portions of fries (while delicious) are a little small.

Nothing to see here.  
 Trying too hard to be different and forgot to pay attention to the basics. 

Onion rings overly breaded and too tough. 
Burger selection was inventive but missed the mark totally.  

Beer selection is good and staff is nice.

We stopped in to have lunch. Love all of the great burger combos, served with fries and housemade ketchup, which is super yummy  we sat in the enclosed patio which was surprisingly warm, as it was only 7 degrees outside  service was fast & friendly. We will be back

My first time here. Couldn't eat in because of the China Wuhan virus. Food was great. Order on the phone and they bring it to the car. Easy. Had a spicy chicken sandwich. All our orders were correct and the portions generous. Will come back when Covid19 is dead and gone. 

4.5 Bellies!  Great food.

It pains me to write this review, because I like this restaurant, but I had a very bad experience on my last visit. Let me preface this by saying that the food was ok. We tried something different with the impossible Hiki'ole (which tasted like a meat burger and was pretty good) and the black bean burger (which I really didn't like). 

As in my previous review, I've touted Bru Burger to be one of the best places to eat at/ take out food from during COVID. For that reason, we have been getting curbside pickup here regularly. On my last order, as usual, we called to put in the order for curbside pickup, at which point we checked that they would do curbside pickup, to which the person over the phone said yes. When it was time to make the pickup, after I drove up to the restaurant and gave them a call, the staff member that answered the phone was very rude. They told me that I need to come into the restaurant and that they don't do curbside pickup on he weekend (because they do the open air dining on weekends). Upon telling them that I checked about curbside pickup just 15 minutes prior (when I put in the order), I was told that maybe the person who took the order wasn't aware of what they claimed. When I said that I've gotten curbside pickup before, I was told that if I'm not going to come in and get the food, they don't know what else they can do for me. Since I wasn't going into the restaurant (for personal reasons) and stated so, the staff member finally gave in and brought the food out to me. At this point, they made a fuss about me having to sign the bill, which I've never had to do here before. They've always brought the food out to my car and left it in the trunk. The staff member wouldn't give me the food till I signed the check. I signed the check, but I was very disappointed with this experience.

I love BRU Burger and generally visit the Indy location - I was so happy to see the same standards of customer service and food quality were present here. This visit in particular was to celebrate my graduation from Purdue. 

We had the triple dip & each had a burger w/fries or onion rings. I do wish more bread was served with the dip, but they quickly brought us extra. We also had a bowl of chili - new to me and definitely something I'd order again. Hands down, the BRU Onion Rings are THE BEST I've ever had. The burgers were also good - the only potential drawback was they weren't exactly cooked as requested. 

Thanks for a great celebration!

Went for the first time on a Friday night and sat outside. They have heating lamps for when it gets cold and it was nice and cozy. Our waitress, Abbie, was so nice and attentive! I had the fried chicken sandwich and my boyfriend had the Bru burger. I loved the sandwich and the fries are amazing. He really enjoyed the burger, it was fairly messy and wet but overall had great flavor!

I have been to most of the Indiana Cunningham Restaurants, so while headed home, I stopped for dinner in Lafayette.  I was lucky and found some free street parking on the next block and walked over.  I noticed there were a lot of customers seated on the patio having dinner already, but fortunately, I was able to grab a spot at the bar.

Inside, the room is very tastefully decorated with lots of dark wood.  The noise level was pleasant, not too loud.

I was greeted by the bartender with a menu and water.  I wanted to get a burger, but wasn't hungry enough for one of their half pounders, so I asked about a smaller version.  They have a basic burger for a lower price and you can add the toppings of their specialty burgers for an extra $2.  So, I went with the smaller version of the Honey Chipotle BBQ Burger.  This was another one of those BMB (Big Mouth Burgers), but I was able to squeeze it down to manage.  The flavor was really good.  I liked the bacon with the BBQ and burger flavors.  

I also had a Gorgonberry Pecan Salad.  I ordered the small (and was only charged for a small) but the thing nearly covered a large plate.  Wow!  I love this salad and get one almost every time I dine at one of the BRU restaurants.

Wait times were minimal and the bartender did a good job of checking in to make sure I was being taken care of.  

Very good flavor with a nice setting.  Really like the ability to not have to over order.

Review #3048

Note: according to staff, the "veggie burger" and the "black bean burger" are not vegan. Previous review was from opening week and the information I got was wrong. They still have the portabello mushroom sandwich and impossible burger which are vegan. My first time around, the waitress told me all I had to do was sub out the mayo to make the garbanzo and mushroom patty vegan. It'd be really nice for the menu to specify exactly why something isn't vegan, so that people that don't want to eat any animal products don't have to rely on the staff to know the difference. 

I'd say I'm much less excited about the place now that I know that my only choices are the portabello and the impossible if it's in stock.

OLD review:

I'm really happy with this burger joint! It's a regional chain with restaurants in Ohio, Kentucky, and (of course) Indiana. 

The menu is very clearly marked to show which items are vegan or vegetarian. For vegans, the menu is pretty skimpy on the appetizer sides. It looks like it may be onion rings or the soft pretzel without the pub cheese (ask first if the pretzel has any butter). We skipped straight ahead to the salad.  

We tried the quinoa salad (spring mix, crispy quinoa, edamame hummus, cucumber, portobello, peppadew pepper jam, and white balsamic-orange vinaigrette). Not at all what I was expecting - the quinoa is mashed into a ball and fried. The rest of the salad comes kind of decomposed, with long slices of portobello. It was delicious. 

And...there are THREE vegetarian burgers:
+ Impossible burger - we ordered medium well, and comes with vegan cheese, vegan mayo mustard, house ketchup, greens
+ Garbanzo and mushroom patty (vegetarian)- it comes with mayo, we substituted for vegan mayo. Comes on an oat bun
+ Black bean burger (vegetarian) - I'm not entirely sure what makes this one vegetarian and not vegan (did not try). 

Few other details: Staff was very friendly, and we were seated quickly. They have have a large selection of rotating local and regional beers, and a good number of wines by the glass on the menu. But no vegan desserts. 

Quite impressive to have this many vegan and vegetarian options, I'm sure we'll be back here next time we're in town.

Went here a few weeks back and it was good. Just a solid burger place that does what they have well. They have a very extensive local beer list and the server we had was very knowledgeable on the menu.

I've eaten here multiple times and have tried several different burgers. The burgers are good but nothing to write home about, and they're pretty pricey. Their fries are great, so I wish they would step up their burger game a bit. 
The atmosphere is nice though and the restaurant is pretty big. It's refreshing to go to a place with indoor dining.

Bru Burger Lafayette-  updated review, heard the salads were good, had the Valencia Salad with Blackened Salmon.  Salad was very good, would highly recommend.  However, don't bother with the salmon, it's high quality but extremely bland.  They should try Legacy Pub's Blackened Salmon to get an idea of what a seasoned salmon filet tastes like.  Literally tasted like a plain filet cooked on a flattop.  Was visually blackened, just no flavor.  I'll try the grilled chicken on the Valencia next time to see if there's improvement, the salad it's self was that good.

Since we aren't going out much during these COVID times, we have enjoyed weekly carry out nights. bru Burger is one of our favorites!  Online ordering is super easy. Burgers come assembled and packaged with care. We order the onion rings "extra crispy " and they indeed stay that way during the drive home. Although we look forward to the days of going out to eat with our family without masks, Bru Burger makes it easy to have a great meal at home.

Having walked past BRU, it looked like a decent place to try.  The outdoor area sold me!

I brought two co-workers, but didn't want sit chummy with them since we're from different parts of the country.  The staff accommodated my request, and we got things going. 

One got a burger (not an adventurous diner), and the other got the BBQ.  I, on the other hand, got the gorgonberry salad w/salmon.  Since I'd been in a hot/humid factory all day, the LAST thing i needed was a gut-buster meal.  I highly recommend this salad.  With the salmon, it had all sorts of flavors & textures to keep me from focusing TOO much on Mr BBQ's onion rings.  They looked GOOD, I have to say. 

Great service from Abby!

We had wanted to try the one in Indy, but never had the opportunity, so when a BRU opened up here in Lafayette, we knew we had to try it out!

We went for lunch a week after it opened( it was busy, but we were able to get one of the last available tables. Our server, Nick, was fantastic! He made me feel way less weird about my...unpopular...meat preferences.

We didn't try any apps or desserts; I'm not really sure how anyone would have room (however, I will say that I may end up making a special trip for the whiskey fudge brownie, which sounds and looks delicious)! My husband ordered The Beginning Burger and fries, and I had the Honey-Chipotle BBQ burger. We both really enjoyed our burgers (mine was particularly massive); the fries were pretty good too (I  tried one, and they were pretty potato-y, which is the only way I like fries).

As for my burger specifically, it could be a bit messy to eat (mostly because pulled pork falls out easily), but the crunch from the onion ring adds great texture. It does have a bit of a kick (as the name implies), but it's not overbearing.

The decor is modern and streamlined, though conversations seem to carry throughout the room. The carpeted area with tables seems like it might be a bit cramped; navigating your way through to get to the bathroom can be a challenge.

All in all, we had an excellent experience, and we'll definitely be back!

Update: We came back and brought our kids. The kids menu offers options that will appeal to most kids (burgers, nuggets, mac and cheese, popcorn shrimp, and grilled cheese), and the kids entrees come with a side and a drink. They're pretty competitively priced to comparable restaurants. My kids had the cheeseburger with onion rings and the mac and cheese with fruit. I thought the mac and cheese didn't have a lot of flavor, but my kids both loved their food.

My husband got the Beginning Burger and fries again, and I tried the Memphis BBQ Melt, which I highly recommend!
Great food and great service! So many unique burger options! There is something for everyone! Even my 10 year old son said he would give Bru Burger 10 Stars!! Yum!!
Anna the server was great nice and helpful also made recommendations. The bartender made me a very good Hendricks Negroni I would come back

reviews.text:
Ok, so I've driven by this place so many times and never considered it. Don't be like me, stop and check it out! When I heard that they have California burritos on their menu, I  had to get one. I was not disappointed! The burrito had a generous amount of meat (Pastor for me), rice, lettuce, pico, guacamole, and French Fries! The taste was amazing, but it was wrapped a little sloppily. My teenagers enjoyed their nachos supreme, and breaded tenderloin. 

We called our order ahead of time, and it was ready in 15 minutes. I'm glad we did, because when we arrived to pickup, the order line was 4 cars deep (at 5pm on a Thursday!). This is totally going into our takeout rotation, there is something for everyone on their menu. The lady working the window (and phone) was super friendly and cheerful.

This place has fed me all quarantine and will continue to be a staple for years to come. Local and convenient. By far, the best menu item is the fresh jalapeño poppers. They are not for the weak as the heat is intense! 

I switch between the stuffed burger, the nachos and the other burgers they offer a lot. They have pulled pork nachos which are a favorite. Amazing owners who put heart into each order!! Victor does a great job! Next, I want to try their mangonadas!

We've been wanting to try their burgers for a few weeks now, but their opening hours are a little unusual so it's been closed whenever we've gone (call ahead!). 

We finally made it on a Saturday around 11.30am but realised that on Saturdays  they only serve one item (and that's till they run out) - Mexican Birria.
This is a stew that is normally made with lamb, but here they serve it with beef. You can have it in different styles: over fries, in a cup, as a taco or quesadilla. We decided to try it over fries (also comes with queso, guac, jalapeños). The beef is very tender and resembles pulled meat. The birria reminded me of Indian beef curries that I've had but not as spicy. The combo of the birria over the fries was yummy. The guac in particular was fantastic and I liked that they didn't go crazy with the queso - just the right amount. 

Overall, this is a yummy dish and worth trying if you've never had it before, but I can't say I loved it. We will definitely be going back to try their burgers which so many people seem to love. 

Service was great and the staff were super helpful.

I drove by a couple of weeks ago and saw a new tenant in the old shack, and I knew I had to stop in. After hearing a client talking about the food, that sealed it.

Nothing fancy, the Wicked Food Shack is just that, a shack serving wickedly good food. To order, you either use the walk-up window or drive-thru. The menu is fairly simple with burgers, hot dogs, tenderloin, fries, tacos, burritos, esquite (Mexican corn in a cup, I got to know it as elotes in Texas), and other goodies. The menu is ever expanding - look for some dessert items in the future. 

I had the stuffed burger, which comes with fresh cut fries. Cheddar cheese and chopped bacon are stuffed inside a hamburger patty and then cooked to perfection. Normally I don't order bacon on a burger because I don't get a good bite on a slice of bacon due to my weird uneven teeth. With the chopped bacon stuffed in the patty, I got all the bacon taste in each bite. No need for condiments on this burger, the juices do it all.

The thick fries are freshly cut, and the interior steams while in the fryer. The exterior is crispy while fluffy on the inside. 

I also had the chili cheese fries. The same fresh cut fries are slathered with cheese sauce and house made chili. Although not as spicy as I prefer, this chili will fit in well with the local palate. These fries would be a great snack when it's 10 degrees out.

The Wicked Food Shack is going into my lunch and dinner rotation, if just for the burgers and fries. I'm going to have to work my way through the menu.
The fried catfish sandwich is huge and filling and tasty! Was enough for my husband and I to share. The fries are seasoned well

On the surface, Wicked Food Shack looks very missable, I mean... hand written menu, total staff is two guys, location is a tiny building in parking lot... but boy can appearances be deceiving. The main event here is the burgers. The Wicked Burger boasts a really tasty hamburger patty, pulled pork and bacon. I know, right? The fries were tasty and plentiful. We also tried a jalapeño burger, which was great. The menu looked great, too, with a chili dog that looks to set the bar for chili dogs, and all sorts of other tasty odds and ends. And to boot, we ate there on National Burger Day. Only in America, folks. Only in America.

Make sure you try out the tacos on Saturday! Soooo good! Very friendly staff that really seem to care about the customer! They actually prepared the food how previous menus had it just because we asked about it! Can't wait to go back!

Mmmm let me let this food settle before I can continue this review.... do you hear the crickets... means the food is so good words can't even describe it! We had the fried blt and tenderloin. Something about this food reminded me of California, oh how I miss it! All I can say is... it's hands down yummy!! You definitely need to try it and please open up a wicked down down south or of Indy!! Ok, back to my food!

Food was amazing! So much better than fast food and wow just flavorful in every bite. 10/10 would recommend! Everything looked very clean and i cant wait to come back time and time again. Owners were very nice! Worth every penny and the prices were fair.

reviews.text: This little cafe has become our go to spot to have a quiet coffee when we visit our daughter on campus. Plenty of seating at both tables and soft chairs. All the tables are regularly sanitized between seatings and the restrooms are super clean! The staff is friendly and happy to bring your order while you stay seated.  Seems to be a popular place for students to study in small groups or individually. Standard Covid precautions are enforced. I highly recommend it!

Been here twice, and tried both their vegetarian pizza's: shiitake pizza and fig & pear pizza. Both were fantastic (I think I liked the shiitake one a tad more). Service is great, prices are reasonable.

Social distancing is in place and all the staff had masks on, which I really appreciated. Hand sanitisers are available, as is disinfectant spray if you want to buy stuff down. 90% of the patrons also had masks on. There is usually a good amount of outside seating available. 

Also a great place to get some work done or read a book.

I'm not quite sure how to describe the location of where this restaurant is at because I'm not to familiar with the Lafayette area. However it seemed like this restaurant was somewhat attached to a community center, play park, apartment, study area, and church. There is plenty of parking and areas to sit outside which was nice, especially in the summer months. 

The menu isn't too crazy big so it won't make it too difficult to choose what you want to eat. However I would recommend the mushroom pizza as it is refreshing and light tasting as there isn't red sauce on it. White sauce pizzas are one of my favorites and this little cafe did not disappoint. I shared this pizza and a Caesar salad with one person and it was plenty of food for a lunch time meal. We even had some pizza left over. The fresh greens on top of the pizza added such a nice touch which was wonderful. There wasn't anything special about the salad, I would just say it tasted pretty classic. But it was good that is for sure. 

I also noticed the huge study area that is attached to this Café which was closed at the moment due to COVID19 however I can imagine that this is a hot place to study because there were a lot of places to sit and even private room areas for silent study.

Update: returned on Sunday afternoon, and it was super busy. Staff was still friendly and service was fast. Had a latte and the Harvest Pizza special- a wood fired pizza special with butternut squash, pork, sage, and onions. 10/10. 

This is probably my favorite coffee shop in West Lafayette. It has a huge breakfast, lunch, and coffee menu. Staff is friendly and quick, and the general atmosphere is very calm and welcoming. I had an almond milk latte, which was hot and tasty. Coffee is high quality. I also had a bacon, egg, and cheese breakfast sandwich. Egg was cooked well but under seasoned. The bacon was cooked perfectly, and the everything beagle it came on was tasty. The patio out front is a great place to sit in the shade and enjoy the weather.

Totally loved the panini I had here. My food was fresh and warm and definitely hit the spot after a long day. I took off a star because they were out of a few side items when I was ordering. The order was ready pretty quickly and the tables were all very clean.

Place was a little hard to find, it's just north of where Smitty's used to be.  It's in a complex with a church, a school, and apartments.  Lots of room to spread out, or even go into another room altogether.

We were here during a very slow time so service was fast, but our pizzas were missing the torn basil.  We got a pile from the kitchen and all was good.  They had some specialty sodas, a pretty good college type menu, and the decor was kind of a cross between steampunk and industrial modern.

I am sure this place is busy when school's in session.  We'll try to visit again next time in town.

Awesome concept being attached to church & great hipster vibe/decor. Service was good/quick/polite even when they made an order error. Coffee was very good. Sadly, the breakfast foods were very meh, not much flavor; we had ordered 3 different items (ham panini, bacon bagel, sausage bagel) & all agreed on lackluster flavor.

I have been here several times, and I love the atmosphere. The place has trendy decor. It's great to grab coffee or lunch with a friend or catch up on work. The brick oven pizzas are by far my favorite! I love the smoked bbq pork and corn pizza. I know that sounds strange, but it's delicious and topped with a few veggies and chipotle. The pizza is a good sized portion. They cook the pizzas as they are ordered, and the wait is never too long!
Blasting music, tepid coffee, mediocre pastries and slow service. I've given Literato several chances over the last few years, and the establishment consistently disappoints.

Wow! What a great place to grab lunch when in West Lafayette.  About a mile north of Purdue, this place was packed on a Tuesday.  I found the last parking spot in their lot and headed inside.  The restaurant has indoor and outdoor seating.  I placed my order at the front counter and after paying, gave my name and waited for the pickup counter to call it out.  Not the most efficient if people have the same name, but the food came out so quickly that as long as I was paying attention, I could get my food in hardly no time!  Fortunately, there were plenty of seats inside, so I sat down with my selections.  

I went with the Cranberry Walnut Chicken Salad sandwich and the Red Skin Potato Salad as my choice for a side.  The sandwich comes served on a rustic Italian bread (fairly thick) and the chicken salad was about an inch deep across the sandwich!  No skimping here!  The sandwich had just hint of blue cheese for depth to go with the dried cranberries, walnuts, lettuce, and Roma tomato slices.  Very hearty and flavorful!

The potato salad was excellent!  Instead of a mustard base, this creamy coating tasted more like butter.  The potatoes were diced and al dente for a nice bite, not mushy.  Just right for me!

The price for both options was under $10, so very reasonably priced for the amount of food offered.  I highly recommend this combo.

Oh, and before I forget, the walls are covered with text.  Some are informational, some inspirational, and others humorous.  It gave me something to look at while waiting for my order or while eating since I was dining by myself.

Note:  The customers are expected to clear their own tables and deposit the dishes and trash at a station by the door.  The staff does come by and clean the tables as well.

Review #283

Great portion size for the money. Fresh and healthy options. Fun atmosphere with many seating options. Great spot for breakfast or dinner. The music selection was Les Miserables and The Greatest Showman, but it wasn't obnoxious...They even had a gluten free breakfast option for me.
Food tastes slightly above average, but is very aesthetic for those who are interested. Moreover, the food is also fairly priced and served quickly, so there's not much to complain about.

Verdict: I'd go back - Quiet coffee place

Location: Okay
Decor: Good
Drink/Food: Okay
Service: Good
Price: Okay

Details: The location is a bit disconnected from the Purdue Campus but it is a good place to get away to when you want some quiet. Other reviews made it sound like it gets busy around lunchtime, but I had no issues finding empty tables on a saturday afternoon. I loved how quiet it was and it was a nice place to work. I would have liked to say comfy place to work too, but they have limited comfortable seating. Wifi was good. 

I got the almond milk latte and a Mediterrano Pizza (based on employee recommendation as the best pizza they have - see picture). I felt that both the latte and the pizza were just mediocre. Nothing to keep coming back for. I've heard their panini's are good, but that will have to be a future review. Prices would have been reasonable if the food tasted a little better. 
I also have to say that the folks working behind the counter were very nice and courteous.

I was in town visiting some friends at Purdue, and they suggested that we go here for brunch. It is in a good location, and the inside is very bright and airy. Rather than table service, you order the food and pick it up at the counter, so if you're looking to go somewhere to eat and really be able to talk with friends this is a good place to go. I think the food and prices matched pretty well, but the reason for my 3 stars was because of a pineapple situation. That sounds really weird, I know, but I am allergic to pineapple, so I asked about what fruit came in the seasonal fruit cup. Being allergic to pineapple sucks because it's so yummy, but I just can't have it. They said that there is pineapple in the fruit cup, so I asked if I could have double of whatever other fruit they were feeling instead of pineapple. When I got my fruit cup, they ended up still putting pineapple in it and charging me for a whole other fruit cup even though my sandwich was supposed to come with one. I was really confused and also worried because if someone was more allergic than me and ended up with pineapple, that could be a really big problem :( 

The food and coffee were good, but I was a bit put off by the whole experience when I went up to the counter to tell the person ringing what happened and she seemed very reluctant to have the manager come over to try to do a refund. I ended up just passing it off and deciding that I probably wouldn't go back.

In town on business and heard about Cafe Literato and checked it out for lunch. This is definitely a spot that I would both recommend and return to if I were local. The restaurant is open and just a nice space. I liked that you order at the counter and then head up to the pass to get your food from the kitchen.

I had the Brick Oven Pork sandwich and a bowl of tomato bisque soup. The sandwich was really good but what put it over the top was that Italian batard bread. Wow. Nice and light/crispy on the outside and soft and moist inside. While the pork was good, all I kept thinking about was replacing the smoked pork with some really good porketta. It would be just killer on that bread. Either way, I'd suggest they hit the sandwich with some pan drippings because the only drawback was that the pork was a little dry. Not to fear, I was dunking it in the bisque, which was delicious...rich, flavorful, and with little bits of crushed tomato left over from the blending process. So good. 

I'd probably head back there tomorrow but have other joints to patronize and try out while I'm here.

Thanks, Literato, for a great lunch.

Chose this spot for vegetarian options as we passed thru West Lafayette.  A large, bright and lively spot on a Sunday morning, filled with students and churchgoers, Cafe Literato is attached to a church and feels like a community center with food. Order at the counter, find a table.

The menu offered lots of expected beverages, including smoothies and baked goods, sandwiches, salads and soups. Ordered an all-veggie grilled sandwich and appreciated the offering: eggplant, zucchini, peppers.  Unfortunately, the tomato soup was sweet and cloying, and the grilled cheese just ok. Mango smoothie was a hit. A good place to meet friends but not the food we'd hoped for.

Cafe Literato is attached to a large church off Northwestern. It has a creative and upscale variety of pizzas, salads, and sandwiches. They also serve coffee and smoothies. I especially appreciate their variety of vegetarian options. I haven't been disappointed with their food when I've eaten here. I've had and can personally recommend the grilled cheese, margherita pizza, shiitake mushroom pizza, and red pepper and feta panini. 

The atmosphere is also really nice with famous authors' quotes etc on the wall. Great lighting and decoration as well. 

It's worth stopping by if you're in the mood for a light lunch/brunch or better coffee than Starbucks.

It's an excellent place to lunch or dinner. It's location is perfect, because isn't to close or to far to Purdue. Each one of my family ordered a different sandwich and all of them was exquisite. The friendly employee suggested a flavored latte, oh my Gosh was delicious. Every time will return to visit my daughter at Purdue I will stop at this place.

I'm a student at Purdue, and Cafe Literato is my friends' and I go-to place for a delicious off-campus lunch or dinner. Their sandwiches never disappoint, always flavorful and fresh. They also have awesome pizza, with plenty of interesting (and delicious flavors). It's only about a mile from campus, and also includes a student-friendly study space in the building its attached to. Great spot for a quick and well-priced meal!

This is probably one of my favorite hangout places. It's a great place to study and a nice place to have lunch! The people are always friendly and super nice. The food is a little more on the expensive side, however, their brick oven pizzas are so good! Their salads are very big and are always made fresh. I absolutely love this place!

reviews.text: Loved that we were able to sign up for a table remotely via Yelp. We were then able to check in upon arrival and waited a few minutes to get seated. As first time guests we got the beignets half off and they were AMAZING. We had the eggs Blackstone benedict, cinnamon roll French toast which came with side of eggs and the southwest omelet. This was a great balance of sweet and flavory for 2 people ( maybe too much). Will be visiting again for outdoor seating now that the weather is nice.

We had breakfast here before a Purdue tour today. It was awesome all the way around. The staff was efficient, knowledgeable, and super friendly. They are doing a good job following COVID protocols. The best part is the food. They have so many good choices it was hard to choose! We started with a plate of the bomb complimentary beignets and awesome coffee. Our table had the Southwestern Scramble without the andouille, the Croissant French Toast, the Cinnamon Roll French Toast and the Salmon Bowl. Everything was fresh and amazing! We were a little rushed so our server packed up part of it to go. She was incredibly accommodating. Really enjoyed this meal. I would highly recommend it!

All I can say is wow. After 4 years of attending Purdue, I decided to try Another Broken Egg Cafe and was extremely impressed.

Positives

-Food: The food is incredible with flavors and combinations that you really can't get anywhere else. The vibe is Cajun with many of the dishes having crawfish, anduille, shrimp, etc, but they also have traditional fares for anyone. The chefs really put craft into their dishes.

-Service: It's tough to get a table on the weekends, but the staff is super nice. Our waitress was very accommodating, kept refills coming promptly, and aided in our questions on the menu.

-Drinks: They have really good coffee, brunch cocktails, and specialty coffee/sweet drinks for anyone to enjoy.

Negatives

-Price: While the food is quite good, the price is pretty steep for most college students or really anyone getting brunch/breakfast. Most dishes are 12-18$, coffee 3.50$, and specialty drink 5+$ vs the typical 6-10$ fares at many diners around. The ingredients reflect the price, but usually that spend is reserved for nicer dinners for most people.

I ordered the lobster and brie omelette with an English muffin and fresh country potatoes. The omelette was okay. It was pretty bland and unimpressive. The omelette tasted a lot more fishy than I was expecting. The potatoes were pretty good. My meal was really big and kept me full for several hours. Also, we were seated closer to other diners than I would have liked. I believe that guests should have been more spaced out to promote safety.

First timing visiting this brunch joint on Purdue Campus.   Each of us enjoyed our entrees.  Belgian waffle cooked perfectly (better with melted butter).   My breakfast sandwich of fried chicken covered in sausage gravy was delicious.  My wife ordered the  crab cakes and fried green tomato entree.  I am guessing it was great since I was not offered a bite

Would recommend to anyone visiting the campus.

My husband, daughter, and I toured Purdue this morning for an hour and we were pretty darned hungry afterwards. My daughter wanted to stay on or close to campus so she suggested Another Broken Egg. I'll confess that I had already selected another restaurant in West Lafayette and had even selected my beverage snd entree so I was silently disappointed. We walked in and was immediately greeted by a friendly hostess and seated. Our waitress, Cheyenne, was great. She suggested many of the house favorites. I settled on the seasonal corned beef, Brussels, and blistered tomatoes topped with two over easy eggs. My was I surprised how good my meal was! The eggs were perfectly cooked with crispy edges. The yolk blended beautifully with the corned beef, potatoes, and veggies. There was a dollop of sour cream that brought all together so well. My husband had the chicken fried steak Benedict, which he said was good and my daughter had the salmon Benedict that she said was good but had a tad too much seasoning salt. Over all we had a great breakfast that did not disappoint.

Have come here years before and have to say that the quality of food and service has declined since then. Ordered a black coffee and asked for non dairy milk and was given coconut cream.... um how does a restaurant in this age still not carry non dairy milk? Just source it from a grocery store it's like a 5 minute drive. We ordered no eggs and just sausage for a side and was given eggs with bacon ... I don't understand if these waitresses can't hear or what but coconut cream is not milk and no eggs does not mean eggs. Anyways, the portions are ridiculously ginormous so better not eat for some time prior to coming unless you wanna waste half a meal.
Stopped in for breakfast and had the Floridian omlet. It was good sized and came with grits. Nice and friendly people but a bit hard to find.

This place wasn't what I expected. From their images online I was hoping for the best and some delicious food. They were very busy which I expected on a Sunday so I did use the Yelp app to reserve a spot in line which was awesome and they sat us down almost immediately. My server seemed very unknowledgeable about the menu and what it offered. I asked if they did any flavored iced coffees and she said she wasn't sure and she'd check. She just brought me a very iced down coffee with little flavor that I wasn't thrilled about. Gave her the benefit of the doubt, maybe she's new and that's fine. I ordered the eggs Benedict and my mom had an omelet. The food came and while it looked amazing the taste just wasn't.. my eggs were cold and the flavors were just okay. My mom said her omelet seemed very over done and wasn't too happy either. My favorite part was the complimentary pancake beignets. Those were soft, hot and yummy but we didn't get them until after paying for our bill. 

While I didn't enjoy this first time experience, I do think it was just a busy day and maybe I didn't order the best they had to offer. I would still come back and try something new maybe sometime.

Located in an odd spot and indifferent about the wait, it was a pleasant surprise.

With a modern and clean interior we were greeted by an eager and friendly staff. Everyone was very pleasant to work with.

We ordered the lobster Brie and cheese omelet and broken egg biscuit sandwich. Both plates were generous and filling. The omelet was extremely rich. It was savory and very decadent with the Brie, cream cheese and loads of lobster. Accompanying it was a generous cup of fresh fruit. The sandwich wasn't a pick up and eat lunch, rather neat but eaten best with a fork and to really indulge, order it with an extra side of gravy! The sandwich was an over size biscuit with a chicken tender on it covered it n Country gravy! Oh buddy, this is Nirvana after a day tailgating if you know what I mean!   ;  ) 

The coffee was a hearty cup. Not the lightweight wussy stuff watered down by so many places. It is hyper sized on the caffeine. 

The only negative is that the wait is sooo long when smelling what is cooking. My advice is if you are reading this on yelp, put your name on the list in advance and reduce your wait time, it's worth both the wait and the food!

I've been excited to try this place for a long time. The location is a little strange and I can see how parking would be a mess on game days or weekends. It's a pretty small restaurant.

Service was excellent. I had the eggs Benedict which was perfect. The eggs were just right and the ham was great. I got a fruit cup instead of potatoes which was $2.50 more. Seemed high to me, including the fact that they sell orange juice for $4 a glass! That's literally insane. I also ordered a side of "biscuits and gravy". I put it in quotes because the gravy was straight weird. It tasted like a chive party in my mouth. The biscuits were fluffy, but that gravy was just wrong. I took it to work and gave it to a coworker. My friend ordered the pound cake French toast with eggs and sausage. She was really happy with it, as well as the banana fosters syrup. She did not like the sausage. It had greens of some kind (probably chives) in it. 

For a $25 breakfast, I just thought it was OK.

Summary: Food seems a little hit-and-miss; great service.

My first time at Another Broken Egg Cafe. Came here with my husband on a Sunday around mid-morning for brunch. The wait was about 30 minutes long and we were seated at one of the high tables. 

I decided to try out one of their seasonal specials (Southern Benedict with potatoes) as they were going to be taking this off the menu shortly. My husband got the Chilaquiles. 

I can't recommend the Southern Benedict. The biscuit was dry and really bland, one poached egg was done well but the other was overcooked. The sausage was really good but there was way too much ham (that too very salty!) to really appreciate the flavours of the dish. The side of potatoes was pretty average, couldn't really taste any seasoning. Overall a pretty disappointing dish. We did inform our waitress about the salty ham and she took our feedback very well.  

The chilaquiles on the other hand was definitely better. Well garnished. I thought it was a little meat-heavy but some people may really enjoy this. 

Coffee: Not the greatest. And was lukewarm when served.  

Because it was my first time we got treated with their classic sugar dusted beignets which were an absolute delight! 

Would I go back? Yes, to try out their other dishes before settling on a final verdict.

Yes! YES! YEEEAAAASSSSSS!!!!!

Before reviewing the food let me tell you this was the best breakfast / brunch experience since Ruby Slipper in my home state of Louisiana, that's in New Orleans. 

This was and is the best meal I've had before noon in 4 years! That includes my own cooking and I'm pretty damn awesome. Despite being a franchise whomever is training and implementing the hospitality is spot on SOUTHERN CHARM. Friendly and not just our waitress Cheyenne, the Manager Seth and every single employee I saw was smiling and being friendly. Only one waitress complaining about a table that had been finished with their meal for quite some time. I get it though, these folks make their money turning tables. Let me explain what this joint gets that others miss...the second, third and fourth visits that end up making you willing to wait 45 minutes for the best experience in the area. I will and gladly.

So on this occasion we used the yelp waiting list function for the first time. Wait estimate was 22 min and it took us about 20 minutes to arrive from the east side. We arrived and within a few minutes of arriving were sent a text and seated. 

Let me be honest, I wanted to hate it on the drive there. Another knock off want to be NOLA restaurant claiming southern cuisine. "Flashback" walking up to the hostess I heard chubby checker (my moms favorite), and in front of me was a hutch that my grandmother had; I scowled. 

Here we are looking over the menu, which I was delighted was not the same paper menu that we first grabbed on arrival. I simply decided to choose my normal routine, first visit breakfast. Here is was the supreme omelette, which as offered was what I was raised on. Eggs, sausage, bacon, onions, mushrooms and Colby jack (gods omelette cheese). I added a 1/2 biscuit and gravy as well as grits. J had the chicken and waffles with home fries. 

Drinks arrive and the Bloody Mary needed some pepper and a splash of pepper sauce to meet my perfectionist standards. J orders a strawberry mimosa because I neglected to inform her that we were drinking early. Both perfect as well as the strong coffee that I sipped.

Food arrives and NEWS FLASH; we had to add seasoning to nothing!!!! 

First time visitor gets some perks (this is the well placed hook) FREE biscuit beignets arrive and I was skeptical despite J trying and loving them. They are different but delicious and if you omit the orange marmalade then you are void of taste buds.  

The freaking omelette, my mèmè would have loved this. The biscuits and sausage gravy!?!? Tender fresh biscuits with amazing sausage gravy (best in Indiana).  The grits were a little bouisey (diced tomatoes green onions and bacon). I pushed that aside for grits only... OMG perfect. Second bite with the bouisey topping; eye rolling and delightful. English Muffin with a light smear of butter to sop up lost bits and it, too was perfect.

Speaking for J as she ate some of mine as usual!!  I tried her Chicken and Waffles with Chipotle Honey on the side. It was her first chicken and waffles and she asked me how to eat it and I offered my opinion which was a fail. So the chipotle honey is a strong honey with slight chipotle kick. Independent of the sauce, she loved it. 

The honest final comment is everything on the menu speaks to my southern soul and if you find yourself trapped in Lafayette, Indiana, you should make your way to this place and piss us all off because the seating is perfect but there is already a wait! 

BTW, the music and ambiance was great the entire meal!
The place was full of people with less protection. I wouldn't go there and do a dine in. The food wasn't as good as before. Disappointed and might not go again.

tldr: The food here is solid/fine, like you'd expect at a breakfast diner. But the prices are more like restaurant level rather than cheap diner level. The result is a fairly satisfying breakfast for more money than I'd expect to spend.

My girlfriend and I shared a plate of plain French toast, which was not great (not hot, rubbery). We also shared a seafood omelette, which was good (lots of shrimp, pretty big, sauce on top). This came with an English muffin (like the French toast, not hot), a small bowl of grits (fine, plain), and a piece of ham (nice flavor). We were supposed to get a side of bacon too but only got one strip. Weird? She also got coffee and we spent $35 with tip. So again it's not like the food was bad, but it was just okay for that much money.

They do have a nice feature on the menu of writing how many calories each dish has.
This is helpful for portion control!

We went on a Saturday morning around 9am and it was not busy (we were seated right away). By 10 or so it got a bit crowded.
Loved it, always delicious! We had a chance to stop there for breakfast today, always the go-to.

This is a cute little breakfast place adjacent to the Purdue campus (located, conveniently, across the street from the Armstrong Building). It's busy for brunch, so there is a wait to get seated, but otherwise service is friendly and speedy. My server,  Brianna, was very nice and had great timing. They definitely earn their tips here! I got a Cranberry Mimosa, which was tart and tasty and perfect for the humid and rainy morning. I ordered Shrimp and Grits for my meal-it's a southern themed restaurant. The actual grits themselves are plain and overly bland, but a good texture. The accompanying sauce and baby shrimp/ sausage add the perfect amount of spice, and the garlic bread pancake things on the side are buttery and tasty. Worth the wait!

During a wonderful weekend on campus, other than a saddening loss to Michigan at sold-out Mackey Arena, my Boiler and I discovered the very best breakfast spot in West Lafayette. Admittedly this is a low bar, as breakfast sucks pretty much everywhere. We are breakfast connoisseurs, and heretofore we have found nothing but mediocrity. No more.

It's called "Another Broken Egg Cafe" and its on Northwestern Avenue, across from the Physics building. The crowds are deserved and the prices (no student budget here) well-earned. If you arrive after 9A on a weekend morning, prepare to wait for a table. And that was before this posting.

An absolute delight when it comes to breakfast and brunch classics. I went here for the first time this morning, and the interior instantly charmed me, with its red walls and modern decour, and the waitresses were the most friendly I have ever come across anywhere so far. I was asked if I had ever been there before, strangely, but I was soon enlightened that new customers got a free half-order of their mini-beignets, which further reinforced my good first impression. Beignets are hard to find anywhere outside of the south, and while their mini ones didn't quite stack up to a full-sized beignet, they were delicious nonetheless (though hard to eat neatly with a beard and black clothing, on account of the powdered sugar).

It was hard choosing what I wanted from their posh and delectable-sounding items, like bananas foster pancakes, chocolate-ganache stuffed waffles, sweet potato waffle, lemon blueberry goat cheese pancakes, cinnamon roll french toast, lobster and brie omelette, chicken and waffles -- on and on. I decided to be adventurous with the unique "crab cake benedict," though, described as jumbo crab cakes served on an English muffin, topped with poached eggs, an "Andouille-infused" hollandaise sauce, and served with a side of potatos or grits. I don't often associate fish (except for smoked salmon) with breakfast, and crab cakes are always a risky business anyways (you can either be served a very good one, or else one that gives you the runs six hours later because of food poisoning). 

Fortunately, there was no fishy business -- the crab cake was tender and went surprisingly well with the poached egg and hollandaise sauce (which had actual Andouille sausage in it, far from just being "infused"). The potatoes were acceptable -- a little dry, and my only gripe was that there was ~$1.30 charge extra for them putting cheese and bacon bits on them, which was not made known to me when it was offered while ordering. I'd say you should probably go for the grits instead. At any rate, I will certainly be returning, and hopefully I will have just as excellent an experience as I explore their other options.

The food was disappointing, but the service was decent. 

I ordered take out during my lunch and was extremely pleased with how fast I received my food. The actual food however was very disappointing. I ordered the Floridian Omelet with potatoes and English muffin. The omelets flavor seemed to get worse with each bite. The combination of crab and cheese just didn't seem to work together in flavors, at least for me. There was also just a huge glob of cream cheese in the middle. So big that it was room temp at best while the rest of the omelet was hot. I tried to eat it all because It's the most expensive omelet I have ever bought, I just couldn't manage it.  My photos are how far I got. The omelet was big and the egg part of it was wonderful the flavors just didn't seem to go together.

I was extremely disappointed in the omelet. The potatoes and English muffin were good but I didn't receive any condiments for them (I should have thought to ask)

I wouldn't suggest to anyone I know to eat here but I also wouldn't caution them away. For the price and other reviews I have read I was expecting some amazing food but was sadly disappointed.

reviews.text:
Mountain Jack's is still our favorite north-of-Indy, cozy restaurant for prime rib and seafood!
We made an early dinner reservation for two in the bar area on a Saturday. So glad we did -- given social distancing -- as that leaves just two intimate booths available. We enjoyed cocktails, dinner salads, stuffed mushrooms appetizer, prime rib entree (requested a lean cut) and salmon entree served Oscar style. Everything was positively top notch and delicious!!
Our server / bartender, Ryan, was simply delightful -- so friendly and she even gave courtesy chuckles to my hubby's dad jokes! 
Looking forward to dining again at MJ's on our next road trip north!
Forest mushroom chicken was to die for. The lighting is amazing, desserts are delicious. Highly recommend.

Definitely the best steakhouse in the area. The prime rib is king, but the ribeye is a close second. I've always loved this place. Classic, dark, has a lodge sort of feel. Desserts change and they bring you a platter to view before you order, which is classy. Mom-Thurs they have early bird specials which include an entree and side. Check those out from 5-6pm. Hade the rare prime rib special, broccoli and added a salad. Delicious! I love it when I order a rare piece of beef and it actually comes out rare. 

This place is always classy. Seemed a little busy during COVID for us, but they clearly were trying. Will always support this classic spot.

Can I give this place 4+ stars ? Like maybe 4.5 stars. They really pulled through on getting us in on Christmas Eve for our reservation. We had been calling for 3 days and it just kept going to an automatic answer, which you could not leave a voicemail on. We tried calling during their business hours after 5pm and again no answer... same auto answer. We finally went online and tried to put in a reservation. Someone called us back the next day and fit us in. The atmosphere is lovely. Several fireplaces, and I love how it has a coat check next to the entrance. This is Lafayette's finest dining restaurant. It was beautifully decorated for Christmas and the atmosphere was cozy. Our waiter told us the restaurant opened in 1977. This place is a classic.

Most meals come with soup or salad. We got the house salad. They used to make it in front of you. Now, instead, you have to tell them what you want on the salad. You can also add bacon and/or mushrooms. Trust me, add the bacon !  They give you plenty and the flavor is amazing ! It's more like finely chopped ham than bacon. They have several house-made dressings. I got the red wine vinegar creamy dressing. Very yummy ! I got the crab cakes to start off.  They were fresh-made, but I think they used the canned crab with alot of breading. The flavor reminded me of a salmon patty. Decent, but not the lump-crab meat patties that I'm used to. My best friend got the prime rib rare. This is supposedly what they are known for. It comes with an au ju sauce and house-made horseradish cream sauce. I also got the largest prime rib. It was 1.5lbs and bone-in steak. The knife I was given was not sharp and they had to trade it out. I guess these are the same ones from the 70s lol. It was good, but even with the replaced knife I had to work too hard to saw into the meat in order to cut it into pieces. My husband got the Ribeye. He had ordered it medium well, but it came out medium. He liked it fine. Definately get the augratin potatoes as your side !  They are cheesy and delicious !!! Another person in our group got the NY Strip. He had ordered it rare and it came out medium well. He sat for quite a while (We were 1/4 complete with our meal) before the waiter finally checked back and then put in an order to replace his steak. The waiter was a bit of a smarty pants. He kind of had an attitude like, .... well I'll work here if I must. Lol  Supposedly, this place is known for their mud pie, but we didn't have enough room for dessert. Total bill was about $100 for 2 people including wine and an appetizer. This is a nice place to have a romantic evening.

Came in for dinner with my husband. It was great as normal. Service  was great especially our waitress Taylor. She was so nice very attentive our cups never went dry. 
For dinner we had French onion soup,filet mignon  with au gratin potatoes. My husband had prime rib and mash potatoes  with au gratin potatoes  as well. It all was very good we tryed all the shrimp add ons as well my favorite  was the scampi he agreed. For dessert we had apple strudel with ice cream just the right sweetness to end the night. My husband had a samuel Adam's off the tap and it was very yummy also.

Went here this evening for a kid free night in the town. Service was great. Food was excellent. Had the crab cakes for an appetizer, they are amazing. Got the prime rib for my entree. Was seasoned perfectly and cooked to my liking. Glad we chose to splurge a little!
Ask for Jeff or Jerry! They will make sure you're taken care of and have a great experience!
Great food. Great service. The calamari appetizer is worth it all by itself. Will definitely be back for the forest mushroom chicken

I wish that I wore a nicer shirt. ;)

This restaurant was recommended by the front desk staff at a nearby hotel. Overall, I do not have any complaints about my dinner at Mountain Jack's. 

I dropped by for an early dinner and grabbed a seat at the bar to have a nice, 'romantic' dinner alone. *I'm not sure if I really had a choice with my seating.* The steak menu is pretty vast. Since I had steak the night before, I was debating between the Mahi tuna or pork chop. *When I was a kid, I was told to never order fish from a steakhouse, so I went with the pork chop for this visit.* Before starting, I went for the crabcake as my appetizer. The crab cakes were just ok. I think that I would have preferred them without the dill sauce because the sauce seemed to drown out the flavor of the crab cakes. My main course, the sweet and sour porks chop, was pretty fascinating. After dinner, I was presented with a tray of super-rich desserts, however, I was far too full from dinner to order a dessert. Looking back, I wish that I had skipped the crab cakes so I would have had more room for a dessert. 

The bartender, who also served as my waitress since I was at the bar, was very friendly and prompt.

If im back in the Lafayette area, I would give Mountain Jack's a second try. I'll just be sure to wear a nicer shirt for my next visit.

I have dined at Mountain Jacks multiple times, typically when Business Associates come into town. We haves dined with family in the main dining room and on my anniversary in the bar area. Stepping into the bar is like going back in time and experience the 50's and not in a bad way. I have never in 8+ visits had a bad experience. You will pay for it in the pocket book so be prepared; it's worth it.

I will update this post with pictures and update the review when I visit again. In the mean time this is currently the only place I send people for the best steak and experience in Lafayette. That's not to say I don't have another go to; but let's be honest, Texas Roadhouse is nation wide and I never recommend that even though I eat it. 

C'est si bon

I didn't get any pics because I was too busy enjoying my daughter's birthday and the amazing food at Mountain Jacks's! 
We started with a bottle of wine and a sampler platter. We loved everything on the sample platter but especially the sauce the shrimp were in. It was like a spicy kind of buffalo sauce but not buffalo sauce. I can't describe it but it was sooo good!!!
We all got the table salad not only was it yummy it was actually pretty fun having it made at the table. My daughter doesn't eat red meat so she got the Barramundi fish. I tried it. It had great flavor with a very soft texture. My husband got the porterhouse steak and he said it was the best he's ever had. He eats his med rare so, I didn't try it but he definitely doesn't say something is the best if it's not. I got the ribeye. It was tender with amazing flavor and a nice crisp outside. Loved it! I almost don't have words for their delicious homemade bread. I believe it may be a sour dough. Oh my, this could be dangerous for me if we lived closer! 
I've only eaten at two restaurants in Lafayette. One was East End Grill and now Mountain Jack's. I liked East End Grill...especially their truffle fries but there's no comparison to Mountain Jack's. Mountain Jack's is by far the winner! Their prices were very reasonable as well.

I have never dined here until recently on a Saturday evening I tried to make reservations and realize it had to be done through the website and so I submitted it on a Saturday around 1 PM in the afternoon I called after they opened as I had not heard back only to find out that reservations are only taken the day prior luckily I called and was able to secure a reservation
Upon arrival we had a brief wait prior to being seated the waiting area has seating and a huge unused fireplace when we were seated our table was on the edge of a main walking thorough fare as well as 6 feet away from either the kitchen or a busy area where orders are picked up and or dropped off the location of our table I thought would give us great service due to its proximity to the kitchen but I was wrong
We actually sat at the table without water and without anyone greeting us after the hostess had seated us for over eight minutes
Our waitress seemed very nice she did tell us she was bringing us bread but never brought it further she had no specials to share nor any opinion to give us about the menu never asked us if we had a special occasion we were celebrating or if this was our first time visit to the restaurant it was very matter-of-fact
We both ordered the prime rib in two different cuts and both arrived lukewarm and overcooked it is definitely a hearty meal and generous in its portions as well as the size that a company at the pricing is very fair considering the area
We did opt for the peanut butter pie and it ended up being more savory than sweet
I have only heard great things about this place prior to dining here and was definitely disappointed

Mountain Jack's provided a relatively quick, filling meal for me and my family on the way home from a trip to Chicago.

It was A-OK, as my rating denotes.

We were quickly seated in the restaurant, which looks a lot like a forest lodge with dark wood and fireplaces.

I started with the tableside salad bar, intrigued by what exactly that was. This ended up being the waiter rolling a cart up to the table, on top of which was a platter with lots of cups filled with salad mix-ins. 

The tableside salad bar is a nice touch. Everyone can pick and choose what they want without leaving their seats.

Continuing with the items Mountain Jack's seems to be known for, I chose the prime rib. This is listed as being "award winning," herb crusted and slow roasted overnight. 

And it was OK -- not the best and not the worst prime rib I've had. It was a little tougher in parts, but the spices on it worked well.

The rest of my family generally enjoyed their meals. Considering we have a variety of tastes, it was good to find a restaurant we all could find something at. It was also convenient that this restaurant is so close to the interstate.

There are few people in life that are perfectly suited for their job but Eric was awesome at not only patiently entertaining every question we had but also making terrific suggestions tailored to the unique personalities around the table. We spent a few hours at the restaurant huddled in a booth talking about our conference, life in general and enjoying the far more honest than anticipated conversations that the relaxing atmosphere encouraged. We had amazing tableside salads that Eric suggested and prepared for us. Friendly service, great attitude and he was on top of all our orders! The food was great, service was quick and all orders received were exactly as we hoped (medium, medium rare, etc.). Definitely worth a trip during your visit to the area. Within walking distance to the Courtyard Marriott in Lafayette.
Mountain Jack's is THE destination restaurant when traveling to IN. As a regional endurance athlete food quality, extraordinary service, with reservation to protect my time. A 5 Star destination!

Mountain Jack's ROCKS!  We ordered birthday dinner for 5 last Saturday. Everything was absolutely perfect. Very well seasoned and scrumptious. In these tough times, it's good to know that we can count on these restaurant professionals to maintain their normal high standards.  We highly recommend this Lafayette local treasure!

Mountain Jack's was a nice place to celebrate a birthday on a Sunday evening. We called a few hours before for a reservation and when we arrived we were greeted with a friendly face and we were asked I a very kind tone what we were celebrating. We were immediately seated at a table with menus and water. We were then tended to quickly and ordered appetizers and drinks. We ordered the cocktail shrimp and the potato skins. The potato skins were decent, kind of hard to mess up, but also didn't seem to have a ton of flavor. The shrimp was prepared well and were served 6 jumbo shrimps. They were good size. The sauce was not spicy enough for us, so we asked for more horseradish on the side. We are in love with St. Elmo's shrimp cocktail and so we like it hot! I ordered the whiskey glazed salmon with garlic mashed potatoes and onion strings. The entrees also came with a choice of soup or salad. The soup of the day was split pea soup with bacon and also offered French onion. I got the opted for the caesar salad and it was alright. The French onion soup was very much so French ONION soup, as there were tons of onion in the soup. I found the soup very sweet and the salad subpar. The  salmon was flaky and cooked well. It was very very salty and ended up scraping most of the glaze off. The mashed potatoes were alright, again not great but decent. The steaks were cooked well and everyone was impressed with the portion sizes for the price. We were also given a complementary dessert since we were celebrating a birthday. They brought us a huge slice of their mud pie and it was delicious. We also ordered a slice of the chocolate mousse pie as well and everyone seemed to prefer the mud pie. We did have an egg allergy and the desserts did have egg. Overall it was nice for Lafayette/West Lafayette.

I can't get over how affordable this place is. For $25 I was able to get a 10 oz ribeye cooked a perfect medium, with a "Neil style" topping (hollandaise, bacon, blue cheese, sautéed onions, sautéed mushrooms). It came with two sides plus a salad. That's a lot of food for $25. And it was so delicious, far better than the more expensive fare at the numerous chain steakhouses in the area. 

It's a nice decor. Much more intimate and a bit more old fashioned than the nearby competition. Their bar is stocked with several fantastic bourbons, liquors and craft beer bottles. And I haven't even mentioned the great and polite service. All in all a great find that I'll be sure to revisit. And I still can't get over the fantastic price!

9/11/19 Calamari was very good. Long Island iced tea was not bad. Award winning prime rib was excellent. Amazing onion straws and garlic mashed potatoes. Other than incredibly slow service, this was a great experience.
Great service and delicious meal. Menu explanations were very good. Waitress very accommodating and friendly.

reviews.text:
Firstly - they do curbside pick up and are very courteous which we really appreciate.

Food - a little oily but very yummy. We tried:
1) Diced chicken in spicy sauce - has a kick but nothing crazy. Chicken is fried well. 
2) Fried chicken wings - it doesn't have a sauce or marinade but it was still really good! 
3) Mapo tofu - yum! If you are not a fan of szechuan peppercorns I would advise against getting this dish. 

Good sized portions and prices are reasonable.

Fabulous food. They always try to accommodate us for our vegetarian diet. I have only ever done takeout and been impressed every time. Their serving size is very good too. We usually get 2 meals out of an order.

So I went back one time and have had delivery a few times. Flavor is not what I remember from my original visit. Everything is either good or ok. Some dishes are crazy bland, which is weird from an authentic Chinese place. And they often get orders slightly wrong - say ordering ginger spinach and receiving a very spicy version instead or getting an entirely wrong order. 

Sichuan House and Peppercorn are more consistent with better flavors.

The Peking Duck was so so and it would be enough for three people. The duck was a little bit too greasy, though. The spring rolls were okay, not fantastic, but they were worth trying. 

Also, there were many people ordering and the waiting time was pretty long, so be sure to place an order ASAP. Expecting waiting time to be like 40 minutes +.

Our first time back to this location. Brand new restaurant and no more grocery store. Try the spicy beef and chicken dishes. They are fantastic--especially during those long Indiana winters.

We started with the Mr. and Mrs Smith chewy beef appetizer and then moved on to the Chef Szechuan Chili Beef and the crispy friend chicken with chilis. All were great dishes.

We will definitely be back. Recommended for two or more, since the portions are large and meant for sharing.

Taste, located in the old CT Market building, is a restaurant we've quickly become regulars at. It's a very spacious location that they've renovated, and it looks very modern and open inside now. 

There are two options when it comes to Taste - hot pot or just regular food. We have yet to try hot pot, but I will update my review when we do. The regular menu is fantastic, however.

We've tried many dishes here, including a lot of the dumplings, mapo tofu, fried rice, various beef and chicken dishes, and more. I can definitely say my favorite is the beef with scallions; absolutely delicious. The beef is tender, and I love onions/scallions, so it's a homerun for me. The dishes come with rice upon request, and I definitely recommend it. Some of the dishes are definitely on the spicy side, so make sure to ask about that if it's a concern. 

Service here can be a on the longer side at times, but for the most part, our food has arrived on time. Service staff is very friendly.

The prices are reasonable, but just be aware that they charge an 18% service charge at dinner, so make sure to note that. (Though if you tip regularly like myself, this shouldn't be a big deal, as it takes the place of the tip.)

Overall, definitely give it a try!

This used to be the old CT Market, which used to have a restaurant quietly tucked in the back, but I'm guessing they didn't want to compete with the New World Market right across the street, so there's an entire restaurant here instead now.

Went here with a friend who doesn't speak Chinese and we got the Peking Duck meal set, Szechuan Wontons, and Snow Pea Leaves. The Peking Duck meal set costs around $40 and comes with either a soup option or a stir-fried option for the excess meat of the duck that doesn't go into the actual Peking Duck. I would say this is among the best Peking Duck I've had in the Midwest, including the likes of Chicago's Lao Sze Chuan, and easily the best in the Lafayette area (much better than the nearby Peppercorn Kitchen and Szechuan Garden). The presentation is wonderful, the meat is rich but thin, and the skin is nice and crispy. The garnishes and sauce are flavorful without being too strong. We got the soup option, which was also nice and hearty, but not quite as spectacular as the main event. The Szechuan Wontons were also some of the best dumplings I've had in a while, with a subtle sweet and peppercorn flavor; my friend was also especially impressed with the dumplings. 

There are two potential downsides that I can see someone experiencing here. First, the items are pricey, especially after the mandatory 18% service charge. I think the food quality was very "authentic" and worth the price for the dishes that we ordered and I had the fortune of being able to communicate with the staff in their native language. Unlike a lot of places with foreign staff, they were pretty cheerful and polite and provided decent service. However, this also brings me to my second potential concern. They clearly preferred to converse in their native language, which was somewhat exclusive to my non-speaking friend, so I'm not sure what experience an entire group of non-speakers would have.

This place is THE BEST Chinese restaurant in West Lafayette  if you want an ensured great dining experience this is the move. Their orange chicken is amazing and they have yummy fried noodles which are basically lo mein :) their portion sizes are generous too. tell a friend!

The best Chinese restaurant! Clean and bright lobby, good service and tasty food. Especially for the hot pot, it is my favorite!  The base is so rich and delicious. Als will definitely go there again.

The restaurant was totally renovated from the past grocery store/restaurant. 
We were not sure how much the menu had changed but we still could find our favorites. Everything we ordered tasted great! Even from the old time, we've never tried their hotpot so we will try that next time.
The best hotpot in West Lafayette. It's quality over quantity, but the quality is there.

Great food and great environment. It offers a lot of choice and come out new dishes every week. I would recommend for people who just want to have a quick bite and also who wants an authentic taste cuisine.
Amazing! We decided to try somewhere new and will definitely be back. Friendly staff and unique foods. Everything we had was delicious!

Food was decent but the service was extremely chaotic and the atmosphere of the place is confusing, the menu cryptic if you don't speak Chinese.

We ordered something described as "Pork Garlic Bolt" in the menu, yet on the check we got after 3 seconds it showed up as "Twice cooked pork with green peppers". We asked our server about this but she said it's the same thing. I still don't quite believe that, but even if it is true, why does the same dish appear on the menu more than once? Also, the dish we ordered was not supposed to be spicy, but what we got was covered in red and green chillis.

We were also served by 3 different people who all had to look at the check on our table multiple times to figure out what part of our order was still missing. Despite that,  all three dishes we ordered were served separately, the rice to go with them only came after we reminded them about that and the Appetizer arrived dead last, when we were already pretty much done with the mains.

I usually don't mind patchy service all that much, because after all if I'm not happy with it I can always give a slightly lower tip than usual. But here, an 18% tip is automatically included in the bill. I hate that because it leads to terrible service.

The place itself is very posh but there was very loud pop music in the background, which was a bit strange.

The menu is very extensive but it doesn't really describe the dishes, it contains items like "Beef - 12.95". 

All of this is a shame because the food itself was not bad.
Super spicy dishes. Great authentic flavor. My noodle dish on my first visit was a little oily, but still delicious. The cumin beef is one of my favorites on the menu. Great experience.

I went with my friends one time and it was a great experience! However, the second time that I went here with my two aunts and mom was terrible. The waiters sat us down with our menus and then they went to the front desk and started chatting with one another. We ordered 6 dishes. After the dishes came, we asked for one dish to be taken back and remade as it was wayyy too salty. But there was no difference and it seemed as though they didn't even make a new dish. The service was definitely not worth a 18% tip. I hope this place takes my constructive criticism as the other dishes were pretty well made and the inside is very nicely decorated with plenty of space for people of big parties.

Visit here 2 months ago and had the worst dinning experience. Not only the service is very poor and slow (waited 30 minutes for them to set up a hotpot). They charge a mandatory 20% tip for two people because we dine in after 8pm, what kind of restaurant does that? If u want a 20%, please provide worthy service.

The service in this restaurant is slow and unattended. The 18% service charge is outrageously unfair on top of the generally overpriced menu items. The restaurant overall is dirty and poorly managed. The food quality is just mediocre. Not recommended.

'Zero' star if there's an option. The most horrible Chinese restaurant in West Lafayette. If you like to be cheated, try this restaurant. Mandates a 18% tipping even when there's just 2 of us. Poor service, food is only mediocre.
The food is absolutely amazing. The prices are very reasonable for the portions you get. The staff has always been nice and respectful. It's one of my favorite places to eat. It's so so so SO good!
