reviews.text:
Excellent food, drinks, and service.
I can't say they are strictly "French cuisine" because there are many traditional selections that aren't on the menu as well as other items that are definitely not French or even French inspired..
 That said, the food was great, the service was friendly, welcoming, and attentive.
  Will definitely be back and eager to recommend to others.

The staff (Yvette) was attentive and gave great recommendations when I was torn between items. Don't skip the seasonal cocktails, I loved my "blue moon" a citrusy White Russian style drink, tastes like a creamsicle! The salad I ordered could easily have been an entree. The Scallops were delicious; the juxtaposition in texture between the spiral cut squash, juicy scallops, and the crunch of the toasted prosciutto surprises and delights. To finish things off, the earl grey pavlova topped with fruit was a delicate and satisfying finish. I'll be back!
So glad Lafayette has a restaurant of this quality.  The food, the service, the entire experience is top notch.

Visited today for the first time and had brunch.  The brunch menu was fantastic!  SO much to choose from!  Everyone in my party was very happy with what they ordered.  Price point for brunch is more reasonable than the dinner menu.  Service was good and all the staff were very polite.

Ambiance leave a lot to be desired.  Kind of boring.  And the metal chairs are very uncomfortable!

Disappointed by the looks of the dinner menu.  I don't know that I'll bother with dinner, but I'll definitely return for brunch!

We had not known this restaurant was here! We parked, got out of the car and realized this restaurant was next to where we had parked. It was worth a try! Was it ever!

Relaxing atmosphere, well chosen selection of food on the menu, and an impressive wine list. 

The options are quite good! They were able to accommodate a keto diet. The food was tasty, of a high quality, and presented well. 

We will go back!

Have never had the same thing twice and have never been disappointed.  Last night I had the "Duck two ways" and both ways were delectable.  The presentation was as beautiful as the taste was divine.  (unfortunately it was so delicious i forgot to get a picture)
Folie is easily comparable to the finest establishments in Indianapolis but with Lafayette charm instead of big city attitude.  A wine selection to be envied, good craft beers on tap, and their cocktails are awesome.  This is the perfect place for special evenings but comfortable enough for a casual evening out.

Very disappointing. The experience started with the hostess being rude while sitting me at one of the tables. 

Ordered the Spanish octopus as an appetizer. Worst octopus I've ever had. It was so incredibly tough. No taste. The server saw that we didn't eat much and looked disappointed. No apologies. No taking it off out bill. Nothing.

The steak was average. Overpriced for what it was. 

Only had one option for desert that didn't sound appealing at all so we went elsewhere for desert.

I had the best food and service. Everything was perfect.  Rachel was terrific.  
They had a great selection of wines too.

We arrived for dinner on a Saturday evening. There were two other parties in our area when we arrived; one of those parties soon left. The interior is quite nice: lighting, carpeting, flooring, art, and the lay out of the space is quite cozy.  We were, at first, puzzled about why the place was so empty.  We ordered a cheese plate, which took a very long time to arrive, considering there weren't too many other people in the restaurant. The cheese was dry, and the fruit, which included some apple slices, tasted terrible. The apple, literally, tasted like someone had found it on the floor, sliced it up, and brought it out to us with the cheese.

Our other dishes were flavorful, but skimpy and all of the "hot" dishes arrived lukewarm.  This place definitely is trying to experiment with flavors, textures, and ingredients, but they just can't get the execution right.  These dishes, also, took a long time to arrive, given that we were the only guests in the dining room who had ordered.

The worst, though, was the staff.  No one was rude or deliberately unresponsive.  However, several of the staff members were talking very, very loudly about things like drug use, and using a lot of profanity when they spoke. The acoustics of the restaurant were such that it was almost impossible for me to have a conversation with my dining partner, and we could not wait to leave. It was a huge turn-off.  All of the staff with whom we had contact seemed very inexperienced, and from what we could tell (e.g., their very loud conversations), they are college students who are in the job for a paycheck, not because they are interested in hospitality as a career.

Very disappointing, and I'm not surprised that when we left, the dining area was +completely+ empty of guests. This, on a Saturday evening in the downtown area.

Folie presents French-influenced nouvelle(ish) cuisine in a relaxed atmosphere. We were greeted by a young staff that took excellent care of us throughout the night. The wine list is superb for Lafayette, IN with a range of options at different price points. 

Our appetizers were pork belly with sweetbreads, and steamed mussels with stilton and pernod. Both were infused with layers of complex flavors. 

For entrees we ordered pork tenderloin with barley risotto in a calvados sauce and a steak with duck fat potatoes. The barley risotto was a perfect complement to the pork and all tasted great in the sauce. The steak was well prepared but was maybe less of a standout by comparison. 

Desserts took on more of a molecular gastronomy flair with a deconstructed berry cheesecake that was to die for. We also tried the chocolate panna cotta; the flavors were excellent but the consistency was a little tough. 

All in all, Folie is a strong addition to the restaurant scene in Lafayette with upscale dining, delicious fresh food with innovative preparations, and a well curated wine list.

I visited Folie during the Christmas Parade. Not sure if it was because of the event, but the restaurant was more or less empty at 6:15 on Saturday. A few more parties came in during our meal, but it never came close to filling up.

The service was excellent. All the staff were kind, friendly, just great at their jobs. 

The menu was small. I appreciate that. I despise large menus. I want to choose from what a restaurant is best at...I don't want to wade through nine pages. 

We ordered a hot appetizer, a cold appetizer and two entrees. Respectively scallop, beet, lamb loin, monkfish/lobster

Prior to any of this we received the bread with truffle oil butter. Not a huge truffle fan, but it was pretty good, so that's a win. The complimentary tasting soup they brought was excellent. Lentil-based, I believe. Very good. Best thing we ate actually.

The hot appetizer was a single seared scallop. Naturally I don't want overcooked scallops, but this was not cooked in the middle at all. And what I don't get is why this "seared" scallop had no coloration on the top or bottom. Not much of a sear-job when there's no color and the inside isn't cooked. The sauce with it was good. The portion was microscopic.

Next was the "Beets". Not sure what i expected, but it was various types of beets. Not a beet fan, and these were beets. Need I say more? The beet sorbet was my favorite option. $13 for what amounted to a single beet. Who knew?

Monkfish was just ok. Lobster with it was good. Sauce was decent. Combined it didn't add up to more than the sum of the parts. Was just three different things. Again, small portion.

Lamb loin was cooked rare, tasted great, sauce was also pretty good. the meat portion here was ok, the sides were comically small. About two bites of zucchini and two bites of something else. Ridiculous.

We also had a couple Moscow Mules (they call them something fancier). Those were very good.

This restaurant has excellent service. I enjoyed my drink. I also thought the entrees tasted good. The serving sizes are very small, especially appetizers. 

This is easily the most pretentious restaurant in Lafayette. The presentation and ingredients of the meals seem to be more important than the taste. $130 for an ok meal is not ok in Lafayette. 

Folie seems to have no set menu. I believe the last two restaurants to try that  model in Lafayette were Restauration & Heirloom. Those one-year experiments didn't end well. 

I do like the idea of rotating a portion of the menu, but by rolling the entire thing over, you can't appeal to the people who are....*ahem*...boring eaters. There is one in every group (and most couples). If you can't always offer a few items that have mass appeal you're going to have trouble keeping guests coming back in a small city like Lafayette. It would make more sense to me if they were to keep a few broad-appeal, perfected dishes on the menu and rotate the rest. 

This restaurant seems like it would only make sense in a very large city. I don't see it making any sense whatsoever in Lafayette. It's borderline ridiculous, but I wish them the best. I would put the quality of the food on par with Black Sparrow or East End Grill, but at a much higher price point (but also with more weird ingredients)

Food/Price would be three stars, but the service was great and drinks were good, so I felt compelled to go with four stars.

Husband and I dined here last Thursday and LOVED it! Can't BELIEVE such a perfect restaurant has come to Lafayette but, boy, are we grateful! The dining room is understated elegance; special but not stuffy. The service is exactly how I like it: attending to your needs without trying to make chit-chat. You feel cared for but not hovered over. 

And the food...the FOOD! All ingredients were the best they could be and each dish was prepared, not just thrown together. I had the trout and my husband had the steak; both were excellent and each was tender. We had a hot appetizer and a cold one. The  pickled vegetables were generous and each vegetable had been pickled differently, making a simple offering interesting to eat. The turnip soup recipe elevated this winter root veggie into something you could CRAVE. (I still can't believe I said that about a turnip!)

We ordered wine by the glass (it was a Thursday) and it was a generous pour.

Didn't order dessert as we were full, but will go hungrier next time so we have room. The words "chocolate panna cotta" are calling to me.

The chef clearly has some big-city skills. We hope locals can appreciate him so he will stay. 

Our advice to locals? Forget the Bistro! Don't bother with Pure! Skip the noice at East End Grill! GO TO FOLIE and you'll have a new favorite!

Had a great time here last night. It can feel like there are limited options for a high class meal in town, and my girlfriend and I were excited to try something new. We'd definitely suggest this place for a nice date dinner. 

The atmosphere was quiet enough to feel calm and elevated, but loud enough to avoid feeling like a food mueseum. It was fairly empty when we arrived at 6:30, but by 7:00 it was pretty hopping. 

Food was great. I got the salmon and my gf got coq au vin. She clearly had the better dish, but mine was elevated and intriguing, combining unexpected flavors (green beans and pomegranate). I got the better dessert, a deconstructed cheesecake that was fun to work through. You can really see the chef thinking through the dishes in the menu, and that level of care added to the experience. 

We'll definitely come back. Can't wait to see what they add to the menu!

We had a wonderful dinner at Folie! Started with the beet and fig salad which was delicious and large enough to share. Hangar steak with potatoes and mushroom sauce was cooked perfectly and very flavorful. The lamb tagine on sweet potato purée and couscous was great. Wonderful combination of flavors. Topped off with the brownie special dessert which was very good and large enough to share. Brownie was not too sweet and the right amount of chocolate. The food was presented beautifully. Very pleasant staff. A special spot.

Went in for a drink on a Wednesday night. The place was hopping! We sat at the bar for a glass of wine and a bite to eat. Loved the ambiance. Excellent wine list. Plus the staff are so friendly. The shrimp and grits were delicious! I am so excited that Folie is here. I will be coming back for dinner ASAP!!

There's a new fine dining option in Lafayette, and it's excellent.

I went there with my wife, and liked it so much I took business associates there a few days later.

The bar is well stocked, with a wine and beer list that's not as big as some in town, but very well thought out. Wine options range from value bottles that would fit the budget of a grad student splurging on a once a quarter I can't stand ramen any more night to a wine aficionado looking for a good Rhone red. The bartender was friendly and knowledgeable without being intrusive.

The dinner menu was concise and well thought out, a range of appetizers that'd be great to use as "plates to share" for a group. The entrees cover the range from beef to seafood to vegetarian. I've tried fried oysters and the pork belly confit. Both were very good, but the pork belly confit was a luscious, perfectly prepared bite of porcine goodness, balanced by a not too tart, not too sweet dollop of tomato jam. Companions raved about the carrot soup and the wedge salad.

As an entrée, the hanger steak was an excellent piece of beef, prepared (I'm pretty sure sous vide) and seared to perfection. The house pickled mustard grains popped in my mouth, adding just the right amount of bitter and acid to offset the round fatty flavor of the beef.

The duck breast was likewise very good. Maybe just slightly overdone, but it had juicy, tasty meat with crisp, nicely seared skin and most of the fat rendered out. The sour cherry and hazelnuts added some crunch and a little acid, it'd be the perfect dish with an Oregon Pinot Noir.

I didn't try the scallops myself, but both nights I was there people at the next table raved about them, and they sure looked good. Have to save that for my next visit.

I've tried one desert there, a classic profiterole, or as my mom used to call them, a cream puff. Folie's are fresh made pâte à choux pastries filled with vanilla ice cream and topped with chocolate sauce.

I have only two quibbles. The front of the house staff were friendly and super eager to please, but still learning. I watched our server struggle with a corkscrew and wanted to help her, but she did get the job done. The second is that the salmon on the menu is farm raised. I'm sure that's an effort to keep prices down, but a chef this good deserves better material to work with. Go with Alaskan Kings guys.

Overall, this is a restaurant that would make it in New York or Chicago, but at prices that won't bust a Lafayette budget. Highly recommend!

Probably the best high class dining in the area. Sure, it is pricey, but if you want to treat your lady to something special, that's the place to go. We had the salmon and the steak which were both top class and I'd be surprise if any of their dishes are not first grade. My girlfriend and I, we both dislike sweets but the chocolate cake was the perfect finish for an over all great experience. Don't go if you're expecting to overeat, but if you want an extraordinary dining experience, this is the place.

PS: Their bar is as well outstanding. Great wine selection and the cocktails, from what I tried, are very well made.

We tried Folie on a Thursday after Science on Tap and it was a fun experience. A little pricey for what you're getting food wise, but it's got that sophisticated city feel to it. Unfortunately, I don't see it lasting long in Lafayette, just like many of the other cute fusion restaurants. Hopefully I am wrong, they made a great dirty martini!

The Parmesan Crusted Salmon was excellent and the wine selection was superb. 

The owners, John & Halie, went out of their way to stop by and spend the time to make sure everything was perfectly cooked.

It was also a fantastic atmosphere to just grab a drink as well. 

The best bourbon selection I've seen in Lafayette!

Best mussels I've ever had. Ladies liked the salmon. Chicken main was well prepared. Chef knows his business. Wine list was solid. Bar area is a bit loud in the dining area, though the quality of the food made up for it.

reviews.text: Ordered delivery today, was early and still hot! The food was very good and they always have really good options. American Chinese food as well as authentic Chinese food. Plus they have a great location right downtown!
My new fav, Covid safe, take out restaurant! Great meat options and even better veggie options! I'd recommend the braised bak Choi with shiitake mushrooms, the flavors are delicious!

Over this whole COVID-19 period, we've done multiple deliveries/curbside pick-ups from Sichuan House. I haven't had a chance to try out many other Chinese food places in Lafayette/West Lafayette, except for Peppercorns Kitchen, so I don't have a lot to compare with locally. 

Their service is prompt and only on one occasion did they get our order wrong. Portions are good sized and prices are reasonable. Unfortunately, most of their takeaway dishes come in plastic containers. Hope they'll make changes to that soon.

Food is good. The reason I wouldn't give it 5 stars is because certain dishes have turned out differently to what I'm used to. For example, on two occasions the kung pao chicken had been deep fried. Traditionally (correct me if I'm wrong), kung pao chicken is not a deep fried dish. 
Their vegetarian mapo tofu is really yum - I'd definitely recommend that. 

My other major concern with their food is that they use a LOT of oil. I usually end up scooping out multiple tablespoons of oil before eating. Please, please cut back on how much oil you guys use. It's pretty nasty.
Ordered the chicken pepper dish and tasted like I was eating chicken dipped into candy.   Come on, you call this Chinese food??

I've been here  a few times but thought it would be a good idea for dinner.
Tonight was a bad decision.
Wonton soup: no flavor and the wonton over cooked and flavorless 

Salt and pepper shrimp: bland
Fried rice: just over soaked in soy sauce 
Pork egg rolls was spoiled. 

ProTip go to Taco Bell
Always great and  authentic food. Quick service. Best hot and sour soup in town.  I also recommend the moo sho pork.

Very impressed. I've eaten at all the "real" Chinese places in town and this is possibly the best when it comes to flavors. Also had great quality ingredients. Portions were ok. Could be a lucky order, but damn, that was a delicious lunch.

This is a pretty decent Chinese restaurant with a very large selection of genuine Chinese food and more American styled Chinese food items. I adores their shrimp mai fun - it is not greasy in my opinion. My bf usually gets the general tsao's which is good and can be too spicy if you're not careful. They can over do it on the chili oil is the only major complaint in things like the wonton soup or Dan Dan noodles.
The other thing is the crab Rangoon is overcooked. The shell is always super hard. These are the biggest issues. If they could address these items they'd pretty much be perfect.

My favorite authentic Chinese food in town. Every bite I took, I couldn't believe how good the food was. Everything was delicious but I think the potstickers were my favorite. 

This is a tough one to beat. I'll definitely keep going back.

Had never eaten here before but thought we'd try something new; used Grubhub for delivery. 

Pros: The food we ordered was delicious! Their eggplant Szechwan is amazing and the hot & sour soup was possibly the best I've ever had. Normally that kind of soup is mainly just spicy, but this was full of all kinds of flavor too. The garlic sauce is light, not the "American Chinese" brown sauce kind, so be prepared if you're expecting that; it's very different, though good! The food had a much more authentic Chinese flavor in my opinion.

Cons: They got our order wrong so we had to refund/reorder, but they fixed the second batch very quickly. The crab rangoon was ok; it's not as good as some. Probably won't order it again only because everything else was so good by comparison. They also sent no soy sauce, but that might be because I didn't request the driver to get any. 

It's such good food that we would definitely order from there again; I know mistakes happen. Very happy to have tried them!
OMG! The food was amazing! Best Chinese food I've ever had. I can't get over how good the food was! Definitely a place I will be visiting again.

Sichuan House is previously Ichiban I believe.

They remodeled everything and the restaurant decor is really nice now.

I only tried one dish (Twice cooked pork) so this isn't a though review, but my first impression is that I would go back again. Overall I would give the quality of the dish 9/10. It was almost perfect but some of the veggies were not thoroughly cooked so there was a bit of raw vegetable taste (mainly in the onion, I think they threw in the peppers and onions at the same time but onions take longer to cook).

It was a little pricy at $13, but that was reflected in the quality of the ingredients (Fresh vegetables and good quality pork). They gave me a random 10% discount, but charge 18% tip reguardless.

Clean, great food, fast, friendly, and good for social gathering. Mapo tofu is really good as well. My recommendation is walnut shrimp. I went here two friends and they really liked the taste of food. It has good combination of oil, meats, sauce and veggies. I don't usually give four starts, but this is amazing place.

Delicious. A delightful setting in which to discover new flavors and combinations with traditional Sichuan roots. Absolutely going back soon!

For the less adventurous among you, there is an "American Chinese" menu section which includes many dishes typical of your standby takeout place.

My friend and I went there when when first arrived in Lafayette. The crusines are very authentic. I felt like they were the dishes I would get in China. We had a big meal including Ma'po Tofu, Boiled Pork Belly and etc. We are all very full and consent. Since it was Easter break, there were only one waitor there. Thus, I could understand that the service is kinda slow. Overall, great experience in Sichuan House!
Excellent atmosphere and setting. Kinda hidden on St. Marks but it's pretty authentic! Great for date night. Be prepared to wait at least half an hour tho

Went for my mother's birthday. Dad is sichuanese and ordered for us. Food was tasty but according to my parents, not the authentic taste they are used to. The dishes were pleasantly mouthnumbing and well seasoned but the heat factor wasn't there. They brought us our entrees before the appetizers, and brought our rice last - which was weird. They also forgot one of our dishes but still charged us for it. We ended up taking it home. TL;DR: tasty food, not necessarily authentic Sichuan flavors but definitely pleasing to the Chinese palate. Disorganized service.

This place is wonderful.  We went on a super snowy night and the manager was serving all the tables.  He told us all his servers were out that evening.  He hustled and it didnt look like any tables service suffered.  He was VERY friendly and had great recommendations based on what my partner and I like.   

We ordered spicy dumplings and pot stickers for an appetizer.  The spicy dumplings were great and in a very nice sauce.
For a main dish, we got some kind of spicy peppered beef.  This was phenomenal.  It was a low level, dry heat.  None of the "spicy" items were very challenging, in my opinion.  
Not to be understated, but the rice was incredible.  It was perfectly steamed and sticky.  

Out food was so good, we got an order of Pork in Garlic sauce to take home.  

Overall, the service was warm and helpful, proportions were generous and food was delicious.  I will DEFINITELY be going back!

Authentic Chinese food! And server said "please recommend to your friends".  I will ! They deserve!  We ordered spicy beef tendon, sour and spicy potato, fired spicy pig kidney and crab flavored tofu  soup. I LOVE it!

Place is legit. Really fair price too. I went on a weekday and there was no wait time. Only downfall is limited parking but if you want authentic Chinese food, this place is your best bet in West Lafayette.

reviews.text:
I order from here a lot. Partially because it's close to Pay Less but also because I like that I can use their own online system and not give away money to third party delivery services.

The sushi is quite creative. They have a large variety of rolls and options and I think we almost always get maybe 4-5 small rolls and a noodle dish and a starter for a family of four adults. The special rolls are significantly larger in size (usually 6 pieces) while the smaller rolls are 8 pieces and bite sized.

They also sell Beijing duck at this restaurant that you have to order in advance. It's not truly authentic because the skin is not crispy, but it's still good roasted duck.

I ordered the udon with beef a couple times mostly to make it a fuller meal but it is one of their weaker dishes.

Stopped in for a quick lunch. The restaurant is very clean and sanitized with good distancing. Everyone was wearing a mask. I chose the 3 roll lunch which includes soup or salad. The miso soup was hot and flavorful. Green onions evident. I had spicy tuna, Boston and shrimp tempura rolls. All were great. Very fresh ingredients and delivered rapidly for a busy dining room. Good value for a nice, not fast food lunch. The menu is extensive. Will certainly want to try it again.

I love getting delivery from this place. I've never been disappointed when trying new items from the menu: sushi, ramen, you name it! This is my go-to place for delivery or pick up and I'm a huge fan. I've been working my way through the ramen menu as you can see from the photos, so far I like them all!

Called ahead and placed an order for pick-up. Unfortunately you do have to go inside as they do not at present offer curbside pick up.

I spoke to Janet/Jeanette over the phone who was a bit curt and seemed to be in a big rush to end the call.
We tried the following:
1) shrimp sumai - this was pretty good albeit a little soggier than I'm used to.
2) aged tofu - nice big pieces of tofu with yummy sauce on the side
3) spider roll - I asked how many pieces are in an order of their regular rolls and was told 6, however only got 5 spider rolls. They were not well packed and two of the rolls had come apart (see photos).
4) spicy girl roll - you get 8 pieces. Very yummy.
5) Tokyo Chicken - comes with a side of rice and either soup or salad. To be honest, this dish tasted like it had been made a while ago... very soggy and not crispy at all. You are probably better off ordering this if eating in person rather than delivery/pick-up. Good portion! The miso soup was good.

Total cost - approx $50

Overall the packaging and service was not the greatest but the food is good.
I would give them another go!
This place is delicious. Pork tonkatsu ramen & sweetheart roll are on point. I eat here at least once a week.
Great sushi and sake choices. Service is fast and dependable. One of the few places in town that allows dine-in at this time, which is nice and refreshing.

This place is amazing! If you haven't been here it's a MUST TRY! everything is as good as it looks! Super fresh, perfectly cooked! Certainly will return!!!! This is our new go to place! The service was friendly and great

I was very happy with this place. They offer indoor  dining and have a very large sushi menu. I recommend their spicy garlic edamame. I saw they have a great lunch menu so I plan to try that out soon!

Grabbed the kids during Christmas break to meet the Mrs for lunch. For starters don't expect friendly servers, if you can deal with that it's a decent experience. Not as good as Sushi Don.

Almost everything was prepared as described but a little on the bland side. Luckily there is chili pepper seasoning on every table. It was the perfect compliment if you like to dial in your spice level and saltiness. 

My wife wasn't terribly impressed with the lunch sushi (spicy tuna & tempura chicken rolls) she said she had had better sushi from a gas station. Now that's sketchy. The chicken karaage were tiny bits of fried chicken that were over done and very dry. On the menu it looks like small fried chicken wings. Once I spiced up my ramen dish it was pretty good. Loaded with too many noodles and shy on broth. To taste the noodles alone, one would not humm with delight. What I mean is it's obvious they are pre boiled in bland water and tossed in at service. I wish the smaller places would take time to bring the noodles back to life within the broth. If anyone can steer me to a place not in Chicago that makes fresh noodles and prepares them properly I would be in your debt.

I gave this a 2.8 out of 5.
The sweetheart roll was awesome. Service is good.  Very reasonable prices. The seating was not social distances but clean properly. The shrimp hibachi was tasty as well.

The service was ok. Our waiter seemed busy with otuer tables a lot but the waitress at the table across from us was super nice and helpful.  The food was amazing we will 100% be returning.  We also ordered the Mochi but my kid's ate it before we for a picture.  They were very professional and kept things super clean .

Modern setting in a strip mall on a good busy street on the west side of town.  Parking is easy too.

Came at 5pm on a weeknight and were the first customers here.

Menu is expansive with fancy innovative sushi rolls.  This first trip had a dinner bento and teppanyaki beef.  Service was quick direct and food was fast too.  Everything was quite tasty and we would come back.  Def want to try the ramen in the future.

Nothing fancy about the place but I don't need that.  There were a lot of takeout orders being picked up too.

Didn't have room for dessert.  One sushi roll two teas and the entrees totaled $52 with tax and tip.  Not bad for a casual week dinner.

A good experience about sums up what you can expect here as a dining experience -- not bad, but not excellent. The interior of the restaurant is pleasant, emulating a modernised/neon-ified Tokyo restaurant, black-stained wood and lacquer off-setting the colourful, glammy lights. The menu has a wide array of sushis, from the simple to the popular Americana rolls you can find in most sushi parlours across the country (Dragon roll, California roll, CC roll, etc.), as well as some other, cooked Japanese fare for those who might not be fans of raw fish, such as a small selection of udon, ramen, bento boxes, and so forth. 

I had a fried California roll with a stir-fried chicken yaki udon, and both were nice, though not the best versions I have ever tasted. I also had the "hot tea" (ostensibly green tea), and I was a little put-out to find that, however else they prepare the tea, they finish it off by blasting it in a microwave, given that the cup is far too hot to hold at first when they serve you it (which doesn't happen if the tea was heated or boiled on its own, then poured into the cup to be served). The service was a little bit chilly as well -- not rude, just sort of absent-minded or apathetic. So there are a few edges that could be smoothed out a little as far as the food quality and service goes, but, again, it is not bad, and I will definitely return.

Best vegetarian roll ever!
The sweet potato roll graced my tastebuds today and it changed my life. This is my second time here and I love this place--always super friendly and quick. Plus the restaurant looks really cool inside! Prices are great for college students.
Overall this is one of my favorite places in West Lafayette.
10/10 even for vegetarians.

Love this place. Onion soup is awesome. Here's my favorite list!

Fantasy 
Godzilla
Dynamite 
Ginza 
Lava
Green River 
Crazy grill 
America dream 
Katana

Service is awesome. They also do a great job with carry put orders.
Great sushi at affordable price. Got 6 rolls, soup, and a lunch box for under $35. Service was good  and overall great lunch/experience

I went here for lunch with a bunch of coworkers the other day.  Located in a strip mall, it's an unassuming looking place from the outside.  Inside the ambiance is much better and you can forget you're sitting in a strip mall.  We got one of the private booths with the bead curtains which made for a cozy little spot.

From sushi to ramen, the menu has a great variety.  I ordered the ramen and it did not disappoint.  If I had to make a complaint it would be that the egg in the ramen was a cut hard boiled egg rather than the usual soft boiled egg found in ramen, but it was delicious regardless.  Very large portion.  I couldn't finish it all.

I definitely look forward to returning and trying more of the menu.

If I could give it 4.5 I would add a half star.

The sushi was fresh, delicious and the rice had a nice balanced flavor. Tuna was very fresh, delicious and the avocado was perfect!

We did an order for pickup because hubby had a very short window for eating lunch.

They included a hot appetizer for crab Rangoon for free when we picked up our order. I don't know if this was a special, she really didn't say why, just that we were getting a free appetizer. It was six pieces and they were good, a little on the sweeter side but good.

We didn't get to try any ramen but based on the sushi order I will return to try more menu items.

Of special note on the service, which was excellent and prompt. As I mentioned earlier hubby had a short window, and it started at 11:30. They open at 11:00 and it's 15 minutes away. So I called the night before, they graciously took my order when I explained the timing problem and were so helpful. And when my son and I arrived at 11:10 everything was ready to go even though we were 5 minutes early. This allowed us to have a nice, unhurried lunch where his meetings were held.

I will definitely be dining at Katana again.

I order food from here all the time and i love it so much.

My favorites are the dynamite roll and sweet mango roll. Fried calamari and vegetable tempura are also great.

They also have amazing bubble tea... i always get the taro with tapioca pearl and it's amazing

Went here on a Tuesday night with a group of about 12 people. The location is great considering that it shares the parking lot with Payless and other businesses in the area. The restaurant is much bigger than I expected with ample seating space. It wasn't very busy. I had made reservations for this place since I had a big group and they offered us the private room in the back, which is also their karaoke room. I was a bit concerned about a karaoke room in a restaurant, but they assured me that it won't disturb  the other customers. The private room was a big booth, essentially with a TV, speakers, mics and disco lights which doubled up as a private eating space. 

The service was nice. As soon as I entered the room (I was the first person there), the manager came by to introduce himself and give me a lay of the land. He also offered to help me with any requests that I had. Service was prompt.

I got the spicy miso soup with pork. Usually, I gravitate to good sushi and try to stay away from the pork dishes, but I had heard good things about their ramen and wanted to give it a shot. I was very impressed with their ramen. The spiciness was just the right amount of spicy, and the ramen was very flavorful. The meat was cooked beautifully and the egg was made to perfection. A couple of my friends got the same dish and it seemed that the dish was consistent across the board. Prices were decent. For Lafayette, I was very impressed with the whole package. I will definitely be back and maybe next time, try out the karaoke. 

Verdict: Get their ramen.

reviews.text: Such a great place! Ramen is amazing. When they say spicy, they mean it. Nice staff. Covid friendly, seats are similar to study hall cubbies.

Similar menu as the downtown Three Legged Crow, fantastic ramen! So good! The Miso Spicy is the answer to cloudy days, rain, hunger, sunny days, fun times, friends, family, it is so good. I always get it and have tried about half the other but none gets me like Miso Spicy. I'm all for the sushi burritos too however they're quite expensive. It's a tidy little campus spot with fun interaction ordering through a robot. There's cubicles that some may enjoy but others will feel confined. Not much window space but good for my sister and I we had it all to ourselves. Glad to have another ramen spot to spread out the space!
Sushi burritos are bomb and worth the money! Super cute and will be getting more soon!

The ordering and delivery process is disjointed but a throw back to actual ramen shops in Tokyo.  Food was good so worth the experience.  
Challenge is when during COVID only one group can be in the entranceway  and other li and e upbin freezing cold outside even when plenty of seats available in dining roon.

reviews.text: The highest rated restaurant in the area for good reason. A strong cultured dining experience and huge menu combined with the very friendly service makes this a go to spot in the county for unique and super tasty food. We had a small sampling of the falafel and shawarma which was tons of food! We went for a takeout thinking it would not have a lot of space for distancing but wish we would have dined in upon noticing how much room is here. Our food was perfectly flavored and went down just like the ideal classic Mediterranean fare of other places I really enjoy like Kebab-G in Peoria, IL. My parents enjoyed some leftovers, quite sure I convinced them without having to say anything!

I went for a dinner date with my husband and we LOVED the place. The decoration is beautiful. It feels like you're traveling. Service was super nice and helped us ordering because we had multiple questions. I ordered a sautee ghallaba that was delicious. It came with 2 sides. The lentil soup was my favorite. Also, it was basmati rice that we all know is quite good. My husband had the falafel sandwich and he couldn't finish it because it was pretty big. 
The portions were very generous so we had enough to take home. Do try their Baklava. It's just amazing. 
Also! Everybody had face masks and gloves. Antibacterial gel was available everywhere for us. 

Strongly recommended. :)

Best Mediterranean food in Lafayette, hands down.  Flavors are amazing, staff is great. Exceptionally clean. The entire experience was pleasant and enjoyable. We got baclava and a smoothie to go, amazing, I'll definitely be stopping in for takeout smoothies by the quart often.  Can't wait to try everything on the menu.

So wonderful. Kebabs, sandwiches, sides are all on point. We've catered their kebab feasts for a couple of important guests and they've impressed us each time. This spot has taken over as my favorite middle eastern food in town.

So confused by the glowing reviews on this place. This was our second time eating there. This time takeout, last time pre-pandemic dine in. Both times we felt the food was lacking. 

The chicken shawarma sandwich was extremely dry and no noticeable garlic flavor. The cucumber salad is more like yogurt with a garnish of cucumber. The spinach pies looked amazing, but were greasy and the cheese to spinach ratio was way off. Needed more cheese for sure. 

Hummus was fine. Be warned, there is a choice of classic or spicy hummus. The CLASSIC comes covered in jalapeños. So ask to skip them if you have an aversion to spice. 

The sautéed mushrooms was the best dish we had. Nice mix of spices and very flavorful. But in two visits, that's the only thing we'd order again. 

Was also disappointed in the level of customer service. When I called to place the order, the person just answered the phone w hello. I had to ask if this was Almadina. Then, at pickup, two server/hostess front of house staff not wearing masks. One was talking to three guests who were leaving, and two of the three guests were not wearing masks. One of the guests had to call the hostess's attention to my presence. When she turned around and saw me, she put a mask on. They must have been friends/family. But you expect a place to follow the signs it has posted on its own doors. And if that's how things are handled front of house, what is happening in the kitchen?

I had carryout once since my original review and I still cannot come to terms with the sky high rating for this restaurant. It's not bad, but it's not *nearly* the best restaurant in Lafayette. Really it's not even in the top 20. It makes no sense. Maybe the low level of seasoning is more aligned with the average midwestern palate? Maybe they're juicing their reviews? I don't know, but I don't get it at all.

We were on our way back home from a Yellowstone vacation, and I was growing weary of restaurant food and was yearning for something from home. It didn't matter. I realized, even in my burned out state, how absolutely great this restaurant is.

We ordered the Shawarma plate for two. Oh my lord it could have fed four. And every single piece of meat on that plate is perfectly juicy and tender. The hummus that we ordered with it was smooth and tasty. I loved this meal. 

My son went with the chicken sandwich. I had a bite and was blown away by the flavor of that one. If you are into sandwiches, I would go with this one.

They accidentally brought us fries instead of rice. This was quickly remedied but I'm so glad they made the mistake. I tried the fries and they are awesome! I mean, I like rice with the Shawarma plate, but if you're into fries, I'd give it a go. 

This has to be one of the top restaurants in Lafayette. If you're driving through like we were, definitely make the stop. If you live nearby, plan to visit weekly. It is that good. One of the best Mediterranean restaurants I've ever been to. This one is an absolute gem.

My wife and I stopped here on the way home from an out-of-state trip. We decided to grab a quick bite and Mediterranean sounded perfect. This The building has tons of room, though when we arrived it was entirely empty, due to the lockdown, which has only started to get more lax.

We sat and looked over the menu, ordered a sample platter of hummus, baba ganoush, and tabouli, which were brought out shortly with some complementary fresh rolls and a creamy garlic sauce. The rolls were so warm and so fresh, and with the garlic sauce, were truly remarkable. Simple ingredients, but done so well. It was exquisite.

The hummus was the creamiest hummus I've ever eaten, truly delivious, as was the baba ganoush. I'm not much of a fan of tabouli, more something for my wife, but it wasn't bad either. We ordered our entrees, but I started to think I might not be hungry enough to eat much, once I finished with the amazing bread and dips we already had.

I was already thinking "five-star for sure" after the appetizer and garlic sauce, as our entrees were brought out. Unfortunately, that's where the quality diverged.

I ordered a lamb shawarma wrap that sounded right up my alley, with lettuca, tomato, onions, and a tahini sauce that made my mouth water. Once I took my first bite, though, the magic was gone. The tahini was bland; not the usual bursting-with-flavor-sauce I was expecting. The portion I tried only had veggies, which were fine, but just a little plain without the strength of the sauce.

I took a bite with lamb this time, hoping it would save the wrap, but it made it worse. The lamb chunks were ENORMOUS. In a wrap, where I won't be using a fork, they should surely be cut into bite-size pieces, but they were at least two or three times that. It wouldn't be the end of the world, but when I attempted to cut them with my teeth, as one would do with a wrap, the meat was SO chewy. I ended up making a mess, having to drag the chunk of meat out of the wrap and pull it apart with my teeth and hands just so I could get a piece small enough to manage.

The wrap was a disappointment, probably a 2-star, maybe even 1, because the lamb was also rather unseasoned. The appetizer and complementary garlic sauce/bread was 5-star, though, and I believe it's possible some other entrees here are better than what I had, but if the lamb is any indication of meat in other dishes, I'd be concerned.

Portions were decent for the price, but certainly not my favorite meal I've ever had.

GO HERE NOW. 

Al madina is quickly becoming a top three restaurant for us. All the food is very well cooked, perfectly seasoned and delicious. We have not gotten one thing on the menu we didn't thoroughly enjoy. Favorite dishes include hummus, grape leaves, shish and chicken kafta, kabob, and shawarma. Everything is very reasonably priced also. 

If you are not dining here or carrying out on a weekly basis, you are doing yourself a disservice.

In a desert of culinary monochrome, Almadina is a refreshing, authentic oasis of Levantine cuisine. The menu offers common Mediterranean staples complemented by some more particular options. Prices are very reasonable, service was polite and prompt, and the food was delightful. 
It is important to support local business in times of COVID, and this restaurant merits that support.
Excellent place for the family and community eating. My family and friends go here occasionally and will share our platters of food with each other.

Al Madina Restaurant is an amazing place for a couple to have a quiet dinner or a large group to hold a big dinner. With ample seating enough to fit many, you can find a corner that best suites your liking. The outside of the building has a fresh coat of paint which does not in any means give way to the beautiful middle eastern vibe on the inside. The inside of the restaurant is lightly decorated with decorative rugs, pictures from the Middle East, mosaic sconces, and beautiful mosaic lighting as well. The ambiance on the inside is quite and pretty. It is the new hidden gem on the block! 

At a first glance of the menu, it seems a bit much, there are many options to choose from, and there are lots of different styles of kebabs. So what does one get? Well, my wife and I tried their "Shish Combo for 2" in the combo and party trays section of the menu. This was recommended by one of the waiters. Let me tell you, this will NOT disappoint! It was such good tasting food, with big portion sizes for such a good price! At just $30, this tray had 7 pieces of kebab, we chose our two sides of rice and hummus, and we were brought complimentary bread with garlic butter. 

Moving from New Jersey/ New York to Lafayette Indiana, I had to be the judge of this restaurant. I went in expecting the food to not be as good as back from the east coast, BUT the food blew my mind. I was VERY impressed with the "juicyness" of the chicken, the tenderness of the meat, and the overall taste of the entire meal. From the complimentary bread, to a flavorful plate of whipped hummus, straight to the main entree, the food was delicious. You were able to tell that the bread, hummus, kebabs, and everything was made FRESH to order. I am one who always finishes my meals at a restaurant, but I had to request a box to go for some leftovers. 

The food was amazing, and what about the staff you ask?  The staff is very friendly, and humbled. The waiters that waited on us were actually part owners of the restaurant. The chef had a bit of down time and stopped by our table to see how everything was as well. You definitely receive the vibe of open arms and welcome from the team of people who run this restaurant. 

Now, this review would not be complete without me pointing out some of the flaws. The first thing I would want to see is a bit more friendly entrance on the exterior of the building. Maybe some flower pots, or some more color. The inside of the place is beautiful, and some of that culture needs to be brought to the outside as well. Secondly, I wish the music was more in the field of "middle eastern" there was casual American songs playing in the speakers, but it just did not fit. Maybe a little middle easter music would complete the restaurant. Other than that, no complaints on the food or the service. 

I encourage everyone to go with a friend or your significant other and definitely, definitely try out the "shish combo for two!"

*** This review was not sponsored by the restaurant, and I have no affiliations with any member of this restaurant***
The food here has never dissapointed. Their bread and garlic sauce is wonderful. Thank you.

I'm so glad a restaurant is in this space! And I hope this one stays. Split a platter with hummus and tabouleh salad - all of it was delicious and the wait for the food was not long. Finished off the meal with kanafeh and Turkish coffee. The kanafeh was an experience - I thought very good, and the cheese gave the syrup and dough a salty hit. Looking forward to coming back!

Me and my wife got the starter combo and I also ordered a chicken shwarma sandwich cuz I'm a big boy ;) The food was excellent and the portion sizes were great for the prize. Will definitely stop by again if we are in the area :)

Under new ownership and the food is amazing. The customer service is unmatched and the menu has lots of variety and options. Try the kabob and any type of chicken and your mouth will water. Go check them out and I promise you won't regret it!

Had lunch with the family, great food across the board.  Had multiple appetizers and mains, all thought what they had was delicious.  All high quality ingredients, nothing disappointed.  Social distancing and every employee wore a mask, felt comfortable.  Will definitely be back!

We stumbled on this gem. We had the shawarma (chicken and meat). It was fantastic with the rice. We also had spicy hummus, which was a little bitter to our taste but still enjoyable. The greek salads were good also. The atmosphere is unique, but very clean. The staff was very friendly. Overall, it was a great dinner!

Our Sunday lunch was nothing short of perfection. From the scrumptious little rolls with garlic sauce, to the naan with the smoothest, tastiest hummus, to the tender, flavorful chicken...perfection. What a treat from start to finish. Highly recommend!

Fantastic Mediterranean food! From the outside you wouldn't expect the quality of food or decor in side. Everything came out quickly and tasted fresh. 

Both vegan and vegetarian friendly which is difficult to find in Lafayette. 

There was a communication problem between the waitress and kitchen which was rectified quickly and we ended up with more delicious food than we ordered. 

10/10 would recommend you go here or order via grub hub.

reviews.text:
AMAZING  bbq spot! Their prices have gone up recently, so a little less bang-for-your-buck, but the impecable quality hasn't budged an inch in years!! The pulled pork is tender beyond description, and the fries are great! Actually, pretty much everything is really great. The coleslaw? Seasoned perfectly. The beans? Yeah you'll want to make sure you get those too. The fried pecan pie? You'll think you've died and gone to heaven.

The only thing that's a little lacking is the somewhat curt service, but the humble dining room and down-to-earth staff paired with authentic BBQ make it the perfect lunch spot for everyone, from a business meeting to the drywall tradesmen taking a break.

My Mom & I went to South Street Smokehouse today for lunch to go (they do not have a dine in option now). My mom is 92 and is hard of hearing.  In accordance with the Indiana Mask Mandate we are not required to wear a mask so that I can communicate to her. As we entered South St. the cashier told me we needed a mask. I said thanks but we have a mask exemption. ANY OTHER business here in town has been nice about this because this is a disability issue. One of the men behind the counter told me we needed a mask. I told him we had a mask exemption and asked if it was going to be a problem to order food to go. He asked another man who told me no they would not serve us. I asked again if they were refusing to serve us given that we had a masks exemption. He said yes and we left. I did not want to embarrass my mom as she had not heard what happened. There were 2 customers in there waiting for their food. We were not a threat to anyone. I sent South Street a FB message because I wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt that they did not know. (screenshots below of my message, the exemption) and they responded in a very RUDE way. (Screenshot below) "Please feel free to report the problem. Your moms hard of hearing doesn't justify you not wearing one. Please feel free to never enter MY ESTABLISHMENT again!" They put up a post a couple of hours later that said they followed the Indiana Mask Mandate. They have now removed that post but I also have the screenshot of it. People that knew me had found out about this were commenting on the post. They have now deleted it. I left a bad review because they could have handled this very differently. I have also filed a complaint with the Civil Rights Division of the US Dept of Justice. I sent them a copy via FB messenger but they have blocked me.
Is this overkill? ... maybe but the rudeness of the response needs to be addressed. There are people with disabilities that are dealing with this pandemic. Why can't we be kind and help them? Would it have hurt them to let us order food, stand against the wall while we waited and then left? My mama loves BBQ and she was so excited about this but I told her we will not be going back. We will give our business to D&R!

We like going here for the food. The staff though could use some work on how they talk to customers. The guy taking orders was very impatient not not please tell with customers face to face or on the phone. I have been there when it's been busier and we were there around 5 and it wasn't very busy, so for him to seem so stressed was strange. Some of their main items were not prepared and it was over a half hour wait if you wanted them. 

The ribs we had were good. The breaded pork tenderloin was less desirable. Mac and cheese is frozen kind you buy from US Foods and it's just thawed out and warmed up. (I used to serve that kind in a kitchen I ran at a school). It's good don't get me wrong just over priced.

This place is so freakin good and always has been. Go. Now. 
Succulent authentic bbq. 
Don't hesitate.
A group of us from work ordered lunch,  the lady taking the order was rude as hell.  The missed several items and missed 2 full orders.
Rude, over priced are just a few words for this place. Better bbq on a McRib. A McRib!

First time here - great place! Nothing fancy, but very fast. Several different sauces to choose from. Mac & cheese and cole slaw very solid. Brisket was tender, but not really smoked, more of a gray than a red. But a great lunchtime place when you are in a hurry. Prices are very sensible, too.

This is a must stop hole in the wall!

Came on a Friday during lunch rush at noon but they move quickly!

Sauces all on the side which is great!  Food quality is awesome and accurate!  I have to come back!

The sauces are not honest.  The spicy is not and the hot isn't hot enough.  So don't be scared to try them out.

Portions are fair but on the smaller side considering this is indiana.  Pricing is fair.

The menu is straightforward and this place is simple no nonsense.

Hard to access the parking lot if you come from the east.  Parking is ample if they're not busy.

Ordered the chicken dal quarter and it was super juicy but fully cooked!

Okay, let me just say yes they are a bit on the rude side, but if you know what you want when you get to the counter you will be fine! Just don't you dare not know what sides you want or ask any stupid questions such as about the nutrition content or if this or that is gluten free!  It is what it is and I guarantee they could careless if you think they are rude.

About the food, sides were excellent and we loved the rub they used.  We have had better barbecue but this was very good.  We only had to wait about 5 minutes which was surprising because it was quite busy.  My husband liked the sauces but I am more of a Sweet Baby Ray's kind of gal and not a barbecue sauce connoisseur.  

So, as long as you are not expecting sugary sweet friendly service you should get along just fine at this place!

I stopped by South Street on a business trip to West Lafayette hoping for some awesome BBQ. 

I will begin this review by saying that I am in love with excellent BBQ, and have been fortunate enough to enjoy some of the best across our great country. I take it very seriously and put a lot of effort into learning what makes great BBQ and how to make it happen. Although my personal BBQ results are varying levels of good, I have had the chance to enjoy what I consider to be excellent BBQ. 

That being said, I was extremely hopeful of a great lunch on the cold January day of my visit. Unfortunately, I left disappointed. 

This seems like a shop that should be able to do it right, and the place was packed during lunch, which makes me think that they are either usually better, or the bar is just not that high, their 4.5 star here on Yelp reinforces my hope that it is the former. 

On to the food. I got my go to that I consider the standard scorecard of good BBQ...Sliced brisket and spare ribs. 

I knew I was in trouble as I began ordering. First of all, there was no combo or option on the menu for brisket and ribs, and when I asked for it I was told to buy two lunches, the brisket lunch, and the spare ribs lunch. It wasn't very expensive, just strange. As I was ordering I asked for my brisket to be a half fatty and half lean. The gentleman helping me looked at me like I was asking for something strange. Realizing that maybe they call the cuts point and flat I restated my order as that and got an equally quizzical look. When this happens I lose hope that they speak great BBQ. 

Sure enough, when my food was ready I received all flat (lean) brisket, although it did have more fat cap than most prefer, so I expect that they believed that is what I meant by half fatty. 

The brisket was very over cooked, when held sideways it broke right in half, which the novice would say means "it is super tender right?" Well, over cooked BBQ falls apart easily, but is super dry and loses all of the things that make excellent BBQ magic. The smoke ring was very light and the taste was that of oven roast beef, which is fine, just not great. 

The ribs were dry and bland, they appeared to also be over cooked (no bark, just jerky on the outside) mushy texture. 

Sides were beans and slaw, I tried a few bites of the beans, but moved on quickly, mainly due to lack of appetite at this point. Not a fan of sweet beans and these tasted like they came from a can, not bad jus not my preference and not special. At some of my favorite places, the brisket beans are my favorite after I finish the main event.  Never tried the slaw. 

I hope I caught them on a bad day, regulars would know better. 

Ribs - 3/10
Brisket 3/10

Not a 1 star, but well below average.

This is my buddies favorite BBQ spot to eat who lives here. My feelings are 50/50 on this one. The food was decent I had BBQ chicken which was really good, the corn bread is a little corn tasting and they didn't have honey that was not expired so it made it taste a little off. The potato salad was really good. They have a few flavors of BBQ sauce they were all pretty good really. The people working didn't look like they wanted to be there which I mean nobody wants to be at work but a smile never hurt nobody. All in all it was OK at best. Not writing home to mom about this one.

Fwitw- went to KC and had their signature brisket sandwiches at 4 different places... South St holds up as good (and my gf thought it was better.) 

This place rules- make a stop here and the the KC brisket sandwich and enjoy the blues on the speakers.

Not BBQ grilled food is not BBQ.
Used to be good but not anymore should have known the place was empty

J.B (2 Star review) and John F. Explain it well in their reviews.  How can you call yourself a smoke house when you don't smoke anything??  Brisket tasted like dry roast beef, 1/4 dark chicken was mushy and had no flavor, certainly never spent any time in smoke.  Or it was held in a steam table so long it lost all flavor?  If you like to add lots of sauce, their sauces are pretty good, but $25 for two lunches is way over priced for what it is.  I also have been to many BBQ joints, I can't understand how the other reviewers can say they've been to great BBQ joints and put this place in the same category.

This place is so freakin' good.

It's super casual, so if you wanna bring a date here that's cool.  Just don't dress up.

You order at the counter and sit down.  They shout out your number and you go get it.

Portions are LARGE and prices are RIGHT.  They have Barq's Red Creme soda on tap (fountain) and that shit is like the tears of virgins.  

Brisket sandwich was TO DIE FOR and the Pulled Pork sandwich looked heavenly, too.  

The fried pickles are spears and you get a million of 'em.  I know that there are fried pickle enthusiasts out there that favor chips over spears and that's find.  I'm not one of you.  If it's a fried pickle, I'm eating it.

The different sauces are all very good.  Get a lil cup of everything so you can try it out.  

Skip the cornbread.  It's extra and it's nothing fancy.
Awesome ribs, super quick, delicious sauces, no frills just good bbq. Nice relaxed atmosphere!

Food was okay. Not the best BBQ, but good enough. The worst was how incredibly rude they were. They were out of everything but two meats and a couple sides at 7:00 and were annoyed at every customer asking for items they didn't have. They were so impatient and yelling. We got our food and ate at a decent pace listening to them yell at every customer trying to come in that they were out and closed. Before we even finished they shut the blinds and turned lights off while we were still at our table.
The brisket was grey, no red ring no crispy rub and bland. Sides were ok. Dining room was clean.

I was expecting the food  to be better.  It was just ok.  Par to a lot of other places. The corn bread was very good tho, moist!  Pulled pork seemed a little greasy and the sauces we nothing spectacular. Onion rings were really good, I think the breading that makes it.
Best smoked turkey I have ever had. Going with 4 stars because they always run out of sides. I understand running out of brisket, but not sides! Really good brisket, but definitely try the turkey.

reviews.text:
If you're looking for some good pho on campus, this is the place to go. I'm a pho maniac, so I definitely wanted to check this place out. It didn't disappoint. I had the beef pho, and it was delicious! They have some other options on the menu, but most of the entrees have some sort of noodle in it. If you dig noodles, this is definitely the place for you!

Pros
- The name says it all. They've got ramen, pho, mei fun, udon, lo mein and more!
- Just order at the counter, and they bring it out to your table.
- Reasonable prices - $8.99 for a big bowl o' pho!
- Delivery and takeout available
- Quiet and intimate, great for a date or a place to catch up with a friend.
- Quick and friendly service
- FREE WATER!!!!!! :D

Cons
- Not good for groups because it's a pretty small place.
- There aren't servers, just one lady at the register who brings your food.
- Parking is basically non-existent. We parked in the Chauncey Mall parking lot and walked over.

Today I was in West Lafayette picking-up my son for Thanksgiving break.  I was hungry and had some time to kill.  I thought Asian Noodles would be a good lunch option as I go hurtling belly-first into the food frenzy of the coming days.  

Be careful, Noodles & I is 1/2 block from Noodles & Company (is the name just a coincidence?).  Don't get hung up on a name, this is a mom and pop shop, and the food crushes the nearby chain.  

I ordered the Chicken Ho Fun.  It was very good.  Service was fast and friendly and you can't beat the price: $9.99 for a generous portion.  The restaurant is clean with plenty of seating.  

If you want Asian Noodles, skip the chain and dine here.  You will be glad you did.

Around Purdue University campus, I ordered the beef congee for $7.59.  The bowl was large but mostly comprised of water, some green onions, a little beef, and a strange texture of the rice.  I knew that it was hot, but the food should not be super heated that I have to wait a very long time before eating; I am feeling the effects of a burned mouth.  So overpriced and too hot.

The staff was knowledgeable, very friendly, and patient.

My favorite place for a bowl of noodles.  I love their pho here! Much better than other restaurants in the area.  You order and pay up front, then the server brings the food out to you and boy are they quick!! This will definitely be my go-to spot near campus for a nice bowl of noodle soup.  I highly recommend!
Nice and clean, perfect stop for hot spicy noodle soup.  I love their fried dough stick oh mine, I was surprised how good they were and so affordable.

I really liked both the spring rolls and sesame balls. Everything served blazing hot, so take your time.

The spicy beef soup was very tasty. Large bowl, reasonable amount of meat, small amount of bok choy and a tremendous amount of noodles. Hey, the place is called Noodles & I, so what should you expect?

The Vietnamese Pho was excellent. As someone else stated, way better than Greenleaf. Richer texture broth with actual seasoning made all the difference.

Only knocks on this place are that it's pretty small and expensive. Food was great.

3.5 stars. Simple noodle shop. 

The Experience:

Nice casual noodle spot. Service was friendly and prompt. 

The Food:

Potstickers: simple fried potstickers. Tasty, well cooked and fresh. 

Spring rolls: small fresh and tasty. 

DanDan- noodles were great. The sauce was rich, peanuty, and maybe even a little greasy, they had this lovely peppery condiment on the table that helped spice it up.

Beef noodles- rich beefy broth, noodles cooked perfectly and lots of beef. 

Over all this was good. Well probably go back.

Our first visit to Noodles & I was okay. The service wasn't great... we had to refill our own waters the whole time. The boys loved the braised beef noodle soup with James claiming it was "the best soup ever!" The gyoza and spring rolls were yummy too. I was pretty disappointed in the Dan-Dan noodles. They were really basic and one dimensional and had an unfortunate texture from using peanut butter in the sauce. We went with a large group, and I think others liked their noodle dishes- pad Thai and lo mein got decent reviews from friends.

** 3.5 stars!! **
I usually go here for pho and spring rolls. It's definitely tasty, but sort of has the feel of having been thrown together out of its basic ingredients; i.e. it is no greater than the sum of its parts. That isn't to say it isn't good food, but I do wish there was something more to it. That being said, it is my go-to spot for when I'm craving pho and the location is very cute.

This place is a fairly new addition to West Lafayette, and I'm glad I tried it out before I leave to graduate! I got the spicy beef noodle soup, and it was pretty good. I think they have the best beef noodles on campus, but the soup does get a bit oily. My friend got the Vietnamese Pho and that was actually a lot better than Green Leaf! It was surprising because last year when she went she said the pho wasn't good so she wanted to give it a try here again, and she's glad she did. I'm definitely getting the Vietnamese pho next time I come here!!!

A favorite among our friends when we want something hot, hearty, and fast. Food comes out quick and in decently sized portions. The braised beef, pho, and korean fatty beef are all good and are great recovery foods after a long night. While the food is good, it is a bit on the pricier side for what you get hence the 4 stars.

A convient little shop about 2 blocks from the Purdue student union.  My wife, oldest daughter and I were visiting Purdue before we send Lauren off this fall.  It was a chilly night and some piping hot pho sounded perfect. It was a Sunday and the place was packed!  Plenty of students kept pouring in looking for good food at a fair price.  We had the beef pho, chicken pho and pad Thai.
The menu has authentic Chinese dishes from top to bottom. Very homey soups on a cold day. Fast and efficient service.

This place was super cute and convenient. It's located where Maru Sushi was before it moved across the street, and though the look may have completely changed, Noodles & I managed to keep the initiate, tucked away, almost cafe-like vibe. It's now a lot lighter and has a clean aesthetic to it.

Solid Asian noodle place with Japanese, Chinese (Cantonese, Beijing Sichuan), Taiwanese, Korean, Thai, and Singapore flavors. A+++ on variety! Completely different from Noodle and Company, and I feel like the flavor profiles are so different that there's no competition (there is). Service was quick, place has a very clean feel to it. Excellent for date night, friends night out, the aftermath of breakfast club, and late night study sessions. Especially because it's just around the corner from study spots like Vienna and Greyhouse. REALLY good for winter nights or when you're getting a quick, sit-down lunch between classes or work (and Maru Sushi is too full). Won't lie, this isn't the best place for vegetarians or vegans. Most of the dishes have some sort of meat. There are definitely more options if you're a pescetarian, as there's a good number of seafood options. However, it's first rate from anyone lactose-intolerant or allergic to milk.

My first time, I came here with my club's treasurer for a late dinner on Monday (Maru Sushi was closed). It was definitely steered more towards an Asian crowd. While I excited at all the options like the fried udon, roast duck noodle, and the Dan Dan noodles, my friend (I'd only introduced him to Panda Express, Yummy Time, Maru Sushi, and Basil Thai by that point) was very confused. I ended up ordering the Singapore Mee Fu and he got the Braised Beef Noodle. I was REALLY happy with my Singapore Mee Fun, as it had been the year after I'd lived and worked for a couple of months in Singapore. After my time there, I missed the unique flavors from there and this made me really happy. However, my friend was really confused because Taiwanese Braised Beef Noodle soup apparently doesn't taste anything like American beef noodle soup. The way the beef was cooked confused him, the noodles confused him, and he kept asking why they put a whole egg in it. Overall though, he didn't hate. So just heads up for if you or a friend you want to bring are not as familiar with Asian cuisine. I encourage anyone to visit if they have time!

By far best ramen place I've found thus far in the Purdue area. Authentic, quick, spicy (amazingly spicy), and addicting ramen. The potstickers are also great. Have returned many times and will continue to come back.

This is one of those places that has good food, but you really have to know what to order. Their noodle soups are, for the most part, good, but their congee and dan dan noodles are terrible (the former is decidedly flavorless, and the latter is intolerably salty), while their jajangmyeon is just meh. The restaurant is always full of flies, which makes me wonder about the hygiene. However, the service is quick and polite, which is a definite plus.
Okay pho. Not extremely flavorful and only a few slices of meat. But it hit the spot. My teenage son got fried udon noodles with shrimp and ate it all.

This place was really good! Authentic, good food that is hard to come by. It's a smaller place but that's another reason why I like it. It's not going to be crowded with the typical loud golden coral loving type of people. (Not shaming.. but come on, we've all seen those people). Price wise it was good too. Good size servings. Will def go back!

I feel like the name of this place might throw people off (especially since it is across from Noodles & Company). There's definitely a lot of flavor in these dishes in respect to that OTHER noodle place. For my first time visit I got the Vietnamese Pho with beef. There's a handful of pho options, but you gotta go with the Vietnamese one right. My bowl of pho was a large, expected size, but very easy to consume for a lunch. It came out quickly, piping hot. It was a little on the salty side, but all in all, that's some good lunchtime pho. PHO-NOMENAL!

My friend got the pad thai, and he was also pleased with his meal. I will be coming back to try other dishes for sure. Places like this need the business. Plus it's got a nice sit-down restaurant feel, but you just order and pay up front and then leave when you're done. That's bonus convenience worth expressing.

Noodle & I? More like Noodles & I Want Some More of Those Delish Noods

Wonderful selection of noodle and congee dishes, I'm working my way through the menu and have loved everything so far. I was especially excited by the Pho, which is by far the best in town. Such a delicious, flavorful broth! Be warned it gets very busy mid week at lunchtime because of the students, but it's worth the wait!
