reviews.text:
Visited here from out of town and loved the food!  I ordered the cranberry turkey club, and it was very delicious and filling.  The fries that were included were hands down one of the best fries I've ever had especially with the sauce they provided. Really liked how the portion sizes were big too.

There was indoor dining, but everything was clean, the tables were far apart from each other, and the servers were really nice.

They usually have a big waitlist but luckily I was able to just walk in and get a table on a Friday night!

They only serve beer, which makes sense considering their name is "tap", which I don't really prefer, over cocktails but that's fine. They have an amazing variety of beer on tap. 

THEIR FOOD IS SOO GOOD. I may not come here again for drinks, but will 100% go for food. We ordered a 6 cheese pizza, sweet Thai chili chicken wings and the tap fries. Everything was so fresh, hot & bursting with flavors!

Fantastic campus vibe without the old fashioned run down walls or tacky interior, all new here! The Tap offers outdoor seating, generous and well thought out inside, a meager yet smart menu, local brews, and a solid friendly staff. Be prepared, there are 70 on tap drips! Easy to get confused! Needs a better way to organized, hopefully there's easier ways to figure out what to order online soon! Will definitely be back and try more things, everyone in our group enjoyed their meals except some had minor niggles more for their own tastes I thought than actual issues. The Black & Blue burger is amazing. Tatter tots appetizer rocks socks. An easy option for adult campus dining, glad to see the first floor of Rise put to good use.

This is one of my new favorite spots at Purdue. I actually like that they have a restriction for 21+ years old only since it is a tap restaurant. It's like a nice place for upperclassmen at Purdue to gather while still having a great place to bring your parents when they come to visit.

I have had a different variety of their menu since they've opened and I've loved every item, even the salads (which sometimes aren't the best at other grill and burger places). You really need to try the truffle parmesan dip for your fries as it's the best dipping sauce I've had.

The customer service is great and they always have a beer to recommend when you are trying to figure out what to try. It's even better that they have free sample sizes so you aren't stuck with a whole beer that you don't enjoy! The only problem I've run into here is the music is excessively loud. It's hard to hear your friends or family that are sitting right across from you.

I was here on a Friday evening with friends. I ordered a flight of beer, tap fries and firecracker shrimp. 
The have a huge beer menu and a lot of different beers for you to choose from. The fire cracker shrimp was very tasty.

The ambience is great and staff are friendly. 
There is street parking available near by. 

Will definitely go back here again.

Overall our experience was great.  The appetizer fiesty feta dip was fantastic.   Great flavor but not too spicy.  The tots were a good choice too.  The other 2 in my party loved their firecracker shrimp tacos.  I ordered the grilled cheese burnt ends.  The fries were good but they didn't grill my grilled cheese.  I should have said something but opted not to make a fuss.  The burnt ends in the sandwich lacked flavor.

We all ordered something different and really loved it. We ordered the flatbread pizza, the thunder chicken tacos as well as a salad and they're all amazing. I got the tater tot's with my Thunder chicken and they were amazing. The tater tot's kind of remind me of the Indiana version of poutine. I would also highly recommend the nefarious nectar draft or the brew crunch draft.

First,  I cannot believe I haven't reviewed The Tap yet. 
Second,  get The Tap fries- really,  you will be immersed in the savory dips &fries and want them every day.  (Can't wait for the fall seasonal fries again this year! )
Okay, I took my parents from out of town to The Tap on a Tuesday around 1130am. We were the only people in there for a while and then two other parties showed up in the end.  The service was awesome and we really enjoyed the food. 
We got The Tap fries (must-have!), Indiana Tenderloin (the reason we went to the Tap), BBQ sandwich and Fried Green Tomatoe BLT.
My only negatives are that The Tap Seltzer tasted like vinegar and that we weren't given silverware&had to request a knife and were still only brought one set. 
Overall, the food was delicious,  service was great & we had a good time.

Great place. Great environment. Our server was a very nice girl with blonde hair (I did Jt catch her name) and she was amazing at introducing me to beers I've never trie before! I was able to tell her what type of beers I liked and she brought me multiple samples until I found one I loved.

Ask for the blueberry beer if you enjoy fruity, fresh, crisp and into the wheat blonde type of beers. The blueberry beer was amazing and had actual blueberries floating around. I'm glad this place has opened back up!!!! I will be back :)

Yum! I've only done their carry-out food a few times at this point but I've enjoyed my meals from here. This location is very convenient for me and the staff are really nice. The line to get in is usually pretty long and the place is way too packed with students for me (social distancing!), so I haven't had a meal inside yet. However, the carry-out meals are nice and fresh. Moreover, you don't have to bother with the long line if you are just there to pick up food. I recommend their sandwiches and the wings for sure!

The service and the food was great! The shrimp tacos had a kick to them, but they weren't too spicy. I also recommend substituting the chips and salsa for fries. The pretzel stick appetizer (not pictured) were perfect and the beer cheese dip had a tonnn of flavor. Beer flights are reasonably priced, but you are only able to choose from the list of Tap beers on draft.

COVID-19 update to my previous reviews. Called the Tap today and ordered two freshly filled crowlers. The friendly customer service dude told me I could come in to pay (which sort of surprised me, because I thought businesses were only doing curbside right now). I explained to him that I am OLD af, so he said he would bring it out to the car. 

Ten minutes later, I pulled up, showed him my ID, signed the CC receipt and he loaded the beer into my car. I wasn't thrilled about having to sign the CC receipt, sort of wish they would try to figure out a way to not make people sign during this virus thing. He told me they had been cleaning the pens between each transaction though.

The beer (Bionic Dragon Blood Orange) was delicious and super fresh. Looking forward to the pandemic fading away and enjoying beers (and food) at the Tap again soon. In the meantime, curbside is the way to go.
How much better can you get than great beer and fantastic food?!? We've tried multiples of their house beers and their guest taps are always rotating too.

I don't recommend this place. Wife went in to order a salad for lunch and upon inspection/eating the salad noticed either dirt or rotting spinach. Took it back in to the manager to get something else. Thinking there would have been some sort of sympathy from the manager but she showed no major concern or even slightly concerned. Charged her full price without any apology. BEWARE! Dirt salads!

Had dinner with three friends this week.  Let me begin by saying I've been to other Tap locations and this is the best of them, WOW. The layout is great and the live music is  worth making the trip. Grace was our server, her recommendations were on point and she was so charming! Definitely will be back.

The Tap menu features something so useful, so simple, and so utilitarian that I simply can't believe that this is the first time that I've come across it. With two pages of beers brewed in-house, determining what to order could prove confusing if you had to go off of names and descriptions alone. Obviously, the types of brews are listed as well, which helps, but there is also a small Cartesian graph with Sweet/Bitter on the X axis and Dark/Light on the Y with the type of beer plotted. This is GENIUS! 
Between the striking number of quality-sounding beers listed and my appreciation for their menu ingenuity, I'm already feeling very favorable toward The Tap. 

I mentioned the large selection of beers, both their own and many others on tap as well as some 1700 in bottles or cans. There are also ciders and a few other brews, but there is limited wine and no liquor, so don't come in looking for cocktails. You'll be able to find something that you'll enjoy if you even marginally like beer.

Or good food. I didn't mention the food yet, which is excellent! Appetizers, entrees, desserts? Got it all and everything has great flavor!

Service was also amazing! Our server was a former bartender who knew the answer to everything we asked as well as being quick and friendly. 

The space is large, with lots of pub tables, booths in the back and a long, winding bar that sits below a small stage for live acts that looks over the two rooms. TVs are present, but not overwhelming, thankfully. Rather, the many paintings of sports or the foot traffic outside seen through the two walls of windows distract the eye more than anything. 

If you enjoy beer and good food, I highly recommend The Tap!

My FAVORITE restaurant in Bloomington. The salad and sandwiches were good, but the stand out was the warm pretzel with cheese sauce.  Pair it with any beer they have on tap and you won't regret.  The beer cheese dip was worth every calorie!

I've been coming in here for the last few months because it feels safe.  What I found today is that it was safe because of WHEN I came in. During off hours, hardly anyone comes in. Today it is packed and I am disheartened to say they are not enforcing masks on the way in the building and while people are walking around. It doesn't feel safe at all to me. If you care about your health, only come in on week days. I've seen zero management in the last two hours, the staff can't keep up, and they are not enforcing masks. I'm typing this on my way out the door. I'll come back when they follow the rules.

I would love to rate it higher as it has a lot of chatter in Bloomington, but it just doesn't go above and beyond other places.  The service was not great as you could just see the waiters all standing around talking to each other rather than coming by to refill water.  The beer cheese pretzels were delicious though!

My friends and I love The Tap! Our favorite thing is the Firecracker Shrimp appetizer. I'd also highly recommend the Nefarious Nectar, it's a great beer. 

They recently reopened in accordance with local and state social distancing requirements. The staff was extremely helpful with navigating the new setup and processes. 

You can even pay for your meal from your phone!

reviews.text:
This is a good go-to for "fancy delivery" during COVID, without "fancy" price tags. The food is delicious. My favorite is the farfalle with almond crusted chicken, delicious and it feeds me for multiple meals when I'm watching my portions. I also highly recommend the bacon wrapped shrimp, sadly I forgot to take a photo before I devoured them. 

Check out their menu for an eclectic collection of delicious food sure to please anyone in your household.

This restaurant has the most delicious food! I have tried so many of their appetizers (they have half-priced appetizer specials!) and they've all been incredible. Their martinis (especially the berry one) are also fabulous. They have great service and treated our dog to ice water when we had her with us on the patio, so sweet!
We both had pasta dishes and they were wonderful. The outdoor seating was convenient and covered. There was a DJ playing but not too loud. The service was wonderful.

Back in Town!  This time, I ate here on two consecutive nights.  The first night, the salmon.  The second, i had their almond/parm chicken. 

In both cases, the preparation was well executed AND offered plenty of interest to my palate and eyes.  More so with the salmon IMHO.  The chicken dish was a lot of food.  

I especially enjoyed eating outside, in the waning days of Autumn.

Loved this restaurant! Great atmosphere and friendly workers. There's a reason why this place is always busy! We took some friends here for dinner and drinks. The menu was great and catered to everyone's food preferences. Highly recommend!
RedSeven is perfect for lunch and dinner! They have great food, great service, and I highly recommend everyone go and try them!

Dinner menu is great. Lunch menu is nothing special. 

Staff is good and respectful, but I always get the impression management is very strict. The staff doesn't have much personality. 

Decor is also sort of weird. It gives and early 2000's las Vegas vibe. 

Good place to grab a great dinner meal. Not the best place to hang out at the bar.

Was very disappointed that they are not following through with what they state they do with precautions for COVID. 6 foot distance was not enforced. Waiter was not wearing gloves. Customers walking around with no masks. I saw a waiter clean off a table...I think sanitized the top of the table but did not clean seats. Sucks. I thought I had a place I could go to.  :(

Great atmosphere and ambiance. This is a nice spot for a date night. The restaurant was not very packed, so it was easy to have a socially distant meal. We ordered the chips and queso and fettucini alfredo with chicken. The queso was delicious! The queso had a perfect blend of all the right flavors. There was even a hint of bacon in the queso. I thoroughly enjoyed the chips and dip. The dinner rolls were super fluffy, buttery, and moist. The pasta was delicious but very greasy. The greasiness of the pasta was pretty off putting. Also, we waited a really long time to get our food despite how few people were in the restaurant. Overall, the food was great and I highly recommend.

It was my first visit at Red Seven getting dinner and drinks with a friend and I was really pleased with the experience! We both ordered drinks to start; I ordered the blueberry lavender mojito. It ended up being too strong and I asked our waiter to add a splash of lemonade, which made it so much better! We then ordered the chips and queso appetizers share and WOW! It was AMAZING!!!! The chips are homemade and came out so hot and fresh. I highly recommend this appetizer to everyone who dines here. My friend ordered the fettuccine alfredo pasta and I ordered the asian chicken lettuce cups. We both liked our food! I kind of expected my lettuce cups to be assembled already, but it came as a spread that I assembled myself. This was fine as well, just a little messy to eat! The peanut sauce that comes with it is the perfect flavor for this dish! The only problem overall was the ceiling slowly dripping on my friend throughout our meal... We think this was because of how hot and humid it was outside. Otherwise, it was a great experience! Our waiter was very kind and attentive!

Excellent place!! Never been to Lafayette been to west side. So we ordered an Old Fashioned and split the grilled chicken sandwich with avocado. The seasoning was perfect and the chicken was juicy too!! We both ordered side salads. I choose the mango champagne dressing (house) and my husband ordered the vinaigrette. The mango was a nice touch of sweet but not too sweet. Definitely will come back

Red Seven is a really great place to enjoy food and drinks. The menu has a lot of good options for a lot of different types of eaters. 

We got the shrimp and feta pasta, risotto, salmon, and truffle Mac & cheese. They all came with salads, which came with a great mango chardonnay dressing. We were served complimentary bread & butter before our meal. The shrimp & feta pasta was my favorite, it was a great twist to the different cheesy pasta options, and it had little tender chunks of pork belly in it as well! The risotto was the most disappointing, but we still ate most of it. Truffle Mac and cheese came with lots of lobster, which was pretty delicious! The salmon was flaky in a good way, and it came with crispy potato medallions in a pool of guacamole. 

Overall? A great restaurant to enjoy good food with good company.

Five stars.  This is not the ultimate in Michelin starred cuisine, but it is quite good and very reasonably priced.  Quality to price ratio gets five stars in my view.  Five of us shared the chipotle queso with homemade chips. . . those evaporated in seconds.  The strawberry mojito drink, recommended by our server, was cruise ship fare, not really the best cocktail, and the weak point of the meal.  All 5 of us had different entrees,all excellent.  I had the thick-cut pork chop, it was a touch dry, but made up for with excellent glaze and delicious mashed potatoes, chunky applesauce and perfect broccolini.  Others had shrimp stir fry, a delicious creamy farfalle pasta, the balsamic chicken dish was really outstanding, and the fifth was a delicious salmon.   Really, quite nice.
My fave restaurant in town. Whether it's date night, lunch with a friend or a small employee holiday party, I've always had an amazing meal here. I love the lighting and ambience too. 10 stars!

I really enjoyed the Pecan Chicken Rollup.  Not too filling for a lunch time meal and the taste was excellent.  The chicken tenders were breaded in crushed pecans, deep fried, and then wrapped in tortillas with a Honey-lime sauce, tomato, & lettuce for a great combo taste of sweet & savory with a bit of crunch.  

I chose fries to go with the wraps and they were a bit disappointing.  There were plenty of the shoestring variety, but they were cool and chewy like you get when they sit out under a heat lamp.  I don't know for sure, just that they reminded me of those disappointing ones.  

The place has a really nice ambiance and I was served promptly, but it was a little weird sitting at the bar for lunch and then the bartender disappeared for the entirety of my meal.  My service was picked up by a waiter, but it felt really odd being the only one seated there and nobody on the other side of the counter.  Made it seem like I wasn't getting noticed since my waiter was only in the bar area sparingly.  Still, he did a good job of getting the food out and bringing my check.  Just would have been nice to have him check on whether I liked my food or needed a refill on my water before I was finished.

But the entree was excellent, so I will let that skew my rating higher than I might have otherwise given.

Review #1534

Easily one of the best dinner spots in the Laffayette area! Everything from the decor to the food to the service is impeccable. The interior reminds me of a classy, old school dinner-date restaurant that really makes for a nice fancy-ish ambiance. The server I had was very attentive with drink refills, orders, and check ups. The food was amazing too! I had the shrimp risotto that a very unique creole style with pork belly and mushroom flavors folded into the creamy risotto and shrimp. My date had the shrimp fettuccini which she also really enjoyed. The price per person is about 30-35 with drinks which is on par with the quality of the service and food. Certainly will be coming back in the future!
Ordered the stir-fry and added grilled chicken. Veggies were soggy and sauce had no flavor.

I'm so glad we stopped at Red Seven today while banking across the street. The food had an international flair and everything was delicious. We had the potstickers and the chicken lettuce wraps along with filet mignon sliders. We shared all the dishes and topped it off with sticky toffee pudding on their sunny patio. You should definitely check it out!

So Ms Music Funkette has left the city were engineers and astronauts make big a$$ bass drums and agri-business is Boilered-up. Yet, the Very Delectable Mrs Funk and I find ourselves here on a Friday eve for a Greyhound pickup of Ms Baseball Funkette away from her Wrigleyville Party Barn for a Sunday Indy event.

As is our way, where Funksters meet, dinner is near. And Red Seven was as close as a crosswalk.

Tall smokey glass outside windows, wooden paneled, sectioned off booths to one side. Shiney-glassed mirrored bar back with hightop fours behind the bar seating. At 8P in a Big 10 town, the joint is... empty! Ah, it is spring break. We chose a Hightop and service was prompt. How could it be anything but.

Signature cocktails Gin and Sin Martini, Cool as a Cucumber chiller and a Grayson Pinot Noir, all at $8 per, start the conversation. A southwestern grilled chicken salad $10, chorizo stuffed empanadas $8 and asian veggie egg rolls $8, round out the shareable evening nosh. Before you can say March Madness, plates of fresh prepared groceries are delivered to the tall table. Delicious satisfaction followed...along with a repeat of the conversation starter.

In my usual close, would we return? Well with a nod to 1960 and Mr Elmer Bernstein one might say this was the Theme to the Pretty Darn Good Red Seven.... know what i mean?
We love Red Seven! Great food and atmosphere.  Red Sevenn is a favorite destination for date night!

reviews.text: Incredibly COVID safe. Got veggie croquettes, katsu curry, and salmon/tuna sushi and it was super tasty. The veggie croquettes were perfectly crisp and sweet! The katsu curry was a little too spicy for me at level 2. The sushi rice was well flavored!

The tables are way too close together.  I felt uncomfortably close to the people next to me.  

We ordered the spicy fried chicken and spicy miso ramen. I ordered the 1 for the spice level and my boyfriend ordered 2. 

It took over 40 minutes for us to get our food. The fried chicken lacked breading.  It was flavorful, but definitely not what we were expecting.  It really tasted like seasoned chicken, not fried chicken. When the ramen came out, we were disappointed.  It looked like one had more hot sauce/oil in than the other so my boyfriend and I switched, assuming his was the one with more sauce/oil.  The server failed to mention which was which. She seemed confused. 

The pork was rubbery - I wish that it was grilled a little more.  The broth was okay, a little bland.  I noticed other tables got different seasonings to add, but we were only given pepper. 

Overall, I don't think i'll be returning.  While, it's closer to campus, I do favor the other ramen restaurant more.

A much cuter place than I was expecting with terrific ramen and a homemade broth with extremely rich depth of flavor. I was impressed by this place since it is quite close to Purdue University's campus but it doesn't feel like a cheap college restaurant. There's a substantial amount of seating, and the place was fairly busy on a Friday night when my friend and I went, but we were seated instantly. 

They have eight ramen options, but all are pork-based and the only meat option is pork belly. I don't normally like pork belly, but it was homemade here and it was fantastic! Of the eight ramen options, four are not-spicy, and the other four are the same as the first four, just with the option of 3 levels of spicy. Both my friend and I went with the spicy tonkotsu shoyu ramen, level 2 spicy. The ramen was served with noodles, fish cakes, a hard-boiled egg, pork belly, seaweed, scallions, and mushrooms with ramen pepper at the table. It seemed like the spicy factor came from the amount of chili oil they added to the ramen, which is a bit like a ripoff since the spicy ramen costs a dollar more than the regular ramen for just a bit of spicy oil ($11 for regular, $12 for spicy). While it didn't feel worth the extra dollar, I think the spicy factor was a great addition to the meal. 

Please note that they don't have a license for alcohol yet, so your options are water, soda, and tea. They also have a list of appetizers/meals like edamame, tempura veggies, and chicken katsu on their menu. Overall, a great place to warm up and eat some great ramen!

I was excited when I found out there was a new Ramen place, especially one near campus. The first time I went there on a Sunday evening, they told me there was a 40 minute wait. I wasn't going to wait that long, so I came back on a very late evening on a weekday, around 8 ish. It was empty, but yet I had the slowest service ever. There was only one person working at the cashier and also serving everyone in the restaurant....so I was ignored for the longest time because she was so occupied at the cashier.

20 minutes later, got the food and oh dear....

The shio ramen was so bland. The broth was almost tasteless and there was only one very thin slice of meat....it was a really sad experience. It's like they watered down the broth until it's completely tasteless.

If you get the spicy one for a dollar extra, they dump some chilli oil in it and call it spicy...you can literally see the pool of oil on the top of the broth (also only on one side of the bowl)

We also tried the "fried" chicken....it doesn't even have any breading on it...and the spicy version is just drenched in oil. Nowhere close to what a proper karaage should be like...

Overall, absolutely not worth the money for the quality of food and be prepared to wait forever to get your food.

Had the homemade pork belly noodles broth etc.....very good...great decor.....waitress was quick and thoughtful helping me pick. Service quick and prick reasonable.
I will return
Service is very good. I ordered the ramen and didn't finish it. The staff boxes for me and separated the soup and noodles.

Not sure what constitutes authentic ramen or not as I've only had it a few times. However, good food is good food, and this is good food. The broth is flavorful to me with a good noodle to broth ratio. I have also had excellent service; my server has always been polite and friendly.

Look forward to eating here many more times when the weather gets cold!

Lovely little mom and pop Ramen shop. Atmosphere and decor are very charming, the kitchen is open which is fun to watch and there's other dishes to choose if you don't want Ramen. The Ramen is good, but limited in variety. There's another Ramen shop downtown which I think I like better for noodles, but where Denju really gets me is their Curry Katsu and their rice bowls. Their curry is so good, and really hits the spot on a cooler day. Rice bowls are very hearty and filling with a good spread of options. The Chicken Karaage is delicious too. The chunks of chicken are very juicy and don't get dried out and bland when fried, and the fry coating is very tasty (spritz some of the lemon juice from the lemon garnish). They claim to make their broths from scratch, which I can believe as there's a little variance from the bowls I've had at different times. Which I kind of like, makes it feel less process and manufactured. 

I've seen a few reviews about service, which I think are pretty unfair. Every time I've been, it's been the same staff. And I'm just speculating, but it looks like a family run place, with 1 server. Looks like mom and pop in the kitchen and the daughter running front of house. Could be way off base, but I've never had a disgustingly long wait (typically in and out in 40min), and they're beyond nice. They're all very sweet and smile brightly when you leave and say thank you, even when it's busy. Something to be said about a staff that treats you as a human instead of a dollar sign.

If you want an authentically fast Ramen shop, try Yata across the river. If you want a nice place to have a conversation, enjoy the atmosphere, and have some warm comfort food that was lovingly handmade, give this place a shot.
Ate here while in town for an admitted student day.  Excellent dumplings and very good fried chicken.  Service was prompt and very polite.  Food was delivered quickly and was very delicious.

Been here twice. First time it was on a weekday and everthing went fine. However second time i went here during dinner time on Sunday and I have waited for 40 minutes. Shame. Ramen restaurants should be fast-serving, like Japanese style fast food. I've been to Japan and have never seen such slow preparation. Unacceptable, though the ramen itself tastes fine. 

NOT RECOMMENDED during weekends or busy hours . If you stop by on weekdays, then it won't hurt giving it a try.
The ramen was delicious & our waiter was super helpful. Not a lot of frills, but it was a great place to grab dinner after an event across the river in downtown Lafayette.
Amazing ramen shop with delicious appetizers.  Small but gorgeous in the inside.  Perfect place for a nice lunch.

Their noodles were perfectly al dente and the spicy soy broth was delicious. The pork belly was yummy especially if you're less of crispy meat kind of person. I really liked their take on karaage (fried chicken) without the breading. The flavor was great and the mayo dipping sauce was quite refreshing. Ryland our server was really sweet as well! My one stipulation is the spiciness comes only from chili oil which was disappointing. Overall had a great visit and will be back!
So good, I come here at least once every 2 weeks.  Fills you up and they wear traditional outfits. Food is made fresh when you order it. Prices are reasonable.

No doubt, this will be my go to place for ramen before I finish my master degree. Truly an amazing ramen shop. The service was great! And the owner was extremely kind. And the best part is the ramen. I had Miso ramen. Bamboo was cut from fresh, and the chashu was extremely flavorful. The pricing was very reasonable.
Nice environment. The chicken and Ramen taste good but require very long waits (around 30 minutes). Would be great if it can be made faster.
Portion size was small, but in general the food was pretty good. One small bowl of food, as elegant as it looks, will not be enough to call a meal.

Amazing tempura.  Very light and fresh. Gyiza was very good too.  Because these appetizers were 5 stars, we had our expectations up very high for ramen.  I had shoyu tonkotsu while others in our group had miso tonkotsu.  We all agreed these items lacked flavor and weren't served hot enough.  Wait was slightly above normal but we had appetizers so it did t bother us.  Yatagarasu nearby wins the competition but I'd definitely come back here for awesome tempura.
Best ramen in Indiana certainly. Japanese owned. Probably the only authentic and Japanese owned ramen ya in the whole Indiana state. JFK is amazing. Tonkazu is also good
Very bad experience , we have been waiting for like 45 mins for the noodle and appetizer!! Also restaurant Cold as f:/

Midwest Seafood Boil is the alter-ego of No. 2 Asian Kitchen... and the sign outside says "Rice Cafe". Identity confusion aside, this is a little treasure of a Chinese takeout place. The Chinese half of the menu has all sorts of unique finds, mixed in with a comprehensive menu of old standby's. The star of the show, though, is the seafood boils. We had the crayfish boil, and it was absolutely delicious. The portions were very generous, and the flavor was amazing. We asked for spicy, and they delivered! It's only been around for a couple of months. We're hoping that they can stick around for the long haul! Great addition to the Purdue area restaurant scene.

reviews.text: Man, I dig it.  I used to eat at Sushi Boss in the PMU, but they shut down, which left me longing for custom sushi.  Poke Hibachi hits the spot to me, because really, the sushi wrap is just a container for all the good stuff inside.  They have lots of options (really, the only thing I like that they don't have is cream cheese, but that would probably be weird for a poke bowl, so I'm okay with BYO on that piece). They're quick, COVID-concious, and my tummy is happy.

Located near the Chauncey mall area. Decided to check it out on a lunch break with a coworker. The space decoration of the restaurant is super inviting. However due to covid restrictions they are only taking take out orders. I ordered a medium size bowl which came with 4 proteins. It was plenty of food & even had leftovers. The spicy salmon was definitely my favorite. Check them out !

Easiest to order ahead of time during Covid!

Staff was not inviting or friendly as I ordered from the door. Not sure if concerns with covid have made them hyper or they're typically unwelcoming. When I asked for suggestions, the staff just repeated to "look at the menu". The menu was posted on the door so each time I had a question, I needed to step outside before returning to the doorway to keep ordering. AwkeaI got a medium bowl with poke tuna. It was good, not excellent. $13 seemed pricey for the size.
Deliver was pretty fast and the food was good! Just a bit small portion wise for the price. But overall pretty good!!

A solid spot for poke! The service was fast and nice and I feel like I got exactly what i would expect. The spicy tuna was a bit too spicy for me (needed to drink milk) so I think next time I'm going to go for ahi tuna instead. Very clean restaurant and very good about social distancing

I love poke!  And I really appreciate that this restaurant opened at 10 a.m. so that I could grab a bite to eat at 10:30 without having to kill time waiting around. 

I have had poke at several places around Indy, so I was pleasantly surprised when the regular size bowl was about 2 cups instead of the massive bowls I've had elsewhere.  I had a lot of things to do and didn't need to feel stuffed!  

I didn't see any "pre-conceived" options on the menu board behind the counter, so I just followed the order and direction from the server on building my bowl.  Size then rice type (brown) were followed by protein choice (Ahi Tuna).  After that, they have a no limit choice of add ins and some that were an additional $.50 per selection (avocado and pineapple).  You also get a choice of sauce (Eel) and a couple toppers (lobster salad and shrimp).  I declined adding more toppers since by bowl was already overflowing.

The only negative I see is that when the bowl is filled, it is hard to stir it all up to get a blending of flavors until some of the bowl is consumed.

I also don't know why there have been so many comments about the expense.  If you want fresh food, hand prepared, it will cost more than a burger joint.  And frankly, I found the regular size perfectly fine for lunch (and I had just walked four miles followed by another six that afternoon.)

I really enjoyed my meal and highly recommend it to anyone who wants a healthy and fresh alternative for lunch.

Review #1134

I love love poke! I like that you can choose whatever toppings you like, but I really think it's a hit or miss with which employee you get and how large your portion will be.  Some of the ingredients don't taste as fresh, such as the vegetables or even tuna/salmon, so that's why I give it three stars instead.  It's not terrible, but it's not the best I've had! It definitely fulfills my poke cravings!

I love poke. This place isn't the best but it gets the job done. I got a large bowl with salmon, edamame, cucumbers, seaweed salad, ponzu and spicy mayo, scallions, and tempura topping. 

My first complaint is the rice. It's dry and a little hard. Pretty low quality rice. There was a lot of salmon which is awesome but it had very little texture and flavor. Everything else was generally fine but as those were the main components of my dish, I was a little disappointed. 

I think one of their strong points is that they give a lot of toppings. Because  I did not want too many things on my poke, they actually gave me double scoops of my toppings which I really appreciated.

I was at Purdue for a conference, and stopped in for a quick weekday lunch at Poke Hibachi.  The service is indeed quick -- fast casual, order at the counter style. It's very small inside, so you may not find seating if they're busy. 

My friend and I split a large poke bowl (around $13 including tax and a 50 cent up-charge for adding avocado), and it was enough food for a decent meal for two people, which was a great value.  They sell hibachi (cooked proteins -- mostly meat or fish -- with veggies and rice), as well. You can choose from a variety of raw and cooked seafood proteins, and there's a tofu option for vegans/vegetarians.  The food was fresh and tasted good -- standard tasty poke bowl fare, with lots of good options for sauces and toppings.

The portion was almost too generous for the size of the bowl I had -- I asked for a mix of brown rice and greens as a base, and was given so many greens that the bowl was basically impossible to mix: you need to eat all the good toppings off first, and are then left with plain rice and lettuce at the bottom. I'm not complaining about big portions; it was very generous. But it might be better in a larger bowl.

Speaking of bowls: there's no recycling container (at least as far as I could see), in spite of the fact that all of the bowls used are plastic and presumably recyclable. 

Bonus, though: the chopsticks are smooth and rounded, unlike the rough-edged, stuck together wooden chopsticks most places have.  No splinters here!

The only downfall of this place is small portions. The food was exceptional! I had the regular size poke bowl. It was very small, so next time I will get a large. You have many choices for toppings, but I went with the following, brown rice, carrots, cucumber, micro greens, cabbage, pickled cucumber, avocado, green onion, poke tuna, lobster salad, sweet wasabi and spicy mayo. The flavors were fabulous and on point. Everything worked well together. It was fresh and well worth the $9+ price tag. My only regret is that I didn't get a larger size. Atmosphere was very hip and cool. I will be ba
Besides being incredibly overpriced, this is a great spot to get poké. Lots of options to choose from and it's quick to order

I am from Hawai'i and this is not poke. The texture of the fish was mealy, the spicy ahi resembled no spicy ahi I've ever tasted, and the sauce that that was squirted on it very strongly tasted of lemon. For you haoles who don't know--LEMON DOES NOT GO WITH POKE. 

The rice had a crapload of vinigar on it. Sushi rice has vinigar in it. NOT POKE RICE. AND NOBODY SQUIRTS IT ON TOP THE RICE. 

Also, all the topping and stuff you put on the poke--no one makes poke like that. Just a way to get away with giving you practically no fish. 

I've never been more depressed to be in Indiana.

( Tbh, the lady who served me was nice. I hope they succeed cause the people seem nice. Haoles never gonna know the difference anyway. This review is for da local braddahs and sistahs.)

This place is ridiculously stingy for the price. I paid $18 for the large bowl and the lady that was working gave me the smallest scoops ever. Some scoops weren't even filled up. My bowl was barely halfway full and I'm honestly incredibly disappointed. The bowl itself wasn't very flavorful and the onions and wasabi barely tasted like anything at all. I took one bite of the ginger and immediately noticed a spoiled and rotten taste. I love poke and came to visit from Chicago and did not expect to be ripped off like this. I will make sure to never come back or recommend it to anyone. Potential customers beware, your money is far better off at a different poke restaurant.
Love this place, tons of choices, amazing staff, cozy place and so delicious, a little pricey but worth it, we went on a sat and got the deal bogo. Can't wait to go back!

Amazing!! Wish I would've tried this place sooner! It's basically a poke-Chipotle. You get to choose all the toppings of your poke bowl, with at least 2 choices of meat (for the regular bowl). As expected, the price is a little steep, so I wouldn't come in regularly, but definitely a nice treat after a rough week :) only complaint is that they have no/minimal temperature control so we were uncomfortable from the heat.

Poke is one of my favorite foods so I was super excited to see a place open up near campus.  I find the large poke bowl is a good amount of food.

The fish tastes quite fresh to new and I'm a big fan of both normal tuna and a poke sauce mix tuna.

If you love fresh vegetables and seafood, this is the perfect place where you can enjoy couple different things in one poke with reasonable price. They also offer really good steak or chicken, but it may not be enough meat for meat lovers. The discount is different and surprising everyday. You may be the lucky one 
to get good food with pretty low price!

Fresh and healthy. Absolutely delicious!!! Nice place in Purdue area! I think this is first poke shop in Purdue!

Also a lot of toppings to choose and they are updating very often.

Food quality was excellent and I really liked the interior. Cozy, neat place. The small bowl seemed a little too light. Large bowl is the way to go if you plan on this being your whole meal. With large bowl there is the choice of two proteins. I got the poke salmon and baby octopus. Both were excellent. Also loved the seaweed salad add-on. Avocado is also a must-add-on.

They had a lot of toppings to choose from. I would love to eat here again. Only negative is it's not cheap, but you get what you pay for.

We've visited two days in a row and we satisfied each time. The first day my kid ordered the steak hibachi and the second day she ordered a Poke' bowl. She thought both were good but preferred the Poke bowl. The large bowl is 11.99 and you get a choice of three proteins and many other toppings.  Some of the toppings are an extra .50, like the seaweed salad, mango caviar, etc. overall we paid 28. and some cents for 2 large Poke bowls with 4 add/owns.

Photo of T C's Restaurant & Tavern - Battle Ground, IN, United States. Lots of boneless wings. Buffalo was typical but the honey mustard is flame .

reviews.text:
Wife and I went here with her family, after hearing that they have one of the best tenderloin sandwiches in and around Lafayette. That definitely rang true. The meat was appropriately thick and the breading was the right "weight" -- not too light, not too heavy. More critically, it wasn't soggy or overly oily. The sandwich itself is massive. We split it between the two of us and were full. I'd strongly recommend adding their bistro sauce to the tenderloin.

Additionally, we also got the fried green beans and buffalo chips. Both were pretty good, although I'd personally get the green beans over the chips.

Overall, this is totally worth the (short) drive from Lafayette.

Don't let looks fool you, this place was great! We were greeted right as we walked in the door by our exceptional waitress. I ordered the HUGE breaded tenderloin and buffalo chips. The prices are great! My only comment would be the buffalo chips don't really have any "buffalo" flavor to them, but I still enjoyed them! Pretty much just french fries cut a little thicker than chips. I can't wait to come back and try a dinner meal. Great little place!
Can't go wrong with TCs. Small town restaurant with a small town feel.  Food is excellent.

A nice find in a very small town!  I had the catfish fillets with steak fries - all served hot and fresh!  He had the pork fillet with sweet potato fries - the pork was just perfect, thick and moist and perfectly cooked.  
We were just stopping nearby for the night and would certainly return when in this area.

Thanks to Yelp, we have found ourselves in yet ANOTHER amazingly delicious  gastro experience!  Nothing fancy but MY GOODNESS! the options are diverse and cover the likes at everyone at our table.  For fun we tried the Wasabi Crab/Shrimp Balls.  Although these are not made from scratch, they are DELICIOUS!  WOW!  These lunch options are FANTASTIC!!!!  Everything has a fantastic flavor and the presentation is beautiful. Our server told us that the restaurant has been here for 30 years and is a local favorite...I CAN TOTALLY UNDERSTAND!!!  This was a marvelous find!!!!
My family and I love to eat here. Good classic American food at a reasonable price. Service is excellent as well!

Nothing fancy.  Best Filet you can get anywhere in the area.  We choose TCs instead of going in town foe a steak.  Prime Rib night is amazing.  Craig the bartender is a riot.  Good experience each and every time.

This an unassuming mom and pop restaurant off the beaten path with lots of local atmosphere. High school memorabilia hangs on the wall from the owners, a local couple. We were there after a Purdue game and it was clear this was a "place to be" for those in the know (this place is not exactly close to the stadium). 

TC's is a "common ground" meeting place for folks of all kinds - we saw young hipster foodies and old-timer regulars; a group of guys kicking back with some beers and a girls-night-out birthday party in heels and high makeup;  an alternative couple with tattoos and piercings, and a buttoned-down family with young kids. Everyone was just there to enjoy the food and the place. 

The best thing: These folks know how to season and cook a steak! We had the strip and the filet, each medium rare. The strip was miraculously medium rare from within a millimeter of the seared edge all the way through. Unbelievable. Maybe the best steak this seasoned steak eater has had any where, any time. The filet was super flavorful, also right to temperature. Not the most velvety I've ever had, but definitely the most flavorful. Also very much recommended: the sauteed mushrooms!

The wine selection is limited but we found something we liked. Our one critique seems to be common around here where there is an apparent preference for corn-fed beef, which we struggle to understand as well-aged Western beef fans. In the end it's a small matter - especially since these folks really know how to cook a steak!

The atmosphere is very basic and old bar style. The food is delicious! I had a great cocktail, grilled tenderloin and coleslaw. My bill was less than $11. Don't miss this classic stop! Great food. Specials daily for $6.50. Yesterday was the ribs, which came with a small portion, two sides and bread. What a steal!

Visited on 10/11/18 and I think it was the best meal I've had in the years I've been coming here with my girlfriends. One thing to know about Thursday nights here - you will need a reservation. Yes, this small town restaurant is PACKED on Thursday nights, which happens to be the only night prime rib is on the menu. Interior and exterior aren't fancy, which can be misleading about the yummy food served inside! Tbh I've only had two menu items in the years I've been visiting - the pork chop and the prime rib. Both are absolutely delicious. Now the rolls and salad are ordinary but the berries are fantastic! If you still haven't been to TC's you're missing out!

What a wonderful place! First, we were really warmly greeted by our server. And that level of service just continued. There are clearly a lot of regulars, and t
I can see why. One side is more of a bar, and the other side a restaurant, but they are both open and there are tables on both sides.
Now for the food. This is a steak and sandwiches kind of place. I got the grilled cheese with buffalo chips and coleslaw. Oh those buffalo chips! I split them with hubs and they were delicious. I'd definitely get the grilled cheese again. Everyone else loved their food too, which ranged from chicken to steak with fries) and the cheese curds and onion rings were tasty and the perfect amount for 4 hungry adults and a picky teenager.
We enjoyed our meals and the service so much that we started thinking of other things to do in this area so we can all eat here again!

Great spot for lunch or dinner. In downtown Battle Ground but somewhat hidden. A favorite of locals (place was largely full for weekday lunch at 11:15). Very good specials and comfort food (great tenderloin sandwich and Pork Manhattan). Reasonable prices. Nice bar. About 10 minutes off I-65; pleasant drive through Prophetstown State Park. Tippecanoe Battlefield nearby.

My family had a mini-vacation to Indiana Beach and before we went home, we stopped by Tippecanoe Battlefield Museum. My wife looked on On Yelp for a place to have lunch and came across TC's. Caroline was our server (and she was beyond excellent) and every single expectation for a family of 5 to get a decent lunch was far exceeded... The food was delicious, the restaurant was neat and clean and we received quite possibly the best service we have ever received at ANY restaurant (high-end or otherwise). I'd like to brag again on Caroline and say that I wish every business had team members like her. She made us feel completely at home, did more for us than any server we've ever had had done and had a genuine smile on her face the entire time. Listening to her and the other staff interact with the other guests assured us that this wasn't an isolated incident... this is a TC way of life. Thanks for everything!

This is a great classic place to take the family. TC's has amazing food and a wonderful atmosphere. You cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. Just be sure to make a reservation! The place fills up fast on the weekend!

A co-worker and I stopped here on a trip up to the Prophetstown area for work. It was recommended to us by a local and it did not disappoint. 

We tried both the breaded tenderloin and the BLT. The tenderloin was huge! It had a nice balance to sandwich. It was not chewy or overly moist, but just the right amount of both. My coworker got the side salad and it was your standard side salad. 

The BLT was very tasty and had a good proportion of ingredients. The bacon was crispy and on the thicker side. I really liked the buffalo chips, which were like flattened Arby's curly fries in their flavoring and they had a good crunch to them.

The place was packed when we got in there for a late lunch. It seemed like somewhere the locals hang out a lot. Good place if you are every in the Battleground, IN area. 

They have a daily special that is $6.50 and it seemed like everyone but us was getting the chicken and noodles that are the Wednesday special.

The restaurant does not cater to children with food allergies.  We always have to bring in food for our son who is highly allergic to milk and peanuts. Whenever it is possible for us to order food for him (such as French fries as we did for him on our visit) we always will order something. As we tried to supplement his dinner with food we brought, we were immediately told we could not bring in outside food. I explained about food allergies and that I could provide a doctor's note and that was not sufficient. We were with a large group so we finished eating and I "snuck" food to our son. The rest of the groups food was fine (average, not great). Unfortunately, we will not be back....

I happened on this place totally by chance. I was lost and cruising the Indiana countryside on a trip back from Chicago.  I hit this little country restaurant and bar about 4 PM on a weekday, with already 30 or 40 cars in the parking lot.  

More out of curiosity than hunger or thirst, I stopped in to see what the fuss was about. Before I knew it, I was watching these gargantuan meals come out of the kitchen from my barstool perch: huge steaks, massive cheeseburgers, even massive salads, accompanied by a LOT of smiles when the plates were laid down. 

I ordered a fried pork tenderloin sandwich, an Indiana state dish if there ever was one. What came out was a tenderloin the size of my plate (see photo). And my plate was a full dinner plate, which was completely covered by the Paul Bunyan-esque sandwich. 

Now that I'm reading the other reviews of TC's, it's clear that all their food is oversized, well-prepared and relatively inexpensive.  By the time I left at 530, the place was jammed up, completely packed, and loaded with laughter and good conversation. 

I'm going back to this little gem of a throwback Indiana pub and restaurant on my next trip to Chicago, and I'll make sure to order a steak or a cheeseburger, which looked good, as did everything else.  And Craig the burly bartender will remember me, as he was duly impressed that I ate every single morsel of my Andre the Giant Tenderloin. And a small plate of shrooms.

Don't let this places look fool you. Steaks are great, burgers are great, and did I mention the steaks? This place is a diamond in the rough. You have to come here and try the NY strip and cheeseburger. I promise you will not be disappointed.

Stopped in with my brother one afternoon and the waitress was the nicest woman! She greeted us by name and made sure we had full drinks, brought our food out promptly, and was more than happy to be working which made the environment enjoyable. The hand-breaded tenderloin sandwich is hands down the best in Indiana!! Best kept secret for tenderloins in Indiana!

I've never had a bad meal here. I've always gone with the 10oz filet and Buffalo chips. The past 2 times I went with the tenderloin. The tenderloin is big enough for 2 meals every time. This is also the fist place I've ever seen my wife eat steak! It's a hole in the wall place and a relaxed fun atmosphere. The kitchen closes at 9 p.m.  Be sure to make reservation to get a seat, if not you may not get in or you'll wait a long time. I'd recommend it to anyone in town or visiting from out of town!

reviews.text: Had the pork belly nachos today for lunch and they are very good. Cant wait to go back

reviews.text: We bought take out from here for dinner tonight and it was delicious. We had Pad Ga-Prow (Basil) with extra vegetables and Thai Fried Rice with Chicken. Both were delicious. The quality was as good as any Thai food we have had in this price range anywhere in the US.

We've been trying to do as much curbside pick-ups as possible given the current situation and although not everyone is willing to offer this service, Thai Essence were superb. The staff were all courteous, efficient, and more than happy to take payment over the phone and drop our order in our car. Much appreciated!

I just got their Tom Yung Kung. This is a very yummy seafood soup, lots of flavor, shrimp and mushrooms! I was expecting it to be a little spicier given the chilli sign next to it, but I also do have very high tolerance! I did feel that for the price of $7.95, the portion could be a little bigger.

Would I go back? Yes! 

Keep up the great work and thank you for your service.

Very authentic Thai food. Just enough spice not to burn. Quick service. Enjoyed the take out and very organized. I will definitely come back. 
Highly recommend the drunken noodles.

The Pineapple Curry Stir Fry is delicious. I usually don't like coconut, but it was toasted and add just the right flavor to the dish. 

Their takeout system right now is also so easy! It is obvious they are taking extra precautions during the quarantine, such as grabbing my credit card with a wash cloth and sanitizing all the pens after use. 

Thanks for a great experience :)

I'm torn between an "as good as it gets" 5 star and a "yay!  I'm a fan" 4 star.  I mean, it's Lafayette - it's literally the only Thai restaurant, so it is literally as good as it gets.  That said, it's also delicious, although the menu lacks a couple of items (mainly in the dessert category) that I'd like to see.

I've been a few times - both eating in and taking out.  I'm a consistent Thai diner - I always get pad see ew with tofu (essentially, a thick, floppy noodle with a lot of soy, with tofu), and -- if they have it -- sweet sticky rice with custard.  Because I'm boring like that, my eating experience is consistent, and tasty.  Aside from the lack of sticky rice.

In terms of dining in, it's a perfectly pleasant experience.  That said, the restaurant itself (at least the eating area) is fairly small, so if you're planning on coming on a busy night, you're probably going to feel rather cramped.  I generally get take out on busy nights, and dine in on a casual Tuesday.

I see another review suggesting that the staff was rude, and the portions small.  I haven't had that experience.  The portions are appropriate for one meal - you're not going to walk away hungry, and you're not going to need a box.  It's just right.  The staff seemed a bit harried, but that's pretty typical for a busy restaurant.

Went for dinner, and instead of a nice quiet dining experience, we were yelled at by the chef/owner/manager. He came storming out of the kitchen with a plate of fried rice and proceeded to chew me out for ordering it without onions... the food he just made was going to go to waste  it was my fault, I was inconsiderate, etc. right after ordering, I asked the waiter to hold the onions, but apparently the dish had already been made. I would have been happy to pay for it, but he was too busy chewing me out in front of all the other diners to even hear that fact. We paid for soup and drinks and whatever else and will never return. It is a shame, as we have been dine-In and take-out customers since it opened. Can't support a business that treats customers like dirt. I honestly have never had such a horrible experience dining out.

This place is my most favorite Thai restaurant anywhere and definitely my most favorite restaurant in West Lafayette Indiana. I usually always order a spicy basil fried rice with tofu. They make the best version of this. Pad Kee Mao, Pad Thai, yellow curry and sautéed eggplant are perfect too. I went with people who are on low carb diets and TE accommodated by replacing the rice.
Great service. Pad Thai was delicious and my husband had the cashew chicken meal. Such great depth of flavors with just the right amount of spice.

My daughter brought me here as a treat.  I had never tried Thai food, but always wanted to do so.  

Thai Essence is an immaculate, intimate space, where you are served with care.  The servers are knowledgeable and kind.  You are encouraged to ask questions about the menu, and the food is superb.  Very fresh.  The curry was spicy but not overwhelmingly so.  The spring rolls we had as appetizers were delicate and perfectly done.

I've since returned and ordered the Pad Ram, with a side of rice.  It was very good.  The cabbage was still crisp and the chicken was tender, not tough.  The sauce was exceptional.

Incredible Thai restaurant!  All of their dishes are well done, from the soups and apps to the curries and fried dishes.  

The service is incredible.... the waitstaff is very knowledgeable and friendly.

Was really surprised by how good the thai food is, i moved here from LA where we have decent thai food and this place beats any place i have been to in LA. The food is so good i get the thai fried rice.... just made sure to keep in consideration that they close for lunch at 230pm and reopen for dinner. Dont hesitate to order here

I love Thai Essence to bits. I used to hop and the bus, stop off in front of the Medical Research Center place (the pyramid building), walk across the highway, just to eat there. It and Basil Thai have the same owner, and they have pretty much the same thing. However, Thai Essence's menu is more extensive than Basil Thai. Both do take-out, but no delivery. Additionally, I find portions at Thai Essence are bigger than at Basil Thai.

My favorite by far is that Thai Essence has a section called Hot Plates. More often than not have the Duck Pra Ram or the hot plate that has lychee, but honesty everything is good here. This is the foremost place I take people if they haven't gone there before. It's more upscale, an actual restaurant versus a mom & pop shop.

If you're looking to impress someone, whether it's on a date, an interview, business meeting, alumni, or family, this is the place to go. And IT'S A REALLY GOOD PLACE FOR PEOPLE WHO'VE NEVER EATEN THAI FOOD BEFORE. You're sure to be in for a good experience. The portions are HUGE, especially if you get the curry pineapple fried rice (hugely popular). 

It's a classy place. Seriously, this is the go-to place I recommend and make reservations to for when friends' have family coming over they need to show off to or visiting speakers/trainers for club. I would recommend dinner. Again, more extensive menu. And pretty much any of the desserts.

BUT DON'T BE FOOLED, YOU CAN DRESS CASUAL. It's definitely more upscale, but the prices are pretty much the same and it's good for all occasions. So while you do have business men and women, advisers, counselors, and families coming in and out, you can definitely slum it as a college student and it's just fine. My club was the Bujinkan Yanagi Dojo, a martial arts club. We would sometimes take our speaker/trainer there after seminars, and almost everyone would come in training duds.Staff is cool like that and attentive.

They do reservations, but it tends to be more immediate. As they're more than a bit out of the way, walk-ins are easier with them. However, they're popular enough that if there is some big event going on, reserve early. They don't do 6 months ahead early, but one or two months ahead should suffice. They're REALLY good for large parties. Unlike Basil Thai, they have the room. Aforementioned seminar crowd had about 12 (walk-in) and I took a family of 7 (reservation) there another time. Both times, we fit comfortable in the back.

Thai Essence is a place where we can always enjoy a delicious and beautiful meal served by a friendly staff. They have a nice selection of wine as well. I don't agree that it is pricey. If one wants "cheap" food, it's best to stick with processed burgers and fries and we have plenty of options for that in town. If you enjoy fresh vegetables and herbs and meats, then it's understood that the price will reflect that as well. We love Thai Essence!

Get the seafood dumplings that are only served at lunch

All meals are good though!

Aammaazziinngg!

My new favorite Thai place! I've been craving pad thai lately but the Thai place right on Purdue's campus is rather mediocre. Thankfully I found this place!! Their chicken pad thai was fantastic, and their thai tea was not overwhelmingly sweet. We also got chicken satay as an appetizer and the sauce was delicious. The service was great, and we sat at our table for about an hour after our meal just talking and I didn't feel pressured by staff to leave the way some restaurants kind of rush you out. This was an excellent experience and I will definitely be back!

Food has always been mediocre but acceptable (albeit rather overpriced) but after the owner/manager openly screamed at a diner last night I will certainly not be returning. Any restaurant that treats its patrons with such flagrant disrespect is not worth my money or my time, even if it is the only "Thai" food in town. If you want good Thai food and good service, find another town or learn to cook it yourself. I promise you the experience will be better.

The food here is pretty good, and the response to COVID-19 is the best I've seen yet around town. All employees wear masks, they take your credit card with a sanitized towel, ask you to sign with a pen that you then place in sanitizer, and you pick up the food from a side table. And the space is marked for proper spacing. Well done.

YUM!

Excellent Pad Thai Chicken and Pad Thai Shrimp!  Exceedingly attentive service!

If we lived in West Lafayette, we would be here weekly.

Food is pretty good but VERY PRICY. I would say the food is same quality with Basil at chauncey but at a much higher price point. Moreover, look at the mango sticky rice...its $7.95 and they gave me this..honestly, for $7.95 its pretty pathetic to be getting only 6 small pieces of mango. Overall, pretty disappointing. Rather go to Basil if im being honest.
Love the mango cashew fried rice. Only listed on the dinner menu, but staff gave for lunch when asked. Good portion size for a reasonable price and good atmosphere.

reviews.text: Husband ran in for pick up so I don't know what it's like inside, but as far as the food: Loved it! Everything felt so fresh and loved how it wasn't greasy at all. So yummy! Got the grilled steak burrito enchilada style and chicken salad. Guac was good too. Will be back!!

My boyfriend introduced me to this place once they opened back up after Covid shut down and let me tell you, SO GOOD! Their burritos and queso are addicting! I have only ever ordered to go, but the staff is always super friendly. Would recommend to anyone looking for a good meal.

The food is amazing! We usually get it once a week if we can. Couple that with the kindness the owners show, they are out there making the food, and they are very friendly. 

I usually get a barbacoa burrito with all the fixings and I barely need dinner afterwards. Even their vegetarian options are delicious!
Outstanding local burrito shop. Homemade tortillas and sauces. Would recommend their pork with Spivey sauce. I get the salad and it's one of my favorite meals on campus. Simple and good.
This place is the best! A must visit every time I am back in West Lafayette. The tortillas are incredible and fresh made.

My all-time favorite restaurant in West Lafayette!! A chill and comfortable atmosphere to catch up with friends! The cheese quesadilla is delicious even with nothing else on it. Try with a side of rice, mild salsa, and guac

I've been coming to this restaurant for years and have loved it every single time.  Try out a burrito with enchilada style!  They take a freshly made tortilla and stuff it full of a meat of your choice and any toppings that you want, then cover it in sauce.  I get this every time I come, and I've probably eaten here more than 100 times.  I've tried every meat selection for the burrito and they all taste good.  It's a testament to the quality that I've been to this restaurant so many times and have never once had a bad experience.

Also, yes, it is indeed a Mexican restaurant that is owned and operated by a Chinese family.  The food tastes great though!

The tortillas here are the closest that I've found to the ones at Cafe Rio. They are delicious! If they sold them separately, I would get a dozen to take home. (Hey, Fiesta Mexican Grill: You all should totally consider selling your tortillas a la carte!) 

In fact, my whole pork barbacoa burrito tasted quite a lot like the pork barbacoa burritos from Cafe Rio. So, if you're looking for a Cafe Rio substitute, this Mexican restaurant might fit the bill. 

The rice here is not my favorite, but it's not NOT good -- it just tastes like instant rice. They only have one type of rice option here (cilantro lime), but I wish they would consider also offering Mexican rice. 

The ordering system is set up like Chipotle, in that you tell them what you want (burrito, tacos, nachos or quesadilla), and then you can customize it however you want. Protein offered is shredded chicken, shredded beef, pork barbacoa, grilled chicken and grilled steak. You can also get your meal vegetarian (which does not come with a protein). 

Because this restaurant is located near Purdue University, it can get pretty busy with students filtering in and out. Also, there isn't much parking on the street. We ended up parking in the parking garage located across the street from the restaurant.

Oh my gosh the other reviews were absolutely right! I LOVE THE TORTILLAS! I've been here quite a few times. My go to is the salad. The portion is very generous! I always get steak. The meat is seasoned well and cooked to perfection. I would say this is a step above chipotle in my opinion! Not super authentic but still amazing. This is my favorite spot for lunch!

Good price.  Good food.  Friendly service.  Stopped by for a quick lunch.  Tortilla was fluffy and tasty.  Enchilada style burritoes were food and allowed us to eat civilized using fork and knife.  Sauces can be bit less salty for my taste but I guess they are typical level of salt.  We chose this place over Chipotle and we were glad (not to say Chipotle is bad).

The place was pretty dark and I personally did't really enjoy eating in the place. The food was okay and I always ordered the quesadilla with double steak on. I would pick a side of lettuce and sour cream. The lettuce was optional depending on if it is e-coli season or not. But overall, it is a decent place in Purdue area.

A lot of people love this spot, and I have to admit I don't understand why. I've been here probably 5 times now, and I don't really have any complaints about the food or service, but I also don't understand what makes it so special. Apparently they make their own tortillas, but they don't taste much different to me than the ones at other restaurants in town or even (sorry) at the grocery store. To me, it's very similar in taste (and price) to Chipotle, but I know that's an unpopular opinion locally.

I was disappointed in Fiesta. Maybe I was expecting too much from the high Yelp rating, or was it an off-day for the ingredients? I ordered one of the most popular items, the chicken burrito - enchilada style - with the cheese and sauce on top. To start, Fiesta makes their own tortillas in the store, cooked on a circular flat top. Pretty cool! The ingredients looked fresh, service was fast, and the staff were friendly. I stopped in for an early lunch, and by the time I left the line was 15+ deep. This place obviously has a following. 

The final product looked good but suffered from several problems. First, the tortilla was doughy. I don't know if it was undercooked or too thick, but it was like chewing a mushy washrag. Second, the rice was too wet, soaking the tortilla even more from the inside. Third, the chicken, beans, and rice filling were not hot enough. I ended up discarding the wet tortilla and scooping up the ingredients with my high-priced side order of chips.  I thought the Diet Coke was flat. Overall 2.5 stars.

What are best in class items here? If they can get the tortillas cooked right, I think that is a big draw, and the salsa is very fresh and tasty. The lettuce was good too. I'll give Fiesta another try sometime, but I won't go out of my way for a repeat visit.
Fiesta is my favorite restaurant in the Chauncey area. Cheap, fast, plenty of seating. Get your burrito enchilada-style or be surprised at how delicious the salads are.

This is hands down the best food near Purdue - these burritos (always enchilada style!) are to die for!! I always get mine with shredded beef, although I've heard all the fillings are great. You get a ton of food for a really reasonable price. Check this place out if you like amazing burritos!
LOOOOVE this place. Wish it was open in Sunday's, that's the day I always crave what I can't have!! Get your burrito enchilada style with a side of the ranch. TO. DIE. FOR.

I've been going to Fiesta Mexican grill every week for months now. The soft, chewy, made-right-before-your eyes fresh tortillas are to die for. I see a lot of the reviews recommending the burritos, but my favorite is ordering the salads because I love to savor every bite of the tortilla after I'm done. I have occasionally ordered their tortillas a la carte -- they're that good. Be sure to ask for a loyalty card at the checkout. After 5 purchases, you get a free drink. Five more purchases gets a free meal.

The service here is great.  They are friendly, efficient, and always get everything right.  I usually get one of the burritos enchilada style.  Their chips, guac., pico, are all excellent as well.  Good (and on the cheaper side), reliable, and a great location.

Nice and fast place to eat. Agree that tortillas are best I've had in long time. Portions are huge.  The salsa fresca with citrus twist was amazing. Service was friendly and fast and also took time to make sure we knew about all the additions possible to customize our burritos. Nice!
reviews.reviewerLocation: Town N Country Alliance, Tampa, FL

reviews.text: It's amazing how built up it is around Chauncey now at Purdue. I was in town recently for some meetings and met someone here for lunch. Great choice for quick, economical lunch on a college campus. I opted for a burrito smothered in sauce. Enjoyed every bite.
