reviews.text: We went for lunch at the Blue Nile prior to Thanksgiving break.  Restaurant was clean, with hand sanitizer at every table.  We ordered falafel as an appetizer, along with the Blue Nile Chicken and Beef Schwarma sandwiches.  Falafel was tasty and came with a light tahini sauce for dipping.  Both sandwiches came out hot, packed with meat, onions and tomato, in a grilled wrap;,each sandwich also came with a bag of potato chips.  Sandwiches tasted great and had a little spice to them (pickled onions?) - we'll be back to try some additional dishes.

LOVE blue Nile! The owner works very hard to make sure the experience is perfect. The hummus is always stellar. Chicken shawarma is a favorite. Also the shish tawook is a must try. I always look forward to dining here!

I really loved my experience there. We ordered an eggplant dish and the lamb biryani dish. The service was quick and very friendly and the food was served very fresh. The sauce on the dishes was well balanced and it dishes were pretty filling. They let is try a taste at their fresh stuffed grape leaves and those were fantastic too. Their lentil soup was also delish.

Overall a great experience and probably my favorite restaurant so far in LF/WL.

It looks like this is a one-person operation, so I'd definitely recommend phoning in your order. I walked in to order and no one ever came around, so I phoned in instead and waited. Aside from that, the food was delicious! They gave me generous portions of the combo meal and I honestly had food from them that lasted me a few days. The worker who assisted me was incredibly kind and hospitable. I highly recommend their massa platter and combo meal--all delicious!
Delicious food and wide selection- there's lots of good vegetarian options. The owner is also super friendly!

What a great little spot. The food was amazing! We ordered the fava beans dish and it was one of the best foods I've ever tasted. All of our meals were flavorful and the service was amazing. The portions were generous at a great price. Will definitely be getting food from them next time I'm in West Lafayette.

Extremely rude service! I ordered a biryani and a lentil soup to go as attached in the picture. I asked her while paying 'may I get some more soup?'. She said since this is a half order this I the amount we give. I said okay and ended the conversation. Then, from her side she said and I quote her' you get what you pay for, if you want more soup be ready to pay another 4$ for it'. Hearing her say this and bring up money I told her politely it doesn't matter giving a little extra soup if it satisfies the customer. And then she said it matters to us the quantity we give and told me we are happy to not serve customers who are unsatisfied. I said then 'okay thank you, maybe I will not come back ' again in a polite way. I left and she came outside the restaurant while I was going toward my car and said' it will be our honor not to serve you'.

This is an extremely bad service and impolite behavior. I hope this review gets shared and this person realizes how rude she is! Being kind is the first we learn as a child and teach our kids. I think she needs a lesson on that.

This place is so cute and the service is awesome. The man serving our table was very kind. There were disinfectant wipes at each table and the restaurant overall was very clean. The food was really good too!!

This is my absolute favorite restaurant! I've come so often, the owner knows me by name. He is so friendly and truly knows the meaning of hospitality. The Lamb Biryani and Chicken Shawarma platters are my favorite, but I normally get the half portion because the portion sizes are so large! And of course, you have to start off with hummus with pita bread. The best Mediterranean restaurant I've ever been to, hands down!

Great food and service.  Sorry for that old half-order person, but our experience was great.  Egg plant, beef kabab, fava, etc were tasty.  Both Jewish and Arab style salads were excellent.  Falafal was on the salty side.  Nice little place for dinner.

1. Amazing service! The gentleman who helped me was so gracious. He made some recommendations and I decided to try something new (Mazaa Platter). Delicious food and I left feeling like that one experience made my day.

I've been here a couple times now. The food is really good. They have vegan options. Sorry no pictures, I forgot to take. I had a falafel sandwich the other day. It comes with a small bag of ruffles. I wish they put more tomatoes on it, but oh well. I'll go back.

Really good choice if you are open to try something new and Mediterranean. Family run restaurant at a relatively hard to find location in west Lafayette. Interior could be a bit updated. Visited on a weekend; probably explains why there weren't anybody at the front desk to take us to seating; had to wait a bit longer than the time I would prefer. But, we go to a restaurant and if the food is food and place place is clean, it is easy bear all other issues. And yes, the food is good and authentic. Worth trying if you are around- you won't be disappointed.

Easily some of the best Mediterranean food we've had. The lentil soup was super-flavorful, and the hummus was perfectly spiced. I suppose if you're going to have a restaurant like this, your hummus game had better be strong, and theirs is! 

Our awesome server was super accommodating to a large party with a bunch of kids, and I'm pretty sure everybody left happy. I'd go out of my way to stop here again.

I've come here several times in the past few months and ordered the lamb biryani each time. It is always delicious hot, and fresh. The lamb is tender and and the rice is the perfect amount of spicy. If you prefer you can also get the dish with chicken. 

The staff are friendly and accommodating and the prices are great. Many foods come with the option of a half portion for a lower price, and honestly that has always been more than enough food for me (the attached photo is actually after I've eaten about half)

Can't wait to come back soon!
Decent food, rude staff. Mandatory "gratuity charge" is insulting.
best service of any restaurant i have ever been to. we cleared all the plates EASILY as the food was to die for. we will definitely be back as long as we are in WL

I almost never have Middle Eastern food, but my friends and I were in the mood to try something completely new and expand our horizons. We found this place by chance and decided to give it a chance after seeing other positive reviews. 

The place was much different than I expected on the inside. The decor was really interesting and aesthetically please. It was incredibly clean as well. Our waitress was really nice and friendly. She was also quite fast with taking out order and getting us our food. 

I started out with the lentil soup. I had never had anything like it before, but it was very good. I saved most of it to use as a palate cleanser when the spice of my main course started to overwhelm me. I would recommend trying it. It's finely pureed and has an interesting flavor.

My main course was the chicken biryani. I did really enjoy it, even though the spice was a bit much for me at times (tag in the lentil soup). I wish there had been more chicken. It was seasoned and cooked perfectly. There was a ton of rice that wasn't anything to write home about. 

I would definitely say it's worth a try. I enjoy trying something new and out of the ordinary, so this was a great choice for a random dinner.
It's a simple place tucked away from the others with delicious food. I'm almost afraid to let the news out, but they make the best falafel I've ever had.

I am very upset I have to give this heartbreaking review to one of my previous top Purdue area restaurant.  Tonight's dinner ruined my day. If it is possible I will give negative infinite.

Food:2 star. Taste Met my expectation. But could be better.  More Serious problem is, three of us who ordered lamb kebab, had diarrhea problem after dinner. 

Price: 2 star, overpriced and couldn't tell the difference between a half/full size of hummus regarding the serving size.

Service: Negative 100.  The lady who served us dinner tonight was extremely rude and unprofessional. The were more than 4 (usually it would be 6 for other restaurant)of us, for sure she could get guaranteed 18% gratuity. Probably that's why we were treated like that. I, politely, asked her how long our food will take for coming, after 30mins wait, she rolled her eyes in my face. Interesting reaction. . Technically speaking, I don't think we did anything wrong or treated her in a unfair standing. We were being polite and patient meanwhile she made us feel we own her 10000 grants.

reviews.text:
I cannot get enough of this restaurant. From the outside, it's an unassuming hole-in-the-wall kind of place on the corner of Main and 6th downtown, but hold your judgment and be prepared to be wowed. They've opened during the past year when between-table barriers became standard. So I don't know if they were planning originally to make the section dividers that they've ended up with or if they were a response to Covid, but either way, they're tasteful and artsy. In fact, the entire place has an artistic flair that combines original Japanese culture with a modern Japanese pop approach to style. From the low stools (which are great and much more comfy than they look), to the artwork on the walls, to even the decor and design of the bathrooms, someone has put a lot of thought into the overall vibe and it shows. A fantastic atmosphere.

Now for the best part...the food. My top recommendations are:
1. I canNOT get enough of they're spicy miso ramen. If you're not a fan of heat, just get the regular miso ramen. It has all of the flavor without the kick. The meat is my favorite part, but the eggs are a close second. I have no idea how they pack this much taste into one bowl. It's unreal.
2. The gyoza. It's like a chicken-pork pot sticker. VERY delicious and a fantastic appetizer!
3. The mochi ice cream. It's like ice cream with a soft chewy outside. Hard to describe, easy to eat. I've had the strawberry, and it's worth it.

Overall, a very solid lunch or dinner location. It's informal enough to meet here for a lunch with a friend but would be just as well suited to a Friday night date spot!

I absolutely love this spot. The ramen was divine and the customer service was exceptional.

Due to COVID-19, it may have been a little slower, but the quality was not impacted whatsoever. Highly recommend!'
This is such a good place to eat out. Even with the Covid conditions, it's delicious and the presentation was astonishing. I got pork ramen and the flavor was great. Definitely recommend!

I have come to this restaurant at least once a week for the last 3 months. I was removed from the restaurant today for asking someone in their tiny lobby to use a mask. If you are worried about your safety do not go here. I am sad to say I will never go here again.

Got spicy veggie ramen and it was delicious! It was one of the most savory vegan dishes I've had. The first time I got this the noodles were green in the veggie ramen and I didn't like the taste or texture very much. Last time I went I asked for the regular noodles and it was fantastic.
Always love this place. I've never been disappointed here and love bringing people that are visiting from out of town. This is the perfect place to bring ramen first timers!

A gem among downtown Lafayette's restaurants. It has a relaxed atmosphere and a truly welcoming feel. Plenty of options to choose from, including choices for those who are vegan and gluten free. The saké list is impressive and all choices are delicious. My favorite ramen is the volcano ramen with added chili oil. The menu has many options to choose from and are all delicious and authentic. If you haven't eaten here, it is for sure worth the stop!

Truly a great find while you were camping at a nearby state park! Fair prices and tons of food. All of our children loved it -Which I should let you know that they have some thing for everyone-and our kids vary in age from 7-12! The mini bottles of sake were a really nice touch and the Decor  makes for a really nice dining experience. If we're ever in the area again we will definitely eat here!
Been here a lot since it has gotten cold. Best ramen place in the Greater Lafayette Area. I've been everywhere for ramen on the west coast. Yatagarasu is on my top 5 list of best ramen.

One of the best places to go eat ramen in Lafayette. I love all the options they have for their different types of ramen. The only thing that has consistently happened that I am not a fan of is when I ask for a certain ingredient be taken out, it still comes in the food. This has happened multiple times, but other than that, the food is really delicious and I really enjoy it. I also love the atmosphere of the restaurant and how it's laid out.

Great atmosphere, get eat service, great food! Definitely a place to check out if you're looking for something new to try or live ramen. Flavors were complex and delicious. The amount of food for the price is also great. I'll definitely be going back!

Fantastic. My son and I stopped in after a quick run up to West Lafayette without the wife so we could try new stuff. Man did I enjoy. I had the Miso Spicy Ramen. Just enough heat but not too much. My son had the Paitan Spicy Ramen. A little more heat than mine but I personally liked the flavor more. 
Definitely recommend this place. Good service from a friendly staff.

The food was alright. Honestly though them chairs are weak asl. I do not suggest going and eating inside the restaurant. You are more likely to be comfortable if you walk 100 feet to the nearest park bench near the restaurant.

A friend told that Lafeyette had great Ramen and I made it a point to drop by to test it out if I ever passed by. I did and my friend was right! Yatagarasu has Ramen that can compete with the big cities.

Ramen 5/5 -  Black Garlic Tonkotsu Ramen. The broth were excellent with the intense garlic kick infused into the deep, creamy and smoky flavors from the long hours of extracting it from the bones. 

Interior 5/5 - Love the chic brick and timber interior, very rustic and raw feel.

Staff 5/5 - Quick efficient service with a smile. 

Price 4/5 - A little dear for the Ramen, but the lunch meal with a drink and side dish for $15 redeems it a little.

Parking 5/5 - plenty of free parkings outside. Rather pay for food not parking!
Been here twice! I've really enjoyed how they prep their take out! The spicy Miso is delicious! :)
Fantastic!!! The Best Ramen I've had around the region. Good portion, amazing taste, and the owner and servers are very nice!!! Will definitely come back again!!

I cannot explain to you how good this place is, but I'll try. I just moved here a couple months ago from Virginia and though I'm from the Midwest originally, three years in the south has made me weak to these winters again. Cold Novembers mean solid ramen is a must and Yatagarasu did NOT disappoint.

My brother and I had the Fried Calamari and Chicken Karaage (not pictured because we got too excited). The seasoning in the breading was impeccable and the sauce for the karaage had such a nice zest to it. The crunch was so solid that it tasted good even to the ears.

We both got the chicken ramen as our main bowl. My brother asked for "some tofu" but our server, Bailey, heard "sub tofu" (my brother's mistake, not Bailey's). Bailey was quick to get the original helping of chicken for the ramen and was so sincere about the miscommunication even though it totally wasn't his fault!
I opted to get a bunch of extras because I'm a man who needs spice, and the chili oil and paste did not disappoint. The broth mixed with the chili was unbelievable. I felt so warm you'd think it was summer. Excellent flavor in the veggies, noodles had the perfect chew, and the chicken was so tender. If it isn't obvious to you yet, this was the best ramen I've ever had. (My brother, though Yelp-less, also agrees.)

We thought we were done, but the allure of strawberry mochi was too much to resist, so we caved. I didn't expect to enjoy such a cold treat in November but after all of the savory flavors in the ramen, the chilled sweetness was extremely refreshing. 15/10 mochi. Might even have to go back tomorrow for it.

Bailey, if you're reading this, you're the man. Also, to all the kitchen staff at Yatagarasu, thank you. Seriously. This meal was a gift.

It was decent. Atmosphere was cool... service was eh. My daughter didn't like it and tried maybe a bite... needless to say it probably should have been discounted but wasn't even offered, hence there is your tip...

We love ramen. Every time we travel new cities, we always stop by ramen place. This is a hidden gem in Lafayette area. We were so surprised the fact that we haven't come this place for the last two years. We just underestimated for some reason. However, this place got us! We planned to try all the manus this Summer! One thing to improve is the cutting direction of lemon in fried calamari in my picture. This cutting direction makes us harder to squeeze properly. You can find easily from Google search.

I've been here about five times now, and I've got to say, it's so nice to have some authentic ramen in Lafayette. I first started to really get into ramen this summer while I was living in Dallas, Texas and ramen places were a dime a dozen. Lafayette, however, doesn't have as many options. Luckily, Yatagarasu is a solid choice. 

My go-to order is the miso ramen. Simple, but delicious. It's savory and hearty while not overbearing. The pork is tender and moist, and I just wish there was more of it. I love the inclusion of a soft boiled egg. It adds to the depth of flavor. 

The other stand-outs here are the small plates. We usually order 2-3 of them as appetizers. The star, for me, are the crispy Brussels sprouts. They're, as the name implies, crispy, with a nice sprinkling of salt and other seasoning. 

Prices are pretty decent here. Ramen runs around $13, but it's a generous serving. 

Service is good, and there have only been a couple occasions where the food seemed to take a while. 

Overall, if you're a ramen fan, and you're in the Purdue/Lafayette area, I have no problems recommending this location.

Photo of Christos  - West Lafayette - West Lafayette, IN, United States. All the yum! Breakfast all day!

reviews.text: My daughter and I had Brunch here for the first time. Seated quickly.  Seats were well spaced.Very nice atmosphere.  Noted that someone was consistently cleaning and spraying tables and seats. Daughter ordered French toast with strawberries on the side, . I ordered big breakfast included scrambled eggs , hash browns, bacon, toast. We cross shared our orders. I ordered coffee it was strong but I did enjoy it. Just what I needed to wake up.The waitress saw we were sharing and brought extra plates. She went above and beyond. Will definitely eat here again.

One of the best West Lafayette dining options serving all day breakfast on a huge menu, wonderful value, enticing options with Mediterranean flair and popular American grill eats, friendly staff, and classically modern atmosphere. Us eight hungry guys dropped in a bit late, were reminded we needed to order as they closed at 9:00, still managed a great time with all of our picks finding the pasta almost hilariously piled high, burgers actually two hands, and I went for the hero quesadilla appetizer thinking my two tacos would be the usual tiny amount of food. But happily my two shells were stuffed full of Chipotle sauce ripe for a filling meal. These local family restaurants can easily be overlooked due to popular chains offering predictable menus but I am very thankful to recommend Christos as well and above all the usual national restaurants in the area for value, variety, and an overall excellent time despite an early closing time.

Not the best wine selection in town, but absolutely the best gyros in all the land!

This is a full service restaurant, but I only have eyes for the gyros.

Ambiance is cool & chic; the gyros will keep you from having to run back to Chicago every time the craving strikes.

Worth a trip! I recommend you see what else they have besides gyros, but as for me, I have an addiction to feed...

I've been here several times over the years. Christos is never a first choice destination for me, but if someone else suggests it, I'm fine going along. At three stars, "A-OK" is a positive and acceptable rating. So go visit for any meal of the day and enjoy, chances are highly likely you'll have good food and catch good vibes from the pies and ambiance. Christos has a "we're a small restaurant group but we're not really a chain" independent feel.

I think it's annoyingly loud in this restaurant, depending on where you are seated. I was in a booth near the back last time and it was fine, until others were seated around us. At that point it felt like we were inside of a megaphone. So is it bad acoustics or do I just get seated near loud talkers all the time, or do I have sensory overload disorder? Not sure. The service was good. My gluten-free friend really enjoyed the bunless burger, which was cooked perfectly and seasoned well. I found the fish tacos OK but not stellar. The fries were done but were almost colorless; another 30-60 seconds in the fryer would've crisped them up.

I've been here several times so I won't rate Christos on today's visit only.  Christos has a large facility that moves a lot of customers quickly.  The staff is always professional and friendly.  The facilities are clean while bring a bit dated.

Christos has a large menu which gives all you discriminating diners choices.  That's one of their assets.  All items are good.  Breakfast is a good choice.

Today I had the Ranchers Breakfast.  The eggs were eggs while the bacon was slightly crisp and soft.  Both are typically of breakfast diners.  My choice came with sausage gravy and biscuits.  The biscuit was served as a whole biscuit - most serve cut in half.  The gravy was poured over the top so you really couldn't the biscuit open.  The biscuit was slightly dry.  The gravy was salty and had very little sausage accent.  Overall the gravy was rather bland.

I've done take out and dined in.  

Did a take out in the weekend for lunch and cake in for breakfast on the weekend as well.

This place is always busy and packed with people and I now know why.

Portions are generous service is fast the pace is clean and the building is conveniently located on sagamore.

I will continue to come back and try more of the menu and those delish pies!

The ambiance is classic diner nothing fancy or over the top but this location is fairly new and the condition o the furniture and flooring etc is good.

Christos is a great choice when everyone wants to eat something different. They have a good variety of menu items, and breakfast is available all day.

I almost always order the Gyro Breakfast Skillet. It's basically a deconstructed gyro on a bed of potatoes and topped with two eggs. It's a very filling meal and great any time of the day! My son tried out their Chorizo Burger. It was so large that he had a hard time fitting it into his mouth. He ordered chicken noodle soup as his side, and the rest of the table wished they had ordered some.

Our server was very friendly and upbeat, stopping by many times to make sure we had everything we needed. 

They have a tempting selection of desserts in the front case, but we are always too full to try any. 

Christos is always a solid choice, anytime of the day.

What a great restaurant. Had the gyro quesadilla which was so delicious, we considered ordering another one before the meal. BBQ chicken salad and chicken souvlaki were outstanding. Had carrot cake and cheesecake which were both melt in your mouth delicious. Definitely recommend. Ask for Manolli....he is super friendly.

Been here an hour still no food .... this is a false wait because tables were open  so apparently someone didn't staff apparently I was told that the kitchen was backed up so guess what We can see you are under staffed  or didn't plan .

We come to this family-owned place often because customer service is best in town as well as the food.  Their weekend menu offers a bbq pork skillet i quite like, 4 dollar mimosas, and excellent potatoes and french toast.  We have a baby and they always help us with that, which we really appreciate.

I have been going here for many years. Always good food and service.  My favorite has to be the breakfast food.  I like the Tex Mex omelette. Hash browns are crispy and good as well.  However, their menu is very diverse and has lots of options.  I would recommend going early on the weekends as it does get very busy.

This is hands down my favorite, go-to restaurant in West Lafayette. I lived nearby for years before finally trying it once and now I go there pretty much weekly. It's got a great casual but nice atmosphere, friendly and attentive staff, and is always clean and efficiently run. It's great at any time of day and they serve breakfast all day. Favorites include the rancher's breakfast, triple double, the turkey club, their fries and their mashed potatoes. Taco salad ("broken taco") is also pretty excellent. Give it a chance and Christos can be your Sunday "I woke up at noon" brunch spot, your Monday "I'm too tired to cook" spot, and more. Last but not least, try the pie.

Bacon smelled and tasted terrible, blueberry pancakes were gross, and the hashbrowns were the absolute fucking worst... greasy and had a nasty buttery taste but everything was bland overall! So disappointed. Won't be back here again.

What the heck!  The food was cold.  When we mentioned it, they took it back and microwaved it.  I have never been to any restaurant where all of the food came cold.  Then microwaving.....  We could have made better food at home.  I just couldn't believe it!  I felt responsible for everyone's poor meal, too, since I was the one that suggested the restaurant.

Christos never disappoints. It's nice to have a family owned establishment that updates its menu and appreciates their customers.  Enjoyed the  mimosas with our French Double Double and Freddy the Butcher brunch last weekend. Thank you!

I visit this restaurant (either the one in Lafayette or West Lafayette) every couple of months. It has such a diverse menu there's always something for everyone's flavor. The service and food are always consistently good. I don't think I've really ever had a meal I haven't liked. I would definitely recommend it - for couples, families, or large groups.

I love this place!!! This is my first time going and the pancakes are phenomenal. I also am a huge fan of oatmeal and tend to be harsh in my judgings of it but the oatmeal here was so good that I got a container for my left over oatmeal. With that in mind I do think that it needs to have different sizes for its oatmeal. This is with added milk, cinnamon and sugar, and cranberries. It had a nice consistency and it didn't feel as though it was over or undercooked. You could also choose to add pecans but I left those out. So I definitely recommend this place if not for their pancakes, for their Oatmeal

Checked this place out for dinner based on the positive reviews. We had great service - thank you Emma - and the food was very good. We had the chicken fried chicken and the pork grilled cheese. Perfectly cooked chicken, great waffle fries. Will definitely go again!

The West Side Christos has become one of my favorite restaurants in the Greater Lafayette area.  I'd visited both Christos a few times in the past and thought they were OK, but the last several months I've been really digging this place.  Clean restaurant, fast and friendly service, a diverse menu and generous portions at a fair price.  Pretty much everything I've tried has been solid, but their burgers are my favorite in the area; flame-grilled, big and juicy.  Their gyros are also top notch.  Their Thursday special chimichanga is tasty and a lot of food.  This might be one to share or save the other half for dinner.  I look forward to trying the rest of the menu!
Came in this evening and Kennedy was our sever! Amazing food and service!! Thank you for a great meal out. Full bellies all around.

reviews.text:
Will you understand why you went here? Probably not. Will you be glad you did though? Absolutely. 

Famous Frank's is the best place to go after a night out at Purdue. They arrive at around 11PM outside Rawles facing Harry's. The menu consists of every possible type of fried food mixed into glorious sandwiches. Alternatively, they have traditional stand alone options like mozzarella sticks and chicken fries. My personal favorite is the Fat Boy. 

If you go out on campus, Famous Frank's is a must-try tradition. One thing to be aware of - there is a $10 credit card minimum. So either be very hungry or bring cash!

This place is one of a kind and something I wish we had on my college campus! Think of all the great, fried salty appetizers you want after a night out and then imagine it on a sandwich. It's delicious and everything you need after a couple drinks (or if you're like me, good for any time).

After hearing many rave reviews from friends that went to Purdue, I had to make a detour when I visited West Lafayette for a wedding near campus before going back to our hotel and I wasn't disappointed. I spoke with the owner who said him and his sons work the truck. He was really friendly and you could tell right away that he takes a lot of pride in his business.

For food, I went with the fat rooster (SO GOOD) and got a side of ranch to dip my crinkle cut fries in (yum). Famous Franks is a cool, different kind of place and definitely worth making a stop if you're in the area.

Best drunk food ever. Usually some food tastes delicious only when you're drunk but this is different, it's delicious even when you are sober. The best part about this food truck is that they accept credit cards now. I used to hate it when they only accepted cash because I never have cash on me.
My favorite is the Fat Boy- hotdog bun with fries, mozzarella sticks, chicken fingers, ranch and pizza sauce. It's heaven in mouth. Everything I have tried here is delicious. I would consider this place a little expensive but who cares about it when you're drunk.
The line can get pretty crazy even when it's freezing outside. They try to get the food to you as soon as they can.

This is my friend group's go-to place for food after a night of drinking. The truck is located between Rawls Hall and Harry's and usually has a decent line. They accept credit cards for orders more than $10. The food is a little bit expensive for what you get, but considering they're open really late, I don't mind the cost.

I usually get the mozzarella sticks, which are pretty standard but delicious, as mozz sticks are. This weekend I got the fat fingers, which are egg rolls with cheese and pepperoni inside. They were pretty greasy and I prefer the mozz sticks, but they're interesting and tasty. The food here is pretty greasy and messy, but that's part of the late-night appeal.

Let me just say that Famous Franks is the best late night food option! Their chicken fingers are a great bang for your buck! The 3 nice gentlemen (on 5/12 shoutout AJ) were so kind and helpful! Such a great taste and helpful for the morning hangover! Thanks for your great service!

If you're looking for the greasiest, messiest, most heart attack inducing thing to eat after a crazy night out at one of Purdue's four campus bars, Franks is the place for you! The "fat boy" was a staple for me throughout my junior and senior years of college. Mozzarella sticks, chicken fries, French fries, marinara sauce and cheese all stuffed into a hotdog bun?! I don't know how these guys come up with their menu items, but they somehow manage to create some pretty amazing combinations. This is not something I would ever eat sober, but at 3am after a few long islands it definitely hits the spot! Also, they now accept credit cards which is a plus!

You will give the cashier a $20 bill and he will give you change back as if you gave him a 10$. Watch out the cashier will take advantage of the fact that you are drunk and try to give you less change.....He tried to pull this off on me twice.

Famous franks is the bomb.com. Everything I've ever had has been the most delicious food I've ever had while inebriated. Recommendations: fat whitey, angus grilled cheese, fat girl, fat frank. Just get it, you'll love it.

If you're drunk and looking for a place to chow down in West Lafayette, Franks is your best bet. Their target market is obviously the bar crowd since they are only around from 11pm-3am Thursday-Saturday. Most menu items consist of a pile of fried food on a bun (mozz sticks, fries, cheese steak, etc). This place usually has a solid crowd of sloshed sorority girls and balance impaired bar rats which is a major part of the charm in my opinion.

This is the best place to eat right after your long night at the bars. The food has just the right amount of grease to hit the spot. Its also light on the wallet. I recommend the Bacon Dog. I would never have ordered a hotdog wrapped in bacon, but I'm glad that I did.

I have been a huge fan of the Chili Cheese dog for years. Yes it's simple but simply the BEST!!!!  They put the cheese under the chili so it melts. However recently they added a crackhead grilled cheese.  OMG. I may have a new favorite.  It's cheap, huge and oh so delicious. Tip:  you will need both hands. Try it and enjoy.

reviews.text: Still the best Korean BBQ around campus. The unlimited is the best way to go. It's a fair price for unlimited, and for sure worth it. Every time I come here, it's consistently great.

The food was great but the services are not the best. An asian fusion restaurant with amazing beef options. I got the mongolian beef, bulgogi, and kimchi tofu soup. The mongolian beef was amazing, full of flavor, tender, and juicy. The bulgogi was good but it was too dry for my taste. I'm not a fan of their kimchi tofu soup because I believe that it needs more seasoning. They were good tho.
However, the server did not have the energy we would want to see... He looks really bored and wish that he could be anywhere but there, but maybe it was his off day? I just hope that they will serve their customers with more friendliness.

So Gaza has integrated with Xin and it looks like they might have sushi in the future?? I gave this place a second chance because my boyfriend and I were really craving Korean BBQ. I'm so glad I did! The service was a lot better this time around. 

We went there for an early dinner on a Tuesday afternoon, so it wasn't really busy. The waitress was very attentive and polite. We opted for the unlimited bbq.  We tried the garlic beef, bulgogi, and beef brisket.  All were really good! I especially liked the beef brisket, because it was a really good cut; there wasn't a whole lot of fat on it like at other Korean bbq places. 

The orange sauce that is served with your meal is so tasty and compliments all the meats! I asked the waitress what it was and she wasn't sure BUT said it was made in house! I loved it.  I also really enjoyed the sides that were included: broccoli, fish cake, potato salad, kimchi, and some sort of beans. 

Again, I'm glad I decided to try this place again. I'll definitely be back!

For rural Indiana, this place isn't bad as far as Korean BBQ goes. We came in on a busy Sunday night and got the unlimited KBBQ for $25 a person with an automatic 18% tip (though it's $20 if you go on certain weekdays). There was an air duct so the smell did not disseminate as much, and the meat was soaked in some delicious sweeter bulgogi type sauce. We got the pork belly, bulgogi, and garlic beef, and like the bulgogi the best. However, the service took forever, especially considering the 18% tip, and we were left waiting for minutes on end for simple things like re-lighting our grill or getting extra rice. Given that this is one of the (if not the) only kbbq restaurants in town, it'll do for now.
Fantastic authentic food. Great service. Will come back and food coma again. Get the all you can eat btw it is totally worth it.
Very very good food. The tabletop grills that allow you to cook your own food are nice. For what you're paying for, you get a lot. Awesome food, good pricing, 10/10 definitely going again.

I really wanted to like this place given the fact that my friends and I love Asian cuisine as well as unique experiences like K-BBQ. Sadly, that wasn't the case here. We wanted to give this place a really fair shot, so we came on a Wednesday at 5:30pm. We figured it would be dead and were correct with only 2 other small groups in the entire restaurant. We all got the basic unlimited which states you have 2 hours at the front but not on the menu (pretty standard time limit). We got the standard start of kimchi, rice, and sauces after our order while we awaited the meat to arrive. We sampled every pork and beef option which is quite a variety of traditional as well as marinated cuts. The food tasted great, and we were having a great time. At the 1 hour mark our server vanished while we waited for him to return to order more. 30 minutes went by (1/4 of our limit) before he finally came back. By the time he came back after our order we were cut off as our time limit was about to expire. We were thinking at 25$ (20 + gratuity) we would be full and content, but we barely had the amount of ordering off the menu. I certainly will not come back ever again as it was a waste of money and felt taken advantage by the "rules" and the establishment

Visiting in West Lafayette and came here for lunch. Being from the NYC area the fact that this place does all you can eat Korean BBQ for $20 blew me away! Not sure if it's because it's a Sunday or because the area itself isn't overly busy, but we were the only table seated. We ordered the pork belly, brisket, baby octopus, blazing chicken, pork butt and garlic beef (SO much food!) you get all the traditional side dishes like kimchi, broccoli, sweet cold mash, rice, etc. Our server was friendly and attentive. My favorite was prob the fact that they give you a DELICIOUS probiotic yogurt once you've finished your meal. It was honestly so refreshing and a nice way to cleanse the pallet.

Dropped the man child off at camp and I was feeling the blues. My husband speaks my love language really, really well and brought me here to get the meat sweats. =]

All you can eat Korean Barbecue for not too expensive at all.

The service was super sweet and food was quite tasty.
I love cooking at my own table. 
You get to choose from two options. Option #1 is 35.00 per person and you get the finer choices of meat. But keep in mind you also have to order off the Option #2 menu which is less finer, I suppose. 25.00 per person. We actually ate off of the Option #2 menu because the meat is delicious and just fine enough. ^_~ Both menus come with banchan and lettuce for wraps. Of course rice and little sauces. 

I really had a great experience here. Three stars you question? Well. Three stars isn't bad. It's actually good. But. The bathroom wasn't horrible- definitely could have a better sense of "clean". AND... pet peeve alert... They add the tip to your total. I understand why they would see the need. They are within a college town and with college towns come broke college kids. But had they not done so they would've gotten a much better tip from us than 18% and another star...

For a small town restaurant, it's as good as it gets :) The price is right for the unlimited korean bbq. To make this a 5 star for me, maybe a little bit more attention from the servers since they impose the 18% tip on you. I've been there twice, and both times we had to wait for someone to pass by for a while because the fire went off because the gas tank was empty. The pan needs to be changed more often too. Garlic beef tasted the same as the bulgogi. and maybe more side dishes, they only give you about 5.

This maybe my 2nd most favorite all you can eat place next to FoGo de Chao despite their inadequacies because of the price. Just set your expectation to the above and you'll be alright.

Second time attending this restaurant only because food was good. Service lacked during first visit and we were disappointed yet again this visit. As you can see in the receipt we were charged for weekend price on a weekday(7/9/20 Thursday). The price is clearly different on their menu and no where was it posted or mentioned to be different. We said something to Steph our waitress and her response was, "Right now we're charging all meals at weekend price.". This would've been nice to know before being lured in for a weekday meal. Couldn't call to confirm because no phone number posted works for this business. Steph confirmed she would refill my water during the meal, yet I ended the meal with an empty glass that was never filled again after being brought to me. Our table asked for the other sides/veggies that traditionally come with the meal and Steph didn't know what we were referring to. She looked over her shoulder at the other diners and asked if we were talking about what they had..yes we were. Then she said they're actually out of that along with multiple other meats we requested with our meal. All this said, food is good when you can get your full meal that you pay for. Don't expect good service or accurate pricing.
No longer have the eel dish so I don't go here anymore. Very disappointing menu change. Other items I've had here are good but nothing special.

This is one of my favorite places to eat in West Lafayette. While I cannot compare it to Korean Grills in bigger cities, the meat is still quite delicious. For a while, I used to get the unlimited option, about $25/person... but be careful! It can be a little too much! Nowadays I order my meats individually, about $10 each. I usually get the Garlic Beef, Bulgogi (a little more than $10 but so worth it) and the Beef Brisket. If you get the grill option, you HAVE to try these! Each order for the grill comes with a bowl of rice, this amazing sauce that I would recommend mixing into your rice, and an assortment of sides such as fish cakes, pickles, broccoli, edamame, and a couple more. I don't remember because I always leave room for my meat! I haven't tried their main dishes which I've heard are good, but I suggest grilling if you do. 

Parking: Big parking lot outside 

Price: I usually end up spending around $20, but you can definitely get away with less. 

Speed/Service: If you're grilling, they'll bring out the meat right away and they're attentive to when you need to change your grill plate. Plenty of seating available!

Great food!!!
Service is a bit slow since only two are serving, they are pretty impatient to finish serving and didn't leave me a pen for signature, after we asked they for a pen, they dropped it on the ground and just left it as it was.
But the taste is pretty amazing and the price is reasonable!
Sit here for 30 mins no one speak a word to you. And left. This place never changed for its poor service over the past years.

The place was clean but I wasn't impressed with the meat cuts (all fat and very little flavor) and sauce selection- only had two sauces and both were similar. Had to ask for a drink refill, the glass for my beer wasn't chilled or cold, and had to ask for a grill change (took a while for the waiter to come by). Staff didn't check on us- had to grab someone as they raced by. Didn't seem like they had a veggie plate and the AYCE Menu was really lacking.

Third time here.  We had the unlimited grill. The meat was fatty and bland.  The "grills" are a hot plate over gas flame.  Very little banchan accompanied the meat.  Service was non attentive.  We never saw our server again after the first serving so never got to order more "unlimited grill".  Pricey too $24 each + 18% gratuity.   Galbi not included.   No thanks.

bad attitude. I took an order from RICEPO and the food was not delivered after one hour and a half. It shows that the food is in prepared. I call the restaurant and they really have bad attitude and yell at me. I have no idea why they did this, the could explain to me. Do not go to this restaurant.

Very Poor Service! As loyal customers, consumers BE AWARE!
Would've given my experience zero stars if I could. Came in as a party of four and we were seated by a very rude waiter with red hair and thin eyebrows. When it came time for the bill, they charged us an automatic gratuity of 18%. On the menu, it clearly indicates that a gratuity charge will only be applied if there is a party of 6 or more. When we brought this to our waitress' attention, she was very abrasive in her response. She questioned our manners, said that this "policy" has been in effect for a month while we had dined multiple times in the last month, always tipping well over 20% each visit. Even if this policy is new, and the menu has not been updated then it is your job as a waitress to let customers know of this "policy" before being seated. Overall, she was extremely rude and unapologetic. She even went as far to ask if she did not deserve a tip. How unprofessional and distasteful. WILL NEVER RETURN.

We ate one evening with friends but were in a hurry. Everyone enjoyed their meal. Great service. Portions a bit small but probably what we should be eating! A couple next to us was cooking on the table grill and that looked fun so my husband and I cans back and tried that. We both enjoyed the experience and food tasted great. Service was once again great.

reviews.text: Really good experience here! They were the safest restaurant I've been to in terms of COVID rules. All of the food was amazing, and although it is on the pricier side, the portions are very fair. I highly recommend the crab cakes and the creme brûlée.

Upping this to 5 stars since this has been one of our favorite and most consistent restaurants for takeout during the COVID-19 situation. We really appreciate that, unlike some other places, they've continued doing contactless curbside pickup, even after they reopened their dining room. Some of the dishes we've had and really enjoyed this summer include the pecan crusted trout, the mushroom cavatappi in marsala cream sauce, the burrata caprese salad and the french onion burger. I like that they change their menu seasonally because most other restaurants around here don't, and even great menus get boring when they've been offering the exact same food for years. It's definitely pricey for the area (entrees, especially ones containing seafood, can be $30+) but the food puts them up there among the best restaurants in greater Lafayette.

I'm kind of torn between 4 and 5 stars but am erring on the side of generosity primarily because I think restaurants should be supported in these Covid-19 times and Bistro 501 deserves special mention for having curbside no-contact pickup, which not all restaurants do. The food is also excellent-- the French Onion burger, which is what I always get when my wife and I visit our daughter and her family and get food from here, may very well be the best hamburger I have eaten in Lafayette. 

There are two reasons, though, that I am a little ambivalent about giving 5 stars. The first is the fairly skimpy menu, at least as far as I am concerned. The primary reason that I always get the French Onion burger is that there really aren't any other entrees that I like all that much. There are nine entree items, only two of which involve red meat (I'm a carnivore); the other items include seafood, vegetarian, and chicken or hen selections. The other meat item, filet mignon, looks good, but I'm not about to pay 44 dollars for a steak.  

And that brings me to the second reason: the prices. 18 dollars for a burger? That seems kind of ridiculous, given that this restaurant is in Lafayette, Indiana, not New York City. It is, as I noted above, a first-rate burger, but I don't really believe it's worth 18 bucks. 

Bottom line: very good food and a nice place to patronize if you're nervous about eating out or having contact with strangers, but meat eaters may find the pickings a bit slim and I'm not sure the quality of the food justifies the prices. A great place to eat, though, if you're looking for a special treat, trying to impress a date or are taking a job candidate out to dinner.

Literally the best food I've had in the Lafayette area! The atmosphere here is excellent and the food and service are really superb. It's pricier but you get what you pay for here. Definitely an elegant place to have drinks, go on a date, or just have a nice night out! You really can't go wrong with any of the drinks or food on the menu.

This location is busy and parking in the area can be difficult. Get an early start looking for parking if you have a reservation during peak hours. The staff will call and check up with you to see if you're still coming if you are running late. I was--driving in circles looking for a spot, d'oh!--but they held my table without issue.

My server was super nice and the manager was beyond delightful. She really took the time to connect with the many guests there and made me feel super welcome. I'm so excited about their future endeavors and will definitely be back!

I had a coconut drink (so good!!), bread/butter, a gorgeous salad, a duck confit dish, and creme brûlée. Everything exceeded my expectations and was so wonderful to enjoy. 

I can't wait to take some guests to this restaurant in the near future!

I honestly wish I had pictures to do this place justice. Had a reservation there during the snow storm and the staff was very understanding and lenient of us being late. Obviously as a French restaurant they have a great variety of wine choices. Typically three course dinner. We had the shrimp tempura and Tuscan bruschetta as our first course ( exquisite !!!) for our main course we both had the pork chop ( seasonal / on temporary menu that the chef releases frequently ) and it was AMAZING. I definitely am looking forward to visiting again for brunch and during the summer time.

One of the great high-end classic dining experiences offering the extravagant blend of craft, quality, and variety with attention to creative and unique menu items. There is so much to enjoy here from the wonderful staff, tastefully decorated inside and out, and a traditional blend of French cuisine with American flair. I came here for my birthday for the first time with my group of four others and all enjoyed dishes from soup, duck, lobster to beef. The Burger was the surprise, easily the most Fantastic Burger I have ever had in my life. What an amazing blend of ingredients that come together for flavors making many steaks embarrassed. The duck poutine was also a stand out, amazed us all! My lobster and crab cannelloni was rich and even though the cream and ricotta took over most of the dish there was some nice flavors poking through. Good words also for the soups and boeuf bourgignon - pure delicious beef and extremely well done with very soft and tasty morsels. The drinks were also well crafted, the desserts very nice, and we will definitely be back for another celebration.

Still my favorite restaurant in Lafayette/West Lafayette area! Maybe even all of the Indiana area! 

Their menu changes seasonally but also hangs onto a few things.

My favorites of the menu items that have stayed are:
Daily quiche at lunch,
French onion soup,
The pate,
Pom frites, 
Bread pudding, 
And so much more!

I love that they now serve brunch on Sundays! So incredibly delicious!

Please! If you haven't given this amazingly delicious restaurant and it's phenomenal staff a shot, make a reservation today!

While do some work in Lafayette , Keisha and I wanted to enjoy some French food . The escargot was authentic with olive oil and pesto , dipped in a goat cheese sauce.  Delicious,  with quality ! 

The cannelloni, stuffed with lobster and blue crab had a delightful taste leaving you wondering when we could have another . 

The desert , caramel whiskey bread pudding wasn't overbearing with sweetness. Had the correct texture for a dessert. 

Sticky toffee carrot cake , had medjool dates given it a great taste . This restaurant is outstanding with the food , and service as quality in quality out !

Keep improving restaurant. Our third time visit here and more satisfying food. New manus are unexpectedly good and genuine. The pistachio ice cream is absolutely delicious and must try item. Recommend this place and will visit again!

A chic French bistro with country charm and incredible cuisine -- what's not to love about Bistro 501?
 
Although I'm not a Lafayette local, I travel here frequently for business and this has become my go-to for sit-down meals. Most recently, I stopped in for an early lunch during the busy Christmas shopping season. While I didn't have a reservation, I was quickly seated. The staff was very attentive, taking my order and then bringing out my meal before the dining room filled up for the big lunch rush.
 
The menu always features seasonal and sophisticated dishes. This time I started with a cup of sugar pumpkin and wild rice soup, which was perfectly rich and creamy -- just as a French soup should be! For my main course, I ordered the humongous beet and goat cheese salad, which was well appointed with lots of other goodies like wild rice, pepitas and oranges. I added salmon, which turned out to be a full portion. The whole dish was so flavorful it could easily stand on its own, but a few touches of the creamy apple cranberry dressing put it over the top!
 
The beautiful details -- lovely old portraits, antiques and carved wood finishings -- throughout the dining room make a spectacular backdrop for the meal.
 
Keep in mind, this is an upscale French restaurant, so you should expect to pay a little more. But the portions are large and the overall experience is well worth it.

Came here on a Friday night without reservations and we were lucky to get a table immediately.

Everything was delicious and warm if not hot in temperature.  The portions are fair and prices are a little more but it is a white table cloth setting.  The ambience is like being in someone's home.  Food timing was done well too.

Service needed some improvement with timing, friendliness and attention to details.  Some suggestion include but not limited to:  Paying attention to the water glasses, not rushing in choosing a wine, providing recommendations, asking if dinner was a special occasion etc.

I would still come back bc the food is that good especially in this tiny town with super limited choices.

Tried out this quaint place on a Sunday morning for brunch - highly recommended!

The bistro is very tastefully decorated, and has a certain charm to it. There's indoor and outdoor seating, but as it was a chilly October morning we decided to warm up inside. 
Service was fantastic, no complaints. 
With regards to the food - no disappointments! Every dish we tried was delicious. We tried their fried chicken on waffles (yummyyyy), pancakes, eggs benedict, burger and the full breakfast. Although I only had the chicken on waffles, everyone else seemed very happy with their orders. 
The one thing I would highlight is that their French press was a little on the weak side, not sure what kind of roast they use. 
They have good sized portions!

Covid wise, best I have seen - tables are thoroughly cleaned and sanitized after each group leaves, servers serve food only, designated people take things away.

Went to brunch today and food was good (chicken and waffles, breakfast tamales, crabby patty sandwich and chicken salad croissant sandwich + poutine appetizer), but appetizer was served late and chicken salad croissant came on a pretzel bun.  When asked, our server said 'they may have run out of croissants today' (11:30 am when they open for brunch at 10).  She apologized for not telling us. Disappointed for a $100 brunch.  We have been here for dinner a few times pre/post Covid and have had better service.

Came here for a new hire dinner with some of the employees of the company I'm working for this summer, and the food here completely blew me away. The Atlantic salmon was absolutely the best I've EVER had, perfectly cooked, perfectly seasoned with the perfect amount of crispness on the outside. It came with these wonderful little sweet roasted carrots and sat on this delicious bed of polenta. Our waitress was so attentive even though we had a big party. Their crème brûlée was divine and it came on a cute little dessert spoon so it was just enough to satisfy my sweet tooth! Our pommes frites also came with this really yummy red curry ketchup, plus two other fun sauces which I thought were unique and added a nice twist. 

Cute little thing that has nothing to do with food, nor does it really matter in the grand scheme of things but I'm adding it anyway: the bathroom sinks had cool little color-changing lights on them so that you'd know when the water was hot, warm or cold (,: 

Overall I really loved this place, and I'd say it's worth the price!

Is it pricey? Yes. It is worth it? Absolutely. Bistro 501  is very well put together and prepared. The cuisine is exquisite, flavorful, and super fresh. The whole staff is professional and experienced. We had the Turkish lentil soup which was slightly sweet and hardy, really delicious. The pork chop was so soft and cooked perfectly. The broccolini pasta was amazing, creamy and perfect texture with the walnut crust. Props to the chef and the owner. The place does has strange hours and is always booked so make sure to call to make a reservation even if they aren't open. You can leave a voicemail and they'll call you back.

It's not often that we Funkster four are in the same place at the same time these days, but when we are, a great meal is usually not too far away.  

This holiday season, that "all together" day found us in a Christmas state of mind at Bistro 501 in Lafayette, IN. Fine Dining in the home of Astronauts, Engineers, a world renowned Collegiate Music Organization (with no music degree available?!?) and a big-a$$ bass drum... who'da thunk it!

On this early December evening The French inspired Bistro provided a spectacular meal and impeccable service as a Lafayette Christmas parade floated by. 

A table next to a warm easy burning fireplace for the evening, at least 2 1/2 hours, made way to signature cocktails, beginnings of meat and cheeses followed by delicious and beautifully presented pasta's, chops, fish and steaks accompanied by a bottle of red and a bottle of white (nod to B. Joel) from the Bistro's superb cellar.

The evening was finally closed with shared desserts, in Funkster fashion, and an aromatic and rich cup of French roast, naturally from... a French press.

It truly was L'Amour from first bite, just remember to have plenty of Francs on hand - even though dead presidents is easier.

Will we return? Well as my good friend PePe Le Pew has said, "One nice thing eez, the game of love eez never called on account of darkness!"

My previous review from 2015 was a 3, and the reason for it was that it was an "institution" and so while the food was just okay you kind of knew were you stood with it. 

Well. Bistro kind of took us for a terrible ride when we were planning our rehearsal dinner spot for our wedding. My mom hosted the rehearsal, so we planned her visit to Lafayette so she could try the two choices (Bistro and East End). My now husband's parents came along as well as a treat. We tried basically everything in the menu that was vegetarian**. The food was okay, but not mind blowing. Still, it's the type of atmosphere that my parents prefer, so they were leaning toward hosting the dinner at Bistro for about 30 people. However, despite having talked to my mom before, and knowing that she was the one paying, the manager just kept on addressing only my husband's parents. Was it because they're American and my mom has a thick accent? (despite being fully fluent?) I don't know, that was kind of our assumption. At some point my mom said "excuse me, I'm the one that's hosting" and the manager said something really awkward like "yes, of course I know" just to go back to ignoring her. Anyway, maybe this all seems like a bunch of petty stuff, but mediocre food (see previous review), poor manners, and feeding me fat duck (see note below). Just no.

** pretty sure, as I found out later, their fries are fried in duck fat, and we talked several times about how we were vegetarians at that time, so wtf. Extra wtf.

We Went here for our 6th anniversary and it was phenomenal. Our waiter, Eric, was considerate and took great care of us. We had the calamari appetizer and it was cooked perfectly, my husband had the half chicken and I had the duck. Both dishes were absolutely delicious, highly recommend eating here, the owner was super friendly and spoke to us for a little bit which we loved and we will definitely be back.
Delicious brunch. Made a reservation for our daughter's birthday and had a wonderful time. We were seated right in front of the fireplace. Service was great! Timing was perfect. Thank you.

One of my favorite places in town!  The food and drinks are amazing!  

Everything we ate was divine!  After living in Europe for a few years and being able to get escargot pretty much anywhere, I'm thrilled to have a place here in town to satisfy that craving!  And they were as good as any I've had before!  I plan on returning just to sit at the bar and enjoy a glass of wine and escargot!  

While this restaurant has a French emphasis, their menu is diverse.  After enjoying my escargot, I had an excellent bahn-mi sandwich.  For dessert, scrumptious creme brûlée.

Their cocktails menu is fabulous as well!  I've always wanted to try the cocktail, The Last Word.  The ingredients are expensive so I've never been able to buy them to make one for myself and not a lot of restaurants and bars around here have them on the menu, but Bistro did!  I was so excited and it was delicious.

I've only been the one time, but I look forward to going back whether it be for a drink and some escargot, a full dinner, or their brunch which looks absolutely amazing! 

The restaurant itself was cozy and well decorated and has outdoor seating on a sidewalk patio in nicer weather.

reviews.text: Delicious food! Had the club sandwich with fries and husband had the Reuben with stuffed mushrooms. We agreed they were some of the best sandwiches we have had! Will definitely be back to try other things.

This cozy neighborhood bar and restaurant has been around for generations. The original Parkside was a humble shack serving inexpensive food and drinks to Columbian Park  visitors and neighborhood. This latest iteration features more upscale food and local brews.

Prices are a bit higher than I believe the surrounding neighborhood can regularly afford, but with the new stadium being completed this spring and hopefully Covid getting under control, The Parkside should be rocking. 

The Parkside features scratch made appetizers and entrees. I had the pastrami sandwich with onion rings. The pastrami (and corned beed) are made in-house and smoked. The pastrami was thinly sliced and placed on toasted rye bread with mustard and swiss cheese. I felt the pastrami was over smoked, the smokey flavor overpowering the flavor of the meat. This may just be a one-off, but with the scarcity of pastrami in Lafayette, I'll take it.

The onion rings were, how can I  put it, were perfect! The breading appeared to be a cornmeal mixture, giving the rings a solid crunch. The onion itself was tender and flavorful. 

I'm definitely giving the pastrami another try.

This restaurant is great if you want a quieter local place to eat for lunch. The staff were all super friendly and seemed happy to be working there. My food (the reuben) came out perfectly prepared with no issues, and was super tasty.

If you pay for extra sauces double check before the delivery man leaves because we didnt get. The pizza was good, the veggie alfredo would have been better had it not been over stuffed with black olives and way too much cheese on top
The menu looks deceptively simple. THE FOOD IS DELICIOUS. Like lick your plate delicious. You won't be disappointed.
First time here since re-opening.  Love the neighbored feel!  Onion rings were awesome.  The Veggie Reuben was great!  Perfectly chilled 2-hearted.  We'll be back often!
Great food...sandwiches, wings, house made smoked meats, salads, fries, great appetizers! Best tenderloin! Lots of drink options...beer, wine, cider, white claws. Overall great neighborhood pub!

The food is fresh and and the staff is friendly.  The food was cooked very well.  A warning, if you are not a fan of garlic aioli be careful what you order.  It is on both burgers, but only listed on one.  It is on the fries.  I tried a burger and fries and was not a fan.    None of our party of five finished their meals.  The ham and cheese sliders for appetizer were very good( no garlic aioli).  Coffee cups were like tea cups for the coffee drinkers, needed constantly refilled which was annoying.

reviews.text: They have the best tacos. There is a language barrier but they do their best and are really nice. Best to order in person to assure you get your food per online ordering doesn't guarantee they received it (why I deducted a star)... tacos, barbacoa, or burritos you can't go wrong

We chose to do takeout for our first visit. Some of the highlights: The guacamole and the salsa were both very nice. The guac was creamy and tasty, just the way it should be. The tortilla chips were great as well, light and crispy, not too salty. The tacos were okay, but not spectacular. The only real problem was that we didn't order any of the above. Somehow the orders got mixed up and we were given somebody else's order. It wasn't a huge problem, as the sizes of the respective orders were about the same, but we didn't discover the switch until we'd left. I would have loved to try the beef cheek tacos, which I hadn't seen anywhere else. Perhaps we'll make it back sometime for another try.

Walked into the grocery side(thinking that's where I would place my food order) and walked up to the window to the kitchen. I walked back to the register because I didn't see anyone and then went back to the open kitchen window. There was a woman cooking meat, with no gloves on who pulled up her mask, grabbed a piece of the meat with her bare hands and took a bite. Another worker saw me witness this and glanced at my phone as if to see if I caught it on camera.

She told me where to go after I awkwardly asked for a menu and I went straight to my car instead of the restaurant.

The meat that was being prepared was steak, in bulk, so I'm sure it would be used for plenty of meals. I was disgusted at what I saw, ESPECIALLY during a pandemic.

I was excited to try them out for the first time, now I feel like I dodged a bullet.

Went to grab some dinner for date night. We got cola to start and complamentary chips and salsa. I did not like the chips and salsa it was just not good. Then we got tacos and fajitas. My taco was just ok very plain and not very good meat. My husband got beef tongue and said it was ok. Then I got steak fajitas and it was again very bad cut if meat. The meat was fatty and chewy. Not flavorful the onions were almost raw it just wasn't good. My husband got chicken fajitas they were just ok at best. I really wanted to like this place :(

Worst Mexican food I've ever eaten and I eat A LOT of Mexican and Spanish food. Got my order wrong, tried to tell me they'd called me beforehand (I had received no calls), completely dry enchiladas with no cheese, sauce, or salsa. No actual refried beans, just the liquid spilled all over the meal. Said they'd reimburse me for what they forgot in my order but I'm still waiting. If the experience were better OR the food were better, I wouldn't have cared so much.
Great authentic Mexican restaurant. The shrimp tacos were amazing. Love the salsa.  The Al pastor was well Marinated.  We are so thankful to have this in West Lafayette.

We had the worst service here! We ordered food and the website said it was going to be 20 min. When we get there our food is missing. No one apologized and no one told us what was going on with our order til we had to ask. Very disappointed. My chips were beyond stale! Do not recommend 1 star is very generous!

These are the best tacos in west lafayette.  They are a bit pricy but they butcher their own and these people do not compromise on quality so buy it.  They have sufficient dining but take out is standard.  I should have checked my takeout order- they shorted me one taco which was no big deal except they were so tasty i was greedy for more.  You indiana folks need to support this operation; go get mexican groceries there too while they prepare your food, cabrones!

I went last night thinking I would just try it out. Ordered the chicken with mole poblano, which is a dish I really love and order a lot. It was awful. I'd never eaten mole poblano that was so sweet. I order this at Taco Rico and love it. Should have gone there last night as well.

I thought this was a very authentic Mexican restaurant. They have a sufficient menu with items you don't see on your mainstream Mexican places. 

The salsa was good, but not chunky. It's thin, but flavor is good. I had a dish with steak for the meat in it. A couple pieces were grisslely. Other than, the taste was very good. Next time I'll try the pork.

I finally got back here after a few years. My first experience was not bad. This time was outstanding. Chips and salsa were great. Salsa was the right combo of watery/flavory. Last time it was much thicker. I like this version way better.

They were out of pastor, but I had asada, chorizo and beef tongue. All three came with a huge mountain of meat, two tortillas, tons of cilantro and onions. Green and Red sauces with the tacos were both very good. Nice smokiness to the red, and the green was the right balance of flavor and heat.

Fantastic meal. Won't take me three years to get back again after that meal.

A little place next to a little store and across from a gas station. Not much else going on around here. 
I think La Aldea needs to update their hours. It says that they are open starting from 9AM on weekdays online and on the storefront. However, I was going for lunch at 11 and the restaurant was not open yet. I go into the store and they said they are waiting for the waitress.... 

You get free chips and salsa. The ambience is cute with a lot of decorations going on. However, there are several TVs and the music is pretty loud. We were the only ones dining in for lunch, but a few people came in for to go orders. Since we were the only ones dining in, our waitress kept disappearing and it was hard to find somebody when we needed service. 

The food was pretty good, I got the gordita. It was cheesy and the steak meat was delicious. Just not worth going out of the way when the hours might not be consistent and hard to get a hold of the wait staff while we're sitting there.

I reviewed this place in 2014 and thought I would never go back, but a lot of my friends were telling me I have to try it again. I am glad I listened. The service, the food and the people are different. Stake tacos are so delicious. My husband had the steak torta and he liked it. I came again and had the breakfast (chilaquiles) was really good. I am really happy that we gave it a try. We will definitely be coming here often.

I was very skeptical of this place because of the location...it's right next to a mini mart in the middle of nowhere. But, some really great, authentic places are in really sketch places so I stayed optimistic. Then, no one was there to greet us when we came in. We awkwardly stood there for a bit, but I just ended up grabbing menus and sitting wherever. About a minute later, the waitress found us and asked us what we wanted. When we weren't ready to order food, she rolled her eyes at us and went to sit at the front desk. Not sure why she had an attitude with us, the place was pretty dead (2 other tables there). Anyway, we ordered and got our food pretty quickly. I got red enchiladas with beef and my BF got the carne asada. 

Warning - the red enchiladas are SUPER spicy. When my chicanx friends make them, they taste pretty mild - but these were 4/5 spiciness level. I looked at the menu afterwards and there is no warning or indication that they were spicy. No red vs. green being more mild or spicy. In addition, no warning from the waitress that the salsa would set my mouth on fire. Anyway... luckily I could handle it and still enjoy my meal without sending it back. I even had leftovers the next day and it wasn't half as spicy as it was the day before... Maybe one side was doused in chile and the other wasn't. 

Anyway, my BF enjoyed the carne asada a lot. Overall, food is delicious and authentic. My major complaint is the service and the lack of spiciness warning for the enchiladas. Despite the low review, I still would come back because authentic Mexican food is hard to find here. Only place I've seen that offers lengua, tortas, and menudo.

We went here on a recommendation from a friend, we weren't sure when we pulled up how it was going to be but it ended up being my new favourite Mexican restaurant. Very authentic, very good service. The waitress was perfectly bilingual. I'll definitely be back.

For dinner I had the Green Enchiladas. The beans were amazing, I ate all of them and could've probably eaten more!

Really pleased with my first visit here, off the Maine route for Good Mexican Food, found this Great Authentic Mexican Food, Great Service with Great tasting,freshly made guacamole dip was awesome, Loved their variety of sauces they brought to our table!

Had the green enchiladas which were surprisingly spicy but not unbearable. Beef was cooked really well. A couple complaints were that the food was a little salty and the chips were nothing special, but other than that I think this is one of the more authentic Mexican food places in West Lafayette.

Weekend lunch is worth the leisurely wait for the kitchen to prepare your food. While the wait for our food was long, there were not very many tables full and we received very attentive service.

Unfortunately they were out of the first two things I ordered (chile rellenos, pozole) so I settled for the breakfast scramble with chorizo.

The Breakfast Scramble is a hearty portion of scrambled eggs with meat mixed in, seasoned yellow rice, creamy refried pinto beans and a stack of warm, fresh corn tortillas. The beans are some of the creamiest I've had in a long time. I'm pretty confident the tortillas were hand made judging by how tender they were, and also how they were not uniform (in a good way!).

Their menu included a nice selection of frozen fruit smoothies as well, and there is a cooler of fruit and ice cream popsicles by the cash register.

Quick Carryout. The chorizo burrito I ordered was ready in less than 10 minutes. The portion size was good, price was good and the burrito was tasty. The restaurant itself looked meh. The cash counter could be a lot cleaner, but the customer tables were pretty clean.
Bruhhhhh  I've tried every authentic spot from Lafayette to West Lafayette just give them a key to the city they got it on lock
