reviews.text:
The best Mexican restaurant in the area!!  Best Margaritas too!  Staff is amazing - so friendly and fast. Max, Annabelle and Vladimir are the best!!

3/19/20 - They are open for carry-out during restaurant restrictions! Let's all keep them busy
Small portions for the price point- charging for another small bowl of chips is unheard of at most Mexican restaurants. Flavors decent.

Best fast food in the world.

..or sit down & take your time food, or gather the gang and laugh till your face & stomach hurts, or whatever.

Check them out! Drink specials, food specials, a caring staff... Can't go wrong!

Okay so I've avoided this restaurant due to some not so good publicity, and have always gone to the one in Attica. Let me just say I'm sorry I hadn't been here sooner because the food and drinks are EXCELLENT!!!!! So good that I went two nights in a row 
Service was excellent, as well as the food. The margaritas will floor you - if by only sheer size. I think the one I had was 27 oz or something and WOW!!! The food seems to be authentic and I enjoyed everything I had, as also did the others I went with. Glad I can visit this one, which is close to home.

Best. Margaritas. In. Existence.

Best food, faster than a drive thru. Lay down & scream delicious. 

This place is a hidden gem. Eat here with no regrets.
Best food, service, and amazing margaritas! It's my weekly haunt. Try the top shelf margarita. It won't disappoint!

This is one of the best Mexican restaurants in West Lafayette! Amazing food with great service! The wait time is usually less than ten minutes. Even if they're crowded, the food will be served very quickly! Their micheladas are amazing! The food portions are enough.

I have had better mexican food. The food is not worth the price. The staff is not the greatest and some of the dishes are odd... Wings, mozzarella sticks, and potato wedges with my enchilada? I think no!

Services is excellent....  But worst food ever I even got to finish first three bites And I was about to vomit worst ground beef and no seasoning... chicken without seasoning and uncook... I got the plate from the house... So I tried chalupa, tacos, enchiladas and burrito any of those where not wven close to decent
Great service and strong Margaritas! The food is always great. We go often with a large group and always have a great time.

This is my family's favorite dinner place. The food is always delicious. I personally love the margaritas. Service is excellent. Yes when they get busy it can slow a bit but they don't operate with a large staff so it's completely understandable. The staff is always friendly. Never had a bad meal or experience here.

We love Mexican so when we heard that Agave Azul had opened we were looking forward to trying it. From a level of service perspective it was an epic fail. They seem to be waaaay understaffed or they need more training. After being seated the chips and drinks arrived quickly. Then the wheels fell off. It took nearly 10 minutes for the server to appear to take our order. The food arrived in a timely manner but that was the last time we saw our waiter. After we were done and the plates cleared off the table, we waited for our check. And waited, and waited. Finally, with people waiting to be seated and seeing us just sitting there the hostess came over to see if we needed anything. I explained we had been waiting over 10 minutes for our check. She got our check and we paid and I doubt we will be back. The food was good but not any better than other Mexican restaurants we've been to in Lafayette.

Decor is fine. Carved wooden Mexican booths/walls. We ordered the queso with chorizo. Was more chorizo than cheese, though. Tasted ok, not outstanding.

Chips were ok, salsa was good.

I had a quesadilla which tasted like processed cheese. Lot of steak, though and it was cooked right. Also had an al pastor taco and a fish taco. very bland. Borderline flavorless.

Kids ordered kids meals of burrito & taco. Ordered the burritos both to be a bean burrito with just beans, no cheese, no nothing. The guy brought bean burritos covered in red sauce and cheese. Then when I pointed out the problem he accused me of incorrectly ordering it. Sorry, I ordered a burrito to have just beans and expected it to have just beans. I even said no cheese...if I didn't want cheese IN it it should be safe to assume I didn't want cheese ON it, but by all means ask if you're not sure! 

The food was sub-par, and I don't appreciate being blamed for a screwed up order. Also the menu is 200 items. Yes, you read that right. TWO HUNDRED. No restaurant in the world could possibly cook that many items well and maybe that's why the food here is bad. Also they have American food on their menu and not just a few items. I don't get it, but it doesn't matter because I won't be back.
Racist restaurant!!!!!!! Called my Chinese roommate Ching Chong during checking out! And that is a Mexican male waiter!! I could give a zero star if I can!

This is our favorite go-to restaurant in the greater Lafayette area! The food is always amazing as are the margaritas! The staff is so friendly and accommodating; it's always a great experience! Eat here - you won't be disappointed!
Dropped in for dinner. Good food and service. Not the best place to host big groups due to its size.

We stopped by tonight for dinner. We had never been to the West Lafayette location, but we have been to the Attica location. The food was delicious and portions were HUGE! We had a small issue with getting our waiter's attention for some extra napkins, but when he was here he was great! Food came amazingly quickly! We'll definitely return.

Overall, a very enjoyable meal.  I would have given 5 stars if I didn't have other great Mexican food in town with which to compare.

We went on a Thursday night and every table was taken.  There are only around 15-20 tables, but we only waited about 5 minutes for a table.  The building is small, so the waiting area isn't huge, but I would imagine there would be a crowd outside waiting on a busy weekend.

The chips were good, not great, and the salsa was better than average.  I got the Quesadilla Azul (chicken, chorizo, onion, and cheese) which although slightly greasy was delicious.  Not as delicious as the similar Quesadilla Rodeo (at El Rodeo), but I had no problem devouring the giant portion.  The guacamole was one of my favorite aspects of the meal, being moderately chunky with a hint of spice.  

The staff was great and very attentive.  The menu was extensive.  The interior was clean and completely redone with bright colors and vibrant Mexican artwork.  It was a very fun atmosphere that made me want to try one of their delicious appearing margaritas.  I think that the convenient location will make up for any downsides as West Lafayette needed a Mexican restaurant in this area.

I will be returning for more delicious food in the near future.

This is a welcome addition to the Lafayette/West Lafayette area. Their menu is very expansive, and goes beyond the cheap, traditional Tex-mex cuisine you see in the area. This was our first visit so we went traditional... something we could compare to...  shrimp/chicken/steak fajitas and chicken enchiladas + a tamale. Everything was clearly made to order except the refried beans and rice. The steak was tender and not over cooked. Really great skirt steak. Service was very friendly, patient, and informative about the menu. Only recommendation I'd have would be to expand the side offerings a bit to match the excellent entree menu. The sauce on the tamale was a little heavy, and unnecessary given how GREAT the tamale itself was. We will be coming back to this place frequently.

I'm so happy to have really good Mexican food on this side of the river. The food here isn't quite up to the standard of my favorite Mexican place in Lafayette (Mi Cabanita) and the prices are higher, but it's a big step up from the other Mexican options (mostly national chains) in this part of town. On our first visit, the portions were really massive, but they seemed to be a bit smaller the second time we visited. I hope that's just a coincidence and not a trend. Service was fast and friendly both times. I anticipate we'll be eating here regularly.

reviews.text: Hands down one of the best meals and experience in downtown Lafayette. My husband and I ordered a bottle of wine and three shared plates. The baked brie is SO delicious! We also got the red wine poached sausage and polenta and the lamb kebabs, both amazing as well! Maren was our server and she was so sweet! We will definitely be back.

Love the new space. We had the goat cheese with romesco. Very nice although I'd prefer toasts vs the bread but still very good. Also some filled phyllo pastry that was wonderful. Of course the wine selection was excellent and some good beer options

Finally got to try out their Brunch menu. 

I got their eggs benedict which was really delicious (and came with three eggs!). The only thing I felt was a bit off was the raw tomato in there... I think it would have enhanced the flavours if they had roasted it. Salmon was on point.

Their croque madame was fantastic. Definitely recommend this. My friend got their nutella crepe which was a little too sweet. Probably best sharing this with someone. 

Mimosa's were yummy and overall, a great experience. I'd definitely go back. Great service.

What a gem! This is the perfect place to treat yourself or a friend for a wonderful wine selection and delicious food options. I went in December to celebrate my first week at a new job and my move to Lafayette. This will definitely be a regular place for me.

The place is actually called The Cellar Wine Bistro and they have the same owners from down the street from before. The location is great. We went here on a Saturday when they had mosey down Main Street going on. Our server was Maren and her service was amazing.

Love this place! This is a great spot for any occasion. They know their wines and tapas! I feel like I am stepping into a whole new world when I come here with loved ones. The owners and staff are very engaging and turn into a personalized experience that makes it feel like home or visiting a friends.

I'm writing this review in the spirit of trying to help. The Cellar is a nice place with excellent staff and a good selection of wines. Their imaginative food offerings were hampered by a few missteps this evening. The Fried Green Tomatoes were crispy, but missing seasoning. The crab cakes were tasty, but overcooked.  The Tonkatsu Lettuce Wraps also contained overcooked pork cutlet. I'm sure these can be adjusted for a better next visit.

I headed to The Cellar after a day of hiking and stopping at breweries with my beer loving husband.

The space is elegant and intimate.  It was early enough that Michelle, one of the owners, had time to chat.  The wines by the glass menu is is small but nicely balanced.  

I didn't check out the full wine list as I knew a bottle was out of the question but two glasses of barbera was a good choice. The $15 cheese tray came with decisions (French, Italian, sweet or savory sides) so I asked Michelle's opinion.  We settled on olive tapenade and onion chutney.  It came with three cheeses, melba toast, apples, raw almonds and grapes.  It was a very generous portion and beautifully presented.
The melba was perfect and I would LOVE the chef's recipe.

If only the Cellar Wine Bistro wasn't 90 miles from home, I would be a loyal and frequent guest.

Great atmosphere!  A significant upgrade from their previous location.  Flavorful and interesting menu, and great wine selections.  The staff really know their wine and enjoy conversing about it.  What a great experience!  
Elegant atmosphere for sure.
Stopped by early afternoon to share some wine with my hubby. Beautiful decor, wonderful staff (the owners I believe).  Would highly recommend!  The food looked amazing although we were just drinking
Excellent, friendly service and beautiful decor. We loved the light, shareable small plates and can't wait to try brunch here.
A good selection of wine and nice pairings as far as food goes. No complaints, just a small space

Photo of The Pickle - Lafayette, IN, United States. Big ol' plate of breadsticks! So good! You can't eat just one. Light and fluffy, like a cloud.

reviews.text: So great! Easy 10/10 dive for all ages, casual atmosphere, huge menu, fantastic service, plenty to pick from, well made popular fare, and Triple XXX root beer on tap! My buddy and dropped in late for pizza and the panini deal. The cheese bread ended up in our order too somehow - a bit average compared to Mad Mushroom but hard to compete with the cheese stix king! My Gyro panini was perfect! So tasty, rich and fresh combo of traditional ingredients, zesty and savory for all the right taste buds. Pizza went down well too though could do with a thick crust option for the thick appetites. It's a decent value and easy pick for the easy family or friends dinner fix, plenty of parking on streets, great location, and hopefully things get back to normal soon so the 8pm closing is extended.

First time here and were not disappointed at all. We had an order oof the bacon sticks. Cheese and bacon on pizza crust with a side of cheese and pizza sauce. Very good and loved the pizza crust.  I had the gonzo chicken panini, without jalapeños. Chunks of chicken and. Ton of melted cheese with a side of a Southwest sauce.  The dough on this sandwich was again amazing. My hubby got the Niko panini (sorry pic is bad). Ham, bacon, lettuce and tomato with a side of honey lime sauce.  I liked the sauce but he didn't. Before we  even left my  husband was already naming things he wants to try on the menu next time. Great food and friendly service!!

The food -- even the pizza -- is always delicious. We've never had a bad meal here, but the desserts aren't worth the extra money. We would give the place five stars, but one of the employees, Haley, was rude -- not just unpleasant, but flat-out rude. Her eye rolls and snippy attitude aren't enough to keep us away, though.

Excellent food!

My wife's sandwich was delicious.

My chef salad was excellent.

We will recommend this place to our friends and definitely visit it again.
My favorite place to eat, the food always makes me want more. I recommend the calzones, a nice size with alot of flavor

What a great place to eat!!!
First time there and I was not disappointed.  It is a quaint establishment, very cozy.  Large menu - I ordered the calzone and it was awesome.  The owner was very personable and an exceptionally good cook.
WE WILL CERTAINLY GO BACK!!!
I called in a to go order on a Friday evening. We ordered a veggie pizza and garlic sticks. Both were excellent! The service was great and on time. Definitely recommend ordering from The Pickle!

The only thing that would make this place better is if they also served beer to go with their awesome food menu. They have an albeit strange combination of pizza, salad, subs, wraps, and Mexican food. Somehow, they are able to pull it off. They have a great patio to sit outside and enjoy good weather, and the inside is a pleasant little dive pizza joint. I would recommend this as a family night out, date night, and a good place to bring a large group of friends/teammates. They are open late during the week, so it's a great place for college students. We got a Greek salad, which was tasty for an iceberg lettuce based salad and was pleasantly seasoned with oregano. We also got an Al Pastor pizza, which was fantastic. The pork was tangy and juicy, and the garlic sauce perfectly complimented the pork and pineapple. Unfortunately, the dough was undercooked and nearly soggy.

Ok, so the pizza is great!! Like 4.5 stars great. We had thin crust. I do wish they offered more than one size for thin crust though, bummer, but we made the medium size work by offsetting our ferocious appetites with an appetizer. We got the garlic breadsticks. Normally I wouldn't weight an appetizer so heavily on a review, but after careful deliberation, I feel it is the right call. 

The garlic breadsticks were greasy. Wayyy too greasy. They came with marinara and cheese sauce. Both of those were, really not very good. Coupled with the fact that the breadsticks were $7, I was displeased. 

Again, the thin crust pizza -- good! The appetizers, maybe skip them.

Relatively simple food done well; salads and other items were enjoyed by my family.  Four of us split 5 entrees (we could not narrow down our selection to only four items) and a side plus drinks less than $50 (walked away with plenty of leftover food too).

We really liked this place. Placing an order was a bit daunting as there is so much to choose from. Luckily we weren't there when it was busy. Had a couple specialty salads and split a small pizza - all were very good...although I would have preferred the pizza to cook a tad longer and have just a bit more sauce. But everything tasted fresh, service was prompt & friendly, and the place is very clean. We will be back on our many travels through town.

Really great food for the price and everything we got was fantastic! Between all of us we ordered buffalo wings (which had a great flavor! Not just Franks flavor like most), we ordered the garlic pizza which had a huge punch of garlic flavor so much sure you're a garlic lover like I am, one of us ordered an Italian Panini which he said was yummy and we also had bacon cheese sticks so good!

We'll be coming back!

I don't live around here, if I did this would be my go-to. Wraps, Pizzas, Calzones, Wings, Mexican Options, and a few more, I've been to this place twice and it has a bunch of different things that are all pretty good. I love it when a place has good food at reasonable prices. All calzones, sandwiches and such were 6-8 bucks and pizza below $15. As dine-in, food was extremely quick (it was very slow at 2pm, however I imagine all the food doesn't take too long) and quite tasty. The lady who greeted us did an excellent job at explaining everything in a concise manner.  
Definitely will be making our way back here. 

The only real con: it's 95 degrees out, this place was about 80. Blazing hot in there lol.

This place doesn't look like much from the outside, but they have some really good food. The first time I visited, I had a Greek salad and a Greek pizza (I believe) minus the olives and added feta. The 2nd, 3rd, 4th, and 5th I opted for the veggie pizza. Each time I ate there, the food never disappointed. The pizzas I had were a nice thin crust that was crunchy. It was probably enough for myself and one other person, but I was hungry each time I ordered and I smashed the whole pizza by myself each time.

This is my second visit and I'm a fan! The Pickle doesn't look like much on the outside (former life was a laundromat). The parking lot is small but there is street parking nearby. Inside is small but It handles the lunch rush. Outside seating is available. The menu is deep. Subs, wraps, panini, calzone, pizza, salads, breadsticks, select Mexican, and more I'm probably forgetting. The wraps are stuffed with fresh ingredients with the dressing in the side. Although I've only ever seen two people working a lunch hour, the food comes out fast. It's tucked away in a residential area just north of downtown on a one way street so it may be hard to find and get to but it's totally worth It especially for lunch. It's my new favorite place. UPDATE 3/6/18 The meaty calzone I ordered today was cold in the middle. I'll return but can't recommend the calzones.

The Pickle, formerly known as Niko's Spicy Pickle, is really good. I don't know what happened to Niko. Best wishes, my friend. The new owners and staff are delivering a great product. They have an unusually light and airy pizza and breadstick dough. It's really tasty, brushed with butter and some Parmesan cheese. The different dough differentiates The Pickle in an otherwise crowded pizza market. It's thin crust pizza, but not very crispy. Again, the airy dough makes it special. You don't feel like a mouthful of bread, but yet you get that tingly carb-o-licious feeling.

We visited on a Monday evening. Specials listed on the left as you enter. Order at the front. Find a seat and the food is delivered fast! We were the only folks there at the time, so our order went directly in the oven. Fast and friendly service by the only guy working there. The only down side I can find, Pickle does not offer Parmesan cheese at the table. At least not what I could see. Crushed red pepper shakers available by the drink machine.

I will return for pizza and breadsticks, and maybe try a sandwich or calzone. It all looks good! Our antipasto salad was fresh, could have used more meat but overall it was good. Some desserts and side items available too. I was impressed with the cleanliness of the place, the local feel, the great service, and most of all, the airy and tasty dough. Nice job, Pickle!

Our first time ordering from the pickle and we were more than pleasantly surprised.  Had an XL supreme pizza and a bbq chicken wrap and they were very fresh and very good. Can't wait to try some other stuff on their extensive menu.

We just discovered The Pickle, and I think we'll be "regulars!" Cute little restaurant, very nicely decorated and very clean.    You order at the counter, which is a bit of a daunting process, because they have SO many options that sound wonderful.   And they are!   We've had several different wraps, nachos and salad, and all have been delicious and very fresh.    Not sure if they make their own wraps, but they taste like they could be.   We haven't tried the pizza,calzones or panini, but they look delicious--they are in our list of "must try's."   Oh, and the pickles:  Each dish is served with a delicious, spicy pickle.  YuThe staff is very friendly and pleasant.  It is also notable that they serve on real dishes, which is very nice.  I expected baskets and paper, so the real dishes are a nice touch.    
The parking lot is small, but there is usually plenty of parking on the adjacent side street, so, no problem.
We always try to patronize local businesses, and we're happy to see that "The Pickle" is doing everything right to be a local success.  Job well done!
Great pizza... excellent service! Always fast and fresh. Loved the Italian pizza! Price is on point! This is my go-to pizza place.

This restaurant is rather probably the best-kept secret in Lafayette. The food is consistently excellent, the staff is kind and patient, and the atmosphere is relaxing and enjoyable. Take advantage of the daily specials; you'll be delighted. A+

reviews.text:
Lafayette Brewing Co. has the best chicken I have ever tasted. The chicken was so good I could not believe what I was tasting. When I first walked in the staff were very polite and guided me to a table with my family. They followed all the health precautions to take during this pandemic very well. The food came in at an average time and I was delighted at the quality of the entree I had. This business is very generous with their kids eat free on Sunday policy's well. This may be the best restraint in Lafayette, IN. Thanks Lafayette Brewing Co. for the great experience.

ーThe Timeless Reviewer
it is a great place with a great atmosphere and very nice service. Their outdoor seating also has one of the best views of main Street. Definitely recommend.

There's a lot of little brewery's in Lafayette/West, so I was pretty happy to find out that LBC stacks up against them all and even brings the best in some cases. The main appeal is that they are a brewery and full kitchen unlike Peoples and Brokerage which is nice because you can totally come for a nice date or have a couple with the boys. The food is much better than the reviews that I read prior to coming. Everything is from scratch and they certainly have a few standouts which include the shrimp po boy, fish and chips, and chicken tippy. The beer selection is a little low for a brewery with about 10-12 taps, but the lack of variety is made up for in value (4.89/20oz pour makes it the cheapest craft beer in Lafayette area) as well as quality of the beer which is phenomenal. The service is always great and they are good with covid measures. If you're a student or someone in the area, LBC should definitely become a go-to.

My husband lived in Lafayette for 15 years years during & after college & he has a soft spot for LBC, saying that the only real food he ate during that time was when he went to LBC. So, needless to say,  whenever we are in Lafayette,  this is where we eat  & I'm not disappointed. As many times as I have been here, I'm still surprised by how good the food is. 

It is pub food, but in all the best ways. They smoke their own meat....yes, please!

This was a good place for lunch and to escape the gray, day in central Indiana. 

The scotch eggs were good to see on the menu. Loved the chicken tippy. They also have a decent selection of daily specials which we enjoyed as well. 

Good find if you are in the Lafayette area

Over the bridge and down the street from the chaos of boilermaker stadium is an establishment called Lafayette Brewing Company. My first thought was to get out of town to escape the football madness. Unfortunately, so did everyone else!

Upon arriving we were stopped in the doorway as it was standing room only. The chaos was insane and the staff were totally taxed - management should be proud of the staff working tonight as they were all busting their hump for this unruly crowd of soaked patrons. On the other hand, management should also be apologizing to their staff and patrons for being GROSSLY unprepared for the work these few staff burdened.

We arrived at 6:30 and were told we'd be seated in 10 to 15 minutes. Chaos, utter chaos! We had people arriving after us that were someones friend and they were seated then the cry me a river story of "I had to sit all day in the rain and now I have to wait to pay you. I'm taking my business elsewhere." Oddly, they too were seated. We continued to patiently wait. Fourth five minutes into waiting and watching patrons come and go, I asked "when are we going to be seated?" And was told, I was just going to page you, your table is ready. We sat at a table to the left of the door that was available and unoccupied for the past forty minutes. Yes, I was annoyed.

We took our seats and promptly asked to taste two beers. Our server Cody, was a stud! Running all over the place helping everyone and really stretching himself. The problem was we got our samples about 20 minutes after we ordered them.

Cody took our orders and we ordered chicken nachos, chicken tilly, rib tips and pork belly. I finished the pork belly and my beer was served. Wow - crazy slow. At this point, the restaurant was slowing down and people weren't standing at the front door. Our food was just served and nearly after an hour into seating I had my first beer. Yep, you guessed I was annoyed. On the other hand, my spouses beer hadn't been served until about an hour and ten minutes after ordering. Excuses aside that's ridiculous considering we ordered promptly when seating. 

Now that's one aspect of the experience.... at a brewing company. Maybe they were making it?

Our dinners were served cold and not exciting. The rib tips were not tips and they were burnt to jerky! The so called sauce that was to accompany was not present and the Parmesan fries lacked Parmesan! The chicken tilly was just wrong. Cornbread is not supposed to be ruined unless it is bad to begin with and this was a great example of that! Now how could anyone ruin nachos? Right. Well I don't know who is in the kitchen but they need to pull their head out. The was the most awful food I have put to my lips in a very long time. 

During this meal we had waited so long for my wife's beer that she was through with eating and it still wasn't served. We flagged Cody down and told him to cancel the beer order as we were through. Through with waiting and really didn't want to waste anything more. Oddly shortly after canceling the order, her beer is served! What's up with that? 

Again I am very disappointed with what was expected to be an easy meal. Sadly, this is not a restaurant I am going to suggest returning to until management changes how it is run more efficiently. Food needs to be served hot and drinks cold not the other way around. Tables need to be bused clean immediately and patrons sat efficiently. 

One day I will revisit this place and I hope it's better than tonight as it doesn't deserve the star I am giving it. The star is for Cody as he was the best he could be with the resources he had available to him. It really is poor when a team doesn't play together, Nobody wins playing for themselves!

I want to give this place a higher review, but I've been disappointed here several times. Location is great. Perfect place to grab a beer and bite before a show at the Long Center or Lafayette Theatre. The beers are hip and local. Inside seating is boring, needs updated. The patio area is really nice, but I always feel slightly forgotten when sitting outside. 

Service was much better this time around. In a previous visit the waiter rang the meals up on the wrong cards. It was a mess. The beer cheese soups is beyond nasty. I wanted to love it, but it tasted like vomit. The scotch eggs are sooo good! Definitely a solid appetizer. Tonight I tried the Chicken Tippy. Flavors were good, but the dish was not warm. The chicken needed more sauce and needed to be hot.

Service was great!  We had 2 flights of beers while our DD had lemon ginger tea.  Shared a tasty BBQ nachos platter appetizer on an early weekend afternoon; specials looked very good.  Beer selection was not extensive, but four 5 oz beers for $6 is worth a visit.

Had date night with my wife here tonight and we had a rockin' time! Our server, Darrius, was super polite and helped me pick my main meal because everything sounded delicious.

My gal and I split the hummus plate which was presented beautifully and had plenty to go around. She's got a smaller appetite so she ordered the house salad and threw in some of the hummus to jazz it up. I got Darrius' recommendation of the Chicken Tippy; the cornbread pancake underneath the chicken was wonderful, chicken very flavorful, and the side of cajun fries had a solid heat and crunch. The only thing keeping this from a 5 star was that I could've used some more sauce drizzled on the chicken to counter the dry nature of the cornbread, but we're certainly going to come back here more and I know I won't be disappointed! 

Overall, a pleasant and quaintly atmosphere for a casual Friday night date, great staff, and tasty food!

They have the BEST beyond burger I've had in a long time! You have lots of options for toppings which is bound for anyone to like it! Their homemade chips are delicious as well as their fries. They also home make their ranch which is delicious.

OK. This place is amazing. Their options are unique but not so unique that it doesn't looking appetizing. I got a vegan option of pesto melt but made it non vegan by adding chicken. This sandwich was amazing. It had good amounts of each topping of presto, provolone, and tomatoes. The side salads are kinda basic but still good. I recommend the Dijon mustard.

What a great local brewery located in the heart of downtown with street parking and great huge windows to look out at while dining. 
I came about 2:30 pm on a Saturday and it wasn't busy. I was able to go inside with my tween and we noticed all the great woodwork and art on the wall. Very clean inside with plenty of tables that were large enough to fit 4 or more people and some tables by the window. Greeted by a young lady and seated right away. The waiter came to our table quickly and we ordered waters, I don't like when they come so fast and ask if we know what we'd like to drink and eat. For never being here before I def needed some time over the food menu and extensive beer menu. After all, i came to have a beer. 
After deciding on a few small appetizers and a beer I noticed that hey also offered croaker specials on this day and after tasting their light crisp beer they had on tap, sorry forgot the name, I ordered one to go to to enjoy later with some friends.  Appetizers came within a good time frame and we weren't over impressed by them. The chips were meh and the soup didn't really wow me. It came out a little more more hot than like warm and it def could have been more heat hot. 
The beer however, hit the spot and if I was out with some friends I would have enjoyed a couple more. Decent prices on food and beer and would be a great place to hang out with friends or go on a date. 
I bet this place gets packed with college kids on the weekends. 
They do have a separate bar room that is a good decent size with tables and bar stools. Plenty of nostalgia based beer signs hang all over but it's right off the dining room and you can hear the noise from the bar seeping into the atmosphere of the dinning room. I wouldn't doubt that when this place gets busy it would be pretty loud inside. Sadly there isn't any outside seating but the windows help.  It is a bit dark inside due to all the wood and dim lighting. 
I cannot say for our experience that staff was super friendly or had personality and the food was mediocre but a great place to try local beer and support local business with I love. Def worth giving it a try and have fun with friends or a date night.

Very yummy! They had some amazing fish and chips and the service was amazing. The waiter didn't talk much and was very fast. Overall, the food was pretty good. It wasn't very special but still very good. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for an average type but very good meal.

We came here for Saturday lunch, no beer.  They accommodated our newborn wonderfully, and i think actually it's a pretty kid friendly downtown spot.  East End is also good but this is closer to farmers market.

The staff are great and the food was inventive and interesting.  Even my iced tea was brewed strong, which is actually rare.  The bbq chicken on a masa corn fritter cake was inventive and the burgers were good, if a bit salty.  See pics.

I'd come back anytime but maybe especially for their mon night beer flight promotion.

Was very happy to find this brewery on St. Patty's Day as our family was looking for a local joint on our last leg of our Indy trip.  It is right on the main strip in Lafayette, and very spacious.  They were able to seat us right away as well.  A LONG list of brews, which was what my husband and I were hoping for!  A kid's menu, which is what our boys were hoping for:) We came to realize very quickly that BBQ is just as big in Indy as it is farther south, so we went with the local grub...and it did not disappoint.  My husband and I actually split a plate of BBQ chicken on cornbread - delicious!  The boys really loved their cheeseburgers as well:)

Definitely worth a stop if you are in the Lafayette area!
A great find while passing through town, the menu has a good mixture of items and they have plenty house-brewed beers. Try a flight, you will not be disappointed.

The food here is excellent.   It's a brewery first, but the restaurant is no afterthought. 

Service is spotty at best.   We never figured out who are assigned server was as no less than 5 people interacted with us during our visit (it also didn't help that all the male servers had the exact same facial hair).

I went here with some friends to get a flight of beer while on a day trip to Lafayette.  It's been around for a long time and was pretty busy for 2:00 on a Saturday afternoon.  We were able to get a table in the bar and were quickly approached by our server to get us some waters and take our order.  He was super helpful as we tried to determine which beers to order. 

Our beers took a little bit of time to come out, however since we ordered 4 flights of beers thats understandable.  The beers though, were horrible!  I was so disappointed.  I really enjoy beer, and two of them were undrinkable.  I ordered a pint of one of the two that I could drink.  I did tell our server how much I hated one, and he was so nice and brought me a small taste of another to try.  I didn't really like that one either, but it was still very nice of him!

Our spinach dip was amazing!  It had a nice kick to it and was a very large appetizer.  They brought us more chips because there was so much dip.  

Overall a nice place, but not one I'd really go back to just because there are others out there that are better.

From the outside this establishment looks hip and standard for a brewery restaurant. When you walk inside the look is more dated, less clean and less focus on aesthetics. There is seating outside. We asked to be seated outside and the manager who helped us at the host station said there were no outdoor seats available and laughed and said he had no idea when I asked what the wait for outdoor seating was... ok. I guess it's crazy to think the manager cares. He actually said he doesn't check to see when tables are finishing like that would be crazy talk. 
  So we sat inside and were seated immediately. Sunday is kids free night at the brewery so it was pretty loud inside. The menus are sticky and not clean. And there was not a beer menu on the tables. They were out of 2 including the only wheat beer they had. One at our table wanted a wheat or Hefeweizen and I could hear someone at the table next to us sling as well.   After we place our orders another server came by, greeted us and let us know he was our server. Okay... we let him know we already ordered and he said yeah it's chaotic tonight. So far I was thinking their management is seriously lacking here. 
  On to the food...  

  I tried a flight of beers also
Lacafe- red ale with coffee. Nice mellow beer with coffee hints. This is good if you don't want a stout but would like coffee nuances. 
Jacktown amber- more traditional red ale. I'm getting the feeling these beers won't punch you with flavor but they are balanced, drinkable and pleasant.  Got the toffee notes 
Black angus oatmeal stout - first notes a little sour followed by toasted oatmeal. Not great but not bad. Nothing to set it apart.

I can't believe this place isn't rated higher. We stumbled upon it just by chance, and I'm so glad we did.  We are in town for our first parents' weekend - let the festivities begin!  

When we walked in we were immediately greeted and seated by a friendly hostess. The decor is simple, and comfortable, with lots of wood and exposed duct-work. My one complaint: the front dining room had carpeting. I dislike carpeted dining areas, (but it won't impact my review). 

On to the food.  My steak sandwich had an interesting twist: nacho sauce.  My wife had the turkey club.  The kids each had build your own burgers.  Everything was tasty, but the star of the meal was the side order of cheddar jalapeño hash browns.  They were delicious!  

But wait, there's more... 

They brew their own beer.  We sampled their stout, IPA, and lager.  All were excellent.  

Service was a little slow, but super friendly. 

To summarize: Tasty food, good beer, comfortable decor, and friendly service.  I'm already looking forward to my next visit.

reviews.text:
This was my first visit to a Lotsa which I really enjoyed.  The facility is very clean, large, socially distanced, open and white!  The subway tile in the wall really brightens the restaurant.

Upon coming in the facility you have to figure out where to go.  It's not obvious.  One you get funneled down the shoot...you get to the kiosk to enter tour order.  The menu is simple.  The order entry process was actually pretty easy.  There was only two staff in the restaurant at the time.  One was focused on making food.  The order caller was very friendly and helpful.

For dinner we ordered several items.  The Apple Pie wings were outstanding.  The wings were very moist.  They weren't very large and there were only 6 wings for $8. The BBQ sauce was nice...not overpowering but added a nice taste without being dripping wet.

The Caesar salad pizza was very innovative.  The Caesar salad was fresh.  The dressing was much like you expect.  The amount was just right to give the salad taste without ruining it.  The cheesy bread underneath was outstanding.  The bread was soft and the cheese was delicious!

The Caprita pizza was also delicious.  The tomato sauce was light with a slightly spicy taste.  It had a mild tomato taste that was much more mild than a normal marinara sauce.  The toppings very light but fresh and tasty.  The balsamic glaze was strong in taste but had a wonderful accept to the cheese, sauce and veggies.

I was disappointed that the fountain soda machine was out of service.  They gave me a bottled Diet Coke from the cooler. I had to ask for a cup and ice because the bottle was warm..and the soda was very flat.

Overall...I really liked Lotsa.  Give it a try!

Pizza on Purdue's campus is absolutely nothing to write home about. Sure, I'm an IU grad so I'm biased but outside of Mad Mushroom, you really don't have options. At all. So when my friend and I visited 2 years after gradating, we were amazed to se an addition to West Lafayette in Lotsa Pizza.

The name might need help, but the pizza definitely doesn't. While we had our sights set on a food tour, we knew we wanted pizza so we kept it light, splitting one pizza to save room for dessert. I have a policy with new places- KISS. Never experiment, and always veer towards a margherita-esque option to judge fairly. The same rules applied here.

Current Boilermakers are pampered with this pizza: with a wood-fired crust that reminds me of MOD in Indianapolis, this pizza is the veritable opposite of the Merriam-Webster definition of 'college pizza.' It's well-crafted, unique, balanced, and NOT over-indulgent.

Sure, it won't cut it when you're hungover, but that's what Mad Mush cheesestix are for. This is a pizza you can build into your life in regular intervals and proportions without risking the Freshmen 15.
Awesome. Great value for the price. My Herbivore pizza was delicious and so was the house salad. Simple. Excellent.
Decent campus fare. The personal pizzas here are square and the cheese carmelizes near the crust. A bit greasy. The bread is fluffy, though.

It's alright. It is reasonably priced for what you get, but what you get isn't ideal. The edges are very crispy, but the bottom was not. It was barley browning and very gummy. The crust was not cooked all the way through. What was cooked through was nice.

Gluten Free Review: 

I was pleasantly surprised that when ordering I was asked whether my gluten free order was due to preference or allergy.  Without being asked or prompted, staff changed gloves and scrubbed the oven before baking my pizza by itself in the rotating oven.  They use Udi's crust, if you are curious.  
I had the Bianca, and loved it.  Lots of cheese, and the crust was not too cracker-like.   Actually could bend it like good New York pizza.  Flavor was excellent.  I had mine finished with salt and fresh basil.  
Drinks are serve yourself, from one of those Coke choose your own adventure kind.  

Atmosphere is what you would expect from a college town.  Not fancy, but serviceable.  All sizes of tables to accommodate all party sizes:   Not too loud, even on a Saturday after the game.   I would like salt and pepper and parrmesan at the tables it's understandable that they would probably walk home with some student, so it's forgivable.  Staff was courteous and efficient.

So I ordered my pizza off DoorDash. It got here and it's super yummy, but it's missing the chicken and basil I ordered on it. 
I'll still eat it, but I'm sad it's  not what I ordered.

For my recent birthday, I chose Lotsa Pizza so that my family could select their own pizzas and know that they are safe since Lotsa offers gluten-free crusts. (The four of us all have Celiac Disease.)

Boy was I wrong.

The wait to order our pizza was long even though there were not that many people in line. The employees seemed overmatched. But that was not the worst part of our experience.

I made it clear to the employee taking our order that all four us were gluten-free due to allergy. For some reason, he only wrote Allergy on three of the sheets that accompany the pies. He made my older son's pizza on regular crust.

Fortunately, the guy who puts the pies in the oven discovered the error and they remade the pizza. However, that was not communicated to us and when I went back to ask what was being done, I was completely ignored even though I was two feet away and politely saying, "Excuse me" to get his attention. Finally, another employee had the courage to make eye contact and assured me that he was remaking the pizza.

Still because of the time to remake the pizza, other pizzas with gluten crusts were put in the oven. That potential cross-contamination could be the reason that my son felt sick after eating.

Lotsa reasons to never return to this place.

Edit: Since I cannot reply directly to the owner's comment, I will do do here. No, sir, I do not want your offer of free pizza. Your employees made two of my family members sick because of negligence. As I said, we will not be back.

Yummy build your own pizza. The crust is perfect mix between crisp and chewy. 

Some confusion on getting the names mixed up- but other than that decent service.

We were in town for a local baseball game.  After the rain out, we headed out to try LSFP.  Having never been there, I was a bit intimidated as the instructions were not clear.  However, the staff was friendly and helpful.

We purchased a couple build your own pizzas and they were done quick.  I added some pesto sauce to mine and it was great.

I like that they have vegan cheese options, as my daughter has cheese allergies.  We will be back with her when we are in town next.

We stopped in Sunday 6:45p and ordered 2 pizzas. I made sure that I wanted both well done. Mentioned it twice. Didn't happen. Disappointed. The  man working the register and toppings and oven was overwhelmed. He was trying. The papers under pies had well done wrote on. 
There was a line of customers with only 3 employees . He got confused trying to sort another order.  That rotating stone is part of the issue. 35 years ago I had my own parlor. We had Blodgett ovens set at 425. with slate Never seen  this type.  The problem is management understaffing.  Food was tasty. Need to ID pies in oven. Just a suggestion.

Disappointed in this. Ordered a make your own with pepperoni, sausage, and a few toppings. Standard red sauce, cheese, and crust. I picked up a piece and it was really floppy, which I passed off at first. Tried eating it was a fork but it was impossible because the pieces would just stretch like glue. I uploaded two photos to better show. The pile you see at the top is an entire piece + crust included - not just the toppings. The second picture is trying to hold a piece up to show how flimsy it is. The top cheese is hardly melted and the pepperoni looks like it just came out of the package..so I'm wondering if it's even fully cooked. Completely disappointed.

Went in here on a Tuesday for lunch and I've gotta say that I enjoyed the experience. I was feeling a bit adventurous and so, got the lunch special for the day - the Bianca for $5.99. Now that is a pretty good deal for their pizzas. The location is fantastic, service was great, price was decent and the pizzas themselves tasted pretty good. I really liked the crust. That being said, I was initially charged full price even though I asked for the lunch special and I had to ask for it to get changed. I'll be going back for their pizzas, though.

I've been here half a dozen times and it's always good. Pizza of your choice, nice staff, fresh ingredients, clean seating area, etc... The crust is thin but firm, and the edges slightly chewy. Spot on. Lotsa has the fancy Coca-Cola machine and I'm a sucker for vanilla Diet Coke. Lotsa stands above the rest in a crowded pizza market. For me it's a favorite go-to lunch in general. The daily special is a great deal: pizza of the day and drink for ~$8.50.
Love their ranch. Cheap good pizza if you like different type of topping compared to the basic ones.

Lotsa failure. Ordered two pizzas online, to be ready in 20 minutes. Arrived at the 20 minutes-later mark only to see people who arrived AFTER us place their orders and receive their pizzas before us. Frustrating. A few employees had moments when they could have been throwing ready-made pizzas into the oven but did not. Didn't even have our garlic sticks ready another 20 minutes later. 

Went to Mad Mushroom instead. You should do the same.

Top spot for pizza and definitely above all the cliche chains in the area. My BBQ Chicken was made in a few good minutes and the service was good enough for a college town eatery. Prices here are great, gluten free crust available, menu has original flavors, and place has plenty of space for large groups but wish there was more informative pricing on adding toppings for a custom pie. I'd like to see other sizes available too since a group having to order their own personal pizzas each gets really hassled and frustrating trying to make each person pick a topping and hope they all eat everything. That's obviously getting very picky. Only real issues are limited and awkward parking especially on busy weekends and watching the nice people try to handle the sardines (c'mon guys it's a great salty addition completely transformed in flavor when it gets on pizza.... OK might still be just for me but I'm all about that option here! few other spots in the whole city offer sardines on pizza).

I am especially pleased to see a build your own stone fire pizza chain come to the small college town of West Lafayette. No other establishment would've fit better in orange leaf's place (RIP). 

Everything was good, but if I had to pick something that limited my pizza love, then it'd be the 5 free toppings. At Blaze and Pieology, they do free unlimited toppings. Maybe lotsa will change in the future, but I mean, I guess you really shouldn't be getting more than 5 toppings (because you'll get fat like me). 

Loved it, will be coming back often.

I have been to Lotsa about three times so far, and it has always been a great experience. I love these types of places, and I'm glad to see West Lafayette finally has a good make your own pizza venue. Also, for it to be located on campus is a dream come true. 

If you've never been to one of these places before, the process is fairly simple - you pick a pizza dough, a type of sauce, your cheese, and toppings. They then fire the pizza in the oven for a few minutes. All pizzas are personal sized. Once pulled out of the oven, you can then add a finishing sauce/ingredient. (Such as olive oil, ranch, arugula, etc.)

I happen to honestly really enjoy this location. Other make your own pizza places tend to have very thin crust in my experience, but Lotsa's dough tends to have more volume and is a nice compromise between super thick crust (which would probably take longer to cook properly) and paper thin crust (which ends up tasting like a cracker). 

The selection of toppings is more than sufficient, and you can get pretty creative. I'm a big fan of Hawaiian pizzas, so I typically order red sauce with ham, pineapple, and ricotta cheese. Sometimes I do mushrooms instead. It's good no matter what! I've never found myself needing a finisher, but I may have to try the pesto someday.

It's an incredibly filling meal for the price you pay. For a make your own, prices run at $8 unless you add a premium topping such as shrimp. Compared to some of the other prices on campus, this is incredibly reasonable. If you weren't particularly hungry, and were just looking for a small bite to eat, I could even see sharing one of these between two people - it's a good amount of food.

Lotsa stays open late some nights, which is definitely nice if you're looking for a late night meal. I've only gone for lunch before, however.

The interior is clean and modern, and there is a good amount of seating. 

Overall, I am so glad to have Lotsa as an option on campus. I will definitely be returning this upcoming semester!

Visited for the first time (for lunch) on 4/4/18 and it was a good experience. Placing your order is a lot like ordering a sandwich from Subway. Positives: you can build your own pizza or salad, or you can choose from specials they've already designed. It was a surprisingly fast cook, which was appreciated since I only had an hour for lunch. The size of the pizza was a surprise too, and the variety of crusts was a plus (regular, wheat or gluten-free). They have daily specials too, which knocks a couple bucks off. Overall the flavor of the pizza sauce was good and the toppings were tasty.
Downside
I observed the person on the cash register taking customer payments and moving food around when it came out of the oven. He did not have food handling gloves on then, nor later when I was leaving. 
I would visit again to try a different type of pizza.

reviews.text: We grabbed their pork butt special and it was the best! Brought it home, shred it, then added some Sweet Baby Rays! Man, best meal. And, we have left overs

We continue to be impressed with their service. Everyone is so kind and willing to help.  Sometimes we have large orders, or ask them to cut our meat a certain way and they graciously do it for us. Their meat is the best in town!  I refuse to buy meat anywhere else now, as no one can beat the quality or selection.
Wasn't impressed. Food was bland and environment was empty and cold. Nothing to write home about. Basic bbq

This place is an absolute diamond and not too far from the highway.

Super friendly service that moved quick.  We stopped in on our way to Chicago from the southern part of the state.  It was between lunch and dinner so they weren't very busy but the food reflected a quality that was always there.

They were out of 1 item but that lead me to one of the greatest discoveries in BBQ - their pork chop.  My lawd the chop was huge, but most importantly it was DELICIOUS.  I hope they have some for my next visit because I can't keep this secret any longer.  Seriously - forget what you think you know and try it on your next visit.

I was hungry and wanted some leftovers for dinner so I also ordered a slab of ribs and some mac 'n cheese.  I'd say the mac 'n cheese was decent (this may have been a casualty of the timing of our arrival) and at least worth it.  The ribs were awesome and definitely worth a trip on their own if the pork chop hasn't given you the itis already.

Thanks for the good eats D&R!  You have my applause and my future business whenever I'll be driving by.

I love the meat here, but they're about to lose my business. I come here weekly and ask for the chicken breasts to be filetes, or a whole chicken to be cut up. The owner or manager, whoever he is, acts like it's the worst thing a customer could ask for. I'm not asking for anything they don't know how to do. He always behaves like it takes time away from him or it's such a problem, even when he isn't busy doing anything. I need to find another meat market with good quality meats because it's absurd that they act this way.

We stopped in for lunch mid-day on a Sunday on a our way back from a weekend in Chicago and found D&R Market based on all the positive yelp reviews. It's not far off from the highway and the perfect place to stop for a hearty lunch. We split the smoked chicken with 2 sides. Everything in the hot and cold cases looked delicious! We enjoyed the smoked chicken with the broccoli salad and cucumber salad. You and pick and choose your own barbecue sauce. The sweet ending to our meal was that the owner stopped by and gave us 2 free desserts and thanked us for our business. Being from Kentucky we saw this a true southern hospitality. Thank you for the good meal and tasty banana pudding and oreo pudding dessert!
This place is awesome.  Get a great meal every time.   Wednesday is Burnt Ends day, better get there early.  Brisket is killer as well.

Stopped at D&R for BBQ quick lunch on our road trip and decided to look into the market. Great little place with an impressive butcher shop. We bought a few cheeses and salami looking forward to our evening cocktails at the beach.  Great selection of foodie munchies and many other products. The Habanero Ghost Pepper cheese is out of this world if you are like me and like to suffer haha .  I will be stopping by again if I find myself in Lafayette  Indiana

The service is great. The prices are a little steeper than I anticipated. The meats were pretty good. I had the brisket and chicken with a side of beans. My coworkers had a potato salad that they loved. Overall it was pretty standard BBQ.

This is a fantastic specialty store. Easy to find and has a great private parking lot. I was a bit confused that there are three entrances to D&R but was easily pointed to the right door when I asked in the restaurant. The market is small and has a lot of cool items to look at it's also busy and the isles aren't That side so getting around is a little hard. The deli counter had wonderful prepared dishes to buy buy the pound, specialty cheeses and meats all at amazing prices. They also had prepackaged meats in another case to look at and several of them were reduced. I picked up three smoked pork chops prepared each one a different way and they were each wonderful. They also carry fresh veggies and condiments to make an entire meal I was happy to run across this place while on my recent road trip 
Friendly staff throughout the store makes this place a breeze to come in and pick up some great items. I would recommend going and wish I lived closer.

WOW! Probably the best BBQ in Lafayette in my opinion. I've shopped at the store for meat for years, but for some reason never have eaten in the restaurant. What a mistake waiting so long. I can't speak for all of their items but the Brisket is to die for. Super tender and moist, with a wonderful flavor. They gave us samples of several sides to try and all were top shelf. Mac and cheese, and green beans were my favorites, but also LOVED the baked beans. They gave us a sample of Chocolate Thunder ( I believe they called it ) it was fantastic as well. Portion sizes were also very generous, had to loosen my belt for the ride home. I will definitely be back!!!

Traveling through on our way to Chicago and stopped to check out the food.  We were amazed by how delicious the brisket was.  It's the best brisket I've had outside of my time of living in Texas. If you're in the area it's a must stop! The service was equally as good. They were very polite and gave us free samples of some of their food just for stopping.

Stopped in with my mom earlier this week after reading they had good food. I had brisket while my mom picked meatloaf. Both were good, but that meatloaf! It was delicious. And my favorite of the sides we chose was the baked potato salad. It was even better than my homemade version. 

While you're in the area make sure you stop to check out the grocery. Lots of unique items you won't find anywhere else.

Wow!!!    The only way to describe the meatloaf that I tried here....I took it upon fellow yelpers.  To see just how good this really was!    Walked in on a Monday around 530 pretty quiet was greeted immediately as soon as I decided which door to go in just wanted to try the meatloaf but their special was the dinner with 2 sides for 999 which I thought great deal. Glad I did Mac and cheese great baked taste a lot of cheeses.  Other side baked beans has like this unreal brisket in it and the MEATLOAF taste was out of this world like a steak loaf in my life I have now dined at over 3300 different restaurants and this sure racks up in the top 20!!!.......do yourself a favor stop by DandR and try their high quality and quantity great meats and sides you will not go away hungry nor not satisfied can't wait to come back this summer and dine inside and try the desserts next!!   Thank you!!

Bomb. Ass. Bbq. Great catering/restaurant joint beside the market. Smart move. 

The meat counter is superb and the people who work here, top notch. Thanks for all the years of service.

These ribs were THE meatiest moistest morsels I've tasted in years!  And the brisket was a substantial spice of heavenly meatiness.  No sauce needed but if you do decide to dabble a bite into one, go for the spicy  as it will tickle your tongue !  

And don't forget to stop next door to their meat market to fill up your 'frig and freezer!
You just have to go there. Great food and such a friendly atmosphere. The brisket is amazing and they cater with high quality at a very reasonable price.
Best place for bbq that I've had so far in Lafayette. Very flavorful brisket. I recommend the baked beans, corn bread, Mac and cheese, and corn for sides.

We brought our dog to Purdue Small Animal Hospital for some testing and found this place on Yelp. Do not skip coming here. Best beef brisket I've ever had in my life. I had the meal, my husband had the sandwich which was more than a meal. Corn bread is amazing. it was closing time and Jeff actually gave me some collard greens to take home for tomorrow's lunch and a little leftover brisket. If I could give it more than five stars I would. Thanks Jeff.
Only butcher shop I know which has this selection In this neighborhood.  Meats are actually delicious and I use them as much as possible.  Actual local business unlike so many places these days.

reviews.text: Reviewing a restaurant in the middle of the coronavirus shutdown is always a bit sad - barricaded sections, stacked chairs, lights dimmed, and one lonely front end person handing out take out orders. We finally headed in to get some tacos on a Taco Tuesday (which El Torito does fabulously). The order was everything that we've come to expect - fresh, tasty ingredients, good sauces, quick, friendly service, great prices. Ordering is by phone only (so we sat outside in our car and called the number on the front window). We were especially impressed by the consistent and genuine smiles, even under some very challenging circumstances.
The food quality and quantity were amazing. Service was quite and all the necessary precautions for social distancing were well adhered to. One of the best Mexican food joints around Lafayette.

Ordered carry out today. Dining room closed due to Corona Virus.  Everything we ordered was fantastic.  Chicken Chimichangas, (Huge) Mexican burger, Chicken Fajitas (generous and tender), authentic Chicken Soft Tacos,  & a Steak Burrito as big as your head.  Cashier was extremely friendly and accommodating.  If you want a fancy atmosphere, this isn't your place. If you like authentic Mexican food with generous portions,  I think you will be very pleased.  Can't wait to dine in next time.
Taco Tuesday. We arrived starving and left with happy tummies. The food was delicious. We are coming back. Probably forever.
Another update - I love a good buffet! El Torito now has a lunch and dinner buffet Wednesday through Sunday. Their regular delicious menu is also available. A great deal for a great variety of food!

My first time here and we decided to go on a Tuesday for their dollar taco deal... but looks like its gone from $1.09 to $1.29. Regardless, it's still a pretty good deal! I tried out the chorizo, steak, shrimp and chicken taco's. They were all great, despite the fact that I'm not usually huge on corn tortillas. If you're going with a good appetite, I'd recommend at least 3-4 tacos. 
I tried some of their tacos with just cilantro and onion, and for some I amped it up with cheese and tomatoes etc. I kind of liked keeping it simple, I feel like you get the flavours more than when you load it with a ton of toppings. Their sauces also add a kick. 
This is definitely a hole in the wall, cheap eats kind of place. The food is great and service is fantastic. 

Would I go back? Yes. 
P.S. on Tuesday's they only accept cash. All other days they take credit card as long as it meets a minimum, otherwise they add on 50 cents.

Fun little hole in the wall with a a huge menu, incredibly friendly service, and classic Spanish fütball on the TV (sometimes quite serious dramas playing not sure why that's allowed in a family restaurant). My parents dishes were huge for the price and very tasty especially my mom's vegan burrito. My sister noticed the beef and her dish was quite tough - must have been an older or not so decent cut because mine was fine. The interior atmosphere is just like a spot in Mexico I've been to. The Tuesday $1 tacos and amazing! And horchata is an authentic treat I'll take any day over the American soda products. Will be back!

This was my first time trying this place. I will definitely be back! Atmosphere is nothin special and very hole in the wall, but the food was great. It was my first time having a huaraches. Wow! Super filling, steak and chorizo with all the toppings on a masa pancake. The grilled peppers were an awesome touch. The red one was spicy and the green on was mild. The salsa was legit. Both sauces on the table were served nice and cold. Spicy but not too spicy. I enjoyed them both. I can't wait to try more tasty, authentic Mexican food.

So glad we found this place!!! Definitely as authentic as it gets. Although we were a little confused as to where the location was because of the lack of signage, our expectations of the food did not fall short. The tortillas are fresh (not dry!!) and the meat has so much flavor!! Service is quick too and the employees are really nice!! 

On Tuesdays tacos are only $1! Cash only starting next Tuesday :) The place gets packed and there's not a lot of seating, but it's worth the wait. We'll definitely be back!

You'll find me here on a Tuesday for their $1.09 taco special! That's all that really needs to be said. Although the restaurant is not much to talk about and the location isn't the greatest, the food more than makes up for it. In all fairness, I've never had anything but their tacos and so, I can't speak for anything else on the menu. Their tacos are just . My favorites are the al pastor, asada and chorizo. Their sauces have a nice kick to them. And the service is really good. Did I already say that you can find me here on a Tuesday?

I went here for my birthday dinner with family. It's a very small place with only a few booths and tables. When we walked in, we were greeted with a smile by our server. I ordered the fajita mix with corn tortillas and a horchata. While we waited for our entrees to come, we had tortilla chips and salsa brought to our table. The salsa was actually quite good and didn't have that ketchup-like consistency that salsas and some other place tend to have. However, if you're not a cilantro person, I'm not sure you'll like the salsa cause there's quite a bit of it in the salsa.

The food comes out in a timely matter. My fajitas were delicious as was my fried beans and rice that came with my meal. The horchata was amazing. In fact, I had to resist the urge to gulp the whole thing in one go!

Overall, an excellent authentic Mexican restaurant with an intimate feel and absolutely delicious food. I definitely plan on returning.

I knew this cheerful little place was going to be something special when I saw they had a section of huaraches on the menu, dressed with meat, avocado, crunchy vegetables, and more. My excitement was confirmed when they set down squeeze bottles of two quite spicy red and green salsas on the table. My biggest complaint is that the huarache was so large, and yet so tasty, especially with the salsas, that I ate too much of it. 

And perhaps most importantly, they are very nice to messy children.

Love their tacos and burritos. Home made hot sauce is pretty damn good. However it seems lately when I order to go there's an issue. One instance, they gave my order to someone else. Another occasion, they didn't have their card swipe so I had to leave to get cash.

One of our new favorite taco spots. $1 on Tuesdays, but cash only. Their tortillas stand out! Salsas are good and my go to taco order- carnitas, al pastor, and asada were all great. James enjoyed his lengua & carnitas and Jack likes the chicken. It's a small spot so be prepared to wait for a table on Tuesdays when the students are in town.

Great food. Great service. Found this place on Yelp while working out of town. Went here based on wanting Mexican food and the previous reviews matched up with what we were looking for. It is a small restaurant that is easy to miss if you are not looking for it. The salsa was fresh and the chips were served warm. We both got fajitas and they were awesome. Fresh made tortillas too? Not sure but they tasted like they were. Highly recommend.

Taco tuesday was hoppin!  $1 tacos with some qualifications (see pics) but very good food and service.  You can dine in but the room is a bit run down and you can you the direct take out order option inside, set up like a taco truck.  We availed ourselves of the steak, shrimp, pork and chicken tacos and guac. All were good.  Chicken, normally too dry/ tasteless to me was well seasoned in - i think- achiote.  Guac was good but maybe too watery?  They have aguas frescas and horchata.  We will back for sure- but probably just for take-out.
The food is fantastic and the service was so welcoming! It's a small place but filled with life and warmth! If you're looking for authentic food with great flavor this is the place to come.

Found this restaurant by accident. 
So glad we did. Fabulous food. Friendly waitress. Food came in a timely manner and was hot, fresh and reasonably priced. Would highly recommend if you are looking for authentic Mexican food. Delicious.

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant around Lafayette and West Lafayette!! It's the most authentic Mexican food I have ever had. I come here almost every week, especially on Tuesdays for their 1.09 tacos! I've shown this place to multiple friends and they have all fell in love. The staff is incredibly friendly and I always have a good time when I come here. I definitely recommend the tacos (get extra to bring home) and my friends love the enchiladas! The sopas is also amazing.

Based on Yelp reviews we had dinner here tonight, and it was great food!  They had a special - 2 burritos or 2 tacos with rice and authentic refried beans for $5.99,  what a deal that was absolutely delicious!  My wife's steak corn tortilla tacos were awesome and the steak tasty & tender.  The restaurant is very small, but the service was friendly and prompt.   This is our new go to for Mexican in Lafayette!!

images.alt: Photo of Freddy's Frozen Custard & Steakburgers - West Lafayette, IN, United States. double california style steak burger with added pickles
Photo of Freddy's Frozen Custard & Steakburgers - West Lafayette, IN, United States. California style Steakburger and fries.

reviews.text: Been to several other Freddy's and this one is consistently good! The steak burgers are thin and crispy just like they should be! I prefer the California style which includes their Freddy's sauce. The fries are crispy and always perfectly seasoned. The hot dogs are great as well. Love they are served on a slice of toasted garlic bread. Great flavor and different for sure. Can't ever seem to have enough room for the custard sundaes but perhaps next time I will skip dinner and get the Peanut Buttercup Banana Sundae. The staff is super friendly and all standard Covid regulations are enforced.
Great burgers and fries. Love the crispy edges on the well cooked burgers. We shared a custard for dessert and it was great. Wish we had Freddy's (or Culver's) in Pittsburgh!

I've been to this location a few times now. It's definitely improving!

As others have mentioned, back in 2019 when it was new, it was painfully slow. Thankfully, it's not quite as bad anymore. However, if you show up around peak dining hours, you can expect to wait in the drive-through for 20 minutes.

As far as the food quality goes, Freddy's is pretty good for fast-food!  It's certainly a step above the top-3 fast food burger chains that everyone is familiar with. That being said, you're also paying a couple of bucks more!

Burgers: Good! Freddy's has a unique technique when it comes to grilling their burgers. They smash them down super-thin, which creates a crispy crust around the edges.  It's a nice touch!  However, that also means the burger patties themselves are wafer thin, so it can feel like you're not getting a lot of actual volume for your dollar. 

Fries: Bad. Freddy's only serves super-thin, plain, straight-cut shoe string fries. If you like that particular style, you're in luck.  However, I personally do not care for them. They're too thin, too bland, too boring. They remind me of the cheap, soggy, flimsy fries we used to get served at the school cafeteria. 

Chicken: Decent quality, bland taste. Once again, the quality of Freddy's ingredients seems to be a notch above the competition.  They serve chicken tenders and breasts instead of the standard reconstituted nuggets served at other burger joints. While the quality is good, the variety is lacking. Looking for spicy chicken or something with a bit more flavor?  You wont get it at Freddy's.  Their spicy chicken is just the regular chicken with spicy sauce slathered on top of it.

Others: Freddy's also serves hot dogs, frozen custard, chilli, cheese curds, onion rings, etc - but I haven't tried them, so I can't review those items.

Overall, if you're willing to pay an extra couple of bucks, I'd say Freddy's is probably preferable to the more established burger chains like McD's and Bking. However, it doesn't even come close to the flavor of specialty burger joints like AJ's or Five Guys.

Their choice of ingredients, passion for yumminess and customer service are what makes Freddy's our choice of a local hamburger shop. And A+ for cleanliness.

From their burgers to their seasoning for fries, you can tell that the owner is serious about serving good fast food.

This was our second time. First went because of a recommendation from a friend.

Duaine and Shey's friendliness and service were greatly appreciated! We will return!

I was pretty excited for the opening of Freddy's.  We go to Meijer/Menards pretty frequently, so I watched it from groundbreaking to opening.  When I actually ate there, I was shocked that there was a 30 minute line out the door, but it was fairly near opening, they had hired temps in the parking lot to help direct people, and I generally forgive that sort of thing.  The employees were pretty clearly still in training mode.

Now I've been there a couple of times, ordered some different things, and can say, "Eh, it's okay."  Basically, I'm comparing it with the other frozen custard + burger options in town.  In general, it's a bit more expensive than their competition, and the quality/taste is just about the same.  So I guess I'll go back, but I'm not going to make a special trip for it.
I've been there lots of times, I live close. Food is always good, service is exceptional! All are very friendly and clean.. will be going back.

Sllllooooooowwwwwww.  Always slow.  Painfully slow.  It is the only fast food on the far west side so people still eat here.  The food's ok - fry sauce is good.  But be ready to wait for at least 20 minutes - drive thru or in the store.  Just waiting for another fast food restaurant to open up nearby!

I'm impressed.  My first Freddys 
Steakburger bigger than the bun.
Fries are tasty.
Definitely will be back to try the custard.

First time at Freddy's. 6 PM. Not that busy. Lots of staff on hand. Food was really good. Food prep service was good and timely.  Tables were all either occupied or encrusted with crud. I mentioned this to the man who was calling out the completed orders and someone came out with a wet rag, set it on a table and proceeded to wander around the dining room. Moseyed back and forth and eventually half heartedly wiped a few tables.  I could have had all of those tables spotless in about 7 minutes. Folks, it's the little things that keep customers coming back or make them stay away.  I know employing teenagers is tough, but if that's your business model, figure it out - fast.
I ordered  a doubled and got 2 paper thin burnt patties smh, not worth the price or taste at all.

Food is really good. Service is subpar. Frustrating when you wait 30 minutes for your food and they forgot to put toppings on your sandwich. Always busy, always slow. Inconsistent with getting my order right. Been here about 5 times and it's been wrong twice. Food taste really great though.
New burger Place in West Lafayette opened Sep 2019. California style double was delicious and the Cookies & Cream shake was great. I'll be back.

So good! My husband and I ate there tonight, and although they were extremely busy, the food was amazing. There was a bit of a wait once we ordered our food (to be expected since the restaurant & drive-thru were packed). We were worried that the food may be cold since we had to wait so long, but that was not the case! Food was great, fries were great (and even thinner than McD's fries), and the service was great. Highly recommend the chocolate custard. I usually prefer vanilla custard, but my husband got chocolate & offered to switch me since I liked it so much (yay). Will definitely be back!

I just want to start by saying I have never once given a bad review (I'm pretty easy to please and will typically deal with a steak that isn't cooked the way I like it, etc.). I'm not writing this after one bad experience, but two experiences that will cause me to never go back. On April 4 I paid for onion rings and got fries. Initially I decided that was fine and I would just deal with losing the extra $ I paid for them. After deciding a second later that I paid for the onion rings, so I should get them, I called them back to see if I could go inside to grab them since the line was so long (thanks COVID). The person on the phone was extremely rude and didn't care about anything I had to say - so I drove on. Tonight, I thought I'd go get some ice cream. After ordering and having it read back right to me and it being correct on the screen, the woman at the window tried giving me the wrong ice cream. I told her it wasn't mine (trying to save them from giving me the wrong food). She asked for the name and I told her. She said no this is what you ordered. I said it was right on the screen and it was read back to me correctly & I asked for the receipt. She gave me literally the worst look I've ever seen someone give any person and didn't give me the receipt. I said forget it and took the WRONG ice cream & left. Super sad about this because I love Freddy's and have frequented there since they opened last fall.

reviews.text: Food was very good.  Service was not as good as other Culver's.  The order was not taken as if the person didn't know  the menu. Ordered a kids meal that comes with a cone and asked to have the cone right away. On arrival at window the order was a least 3.00 too high because they charged for the cone. They fixed this but it would be better to get it right. It is fairly new and a great addition to the West Lafayette.  Food temp. and every item was delicious. Good parking lot. Outdoor seating. Just need to work a little harder on drive thru.
