Photo of Sweet Revolution Bake Shop - Lafayette, IN, United States
Photo of Sweet Revolution Bake Shop - Lafayette, IN, United States. Iced Chai
Photo of Sweet Revolution Bake Shop - Lafayette, IN, United States. Croissants
Photo of Sweet Revolution Bake Shop - Lafayette, IN, United States. Day 1! Excited for this new bakery downtown. They've got delicious coffee as well and a great selection of tables & seating!
Photo of Sweet Revolution Bake Shop - Lafayette, IN, United States

reviews.text: Everything is always presented well and such good quality. A lot of times bakeries only master the presentation, but this also masters quality and taste!! I'm not even a cheesecake fan normally, but I really enjoyed theirs. There is street parking available as this is in downtown Lafayette. They are taking Covid seriously and allow a few customers inside at a time (as of this summer).

My boyfriend and i used to come here weekly before COVID. The staff is always lovely and the sweets are very good and fairly priced. I'm happy to support this business. Their oatmeal creme pies and macaroons are addictive; be warned!

I must have had a weak moment.  I rarely dole out 5 stars.  I was on my way to dinner, and stumbled upon this bakery.  Being a dessert snob has its pluses & minuses.  Most of the crap out there is easy to, as Dionne Warwick would say, walk on by.  HOWEVER, when I find something worth the calories, think Bruno Mars "that's what I like, that's what I like".

Their salted caramel oatmeal cookie is a must, as is their pear tart.  

It saddened me a bit to see the remaining inventory at the end of the day. YO!  Locals!  This place is a gem.  Support it.
Yum. The aroma will hit you first! The space is small but sweet, The macarons are so pretty and I typically try one or two as the flavors change. A good assortment of gluten free and vegan options.

It's so amazing that the small city of Lafayette has such a great option for a gluten-free and vegan bakery. Sweet Revolution offers a good variety of healthy options including muffins. I've had both the blueberry and chocolate varieties and both are outstanding. 

I've visited several times and every single employee is courteous, knowledgeable and pleasant. I will keep patronizing Sweet Revolution and enjoying their gluten free and vegan delicacies.

OMG THE PIES!!! I'm new to the area and was looking into local bakeries. I was intrigued when this one popped up and I'm so glad I went! They're situated in cute downtown Lafayette and are a small shop. Their products are delicious, though! I was blown away by the quality and flavors of the pies. 

Since my first visit, I've mostly purchased their mini pies and have tried Key Lime, Pecan, a mini fruit tart, and a mini and a mini cheesecake. My favorite so far is the fruit tart, since their custard is just out of this world. They also have a half-off section for what I assume was baked a day before. 

I highly recommend visiting this cute little bakery. You can't go wrong!

One of our absolute favorite spots for a treat and a delicious cup of coffee. The croissants and danishes are my favorite, with the boys usually choosing cheesecakes,
macarons, or the giant oatmeal cream pies. The quiche is amazing, as is everything else really. Savory or sweet, you can't go wrong. The owners are lovely people... a great family owned business to support. Such a treasure to have in Lafayette.

While planning a full day of exploration, I decided to stop in Lafayette for a cup of coffee.  This place popped up on my Yelp! search.  So, despite the title, I had "coffee shop" on my brain.  I grabbed a parking spot along the street (free) and headed inside.

After passing a pair of small tables on the sidewalk, I saw the interior was rather small.  Some seating, but I got the impression it was more of a "to go" place than "sit around and drink coffee all day" place.  Don't get me wrong; there are tables and chairs and they do make some specialty coffees.  I only wanted a black drip coffee which is self serve and served piping hot (tongue scald Yikes!!)

What I will say is that they do have a variety of baked goods and because it was still fairly early, I wanted to keep it light.  So I passed on all the rolls and breads and honed in on several macarons.  These are larger than most I've had and came in a variety of colors and flavors.  I liked that they would hold up over the course of the day without drying out.  

I enjoyed each of them that I tried.  Light outside with a bit of crunch.  Tasty filling inside that paired well with the cookie part.  Really nice macarons.

So, although I really enjoyed my cookies, I have to knock a point off for the coffee.  I ended up driving to my next destination and was finally able to drink without losing taste sensation.  Fortunately, the coffee did have good flavor.

Review #3000

Their bourbon banana cake is divine! Moist, rich and the crumble topping gives it a great texture. Good portion too. 

Also got the pigs in a blanket... super yummy! The sausage was perfectly garnished and the pastry melts in your mouth.

This place is not exactly cheap (the above two came to about 8 dollars) but I'd say it's worth the money. Will definitely be going back.

Such a fun local place. I like to stop by on Saturdays to grab something for dessert that evening and a goodie for Sunday. I'm always pleased when there are macarons and haven't had a bad flavor yet! They are so wonderful about explaining the menu and if I'm looking for something specific. I can't wait to bring my sister to try their oatmeal crème pie! When I'm feeling extra decadent, the salted caramel chocolate stout cheesecake is my go to.

Rude, rude, rude and incompetent!!!!!  The hostess might as well have said "hi welcome to sweet revolutions, we wish you hadn't come and can you leave ASAP!"  So, after tolerating the crappy attitude, we didn't even get our complete order.....but you can damn sure bet we got charged.  Oh, and I'll bet they didn't credit our account once they saw their error.  The place is overpriced but I have tolerated that to support local business....well those days are over.  I'm done done done with this company.

They did refund my money after I called.  The girl on the phone, who took my order in the first place had not even considered refunding my money.

I went to the farmers market two weekends in a row and both times I've tried something from here. I got a little pumpkin pie, and an oatmeal cream pie. The pumpkin pie was pretty standard, but it was super cute and had a Jack o lantern face on it, plus standard pumpkin pie is delicious. The oatmeal cream pie was out of this world. It was SO sweet. It was so amazing. It lasted me two days because it was so rich I could only take a few bites at a time.
I've also heard their strawberry rhubarb pie and their insanely sweet chocolates pie (which was the sweetest thing I've ever tasted in my life). I love this place so much.

I used to love this place. Very sad that's not the case anymore. My last several visits have been beyond disappointing. The staff has either been very short with me and or just straight rude. Didn't use to be like that. I dread going in anymore just because I don't want to be treated like that. Anything I've gotten with pie crust has been okay minus the crust being hard and almost inedible. Something must have changed. Unfortunately, I will not be returning. :(
Amazing service and DELIGHTFUL pastries. My favorite is the ham and cheese croissant. The way the croissant flakes reminds me of a European Pastry.

Having lived in downtown Lafayette for the past year now, I can attest to the quality and consistency of everything they serve up. 

They have the flakiest and tastiest quiche in the county, which has become my weekly Saturday lunch. It's gotta be some sort of black magic!

When I indulge, they have ample selection of tasty croissants, galettes, macarons, pies, and cookies. Everything I've eaten here has been delicious. 

Even better is the friendly staff who keep me entertained each time I visits

I can see why this place consistently gets a good review. The items here are yummy. We had trouble deciding what we wanted to get here. Came in on a Saturday as part of their stall at the Farmers Market right outside. They had a very rich banana cake with Fennel which we got. Very rich and very yummy! I would go back. They are not cheap, but the food is totally worth it. I haven't had a chance to try too many of their savoury items, but I'll be back for sure!

You'll want to try everything they make here. Places like this tend to be some lovely side plot to a Disney film - it's all so perfect, perfectly presented, perfectly tasting and delectable in all the right ways. I'm smitten. Great service, easy to find right in downtown heart, offers the strange wayward combination of vegan and desert too! The vegan cheesecake takes the cake for me. Not the familiar milky creamy but more nutty and sticky/silky, offers all the hope anyone would need hearing they have to cut out the middle man, uh, cow. Prices seem about normal for city living and sugary pleasures. Some spacious outdoor seating wouldn't go amiss!
The early bird truly catches the worm here! This is an EXCELLENT and FRESH bakery. I have tried almost everything visiting here often with friends. My favorite is their pot pie!

This place is a top notch bakery!  They had many gluten free choices including various cheesecakes, a chocolate torte, and muffins.  We ordered a non gluten free blueberry pie for his father for Fathers Day and it was one of the best blueberry pies I've ever had!  We treated ourselves to the gluten free chocolate cheesecake and it was very tasty.  I couldn't even tell it was gluten free!   He is celiac and had no problems eating here.  I very highly recommend this bakery not only for their delicious food but their outstanding customer service.  I ordered the pie by email and they were quick to respond.  The girl who checked us out st the store was very knowledgeable and pleasant.  We love when customer service is smiling and helpful and this place was for sure!  It's in a small shop so check the map before you go so you don't miss it.
Great family owned bakery right downtown! Love grabbing breakfast or a mid day treat here

reviews.text:
This is our first time visiting since they have reopened the seating area!
Pre-covid: dine in seating was very crowded and service was slow.
During Covid: they remodeled and put in coolers and hot stations for to go. You could come in and grab what you needed or call in an order for pickup or curbside delivery.
Now: they have socially distanced tables where you can grab your food from the cold/hot stations or order from the menu at the stand and sit at the tables to eat the food. You can eat quickly if you are in a hurry.
The food is always good and fresh!

Free parking next to their business.

Due to the pandemic, Sushi Don has completely reinvented its business model. They have removed seating in order to install refrigerated cases to sell sushi to go - they call it Grab and Go. There is still a small amount of seating. There is a bar down the middle of the space with counter stools and a few tables along the windows. The tables are the only remnant of the pre-Covid dining room.  The concept is exactly what it says. You go to the cases, choose your sushi rolls, sides and drink, and pay at the front counter. Kudos to Sushi Don for turning a pandemic into an opportunity.
Delicious as always, which is impressive since it was ready so quickly. I order online and it was ready in ten minutes. Everyone inside wore a mask!

Get here early.
Stand in line. (Yeah I know. Sucks.)
Eat fast, people are waiting for your table.
Pay, tip good and leave.

I am really disappointed. I previously gave Sushi Don a higher review because I really like this place. It's been a staple takeout place for me and my husband. However, I ordered the soy garlic chicken wings via GrubHub (through Yelp...) and got to the bottom of the pan and noticed some things that could have been just large chunks of garlic but they were peanuts. I have a peanut allergy (see note 1)The peanuts were not listed on the GrubHub menu or the menu pictures on Yelp that were added by the business owner. 

I called the restaurant just minutes ago. The person on the phone was friendly but a little flustered (which I understand. I didn't like being a "Karen" and it sucks to serve one too). He sympathized, having a nut allergy himself, and told me that he would try to contact the right people to get things updated and would make a note to give me free wings the next time I come. He also informed me that the pictures on Yelp have been outdated for months (see note 2) which is...not an excuse but explains how I got myself into my little conundrum.

Notes:
1. I understand that people may wonder why I didn't ask beforehand. My allergy is not severe, so I tend not to ask. Generally, I hope and expect people to keep that important information on their menu. Usually that's enough...I am going to get a bad eczema flare, that is for sure.
2. My previous review recounted a different incident with the outdated menu. This was in either the spring or early summer. While I'm sure some would say I should have been wiser and checked the menu again, it is the business' responsibility to keep that up to date. The customer shouldn't have to go running for the right information.

Driving through the area and was not expecting to find a sushi place that had great reviews ! We decided to try it for dinner since we had fast food otherwise. 

We got: 007 roll, Bond girl, and crab Rangoon. They were all very good !!! Definitely impressed with the sushi as it was fresh, flavorful, and unique combinations. 

It was ready in 15 min. They also had happy hour going on which means we scored 3 sushi rolls for only $21!!!! Bonus. That was a great deal.

Tonight was unacceptable. I spent $37 on a very disappointing experience. This was delivered, so maybe that had something to do with it. First- Heart Attack, normally delicious was under cooked and not spicy. California Roll was good and only because of the seeds on top. I spent $15 on the Grand Canyon Roll and it arrived all in a pile in a bowl. Flavor was great but it came apart and it was a mess. No scallops to be found. Last time I do delivery with Sushi Don. See the photos.
The best sushi in the county and its not close. Really cant go wrong with anything but I suggest the crab rangoon roll. Absolutely amazing

I ate take out from Sushi Don for the first time.
The California Roll was fresh. The Crab Rangoon roll was warm and crispy. Very tasty! Also had the spicy shrimp roll. It was very quick to just drop in,
Shop for what you want and pay. The service was excellent.

I am quite disappointed with my service experience here at Sushi Don. 

I was visiting from out of town and my friends had mentioned that I try this sushi place, Sushi Don. They've only had good experiences here and I was excited to try.

Walking in, there was a very crowded waiting area and my friends and I walked to the "please wait to be seated sign" and waited patiently. 20 minutes passed and we haven't been greeted once by the host. We noticed that people who had arrived after us, were already getting seated. We were confused and had thought they had reservations but politely asked the host when we were next to get seated. He replied very short and with attitude, telling us that we had to wait and told us we should've checked in earlier. We never knew to check in because we were never told to, despite making eye contact multiple times with the host. We ended up waiting almost an hour to be seated, to which the host just cocked his head at us to follow him and didn't say a word when we sat down. He threw the menus down on the table and walked away briskly. We were upset by the host and his unprofessionalism but wanted to keep positive.

Our waiter, on the other hand, was SO SO SO nice and amazing. Even though he was busy running to so many tables, he was very polite and genuinely wanted to make sure our experience was a good one. We ordered 6 rolls to share off the happy hour menu (50% off rolls). The sushi had pretty good flavor (although some tasted the same even though they were different rolls) and was decent for the price. Ended up paying around $13 each person (3 people total).

Next time coming here, I plan to steer away from the very rude host. But I did enjoy the food and our waiter so maybe we'll try this place again when we come to visit.

We had the Lion King and Bond girl roll and I can easily say this is the best sushi I've ever had!  They have sushi and alcohol specials throughout the week  so it's worth checking out the deals.  I love that the rolls cane with miso  soup and salad, with my favorite ginger dressing.  We had the peanut boneless chicken as an appetizer  and it was obvious why it's the most popular.  You will not be disappointed.  This is my number one pick for sushi in Lafayette.  It's reasonably priced and well worth every penny!

I loved the EBI Tempura! It was wonderful!
I wasn't a big fan of the spicy California roll, I would have preferred to have 2 EBI rolls. 
I ordered it to go, so I didn't get to enjoy the atmosphere, and it was the first time I ate at this restaurant. I was pleased and I will be back!
(I got both of my rolls without cucumber because I don't like cucumber)

This restaurant never disappoints. Delicious food and great atmosphere. My son and I love to eat here! Friendly staff as well. One of the best restaurants in Lafayette.  

8/13/2020-still great food but very sad you removed Bibimbap from your menu!!!
Great sushi! Always consistently amazing service and food. This is our go to when we want awesome sushi. Never disappoints.

Ok so as far as takeout sushi goes- this is the best.  Tastes and looks fresh, a wide variety of options, nicely presented. My only complaint is that I wish they offered indoor dining. I would go here more often but there are other sushi restaurants with similar quality that still have seating. Dang Covid!
Good selection of sushi and it was very good! Can't beat the half price lunch and dinner specials. Have tried several different rolls and all are excellent.

Decided to try out their amazing specials with my girlfriend for date night. One thing to note is that the wait times are incredibly long for their happy hours because its 50% off. We waited 45 minutes for a table, but it was worth it! The selection is quite good as it ranges from your typical sushi rolls to some pretty unique chef specialties. I had the salmon meets tuna along with the spicy salmon roll and both were very fresh/well crafted. My partner had the Lionking roll and the Philadelphia roll which was also very good. Easily the best sushi in the Lafayette area, so remember to call ahead or plan to wait

Good sushi rolls at great 1/2 price specials on Tuesday and Thursday evenings and Monday, Wednesday, Friday and Saturday lunch. 

Usually crowded for the evening specials. 

1/2 price alcohol specials are opposite the sushi specials.

This has been my go to sushi place for the past 4 years, however recently they have made a change in their business model for the worst. I'm not sure whether or not the management has changed or what has happened but I do not like the new "grab and go." The sushi is pre-made and unfortunately it tastes pre-made :( For me there is a drastic difference in taste from their fresh sushi and the now pre-made sushi. I did have one of their poke bowls which was pretty good but not sure if it is worth the drive. I am so sad so say that I will not be returning, for at least the time being, with the new business model.

We ate in once before March 2020 and it was great. We've done pick up orders twice since, and while you need to be sure to place your order an hour before you want it, the sushi is fresh and delicious.

reviews.text: We came here for lunch and sat on the shaded part of the patio. I must say, we had a really nice experience. Atmosphere is great, especially outside. Service was fast and kind. It's hard to deal with the COVID issues, but they seemed to handle it well. My group had the grilled tenderloin, the tacos, and the southwest salad. I usually order the paradise salad, which never fails me. The southwest salad was very flavorful, with a spicy dressing I used sparingly on the side. I went with the lettuce and no pasta, which I think was a good call. I know they have some mixed reviews, but give them a try for nice outdoor seating. Would definitely go again!

Phenomenal experience. This is a great place to go for a date night with your significant other or even with a few friends to catch up. The star of the show is the ambiance. They have a wonderful seating area outside as well as a window room that gives almost the same effect. The food was decent; not the best but also not bad or anything. They have a fairly large menu with an option for anyone to be satisfied. The proce point is very good for the quality and quantity of food as you'll probably run about 35$ for 2 people with drinks before tip which is outstanding for the experience. I definitely recommend coming back!

Decent food at best, on average it is well below average, haven't had anything special here nor have heard anything too positive from a few friends. Service is hit and miss, bit perk is the extensive room in a classic American atmosphere and gorgeous backyard with outdoor dining. No other place in the area offers the view they got here. This is the place when no one cares about the food. Your boss is picking up the tab and that means the tap. They got the full bar with all the goods those dull meetings need to remedy. After all, meetings are where people keep minutes and waste hours right?! Despite prices to make it feel like it is about that family food times and a menu full of variety - it really is just enough to be an adequate backdrop for the annual whatever. Meats, sandwiches, salads, soups, apps, and drinks to satisfy. Again this isn't food quality like Red Seven, Bistro 501, Black Sparrow, Town & Gown (T&G has that salmon and pasta on a whole-nother level), even Cheddar's gives more eating fun. But this is the only restaurant in the whole area with a view! The back outdoor dining area is open to the country and pond, quite the vibe. I wouldn't ever pick this place with less than 10 people or sit inside. This is where the office gang ends up to relax and enjoy a Friday evening with drinks and a view.
Tahnee was our waitress . And she was outstanding.We ordered onion rings fried shrimp fish and chips. Outstanding,food.service is great.

This place is so nice! Beautiful building, beautiful interior, tons of space. The service we had was really good but it was kind of slow. I think they are understaffed. I ordered the only "vegan" item on the menu- which is listed as a vegan burger- but they don't have a vegan bun! 

I also ordered a mule- my first time trying one and I loved it. They have an amazing bar- a great place to stop in and grab a drink for sure. 

I would definitely recommend this place if you've got time.

First impression was already bad when we stood at the front for a long time and no one showed up. And that was a late lunch at 1:15pm so the place was not crowded at all. Then it took forever for someone to come and get our drink orders. Food was sub-par. And the place is loud.

Best wings on Lafayette
Live the garbage salad ....put it back on the menu
Will return

This has been one of my boyfriend and I's favorite places in town. We have ordered carry out over the phone several times. I did the same tonight and was told our food would be ready in 15-20 minutes. When we arrived after that timeframe my boyfriend went in to pick up the food. He was told that someone else had taken the food. Then they kept asking if he ordered through DoorDash which we did not. The bartender said she remembered me calling. They said they could remake the food if he wanted to wait. Not many other places are open at this point so he did. I am honestly just not sure how this happens and kind of in disbelief that no apology or discount was offered. And to add salt to the wound, the food was not very hot and fresh for having just been remade.

Very spacious and nice-looking Tavern in Lafayette. They have plenty of beer and space to sit about and watch television however they do not seem to give you the price once you make an order if you order the wrong beer you may be surprised by the cost. They also had a lot of food orders to go while I was there observing and it appears that the food must be pretty good in above standard for bar and pub and grill. there is also a lack of bars and restaurants in the area so this could also explain the popularity of this place

Wanted to give this place a chance regardless of the reviews. First off, the drinks here are delicious and there are so many cool drinks to choose from. They have deals everyday, I went here on a Friday for $1 off martinis and got the Peanut Butter and Jealous Martini--it was yummy. Walt's is huge and has a lot of space, make of that as you wish, but it was awkward when the place was 3/4 empty and so vast. We ordered their sampler appetizer, which was good, but all of it was fried and crispy and tasted like a bunch of microwavable boxed appetizers heated up, except they were plated nicely and were expensive. The place was dark inside, had an odd layout, and had a really funky, strong smell to it, I kid you not, like chopped romaine lettuce (maybe it was all the wood?).

Have been here twice in one week!  Came once after work with a group of colleagues and had the best time!  
Southwestern egg rolls chicken wings and nachos were toooooo much food!  So delish!  The beer specials were great too for $3 a glass!  Such a deal!
Service needs some improvement but if you're with a group of people it's ok!
Parking is ample and the outdoor space is great too!  Two huge bar areas as well.  Decor is quite modern and new.  Luckily bathrooms were kept up and nice.
I am going to keep on coming back!

I really like the building and decor. It's spacious and clean.  I like the fireplace and the touch of wood smoke smell.  If you have a function or large party they have several spaces to choose from.  One room has its own bar as well as a nice view of the outside and deck.   The basement is probably the largest space and it also has its own bar. 

The foods I've had here so far have been about average.  Not bad but i've not had anything yet to get excited about.  Pricing is also about average to a touch on the high side for similar fare elsewhere. 

Today at lunch I tried their Baha salad with chicken: greens with rice, chicken, teriyaki sauce, corn salsa and a fried egg and half of an avocado on top.  It wasn't bad but it just seemed like a fusion dish that was confused. I wouldn't get it again.  

I will visit again and try other options.

The facility is nice, the wait staff is good, our food was substandard.  My son had the full rack of ribs, I had the chicken pasta Alfredo.  We also had the appetizer potato skins and a Caesar salad.  The salad was good.  The skins were almost half potato with minimal seasoning, but we ate those.  The entrees were generously portioned, but abyssal in taste and almost inedible.   The "pasta alfredo" was a big plate of macaroni with small cube size chicken - the only seasoning I could taste was butter and melted cheese - it tasted like microwave heated home made leftovers.  The rib sauce tasted like a combination of Worcestershire and A1, the meat had a very funny aftertaste.  We took 75% of the entrees home.  They didn't taste any better reheated, so we threw them away.  I wish I could have my $63 back..

Side note - we saw several patrons entering, walking around, and leaving the restaurant not wearing masks.

We came here not expecting much, and that's what we received. The food is uninspired, but okay. The nachos and wings were fine and we were surprised that they had a decent draft beer selection. We ate downstairs for trivia, and our poor bartender was serving the whole room. She definitely could have used some help.

For whatever reason, my dad's side of the family always plans to have our Christmas dinner here. Probably because they live out of town and this place gives the impression of being a high end restaurant. The management sucks and the food is sub par. Not much else I can say other than they should try to be more like their counterpart on the other side of town. If you're thinking about coming here, go to Walts other pub instead.

Meh.  Nothing stands out about this place.  Newly built, but zero ambiance.  It wasn't crowded yet they sat me right in front of the waiter's computer so they're walking around me the entire time.  (Seating should never be in front of the wait staff's computer anyways). Even so, looking around, I didn't see an area in the place that looked like a cozy spot to sit.  For a newly built restaurant, they should have done more for their ambiance.

Food is average.  Reading the menu, it sounds great, but in reality it's nothing special.  Nothing terrible, but nothing great either.  I've eaten here twice and can't say I'd bother to return again.

Food: late lunch. Food: very good. Service: excellent. Ate at the bar. Cup of chili, black and blue salad, margarita pizza. Pizza excellent. Chili very good, needed little spicing up.  Salad excellent. We will be back

In town to see some family and friends and decided to try Walt's new spot. Very very very nice decor. Food was great service was great. Had lunch with a friend and the server did a great job of keeping tabs on us. I then went to the bar and had another beer and the bartender was very good and informative. I will definitely be back next time I'm in town.
Went for the first time last night.   Atmosphere was fantastic.   Food was great.    Sat at the bar and the bartenders were incredible.
The interior of Walt's is quite lovely, the service is usually good, the food is usually good, and the patio is EXCELLENT if the weather is nice and they have it open.

reviews.text:
We ordered takeout from this place Saturday night. The food is everything here. It is homey, authentic Szechuan cuisine. We ordered twice cooked pork with Chinese cabbage, eggplant with garlic sauce, and squid with Chinese pickled vegetables. It was nothing fancy; just freshly prepared and straightforward delicious. 

Picking up the takeout, we observed two things. First, it is mostly Chinese clientele, and the place was absolutely hopping, which we took as an excellent sign. Second, they started the food once we asked for the order - which was ok by us, as it was guaranteed fresh and not something that was warmed over or cooling off by the time we arrived. Can't wait to try more!

Chinese colleague pointed us to this place near meijer.  We ordered twice cooked pork w leeks and eggplant, and they were both outstanding.

This is a family run restaurant and what it lacks in decor and server attentiveness it more than makes up for in authenticity and quality.  It's not "american" takeout chinese and that's a good thing.  On our visit the two dishes we ordered came out hot and fresh but we had to ask for rice (?) which is to say that they are probably pretty short staffed but try to focus on the food not the ambiance.

Pretty good but a little rough around the edges.
This was my first visit and it was a weekday at lunch time.  Dining room was simple and tidy.  I was the first customer so the host/server took my order right away.  I ordered the Dan Dan Noodle which was ready quickly.  It was pretty spicy but very tasty.  I would order it again.  My main complaint was that the restroom was dirty and had a sticky floor.

Food: 3/5
Service: 2/5
Price: 2/5
Bill handling: 1/5

We tried this restaurant today after having some authentic Chinese food craving. The store appears to be informal, meaning that family-owned and not professionally maintained (cleanliness, sticky table/floor etc). But as long as the food quality is good, the rest can stay behind the scene. 

We ordered crispy duck and egg plant in garlic sauce. Egg plant in garlic sauce was decent, to be served with rice. The crispy duck wasn't bad but lacking flavors. The server never stopped by to ask how things were and they seemed busy taking care of their kids and eating lunch. I was going to ask for a salt but at the end I did not bother. 

The bill handling was the major turn off. It was not printed so I could not understand the hand-written Chinese/English mixed scribble. The exact breakdown could not be understood but the final price which was ~$35. The crispy duck was $14.95 and the eggplant was $10.95 which I remembered from the menu prices. Therefore $26 roughly before taxes but how did it jump to the final $35? I found out later on 18% tip was added. I really don't appreciate when the automatic tip is assigned without notifications. 

If the service and price would have been reasonable, I would have returned to try out other dishes but most likely I won't be returning. A bad first-time experience unfortunately.

Dirty. Dirty. Dirty.  Food was not cooked. Server did know what on menu. Cutting vegetables on table. Widows dirty. Walls dirty. Very salty. Vegetables where not cooked.  Dirty glasses. Bunch of crap in dining room in corner of restaurant.

Pretty authentic.... but.... that being said.... it's more of a "I'll only go if I'm starving" place- and nothing else is open.  I gave it 4 stars, because my husband who loves salty food liked it.  For me, it was too salty and a bit too oily.

Everything we ordered were very yummy. The spicy pork that we ordered for an appetizer was especially a hit for my husband. He said that the flavor was the same as what he ate in Sichuan, China. We were happy to find this restaurant. This is added to our go to Chinese restaurant list.

The 鱼香茄子 No 184 garlic eggplant is delicious. It comes with a large portion which is enough for me to eat 3-4 meals. The 酸菜鱼 No 107 tastes good too. There are more choices in this restaurants compared to other restaurants near the campus. 有烧烤和啤酒鸭 晚上想吃烧烤的 可以来 11点才关门 非常适合熬夜通宵的人们储存能量

I ate here once previously, soon after the restaurant opened. That experience was ok, but they were out of some things. This time I came at lunch by myself instead of with picky children. 

I was the only customer in here at about 1:20-1:50 Friday afternoon. I ordered the Century Egg with green pepper and the #138 - Home Style beef with chef special chili sauce.

I'd never had a century egg and had wanted to try one for a while. It's a preserved egg that takes weeks to month to turn into a black version of its former egg self. Check out pics online if you've never heard of it. The yolk texture and flavor is delicious. The "white" (now translucent black) has a gelatin texture and look. It really tastes a LOT better than it looks. The chopped green pepper with it seemed silly. If I'm grabbing a slice of egg, why not slice the green peppers so they're big chunks? I don't get it. The sauce was very spicy, but good flavor. Was happy with this one.

The Home style beef is chopped almost to the point of being similar to ground beef. Plentiful crunchy celery bits (that Chinese food celery that somehow doesn't taste like celery but has that great crispness) were included. The chef special chili sauce was EXCELLENT. I will likely order another item with this sauce soon. Very good.

This is a *real* Chinese restaurant, so don't go here and order General Tso, (Please!!!)

My prior experience was ok, this one was very good. I recommend this place.

Some of the dishes we tried could be hit or miss but we ALWAYS come back to this place for their dry spicy fish filet!! It's so crispy on the outside and tender on the inside with the perfect amount of seasoning and Szechuan wild peppers!! The heat is nice in this dish but it doesn't overpower the fish. The portions are pretty big so you could easily split one main dish and appetizers between two people. It is on the expensive side for Szechuan food in Lafayette but it also has great food!

Tried this place on a recommendation that it was probably the most authentic in town. Not a lot of people there so service was very quick. I chose the Kung Pao Pork and my wife ordered the salt and pepper shrimp. Completely unlike any Chinese food I've had locally. It was outstanding. The sauce was spicy and peppery and so delicious, although I was full I could stop eating. My wife ate more than usual and commented about how the sauce was so good. We will definitely be returning to this place and it's now our go to sit down Chinese even though it's completely across town from home.

We had the "unforgettable" chicken with happy sauce, and the stir fried minced chicken.  Spicy, but very tasty!   We will be back.  :)

Returned with the kids. Ordered food from the menu avoiding the spicy symbols for the kids, but one dish came with hot red peppers anyway, so take heed if ordering for kids.  No problem they kindly remade it without the hot red peppers.  Kids loved the egg drop soup, and the pork and onion noodles.  The noodle dish is almost all noodles, with a small amount of meat on top. I loved the pork and chive flower dish.  Great tasting food and a large menu to explore!

I wanted some good Chinese food. I had frequently gone to another place in WL that had just changed management and now the food was not good. Shu ge looked like it had promise. The menu left me wondering what to order since I had never seen any of these items before. I will like to try what I know and if the common food is good I can explore others later. I asked for help in finding the common choices, which were all on the last page. The food was some of the best I'd had to date!!  I will be ordering some of the items from the menu front since this has been so good! Not your everyday routine Chinese!!

Shu ge makes mediocre Chinese food. That's not the worst part about this restaurant, their customer service is non-existent and has no respect for customer's online orders. We ordered from them through Grubhub and placed the order at 10:36pm because it says they stop taking orders at 10:45 pm, so I made sure we put in the order before that time. However, Shu Ge never bothered to update us about the order, instead of calling us or canceling the order, they straight-up ignored our order and never alerted the Grubhub system to cancel or modify order, as a result, we waited for 2 hours just to get told that they never made our food but still accepted the order to just let it sit in the system. When we finally got a hold of Grubhub customer service, they told us the whole story. At least we got a full refund and some meal credits, but people need to be aware of their business hours especially if you want to order online from them, they are not honest about their delivery policy and didn't honor the business hours they promised on their websites. Very disappointed!

Meh, I will give this place a second chance since it wasn't horrible just quite frankly nothing to write home to mom about. With all of the choices for Asian food in the town you would think that a new place would try to fill a void. Add something unique that differentiates itself from the rest. 

I'll try something new next time and hope to be blown away.  

In short try it out and prove me wrong.

Photo of La Hacienda El Sol - West Lafayette, IN, United States

reviews.text: We've been ordering take out due to COVID. Orders are quick, accurate, and easy to pick up with window. Food is fresh and tasty!  Perfect for those Mexican cravings when you don't want to go out!
I ordered a steak quesadilla and beef tacos for carry out. Everything was AMAZING--will def be back!

Stopped in here to grab a beer and snacks.  Chips and salsa complementary.  The draft beer was very cold and delicious.  Ordered nacho supreme with beef and not worth the $10.  It was small with few toppings.  The ground beef was huge chunks of under seasoned beef.  The bottom of the plate was filled with liquid (assumed from the ground beef) making the chips soggy.  Less than desirable experience.  I will not be returning anytime soon!
Ordered tacos soft and hard salsa was little week, but everything else was outstanding waiter was great

Yikes...I thought I would like this place. Everything was pretty greasy and lukewarm, just not the most appetizing. The chips were pretty stale as well. I won't be returning, but I hope their quality improves in the future.

We go here a lot! The food is always great! The drinks; superb!! Service is excellent and fast. 
I would suggest a complete overhaul of the bathrooms though, outdated, smelly. If this item could be tended to, this venue could go from great to awesome!

I am an "essential" employee, and still work five days a week. I stopped here for lunch ... after the experience I had picking up my food from the side window ... I will be making this place my new normal! The employee at the window was upbeat and friendly. The food was DELICIOUS and generous. They even threw in a free beverage! Thank you so much!

Verdict: Definitely check this place out for their tacos

Location: Okay
Decor: Good
Food/ Drink: Great
Service: Great
Price: Great

Details: Although I live like 2 minutes from this restaurant, I've never had the pleasure of trying out their food. I would have given it a higher rating for location (close to some apartment complexes/communities), but it is out of the way for the greater lafayette/ west lafayette crowd. Went in on a saturday night at about 8pm to get some carryout. They had a karaoke night going, and a few families were in there there enjoying the karaoke. The server told me that 9pm would bring in a much younger crowd and that any type of karaoke is available. Getting that late a dinner would probably be too loud for my taste. They have a few parking spots available outside. 

The Decor was simple but the place was clean. They had one of those wall mounted fireplaces and an aquarium too. Since it was karaoke night, they had the lights dimmed down and party/disco lights going(see picture). The server was very friendly to talk to and gave me recommendations on their food. He recommended the taco sampler (see pic) which is originally listed under appetizers. According to him, they are known for their cheap, tasty, authentic tacos. You get 7 tacos and that was a good price for $8.95. Service took about 20 minutes, but the karaoke kept me pretty entertained. The server also gave me a rundown of the place and told me that they love to host bigger groups and that they have a lunch buffet special. They are willing to accommodate the requests of larger groups in case that information might be of some use to you.
 
Once I got the food, put it in my car and started heading home, the 2 looooong minutes of driving was pure torture. The food smelled amazing! I could wait to get my hands on those tacos. Really! When I opened up the box, the dinner was all I thought it would be and more. They had some mild and spicy sauces on the side, and I really liked the spicy sauce. The tacos were really good. Can't believe I'd never been here before in spite of this place being so close. I definitely liked everything about this restaurant and will be back. I'm saving the 5 star rating for a 2nd experience, just in case this was a one time wonder. But definitely check this place out.

The restaurant is spacious with unique Mex style decoration. The price is unbeatable. They have daily discount for food and drinks. Margarita costs 1.99 and tacos 1.5 on Tuesday, and they have things like this everyday. 

Remember to try HORCHATA (rice water drink), it is large and  tastes good.

The *worst* service in West Lafayette. And the food is below average.

The only partial redeeming quality is the $5 cactus drinks on Thursday.

So good!  We stopped here for an early dinner this evening and were extremely impressed.  Because we were there early, we received  fast service!  The waitresses were super sweet and made the experience even that much more delightful.

They have a large menu with a ton of seafood options-which I'm always a fan of!

Their chips and salsa were tasty and their guacamole was even better! It was more "peppery" than I've had at other places, but I actually really enjoyed the flavor.

They are known for their tacos and they did not disappoint.  My husband tried their Mexican style chicken, marinated pork, and chorizo/steak tacos with the green & red sauce.  He thought the chicken were best, but was super impressed.  They are small--so you can eat 4 - 6 if super hungry! 

I tried the shrimp fajitas and loved the sauce they used with the grilled veggies.  My only "issue" is that the shrimp still had their tails, which can make it a bit messy. 

They have a nice kids menu & their cheese quesadilla was a generous portion.  

The decor was cute, they offer a taco buffet on weekdays for lunch (that we NEED to check out), and they had an actual changing table...like the ones in homes, which I very much appreciated.

I think we found a new favorite for Mexican food on the West side!

Food is delicious but there are flies everywhere.  Not only that but the service is horrific.  I had to swat flies away while I waited to get my waitresses attention.  She was busy talking to her friends for EXTENDED periods of time.  We were both sitting in the same area.  Just look around.

I have been to Sunset MANY times for their lunch buffet.  Normally I am very happy with the service and always love the choices on the buffet.

Today's food choices were no exception.  Marinated Pork, Chicken Burritos, and the normal taco meat, refried beans, rice and the fixings.

Sadly, the one thing that was missing today were the taco shells and tortillas!!  I spoke with three different waitstaff about it; 20 minutes later, they FINALLY bring them out. 

 Of course by that time, my lunch hour is almost over!

When I went to pay for the check, I did get a "sorry about the taco shells" response, but no offer to reduce or compliment the meal.  

Good food and great prices; but if you don't take care of your customers, don't expect to see them return!!

A hidden gem in West Lafayette!
The location was hard to find the first time but it's definitely worth knowing about. Food is better than most in the area and servers are super friendly. 
Probably the best and most authentic Mexican food around!

This is absolutely a great place to take anyone!  It has a fantastic menu of great tasting food, a festive atmosphere, beautiful designs everywhere, televisions all over the place, a full bar, fresh ingredients, and daily specials.  I would highly recommend that anyone that misses Don Pablos try this place out, you will not be disappointed!
We enjoyed our Delicious taco salad and arroz con Pollo. The service was very fast during the lunch hour.

Our server was good, probably overworked but he really tried. Don't order the beans, they taste like straight up water. It's liked all flavor was leeched out of them, they were inedible. Thank god the extra order we got never came. The rice wasn't much better. We ordered veggie fajitas and there were multiple pieces of meat in them. As a lifelong vegetarian I  was thankful I caught it in time. We got another order but it wasn't cooked as well. It was half off though, shout out to our waiter who was pretty dope. I don't know how this place has an okay review, the food was definitely below subpar. I could've eaten ass and it would have been better.
Food is amazing! Asada fries are my favorite. Also try the barbacoa anything super yummy. Very friendly staff. Best Mexican food in West Lafayette.

Best little secret in West Lafayette.  Food was really good and prices are very reasonable.  Seek this gem out.  You won't be sorry!

I think this has changed hands since some of the other reviews were posted.  It is a Mexican food restaurant now.
Good food, and a great staff. They were very nice and attentive. The prices are also very reasonable.

Photo of Two Fellas Grill - West Lafayette, IN, United States. Menu
Photo of Two Fellas Grill - West Lafayette, IN, United States. Menu
Photo of Two Fellas Grill - West Lafayette, IN, United States. Barely any chicken in the wrap :(
Photo of Two Fellas Grill - West Lafayette, IN, United States. Southern hospitality wrap and tater tots

reviews.text: Amazing food to grab late at night. All their menu options are fantastic. Highly recommend if you're in West Lafayette.

The food here is good especially after a night at the bars. But to be able to get the food in a timely manner is an art. You NEVER want to call them. You can call them 20 times and they wont pick up. Sometimes you'll get lucky and they'll pick up the phone but it's a very rare occurrence. Your best bet is going into the store and ordering or, if it's past hours where you can wait inside, Doordash or Grubhub pickup is best. Their waitstaff is often times rude and unaccommodating.
Two fellas has some amazing late night options. Always my go-to for the night! I really like the mozzarella sticks and the chicken tender wraps.  Would definitely recommend!

This spot has good food BUT, big BUT, the staff bullied us into tipping for an order that we walked to pick up, they doubled (or more) the wait time for all the customers here without notification before payment. The staff was rude taking orders and delivering orders (they required that they needed nicotine before checking on the orders of multiple groups waiting outside in the cold and also cussing.

I'd been passing this place for a while now and wanting to try it out. I decided to order in for lunch today. As usual, here are my Pros and Cons for this experience. 

Pros
-The Boiler wrap was delicious. Great flavor, great sauce, and great crunch. 
-The side of tots were cooked perfectly. To take a twenty-minute car ride in a styrofoam box and still be crispy means they were made right. 
-Very filling! When I saw the side was tots, I thought I'd better order Onion Rings too..yeah, I couldn't finish them. 
-Speaking of onion rings, they were perfect as well. They were made in a smooth batter style and perfectly al dente so you don't rip the whole onion out when you bite. 

Cons
-Only con is now I'll want this place all the time and the location isn't ideal. 

Great experience. This is the perfect campus dining.

Called and asked how long a wait for 3 burritos would be. They said 15 min. Ordered said burritos was told 25 minutes (totally fine). Goes to pick up. Has to wait longer. They short us a burrito on top of that. Had to wait 20+ more minutes. Still waiting :-)
Don't ever answer the phones.  When they do answer, takes at least an hour to get your food. Not worth it at all. Go somewhere else

If I could give this place negative reviews I would. We came in and my friend got water and the guy called her a name and made her pay $4 for WATER. He was so rude to us for WATER. Never coming back and this guy should be fired.

Atmosphere / decor - 3 
Service - 3.5
Food - 4
Location - 4
Value - 3

An overall 3.5

The feel here is very diner-like. The workers seemed friendly nothing, just doing their jobs behind the counter. We were the only customers when we arrived (3 of us). It's right on the main strip which is convenient. 

I got a burrito with BBQ sauce and chicken (can't remember the name!). I don't eat gluten so I ate the filling out of my burrito. I thought mine was very tasty, it had enough sauce to be covered but not overwhelming. There wasn't a ton of meat but the tots were filling. The food was hot and was cooked/heated in front of us. It's pretty hard to go wrong with tater tots . The burritos were a good size, probably average for $7.5. 

I'd say it's worth a try as a meal is less than $10!
Two Fellas is the best late night snack. They have good hours so you literally get it whenever you're craving it. The staff is super chill and quick!  It never disappoints!!

This is a new place that has opened on campus as of Spring 2017. It is located right between Jimmy Johns and AJ's and there is access from both sides of the building. I believe Two Fellas Grill started in Kalamazoo, MI and is looking to expand to Purdue's campus.

So far there are only two tables to sit at, so you're most likely in for a standing wait if it's busy.

The target market is for those late night bar crawlers looking for post-bar munchies, but anyone that appreciates a good wrap should go.

I ordered a steak wrap called "The Rich" and it was surprisingly better than I anticipated. I am usually not a fan of wraps, but this wrap had more food than expected, and the steak was cooked well. What added the most flavor was the tater tots inside. Yes, it was a bit greasy, so be cautious.

Good news, it's open late, until 4am, but it also opens earlier during the day at 11:00, and they have a selection of breakfast wraps.

If this sounds like your kind of food, do try!

Disappointing! Not impressed at all. Heard this place opened a few months ago, decided to try it tonight.

Pro: opens late

Cons: my chicken wrap barely contained any chicken pieces. Mostly iceberg lettuce. Sauce was blend, the wrap tasted like tortilla.  

My boyfriend got a wrap with chicken and tator tots. Mostly tator tots and little chicken pieces.

+ my stomach hurts now :(

The perfect spot when you need to get full or take care of the post-bar munchies. Every menu item is delicious, and will probably have you full with some left to take home. But if not, they also offer sides of tater tots, cheese sticks, mac bites etc that will satisfy even the hungriest of boilers or game day visitor. I suggest the Boiler or the Mac Dad if you're really hungry.

This is one of the best places to get flavorful, good food in WL. My favorite is the Luau (then, Southern Hospitality). We have gone here more than 5 times (in a space of a montH) and are continuously impressed by the food and quality. Very courteous and helpful staff as well. I have never dined in here, and I don't expect to have great dine in seats either. It's the perfect place to pick up and go.

I eat a lot and wish the wrap was a little larger, but still the taste and quality of the ingredients is worth it for the price. If this was a little cheaper I'd be eating here twice a week.

I was sick and tried out delivery yesterday, and it was cheap delivery at 50c a wrap, and fast (got the food in 10 mins!).

Bartender who has loyal customers every Monday order from here. Great delivery service (from Sarah) until tonight. Had one guy order, quoted under an hour. Group of 6 come in 15 minutes later and calls to order. First guy waits an hour and a half before calling to ask where his food is, they tell him the big order is on its way, but the delivery driver forgot his food. Delivery driver brings first guy's food. It's almost 2 hours before the second group that ordered called to see where their food was. They CANCELLED the second group's order after the first guy called to see where his food was. So now almost 3 hours later, the second group still have not gotten food.

Absolutely love the wraps here! I often get the Caesar or the Southern Hospitality while my husband loves the Luau. The wraps hold a good proportion of meat to other ingredients and the blend is very tasty. 
The wrap itself for me, is something special. It's a little flaky after being on the grill and it gives it an almost parity texture, but not quite. It was interesting to bite into that. Overall for $7.50 I think they are value for money and bursting with flavor!

I've been here before and the wraps weren't that bad but I'm honestly now regretting coming in this morning bc the chef/cashier seems gross bc he keeps coughing .... he started cooking my food & didn't wash up either. I am kind of disappointed with the cleanliness of this place

A great spot for food. Go in and do not do delivery though or else you won't get any sauce. 8/10 deliveries is missing something. Sometimes they will take your delivery and not give u the food but when u try to call the phone line is disconnected for the night, like they just gave up. But if you buy the food in house your experience will be great! The wraps are filled with tater tots, meats, and sauces. My favorite is the boiler maker add ranch. The first item on the menu is also a safe bet, since sometimes they will forget to add ranch in the boilermaker even if u ask. Their honey mustard sauce is also very tangy and sweet. Some basic chicken tenders complements it very well.

I normally love two fellas but I came in at 11:10 am and got my burrito at 11:30... with two customers ahead of me. Plus my burrito (got the farmers) didn't have half the ingredients in it... only cheese and tator tots (half were burnt). Haven't even looked at my friends order.. a little confused ‍

Love the food, very creative wraps! Very clean and the staff is always friendly. My friends and I have always had great experiences. They're open late. Do not go if you want to sit down, there isn't much seating.

reviews.text: Stopped in on a whim, I've driven by many times and had always been curious.  I ordered the Italian beef and sausage combo, and it did not disappoint.  The beef was seasoned well, the au juis was soaked into the bun perfectly, and the sausage was grilled nicely.  Best I've had, short of something downtown Chicago.  Thanks, I will be coming by again!

Overall score is a 2.4

Honestly there is nothing in the area to judge against so this family owned and run joint gets a higher score. It's not great or awesome or like WTF I need more. It's jut ok that hit my Greek fast food gyro need, a guy could go to Arby's and get the same meat. I say that because it's shipped in log Gyro Meat.

With that said. Friendly and good / decent service. I openly stated it was my first time there. And we received a warm greeting. I ordered the Gyro Supreme not noticing American cheese; that's my fault. Honestly should not be on the menu with American cheese. So ordering please read carefully. The gyros were both stuffed with meat and filling. Slightly stale pita despite flat top warming. We also ordered the hummus and pita. Same stale pita but the hummus was really really good.

Here is my big deal; the preformed conical meat nonsense that they warm up day after day despite a slow day. Just stick it back in and it processed bulk meat. It isn't good at all. If you want a Gyro in Lafayette, please go to Arby's. We will try another time for a good dish. Maybe dinner is scratch made!? It should be.

THE OWNER IS SOOO RUDE!!! I have never experienced such bad customer service from a business owner, my husband always brings us food from there, but this was the first time I was able to order via phone call. I called at 3:44 to order a gyro dinner and he was already in a bad mood so I ordered as fast as I could, he told me the food would be ready in 10 minutes but then realized I ordered the wrong rice so I called again at 3:47 to change it and he said the rice was "already made". I asked him if he just made the lemon rice in 3 minutes just for me and he said "yes" which is a total bs... The rice is always pre-made, so I told him if he could change it because I didn't want that one, he said "thank you" and hung up on me... Not to mention that I was already outside the restaurant waiting in the car with my baby in the back seat (that's why I made the order through a phone call).
I've been coming here for all of my six years as a Purdue student and I've never been wronged. Amazingly good gyros, brisk service, and the portion sizes are off the charts. Cannot go wrong here!

My wife and I go here regularly. The staff is very personable and while professional, make you feel like pet of the family. The food is excellent. I usually get the dolmades and gyro platter. My wife often gets the garden salad with Gryo meat.

I've had this before and could not believe how fresh and delicious. Just got lunch and both gyros were dry and old. I'm sad to say I will
Not be returning. $20 for food old pita from a Greek place.
Who doesn't love a great Gyro? These are authentic gyros and the owners are very nice! Always good food!
Akropolis has great gyros. I no longer live in Lafayette but when I am back I come here for the gyro. I've been twice this year. Great Greek fries too!

This is the place where I fell in love with Greek food.  I started coming here as a kid and always ordered the gyro.  I since moved away and have been gone for twenty years.  During that time, I did a lot of traveling, including to Greece and the food at Akropolis was just as good as any authentic meal I ate in Greece.  Upon returning home for the first time in twenty years, this was one of my first stops.  While ownership has since changed, the food is just as good as I remember it.  I've only ever ordered a gyro here because I just can't get over how good they are!  They are so full of meat!  I do look forward to exploring more of their menu.

Family owned and operated, the service has always been excellent with both the previous and new owners.

The family who owns and runs this restaurant couldn't be nicer- service with a smile for sure. The food is a really good bargain, definitely less expensive than the other Greek place in town. The portions are large and you definitely get a lot for your money. The veggies are fresh and the feta cheese is amazing. I tend to stick to the same thing every time but I've tried a few other things and everything so far has been really flavorful and delicious. Basically this is a greasy spoon-style restaurant, Greek style. I love it and I'm happy to support a family-run, neighborhood restaurant that isn't a chain.

I love this place for the food and the people. The workers are so nice and greet you. They make you feel at home. Service is fast and they always check to see if you need anything or more drink. The food is delicious. I like the greek salad which is authentic and you can add chicken or lamb.

First time here. I saw a review that stated they had a new lemon chicken and rice soup. I loved that sour when I was in Anchorage AK at Little Italy. I have missed it
Well not the same but still very good. 
I came for lunch and expected smaller portions.  The soup came in a bowl generously sized.  The Greek combination plate seemed like a good way to sample several things. A beef gyro, chicken gyro, seasons rice, and potatoes,boiled   And pitas that are fresh and fluffy. Oh yeah Tzatziki.  All very flavorful, good. All above seems to be freshly prepared on site. 

You order at the counter and they bring you the food on China with metal flatware. 

Just a note Yelp won't allow a check in. It says I am too far away. I am sitting in the dining room.

I grabbed lunch with a friend and had ordered a gyro. It was good, I especially liked the tzatziki sauce! The restaurant was clean, the decor looks a bit dated. But the staff was very friendly, and helpful. It was a nice quiet atmosphere to catch up with a friend. The pricing is good, and they were very quick to serve our food.

Akropolis was purchased and the food is slightly different now. The interior was somewhat redone in the past couple years after the transaction, but it's basically the same layout and vibe.

I finally got back and had a gyro and fries. The tzatziki has been improved. The meat is pretty much the same. Pita was not very soft. Toppings were good quality - tons of onions and tomatoes.

On the whole this is an improvement as Meat and Tzatziki are the primary factors of import when judging a gyro. As a result, Akropolis has jumped one spot in the Greater Lafayette Gyro Standings. See below for my updated gyro rankings as of October 06, 2018:

Greater Lafayette Gyro Meat Rankings
1. Captain Gyro's
2. Akropolis
3. AJ's Burgers & Beef
4. Parthenon
5. Christo's
6. Arby's
7. Parkway Pizza & Subs

Greater Lafayette Tzatziki Rankings
1. Christo's
2t. Captain Gyro's
2t. AJ's Burgers & Beef
4t. Parthenon
4t. Akropolis
6. Arby's
7. Parkway Pizza & Subs

Greater Lafayette Gyro Pita Rankings
1. AJ's Burgers & Beef
2. Captain Gyro's
3t. Parthenon
3t. Parkway Pizza & Subs
3t. Arby's
6. Akropolis
7. Christo's

Greater Lafayette Gyro Topping Rankings
1. Akropolis
2. Christo's
3. Parthenon
4. AJ's Burgers & Beef
5. Arby's
6. Parkway Pizza & Subs
7. Captain Gyro's

Overall Greater Lafayette Gyro Rankings (Weighted rankings, meat/tzatziki count 2x, Toppings 1x, Pita 0.5x)

1. Captain Gyro's (15 pts)
2. AJ's Burgers & Beef (15.5 pts)
3. Akropolis (17 pts)
4. Christo's (17.5 pts)
5. Parthenon (22 pts)
6. Arby's (31 pts)
7. Parkway Pizza & Subs (36 pts)

Verdict: Not impressed

Location: Okay
Decor: Okay
Food/ Drink: Okay
Service: Good
Price: Good

Details: I have to start by saying that I love greek food. Went here on a Saturday evening. Finding the place wasn't the easiest with no clear signs till you get right up at their doorstop. Parking was convenient. The restaurant wasn't packed and it is more of a self serve kinda place. I wanted to keep it simple and just got the lamb/beef gyro. The service was really nice and they were very friendly, which is a plus. The price for the gyro was decent, but can't say I was very impressed by the sandwich itself. It was definitely meat loaded, which is never a bad thing, but it felt a bit dry. The pita was softer than the meat itself. It also seemed like they were skimping on the tomatoes, onions and sauce, which didn't help with how dry the gyro tasted (I saw similar comments by other members on yelp). Maybe I'll give this place another shot and try the Moussaka next time.

I love  this place! Just tried Italian sausage, it came with two sausages on bun and flavor was awesome. I usually won't eat Italian sausage unless it's johnsonville but wanted something I could warm up when I got home and it was fantastic. Also had Gyro's which are usually what we order. Also the service is quick and staff friendly.

Great food! I just had the gyro cheese burger and not only was it delicious but it was probably a larger serving than most could eat.  
If you like gyros or just like Greek style restaurants than you cannot go wrong here.  Prices are good portions are good too.  
At first I was worried when the couple who owned it since the 70's finally retired but the new owner does not disappoint.  
My friends really like the sandwiches and the rib tips as well.

The food is delicious, especially the spinach pie and the lemon soup. Nice to have authentic Greek food in an area filled with so many chain restaurants. Staff is friendly and accommodating. Decor is simple but clean.

I grew up in Lafayette and since moving to Indianapolis then Chicago, Akropolis is always a favorite spot when I'm visiting. The food is always fresh and I swear their lentil soup feeds your soul. They remember their customers and are always friendly. Definitely worth stopping in no matter where you're coming from!
My wife and I greatly enjoyed the gyro meat with saganaki. Their appetizers as well were delicious. We will definitely return!

reviews.text: This is literally my favorite Thai place. I will drive from Indianapolis just for the chicken satay. The peanut sauce I could eat alone with rice.

Good place for a quick bite to eat if you're craving Thai food! We went with the chicken pad Thai and chicken red curry. 

The pad Thai had a really tasty sauce but the heat wasn't there. We had to ask for chili sauce and flakes. 

The red curry was decent. The serving size for this is a little smaller than other Thai restaurants I've been to but it was still good. 

The server was friendly and attentive. I would definitely come back though and try out other dishes!

Delicious food every single time!!!  Amazing bubble tea & lots of flavor options!  Gluten free, vegan, & vegetarian options. I absolutely LOVE their blueberry slushee with bubbles. Pad Thai is amazing & so is the tofu satay!!  Great service!  Always a go to when I'm in town. Always 100% satisfied!!!

Paid about 10+ for the Tom Yum soup. Tom Yum is usually very flavorful, but this just tasted like broth with lemon grass. I also only got 12 oz of soup when other restaurants in the area give you 32 oz for around $5. But $10 for essentially the amount of a can of soda this was definitely not worth it.
2/4/20 Not a fan. Tried the Pad Thai, which had a pungent odor and slimy consistency. Waiter was friendly.

Thai food is Thai food, this place wasn't the best place I've been to nor the worst, it was kinda okay. The food was fresh the place could use new wall seating, but then again it's main source of customers are from the university. 
The service is what's expected from a college town restaurant.

This is a great place to grab some good Thai food to go. The restaurant is small and pretty boring on the inside. Food is always good and usually fast. I really love the pineapple fried rice, which has toasted coconut on top. It also comes with a cool cucumber salad.
I can not get past the pineapple fried rice.  I'm sure other things are amazing on the menu but I can't quit this stuff.

This is my go-to place to eat because it's a genuinely good place to sit down for a meal and I will thrown down with anyone who says otherwise. (Seriously. Fight Me.)

On a more serious note, this is a one of my favorite places, period. For one, the food is good. It's cheap and you get a good pile of it. Overall, the shop carries the feel of a mom and pop shop. SUPER small and very narrow. It's not the best places for an intimate rendezvous unless you get take out. On the busy hours, everyone is squished together and there was definitely one time I had to climb over tables to get to the booth seat so my friend didn't have to. At the time, we were seated in the middle, between a few other groups on both sides, so it's not like I could scoot from one end of the couch. 

You'll have trouble finding a seat or evening just standing in line to get your take out during the busy hours on the weekday. Yeah, you heard me, weekday. It's on campus and very generous with their take-out. It's delicious and filling, and I've had a lot of success with people who have never had Thai food before or are picky eaters when I bring them here. Additionally, I've lost count of how often I've seen people bring benefactors, alumni, and business representatives or guests here with all them still in their nice suits.

They service delicious, hot food you can pick up in between classes or on the way to work. Actually, that's how it was for me more often than not. When there wasn't enough time for me to walk and ride back to the dining halls and then to another class, I'd call Basil Thai with my order. Then I'd walk there from wherever I was (or if you're further off, I suggest taking 23/Connector and ride to Wood & River, it'll drop you on the same block), pick up my food, pay for it, and get back to class. 

If you choose to eat there, it usually takes around half an hour. I usually finish in less. I'll lay it out to you. Any of the curries, noodles or stir frys (Pad Thai, pra-ram, etc) will usually take less than 10 minutes to get after you order. Moo ping or catfish or the chicken halves usually take 15 to 25 minutes. It's why when I'm in a middling rush, I go with pra-ram (the mildly spicy peanut sauce is really invigorating). When I have a bit more time, I like getting moo ping when I have more time. Unless they're having an off day in the kitchen (especially busy or backed up), it usually takes about that long whether you're sitting or getting take out.

I have seen younger kids in there twice, but it's on campus and primarily swarmed by students and faculty. I'd suggest going during the non-rush times, primarily right at 11 AM (but it'll get super crowded around 12 PM) or after 1 PM for lunch, and before 6 for dinner. On most days, there's usually less people at those times. That is unless there is some kind of big event or career fair that day....Well, they don't take reservations, and it is one of the first places to get flooded. If you're looking for a place that DOES take reservations and you have a car, then get a reservation at Thai Essence, their sister restaurant up north. Nicer place, more extensive menu, and slightly more formal, but more same owner and same flavor.

Don't be offended or surprised if they give you the receipt pretty much as they give you your meal. They're well aware that their place primarily serves people who are getting in, eating, then getting out. Eat your food, bring your receipt up to the front to pay. Very rarely will they pick up your check with your card/cash. 100% would recommend and am recommending. This is the place to go if you're being casual and would like impress somebody with your know-how of local eating places (if they don't already know, most do). It's a hole in the wall, but there's a reason it's so popular.
Just a small casual place that focuses on quality. Stopped in last week for a bubble tea and it was great as usual. Had Strawberry and it was great as always. Terrific place.

Good restaurant. Food is authentic and tasty. There are a variety of food options and bubble tea options. 

The price could be a little pricy, but personally it is worth the price, it is located on Purdue campus which can make it a little inconvenient for some. But for those living on campus, it is definitely a great place to visit and have a meal. 

The restaurant itself is small and not very big, you'll prob have to wait during busy time but it is def worth it.

Only recommend I can give is for them to expand the place, or do delivery. It'll make them a lot more money.

Best go to Thai place on campus. Definitely a hole in the wall restaurant with limited seating, so come early or order to go cause it gets pretty busy. Most everything is under $10 and they have a lot of options! I went last week for spicy eggplant (recent favorite) - it was very flavorful and was a huge portion (2 meals worth for me). I've also tried the pork skewers which were super delicious and I would recommend trying that. 

Their bubble tea is also pretty good! Haven't tried it there recently, but it has been consistently good in the past. Service is also great by checking up on tables and refilling water :)

This is one of the best Thai spots I have ever experienced. Pad Thai and the Red curry are my favorites. Inside are just a few tables, with mirrors to extend the visual space. While a very popular Purdue destination, we were still greeted and sat quickly. Food was prepared right away with very brief wait times. Multiple levels of heat available for their dishes for those who like it hot. Price is low, and excellent large portion sizes.

**VERBALLY HARASSED BY OLD ASIAN SERVER*** The food is decent but the staff is very rude. I went in for pick-up and decided to eat my food at the table. Unfortunately my chicken was undercooked, but I didn't complain. But then suddenly a server came over and started yelling at me for my insufficient tipping about. Terrified of this screaming server, I tipped him so he would stop verbally harassing me. He then kicked me out, and told me not to come back. 
This is the only Thai place so therefore I will only be having takeout from here on. I have also seen this old asian man yell at other people.
Terrifying, he needs professional help.

While I enjoyed my dish, there were things that I just couldn't get past. First off, they didn't have the first two things I ordered, so I went with my third choice. They also didn't have the custard bubble tea, so they got me "two color" bubble tea instead of 3 color. I ordered it without bubbles (tapioca) and they gave me an excessive amount of bubbles. We were also seated at a table in which our entire party was facing the mirror, making it a strange encounter indeed. One of us also didn't get a receipt after paying and had to go out of her way to retrieve it. The service was friendly but just couldn't follow through.

This is one of my favorite places on campus.  Located on Chauncey Hill, this place is always packed!  

There is limited seating and we've been there when the service has been bad, but the food more than makes up for it.  You can order take out too...we did that a bunch in college!

They serve a variety of bubble teas, but you can get better ones for a cheaper price at Latea or Kung Fu Tea.  The real reason to stop by here is the food!

Today I got the Hot & Sour Noodle soup with chicken. It is my go to dish and when the weather is cold, there is nothing better.  The broth is amazing with the green onion, garlic, cilantro, peanuts, sprouts, and noodles.  It comes in a huge bowl, so you may take some home.

My husband ordered the pad gra-tiam with pork.  It is basically covered in a garlic sauce served over lettuce and a side of white rice.   This dish is absolutely amazing. If I could bottle that sauce I would.

We've also tried their Basil Thai Fried Rice & Pad Thai.  While we normally don't get these dishes, I do enjoy them.

Occasionally we will get their Satay with peanut sauce. It is chicken marinated in several spices served on skewers.  The peanut sauce isn't needed, but we love it.  A little definitely goes a long way!

They open at 11:30, except on Sunday when they open at 12.  Definitely give them a try.  If you don't like being on campus they also own Thai Essence out on 52--it's their "fancier" version and it is great as well!
Very good Thai restaurant. Their yellow chicken curry, green curry, red curry, roasted duck curry are very tasty.

I called at 8:50pm to place a to-go order and they answered the phone and told me I couldn't place my order because the cook left to go to an event. Their hours on google say 9:30pm and so does their voicemail. Why are they open if they aren't going serve anyone. It's not like I wanted to sit down. They should have not answered the phone and changed their voicemails so customers are aware. This isn't the first time this has happened with this location.

Love this place!! I've been here several times. I've tried their fried rice, pineapple fried rice, garlic chicken, bbq chicken, catfish and my personal favorite, the cashew chicken. The portions are really good for the price. Most value for money meal in west Lafayette. The place doesn't have the best seating area/ ambience so try to go during the non rush hour time.

This is more of a fast-food Thai restaurant which is okay and consistent with the price and atmosphere.  We went on a Sunday evening so it was very busy.  The restaurant is a small store in the Chauncey Hill mall.  The shop isn't big and the tables were squeezed together.  I felt like I was dinning with the table on my left and right.

The food is pretty good and fast!  We had a couple Pad Thai and #91 dinner.  Both were tasty but not necessarily gourmet.  The service was good.  It felt like a group of college guys who were intently focused on running a restaurant.  They did pretty well.  The bubble teas were pretty good too. 

Give this place a try if you aren't after a finer Thai dinning experience.
