reviews.text:
Visited for the first time on a Saturday morning, right before noon. Fun and diverse crowd: groups of singles, families, all age ranges, and skin tones. Wait staff prompt and helpful. Social distancing between the all the tables, hand sanitizer near the entrance. My only concern related to COVID 19 is that a few kitchen staff weren't wearing their masks correctly (masks not covering the nose). The majority of the staff, however, were masked. We felt safe overall. Here's what we experienced:
 a. We got an omelette, a patty  melt, and drinks. Food was hot and fresh and tasty.
b. Wait staff seem to be a fairly young crowd, with oversight from a few more experienced people.
c. Tables were clean, but slightly sticky, which automatically means the good will be great.
d. Fun to crowd watch. There are booths, tables, and a "bar" area with a few people dining solo.
e. Pastry case near the register with pies, muffins, etc. Again, perfect for a diner! We didn't try any, but maybe next time.
f. Menus are available with QR code, to minimize contact.  Paper menus also available.
g. Good prices. Our check was under $20, before tip.
h. Our server called us "hon." 
i. What else is there to ask for?

Terrible service. I have never been to a place where servers actively look at you and do not care to attend to you. This was to the point I was ready to raise my hand like a child to get service. 
Not only did our table not receive things we ordered, we were also charged for those things. When we received our bill we waited for at least ten minutes for a server to come grab our check and at that point we just took our loss and left. 
I am extremely disappointed in the servers and the staff. You should never let a table go without drinks, especially when you are actively making eye contact with the customer, that automatically should tell you they need something. 
Absolutely embarrassing and I recommend hiring all new staff if that's how they treat customers. I don't know who these girls think they are, but yes we did notice you both clean a booth together when it should be a single person job, after seeing us needing attention. 
I am absolutely just lost for words at how childish this staff is. We may be young but we all work in the industry and would have absolutely loved to treat a good server, but that was not the case. Great food, but absolutely awful service. 
After closing our own places of work, we wanted to support other small Lafayette businesses, but we will for now on take our business elsewhere.

Stopped here for the first time on my way to work and when I got to work and opened it up I was not impressed. I ordered a coke and got Diet Coke and wanted grape jelly and got strawberry. My hash browns were way over done and my bread was soggy. Will not be returning.

We were in town for a wedding and decided to get breakfast at Westside Dinner.  On a Saturday around 9:30 we were seated immediately.  The service was great and the food was delicious.  Serving sizes were wonderful and we had a wonderful visit.

My only trip to WD was for breakfast on a very busy Sunday morning.  The facility is small.  The tables are squeezed together tightly.  Unfortunately I sat in what ended up being a high traffic area for everyone.  So my chair and coat were constantly being bumped.  On top of that the dinner is very loud.  You won't find a relaxing meal here.  I also found it very odd that people had to enter in behind the counter area to access the restroom.  Obviously layout in this dinner could be improved.

That said...the meal was pretty good!  The menu is decent size.  There was enough of the usual breakfast items to pick.  I had the corned beef hash and eggs plus a one biscuit side of gravy.

The hash was very good - better than most places.  The hash didn't have a strong corned beef flavor.  However it was cooked to perfection - slight crisp on the edges.  I added plenty of Tabasco sauce which cane standard at the table.  The gravy was a bit bland.  I had to spice up with a lot of pepper.  The biscuit was split and "smashed" to the plate.  I've never had a biscuit that was so thin.  That created a little bit of a tough texture to cut - just odd.  I had the sour dough toast which was a bit dry.  I had hoped that it was made fresh on site.  I don't think it was since it didn't have a fresh and moist flavor.  My wife said her English muffin was probably the best she has had (fresh) at a dinner.

I was impressed by the POS system used to take and process our order.  Very easy to do which created an Informative and fast check out.

I was also impressed by the team working here.  I saw a lot of teenagers and 20 somethings working.  Very few older adults.  I assume this is a family business.  If so...they did an excellent job at hiring and training good employees.  Our waitress was very attentive as she could be on a busy day.  There was a lot of staff on hand to handle the rush.  I was most impressed with the bus boy who wiped the crumbs from the table into his hand instead of onto the floor.  This young man frequently washed his hands throughout the shift (as the sink was in view of the whole dining room).

I definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a fast paced dinner experience.

First time trying this place but will not return. There are many better breakfast spots in town. The coffee was not good. French toast was so hard I could not get a fork in it. Giving 1 star for the good biscuits and gravy my husband had.

Great breakfast food, good lunches.  We have tried multiple items on the menu, including the poblano and pepper omelette, breakfast burrito and quesadilla.  When they are busy (weekends, especially when school is in session), you will wait 25-45 minutes for breakfast (recommend getting a warm, iced cinnamon roll while you wait).

I like this place.  My first visit was today. They did a nice job of remodeling. The space is clean and open. Server and other staff were friendly. 

I ordered the Monte Cristo sandwich with home fries.  It was tasty enough but was more like a slightly sweetened ham, egg, and cheese sandwich that was a little thin on the ham.  The home fries seemed to be just a cut up baked potato. They tasted ok they just seemed "unfinished" compared to home fries i've had before. 

I do not like the coffee. The coffee was very weak and tasted a little off.  Kind of common for diner coffee though. 

These criticisms are not major.  I like this place and will be back for another visit.
Love the food here, great service.  It's a shame the three cooks that I can see from the counter are NOT wearing masks over their noses and mouth.  Those aren't chin straps.

Came in with pretty high hopes given the reviews but was a little let down. Purdue area has a ton of diners around, so there is a lot of competition for this one to live up to. I walked in on a Sunday around 10:30 knowing that it would be busy from the hungover college students as well as the early church crowd. It was packed to the walls and clearly did not have any form of managing it. People were literally standing inbetween tables, outside, and in each other's space. My buddy and I didn't want to wait, so we sat at the bar just to be constantly bumped and breathed on by people waiting for they're table. What brought the score up was the fact that the service was not too bad given the amount of people. Drinks were filled occasionally and orders were taken at a decent pace. The food was very ok. Nothing about my chorizo hash or my buddies breakfast burrito stood out. They were cheap and they tasted cheap rather than nostalgic like top tier diners. Given the other options, I would go somewhere else.

The servers were great. However it took 45 minutes to get our breakfast. I ordered the hash browns well done. They came cold and basically raw. The eggs were mundane and the sausage gravy tasted like it came from a can. I will not go here again.

Such a wonderful place with such wonderful servers! I just moved to the Midwest (from San Francisco) and this was the first time coming to Indi and it was a great experience. The food was good. My server was so sweet. I wish I would have gotten her name. I got the taco salad. It was huge and so beautifully presented. My server was attentive and we had some good conversation because I was there after the lunch crowd. I look forward to coming back here again on my next trip to Indi.

Visited for the first time 05/16/19 for lunch and was pleased with the variety and quality of food. I really like the diner atmosphere - there aren't too many of these around it seems. Small town feel which was delightful. Plenty of seating and the service was really good considering there was a lunch crowd. Definitely visiting again!!!

The Route 66 diner closed down and this new diner replaced it. They've made some much-needed updates to the interior. The prices are similarly low. It doesn't have the exact same menu as Route 66, but I think the owners of this place must have gotten some recipes from the Route 66 owners because the menu still has some of the signature items, including what used to be called the Drew Brees (now called the country steak breakfast), which is country fried steak, eggs, potatoes and griddled biscuits. The biscuits taste a little different, but everything else tastes pretty much exactly the same as it did at Route 66. They also have some appealing options that weren't on the Route 66 menu, including chicken and waffles and a breakfast sandwich on either a biscuit or croissant that comes with your choice of meat, including fried chicken (it's more of a chicken cutlet than Southern fried chicken, but it was still tasty and I appreciate the option for those people like me who don't eat pork). 
My biggest complaint is that, compared to Route 66, the food takes forever to come out. But that's pretty minor and overall we're happy to have such a tasty, affordable place near our house. I expect we'll come here often.

I really like this place and go often. It's basic diner food, not amazing but not bad at all. Fine omelettes. Good mushroom burger. Love the flat fries and the pie!! Except... some weekends. I don't know who's on the grill in the afternoon/evenings, but I've twice ordered a patty melt during those hours and it comes out not-grilled! Like on barely warmed bread! That's NOT a patty melt, people. So, it's hit or miss, but good enough I keep going back. But I avoid weekends later in the day.

I had the chicken and waffles with a side of hashbrowns and it was sooo delicious. My husband and sister both had burgers and they were really flavorful. The waitress was so sweet and attentive, didn't have to wait long for the food at all. The price also can't be beat.
Breakfast burritos are A+ as are the pies. Great service, never a long wait, reasonable prices.
Good food, good service, always a pleasure coming here with great customer service. I come at least once a week. Even the desert is yummy.
Always loving their food. Best grilled cheese I've ever had. Fried potato is very delicious!
The food was good, I liked the atmosphere and service. They didn't have a kids breakfast menu.

reviews.text: Whatcha see is whatcha get. Nothing fancy and that is absolutely ok. Very well prepared homemade food in large quantities. Hubby had a perfect western omelette with enough hashbrown casserole to feed four people. My over medium eggs were perfect as well. Great sausage gravy that certainly did not come out of a can. American fries that definitely were never frozen. Super friendly and attentive staff. Will definitely return.
Awesome portions for the price! Simple, yet filling. Always a short wait, despite only a few people working. A great little diner!
This great breakfast and lunch spot had to move to Lafayette.   Find them at 11 North Earl Ave

Small town treasure. 

This place looks, feels, and smells like my great aunts house. Old, quaint, unpretentious. Service was friendly and most patrons seemed to know each other. A table of old retired guys hanging out and drinking coffee like any reputable diner should have. 

Came here for breakfast with my son. 

He got the kids pancakes and bacon. They were good. 

I got the biscuits and gravy with an egg on top since it's small town Indiana. The biscuit was good- moist, substantial, but not heavy and clearly homemade today. The gravy was also good, not overly greasy or heavy, hint of sweetness, and very good. 

Plus it's cheap-With drinks and tips it was less than $15.

Hubs and I went for the first time this morning based on a recommendation from his coworker. The SMALL town of Battle Ground IN is only a 10 minute drive from our home, and we were feeling adventurous, so we headed out. It's a seat-yourself, home-cookin', small-town, dinning hall with miss-matches chairs, and family pictures, and memorabilia on the wall. There was an all-you-can-eat buffet today for $11, manned by a student of Hubs (He's a teacher, and she's the sweetest little thing ever!) but we opted to order from the menu. They have a decent selection of well loved foods. And my half B&G/ half hash browns all cover in gravy was really good . Hubs has the Bacon Omelette and it was enormous, and though he enjoyed it a lot, he couldn't finish it. 

The place is filled with locals who visit often, and just like a small town, everyone knows everyone, and owner Stephanie Bailey knows most of them. We were definitely not from around those parts but we never felt out of place. At one point I told my husband he looked like Jane Goodall lol. The owner and the other employees were all friendly...even during the after church rush that we witnessed. 

The whole experience was great. The food, the prices, the hodgepodge of decorations covering every available area in the place was all worth it. I will go again, and I recommend taking the time to visit.

A fun, local diner--perfect for a good old-fashioned stick-to-your-ribs American meal!  Good food, good service, amazing coffee!  What more could you ask?  We out-of-towners definitely bookmarked this place on our GPS!  ;)
We completely enjoyed the food and the service is excellent in the feel at home cafe. We hope to make it back to this area and we will definitely return for great eats.

This had to be one of the worst experiences I've ever had with a restaurant. If you are not a local/regular, dont even bother because they will make sure you know how unwelcome you are as an outsider.

Basic dinner food served by a friendly staff.  We were amused by the belt buster burrito.  So big it could feed a family of 4.  My biscuits and gravy topped with two over easy eggs was just the right size.

I traveled from Logansport to have the biscuits and gravy.
I don't know if it was a bad day for the cook but the gravy was like wallpaper paste.
I've so much old things about the Eye Opener but the morning I was there was a very big disappointment.
I won't be back. 
the Good & Plenty in Logansport is much better.

Really nice small-town restaurant with friendly service and excellent food!  The portions are huge!  Great value for the prices.  Definitely a wonderful place to stop by to eat if you are in the area.

This is a wonderful restaurant with a friendly family feel. Their breakfasts are an excellent value (and I imagine their other meals are, too -- I've only had breakfast here.)

On Saturday mornings from about 7 am til 9 am or so a local area group called The Hazelnuts plays their music at the Eye Opener. You might hear numbers by Hank Williams, Patsy Cline, Merle Haggard, Buck Owens, The Carter Family, Hazel and Alice, or any of a number of others. 

I like Saturday mornings -- breakfast and music. What an excellent combination!
Such a wonderful place. The staff is extremely nice and the food is delicious. Best biscuits & gravy I've ever had all for a reasonable price.

My grandson and I LOVE this place!  Everyone is very friendly, the food is great and the prices are more than fair.  Our plates are always too full and we wind up taking food home.  Now they have opened an ice cream & pie shop next door so we are in complete heaven!  She makes homemade pies like you *wish* your mother had made!  Lots of flavors of ice cream and other baked goods too.  This is as good as it gets!
The portions are generous. The staff are friendly. The prices are reasonable. And the food tastes great.

We came here for breakfast while staying at Prophetstown. The sausage and cheese omelet was good flavor. The eggs were cooked to perfection which you don't find often. Bacon had a good flavor. Everything came out piping hot
Awesome pancakes!  Friendly people. Glad we stopped. Restaurant weary business travelers, this place is like having breakfast at moms.

One of only two (possibly three) restaurants in a very tiny town, but a good one! Fiance and I came here for lunch just as they were switching shifts. The decor is a cross of country meets cafeteria. Sunny was our waitress and she was as nice as can be. Very eager to steer us in the right food direction! We got the BLT with a side of homemade coleslaw and a cheeseburger with a side of onion rings. My fiance loves burgers and he was very impressed with the freshness of the burger as well as the bun! Based on our lunch, I would imagine their breakfast is equally as good and I wish we had arrived just a tad earlier so we could have indulged in that meal (as well as the musicians that play every Saturday morning). After we finished eating, the cook came out to talk with us about the area. Very nice guy and a good cook too! If you're ever passing through this area (we stopped for the Tippecanoe Battlegrounds) keep going a bit further down the road and you'll hit this place!
No frills, small town diner with decent food. Great prices, great service. Fine choice if you're in the area.

The eye opener has great food. The waitresses and staff are very nice. I work across the street and get busy a lot. So I order my food and the waitresses will bring us our food. That's what you call service.

images.alt: Photo of Hala's Grill - West Lafayette, IN, United States. Falafel (I ate one already!)
Photo of Hala's Grill - West Lafayette, IN, United States. Build your own bowl

reviews.text:
Hala's Grill is unique to the community, and something that was totally needed. Think of it as a Mediterranean version of Chipotle. There are several options to choose when you build your bowl, which was great for my family, everyone customized to their liking. Between the 4 of us we had the Beef Shawarma, Chicken Shawarma, and Falafel. It was all cooked to perfection, the falafel was still crispy even after the drive home. The bowls were filled generously, and all of the toppings and sauces were tasty. When I was eating my bowl, it seemed like it was unending, a very large amount of food.

I ordered online through their website, and they were putting the finishing touches on the bowls when I arrived 15 minutes later. The website was very easy to use, and it allowed us all to personally customize exactly what we wanted. The restaurant space is take out only. Both the employee and owner were very friendly and passionate about their food. My family can't wait to try it again.

I got a build your own bowl with basmati rice, shawarma beef, lettuce, tomato, feta cheese, cucumber yogurt salad, onion with sumac, ranch and tahini sauce. Super good! I would try chicken next as the beef became a little hard from the drive home. Next time I'd ask for more sauce too
We were glad to have tried this small restaurant as we found the food to be quite tasty and it was a healthy meal that left us feeling very satisfied.

Photo of Sacred Grounds - Lafayette, IN, United States. Just WOW
Photo of Sacred Grounds - Lafayette, IN, United States. extra seating
Photo of Sacred Grounds - Lafayette, IN, United States. Great shots all day long!!!

Photo of Sacred Grounds - Lafayette, IN, United States. Dirty Punkin just in time for fall
Photo of Sacred Grounds - Lafayette, IN, United States. Tea flavors

reviews.text:
Such a cute place! And even with all the social distancing measures taken there is still TONS of seating! I ordered an iced honeysuckle latte and my husband got their sacred hippie. Both were soooo delicious! The honeysuckle latte had the perfect amount of sweetness with a light honey taste and lovely hone
ysuckle aftertaste. The sacred hippie is the sweet version of a dirty chai. It had whipped cream with a caramel drizzle and toffee sprinkled on top. The barista described it as "dessert in a cup" and boy was she spot on. If you like a little coffee with your cream and sugar then this is the drink for you, but if you take your coffee black/unsweetened then maybe order something else. 
Overall, we loved the coffee and atmosphere and are looking forward to visiting again.

My favorite beverage depot in the area besides the awkward location not on the way to anywhere. Sacred Grounds is my spot in the city, free WIFI making it easy to stretch out in this eclectic reborn urban atmosphere. There's a great menu with original drinks, tasty real foods cooked up not heated up in a box, and really cool staff eager to please and drip an off menu drink as you like. All making good not just trading cash for caffeine but a wonderful reflection on the origins of this place also depicted in the graffiti. The only things missing are a strong selection of deserts like cheesecake nibbles, chocolates, and indulgent blended magic like Grayhouse does with their frozen hot cocoa liquid bliss. I've sampled many things here. The breakfasts are fantastic, wow proper biscuits and gravy! Makes The TripleXXX Diner look like bad Cracker Barrel. The wraps are amazing too. My usual was a Dirty Chai which sent taste buds a tingle and heart to palpitations. Last fall the pumpkin latte was legit pure riches. Lately I've realized Trent is a master: the Atomic Pony, lavender and white cocoa I think it is, when Trent makes it I cannot think of a better brew in the county. As my check-ins shows I might have a problem! It's a bummer we haven't had live shows this year. Shawn McDonald made for the best concert I've been to a few whiles ago because I was 15 feet from the stage and didn't have bleeding ears after. I would really like a Sacred Grounds 2 on campus: Hebrews? Espressoul? Brew Unto Others? Latte Say Grace?

Plenty of cozy tables and comfy chairs. Off the beaten path so traffic is slower. The latte art is picturesque & the staff is friendly and helpful. I love the dirty pumpkin iced and the honeysuckle latte hot (both with almond milk).

I wish I found this place sooner. I absolutely love what this place stands for and how great their food and coffee is. They have the best of both worlds. We ordered a grilled cheese and quesadilla and both were extremely delicious, filling, and flavorful. Even though it's a cafe, the food was restaurant quality. They took their time with our coffee making sure it was just right and put in extra effort with the whole process--pouring slowly, decorating with latte art, and bringing it to our table. In other words, I felt like our food and coffee was made with love. I really appreciate the Christian element too; the subtle Bible quotes and crosses made me feel at home. The inside is cozy in general, though I find the ordering side of the place much more aesthetically pleasing than where the couches are (what initially made me unsure of going). I wish this place had better hours so I could come more often!

Although I only stopped in for a plain cup of coffee, I really enjoyed my visit with the manager (owner?) of the place.  Located in an old church, the husband and wife team that run the place had things running smoothly.  I ordered a black drip coffee and had a choice of types, going for the Ethiopian coffee.  I love when a coffee is hot, but drinkable right away.  I refuse to give 5 stars to a place that intentionally tries to scald my palate or make me wait 20 minutes to make it drinkable.  This place was perfect like I make at home.  And with the cold temperatures outside, I appreciated that I could get the warmth inside me as soon as possible!

There is a Christian theme to the setting, but other than overhearing some discussions about theology at some of the tables, nobody tried to force their opinions on me.  

I was in town hunting down some public art and on the side of Sacred Grounds was a large mural and on the front, a 3D mural as well.  The murals were added in Sept 2018 as part of the Wabash Walls program and the manager was really helpful in directing me towards the locations and "extras" to look for beyond the large pieces.  It really made my hunt for the murals successful and I appreciated his taking the time to help me.

Five stars for customer service and for a great tasting coffee.

Review #1532

Unmatched unconditional love atmosphere 
Good coffee beans. Trent does his research. We get to benefit from his knowledge.

Found another favorite! My brother brought us for coffee and grilled cheese, and the employees hospitality completely won us over. They answered all of our question, made recommendations and were so friendly!! I had the Milky Way with their grilled cheese, while my husband had the dirty hippie with the grilled cheese as well... All of it was amazing. I cannot wait to come back and I definitely encourage anyone to come and try it.

Tried this place on a Thursday morning about 8:30.  Friendly from the start.  Great coffee and a three egg veggie scramble.   Excellent, peaceful, comfortable and very reasonably priced.  I'm not from LaFayette but while I am here I may come every morning.
A barista told me that this establishment is run by St. Ann's Catholic Church. If you disagree with ultra-conservative values, then please take your business elsewhere immediately and permanently.

Sacred Grounds is a wonderful hidden gem in Lafayette! Sacred Grounds on the outside, looks like an ordinary coffee shop, however when you enter the shop, the store transforms. The store interior is very homy and cozy. There is brick detailing, and many tables to use to study, catch up with a friend or read a book. 

In addition to a wonderful interior, the coffee itself is delicious. Each beverage is handcrafted, and all of the coffees/drinks are made with care. My personal favorite is the Milky Way, an espresso with milk, and lots of whipped cream. The baristas are always so welcoming and friendly! 

At most coffee shops, coffee can easily be $4, if not $5. At Sacred Grounds, coffee is reasonably priced! In addition, Sacred Grounds offers a 15% student discount and frequent visitor card.

I highly recommend Sacred Grounds if you're looking for a new place to grab coffee, study or meet up with friends!

This was the best stop on the start of our holiday vacation. Trent, the barista was kind and personable and the coffee was AMAZING. The atmosphere was so peaceful and welcoming. We also ordered breakfast and I was happy to see a Keto friendly meal that was delicious. Definitely a must go to spot!!
Stopped here for an early lunch with a coworker. Cool building with good vibe. I ate a grilled cheese and has a specialty coffee both were god.

I guess in the Midwest everything is slow. I'm used to 3 minutes max on waiting for a latte in Philly. 

When I arrived at Sacred Grounds there was no line and the woman behind the counter was doing something. The shop is cute but there is a large sitting/gathering room on the right side of the building. There was only one employee and it was around 7:35 when I arrived. 

It took around 5 minutes for her to finish whatever she was doing behind the counter as I awkwardly stood in the shop. There was no indication of where to stand to queue to order. Finally, she called me over and I ordered a small latte with whole milk. It took another 5 minutes for her to grind beans and make the drink. 

In between my waiting, another woman came in and grabbed a cup that the cashier had already made. I guess you can order ahead? If you can, I'd definitely recommend it cause it took wayyyy to long to get a coffee and I was cranky.

Overall, I won't be back, Nothing too interesting which is too bad cause I love to support small shops.

This is my favorite coffee shop in town! I've been there maybe 5 times now, and have loved it every time. My favorite drink is the chai tea latte, and I love that it comes at a drinkable temperature and I don't have to wait for it to cool for ten minutes. I always bring homework or a book with me, and it's the perfect atmosphere for that-- quiet, cozy, and productive. My only complaint is that there aren't a ton of convenient wall plug-ins, so I'd recommend charging your laptop beforehand, or just be willing to search for a plug-in

Well it's NOT a top-less bar! ~back in the day it was!

It's been reclaimed into a place where most 
of the Harvest Chapel and the "Avenue" residents 
Come to gather for Spiritual food! 
Human Food is good, mostly sandwiches...coffee/drinks are excellent and priced right!
Nice warm eclectic urban Safe place to hang-out...
For reading a good book/bible studies, listening to 
Christian music and they do have some top-notch 
Bands as well!

Everything said in the previous review still holds, although I realized I hadn't updated the tentative 4 to the well deserved 5.  

The food is good quality at good prices, the coffee is great (for once a place that does not over roast their beans).
And as I said in previous post "he place itself is super cute, brick walls, lots of light.  There are a ton of tables for working or studying or just sitting reading a book." 

But most of all, the people here are just completely wonderful. I feel extremely welcome. How could that not make you want to come back?

This is a very groovy place. Bright and open, it had easy access (except for a 3-step entrance with sturdy railings) for my 88-year-old mother in law who uses a cane. The breakfast menu was sparse (scrambled eggs, egg burrito, biscuits and gravy, oatmeal, and yogurt were the only offerings) but we really enjoyed the flavor of our eggs w mushroom, onion, cheese, and sausage and the biscuits and gravy. 

We especially liked the coffee, which was tasty (we had a mocha and a peppermint mocha) and we agreed it was better than other mochas we've had elsewhere.  The style is "order at the counter" and they bring it to your table. There were some tables of people working w papers and laptops about and other tables with big groups of chatting people. It was quiet (Monday morning at 9:30 between semesters at Purdue) so we were able to enjoy our conversation without struggling to hear each other.

The atmosphere was very interesting, with reclaimed items of all types repurposed for the decor. I gave 4 stars because of the narrow menu and also, our food wasn't served hot. I'm sure if we had asked, the pleasant and helpful staff would have taken care of it for us. We weren't excited about our menu choices when we placed our orders but agreed that everything tasted great. So ultimately, we were very happy with our breakfasts.

I would definitely return if I wanted a reasonably-priced egg breakfast with excellent coffee and low ambient noise. And, because I'm someone who spends a lot of time sitting in restaurants w my computer, this would be a perfect spot for me to hang out. 

P.S. There were some awesome-looking cookies that were freshly-baked. I didn't try them, but it's another plus to this interesting spot.

Thoroughly impressed both by the atmosphere and the young lady who served us.  I can't remember her name but she's the stunningly gorgeous one with exceptionally genuine customer service skills.   

My (equally lovely :) girlfriend and I wanted to be turned off by the blatantly Christian motif of this place, but ultimately we had to simply appreciate it.   Great design, unpretentious feel, and a solid B+ on the food and drinks.

WOW! come here you wont regret it. Oone day after taking a 9hr exam and hanging out in LAfayette of all places!
 Amazing coffee! Amazing space.  Plenty of plugs. Warm And courteous staff.  Awesome tables.  And apparently they host Nashville artists!! 

GREAT COFFEE! + GREAT STAFF + and music = gem

One thing wrong with this place is that its not where I live in chambana, il!

Note: seems like its christian owned from the Christian music (which I happen to be very fond of, im catholic raised) and the design of the tables (the tables seem to have been designed with bible pages see the pictures.)
Dont worry the place is not uncomfortable for atheists, agnostics, and or other creeds.  Its a coffee shop! A great one!

Note 2: im from Los Angeles and have lived in Philly, Boston and am very familiar with Chicago AND this is a great coffee shop!

Came here for lunch one Thursday afternoon with a friend. It's tucked away in a neighborhood so parking is not a problem. The building itself is very rustic and provides a very homey vibe. The menu is very "hippy" so to speak.

Ordered the Honeysuckle Latte and the Chicken n Veggie Quesadilla. The Latte was very earthy and sweet while the quesadilla had the right blends of cheese, veggies and chicken.

reviews.text:
Great food, good service.hahahahahahahaha
Would like to come back again.
Strongly recommanded.

I got delivery for my first try at this restaurant. I haven't had Chinese in forever and I was really pleased with what I got. Food was hot and fresh. Crab Rangoon was not just cream cheese, which is awesome! I got 4, but could have had 8 of these babies. The garlic chicken was really good, but not spicy at all. I was really happy with all of the vegetables in the dish. I added spicy garlic sauce from home to add some heat. Ask for it spicy. Overall, I will order again. Very filling and I have left overs.

Ate dinner at Blaze and it was all around really great! The seating area is fairly small, but made dining feel cozy. Everything we had was delicious. We split the dry pot combo. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because we had to stand up to get our own utensils and napkins (definitely not the end of the world). But the service otherwise was good and our food came out quickly!
There food are the most authentic Chinese street food on campus, period. Full of people every day during busy hours at noon and evening. So you better be early.
If you want chinese BBQ, this is definitely the place to go to! Great authentic food and strong flavor!

Visited for the first time on 10/12/18 for lunch and really enjoyed it! Small place with friendly service and more than enough portion sizes! Food came out pretty quickly once we ordered. One of my friends got soup and the bowl contained enough for 4 people! It was steaming hot, too, and I can't wait to have my own on a cold wintry day! Reasonable lunch prices $5.95. I will definitely visit again.
Be aware of MANDATORY TIPPING. We didn't have a very pleasant experience there. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to my friends.

This place is amazing!! I've always been a fan of Americanized Chinese food but always wanted to try authentic and this place has both! Great service, clean bathrooms and most importantly fantastic food! Don't be afraid to try something new because you will not be disappointed!!
This is the best place to go for some cheaper chinese food! The portions are very large and the staff is wonderful!
gooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo­oood verrrrrrrrrrrry goooooooooood strongly recommended.

I've been here multiple times and the food has always been kind of bland. I had the sweet and sour shrimp and the shrimp was frozen. It's cheap and the service is very good. The inside is small and there isn't much space.

Photo of Escape Velocity Brewing - Lafayette, IN, United States
Photo of Escape Velocity Brewing - Lafayette, IN, United States. Bar and indoor sitting area
Photo of Escape Velocity Brewing - Lafayette, IN, United States. Good going area
Photo of Escape Velocity Brewing - Lafayette, IN, United States
Photo of Escape Velocity Brewing - Lafayette, IN, United States. IPA and a porter
Photo of Escape Velocity Brewing - Lafayette, IN, United States. Pilsner & Kolsch

Photo of Escape Velocity Brewing - Lafayette, IN, United States. Dunkel and spinach artichoke dip
Photo of Escape Velocity Brewing - Lafayette, IN, United States. Drogue Chute

reviews.text:
Great addition to the local brewery scene. They have a small selection of beers, but they do it right. We had the Drogue Chute IPA and SCE to AUX Dunkel. Both were smooth, with no off putting after tastes. I loved the matliness of the Dunkel. 

They do offer food, and have a selection of appetizers, sandwiches, and snacks. The majority is made fresh in house. We enjoyed our spinach artichoke dip. 

They have a covered patio area that was perfectly shaded on a sunny afternoon. Our server was very knowledgeable and friendly.

We found this via a web search driving home from Bloomington to Chicago, and the menu looked perfect for us. I called ahead and said we'd be there in about 25 minutes, and the person who answered the phone said he would have our order ready when we arrived. When we got there, we just pulled into one of the marked spaces for curbside pickup, and they came out and took our payment then brought the food right to the car. So easy! And OMG THOSE SANDWICHES! They were DELICIOUS - I got the vegan grilled cheese and my husband got a weekly special sandwich with mushrooms. Both were FANTASTIC and came with really great crunchy potato chips. This will be a regular stop for us on our way to and from Bloomington. I highly recommend this place!

Good food. Vegetarian/Vegan which I'm not but I was happy with my falafel and my wife's grilled cheese and tomato soup were excellent. Great beer and a wonderful selection of ciders. Covered outdoor seating too

Wonderfully pleasant and easy going spot for casual brews, polite staff, and simply modern and accommodating atmosphere. I first sampled the magnificent distillation Stout and had to get more! Brought my own keg in and was pleasantly surprised to discover they only charged me ten to fill it up. It's a small menu but offers all the basics however a shower is maybe not surprisingly lacking. I'm all about the food menu too but didn't have time to sample it. Can highly recommend and will certainly be back soon with some friends!

First visit last night with our best bud Arlo. Beers are a good start for a new brewery with a ton of strong competition in town... 
Veggie/Vegan menu is a HUGE bonus and will draw many. Jackfruit Torta was AWESOME, chips were amazing and spinich/artechoke dip was great as well. 
Our server was GREAT and she was a dog-person and hit it off with our boy - nice bonus for us and our best boy. 
Looking forward to great things here!

Huge fan of escape velocity. I make the drive up every once in a while and absolutely worth it. Always great beer options that are brewed to style. If you're a BJCP sort of person you'll love it. The options seem to change fairly often, so usually something new and exciting to try. I am not a vegetarian, but all the food I've had so far has been very satisfying. I especially liked the jackfruit torta. I've never had jackfruit before and had no idea it was so good. The staff is amazing every time. Always glad when I get here.

Delicious beers. Great food. Great service. 

It is so great having a brewery in Indiana with such great beer. Jason is an award winning brewer and it shows, especially if you enjoy dark beers. I do not care for dark beers and luckily the Hefeweizen is outstanding. 

Great vegan, vegetarian, and gluten-free options and a killer sound track make EVB a must visit for anyone who enjoys a great pint.

There's always a first time.  And, this visit was it.  We've been to so many breweries over the past 25 years and unfortunately a lot of newly opened breweries serve subpar beer. But, NOT Escape Velocity. All 5 beers on tap were perfect. Perfect, you ask? That's a pretty brazen statement. But, yes, I will repeat myself, PERFECT.  Besides excellent beers, the brewery has a super cool atmosphere with fun colorfully painted walls, very comfortable seating, and the owners & partner slinging out the beers are really friendly and knowledgeable about their beers, of course. Beers sampled: IPA, pilsner, Kolsch, porter and a hoppy Belgian wit.

The beer was good; as was the service.  However, the soft pretzel was kind of a joke.  It seemed like it was basically bought from the Walmart freezer section, an 8 count for $2.  However, this was $7.50.  It came with flavorless beer cheese, so I ask for the other dip, horseradish mustard.  It wasn't bad, but not worth the $2 extra they charged me.  Go for a beer but eat before you get there.
Everyone should try the seltzer's, especially the pumpkin pie! I see it it everyone's future!
Great service and great food. First time having jackfruit and excited to try the rest of the menu.

images.alt: Photo of Buttery Shelf Eatery - Lafayette, IN, United States. White bean soup. Filling and delicious!
Photo of Buttery Shelf Eatery - Lafayette, IN, United States. Colonial theme seating area is small but nice
Photo of Buttery Shelf Eatery - Lafayette, IN, United States. Baked potato soup from the Lunch Sampler - very good
Photo of Buttery Shelf Eatery - Lafayette, IN, United States. Front of the restaurant
Photo of Buttery Shelf Eatery - Lafayette, IN, United States
Photo of Buttery Shelf Eatery - Lafayette, IN, United States. Full table available in the front
Photo of Buttery Shelf Eatery - Lafayette, IN, United States. Menu
Photo of Buttery Shelf Eatery - Lafayette, IN, United States. Chicken & dumplings and bean soup
Photo of Buttery Shelf Eatery - Lafayette, IN, United States. Menu
Photo of Buttery Shelf Eatery - Lafayette, IN, United States. Chicken salad sandwich came with a little scone, strawberry, and potato salad on a metal plate keeping with the colonial theme

reviews.text:
The Buttery Shelf is fantastic. This was my first visit, but I will absolutely be back. The business hours are limited, but it's a great place to grab lunch on a Friday or Saturday.

The food is great, and the portions are very generous. I had the lunch sampler, which includes a salad, a bowl of soup, and and a large sandwich. All three were delicious, but the corn chowder soup was definitely the star.

If you haven't tried the Buttery Shelf yet, you're missing out!

What a true treasure! The atmosphere is amazing. This is a place I would love to take out of town visitors. The owner is so generous, kind and does wonderful things for the community. The eatery is colonial and totally charming. The portions are ridiculously generous and the food is so comforting. Prices are really cheap, but the food is not. Try this place for lunch! Be aware of the limited hours.
A real hidden gem. Some of the tastiest food I've had in Lafayette. Great vibe and totally different from our standard sorts of places. We'll be back for sure.

After reading the reviews, my husband and I decided to check out this restaurant. We were not disappointed. It's a charming colonial setting with generous portions of delicious food. We each had the three course meal of salad, soup, and sandwich. A roll was served with the salad. Along side of the sandwich was a strawberry, a broccoli pasta salad and an amazing, tart mini lemon cake. We were offered take out containers for our sandwiches. For a very reasonable price we got multiple meals. The service was friendly. So pleased we could help others by dining out. We'll definitely be eating here again.

Great Thurs-Sat lunch place.  $7 for the 3 course lunch of soup, salad and sandwich  - any one of which would be priced at $7 or more in other restaurants.  Good quality and generous portions.   Very nice people supporting a charitable cause so even though you can eat very inexpensively, if you have the means, consider over-paying as it all goes to charity.

CLOSED until March 2017.  Very disappointed
 I hope they open again the reviews are very tempting.
The food was phenomenal and the rustic charm this place exudes is intoxicating! Best eatery in Lafayette!!

We've tried to go to this restaurant, but the hours are pretty tough (only open for lunch).  

Additionally, once we went on a Saturday when they claimed to be open, and no dice!    Bummer, the menu online looks good, and I love the concept

This is, hands down, the BEST restaurant in the whole of Lafayette/West Lafayette. We've been there on many occasions one of which was with a very large group that included children too. 

Remember that proceeds from this restaurant go to run the charity organization run by the owner. And all staff there are volunteers who've benefited from the charity at a certain point in their lives. So, they'll only be open for limited business hours. 

The very fist thing I noticed was the ambiance. It is has an exceptionally charming country feel to it. If charm and character in a place are your type of thing, then go there!

On the rare occasions when I ordered something which they ran out off (it happens in a small not-for-profit business like theirs) they'd always get a replacement which was just as fresh and delicious. Sometimes, they'd give over compensate and I'd get a huge box with food to go that I couldn't finish.  It comes in handy when you don't wanna cook.

The manager, Anna, custom made the entire menu for our party. They'll even make a separate menu for children if you request it.   

They're very vegan and vegetarian friendly. So, if you have a group with dietary restrictions they'll always come up with a creative menu that works well for all.  

I highly recommend their three course afternoon tea. Their portions are generous. I wouldn't recommend eating lunch before tea.  

And there's a chic little boutique upstairs too. So for anyone who likes to shop, check that out. It's worth it.
What a hidden gem! Food was outstanding!! The entire experience was above and beyond expectations! Can't wait for a return visit!!

This place is awesome. The decor is colonial American (pretty cloaks, dried flowers, woven baskets everywhere) and has a comforting home-cooked vibe. The servings are enormous- seriously, split an entree. My favorite is actually the spinach salad, they have this onion dressing that I love. I heard a server say that the spinach salad is what they're known for, and I'm not surprised. They always have different soups available and offer sweetened and unsweetened tea. The hours are a little bit weird, they're not open too often- usually I go Saturday for lunch. I'm not exactly sure how the charity affiliation works, but I know that a lot of the proceeds and I think all of the tips go to programs for feeding the hungry- they must be subsidized somehow and there's a short explanation in the entry if you're curious. It's cheap and delicious, I 100% recommend it on the food alone.

reviews.text:
During COVID-19 we've been looking for places that allow contactless payment and curbside pickup. These guys were really great - we asked them to drop the food in our car boot and allowed us to make the payment over the phone.

Food is still really great. Tried their wings for the first time - juicy and tender. The herb and Parmesan were great, as were the hot & spicy ones. Would definitely recommend. Pizza is great as always!

Great pizza!  Our Lafayette and Muncie favorite pan style pizza joint. I love that I can go to the brewery next door, drink a beer and have our order delivered to the brewery.  I think the Greek dressing on the Greek salad is a hit as well.  Meatball sandwich is a good sammy option. You can't eat in the brewery now, but you can take it home from there.

Really good pizza it's a bit expensive but worth it because it's better than most fast food you'll find around here and they have variety and authentic ingredients with great taste and it's not too greasy
Greek special pizza is one on the top 3 in the area.....very special.....good service...will return

If Chuck E Cheese wants to reach a different demographic, they could sensibly team up w this chain. 

Boasting sauce so sweet you'll be scrambling for an insulin pump, and a crust so bland and vanilla you'll wonder if it's recycled Wonder bread, this pizza doesn't even taste good if you are absolutely ravenous. 

Whole bunch of cheese though, hence the one star. Skip this place & try somewhere else. At least Chuck E Cheese includes entertainment for the price...
Why say your open until 9 when you actually stop orders at 845? Worked retail 15 years and would let people in 2 min after closing but I guess that was when customer service mattered...

Excellent Pizza and Wings‼‼ Best tasting delivery pizza in town.    
The owner works really hard to make sure customers are satisfied.
Very Satisfied customer

Deborah
Pretty decent pizza, though it's a little "pizza hut" for my liking. Still, I appreciated that they delivered to the nearby bar where is was having some beers. Good prices too for what you get.

Very good!  I ordered for the first time and was pleased with my order.  They have daily specials, and I took advantage of today's special, one medium pizza with two toppings for $2.  They have good choices for toppings.  The pizza and its topping were great.  It has a thick crust, but flavorful and not too thick and dense.  Pro tip:  order sides of cheese sauce and dip the crust like breadsticks.  I also ordered a Greek salad.  Loved that the lettuce is finely chopped.  My order was for carry out.  When I picked it up, I noticed that the seating area was nice and very clean.  I'll definitely order again and would dine in as well.

Our first visit and we ordered the Roma, a small antipasti salad, spicy buffalo wings and a large pepperoni pizza. The price point was a bit higher than other fast and ready places but the quality of the food is worth it. The favorite: the Roma pizza. The pizza has a white sauce and is loaded with flavor.

I crave this pizza in my sleep! Being from Chicago, I'm pretty picky on my pizza! After 12 years being in Tippecanoe County, I have finally found a great pizza place in West Lafayette! Don't forget to get their breadsticks, their dough is handmade right in their kitchen, flaky and delicious!

I like Greek's. The pizza is pretty good and reasonably priced for a local place. This may just be me, but I don't love the plain cheese pizza. It tastes off to me. I love the ham and pineapple! That's actually the only pizza at this place I DO like. I'm still giving it 4 stars, though, bc the staff is friendly, pricing is reasonable, and the appetizers are good. A community staple!

We get pizza from here pretty regularly and it's one of the best pizza places in the Lafayette area (which isn't saying all that much). I especially like their Roma pizza, which has tomatoes, spinach, feta, mozzarella and a really yummy garlic butter sauce. There's hardly any seating and I definitely recommend taking your pizza to go.

Excellent pizza in a very cute shop. Not much seating space. Roma pizza was a white pizza with LOTS of cheese. Perfect. This is NOT a Greek restaurant though - don't come looking for gyros or baklava.
Reliably good pizza, delivered early. Yum! Not quite thin crust, yeasty. lots of toppings.

This is definitely one of my favorite pizza places. I usually order the Chicken Bacon Ranch and the Buffalo Pizza for my family to share. I usually get it delivered, however, it takes them over an hour to deliver them to my place even though I don't live very far from them. Although it is one of my favorite pizza places, it is pretty pricey. I would say 2 XL pizzas would be around 50 dollars. I will have to try their other pizzas in the future!

My friends and I go to Purdue. We decided to try Greek's Pizzeria on a whim. At first glance, I thought the restaurant was take-out only but turned out to have a cute and cozy dine-in area. Upon entering, we were greeted with the sweet smell of pizza baking! We ordered three different pizzas. We ordered both Sunday specials for $12 each (one came with sticks and the other came with two toppings) and we ordered a small Roma pizza. We thought the Roma pizza would be enough for two people but turned out not to be. Fortunately, the chef had no problem in whipping us up another medium merely 20 minutes before closing. I was very impressed with his daft customer service. The pizzas shined in both the sauce and the cheese components. The sauce was well-made with a rich and somewhat sweet sauce. The cheese was thick and gooey which I preferred. The dine-in area had a TV with a gameshow playing. We were very invested into the show which added to the overall experience. But that's not all, the cream of the crop was that they sold Triple XXX root beer! Overall, great eatery with what seems a rich history. Thank you!
No impressed with their pizza at all! Find the nearest Pizza King or Arni's. Tried it twice, not friendly at all, pizza burned underneath both times. Pretty light on the toppings

My first go at Greeks was decent I suppose. The ingredients were fresh, but the feta on the Roma pizza had a some what chemical taste. The crust could have been crisper. For vegetarians there are more options than most places, but their sizing options are a little odd. They offer small, medium, and extra large. Skipping completely over large. Over all I might try then again, but I know I make a meaner pie at home.

My favorite pizza place in town. The pizza is very fresh and delicious. And you have to order the Garlic breadsticks! They are made fresh everyday from dough. Service is always great as well. Give it a chance, I'm sure you will be pleased!

reviews.text:
Got Peppercorns Kitchen after SO long and the wait was worth it! 

I called them on phone to place my order and they let me know that my food will be ready in only 10-15 minutes (yay!). The pickup was contact-free and awesome. When I entered the restaurant, there were tables marked for pickup and you just had to find your order and pick it up! 

We got a Crispy Chicken with Garlic Sauce & a Chef's Special Stir Fried Chicken. I was a little worried that the dishes may be too dry or too oily - but none of that was true! I absolutely loved both the entrees, they were perfectly cooked & still warm!! They sent a rice box with each of the dishes. Their packaging was super nice so that if any of the sauces leaked, they would still be in the packet, which wouldn't seep through. 

The prices were a little bit steep, but definitely worth it because the quantity is a lot, so you can either share with multiple people or eat the food over multiple meals. 

Would 10/10 recommend you to go try it out if you haven't already!
The food is slightly on the expensive side, but it's so good. We've used this place several times over the past year and never had a bad experience.

Ordered from grub hub for on a random weeknight at 720 which I thought was a peak time and was pleased that it arrived by 8.

I ordered Mongolian beef and unfortunately came out very sweet and oily and did not have the regular fried glass or rice noodles I have typically seen it come with

The Kung pow chicken also was a little bit sweet and not spicy enough even though I chose and spicy and this came with a lot of wet sauce which I thought was a little interesting as well

The dumplings which are really Gyoza were fine and the crab Rangoon's were par for the course

If I were to order again I would choose something different the portions however are fair considering the prices the pricing is in line with other Chinese restaurant competition in the area

Got dinner to go for me and the family and can I just say this is great quality food. The food has great flavor. My husband got General Tso hot and spicy he said it was very good but he wished it was more spicy. My kids got orange chicken and they loved it even my son who is picky loved it. I got sweet and sour chicken and it was by far the best sweet and sour chicken I have found around town.

This was probably the most difficult rating I've ever given.  I wrestled between 2 stars and 3 stars for hours, if not days.  I really wish we could incorporate 1/2 stars.  After much deliberation, I finally decided upon two stars.  I don't know - maybe this is being too harsh.  I'll let the readers be the judge.  On to the review...   

I arrived in West Lafayette at approximately 6:00 p.m on a Friday night.  I was famished, having not eaten a morsel all day.  I was craving Chinese, and turned to YELP for help.  There were many options, but most weren't rated very high.  Peppercorns hooked me with a bunch of appetizing photos.  

When I walked in, I had mixed feelings.  The decor lacked something.  I can't put my finger on it, but it definitely lacked something.  On a positive note, the place was nearly packed, and I'd estimate 90% of the customers were Asian, so I figured it had to be authentic.

I ordered the Crispy Chicken with Garlic Sauce.  It came out on a twice-chipped plate (two huge chips).  A chipped plate isn't as bad as a chipped glass, but its still an issue to me.  As I mentioned earlier, I was famished.  I spun the plate so I couldn't see the 2 chips, and dug in.    

On the menu this is listed as: Crispy Chicken with Garlic Sauce.  It should be listed as: Salty Chicken with Oil.  Way too much salt and way too much oil.  Don't take my word, check-out my photo and you'll see the oil.  I did not like it.  But too be fair, I've never ordered Crispy Chicken anywhere in my life; so maybe this is exactly how it is supposed to taste.    

On a good note: service was awesome.  There were tons of friendly, and attentive workers scurrying around the place.  Some of the best service I've experienced anywhere.  

I wish I ordered a different dish, something I've tasted before.  Then I would have a point of reference.  I will be back here soon, and I will order a different dish.  Then I will either update my rating, or be more comfortable with the rating I gave.  Judge for yourself...

Eggplant with garlic sauce was floating in oil; I could barely eat it. The basil beef was decent but not as flavorful as I'd hoped. The rice was bland- I know, what do you expect from rice? But some Chinese restaurants make really good rice, trust me. The spring roll was good. Overall it was meh. I probably won't order from them again.

Food was very good.  
Service sucked,  
I understand now why there's a 18 % gratuity added to the bill.
Might be back, not sure though.

First, NO LUNCH SPECIAL ON FRIDAY (any more), albeit it still says Monday to Friday on their website. 
Second, it's already ridiculous to charge an 18% tip for lunch of a party of two, let alone the service was so bad from the ignorant waitress with that long, unhappy face. 
Finally, the food was so oily, and a $14.95 dish doesn't even include a small bowl of rice. You have to pay 1 extra dollar for it. 
Simply terrible. Will not return. Really wish there would be better options in town for some decent Chinese food and friendly services.

OMG.  Amazing!  Loved in Taiwan for 2 years and have been searching for a restaurant that can serve the delicious food I've been missing.  Didn't know I would find it in Lafayette!  Such a gem!  The spicy wontons and Peking duck were amazing!  Will probably go back before we leave.  Hope our son goes to Purdue so we can visit!

Ridiculous REQUIRED 18% TIP.
Lunch special dish $8.95 was charged regular price $13.95 and did not come with Spring Rolls/Soup.
WTF???!!!

I went despite reading the negative reviews, and I was pleasantly surprised since I did not see anything said in the negative reviews. The food is quite tasty. I had the shrimp and veggies fried rice, very fresh with just the right touch of seasoning. The service was courteous and prompt. I did not see an automatic 18% tip added to the bill. I'd go back anytime I'm in the mood for Chinese food.

Earlier this week, I had the pleasure of dining at Peppercorns Kitchen.  It was among the best Chinese food I've eaten, and one of the dishes was in the Top 10 off all-time.

Let's get two things out of the way:  one, the restaurant's internal signage is in Chinese.  The bulk of the menu is Chinese, with (very) short English descriptions (but lots of pictures).  Even the sign that usually says "Please wait to be seated" is in Chinese.  At least, that's what I'm guessing it said, based on where it was located.  But based on how much Chinese I speak, it could have just as easily read "Free Beer Tomorrow", or "Tonight's Movie is 'Crazy Rich Asians'".

The point being, it's a CHINESE restaurant.  While I hate to use the word "authentic", for any culture I'm not a part of (Chinese, Mexican, hipster), I'm going to guess this is the real deal.  But it's Chinese first, and you have to figure it out.

Two, the service is different.  Not better, or worse.  Different.  I've seen this in similar restaurants.  Multiple servers.  Dishes served in the "wrong" order.  Dishes coming out at different times.  An indifferent attitude toward cleaning off tables.

So now you know.  If either of these bother you, don't go.  They aren't going to change, and I'm sure there's a Chang's somewhere nearby that will suit you better.

But if you have an adventuresome palate, this is your spot.

Four dishes were sampled:  Chinese Broccoli with Garlic Sauce, Xinjang Style Sautéed Beef, Chicken with Sichuan Pickle, and from the "Specials" menu, the Cauliflower dish.

The broccoli was perfectly cooked, tender, with a gentle garlic sauce.  It's not overpoweringly pungent, just a great taste.  It was very well-done, and was the worst of the four dishes.

Because the other three were outstanding!  So good that a dish that would be one of the best at another restaurant was simply an also ran here.

The Chicken was a stir fry of ground chicken meat, spices, and chopped pickle.  Don't think cucumber garlic dills; this was more of a preserved pepper.  Heat, not vinegar.  The dish was served with steamed bao-type buns, and the bland buns helped temper the spice.

The Beef was amazing.  It was strips of beef and onions, sautéed with a delicious sauce.  The sauce caramelized a bit, so there was a bit of sweet, then a fullness of flavor hits.  Unctuous, rich with umami.  Even the onions by themselves were delicious, given this sauce.

But the best was the Cauliflower.  Served in a small wok, over a small burner, the cauliflower, peppers, and pork belly are sitting in a small pool of enhanced oil.  That begins to bubble and pop, so you stir the dish as you're eating it, ensuring the belly crisps up, the cauliflower sears a bit, and the Sichuan Pepper infused into the oil begins to flavor everything.  As a result, your tongue will get a bit numb (side effect of this pepper).  This is one of the best dishes I've eaten, with the three kinds of cauliflower (yellow, green, white) aggressively spiced, with the delicious pork belly providing a kick of salt and delicate fat.  The heat kicks in after a few minutes, and when you finish, you'll realize you've eaten a lot of peppers.  It is an amazingly flavorful dish; one of the best things I've ever eaten.

My apologies for not taking pictures.  Frankly, I was too busy eating to pay attention to preserving the experience.  It's that good.

So why only 4 stars?  Hey, the food is a solid 5 stars--really outstanding flavors, plated and presented nicely.  But uncleared tables are unappetizing.  So while I can certainly deal with it, it does come into the rating.  Same with spotty service.  I don't care, if the food is great (and it is), but it does come into the rating.

So 4 stars to some of the best Chinese food I've ever eaten.  I'll absolutely eat there again.  And again.

Expensive, but I've been there three times. Why? It lets me remember my hometown by 50%. And that's already pretty good. 

I don't think there is any restaurant here that can fully resemble the restaurant in China, so I give 4 stars to show how good they already did.

EVERYONE CAN DISPUTE THEIR 18% SERVICE CHARGE IF THEY DID NOT INFORM YOU UPFRONT.
 This is my first time here. We really enjoy the food here. The only thing we are dissatisfied is that they included 18% tip on the receipt. And I saw many people struggle with the same issue.
I argued this tip with one of the server, and she told me they have been doing this for a long time. (Whaooo?? This is not an excuse for not telling us)
Well, this is not what we do thing in California 
Service fee is not mandatory by law (I believe this is true in every state?), and if the restaurant requires customers to pay 18% tip, the restaurant must inform customer ahead of time (not when they get the bill).
Yes, whatever I said is by law. Please search it up yourself and correct me.
Btw, I don't see any pleasure service in this restaurant that I would pay 18% though. 
At lease server in LA would help me put the left over in boxes for me‍‍‍

Nice authentic Chinese Szechuan restaurant. They have a very diverse menu with ~10 options for every meat and vegetable option, not including chef specials or appetizers. The restaurant itself is very clean, neat, and there is plenty of seating. I returned last night (after 2 years of not going) and it has greatly improved. I was hesitant to return because the service wasn't as good and the food was mediocre for the price. This time, I was very pleased with the food. The price was still a bit steep for me, so it's more of a "treat" than an everyday restaurant. Prices average almost $14-15 per entree and rice is not included ($1). 

We ordered the spicy wontons, crispy chicken in garlic sauce, and shredded pork. Spicy wontons were only ok - the skin was a little too thick, the stuffing was under seasoned, and the sauce was only ok. I probably wouldn't order again. Definitely spicy. Crispy chicken in garlic was delicious! Not overly greasy and the sauce had a good mix of sweet and sour. Tasted like a homemade sauce with Chinese vinegar, ginger, and other great spices. Our favorite dish was the shredded pork in garlic sauce. It comes with tofu skin and sliced green onion to make a mini burrito. Amazing combination of flavor and texture. Would definitely order the chicken and pork again. 

The service was also on par. Staff are constantly circulating to clear plates, refill waters, and get boxes/check. It was amazing, especially since we needed water for our spicy wontons!

One bad thing that I dislike for all restaurants - 18% added gratuity included. I found it very strange, especially since we were only 2 people... Luckily, I feel like the experience deserved a good tip, but I just don't like it forced on me, ya know?

TLDR - Delicious, but pricey food. Great service. Can't wait to try more! 18% gratuity even in groups of 2.

Decided to get takeout because the service here is terrible according to every person I've talked to. I got the Mongolian Chicken extra spicy and my friends got the Kung Pao Chicken. Overall flavor was honestly fairly average for Chinese food. The spice was there, but again nothing that stood out. The price was really what blew me away. 14 bucks for a single entree at any takeout chinese restaurant is highway robbery considering the fact that it was the same quality as panda. I could have saved money, gotten similar quality, and more food elsewhere.

Can't believe some of the poor ratings...food is awesome and authentic! Steamed pork belly on greens is my new fav. Give it a shot if you've ever had the best Chinese food served on paper plates elsewhere in the world. Otherwise, stick to Panda Express lol

When Peppercorns opened the food was amazing. I've noticed a slow decline in quality over the past few years. Sadly Chinese restaurants in Lafayette seem to follow that trend.

I ordered take out on Wednesday for myself and a friend. Pan fried noodles were far from pan fried. I didn't make a fuss over it because in the past pan fried or not they were tasty. Tofu/pork was 95% tofu, 2% garnish, and 3% pork. The Chinese buns and sticky rice were the only really good item we got. I'm very easy to make happy if the food is good. I can't say that here. The mains tasted exactly the same. It was very bland as well. Blindfolded I'd be hard pressed to tell which was which.

I regularly eat out or bring home Chinese food. Top 3 cuisines easily. Last 2 times I had food from here I had thought the dishes tasted very similar but I gave benefit of doubt. There is no doubt now. That was the last time I will be ordering anything from here. It was a very expensive plate of rice and buns. The mains were not edible past a few bites.

Summary: Good Chinese food

We'd been in Lafayette for a week and were really craving some authentic Chinese food so tried this place out on a whim. 
Firstly, it's a nice, spacious restaurant, clean, well lit with lots of seating. 
Our server was polite enough, but didn't go out of her way to make us feel welcomed (I think there may also have been a slight language barrier). Sometimes it was a little tricky trying to get their attention .

The menu has some good choices, of which we tried the following:
1. Hot and sour soup - my parents loved it. My mum can be very picky when it comes to her food (being a great cook herself) but she commended the soup. 
2. Dumplings - they were good but more oily than what I'm used to. 
3. Seafood fried rice - delicious, hefty portion! I don't usually go for fried rice as I prefer plain rice or noodles with the side dishes but the fried rice was really great. Almost a meal in itself I would say. 
4. Sizzling fish fillet dish - strangely enough it wasn't sizzling when it came to our table, not sure why? But the dish was your standard fish fillet, nothing spectacular. 
5. Mapo tofu - this is a tofu with minced pork dish that we invariably end up getting. I can't say this is the best mapo tofu I've had, but definitely not the worst either, a happy medium perhaps? One thing I noticed though is that there was quite a discrepancy between the amount of tofu vs. minced pork in the dish (the latter being more sparse). Otherwise good (a little oily!)

Would I go again? Probably. Our only main issue I would say is that they did add a 18% service charge to the bill. We weren't exactly thrilled with our service to start with, but this is something to watch out for.

Here is the break-down of different factors: 

Food quality: 5/5
This is an authentic chinese restaurant. You should be able to find that out as soon as you look at the menu. Do not expect to get american style (panda express-like) "orange chicken" or such entree in this place, you won't get that. I've tried many items here from unregular ones like pork-intestine pot to more regular ones like lamb saute or crispy chicken. Very good quality. 

Service: 1/5 to 5/5 (it varies)
The service part can get better. But the 18% mandatory tip ruins it. There is no reason for waiter/waitress to earn the tips because it's already there.  I'm not a business owner so I do not know, but I would rather get rid of the mandatory 18% tip and strive for better reviews on yelp/google hence attract more customers. It just ruins it, please.

Final rating: 3/5
