reviews.text:
We have been to The Bryant many times and it is always great! Our family enjoyed the Superfood salad with shrimp, Mexican Corn Salad with shrimp, and the Mexican Corn Salad with Chicken. They were all so good but the All-Star was my daughters Chicago Italian Beef Sandwich! It was so tender and full of flavor! The fries were good too! My grandson got the cookies & cream milkshake as a dessert and we all shared it!
Free parking on the property. They have a great patio if the weather is nice too!

The Bryant has a large patio, which was perfect for our first dining out experience during the Covid crisis. The staff was all wearing masks, and they use disposable paper menus. They have a large drink menu with a good variety of craft beers and unique cocktails. 

The dinner menu has a good balance of entrees and sandwiches. I had a hard time deciding what to order, but was hungry for fries so I went with a burger. I had the Strawberry Brie burger and my husband had the Chorizo burger. The flavor combination on each burger was fantastic. There was a generous amount of toppings, and my beef was cooked a perfect medium. The fries were cooked just right, and we received a large amount. Our server was friendly and professional, and all the staff made us feel welcome and comfortable.

Go eat here.. you will not regret it.  --- that should be all I need to say, but I'm not a social media influencer, so i'll provide additional details. 

Went during Covid for inside service (was 100 degrees outside).  Bryant (pub probably intended) was our server and he was AWESOME.  Great, quick, friendly service.

The menu offers plenty of options from sandwiches, hamburgers to gnocchi.  I went with a jalapeno burger and added bacon. Bryant tried to tell me it will be the best burger I've ever had.. 
. 
.
suspenseful huh? 
It was legitimately one of the top 3 or 4 burgers I've ever had.  It was cooked perfectly (medium) and had flavors everywhere.  Compliments to the chef on taking a normal, basic burger and crushing it.  I ate it all. 
We also had some nachos to start (or something like that) that were awesome, great pairing of flavors

Beer - plenty of options, i did the pick 3
Cocktails - lots.. friends had good things to say
liquor  - well stocked - had blantons. 

Do yourself a favor.. go there.. enjoy the libations and food. Tip them well.

I stopped here recently for a Saturday afternoon late lunch and my party of 4 enjoyed the food and it's a comfortable place.  Very good service from Bryant-don't know if that was a coincidence or not!

The Crispy Fish Sandwich was tasty, with banana pepper rings a highlight while the Lamb Burger was a hit as well.  The Warm Pretzel appetizer was tasty, with the sauces-mustard and beer cheese being great.  Good sauces, dressings on everything we ordered.

I'd return next time in town-or even-when traveling past.

This place is cute and as you drive by wouldn't think it's a restaurant. The side patio looks like it's a great place to be when the weather is nice. 

I enjoyed the raspberry purée mule. We started with the cheesesteak egg rolls. The egg rolls were kind of bland. The beer cheese dipping sauce help some. My husband and I each had a side salad which was a typical salad, it was good. My husband had the chicken. It was topped with a chorizo mix. He enjoyed the chicken. He said the potatoes that came with it were dry. I really enjoyed the Cajun shrimp. The flavors were awesome and it had little strips of sausage in the mix. 

Only issue we had was our waitress would go missing for long periods of time. Other than that it was a good find.

I'm glad that I was finally able to check this place out! They have an extensive menu and it was difficult deciding what to get. We were both craving burgers and decided to try some out. We ordered poutine fries as a starter. It did not disappoint! The fries were crispy and were covered with just enough cheese. There was plenty to share between the two of us and we even had some to take home. 

Now the burgers were just okay. I favored the jalapeño burger over the Bryant, however both burgers were greasy. The jalapeño burger had too much sauce. I would recommend asking for the sauce on the side. 

I would come back, but I wouldn't order a burger. The overall atmosphere was nice and the waiter was friendly.

I've been here a few times, but this is the first time I tried more of their vegetarian/vegan dishes. Unfortunately, my experience wasn't too great.

Service: Excellent. They were more than happy to offer us curbside pick-up and kept the whole transaction contactless. 

Food:
1) Their superfood salad comes with a red wine vinaigrette. The portion is great, but it was a very dry and stale salad. It was lacking in shaved parmigiano, pear, and dates. Definitely needs more dressing for the amount of shaved brussels and cabbage in there! I just would not recommend this dish for $8. 
2) The Impossible Burger is good, but it just seemed a bit "flat". Perhaps it could do with more lettuce, dijonnaise, cheese ? I'm not able to pinpoint the exact issue, but it's not a juicy burger, which is what I hoped for. 
3) The Impossible lasagna was my first taste of a vegan lasagna. This, I would recommend! It was flavorful, had the right balance of cheese and "meat", and it was a good portion size. The pesto sauce that comes with it was super yum!

The modern aesthetic inside is nice and sleek, the staff seems to all be very accepted by their owners, dresscode makes the place a nice and warm environment.  Good beer and good burgers.  Not sure what else was there, the burger smelled too good.

The Bryant is such a nice place, the interior was gorgeous, and great for any occasion! They have great food, great service, and I highly recommend everyone to go!  I went for lunch and I ordered several items, and everything came out in good time and looked gorgeous!

I had to get takeout, so it may be better when eating in. I had the Bryant Burger with bacon. I was a little disappointed with the burger. It said it's made with brisket. The burger looked like a pre-made patty from Wal Mart. I expected something more homemade. Flavor was okay. A little disappointed with my food experience. Some of the members in our group had the mushroom risotto. It was okay, probably much better eat in. The food was all hot. The lady serving the food was friendly. 

Overall 3.5 bellies on my 5.0 scale.

We ordered the pretzel, Bryant burger, and Cajun shrimp pasta. As an appetizer that isn't too expensive ($6) I completely recommend the pretzel! It was veryyyy good. The Cajun shrimp pasta had a nice kick to it, so I wouldn't get it if you don't like spicy food. I really enjoyed the flavors in this dish and my boyfriend kept stealing bites of it. He said that his burger was mediocre - not the best burger he's ever had, but he finished the whole thing. I also recommend the raspberry Moscow mule.
The service was pretty slow, and it took him a long time to come and take our order.

Fantastic meal. Ate here tonight with my sister and mother. I'm from out of town and like to eat locally owned and this was a great choice. Love the clean, modern setting. Our waiter, Josh, knew the menu inside and out. We got the pretzel appetizer. For my main dish I got the salmon with butternut squash purée, Just excellent. My sister loved her Mexican street corn salad with bang bang shrimp and my mother had the macadamia crusted chicken with mascarpone mashed potatoes that were to die for. The service was top notch, we weren't rushed. I can't recommend this place enough.

Services was IMPECCABLE! Our server's name was Cassondra and she was so helpful and suggested great drinks for us. The atmosphere was perfect for a lunch or a dinner. 10/10 on the old fashioned and the strawberry Brie burger! it would be a mistake not to choose this restaurant!

I don't even know where to start with the BryantRestaurant... I'm a former Lafayette restaurant for 28 years, and was visiting my family for thanksgiving when I stumbled on this newer spot, and I have to say I'm extremely upset it wasn't here when i lived in town.

The whole vibe of the place was great, and is a very trendy spot to grab dinner or drinks. I'm a burger fanatic so I went with the Bryant burger, and I'm 
glad I did.

The burger was cooked perfectly and very juicy, and the cheese melted perfectly over the patty. The bacon was thick the way bacon should be, with added onion straws for additional crunch. The fries were another big plus, which I've found in most restaurants like this, the burger is great with mediocre sides.

For $14, I have no complaints and plan on coming here each visit home! (Put one in Orlando Florida please!)

Was very impressed with the Bryant. 

Took my mom out for a nice dinner and had a great time. The service was great and the food was even better. We had drinks, appetizers, mains, and desserts for about $40 per person. Not cheap but not awful given the quality.

Can be pretty crowded so probably best to make a reservation if you don't feel like waiting.
Amazing Buffalo chicken burger. Truffle fries are great. Slowing working my way thru trying everything on this crafted menu. My compliments to the chef!

If I could give a 4.5, The Bryant would definitely deserve it. It is a perfect date night or family celebration dinner place as the ambiance is very contemporary/new looking. The menu has something for just about anyone too with the variety of burgers, pasta, and steak/chicken options. I had The Bryant Burger, and my date had the ravioli. The burger is exceptional in flavor, and one of the best overall burgers I've ever had. The ravioli was also presented well and tasty. They have a great draft beer selection from local breweries too which is great. Overall price is about 50$ with tip and drinks for 2 which I think is very appropriate for the quality of the food and service.

I used to visit Morris Bryant for the seafood buffet when my parents would come to Purdue to visit.  Teenagers and food produce good memories.  On this occasion I brought my senior and college here - still good memories!

The facility is large and nice.  There is ample seating and the crowd moves along.  The noise level is very loud on a busy Saturday evening.   This can be difficult to enjoy conversation at times.  The place is nicely decorated and makes you feel welcome.  Note:  check out the integrated faucet and air dryers in the restrooms - very innovative!

For dinner we started with the pretzel and meatballs.  The pretzel was nice and moist with a good pull apart texture.  The mustard was very tasty as was the cheese.  The pretzel didn't feed many people though.  The meatballs were excellent- nice blend of cheeses and meats.  The marinara sauce with peppers was delicious!

For dinner I had the shrimp Cajun pasta.  The place specializes in burgers but that isn't my fare.  The pasta was cooked perfectly.  There were about 6 large shrimp which was plenty.  The sauce and peppers were creamy and very tasty.  I definitely recommend a side salad with the cucumber wasabi dressing. The lettuce was very cold as was the dressing- both accentuated each other very well.  The extra cold cut the rough wasabi edge so you could really enjoy the flavor.

Our waiter was friendly and professional.  The hostess team seemed confused once the place out really busy.  We had to remind them our party of 4 had been waiting while other parties of 4 walked in and were seated ahead of us.

Overall...an excellent experience!  Give it a try!!

Was in town visiting my sister and she insisted we come here! She loves it and it was my first time trying it. First off, the atmosphere is everything. Kind of like a modern, industrial feel. But also homey in a way? It was amazing. We came on a Friday night so there was a bit of a wait for all 7 of us. No biggie because they had plenty of seating and standing room in the lobby. We also go cocktails while we waited. For apps we got the pretzel, meatballs,  and shrimp and everything was phenomenal. For an entree I got the mushroom risotto and it was incredible! I didn't get pictures of the food because I was so hungry but next time I'm in town I'm definitely coming back here so I'll get pictures then!

I was traveling and though it wasn't quite dinner hour, I decided to stop by  here to grab a bite to eat.  Very impressive setting and because I was one of the early customers, I had no problem with noise, crowds, or wait times.  Everything went really well.

Getting here is easy if you are heading northwest on Sagamore.  You can pull directly into their lot.  However, if you are traveling southeast, the highway is divided and you have to turn onto Morehouse and cut through some adjacent parking lots to get here.

The building is well designed.  There is an outdoor patio for those nice weather days.  The interior is somewhat dark with a stylish contemporary feel with some ornate wood fixtures at the ceiling to warm the cool decor.

I was greeted by the hostess and selected the bar where I was seated at a 2-top instead of the counter.  This was comfortable and allowed me to watch the multiple (but silent) televisions for entertainment while waiting on my dinner.  

I grabbed a local craft beer from People's Brewing (Boiler Gold!)  I also ordered a side salad to go with my Shaved Sirloin Philly.  The salad was fresh and crisp with a tangy vinaigrette.  The sandwich was good with "blistered" bell peppers and onions on top of the hoagie bun.  The meat was pretty good, but meat sliced that thickness can get a bit dry without an au jus sauce for dipping.  Still, it was pretty good.  It also comes topped with "beer cheese" which looks and tastes like cheeze whiz to me.  I would have preferred a nice slice of provolone instead.

Service was pleasant and fairly prompt.  I would gladly come back to try some more menu items.

Review #2795

reviews.text: I'll give these guys five stars because it's a really nice place. I had a poor experience, however. I went out with a couple friends and we played some games, ate some food, and had a great time. The staff was friendly, and the prices were affordable. We loved the selection of games. However, at the end of the night, while we were getting ready to leave, I talked to one of my friends. I asked her out, and she friendzoned me at the front entrance to the place. Very sad! So I don't know when I'll come back, just because of the hurtful memories, but it really was a nice place. I suggest going here with a date that doesn't friendzone you!

Great selection of games, and very friendly staff. 

The food and drink are a little pricey on top of the $7 admission, and it can get quite loud when it's full, but other than that I've had a lot of fun here.

My all time favorite location for a double date with my wife and friends!

There is a solid food menu with some basic pub entrees, along with a great beer selection. 

There were hundreds of table top games to choose from (from popular party games like Cards Against Humanity to intense RPG's). We chose "Settlers of Catan" and none of the 6 in our group had ever played. Within 15 minutes the waiter had the game set up for us and had explained all of the rules. We jumped right in and had a blast for all of 3 hours!

The major selling point here was having a helpful staff member available to be a game guru when we had questions. Setting up a never-before-played game with friends can be a daunting task otherwise. 

5 STARS all the way.

This is such a cool new place in Lafayette, and I absolutely love that it exists. Ever since I was a kid, I have loved playing board games with friends and family. Video games are great, but there's something about the shared experience of sitting down and talking and laughing over a board game that I just absolutely love. 

This location is an amazing place to take part in a night of board games. I have been three times already this semester, and I plan on going back plenty next semester. 

Essentially, you walk in, choose a table, and choose a game. There's a sitting fee of about $5, which is more than reasonable. When you consider that you could easily spend 3-4 hours here, $5 is minimal compared to say a movie or a bar. You can swap out games as many times as you would like. 

They also offer food and drink. I have had a few of the bottled ciders they offer, and they've all been very nice. Drink prices are about average. The food prices have recently decreased, and the food consists of sandwiches and snacky appetizers mainly, which makes sense for this type of venue. I've never had a bad sandwich here. 

The staff are very friendly, and they're more than willing
to help teach you the rules of a game. 

Overall, I highly recommend going here. It adds something new to the area, and there is a lot of fun to be had.

Impromptu adventure into Merlin's Beard tonight for dinner and a board game. We were seated at a shared table, because apparently it's already a very popular place.  We played a 2-player game, and were given great advice on a game new to us, as well as some assistance getting started. We were also instructed about the white flag we could use in the event we wanted to invite others to our table to join us for a game. We sampled some sandwiches, which were great and some beer and cider, which were equally great. Staff were friendly and knowledgeable and we even made some new friends. Best of all, it was kid-friendly, which means we don't have to have a babysitter to visit again. Looking forward to playing there again soon!
Invited by son and his girlfriend to come here and play katan. They offer food and drinks. Had s lot of fun. Place was filled by time we left.  Great idea and and would come back for sure

I went here on a date that ended up being horrible, but have no complaints about Merlin's Beard.  They have a giant game selection, including some version of Trivial Pursuit from the mid-80s.  It was a great way to demonstrate the transitory nature of fame and important events, because we didn't remember half of the people or things cited.  They also have more recent games if you want to have normal fun, I guess.  And a menu of drinks, with very good coffee!  Overall, I'd recommend a visit to Merlin's Beard.  It's a great place to hang out with friends or with someone that you hope to never see again.

One of my favorite hang out places in Lafayette! The owner, John, is great and is able to help out with games if you don't know what's going on. The rest of the staff is extremely helpful as well and are always willing to answer questions. The sandwiches and GREAT and I always have to get one when I'm in. I highly recommend coming in to check the place out! You won't be disappointed

I'm so excited that a place like this has opened up! There are a few places around town that hold game competitions and game nights, but if you want something a little more relaxed, then Merlin's is for you. All you have to do is walk on in, pick a game, and start playing!

They have a nice variety of games both adult favorites and kid friendly, ranging anywhere from simple classics like Scrabble to more adventure cards like Munchkin. There is a five dollar sit in fee, meaning you pay five dollars and can play as much as you want. They also offer food and alcohol. Their grilled cheese sandwiches are the best! 

The staff are super friendly and may just pull up a chair, chat, or show you how to play a game. They are always willing to teach! If you fall in love with a game, be sure to check out the game racks in the corner to see if they have in stock and take it home with you. 

Located in downtown Lafayette, parking can be tricky, so you may wind up parking a few blocks away, but it's worth it. In the evening, parking may be easier to come upon. I'd recommend this place for game lovers of all kinds. No matter what games you're interested in, you're sure to find something you'll love.

I was excited to check out the new board game bar in Lafayette. Went there with a few friends and I was very happy with the service, atmosphere, and game options. They also have a good variety of food and drink. I definitely recommend this place for a good time!

Stopped in on a whim one night with a group.  They helped us pick out a new game to play and taught us how to play.  We didn't try food, but they do have a nice selection of beers.  Also tried the wine slushy -- pretty good.  

If you enjoy card or board games and are looking for something fun and different from the usual bar scene, this is the place to go in Lafayette!

Quick edit - it is $5 per person to play -- or if you intend to go often, they have membership packages.  Hey, you'd pay $5 or more to go into another bar to see a band or for some other type of entertainment.  I see this as the same thing, so don't let the "cover charge" keep you away.

What a great little place! If you have a group or just want to find a group to play something, this is the place! The owner is always in and is always up for a game, and can set you up with a group. They have tons of games to try. It's $5/person and you can try as many of their games as you'd like. Their menu is basically sandwiches, beer and wine. Make sure to try their wine and beer shakes since they are pretty inspired. My friend had a shake from a pineapple cider and it was great. I had an alcohol butterbeer, which was pretty awesome. I wish a place like this near me!

This is a unique place to hang out with friends.  I have only had their grilled cheese sandwich and a butterbeer (non-alcoholic drink) as a non-drinking vegetarian, but both were totally delicious! I absolutely love their wide variety of games to choose from and the prices per night are great! The guys there are extremely knowledgeable in their craft and will help you find just the right thing to play.

What a fun place to have in our city! We went in on a Tuesday when, luckily for us, it was free to play with a $5 purchase! As they have a variety of beer on tap and a solid selection of snacks/sandwiches, this was no problem at all. They have an excellent selection of board games to fit all tastes - strategy, family, collaborative, long games, short games, you get the idea. There's a link from their website that has all the games currently available if you want to check it out beforehand, though we had fun looking through the games in house until we found one we wanted to play. We had an excellent time and will definitely be returning!
Excellent food and service. The guys are really courteous. Had a wonderful night. Will try their games too

I love this place! So many different board games - if you don't know how to play then the owner will be happy to explain the rules. Fun for any age and such a relaxed atmosphere. There's also bites to eat/drinks so everything awesome in one place! Definitely will be back
Fun place, lots of good games, and solid food. It is an enjoyable place to go as a group or as a couple!

Really cool spot! I never would have thought of something like that but it was a good way to spend the afternoon. Went with the family to try out a few new board games. Owner was very nice and helpful. Will probably be back!

Hubs & I enjoyed a date night of playing games.  The owner was very knowledgeable and helped us pick a great game for 2 players.  We will definitely go back for future date nights, family outings & to try out any game that we might want to add to our home collection.  Such a fun place!

Awesome place to spend time! Great place for date night, great place to get to know people of you are new to town. Literally helped me transition and find friends when I moved here and did not know anyone yet. The owner is super nice and the staff is as well. They also explain games, so don't worry if you don't know how to play boardgames (like hobby games).

reviews.text: This was our first visit since they reopened the dining room after the COVID-19 shutdown, and oh my goodness. (They're operating with 50% of their dining room roped off.) It's like they spent the entire shutdown improving the quality of their food. I had a cabeza taco, and it was exquisite. Tender, flavorful. Wow. And the (crispy... is there any other way?) tripitas taco was everything a tripitas should be. Texture, flavor and even quantity was perfect. My wife had a (less adventurous) taco al pastor, which was positively heaping with meaty goodness. Generous portions of meat, fresh, fresh, fresh. Even the tortilla chips and salsa were among the best I've had. We topped it off with a camarones a la diabla, which had the perfect amount of heat and flavor. I didn't think Taco Rico could get any better, but they truly outdid themselves this round. We may just be back, y'think?

One of the better Taco spots in the city, ua three guys dropped in around 8:00 p.m. for a weekday dinner to find a friendly and accommodating staff, lovely atmosphere, and large menu with all the fantastic options however horchata was sadly missing. We got a smattering of dishes all different. My BBQ beef was quite nice, missing tangy flacpes American BBQ boasts but tender great along with the rice and guac. The others are well too tho two muttered about how dry some of their meat was and unedible the chips were. Maybe a better spot for a rual lunch and dinner times! My one friend was very excited to come here again so guessing there's plenty here to make a tasty time.

Both the fajita taco salad and steak and shrimp fajitas were big portions with lots of flavor! I did take off one star, because the salad barely had any shrimp in it, and they were very small cut up pieces. The shrimp fajitas may be more worth the price than the salad. We would come back :)

Stopped in on a Saturday afternoon for an early dinner.  It took 10 minutes for a server to visit our table. The restaurant floors and tables were very dirty.  We ordered margaritas and were told they do not have margaritas.  I have been told the food is really good but we did not stay.  Due to the lack of cleanliness and lack of margaritas, we left.
Their burritos and tacos are amazing!  They have great menu options.  I wish they had liquor choices like a margarita, but their food is so yummy you don't need it.

This place has never let me down. A friend and I met here for lunch and she was surprised by the cute atmosphere. Saw several people having the shrimp cocktail, which looked delicious. Service is pretty standard here. They do sell bottled coke, which is always a treat. Only real bummer about this place is that you can't get a margarita! 

My friend had the chimichanga, which was enough for 3 people. She took most of it home. The guacamole here is out of this world! It tastes so fresh. Some of the best I have had. Worth it! 

This time, I ordered a carnitas sope and a steak taco. The fillings are always flavorful. If you are looking for fresh Mexican food, try this place. They don't drown everything in white cheese!

Real, authentic, and delicious Mexican food- a jewel of the Midwest and a must visit place for anyone living in the area. Food is served fast, servers are friendly, and the general atmosphere is positive. I had the Al Pastor and the Carnitas tacos- both are juicy and delicious, and the Al Pastor has just a little spiciness to compliment the acidity of the pineapple. The tacos are street size, and you order them individually, so they are perfect to get a variety of flavors.
Great place! Nice authentic Mexican food in a clean restaurant with very friendly staff. I recommend!

Had a great meal here over the weekend, ordered 2 asada tacos, rice, and a medium horchata all under $9. The tacos were some of the best I've had within the Purdue vicinity, and while I would have appreciated more toppings within the rice (like some sort of veggie), I'll take what I can get. The other complaint is that each taco cost $1.95, which was a little steep in my opinion. However, the asada meat and horchata were delicious, I will for sure be coming back.

Definitely would recommend this place to anyone looking for a great, authentic, Mexican place. The staff was friendly, the atmosphere was fitting and the food was amazing. I ordered the Barbacoa, pollo and roasted pork tacos and all three were tasty. One thing I did notice though was that if you order tacos you need to ask for lettuce, tomato, cheese etc. and they will give you a nice loaded taco. But if you choose to not get these extra items added on your taco may seem a bit dinky in size and portion. Overall I would confidently say their authentic food and famous tacos are worth the try if you're in the area. Neighborhood is a tad sketchy but the strip mall it's located in alleviates that.
Best Mexican flavor in town. Can't beat the Camorones a la diabla! Every time we come in they surpass expectations.

This place is very Americanized Mexican (chimichangas, burritos, fajitas, etc.) but it's pretty good and very affordable. I like that the entrees come with rice, beans and gauc and most of the food is very tasty. The free chips could be better, but that's pretty much my only complaint about the food. Today we came with our toddler and ordered a plain cheese quesadilla for her. It was SO good that my husband and I couldn't stop eating it. It's such a simple, basic thing but somehow they cooked it very well. We had way more food than we could eat and it was only around $25, so definitely a good value. We will come back for sure.

Love their taco salads and tacos! The only con I have is that the table salsa is definitely from a jar.  Other than that, everything else tastes great.  The guacamole is always fresh and the tortillas are good too!
Was heading  towards another restaurant it was closed saw this nearby and decided to try it out and glad we did ! Excellent food , spicy upto the point and deliciousness at its best !

My one year old daughter & I both got very sick from this place that used to be my favorite. Went there two nights ago, yesterday she was throwing up and extra cranky, I was nauseous and had the worst body aches that kept me up all night! Both had night sweats and I'm still having body aches and she still won't eat today. 'My poor baby:(
It had to have been from taco Rico because that was the only thing we both ate to get sick at the exact same time

The food is good but we got so sick so I'm not going to take the chance again especially because of my little baby girl! Hopefully they will be more careful next time! 
We went with someone else but he didn't eat my daughters chicken quesadilla and guacamole & tomatoes  like me and her did. So I'm guessing it was that.

I'm not sure why I haven't left a review for this place, since it's become my standard for tacos, tortas, and burritos. I never let my friends say they don't like Mexican food unless they've had Taco Rico. One of the saddest things about graduating and leaving West Lafayette is leaving behind this establishment. 

The staff here is always friendly and it has an authentic and welcoming vibe to it. The food is usually perfectly seasoned, and the chips and salsa are the real deal.  It's all reasonably priced though I'm a little sad that taco prices have gone up.

The only reason it's not a 5 is because a few of the dishes are alright. One of them being the enchiladas. The enchiladas themselves are good, but the sides are a bit bland.

Can't get enough Taco Rico!  I've tried a few things on the menu.  Taco Salad, Enchiladas, Fajitas...even the Chili Rellenos.  They were all excellent!  Fresh, perfectly prepared and incredibly tasty! My favorite though?  Steak tacos with cilantro, onion and I add ok n fresh avacado slices.  Stellar!  My favorite Mexican place in Lafayette!  Keep up the great work Taco Rico!

Update: I've been back a few times since, and it's been delicious every time! The tacos are great (I've had chicken and shrimp), and the taco salad is wonderful. We've even brought our boys, and they enjoyed it too! This is definitely our go-to for Mexican in Lafayette!

Being a Californian and living in New Hampshire, I am a bit starved for good, authentic Mexican food. Visiting Purdue, I spied this taco joint on Yelp and it didn't disappoint! We went basic tacos, no fuss, all flavor with stacked corn tortillas, meat, onions and cilantro. Salsas they bring are excellent and balanced with the plentiful lime wedges. I had a diet coke, but an icy Corona would have been a good choice. Great dinner choice and friendly server.
Always amazing.... authentic and friendly atmosphere with great food. A lunch time favorite.

reviews.text: Love this place! If you like dive bars close to everything then you will too! In the heart of DT with good food and cold drinks! #touchtunes is a plus! Outdoor seating!

We have been to Digby's multiple times, pre-Covid-19.    We usually have drinks and may get a cheese brick but have never ordered meals. 

Digby's food has always been a bit pricey, but we had purchased a $30 Groupon for only $14!!!!

We called in our order and it was ready in about 15 minutes.   The cheese bricks were large and tasty. My wife enjoyed her fish and sweet potato fries.  My classic burger (bacon and cheese) was cooked just right and very flavorable.  I ordered fries as a side and they stayed crispy on the drive home.   

The food is on the higher end for pub fare, but honestly, its well worth it.  Our order totalled just under $30 and we got a lot of food for that!!!!!

Love this place great drinks snd bar food. The outside patio is great. Spend lots of time here late summer as my job is very demanding and this is a great place to unwind. I would recommend it. The duck blt and the Reuben are outstanding. The pub nachos and cheese bricks awesome

This is definitely one of my favorite places in town and I've gone so many times. The cheese bricks and the raspberry sauce they come with is a must. My boyfriend always gets the lamb sliders and he's always talking about them. The service has always been good too.

Wow...   I expected so much more.   I know it's a college town on a Friday... but...  

Went out looking for a good time tonight after having out second shots now for some time.   I know that local establishments are struggling, but...  This was our first time in this place.  We reviewed the online reviews and their website.  With that said, they don't match the real life of Digby's.

We were not greeted upon entering, even though there were 3 people at the front door.  Spacing was ok if you wanted to sit in a corner.   Most people were not wearing masks as they walked around the place.   And, the NOISE...

Even though we were in a corner, furthest away from everyone, you couldn't carry on a conversation.  Between the loudness of what was going on and the music above us, you couldn't hear each other.   I tried to play some music that would be a little easier listening, however it was shut down by a guy playing a guitar toward the front and around the corner.  Still couldn't talk and to beat that the music wasn't any good.

Ok... Overall, this is a college bar.  One that has mostly younger crowd.  That is not me.   Yelp doesn't have a rating for that.

So, don't believe in the websites they post.  If you want a noisy place to slip up to the bar and yell at each other, go for it.

Food was said to be ready for pickup at 7:30. Got there at 7:45, food wasn't ready. Food wasn't ready until 8:15/8:20 and wasn't even hot. Bar tender would remove their mask to talk to people. Overall awful experience. Honestly wish i could've got a refund.

The mixed drinks here are wonderful (current summer special is boozy slushees- yum!) and the beer is great also, but the food is mediocre at best. My friend had the plantain Chips, which were outrageously over priced and not very good. The mixed drinks are great and priced competitively. I had the chicken tenders, which were slightly over cooked but still good. In other words: come here for the drinks, but get dinner elsewhere. 

However, any good attributes were overlooked by a BAR that allows children. If a six to ten year old can sit at a bar and twenty something patrons who easily look like teens are not carded, this place is actively looking to (and 100000000% deserve) to get shut down. Children cannot sit at a bar. Period.

Came here on a Thursday weeknight with a group of 7 friends for drinks and dinner.

Specials on a Thursday we're quite a good deal!  Food specials didn't really exist.  Menu is small and limited but portions are fair.  Service is very friendly and helpful too since it was our first visit.

As the night progressed lots of people stopped in for dinner.  Some stayed for the single pool table others were there for open mic night to perform.

Overall the food needs improvement in quality and selection.  The Mac n cheese bowls all came out at Room temperature.  Fish and chips had no malt vinegar option, choc cake was solid frozen and their famous cheese bricks could use some seasoning.  

I am sure come summer this place will be bustling as there is a huge front outdoor patio.  I hope in the next six months they improve so my return visit is better!

We stopped in here late on a Saturday evening.  The live music was cranking and the bar was alive with lots of patrons.

The facility was clean.  It is set in an older building which adds character.  My mixed drink was appropriately strong and sized to enjoy!  The waitress was friendly and professional.

We ordered the Cheese Brick which was very good.  This mozzarella stick literally looks like a brick of fried cheese.  The breading is light and tasty.  The cheese was nicely melted - especially for a hunk of cheese.  The rum raspberry sauce is a great accent to the breading & soft cheese.  

We also had the pretzels and beer cheese.  The pretzel was soft, warm and salty.  It was made to pull apart and dip into the cheese.  I ordered a cup of chili too.  The chili had an Italian sausage taste.  The meat was finely ground.  The vegetables and broth were well done!

Give this place a try!!
Decent atmosphere.   Food was not bad, did not overwhelm me though.   Service was good.
The food is good as always but a lot of staff are wearing facial protective masks on their chin, not protecting anyone. What's the point in wearing them this way? No way to conduct business.

This has always been one of my favorite places in Lafayette! Delicious food for a wonderful price, fun and tasty drinks, great drink and food specials, and a ton of well picked live music! The staff is great, bartenders are always fun and they always have good servers too! This place offers an awesome vibe that always meets what you're looking for. It's family friendly during the day with a restaurant side and turns into a high energy vibe at night. If you're questioning trying Digby's for the first time, this is your answer! 10/10

I was oscillating between 3 stars and 4 stars. I have been here twice so far, one time with a party eating/drinking out on the patio, another time with a friend inside the pub proper. The pub interior is nicely-decorated - it has a strange, old-timey, river/steam boat aesthetic to it. Not so nice was that the floor was very sticky, the tables were filthy, and the appetiser dishes were greasy, as if they were just blasted with water, no soap deployed. You don't have the same problem of goopy floor and tables outside, at l east, from the fact that the rain will at least clean it up. 

The beers are decently priced for the area, and there is a fair selection. The main star of the show, though, is their pub food. It is definitely some of the most unique in Lafayette, with such fair as massive blocks of buffalo milk cheese, battered and deep fried (appropriately called cheese bricks), fried bits of alligator, ground lamb sliders, fried plaintains chips, and more. Most of what I tried so far is delicious - though I would not recommend the plaintain chips. They are inconsistently cut and so most of them will be soggy and chewy, instead of crispy or crunchy like you would expect with plaintain chips. They are served with an orange cream soda sauce, though, which is one of those weird things that somehow goes with everything. 

Which brings me to another +/-, their creative sauces accompanying their appetisers. I am noticing a pattern of them matching good but whacky sauces with things that do not compliment them at all.  The gator bits are served with a ranch sauce that does not go with it at all. The cheese bricks are served with a raspberry sauce that is borderline too sweet for it. Then the orange cream soda sauce, which goes with everything, is only served with the nasty plaintain chips, which can't be salvaged even with the sauce. Really odd culinary choices, though not wholly unwelcome. They just need to recommend the orange cream soda sauce on everything. 

One thing that helped bump the rating down was, from looking at other's reviews, I get the impression that they might have been gradually shrinking the size of appetisers over the years, but not reducing the price accordingly, though I could be mistaken. The cheese bricks today, for instance, are only served in a plate of four, though I am seeing that they originally came in an order of 6, ostensibly for about the same price as today, and then a bit later, 5. Down to 4, it seems we are. I am never alright with that sort of practice, if that appears to be what is happening. 

Still, I would say it is worth a visit now and then. Decent and unique selection of pub food, and it is great when the weather allows you to be out on the patio. I would just say mind the hygiene a little.

My husband and I stopped in for lunch, because I'd heard good things about the food and we wanted to try something new.

The food lived up to the hype.

I had the beer & bacon mac, which was served piping hot and absolutely delicious.

My husband got the classic burger and fries, which he loved. I stole a couple of his fries (I don't usually like fries, but they looked really good), and they may be the best fries I've had locally.

I'm not a big drinker, and my husband doesn't drink at all, so we can't really comment on the beer or mixed drinks, but they did seem to have a large selection.

The interior is cozy, with lots of wood and industrial details. Sound does tend to carry though; there were a few very loud patrons in when we were there, and it seemed quite noisy, but it was much quieter when they left. The patio looks like it's a great place to hang out when the weather is nice.

The bartender/server was very pleasant and knowledgeable about the menu. 

We would definitely come again!

We dropped in here for dinner on a Sunday evening when driving back to Chicago and we needed a dog friendly patio, as it was too hot to leave the dog in the car while we ate. The servers were friendly here. The downtown and this restaurant were dead on a Sunday night, but it still took a while to be helped. I think that's because the hostess was on a smoke break (sitting on some steps in the middle of the patio which was weird) and told us where to sit, but probably didn't tell our server. Only one beer was on draft, a good IPA, but was surprised that such a large bar and grill didn't have more draft selections. They have 3 sizes of burgers offered: 1/2 lb, 1 lb, and 1.5 lb, and they seem serious about those options. I would have liked to have seen someone go for the big one.

Anyway, place was okay and it was dog friendly which was huge in our situation. Food was so-so but filling. I had the Reuben and my wife had the chicken tenders. I will say, portions were huge. The atmosphere was weird with only like 1 other table occupied in a large space. But maybe people just don't go out on Sunday nights in Lafayette. I could see this place being fun on a more crowded night. Looked like it might even have a stage, which could make for a livelier time.

A nice place to frequent for either the awesome patio that regularly has live music or the inside bar/restaurant with nice whiskey themed decor and various bar arcade machines. 

Digby's has regular specials, but my favorite lately has been the chili. However, I do have to note that consistency is a bit of a problem here. I've ordered the chili 3 times and each time it has been different, although still tasty. 

The beer and liquor choices are extensive but I usually go with a beer due to their impressive selection of craft options. 

Their chicken tenders are delicious and served with the best house-made ranch I've ever had. 

Prices are acceptable especially if you order whatever the current special of the day is.

Great outdoor seating, food is good.

Dropped by one evening to grab a quick meal. They have some great outdoor seating but because it was a little chilly we decided to sit inside. 
The service was prompt and the staff very friendly. 
We had a couple of ciders, their chicken bacon ranch wrap which was good and a mushroom and truffle oil with mozzarella cheese on flatbread which was really yummy. Their sweet potato fries were fantastic.

I've been here a couple times with my boyfriend and our dogs and have always had a great experience. We try to always find a place that are dog friendly and there aren't that many in this town. The staff have been attentive and even offer to bring our dogs bowls/water for them or if we ask they are more than accommodating. We've only been there for more of a brunch or early dinner and can't say much about the evening/night scene but I'm sure it's a good atmosphere with live music. I give it 4 stars instead of 5 bc I wish they had a larger/variety of food choices bc I get the same thing everytime. But the gator bites are amazing and tastes like chicken but are more tender/juicy.

This was not my first time at Digby's. I've been here multiple times before and usually I enjoy their food but I never got around to writing a review for them. Their cheese bricks are amazing and a must try for anyone that hasn't tried it yet - if you like cheese, that is. I've had issues with the service here before.This review is about a group event I planned at Digby's on a wednesday evening. 

To give some context to this review, I was hosting an event for approximately 15 people. I called them two weeks in advance and made my reservation. When I called them the night prior to give them an updated headcount, I was told that there was no such reservation made. The person on the phone took down all the information once again and I updated the headcount to 14. She asked me to call them and let them know if there were any further updates before the start time. When I arrived at the scheduled time, I had one of the servers tell me that I did not make a single reservation. I asked her if she could check the system and she complained to me that I shouldn't expect them to have seating ready if I don't make a reservation. Since the first server was just accusatory, I went up to another server. I was helped by two other servers in setting up the tables and chairs, after my original reservation start time, on the deck/ stage area outside. They were both apologetic. One of them was off the clock at that point, but stayed on to explain what could have happened. He also mentioned to me that they have a new chef now and that they will be making some new additions/changes(daily fresh desserts for example) to the menu. He was very helpful. 

The server assigned to our group was friendly and helpful, but it seemed like she was set up to fail from the get go. It was unlimited wings and half price bottle night, and there were 14 of us in the group. She was the only one assigned to the group. She tried her best to accommodate all of us and try to make it a good experience. Unfortunately, we had multiple instances of getting the wrong order and cold wings. The server was still a trooper and she was very apologetic for all of the chaos, but I believe that better planning on the management's part to handle a group this size would have alleviated a lot of the issues. Unless the place sorts out some of these issues, I would not recommend this place for groups. 

I had the wings themselves and I was not a fan. For each round of the unlimited wings, I tried a different sauce and in my opinion, the wings were just doused in the different wing sauces. I didn't have a single one that stood out as tasty. 

Prices are very decent. The unlimited wings on wednesdays are $9.99 and you also got half price bottles of wine. We got a Cab for $12.50 after the discount which was a good deal. 

Digby's has an amazing location. It is in the heart of downtown lafayette. They have a beautiful patio and on multiple occasions, they've brought it live music performers, during both the  summer and winter, which is great. There is seating inside as well. Even though it's a bit dimly lit, it gives a nice ambience. 

All this said, I'd still probably go back for their cheese bricks. They assured me that it was going to stay on the new menu.
I had a very bad experience here.  The food was overcooked and the waitress was terrible.  I had to call her over two times.

reviews.text: Absolutely delicious food, and it's extremely close to me, reasonably priced, and fast pick up. I'll definitely be ordering again soon

Not usually my go-to Chinese take out but almost every other restaurant was closed for the pandemic so I gave them a try. Was given the wrong order but they called me as soon as I pulled up at home and told me their mistake and recooked my order and told me to keep what I had. I had to go back again but it was worth it for the free rangoons I got!!!  Food was your average Chinese take out but still very good.
I got the General Tso's chicken with rice and some crab rangoons and it was one of the best meals of my life. It was even a little spicy which I loved.

Great food! This isn't a fancy restaurant, but excellent hole-in-the-wall for reasonable prices. This is our favorite Chinese in West Lafayette. We usually order the General Tso's Chicken combo (comes with fried rice and an egg roll), Lo Mein, and Hot and Sour Soup.

Lin's Wok is an unpretentious, authentic good quality family-run Chinese restaurant. The prices are reasonable, the food tasty and the portions are generous. If you're fortunate to have the boss handling your table, you'll have good, friendly service. With some of the other family members, not so much, as others have mentioned.

All that said, this is our current favorite local Chinese restaurant. Based on the predominance of Chinese faces in the place most of the times we've eaten there, the local Chinese community seems to agree.
Great budget chinese food!!! Loved it for years! Family owned and ran. You definitely get your money's worth here.

By far my favorite restaurant for take out. I love the old school feel that this place has. While most of the business is take out, they do have a seating area for those who would like to eat in. Everything is freshly made and I have had no food that I was disappointed with. The menu is large and has a wide variety of food to choose from. I always get the egg drop soup, which is made daily and is always delicious. The crab rangoon and the egg rolls are great. The other appetizers are fantastic as well. There is a great selection of noodle dishes, seafood, even duck. I have been a customer here for decades and will continue to be for as long as I'm living in this town. Always happy with the service and the food. Top notch selection for West Lafayette when it comes to quality take out.

Total hole in the wall, Americanized Chinese place. If you go into it knowing that beforehand and that's the kind of Chinese food you want, it is quite good!

We ordered the pork lo mein, the sweet and sour chicken, and the beef with broccoli, along with some pork egg rolls. The pork lo mein was excellent. The beef with broccoli was very good. I do wish the sweet and sour chicken had some vegetables in it - we just got a container of chicken with the fried coating and sauce on the side, no veg mixed with the chicken at all. 

Overall, would happily order again.
probably the best Americanized Chinese food in the area. the food always tastes rather fresh. I've never had chewy meat or bad vegetables. This is where i always get my Chinese!

I ordered chicken lo mein and orange chicken. The prices were a bit more expensive than normal Chinese places like this. The chicken in the lo mein was really chewy and the orange chicken sauce was not the best. I wanted to try this place over Happy China and I much rather would prefer Happy China.

Basic. Decent sized portions and fast, but nothing special. Ordered sweet and sour shrimp (comes with white rice) and veggie egg roll for around $12. Order took about 10 minutes to be ready. Probably wouldn't return.

We usually order take out Chinese from Szechuan Garden (in West Lafayette) but thought we'd give this place a try instead.  Unfortunately, the overall flavor of the food was really bad.  My wife did say that her mu shu pork was decent but they didn't give her the "pancakes" or wraps that usually come with that dish.  The mixed vegetables had a weird flavor to them and the pot stickers were nasty and cheap.  Szechuan Garden is way better and more consistent, so we won't be ordering from Lin's Wok again.

Why oh why does this place have so few stars?  I'm not sure what people are expecting from a hole in the wall Chinese place in the middle of Indiana.  

I love me some Lin's Wok.  This has been my go-to Chinese joint for over 10 years.  I've tried a little bit of everything on the menu, and I'm always pleased.  I usually carry out, but they have a comfortable little dining room attached if that's your thing.  They also deliver which is great for those late nights when you need your greasy Chinese fix after a few brews. 

My personal faves are the beef and broccoli, chicken lo mein and sweet and sour pork.   All delish, and always very consistent.

I have visited most of the Chinese places in town and in my opinion, this one is the best. 
It is family run, fast, and friendly. The food is authentic, portions are generous and inexpensive. The crab rangoon are the best I have tasted, I'm always tempted to get a few orders and make those my whole meal. Though, I have tried almost every item on the menu, I have yet to find a dish that wasn't delectable.
Potstickers are small and expensive. Poor service...seriously!  Some dishes are okay, but mostly we just avoid it and go to EnLai over by Rural King. Choices are limited in this area.

Quality has gone down in the past year.  Been going for over a decade.  Always expect mediocre service but those poor girls have been forced to work their since they could reach the counter so I would be bitter too. I always tip hoping they get to keep it at least. Still my go to Chinese in town.  Open on Xmas also!

Average at best. Don't bother with the curry, it's way off. Also claimed to have the spicy demarcater and was not spicy at all. Make sure you ask for sweet and sour with crab rangoons if you order them and make sure you grab your own silverware for carry out.

As I write this I really can't understand how I ate here so many times. It's the closest Chinese restaurant to my house, so inertia I guess. Last night was the final straw. 

Last night I ordered Happy Family and it tasted like nothing and was loaded with onions. My wife ordered sesame chicken which was described as being served in a 'brown sauce'. What she got was General Tso with sesame seeds sprinkled on top. I tried hot and sour soup for the first time here and it was bland and somewhat gross. The 'pork' egg roll has no meat in it and tastes like the fryer oil is three months old. It was by far the worst meal we've gotten.

I've ordered things occasionally for three years now. I keep the menu in a drawer and since there is no standardization among Chinese restaurants on anything other than General Tao/Tsao/Chao (but even its name isn't standardized!) I write down what I thought of each item I ordered. Let's go back in time and summarize everything on my menu to date:

Pork Egg Roll - "More like Cabbage roll"
Egg Drop Soup - "Bland"
General Tso - "ok, but sweet"
Shrimp fried rice - "good enough"
chicken lo mein - "not great"
moo shu chicken - "really good"
moo shoo pork - "good"
fresh shrimp with lobster sauce - "ok"

I forgot to rate some meals, but my God, how did I keep going here? Other than moo shoo they are clueless.

The place is a dump, the dining room seats about eight people, the people seem to resent being there, the prices are high. 

I would suggest going somewhere else, or just going nowhere.

Pretty sad because the place has good food but horrible customer service. I mean, would it hurt to crack a smile every now and then? Anyhow, I've had their hot and sour soup, beef and broccoli, and lo mein. All are pretty good for the price you pay, especially for lunch!

I've ordered take-out from Lins a few times, it's really your standard, run of the mill Chinese place.  The food is made fast, at a cheap price.  The steamed dumplings are my thing, I also enjoy the Chicken Lo Mein.

Personally, I've come to seek out higher quality Asian cuisine, that I do not mind paying higher prices for.  I know every town doesn't have 'Simply Ming' providing gourmet delicacies for its citizens - but it doesn't mean we should not expect more quality in our food.

reviews.text: Fuel's new location is much more open than the previous one, but I miss the downtown funk. The coffee drinks are just as good. There is also outside seating which they did not have before. There is a small lot with 3-4 spots reserved for Fuel, but most customers are student walk ups. Nice location but I will miss Fuel downtown.
Pleasant location. The coffee I had was great and I'm really digging the interior. Their hours are a little bit out of my way so I haven't been able to come here as much as I want to.

Easy going campus coffee spot providing a smart alternative to Greyhouse and Vienna with more space and better prices for the quality than either. Parking is more awkward however and as the limited hours. I really enjoy their Miel and various roasts here. Plenty to cater to caffeine needs and fantastic friendly service with easy to use rewards program.
A little busy during lunch hour during the semester, but their service is still speedy and friendly! I got an iced earl grey latte, which was delicious. 5/5 stars

I really enjoyed this unassuming coffee shop next to the Lutheran church! I ordered a masala chai with a shot of vanilla for $4.60, which came in a great size and was some of the best chai I've ever had. However, their earl grey latte had some sort of weird lavender soap-y aftertaste that I was not a huge fan of, but perhaps some people enjoy that flowery taste. I look forward to returning and trying more of their drinks, along with some of their food items.

Fuel is by far my favorite coffee shop in the West Lafayette area! I visit at least four times a week. The coffee is simply delicious, and they always have such a variety of roasts throughout the week. I typically just get a black coffee, but their chai tea lattes, flavored drinks, and teas are also excellent. This is the perfect place for studying, meeting, or just getting together with friends. There is always plenty of seating, and the baristas are always friendly. I cannot recommend this place highly enough!

Love this coffee shop! Best iced coffee in town! I didn't know this was there until recently, but I'm so glad I found it! My friends and I love the atmosphere for studying. Their iced coffee is amazing - the best I've had - and their food (especially their vegan chili) is a major bonus! Looking forward to stopping in here regularly during the upcoming school year.
Great place to get coffee and breakfast/brunch. Loved the Lafayette location!  Very nice, friendly. Pastries and muffins awesome. Very good coffee too!

Photo of Five Guys - West Lafayette - West Lafayette, IN, United States

reviews.text:
The food was so good that I really couldn't wait to eat, hence no pictures :( 

I got a little cheeseburger with lettuce, raw onions, jalapeños, and ketchup. It was seriously one of the best cheeseburgers I've eaten! I also got a large Cajun fries (duh), sooo good!! 

The pickup was easy, didn't have to wait for longer than 2 minutes in the restaurant. The staff was quick & wearing masks too!

I LOVE Five Guys' burgers and fries, but 2/3 times I have been to this location the wait has been ridiculous. Tonight I ordered on the phone and said I would be there in 15 minutes. As soon as I got in the store I let them know who I was and asked after my order.

About 40 minutes after my call was placed, I received my food. While I was waiting in the store to get to the rest of my night, I had ample time to grow frustrated and write this review! Sure hope they can hire some more help so the wait isn't so bad. If this had only happened once I wouldn't write a review, but the whole point of calling ahead was so I could expedite my order. That clearly didn't happen.

The best burgers on campus under $10! Or AJ's, depends what you're feeling! I have tried both multiple times and can't complain with either. Fast and really friendly staff here, they sure manage a massive crowd well, easy to get in here and out when it's not a big game night. Five Guys is the spot for loading up on the good beef and classic big fries. Them shakes help it all digest too. This is the classic American burger hit up holding down what's left of the Chauncy Mall before it's stripped away and made into a new corner of campus.

Fast service & friendly enough. Stopped by when picking up my cap and gown. I will say that while the kitchen prep area seemed clean, the drink/ napkin/ condiment areas could have used a wipe down and replenishment. 

Burger was tasty & came out as expected, although a little greasier. They're always heavy on the condiments - something I like at 5 Guys but means the patty itself is less flavorful (if/when you had a regular burger).

I ignored the poor rating to my own peril. 

After a longer wait than I would have liked, we received our burgers- 4 burgers with about 4 different toppings on each. 

None of the burgers came out with the right toppings, with the two bacon burgers both coming out with no bacon as well as missing other toppings. 

The other major problem was that 3 of the 4 burgers came out cold.

I love Five Guys but this location has some serious issues and for that reason I will not be returning.

Ok , the burgers gets 5 STARS  but as for the lady in the cashier who seems to be orienting a new staff was wearing her cloth mask on her chin the whole time we were in line until we left the AND the guy who set  up our burgers was wearing his masks in between half of his lips & chin ... needs to do better .There are still a LOT of people hesitant to dine out . What gives us a little re-assurance is when we see your staff taking the CDC Covid guidlines seriously so that we are not just left to crossing our fingers hoping that 14 days after visiting your store - we won't  hear anything in the news that someone tested positive .

Five Guys is always crowded; it's easily a top 5 college student craving. Their fries are delicious--I'd recommend the Cajun fries--and they have a lot of optional free toppings. I personally love getting the lettuce buns, and they never mess up my order. Really can't go wrong with Five Guys at any given day or time. Many students complain about it, but all the complaints are because drunk students are there causing trouble. The workers do their jobs; they get us the food we ordered efficiently & accurately. Cut them some slack because like I said in the beginning, they're always crowded.

So I came here today 135 S Chauncey Ave, West Lafayette, IN 47906, EE. UU.. Entered the local at exactly 10:58 am because I needed to use the restroom and I was trying to order a milkshake in the meantime. Door wasn't locked. Nobody was in the ordering counter. There was a man (big man of color, middle age, bright green shirt, black cap) at the entrance looking at his phone as I entered and looked at me weirdly when I approached the counter. He didn't say anything. As I saw nobody there in the counter I went to the restrooms which were locked. Asked some employees that were there if I could order something, didn't know the place was open until 11:00. They told me this and I went back to the counter at exactly 11:00 am. There was a boy (young skinny, white, glasses, wavy blonde hair) there ready to take my order when a lady (middle age-big woman of color-short grayish hair-glasses, five guys uniform) started shouting at me saying: "she came here when the place wasn't even opened and demanded someone to take her order"  the boy taking my order started looking at me kind of embarrassed and started excusing her as I said to him "sorry I wasn't demanding anything, I just needed to use the restroom as an emergency and that's why I didn't notice the time of opening" she kept shouting at me repeating herself, didn't even bother to look at me when saying this, she was looking at the big man at the entrance. -they both looking very offended that I'm a foreigner and that I dared even to enter to a place with the door open, 2 minutes before 11 am, time of service.- I ended up not ordering anything, excusing myself to the boy and left the place pretty scared as the boy said there was no problem.
To the woman that shouted me out of the local: I wasn't being rude, I had an emergency. Hope you never find yourself in that situation. I was going to order something, I just needed to use the restroom while my order was ready, because I didn't want to use the restroom for free and I was never demanding. I barely even spoke and stayed quiet the whole time you shouted at me. But while I was looking for some compassion, you chose to deny me the use of the restroom and you lost a client.

reviews.text:
Visited the Linnwood Tavern at about 0730 on a Saturday morning.

Social distancing was in effect and people had on masks when/where appropriate.

Ordered the sausage omelet for breakfast and was thick and had an ample amount of cheese.  It was very tasty.  I have yet to order something off of the breakfast menu that was not superb.  Very good breakfast.

Saturday mornings are fun there because at about 0900 the bar starts filling up with people that are continuing the party from the night before.  There is lots of music playing on the TouchTunes and darts being played at 0900 in the morning.

Lafayette is a factory town so there are many bars/taverns that open at 0700 to accommodate the third shift crew.  Linnwood Tavern is one of them and does a good job of accommodating the different crowds in the morning.  

The bar got remodeled and painted over the initial shutdown in the SPring and is very well done.

It is a smoking bar so that may affect your decision to visit.  The 'smoke eaters" do a pretty decent job while you are there, but when you walk out you can tell you were in a smoking bar.  I am not a smoker, but it never has much of an affect on me.  

The Linnwood Tavern is a place for great breakfast and a good time, even at 0800 on a Saturday morning!!!
Great bar and food. Unfortunately, the smoking ruins both the food and the atmosphere.
Would you please consider going non smoking?? My friends and I enjoy Linnwood but the smoking is a deal breaker.

Don't overlook the Linnwood's breakfast. Sure The Wood is known for great live music, fun times, and great food.  But if you want an old school breakfast get in here. They cook to order (I'm particular about how I like my bacon) but I usually get the sausage links because they are special. They are bigger around than my thumb; plump, juicy, and flavorful. Good coffee. You can't beat the service. Only caveat, they do allow smoking.

This is the place to go when you are in the area and you are parched!! They have anything you can imagine when it comes to alcohol and their food is excellent!! Great place to meet up with others and laugh the day away!!

Lynnwood Tavern is a local neighborhood bar, nothing fancy. There is a small stage for bands to perform, and some space for patrons to dance. There are plenty of TVs lining the walls, as well as dart boards and a jukebox pumping out music. This is a smoking establishment, with clean ashtrays on every table. I haven't visited during the evening, yet, to partake in any other entertainment they provide, so this review is about the food.

And the food is good. New ownership revamped the menu and cleaned the place up a bit. There are daily specials, and breakfast is served every day until 2 pm. The beef and noodles is awesome, just the right amount of food, at a very good price. Their pork tenderloin is mammoth, and the breading stays crunchy throughout the meal. The bun looks puny covering the huge slab of meat. 

I recently discovered Lynnwood's breakfast menu. Normally, I go right for the corned beef hash. But my wandering eyes fell upon this contraption called the stuffed hashbrown waffle: hashbrowns with diced green peppers and onions and your choice of breakfast meat, cooked on a waffle iron. It comes with two eggs, and toast/biscuit. It looks a little funky, but the crispy shell combined with the fresh peppers and onions make this an amazing dish. You only live once, so I ordered a side of sausage gravy to go with it.There was enough gravy to cover the huge biscuit AND the meal. 

I think I found my new breakfast favorite. 

Lynnwood Tavern now does accept credit cards. The kitchen hours are limited: 7 am - 2 pm every day, and 5 pm - 8 pm M - W, 5 pm - 9 pm Th - Sat. I would have given Lynnwood Tavern five stars except for the blast of smoke smell when you enter, and lingers inside. If you are a smoker, you probably won't notice it. The staff is great and attentive; when it gets busy they can be taxed so be patient.

Best breakfast north of Main Street in Lafayette!
I've had multiple selections and they've all been excellent. I think over the last year the food quality and selection has actually gotten BETTER.

Among our favorites, pub chicken wrap, tenderloin, B&G, and full order onion ring basket. Good service, fair prices, and as much as we don't care for cigarette smoke, it isn't all that bad. They do a good job of making it comfortable for non-smokers. Nice of them to offer breakfast items until 2PM daily.

Recent renovations by the new owner have transformed this place. The chicken strips were surprisingly large and much better than the usual bar fare. A singer and guitarist duo gave it a rockin' vibe. Plenty of TVs above the bar and along the opposite wall for sports.
Didn't even stay.  Went for breakfast on Sunday and it was a cloud haze of smoke and ashtrays.  Not conducive to Sun morning breakfast

The food wasn't bad and actually very well priced. However, the smoking inside was non stop and overwhelming, which is why I could never go back again. If u smoke then I would recommend.  Service was poor also. Sat for20 minutes before ever getting menus. If I was just rating the food it would be a solid 4.
This is a fun place to just be yourself and hang out with blue collar people. They have a band on the weekends and the bartenders are all very friendly. Good folks in there.
Comfortable seating, good pricing, and great service make this bar ideal for bands wanting to perform for a medium sized crowd. They do not take cards but do have an ATM inside.
