reviews.text: Got the Beef Pho, and they prepared the takeout carefully. Separated everything, I enjoyed it. Just wish it was a little more flavorful.

The restaurant is a staple on my list of restaurants to eat in west lafayette. They have limited parking space but there are always available spaces around. Plus, there is a good ice cream place near so you could get dessert afterwards. I was not a mandarin speaker at all but it would help if you could speak the language.

The menu items I always order are japanese tofu, squirrel fish and salt and pepper chicken. I personally think the three are the must order.

I really enjoyed their packaging and food taste. Out of the four things I ordered, three were pretty awesome! The quality and quantity were great as well, but I didn't like the overpowering flavor in my Singapore Mei Fun noodles. I enjoyed the Schezwan Chicken and the Chengdu Dry Chili Chicken. The Cheese Crunch was so yummy, I had those for the first time!

The food and service was average.  My boyfriend ordered the pho, which I wouldn't recommend.  The broth was watered down and they didn't have hoisin sauce for the pho which is a staple condiment with pho!

I had the tonkatsu ramen which was pretty decent.  We also shared the beef with green bean combo platter which was a little salty. 

Overall, I don't think I will be returning any time soon.  There are other places I'd like to check out first! It is located conveniently near campus on my route home, so that's the only plus for me.

This place is a gem around Purdue campus. Their noodle soup is on point, and comes in huge portions. And all the combo platters are definitely the best in town. Most places skip out on ingredients if the platter is heavy sauce based, not this place. The authentic stuff is amazing too. With many Chinese food places closing down due to health code, this place has been around long and never had issue.

Tldr; the chef here knows how to work a wok and makes the best stir fry dishes in town. Clean

A one-star well-earned -- this is without a doubt the worst Asian restaurant I have ever eaten at in my life. I can excuse the tacky decour, the owner or other employee's kids talking and screaming loudly in the dining area, the dirty kitchen smell, and the sticky floor that clearly has not been cleaned beyond maybe once-overs with soapless water and a mop now and then. I can't excuse food that was literally inedible. I ordered the chicken yaki udon -- a simple classic that no one should be able to mess up -- and szeschuan chicken, which comes with a side of rice built in to the price. 

Both came out relatively fast, and, at least for the szeschuan, it was apparent that in their haste, they forgot to properly cook the vegetables. Broccoli, bell peppers, carrot slices -- all of it was crunchy from being undercooked/close to raw. That would not have been too much of a problem -- I don't mind my veg -- if the dish had any flavour to the sauce or the chicken, but it didn't. For a dish that was marked as "spicy" on the menu, there was no heat at all, being served in a limpid, soy-like sauce with no flavour other than sodium, and the chicken was tough. I could not stomach more than a few mouthfuls of the yaki udon -- the whole dish smelled like dirt because of an overabundance of undercooked bean sprouts, with no taste besides that cloying stench. I now know why some people have an inordinate aversion to bean sprouts -- they must have eaten at places like O-ishi once in their life. 

In short, for the ~$23 total, you get a cup of rice that smells like dishwater, and some bits and pieces of dry chicken, as those were the only items I could choke down. Do yourself a favour and stay clear of this place -- you will just waste your money for food that is worse than Panda Express.
Foods and service are OK. However, no reason to choose this Chinese restaurant over other Chinese restaurants around this area. And no special things are in their foods.

This was my first time being at O-Ishi and there were such a large variety of options to choose from! The staff was very helpful, nice, and it was a clean cozy place. The food was pretty authentic and it had a good range of Americanized Chinese food and actual Chinese food. I definitely will come back and try more dishes!

For me, O-ishi is a series of hits and misses, and the opinions throughout the campus tend to be similar (love it or hate it). They have a number of things they do VERY WELL, and a couple of menu items that someone clearly just thought "let's add this just because", and then the chefs had to improvise from there. Overall though, my experience with O-ishi has been excellent and I've been coming here since freshmen year (meaning, before they took credit card and, frankly, when they were still working on wiring things up).

It's a real hole in the wall, mom and pop, diner-like place with an emphasis on comfort food that has a similar feel to the restaurant at the back of C&T Market. They're down at Rivermarket, and most of the time you can get there via 23/Connector or 1B. However, I don't know how it currently is with the construction going on and the bus routes shifting. Very casual, good for groups and family, and (won't lie) most of the people who go are some flavor of Asian. I've known people who were a bit intimidated by this, but don't be. The staff is very friendly, super casual, patient, and very attentive. Surprisingly, it's also a really good date night spot. 

Their menu is a mish-mash of Japanese, Korean, the most basic of Indian dishes, and different flavors of Chinese food. Unlike Ichiban, the don't solely focus on Szechuan dishes, and there's definitely some dishes that have more a Beijing, Shanghai, or even Taiwanese taste. Actually, I have some trouble describing just how extensive this menu is. Few years ago, they had some really worn torn menus and you got multiple menus (some purely in Chinese) to show the regular dishes and the specials. Since then, they've tried to update. Two years ago, they finally got a card reader to take credit cards, put up more things on the wall, made it so their tables aren't sticky anymore, and streamlined their menus so you get the nicer ones you have today WITH English translation. So kudos for their effort.

So there is a range of spicy and then a range of non-spicy food. For example, the curry that comes with the roti appetizer is hot, but not the same kind of hot as any of the pepper dishes. The highlight for me though, is their hotpot. I've come here with groups of 4 to 6 just for their hotpot. They come with a range of sauces and just SO MUCH FOOD. Definitely recommend it, it's fun. It's probably also important to note that Ichiban really holds to the traditional Chinese way of dining, which is where you order multiple dishes to share. Everyone gets a bowl of rice and no dish is really one person's. I've known this to confuse some friends who would order something like beef and green beans and got really confused when what they got really was a giant pile of beef and green beans and just that with a bowl of rice. There's just a real emphasis on GROUP eating. And really, trying out new things on their extensive menu is a pretty fun. I recommend getting the Scallion/Green Onion Pancakes (they have it even if it's not on the men) to use to dip into any other dish you order as long as it has some kind of sauce. It's a bit pricey compared to some other places, but I find it worth it considering just how much food they give you (my inner college student purrs in contentment). 

Best way to order when you go in a group is to have at least one vegetable dish, two protein dish, something small like dumplings or roti, and a noodle or rice. If you want to be even more legit, afterwards, you squabble over who gets to pay for the check (by any means necessary, you will pay for it). XD 

Okay, okay, just joking. You order and pay however you want. Usually though, you go to where the cash register is to pay. Basically, that spot next to the low shelf where they keep the menus and take out boxes/bags. Oh, and before I forget, don't be afraid to just go up and grab whatever take out boxes and bags you need. It's just faster that way. 

In summary, good service, usually really good comfort food (and a lot of it), on campus (convenient location if you don't mind crossing that nightmare intersection), and a nice and casual ambience. You should defnitely visit at least once, though I suggest going with a lot of people so you can try something of everything to see what you do and do not like. You'll find SOMETHING, as long as you're open to trying.

Best AUTHENTIC Chinese restaurant in town! The food is just top-level ! And the price is fairly affordable. The pickle and fish soup, spicy pork side, cumin lamb, you name it! And they give you a large portion. If you don't know what to order, just ask for some recommendations from the waiter. There is a whole lot of dishes to explore. Highly recommend!

We ordered several dishes and they were delicious. Portions were generous. One thing you need to watch out is the check will include 15% tips automatically. When you get the receipt to sign, you won't see the itemized price with the 15% included any more and the tip still shows blank.

When dropping my kid back at Purdue we wanted to go somewhere other than our usual for dinner.  She picked it just from the search of "Purdue Asian food" and we will not return.  The staff was nice, the floor and table was sticky from something, the food was ok at best.  We ordered the cheese crunch for appetizer - crab rangoon.  It was lackluster.  The wraps they use taste like stale chips, the filling was flavorless yet airy.  I ordered Princess Chicken which was suppose to be spicy.  It was not.  It was again, ok and the chicken had a very odd texture.  I will never wish I could have it again.  My daughter liked the Beef and Green Beans, but again it was only ok. Also - I hate when places add a tip to the bill for less than 6 people!  Then they included a "tip suggestion" as if it was not added.  REALLY WRONG especially since tipping is not mandatory.  I am a good tipper and hate when people do not tip right or at all just as much as when a place tries to scam you for extra tipping.  So VERY WRONG  Something overall lacking and I know there are better places out there, cleaner places and honestly just do not go.

This place is one of my favorites for Chinese delivery. They make online ordering for delivery/takeout so easy and the delivery fee is only $2. The Shanghai meatballs, beef & enoki, and sliced potato & jalapeño are truly delicious. Everything I've had here has been tasty (besides the salt & pepper squid). I've only eaten in once, and the service was reasonable.

Food is good and unique for Chinese. Floor sticky. WARNING! They tack a 12% tip on the bill and don't tell you. THEN they even have a tip line on the credit card receipt so take care not to double tip!

One of the best Chinese food places in West Lafayette.  However, the prices can be high--probably due to lack of much competition in this market.

If you like your Chinese food spicy, you will like this place a lot.

Convenient location in town and close to Purdue.

This is one of the top places my wife and I have visited in the state. Yes, it is informal, with Formica tables and a bit of a run down interior. However, look at it closely, you will see an almost entirely Asian clientele--with part of the menu in Chinese characters on the wall.

The best two items on the menu are Cumin Lamb and Dry Chili Chicken. The noodle bowls are also strong. There are many other things worth eating, but if you haven't spent time in Asia they might not be up your alley.

The food is Malaysian-Chinese fusion, and is a little spicier than most Chinese cooking, although noodle bowls and rice dishes are innocuous enough for your less adventurous comrades.

Smoothies and Boba tea are worth having.

This place is a foodie's paradise. Eaten here at least 20 times, never once disappointed. Less adventurous Americans won't dig it as much, but if you've travelled and love ethnic food, this place should be near the top of your list

This place is under rated restaurant. (deserves to be four star)

I do not recommend ordering any regular menu targeted for the American customers. What they excel at is Chinese food targeted for Chinese customers. I am guessing (I am not Chinese nor a Chinese cuisine expert) the owner or the chef is from Sichuan province famous for spicy, salty and oily. 

I recommend getting food on house special section of their menu. The specialty section is also written in English and has descriptions under names. My favorite is mapo-tofu  and cumin lamb. I think the got the best mapo tofu around this area. Double cooked pork is not the best Ive ever tasted, but way better than other Chinese food in this area. Yes, it will sometimes taste too spicy, salty and oily because of its origin where preservation of food is only achieved through over flavoring the food. 

This restaurant deserves four stars. Service is not always perfect, their 'regular menu' does not taste good enough, and restaurant feels unorganized. Only reason I am giving five stars is the under-ratings at Yelp.

O-ishi is now a special treat for my boyfriend and me, and the place has definitely grown on us. The staff (usually a woman) is helpful and friendly. One time, we came 30 minutes before they closed, and they still took our order without complaint. One reviewer mentioned that there is a Chinese menu; this is true. We found out by accident when my boyfriend saw a dish another customer was eating that we wanted to try. The waitress showed us the item on the Chinese menu and since then, that is all he orders. We went in yesterday, and the waitress even went to the lengths to give us the paper menu because it was up to date and explained that the reason the dish we ordered isn't on that English menu is because it's rarely ordered but showed us one that was similar. 

NOTE: If you are curious to try, ask for a beef soup with pancakes. This is a light broth dish with vermicelli noodles, bok choy, earwood mushrooms, bamboo, and sliced beef with a side of scallion pancakes.

O-ishi is a pricey place to eat though (they automatically charge a 10% tip to your bill) and sometimes the food can be a bit salty, which is why I give it 4 stars. Still, if you're looking for one of the most authentic Chinese restaurants in West Lafayette, I recommend this place.

Anything less than 5 stars and you're stupid. So, don't be stupid. This place is wonderful. The shabu shabu is shabeautiful!! Cumin lamb is amazing. Love going when I'm in town and will continue to go so long as it's there. The place has to be good considering it's typically an Asian crowd and they would not attend unless it was tasty!
I like this place a lot. The chef is skillful and the price is reasonable. The restaurant is not fancy for sure but really a nice place to eat daily.

reviews.text:
My boyfriend and I decided to check this place out on a Sunday afternoon. It was quiet, there was only one other party of two there.  The decor is definitely outdated and it seemed as though this has been around for awhile.  

The waitress was friendly and welcoming.  We both ordered the steak and chicken hibachi with gyoza as an appetizer.  Our salads came first.  I chose the ginger sauce, while my bf chose the sesame one.  I liked his better, but I just wanted to try something different! Our gyozas came out next.  It was fresh and really hot! Once it cooled down, the flavor was great, and the sauce complimented it. 

Next, the chef came out with his cart.  He was very friendly and explained the different sauces that paired with the meats. Even though we ordered the chicken and steak, he added a couple pieces of shrimp, which we appreciated. The portion was very large and I really liked the sautéed vegetables! 

Overall, the food was great but it is a bit overpriced.  As someone stated in a previous review, you are paying for the show.  You can get a similar meal at a cheaper cost at a different Japanese restaurant.  It was a good early dinner date though for my boyfriend and I. Maybe with some renovations this place can get a little bit more business, because I can see it being a great spot for a date night.

I've lived in Lafayette my whole life (except for 6 years in the service) and had only been here once when I was a teenager. We were driving by to go somewhere else to eat and I joked about stopping at Mt. Fuji for dinner. So we tried it. The food was really good! I got the Steak Habachi and the spouse got the Fish Habachi. The only thing you need to be aware of is it is a Habachi restaurant. So you sit at a table with others. They aim to wait until a table is full and orders are taken before your chef comes out and cooks everyone's food. So if you come in hungry, expect this and order an appetizer. I'm deducting one star as the high chair they had was broken.

Don't let the faded sign and outside appearance of the place deter you. It was clean and the staff was friendly. Recommended!!

(Also I was very pleased to use the word 'Habachi' so many times in this review)

We ordered the shrimp and they were spoiled. We could smell the stench from the time they hit the grill. We informed the cook, but he acted as if he could not smell what we were smelling. He finished cooking and attempted to serve them to us. I declined, but my sisters both trusted his word. They both regretted that decision. He told the manager to take them off our bill. She came to our table, and instead of recognizing the issue, she proceeded to tell us how she's never served a bad shrimp in her 21 years working here. I personally would not recommend this place to anyone.
Friendly staff and delicious food! The prices are very, very affordable and you leave stuffed. I had the filet and lobster tonight. A must try!

I've gone here twice, and I won't lie, not their biggest fan. It's fun, it's just that teppanyaki isn't really for me. My brother. however, LOVES IT.

The important thing to remember is that you go there for the show. The chefs are performers and entertainers. You're there to have a good time, interact, see some fireworks, laugh with friends. In that, the chefs succeed. They're great and pretty funny as long as you're open to chat and interact. Be aware, because there are multiple stations, during busier hours when there's multiple tables going it can get a bit loud.

Food has kind of a one note flavor and kind of salty for me. Actually, I would see most of it was pretty dry. Even the rice. However, I've also noticed that some of my friends who have kinda only ever eaten American Midwest cuisine seem to like it a good bit better than the rest of us.

The other problem for me is that I just had trouble getting to it. College student, no car, relies on bus and friends. And when I actually have to have a friend drive me somewhere or recommend a place, it just isn't here. 

However, the food is cheap and plentiful and can be pretty fun. If you go with a large group of friends and family, there's a good chance you'll have a good time. Best wishes!

Very, very good.  I went to the other local Japanese Steakhouse last week and stopped by here today to compare.  Both tasted good, but here is what I liked better about Mount Fuji.  We felt more welcomed and appreciated.  The chef was friendly and educated us on what the sauces were for.  The establishment was very clean.  The  choice of vegetables in the dinner was better, it had Zucchini, mushrooms, and onion.  The other place had carrots in place of mushrooms which were a little  undercooked.  I definitely recommend!

Although the design of the building and the inside is a little outdated, the food was very good. We loved the soup, salad, and the main course. Our chef was amazing and entertaining. I got the filet mingon hibachi which was soooo good and my boyfriend got the chicken and steak and he was also very happy with his meal. Don't let the appearance of this  place be a turn off, it is very good with really great staff and we will definitely be back!

Don't be in a hurry if you come here.  It's a unique experience with the chef cooking your food at your table and it's fresh and delicious!  The hostess is not the friendliest person either.  Prices were reasonable.

I really do enjoy Mount Fuji.  I have no real reason for coming here so seldom, but the Lafayette/West Lafayette area has so many Japanese restaurants that it kind of slips through my mind.

My husband and I hadn't been for a year or so, so we decided to check it out again after church this past Sunday.  They do not offer sushi-strictly hibachi style cooking and a few appetizer choices.  Their prices can't be beat and the cook is less "in your face" than some of the other hibachi chefs I've experienced.

We ordered gyoza for appetizer and my husband ordered the scallops while I selected the filet & shrimp combination.  The entrees come with your choice of soup or salad--we both enjoy their salad with ginger dressing; fried rice is included-Asahi charges extra if you want this; and mixed vegetables.  The sauces they serve on the side are good as well.  I think their cooking can sometimes be a bit salty, but overall I like this place.  I would recommend it if you are looking for affordable hibachi.

We have only ever been for lunch, so I'm not sure if their dinner menu is bigger or not.  Good, open seating with several grills so they can accommodate large groups!
Delicious food! Super recommend! I had lunch there with a friend. I believe it was a super fair price for a the amount of food. Fresh ingredients and the meat yakisoba was great!
This is my favorite restaurant in Lafayette.  We don't even live in Lafayette anymore, but every time we come through we stop and eat here.

This place is okay.  The food is just average, nothing real special.  The good thing about this place is that the chef interacts with the customers and makes it pretty funny.  He is really good with the kids.  The other table with kids loved his comedic act.  The food can be a little bit too salty for me, but that's just my own taste.

I went there for a birthday celebration a couple nights ago and was very happy with the experience. the restaurant feels open - they have windows with light coming in unlike another hibachi place I went to nearby once upon a time. The service was good - waitress wasn't exactly jovial, but was quick and efficient. Our chef had a nice upbeat demeanor and wasn't too cutesie - sometimes those hibachi guys get annoying.

We started with the miso soup with salad. Soup was not bad, ginger salad dressing left something to be desired, but not saying it was bad, just have had better. 

They dont seem to have a website, so I will not be using authentic food names here:

Appetizers were a steak kebab in a sesame sauce. Fantastic. We also had the deep-fried tofu. The exterior was delicious as was the sauce, but I thought the tofu itself was too large. Would have been better to have more, smaller pieces to get a lower tofu/exterior ratio. Overall the appetizers were very good.

Our main courses were filet/shrimp and a chicken/pasta number. It of course came with fried rice & vegetables. The rice was good. The vegetables were just ok. Shrimp and filet were outstanding as was the pasta. Never had a noodle dish quite like that and the noodles had a lot more flavor than I was expecting. Chicken was just ok. 

Overall, my rating also takes into account how bad the other hibachi place in town was the last time I went there a couple years ago. The two restaurants are not comparable. Mount Fuji is great - now they just need a website so people can look at their menu.
The cook was a big flirt, I did not appreciate and everything was too salty too much soy sauce..
Really poor service, food was very bleh, atmosphere was very very outdated. Overall very poor experience.

I've only ever had lunch here and I get the filet special with vegetables and a salad. You can't be the price, less than $10. This place is never busy when I go in to pick up my food. I've never seen more than 2 people in their eating at a time.

Neat place for a large group. They have about 6 chairs around each grill. The chef was friendly and fun but the food was bit bland. I really liked the fried rice that was made fresh right in front of me. But the meats and tempura vegetables were kind of flavorless.
Definitely pricey, but the chef interacts with the audience well and the show is very enjoyable. Everything is perfectly cooked, and flavors are good. I would say it is a solid 3.5 stars.

After having Mount Fuji recommended to us several times we decided to try it out. This restaurant is definitely underrated and hidden under the undeserved popularity of the other local Japanese steakhouse Asahi. Besides a slight conversational language barrier the staff was extremely friendly. There were only a few customers in the restaurant when we went later on a Saturday evening. The cook was entertaining, skilled, very friendly to the young children at the table, and most importantly the food was very good. We had the shrimp, steak, and chicken. I would recommend all three. The cook made sure to drop a piece of each meat in their respective sauce dishes in front of you to be sure you used the appropriate sauce for each meat.

We will definitely be back to Mount Fuji in the future and we will be sure to bring more people with us to be sure Mount Fuji becomes a  popular Lafayette restaurant destination.
Great place to eat overall.  The food takes a while, but the chef prepares it right in front of you and is delicious, so it is worth the wait.  The staff is very friendly.

reviews.text:
I spoke to my friend and the reason this place has 2 stars is because of the previous ownership involved. However, I'm from California and my friends brought me here for hot pot. I was so happy. There are so many options here, it's quite astonishing. All of it for just the simple price of $25. The waitress knew that I was from out of town, and kept asking to see if I enjoyed the food, and I got to say, I did. The meat felt good, the vegetables were just right, and the complimentary side dishes were amazing. It doesn't seem like too many people know what hot pot is out in Indiana, but man, it's like the best meal to have on a cold winter day. JUST GOOGLE WHAT IT IS!!! Like seriously. I know it's 2 stars, but I was so impressed. They also provide several different types of sauces so you can mix and match them to get the nice flavorful meal you always desired.

PLEASE, MANAGEMENT HAS CHANGED AND YOU WILL BE DELIGHTFULLY PLEASED WITH THE SERVICE AND THE AMOUNT OF FOOD YOU GET(HOT POT).

It was ok. I stopped by before 1:00pm on a weekday.  I was the only one there. The place seemed tidy enough and yet a little rough around the edges. 

I really wanted pork buns or a similar style dumpling but they said it would be 25 minutes or so.  I didn't have that much time so i just ordered beef with garlic sauce from their lunch menu. 

The beef didn't look or taste like beef to me.  It was very lightly colored.  I'm guessing it was actually slices of pork. That aside the dish was ok and not much different from other similar Chinese restaurants.

In terms of Chinese food takeout, this place is fine. I think the older Yelp reviews don't capture the rating level today. Food tastes like any other take out place. I can't say I've never had better, but it's far from poor. Looks like interior has been updated compared to some of the comments in the poorer reviews.
i have eaten here lots of time. Food quality is quite good. recently they add more new food which i like it very much. I enjoy eating here because I could always feel like home.

Excellent Service, food and furnish is great too!

Both American and traditional Menu are worth to try~

Recommend: General Tso's Chicken.
                       All kinds Noodle Soup.
              BBQ probably the thing u must try!

I would give this place 3 stars for food and 1 star for service and ambience. 

On the positive side, they have both a Chinese menu and an American-Chinese menu (e.g., beef with broccoli). Both menus are written in English. My Szechuan fish strips arrived quickly and they were tasty and spicy. 

On the negative side, we ordered 2 entrées (Szechuan fish strips and Moo Shu Chicken) and one milk tea and our bill was almost $33. We ordered at the counter and the guy who took our order acted as if he were doing us a favor. He was like a parody of hostile wait staff you would see on Saturday Night Live. When they brought the food to our table, the woman refilled my husband's water and that was the extent of the service. The decor was okay but the TV was blasting some Chinese movie which made conversation difficult. 

This place would probably be okay for takeout or if you like watching Chinese movies.

Mandatory Tip, holy god. Went in as a group of five for the hot pot, said the only table for six is not functional so we took the table for four. Shared a stove with a friend, taking the whole meal in reduced space. We refilled the drink (water) and the soup base ourselves and we took the menu ourselves and of course, returned it to order by ourselves. The service is really bad, let alone the food. The sauces are awful too. Later the wrong soup bases were served. In the end the waitress firmly required a 12% tip when I intended 10%. Why does this kind of place even exist :/

Save the time. Happy china has order online, and the food you expect. This place seems more like a Day care than a restaurant; usually there are more kids than adults there, and it seems more like a babysitting service. This place is a little less refined than w. Lafayette businesses and deserves the poor rating. I'll happily drive 5x the distance for slightly better food.

Do you ever have those times when you read a reviews for a restaurant and you think- well I"ll try it anyway? Wait til you see this place. I couldn't possibly describe it adequately- Its like a garage sale and a basement of a day care collided...seriously there are puzzles and stickers all over the walls- filthy menus, piled up junk in the corners the chairs were nice though.... smh.  
     On to the food-Spoiler alert-  it is worse than the decor. Ordered 3 dishes and an appetizer (chicken lo-mein, 2 Gen.Tso's and crab rangoon) $34.00. Everyone took 1-2 bites and we got up and left it all...grossest chinese food ever. Oil dripping out of the sugary sweet crab rangoon. The Gen Tsos tasted like ketchup. so sick. No argument -no bs, we all just got up and left. The lady chased us out the door and said "what wong?" My Husband politely told her we did not like it and she said "we been here 14 years - you first to complain food is no good."  I highly doubt that. So if you read this- and you go there- You've been warned.

I always get the General Tso's Chicken. Overall it's pretty good!!  Downside, the fried rice doesn't have veggies. The inside of China Dragon is always clean!! Definitely worth the lunch special ( $5 )
The food here is absolutely disgusting, almost as if it was spoiled. The lady that works there does not speak English so I couldn't complain to her about it.
love spicy fish fillet pot,  also add beef and tofu. it tastes great. want to try lunch special next time.

This place is a complete an absolute joke. Their sign on the door says they are open from 12pm-2am on Mondays but I am currently sitting in the parking lot at 12:21 with not a single person there. The door is still locked. At least 3 cars have pulled into the parking lot and left frustrated. Also, their "lunch special" menu says it is from 11am-3pm but that doesn't make sense because it doesn't even "open" until 12. Don't go here
Worst restaurant in West Lafayette. Tastes bad but expensive, with a rude service, dirty place.

First, phone number: 765.743.7770 since I had a hard time finding it when I first ordered. Second,this place is great, and easily some of the best Chinese takeout I've had since moving to Indiana. All these "poor service" reviews are straight up racist, and just plain wrong. True, some of the staff doesn't speak or understand English super well, but they've all been nice and appreciative to me. The food is good, and their crab rangoons are particularly good in my opinion. I've already been a few times and will definitely be coming back. I haven't tried the noodle soups but they look good. Don't believe the haters, this place is worth it.

I think it's the best Chinese food I've had and they have both Chinese and Chinese-American food. The decor is lacking, admittedly, but it makes more sense when you realize the sheer number of hours the owner (I think) is there with her kid. Contrary to the other posts, the staff is not rude but quite friendly although the curtness may come off as rude. I interpret it as a cultural difference and not as disdain or apathy. Excellent food and friendly staff keep me coming back. Oh, credit is accepted but cash is greatly preferred like many places in town.

First and last time to stop here. Dirty unattractive dining room that is serving as a durable storage area, family living room, and childcare.  And I actually understand living above or behind  your business, but living in it doesn't work unless you just provide carry out. Our entrees for carry out were OK but the egg rolls were terrible.

Best Chinese food in Lafayette area. People who claim the food is not good or service is rude are likely expecting the more common white western Panda Express type of Chinese. If mass produced us style Chinese food is what you are looking for this is not the place for you.

I just don't understand why they automatically add tips to my bill. We ordered @ the counter. No one ever came back and ask if the food is good. It is rude to enforce the amount of tips they preferred.

Poor service. Cashier is a young man and extremely rude. My dish was about 8 dollars and somehow the total magically totaled to 11:45. Automatically added tips, I think. Food is average. I am extremely disappointed and will not be visiting again.

reviews.text:
Write-up is for dining at "The Village Pub"

The Village Pub is open to the public and they serve delicious food with good service  at very competitive prices.

I've tried the breaded tenderloin, chicken wings, cheeseburger sliders, veggie burger, mashed baby reds (potatoes), fries, and onion straws.

Most entrees are $8. There are flat-screens throughout the sports-themed pub with a separate pub/bar area (with full bar) that is 21+.

A great place for residents to take friends and family. A great, very close place for residents of Bar Barry Heights and University Farms to enjoy as well.

Don't be fooled by the location within Westminster. This is a great place to enjoy a meal.

reviews.text: I ordered some sushi for dinner today and totally enjoyed it. They prepared it in less than 10 minutes and pickup was easy. I ordered the crunchy salmon roll and would definitely order it again!!

I've eaten here many times and every dish I've had is delicious! Today I ordered pickup amidst a pandemic, they made the food quickly, called to let me know it was ready, then safely confirmed my pickup from outside the door. I felt very safe during this scary time and the sushi was perfect. Very great restaurant.

Sushi is delicious! 
Place is small but quiet.
Had Alaskan Roll, MAJE Special Roll. They all taste original! 
Love this small Sushi store.

Fantastic sushi option on campus, a bit expensive and feels way overpriced compared to Fresh Thyme and even PayLess Grocery (Kroger) however for late night raw fish, friendly service, and getting that fresh seaweed wrapped special sauce, no better options in the area!

I once was turned off by sushi and throughout the years have come to love the taste of the roll as it enters my mouth. I've had many amazing rolls in my mouth which have delighted my tongue and my senses. Nothing has quite given me the pleasure nor the sensory delight that this wonderful sushi has given me. From the moment I opened the container to the time I swallowed the last fleeting bite, I could not hold back the joy swelling within my heart. I smiled ear to ear as I finished this delicacy. Quite possibly the best sushi in the United States. I do not say this lightly. Trust in me, a past doubter and enemy of sushi restaurants, now turned sushi lover. This has truly changed the way I view sushi. I will continue to strive for the joy this sushi brought me today. I cannot convey through any number of words or phrases how truly amazing and special this sushi was. To anyone looking for sushi, look no further, I promise on my life that this will more than satisfy the hungry sushi monster that thrives within us all. I love Majé Sushi and will continue to do such until I pass on from this world. Do not miss your chance. Life is short, have Majé Sushi. -Thomas, the most critical food critic.

I usually order here during the week for lunch.  My office is nearby so it is easy to drive to pick it up or walk in and order them enjoy it there.  I have done both depending on time constraints.
What I like about this place despite it being in the mall, is they make your sushi once you order it.  There is nothing sitting in a fridge waiting to be picked up or chosen.  You can watch them make it too.  I have not had issues with the crab or tuna or shrimp tempura freshness quality ever.  I continue to come here for sushi but the pricing is a bit high considering it is in Lafayette, Indiana.  The quality is better than the grocery store kinds but there is a popular sushi resto down the street that offers similar prices but with more selection.  I hope they continue to innovate so they stick around.

Good for the price! Always enjoy this place. Delivery can take a while, but worth the wait. Veggie plus roll, combo B and Hoosier roll are good. I don't care for the regular veggie roll as the peanut sauce is a curve ball. If you want FABULOUS sushi, I'd say drive 2 hours to Sushi Umi and call me in the morning. I use this place to get my fix. Would give 3.5 stars if Yelp allowed.
Delicious sushi!! Heads up though, there isn't any seating besides a small row of barstools, but still a great place for pickup.

Grocery store sushi prices, but much better quality. Maje has a decent variety of sushi, and they do a good job of preparing them. We have always called our order in, and it is ready in 15 minutes. Last time we tried the Cali Boiler, Hoosier Roll, and Orange Dragon. My favorite was the Orange Dragon, but my son liked the Hoosier Roll the best due to the crunchy tempura shrimp.

Fast, fresh, and fairly priced makes Maje a winner every time. 

The space is very small, so take out is the way to go. The selections are pretty good and for vegetarians the options are wider than those at other sushi restaurants in town. I'm never disappointed and I love thay you can order through Yelp. 

One person can have a feast with tax for around $15. That got me a salmon crunch roll and a combo roll that had three different rolls that equaled 1.5 rolls. 

Check them out.
This was delicious! My first time trying sushi and they did not disappoint! They had a wide variety of vegetarian options and it hit the spot, a perfect afternoon snack.

Very small, almost 100% take out (and delivery). Sushi, sashimi, and a few wraps (tapioca paper around seafood, vegetables, and or/chicken), but no other entrees, appetizers, soups, noodles, salads, or desserts (unless you count the strawberry cream cheese wrap). Brown rice (sometimes) available for extra charge. If you're a regular sushi/sashimi eater, you may need extra wasabi; theirs is pretty tame and the wasabi sauce tamer.

Has a very limited range of fish compared to average restaurants (though more than a grocery store). Mostly just salmon, tuna, eel, yellowtail, Krab, and shrimp (cooked or tempura); do have inari and a real crab roll. Does not have salmon skin, mackerel, roe, egg, squid, white fish, etc. etc. etc. But the quality is much higher than a store and you can call to order ahead.

A much wider range is available at the sushi/Japanese restaurant around the corner, but Maje is open later and does basic take out quickly and well.
Hands down my favorite place to grab sushi! There's so many choices, food comes out fast, and it's the perfect place to go. Highly recommend
I would recommend this place if you want to spice up your dinner occasionally. There are so many types of sushi and It is literally 5 minutes walk from my apartment.

Can't get too rallied up on how bad the sushi was considering I'm in the middle of Indiana, but darn it was seriously horrible. I ordered delivery and I was honestly surprised how fast it came to my doorstep. That's all the good I have to say about my dinner. I spent $17 on the Orange Dragon roll plus 3 pieces of salmon sashimi. While the sushi roll was actually somewhat bearable and packed well enough, the sashimi was super cheap and not even cut into a proper shape. The three pieces were awful, almost frozen, and barely looked like salmon. I have heard some good reviews from friends about this place so I was surprised by how utterly disappointing everything was. Definitely never ordering again.

Where I lived there were great sushi restaurants and I was on a quest to find something comparable here in Indiana 
I have 
This and one other comes very close and I'm delighted 
I think you will be also 
Try it

Oh, Maje.  How I love you.  You were the first place I ever tried sushi and you were the place I went back to week after week after week after week during my time at Purdue.

Maje is delicious.  The prices have gone up a little since I first started going there (2 years ago) but they're still completely reasonable.  A California roll is $4.  A lot of the rolls are customizable, so you get to pick the kind of fish you want.  I also had a roll asked to be made without the cream cheese and it came out perfectly.  You really can't go wrong.

I highly recommend any of the Dragon Rolls.  I also highly recommend calling ahead to order to avoid a wait when you get there.  The space isn't very big and can get crowded with raw salmon lovers quite quickly.

I definitely prefer them to Maru.  I'm can't wait until the next time I'm on campus so I can get my sushi fix and relive my glory days at old Purdue!  Boiler up!

I love this place! 

Whenever I want sushi I always come here. Great portions, great quality, and great price. A few days ago I ordered an orange dragon roll and a spicy tuna hand roll. It was GOOD. It was complimented by a generous amount of ginger and wasabi, unlike other local sushi establishments.

If you do takeout, takes 10-15 minutes.
When I went to Purdue this was my go to sushi. I still came here for sushi from Indy. And I will still get sushi here when visit from south bend. It is the best!
Not bad but not spectacular. Decent rolls at an okay price. They have some stools and a counter to eat at but more of a pickup/delivery joint. Not much else to say.

reviews.text:
I wish I could take a snapshot of flavors because I guarantee you haven't had lattes like these but I'm in a poetic mood so let me try to capture their essences -- actual flavors in parentheses. 
*"best is yet to come" (orange marmalade+clove) is like a sunrise but the kind that makes you want to jog around a small downtown and take random pics. 
*"las vegas past" (rose+pistachio) will make you question why you havent written songs for an irish indie band. 
*"good karma" (chinese 5 spice+mocha) conjures images of sitting down and reading the whole Harry Potter Series in french (and understanding it). 

In short I love everything I've had here and can't pick a favorite because moods often dictate my drinks. Check their menu on their website. 

The food is also always super fresh and has great textures. The number of indoor and outdoor seating options is excellent because it's also in the Spot Tavern.

The most unique and eclectic brew spot in the area, grunge meets flower child interior designer with a taste for the slightly rude and awkward, super polite staff, unusual coffee lattes, and easy to spend good time in the outdoor seating. I tried the Anywhere But Here and Forbidden Donut. My dad loves the chai! The passion fruit did a curious jungle thing with the coffee, not for everyone but it does work! Sadly the Forbidden Donut with all its anticipation of mixing two wonderful worlds wasn't so great. Tasted like mushy old donut instead of that fresh baked morning drugs infused with caffeine beans - looks like there's a few left I got to try so I'll have to come back. Great deal to see making good use of the Joe's app! Every coffee shop should use Joe!

A great addition to Lafayette with their outdoor, colorful work space and house made syrup lattes (Tinker Coffee). The bagels are fresh and the spreads are yummy, but don't take my word for it, head there ASAP

It's no joke when I say I come in every day that I am available. Gianna, Thomas, and all the other peeps are so welcoming!! My favorite order is an Oat milk cappuccino with lavender. All of their house lattes are amazing as well. You can't leave without a bagel sandwich either! I definitely recommend checking this place out!!
Best flavored lattes I've ever had, best bagels in Lafayette by far, cannot go wrong!!

reviews.text:
Curbside pick-up on a Friday night.

Service: Great! Staff were really helpful and kept everything contactless for us. 

Food: 
1) Chicken and giant shrimp in peanut sauce (comes with a side of white rice) - decent sized portion (good for 2)
- the peanut sauce was good, but just seemed to be lacking in some vigour. I won't be getting this dish again. 
2) Singapore noodles 
- good portion
- great taste but felt like it could do with some more protein in there
3) Crab rangoon - fantastic!

Price - reasonable.

Would go back!

Great delivery! My food arrived in good time, in great condition, and it was all delicious. Happy to support a local place on national takeout day! I won't be able to eat this all, so I'm looking forward to some leftovers for lunch/dinner tomorrow!

Great sushi.
Everything we had was very, very good.
Service was friendly and quick.
The rolls were perfectly made and tasted fresh and delicious.
The highlight was the 'Pink Sandwich' with rice paper, tuna, lobster, and some nicely seasoned sauces.
Looking forward to going back and trying an entirely different set of selections.

A great Asian fusion spot for the Lafayette area, offering very friendly yet slow service, a huge menu with lots of wonderfully done items, enticing and rich atmosphere, and quality ingredients in their original dishes. Prices are a tad high as with sushi in the midwest. A good sized appetite will need near thirty dollars to fill up which isn't uncommon like Maru and Make but Sake has everyone beat with their huge menu. I noticed a little discount on the Yelp app for checking in and ordered that udon. It was fantastic! Tried the crab rangoon too, in house batter for the win. My buddies got sushi which was as good as the Boilermaker city can get. I'm not sure why they don't make their own Thai tea but the canned stuff wasn't awful. Parking isn't an issue for dinner with most streets being open this side of downtown. Lots of great places around like Revolution BBQ, Town & Gown, and RedSeven, and glad to find out this good option for Asian cuisine.

YESS another great sushi spot in Lafayette! I was impressed with how spacious this restaurant was. Especially with the tables upstairs!

After looking through the menu, we decided sushi was going to be our main focus even though the other items on the menu looked good! We'll have to come back for those ;)

We went with 5 rolls total: shrimp tempura, yummy, tiffany roll, american dream, and lafayette. The first three were maki rolls and the last two were the house special rolls. The house special rolls were definitely our favorite! I feel as though the maki rolls were kinda thin, but I understand it was because of the different price point. 

The server was very nice, although she didn't refill our waters at all, even when I had asked at the end of our meal. We paid and decided to just leave lol. 

I definitely recommend this restaurant and I'd return!

Nice atmosphere and good food- but bad smell in restaurant both times I've been there. I am from California so I was happy to discover that it is possible to find decent tasting sushi in the Midwest. The atmosphere inside is nice and the place is quiet. But there is a sulfuric smell of mildew or something unpleasant that is unappetizing and makes me not want to go back. If the smell were resolved I would give this place a higher rating for sure!

Our family was visiting for my brother's orientation at Purdue and was trying to find a place for dinner. It was the day after July 4th and there didn't seem to be a lot of people out and about the town. The other spot we wanted to try seemed to have closed down permanently so we found this on Yelp. Although it sounds like an exclusively sushi place, they actually have a very extensive Chinese menu. Turns out when we arrived that the sushi chef was not in so only kitchen items would be served.

We decided to order their Sichuan special. You can pick from a list of meat, mushrooms, veggies, etc. and they will stir fry/satay it with the spicy sauce. It is absolutely delicious! We got various other items off the menu and everything tasted great, we were very impressed :)
Good deals , decent sushi for the price and neighborhood adjacent location. Miso Soup is not so great

This was my first time here. It was a very slow night. Service was good I was very impressed with the food presentation and flavor. The blackened tuna was delicious and I would definitely order it again. The atmosphere was nice but the food was certainly the star. If you haven't tried this place, do it.

My bento box was incredible. The lady (Jenny) who served our table was an absolute angel and even gave my boyfriend a complimentary bowl of miso soup to try. Quality food and service. Will be coming here often!!

This was good find my wife and I were looking for a restaurant we have not eaten at and we definitely were not disappointed.  The food portion was good and the taste was on point as well we each had a sushi roll and an entree and a soda my wife had a chicken bento box and spicy girl sushi roll I had a salmon entree and a Benjamin roll

The best sushi around!  The restaurant is in a cool, high ceilinged space.  Parking is available on street. We have had consistently good service and the food is always amazing.  Get the tuna and black pepper roll - sounds weird, but tastes AMAZING.

The food was good! Avocado salad was filling and came with different dressings. Green curry was nice and acidic but had a lot of strange fungi(some like it but my partner doesn't.) Most of us got sesame chicken and it was pretty big so I would recommend sizing down to lunch size. The sesame chicken was drowning in sauce and there wasn't much clean space to get rid of the excess or where to put rice without getting it soggy. We were the only people in the restaurant, but the service was a bit slow and non intuitive, we had to call for our waitress several time but it wasn't a big problem since it wasn't crowded.
Overall it is a good spot for an Asian fusion, but you have to leave some time for the servers to wake up.

A-Mazing. We still couldn't get our oldest to try sushi-BUT no worries, sweet and sour chicken (5stars) and chicken pad Thai (5 stars) for the WIN. We ordered 6 different rolls and HIGHLY recommend their saki role. Regina's recommendation for the win! She's the best. 

Thanks so much for a delicious meal.

We were really looking forward to checking this place out. We did not have much time so we got the red curry  and spring rolls to go. The springs rolls were pretty good but the red curry was awful. It had a little heat which was just enough but other than that, it completely lacked flavor. Total let down and sadly we won't be back.
Very tasty, good portion size as well. I ordered the tempura chicken, which was amazingly light and fluffy, at the same time filling. It could feed 2 lighter eaters.

This place is great. Quite a few vegetarian options and everything I've ordered here has been delicious.

The staff has always been a delight as well!

This is family run operation, the owner/chef is busy rolling sushi, while his mother and sister tend to the dining room. While I am charmed by the family affair, the service is severely lacking. 

The place was not very populated on a Friday night, yet there were many  dirty tables that were left abandoned during my visit. The microwave is in sight of the dining room and I watched my hot sake and steamed edamame both come out of that microwave and brought to my table. I get that restaurants use microwaves, I just would rather not watch it. 

The server took a while to bring water and then confessed she was waiting for the water glasses to be washed. How they didn't have clean water glasses was truly puzzling because the restaurant was not busy. 

While I ate, the staff never came to clean up the dirty tables, so I was surrounded by tables with empty plates and used napkins, it was less than appetizing. 

The 2 sushi rolls were good! I was pleasantly surprised by the food, but the experience was impacted by the service. If they could hire staff that knows how to run a dining room, I would return.

New place in town with a lovely lunch roll special and eager staff.  Sushi chefs are talented and friendly at this chinese-run establishment.  The room is airy and not too busy on a late monday afternoon.  I got sashimi and appetizers as well as rolls.  Sashimi was displayed elegantly- see attached pics.

Service was good, albeit a bit slow. Of course, we did arrive right as they opened. The atmosphere was nice and clean. 

They have a massive selection of sushi, but they also have your more typical Asian fusion dishes. It definitely took a bit of time to go through the menu. 

The presentation was very nice, and the food itself great. We had crab ragoon, gyoza, the Lafayette roll, the Sake roll (not pictured), a 7 pc. sashimi lunch bento, and 2 drinks for about $60.

reviews.text:
LOVE THIS PLACE! we eat here often and it is always good. Their salsa is the best in town! I got the Pescado Feliz and the tilapia was grilled perfectly. It was spicy but sooo good! My hubby got the soft chicken with rice & beans. They have plenty of parking so it is easy to visit them. The inside is beautiful and the music is great!  They will allow you to walk in without a mask now that the mask mandate with our state has ended.
The servers are always attentive and do a great job!

The place is brand new and already firing on most cylinders. Good job with masks and distancing. Some of the best salsa I've had in a restaurant. I had the enchiladas Cancun aka shrimp enchiladas. They were amazing. Great flavors and not drenched in sauce. Served with beans and rice, both tasty. Everyone else enjoyed their entrees as well. Service was good but I think they were a little overwhelmed by a big dinner rush. We had to wait a few minutes for refills. Also, so new that their liquor license isn't active. Server said by 11/11/20. Check it out.

This place just opened up, so they still have a few kinks to work out. When we visited (10/11/20), they didn't have any soft drinks available, just water and tea (sweetened and unsweetened); this wasn't an issue for us, but I know it could be for some people (I think their machine was down, because they do normally have them). They also won't have alcohol until 10/14, if that's an issue for you.

The space is bright and welcoming, with plenty of seating (both booths and tables). The banquettes seem to be custom made, and there are beautiful masks and mosaics decorating the walls. I never would have imagined that this space had once been an Italian restaurant! There is outdoor seating, but it didn't seem to be in use even though the weather was gorgeous.

Service was polite, though food was brought out as it was finished, instead of all together. I was a little taken aback when the waiter started trying to take my plate as he asked if I was finished (I wanted a box, because portions are MASSIVE).

Payment was done by scanning a QR code, which was convenient, though it wasn't working for us. They do have a handheld card reader they can bring around.

The food itself was every bit as delicious as I remember the Riviera Maya in downtown Anderson being. You get a lot for what you pay.

NOTE: There IS a kids' menu, but it's not in the printed menu. Just ask you server!

This was our first time visiting Riviera Maya and the three stars is not necessarily for anything bad, but rather for just being average. The service was fine and the seating was in accordance to new health department guidelines.

The decor is straight out of the "Mexican restaurant in a box" catalog. If you have been to Lindo Mexico or El Rodeo or.......you have seen this interior. 

 I ordered a chicken quesadilla and accidentally got it with the shredded chicken. That means it came with all of the peppers and onions in it. That is my fault. The refried beans were good, and the chips that you get for free we're good as well. The salsa was nothing spectacular. Our Margaritas were average normal Mexican restaurant margaritas.

If you are on the east side of Lafayette and do not want to travel to El Mason, Lindo Mexico, or some of the other restaurants in town, then your Mexican fix will be fulfilled by going here. 

Again, nothing bad, just generally average. Next time, we will make the trip to El Mason.

Margaritas Suck!!! 

I'll start by sayin despite their mistakes this is still great food. Not amazing, not best ever but from this Texas palate is good and better than all others in Lafayette. 

3.4 is the overall after 2 visits. 

Both times the first being dinner and second lunch we ordered the same meal. Other that the pitcher of margaritas. "They were horrible", that's all I can say about drinks other than  typical cloudy tea.

I've had the Chimichanga Acapulco and a al a carte tamale both times and the only complaint is you will discover no more than 3 whole shrimp and it will not be evenly distributed in the chimichanga, however it is flavorful. The tamale with queso is always good.1/2 the dish had no shrimp!!! The inconsistency cost them 1 point. Along with crappy pitcher of margaritas. Those should draw people but they missed on the margaritas big time. I will try a specialty margarita when I return for dinner and give them a shot at redemption. 

J's second try at Arroz Con Pollo, was as good as the first but Tortillas were served the second try which seems appropriate but not the first visit. The restaurant preps all chicken in tiny strips and it's not a traditional Arros Con Pollo but very good according to J.

So this is a new restaurant in town, but it is a chain. I'd say food is on the low end of the spectrum for mexican food. Very bland, basic flavors perfect for the typical gringo palate.

Service was good, fast and efficient. 

But I won't be back, not when there is better tasting mexican food literally just down the block.

We've been here a few times. The food is pretty good but the service has not been great. Nobody comes by to check on you after you get your food or to get you a refill! Also messed up my wife's order.

3 stars is very fair, in my opinion, because there are too many other better options for Mexican restaurants elsewhere. The ambiance made a good first impression, but the service was poor and the food was only mediocre.
Good food. Good environment. Good drinks. Good and friendly staff. Very good Mexican experience.

Food has always been great, service meh. Hard time getting drink refills and have had a forgot meal or side dish a couple times. Willing to give the benefit of the doubt since it's new and the servers may be inexperienced.

This place is where the old Spaghetti's used to be located. The food here kind of reminds me a bit of Chi Chi's.... if you are old enough to get that reference. It's a very Americanized TexMex restaurant that serves a lot of food on your plate. For the everyday Joe, this place is fine. If you are expecting anything close to authentic, this isn't it. In fact we started laughing when the waitress asked us what a Poblano was when I had asked her if any of the dishes contained them. I then asked what dishes they had that were spicy on the menu, and she didn't know and 2 other waiters came over when she asked, and they all kind of laughed. Yeah, then we laughed too because here we are at a Mexican restaurant and there's nothing spicy on the menu. Lol ! I got a horchata to drink. It was fairly tasteless. I also got a margarita and that was weak. Dang it, I really needed a drink. *sigh* The chips and salsa were probably the highlight of the meal. The salsa tasted really fresh. The chips looked and tasted made in-house and were light and crispy. My friend got a chimichanga and seemed to like it. I got the shrimp al diablo. The ONLY somewhat spicy item on the entire menu. They did have a salsa they brought out that you could add that was brown and spicy, but I didn't really like it. It kind of tasted like burnt dirt. Haha. They gave me salsa verde and that was fine. This is what I ended up using on my shrimp. Corn tortillas are available, so that's good. Most people get the flour tortillas, but corn is a bit more traditional. The Diablo (devil in Spanish) was missing heat... it had a little; but, well, I did say this was Americanized afterall. The Devil apparently lives in a condo on the lake lol !!! Each dinner was served with lots of rice and beans. So, I gave it 4 stars because it's a lot of food and it's decent. Many people will probably like it. I prefer more flavor, but this is probably fine for most folks.

For a chain restaurant, we thought it was pretty good! The service was fast and friendly and the food was yummy.  The chips and salsa were delicious.

They don't have the kids menu available yet, but there are plenty of smaller options for children.  They are also not serving alcohol yet, so if that's a deal breaker you might want to wait or call ahead! 

I'm sure we'll be back.

This place has an amazing menu with many drink and food options! I have been five times and have never left hungry or disappointed! The salsa- 10/10, cheese dip- 10/10, and pitcher of margaritas- 10/10 very strong and tasty!!!

Family and I went here for dinner. Got right in. Problem was, waiter was rude. Sat down, he comes says he will be right back. It took almost 10 min before he came back. Took our drink orders, then didn't see him again for almost another 10 more min. got our drink order, took another 3 min. to get it. Then he sat them down and was gone for a bit. Took our order and it was out almost immediately. It was cold and nasty. None of our orders was good. 3 of my kids, my wife, and myself didn't have good food at all. Won't be going back.

We enjoyed our first visit to Riviera Maya and we will definitely be back.  Portions were huge and the food was delicious! This will now be our go to Mexican restaurant in Lafayette. They were very busy but we were seated right away and it didn't take long at all to get our food. Love the decorations and vibe inside and the wait staff was super nice.

I wish there was an opportunity for ZERO STARS, because this is what they deserve.  I got there about 8:20 and they close at 9:00pm.  They were more concerned with cleaning the floors using a very strong smelling cleaning agent.  The smell is not something I find pleasing when trying to eat (really strong Pine Sol comes to mind).  While I can appreciate a good and thorough cleaning particularly now, I object  to this treatment during a time when customers are trying to enjoy their meal.  When I pointed this out to the staff, they couldn't care less.  Since it is apparent they are more concerned with their needs than in providing a quality dining experience, there in no way I will ever be back, nor could I recommend this place to anyone.  There are numerous other choices within a mile and I am certain you'll get a better experience elsewhere.  Oh, the food is nothing special either.

reviews.text: I ordered the rice noodles with sautéed beef and it is absolutely delicious! Great price, quick pickup, I definitely recommend trying this dish!

My absolute favorite restaurant in Lafayette!!  Delicious food, great service, and they have great bubble tea with an abundance of flavors!  Gluten free & vegetarian & Vegan options. I go as often as I can & it never disappoints.

When I'm hungry for Vietnamese food, this is place to go. 
My girls and my husband love Pho and I'll eat beef and noodle #24. Spring rolls, bible tea.

Edit: I went back, because my boyfriend wanted pho and i wanted to try something else on the menu. I went with the chicken yellow curry. It only had chicken and potatoes in it. the chicken was very dry and the potato tasted like a hash brown (crispy on the outside soft on the inside). I think that they pan fried the chicken and potatoes then put it in the curry, hence the dry chicken and crispy potato. The curry was a little oily and bland. I also ordered a side of sausage which was pretty decent. Tasted like the Chinese sausage my mom would get from the grocery store. It was sliced and cooked well!

I really tried to give this place a second chance but eh not a fan! My boyfriends pho wasn't oily this time though!

If I could take a star away and rate this a zero I would.

I can't blame the second visit on my wife. I wanted PHÓ so I decided since I didn't actually eat the last time I was here I would order what they have and give a complete review. For starters RUDE waiter/server, yes one in the same. Let's just call this dude the beatnik. He took our drink orders by saying can I get you guys waters? We both said yes but I ordered a Thai Tea as well. As he dropped my TT off my wife attempted to get his attention but was ignored. He returned with our waters and my wife stated she was trying to get his attention to order something else and his response was "ok so tell me". Just seemed off putting. We ordered the pork dumplings and I ordered the Green Leaf Special PHÓ, my wife ordered the flank and round PHÓ. The drinks were delivered and the raspberry tea my wife ordered was like juice not tea, the Thai Tea was package product not made from scratch. The dumplings which I expected to maybe be pan seared but steamed, these were fried hard all the way around, 2 out of 5 and don't attempt with chop sticks. While eating apps we surveyed the dining room. Walls by our table were disgusting. The ceiling had water stains and there was clutter on tables close to the register. There was also a sliding glass door fridge in the dining room which a cook came and retrieved items from items from multiple times. 

Food arrived and the broth was more akin to water than broth, I have seriously had better from a box. First observation of mine was lacking. My PHÓ the house special all the meat, flank, round, tripe, meat ball, chicken and shrimp. There was no flank, two shrimp, 3 slivers of shredded chicken and two meat ball quarters. It all seemed bland, no color on the meat and just no flavor. I added the cilantro, basil, jalapeño and bean chutes. Another taste called for salt, pepper and a heavy dose of sriracha. Both my wife and I ordered a large but my bowl was twice the size and not for meat sake, crowds of noodles. I would never ever ever order this PHÓ or any other from GL again, it's a waste of $38.00 w/tip. 

Leave this place to the college crowd and hopefully they will go out of business.

Predictable yet restrained, great spot for quality and tasty Vietnamese inspired cuisine on a simple menu of appetizers, soups, and dishes with most a noodle or rice base. There's a few great dishes but majority isn't that appealing for me. I'd prefer more hits of heat and flavor like the lemongrass chicken - that's my jam! Good service, polite staff, place felt clean and open, and menu is good for wheat and other allergies. Our food arrived fast and fresh. My curry was perfect both flavor filled. Will definitely come back!.... 
Update: Was just back four months after the above (took way too long). Tried the Rice and Yellow Curry Tofu, friend had rice, egg, and sausage. All super! Teas are super tasty but overpriced for tea flavored sugar water.

Green leaf was pretty good but they made two fatal mistakes in my to-go order. One was that the spring rolls didn't taste fresh. I suspect that they placed the rolls on top of my hot food which gave them a texture and taste that made me toss them in the trash. The second mistake is that my boba coconut drink was served lukewarm. I don't know about you but I always see ice in my boba drink. No ice here. Just straight up liquid. Instead of a nice refreshment. It made for awkward temperature and taste. Everything else was delicious.
Met my buddy for lunch.  He got #18 (chicken pho).  I had beef.   Excellent.  Parking when Purdue is in session might be more challenging.
This is one of my favorite places to eat in Greater Lafayette. Pho is always a good choice here, and I also enjoy the curry dishes.

This was my first time eating here so we ordered 4 different dishes. I ordered carry out and only had to wait about 15 min.

I was craving Pho but was disappointed in the lack of flavor. It wasn't bad but the broth and meat didn't have much flavor. Once I added some sauce it was good but I preferred to not have to put anything in my pho. I did get it to go so that might have been why. The portion size was good and they did a great job of separating everything for me to be able to travel.

We also got two rice dishes one was pork it was good but I wouldn't order it again. 

The star of the show was the rice with beef cube. The meat was cooked perfectly extremity flavorful and all the side items were very fresh. 

The atmosphere was very nice with a mix of students, families and patrons of all ages.

I would eat here again but wouldn't for pho.

I absolutely love Green Leaf! I'm still shocked at all the negative reviews though.

To a college student, Green Leaf is ideal. It's inexpensive, and the food is tasty and flavorful. Green Leaf's pho is the best hands down. It's filling, the broth is rich and has great portions. I have never been disappointed in the quality of food. Green Leaf also has a variety of bubble tea at a reasonable price, and generous portions as well. I even took out of state students to Green Leaf and they all agreed that the pho was one of the best.

The only downside to Green Leaf is the service, which is understandable because it is so popular. I would definitely avoid going on a Sunday night, as dining courts are closed and many students venture down to Green Leaf. The service is decent, however I always feel rushed because they are always trying to serve the huge crowds they come. If it does get too busy, such as the weekend for dinner, you may not be served for another 30 minutes.

Besides service, I would definitely recommend Green Leaf! Especially if you're just visiting West Lafayette, as it is one of the better restaurants for Pho or Vietnamese food! :)

It's a good hole-in-the-wall place to casually meet up with good friends. 

The place itself is kind of hidden away and not quite in view. If you know where Pint is at RiverMarket Apartments (the bar across the street from McDonald's and Triple X), just continue down the walk along the building, pass Kibu Cafe and the hookah place, and it's the last restaurant. 

Super casual, and you might have to pull chairs and tables around because of the crowds during the busy hours. During those dinner rushes/lunch times, service may be a bit slow.

Food is decent. Lots of options and things you can adjust. I'm not as much of a man, because a lot of the things have the exact same flavor profile. It doesn't take long for different appetizers to taste the same as your entree, depending on what you order (ex. spring rolls then pho). Which, honestly, not surprising. That's just how it is. I'm just not a big fan of it. But the food is good and filling, and it's a great place to go with friends. Bubble tea and boba are the same as any other place. Let's face it, pretty much everyone in the area uses the same powder for taro milk tea. Finally, I suggest going for the pho rather than the rice plates. I find a lot of the grilled meat options here rather dry and/or one-note.

Go up to the cashier to pay. Be aware that this place is usually almost always just filled exclusively by college students. Unsurprisingly. It's also quite popular as a hangout and gets crowded really quickly. Even those hours you think are peaceful can suddenly get extremely busy and loud, so I don't suggest working on things here.

Summary: Recommend, but don't expect to be wow'd

Location: Good
Decor: Good
Food: Okay
Price: Good
Service: Meh

Details: I have to start by stating that I love my Bun Bo's more than I like regular pho. The fact that this Vietnamese restaurant didn't have it was a small disappointment but I was willing to let that pass, if their pho was great. What disappointed me more was when out server told me that I could add sriracha to the pho and it tastes just like its spicy cousin. Not true. I was not impressed by the pho either. The side veggies were not even washed I felt like. The pho was lacking in flavor and did not bring any joy, like Vietnamese food usually does. 

The place was packed, so maybe it could have just been the food that I got which was subpar. Or maybe, folks didn't have a better option anywhere nearby. Whatever the reason, I don't think the pho will ever draw me back. Prices were reasonable, especially for a college campus. Very disappointed with the service. They were barely there, didn't respond to requests for water. Had to put in multiple requests. I also didn't like how our server shouted out to us from across the room to come to a table.

My 4 friends and I just got kicked out of the restaurant!! We wanted to get some milk tea to celebrate my friend's birthday and when they brought us our drinks we were told that you can only stay if you order food because they have a big dinner rush. Honestly, we would have been fine with that if they actually DID have a dinner rush! I looked around and they still had at least 4 tables open with 20 seats. Ask us to leave ONCE you're full. This is not how you treat paying customers. To top it off, the boba was hard and obviously not fresh. Shame on you.

Cheap and filling Vietnamese rice noodle dishes and pho. While this place may struggle in a more urban area, it was a pleasant vibe in the sometimes chain-food area that can be West Lafayette. Ordered a beef dish with rice noodles and demolished it, paid a little over $10. The pho is also pretty good according to my friends and fairly inexpensive.

Sauteed chicken rice made me homesick!! It tasted something like chicken rice （雞肉飯）in Taiwan but with XO sauce (salty dry fish and scallop sauce). This dish caught the delicate balance between of seafood saltness and chicken savory with peanut fragrance. Green onion on the rice was also a genuine combination of Asian taste. I took out the rest of my rice and crazed for more next time. 
Spring rolls were large and fresh. The sauce for rolls was so great that I used it up!
Cornish chicken was another awesome pick! It was savory and tender.

Go to pho place in West Lafayette! I always get the #13 large and it's always fast, cheap, and delicious! Their bubble tea tastes good and they have a nice selection of flavors. 

Ive always wanted to try the other rice dishes and appetizers they have to offer, but I keep coming back for the pho. The place is CROWDED at lunchtime on the weekends, so service can be a little slow. 

I'd definitely recommend this place. A local, inexpensive place for good food!

Greenleaf is one of my favorite restaurants on campus! The combination pho is my go to on cold days - it always warms me up and the flavor is great. I definitely recommend adding the veggies to the soup for a nice variety of flavors. If I want to mix it up, I'll order the rice noodles with egg rolls and pork skewers or the yellow chicken curry. I also love the pork and shrimp spring rolls! They're light and refreshing. The service is always great, all of the servers are very kind and polite. I have noticed that if I go at peak dinner hours (5-7), it tends to take a little longer for the food to come out. This makes sense because they seem a bit understaffed, but regardless I always enjoy my food when it arrives! I would recommend going for lunch or at times when it's less busy for the best dining experience.

I enjoyed myself at Green Leaf.  I was once a student at Purdue and have since moved here permanently to raise our family.  I have always loved pho and was disappointed when there were no real options in town.  The Union has a small place called Lemongrass, but it offers very little variety and you get what you get when ordering their one pho option.

This little place is hidden away, so I never experienced it as a student.  I wish I had known! The pho was super tasty, savory broth, and they had several options to pick from.  They also had a pretty big menu selection of other items, if you aren't interested in pho.

We ordered our little one the pork dumplings. We stole a bite and they were delicious, with or without their yummy dipping sauce.  

My husband and I both tried their Signature pho and we were not disappointed.  The serving was generous, noodles were nicely cooked, and the broth was super savory.  The Signature pho lets you try a little of everything (chicken, flank, tripe, shrimp) but you are more than welcome to "create your own."  They also bring out a plate of clean, fresh vegetables to add in as you see fit (sprouts, lime, jalapenos, cilantro, basil).

I also tried their Thai tea with pearls and I liked it just fine.  My daughter ended up drinking more than me, but I would order it again.  Nothing "unique" compared to other bubble teas, but it tasted good.

For our entire dinner we paid $29, so super affordable.  Service was a little show, we waited for our check for quite some time, but other than that we will definitely be back again.

Great food and generally great service. However, the guy who always wears a beanie is ALWAYS in a foul mood. I momentarily sat in a chair at a larger table while waiting for the smaller table to be cleaned, and he stared me down from across the room, said "NO" loudly while wagging his finger. We weren't trying to take the larger table, and even if we were that's not how you talk to customers--especially not people who regularly frequent the establishment. If that guy hates his job so much, he should find a different t one.
