reviews.text: I'm glad to see DT still operating during Covid. I went to visit a few weeks back and had the fried pickles with a Reuben. Very greasy and flavorful as always. They had a limited menu so don't get set on something before hand, limited menu seemed pretty small.

Stopped in around 1pm on St. Patricks Day.   There were about ten people inside while I was there.  The bartender was professional, polite and courteous and my pocket burgers came out quick and they were cooked perfectly.  I assume it got really busy for the holiday, but I was not around later.  

For the time that I was there, excellent experience, as always.

Very cool place. Drove out of the way to check out the converted theater. The spicy chicken was Awesome! Just the right heat. Homemade thin sliced steak fries and cold beer. Super neat place and definitely a local hangout.

Nothing fancy about this local bar on Main Street.  I walked right by it once before backtracking.  Just know that it is located under the marquee.  Once you enter, the bar is to the left and the dining area is to the right.  It's one of those "seat yourself" establishments.

I didn't see anyone working on the dining side, so I asked for a menu at the bar and grabbed a seat at a table on the dining side.  Fortunately, a waitress arrived before long and I was able to place my order.  

I will say that the Chicago Dog (with chips and pickle spear) was really good.  One of the best I've had.  It was fully loaded with that crazy blue/green relish, the pickled peppers, tomato slices and served on a soft bun with poppy seeds on it.  The dog itself was puffed and tasty.  In fact, the sandwich was so loaded that I had to eat from angles to avoid spilling the contents.  Very tasty indeed!

I got the house chips which were crisp but could use a bit of salt/seasoning.

Free street parking is available out front for up to 3 hours.

Overall, quick and inexpensive food.  They have a 3-way bar set up, but I didn't try anything during my visit.

Review #3341

Came on a Friday night. It was busy but the staff was great. Our server was Tommy and he took great care of us. The food was delicious and at great prices! Overall it was such a great environment. I'll definitely be back!

Very fun and loud environment. 

If you want to have a nice quiet dinner, especially during football season, you may want to check out another spot. DT Kirby's is a perfect random mix of a dive bar and a restaurant. The clientele is a bit on the younger side (mid 20's) so you will have a very lively experience. Our server, Lelenne (sp?), was pretty great and on top of things. We took her advice and had the wasabi chicken wings, which were AMAZING!!!

We were seated immediately, but it took awhile for our server to come to our table. We ordered our drinks as I waited for my brother to arrive. There were five of us in a booth made for four. My brother refused to pull up a chair... So weird. He just squeezed in the booth side of the table. We ordered an app of fried mushrooms. I don't really like mushrooms, and I especially don't like canned mushrooms. The mushrooms they use for their fried mushrooms looked like sliced canned mushrooms. I was imagining the whole mushroom with the stalk removed. 
We ordered our meals. Most of it came out right. My burger was a medium rare. I wasn't aware that all burgers came medium rare unless specified, which was fine. My bff's mom's meal was the only one they messed up. It came with fried mushrooms instead of the onion rings. The server explained her mistake when she brought out the meal, and we ended up getting the onion rings by the time we were getting ready to leave, so she bagged them up for us. 
I wasn't very impressed with the food or the server. The server just seemed sort of lost the entire time. The other guests with me had previously been the DT Kirby and said that some things had changed. They said the burger buns were different; they were larger and poorer quality. They also said the fries weren't the same. I didn't have any fries but they looked soggy and limp. But hey, the bathroom doors are cool.

Cute bar. Tons of burgers to  choose from and hot dogs. Which neither of us got. Hubby had the triple hog and loved  it. I had the chicken pita. The chicken had good flavor to it but not much on the sandwich. Huge pile of lettuce with a good amount of sauce and feta.  Both sandwiches came with house chips. The chips were bland.

Very good bar food right in the heart of downtown Lafayette! I've been here a few times now and have been impressed every time. They have an extensive menu full of tasty-looking options. As an Indiana native, I am quite appreciative of their massive breaded pork tenderloin sandwich. I've tried both the cheese curds and fried pickles as appetizers and they're both very good. They have great deals on beer as well, with cheap domestic buckets even on the weekends. It's a Chicago-themed bar full of Chicago sports memorabilia. I'm excited to come here in the fall to watch a Bears game!

Hard to find a more authentic dive bar with Chicago menu and as much personality as DT Kirby's. The wait staff and bar keeps are edgy and cool, even more so than me in the 1980s. The menu is filled with voluminous options, and dozens of TVs keep the faithful entertained. As a bonus, sometimes Don will mill around the place and give patrons a warm welcome. The beer and liquor selection is good, big menu with many comfort favorites. The only thing keeping this 4.5 star review from 5.0 is the questionable bathroom cleanliness. Sometimes the smell is strong enough to knock a dog off the gut wagon, or at least make me hold my breath. Thank you Kirby's for always delivering a dive bar experience and locals' favorite hangout!

I had to check out this Chicago sports bar since I'm originally from the Chicagoland area. I had read that this place was hard to find since there isn't a sign on the outside so I relied on good ol google maps to lead the way! 

Since it's located in downtown Lafayette, expect to park on the street. Hope you're good at parallel parking unlike the person in front of me LOL 

The inside is pretty cool. You can choose to sit at the bar or at a table. We opted for a table in the back. The decor has a Chicago homey feel to it which I was vibin' minus the Cubs stuff since I'm a White Sox fan! Boooo Cubs boooo!

Ah now for the food. I went with Trish's pita with fries instead of chips and my boyfriend ordered the Chicago Italian beef also with fries and had asked for it to be done Chicago style, meaning the bread/sandwich is dipped in the au jus and topped off with gardinera. When the food arrived it was fresh to order! No cold fries YAY! However my boyfriends Italian beef was not dipped and the au jus and peppers were on the side but we were hungry so he said it was fine. I had some of his sandwich and the beef was dry but the gardinera and bread was okay. Mmmm I've def had better in Chicago and this did not represent our city well! My pita wasn't too bad honestly! No complaints there. The chicken was seasoned well and tzatziki sauce on top was a good touch! We loved the fries!! They were cut wide but thin? If that makes sense! And they were crispy!! 

Verdict: average bar food with huge portions. Would I come back? Probably not. There isn't anything else on the menu that I would like to try. Too heavy for my taste but if that's your forte this is the place for you!

Came on a Wednesday right after work around 430pm.  First of all there is no sign no name no nothing to indicate a front door or location from the street.  So get your GPS out or you'll miss it

This is definitely a dive location full of locals barely any students or visitors or professionals in the area

Menu is full of classic bar food and local favorites our selections were not disappointing at all in fact quite a surprise the portions were as expected food quality was above average for this type of ambience and location

I give this place three stars due to the lack of signage due to the lack of minimal civilized service and poor ventilation and rules around smoking on premise

Came here with a bunch of friends on a Saturday night because we heard the food was great and the portion size was better. The inside is sporty and bar-like with the bathrooms being disguised as porta poties. It was packed, but my party of 6 was still able to be seated right away.

 I had heard that DT Kirbys had a food challenge, and so I decided to give it a go. I got the Chicago dog with chips, prime burger with fried mushrooms, Brady brunch (sandwhich special for the Superbowl) with onion rings, and an appetizer of spinach & artichoke dip with fried pita bread chips. Every single item was spectacular. The burger was beautifully cooked, the sandwhich had some of the best chopped steak, and the sides were fried to perfection. With that being said, the challenge was tough. This place serves food to drunk people, so obviously its going to be greasy. I was able to complete the challenge in 40 minutes (45 time limit) and get the free meal, tshirt, and wall of fame. I do not think that most people can eat this much food, but if you're into challenges, give it a try.

The only negative was the fact that the server wasn't very knowledgeable about the specials, menu, or the challenge, which gave some of my peers triuble when ordering/paying as well as me trying to understand the challenge rules.

It's unfortunate that experience tonight was AWFUL. We want to support local businesses, so that makes writing this even more difficult. We ordered quite a bit of food for carry out which included 3 different burgers. All the food except the burgers was great. All 3 burgers had a funny taste, not sure if it's a new seasoning (this isn't the first time we've got burgers here), new meat supplier, or maybe meat is just rancid. I can deal with something changing or something beyond the control of the restaurant that makes these things taste like well water. What I don't appreciate at all is the customer service, or lack thereof. Upon calling, I was told the manager couldn't be found (place was half full due to pandemic). Person I spoke with on phone said she talked to kitchen and nothing has changed. And then some MENSA associate in the background exclaimed "to be honest, getting our food carry-out isn't the greatest." To be clear this is at least the third time we've ordered carry out from here during pandemic. And we've always had at least one person order a burger, and food has been fine. Sure, you lose a little bit in the transportation, but that drive home didn't make all 3 burgers taste like the Wabash River. Apparently, DT's has no interest in making this right and that is unfortunate as 3 of our family's main entrees are inedible, and we are out $30+ (burgers alone, at least we got some sides that will do the trick). So, I guess we just made our last trip to DT Kirby's. Kinda makes me sad...

Chill place with good bar food.  A huge selection of burgers, sandwiches, and hot dogs.  Authentic Chicago style dogs and sandwiches which is great!

Casual decor with hilarious bathrooms that look like a porta-potty, but is actually just a door that leads to standard restrooms.

DT's is a nice little pub.  The restaurant is set in an old building.  I love the brick, hard wood floors and industrial look.  I wasn't fond of the portapotty entry ways to the rest rooms.  Maybe that's okay for a bar...but not a fan.

We ate late on a Saturday evening.  The waiter warned us that service and the kitchen would be slow.  I appreciated the honestly.  This gentleman hustled his tail off, as did the others, to help make things better.

I had a SoCo and waters.  The drink was served in a tall glass with a nice amount of ice and alcohol.  The waiter hustled to keep the drinks coming the best he could.

We had an appetizer diner.  I had the Thai-1-On wings.  I was expecting an Aisian Zing type sauce.  I was pleased with a Thai peanut style sauce.  The wings were large as advertised and the sauce was very good if you like a mild peanut sauce flavor.  The pretzel and cheese was a hit.  The pretzel was soft and large enough to share.  The cheese didn't have any dramatic flavor but it didn't just come out of a can either.  The fried pickles were interesting.  They appear to have taken a dill spear and cut it into small pieces.  The fried breading was thin, crunchy but salty - to salty for me.  The dip was a nice chipotle style flavor.  Many of the chips were small enough that it was difficult to dip them.

In the past I've had their burgers and dogs.  Both excellent.  Give this place a try!

Yummy, messy burgers!

This was a fun place to eat at, what with their kitchen roll concept (number of rolls indicates how messy the burger is going to be). It has a great vibe, and the burgers were as promised very messy but delicious. They're also good sized burgers - I couldn't finish mine.
I really enjoyed their fries which are different to your usual french fries (a little on the salty end). 
My only issue would be with our waitress - she wasn't outright rude, but not exactly the friendliest/most approachable either. 

It's definitely worth a visit.

Looking for a destination to enjoy some brews and watch some bowl games. Upon entering we stopped at the check in table and were told there were no tables available but we could sit at the bar. 
I told the hostess that we wanted a table when one came available. I dont know if she didn't hear me or what, but she looked at me and gave me a back handed wave, as if to say "whatever", or perhaps "F off".  Not sure. 
As we sat at the bar we could several open tables. Rude and scrappy service not welcome.

Great atmosphere, lots of fun!

Watch out, though, they have rules...but, free Jamey shot if it's your first time there! (I probably just broke one of their rules by calling it "Jamey".) 

The one bartender kept calling me "pal". Not sure if he was being smartass or not. But, it all goes with the atmosphere there. 

Fun place.

We made late decision to eat postgame meal together, have a few Daddy Pops and watch football after great day in Ross Ade... I got parking spot at front door!  That was highlight of our meal... 30 minutes after sitting we got water and drink order in. The sense of urgency doesn't exist,,, granted people are running around, but it wasn't standing room only.. just busy. 8/10 busy. Our hostess was apparently busy doing something else. Like filling ketchup cups, as we witnessed the party across from us finish their meals before they got ketchup. Knowing this delay was standard, i noted the ketchup cups on a fridge and decided to fill my own for our table. I also got flatware, since having an enormous hamburger is generally a messy endeavor. Our food came out, 1.25 hours from walking in. Burgers were done right, except one... which was apparently due to fact that when trying to order a DT Kirby burger without mushrooms was delicately denied, so the hamburger became a Swiss Mushroom burger, for person not wanting mushrooms.  Remember we wanted to have a few beers. I got one... one beer due to lack of service.   Floor manager is really negligent, so unless he's the owner... he really needs a vacation, b/c he is not attentive to clients. 

Well my Bar Burger was good tasting, but cold. After more than an hour ... I could have eaten my arm. Which would have been crispy'er than the home chips. These were cooked in a fryer that was overwhelmed or under temperature. They were soaked in grease and about like eating leather coaster after soaking sweat from beer you wish could ordered earlier. 

We won't return, no matter how clever this Chi-town motif is. I guess the Billy Goat tavern has no worry of competition or anything on lower Wacker drive...

reviews.text: Very popular and highly rated small chain of easy going and friendly pizza making, our group of 7 waited a bit Saturday evening but no surprise considering all other restaurants were overwhelmed with customers too. We all got pizzas and found them all well done and very tasty. There was nice indoor seating and fun to see outdoor options too but we took it all to go. I had the Mama's Little go and added a few additional toppings alonelg with trying the cauliflower crust, was super good! Tasted like a real pizza more than looking like a salad! Can highly recommend!
This place is pretty cool! It's a fun environment and is just like when you order at blaze pizza. They have great options for vegetarians too. They are fully abiding by Covid regulations.

This by far my favorite restaurant in Lafayette!  The staff are always courteous and as a regular customer they have begun to know my order.  I love the attention to detail!  I know times are tough but they have made carry out easy and bring it right to your car.  The food is always fresh and I feel like I'm enjoying a "healthier" version of pizza.  Every month they have a pizza of the month, so I love how they mix up their options.  My favorite is always February "mac daddy" with Mac and cheese of course.  I think it's one of their most popular pizzas.  No matter what you pick, you can't go wrong!

I was looking forward to trying the pizza here because we have heard good things, but were disappointed with our experience at Azzip. My husband grew up in NJ/NY and has had some great slices, and I make pizza at  home (dough from scratch) on a semi-regular basis. 

They get a 5 for customer service- they were happy to honor a kids' meal coupon even without our 2 year old being present (b/c COVID-19). We ordered two pizzas and ended up with 3 because of a mistake, which was generous of them. 

Unfortunately, 2 of the 3 pizzas were still incorrect- they added the right extra vegetables to what was the mistake pizza, but then added pineapple (not on the our list) to the pizza that was almost right. 

They omitted 2 sides of Parmesan as well as 1 side of Grippos..my husband forgot to check the order before he left, but he also mentioned that there were very few (if any) customers eating in, so we aren't sure why there were so many mistakes and omissions.  

The pizza crust is thin and crispy, but to us tastes more like a yeasted version of a saltine cracker. They are generous with toppings, but some of the crust near the center was gooey and underbaked- like someone forgot to add time to account for more toppings. If they had people in training, it would have been better to have someone oversee or double check their work. 

We really like the concept and the variety of toppings, but felt like the execution and dough could be much improved. We won't be back unless someone pays us to eat, and even then, we may hesitate..

I was on a super long Lyft ride and found myself dropping off in Perdue University land. Had no idea where to go eat and this place popped up in the area. I was pleasantly surprised! Can't say it was the best pizza I've had but it was very tasty. It was like Blaze pizza with less topping to choose from but a better crust. Convenient and inexpensive. I'd go back if I'm ever in Lafayette, however very unlikely. Thank you for a quick dinner before my 2 hour drive back home.

An incredible establishment! The concept of this restaurant was created at Purdue and is owned and operated by boilermaker graduates. Pizzas are hand crafted in front of you and you get to choose whichever toppings you desire. Many menu options to choose from or make your own to your own liking. There are several seasonal options that are delicious, my favorite being the crab madness pizza available around March. The staff is incredible, both attentive and welcoming. The prices are inexpensive and the quality is unmatched, making this one of the best value restaurants in town. One of the best options for pizza in town and always a go to that will satisfy the entire family.

SO GOOD!!!!! I had Azzip Pizza for the first time and was definitely impressed! Let me start with their carefulness. I told the gentleman serving me that my order was gluten free and he asked if it was an allergy, I confirmed, and he took the time to clean off the counter, wash his hands, the utensils, and the whole space. I then proceeded to order a certain pizza and he caught that all of the ingredients in this specific pizza werent gluten free. I was very grateful that he warned me. I switched my order to a different type of pizza and he was extra careful with my order. It was a bbq type of pizza and it was AMAZING!!! The toppings were different that I have seen before and they all came together perfectly. It was also the perfect individual size for lunch. I was very satisfied with the entire experience! Definitely go get food at Azzip!

I've been to Azzip Pizza two or three times now. They're handling COVID-19 really well. In addition to physical barriers, masks and half of the tables taken out of use, they have a very sensible policy on payment forms. They say that they prefer credit cards, but if you'd like to pay with cash, please ask them. I'm presuming that they have a protocol for that.

The food is quite good. The choices of ingredients are top notch, with roasted garlic and sun-dried tomatoes included among the more standard fare. They do a good job with gluten free pizzas, with a couple of options (including cauliflower-based crusts).

The staff have always been friendly, informative and patient. Definitely deserves a place on our regular restaurant list.

(True confession: It took three visits for me to figure out the name. Sigh.)

Overall food was good and they were super careful with food allergy issues.  The wait was crazy......lots of people working but not sure they were working together.  Waited in line for 30 mins before we ordered.

Loved it. I like the kind of pizza joint where you can have your own individual pizza so there are no pizza compromises. Nice thin crust, I picked the pizza of the week, wife had a meat one and son had pepperoni.
Good service, fair prices, good selection and hot fresh pizza. 
Definitely recommend.

I went here for the first time while in town for work. It was close to closing time, but they were still pretty busy and very friendly and fast.

I had the Funky Chicken - a great spin on a buffalo chicken pizza, and the Zip Sticks - which I really liked with the pesto.

I came back again the next day for lunch and had the Italian Stallion, which may be my favorite.

So these folks are not only fast and friendly, but they take care of their customers. One guy had a pizza come out with some bubbles in the crust, and they tossed it out and got him a new one quickly. Great customer service!

A very unique pizza place- order your personal pizza, watch it made, and often get it by the time you pay for your food.  

Thin crust personal pizzas only- completely customizable. 

They go the extra mile for gluten-allergic (celiac) patrons as they clean the work station and use dedicated equipment to prepare your gluten-free pie. 

Oh yeah- the pizza is great!

Came here on a weekday during peak lunch time.  Expect a line and waiting.

Once helped the man was very nice but did not ask me if I wanted anything more than the initial pizza I ordered.  I had to ask and prompt him to get my second pizza ordered.

The cauliflower crust pizza burns quickly and left much more to be desired.  The azzip sticks are the same dough for the pizzas.  These pizzas are thinner than paper.  The sticks are not sticks just flat dough.  The toppings choices Are abundant and fresh.

The only bags for to go orders are plastic bags that do not hold the pizza boxes.  It also failed in holding three drinks and ripped causing one of the drinks to fall to the ground and break.

It is tough for me to go back as the pricing is a bit high while competition pizza places are lower and offer more pizza for the price.  If there is another special flavor or topping pizza I might consider it.

A great pizza spot, everyone gets what they want, including gluten-free. Well done Azzip! I'm impressed with the plethora of options, great staff, sauces galore, and high quality Parmesan cheese to sprinkle. The zip sticks were good and the Funky Chicken was top notch tasty! The Chicken on the Beach was a disappointment, interesting concept but the queso cheese loaded down the middle of the pizza and it didn't cook through and through. Also, it's Pepsi, no Coke. Very decent beer options for $3 and $4 each.

I can't believe I am just trying this pizza for the first time. Wow! So good. The crust is so thin and crispy. Topping choices/sauces are abundant and creative. Spring for the larger pizza, as it is worth the price. The pizza cooks in just minutes. I will definitely be back!

I love this place!! I always order the cauliflower crust and load up on the toppings!! I really like their habanero honey and of course sriracha goes on everything! This is definitely my go-to spot when I'm craving a veggie-filled personal pizza. The employees are friendly and the shop is always clean. I highly recommend this place if you're on this side of town!

Always great pizza just the way you like it. We love their E'ville pig but many times we also pick their special pizza. Love their salads and the fact you can get Ski cola there is a huge win! They also have Grippos which makes them very special in my Souther Indiana eyes!

A nice find while visiting our daughter for Parents Weekend.  The pizza was fast, affordable and tasty. You can choose from their pre-set offerings or create your own masterpiece.  The draft beer selection could be a little larger in choices, but I made it work.

Visited for lunch on the second day of business. The dining room was pretty crowded at 1 pm on a Monday. There has been a lot of excitement about this opening.

I ordered a small employee creation called The Founder. You watch the employees make your pizza, much like at a sandwich shop. The oven is right there with them, and the finished pizza comes out by the cashier. Although I am not a huge fan of conveyor ovens, Azzip's pizza crust comes out nice and crispy, and stays that way.

The employees are friendly and don't rush you during your meal. The only downside is they serve only Pepsi products. Yes, they serve beer! 

Don't forget to get a couple warm cookies on your way out.
Service is always great place is always clean and enjoy the monthly choices the white lightning is still my fav

reviews.text: This was the best meat I've had in town, hands down. With other places, usually I'm concerned that the meat will be dry, but with Smolders it was perfect. Best pulled pork in town! I am severely impressed with their quality. Highly recommend.

Was meaning to check this place out and was a nice change of pace compared to the bbq offered by brick and mortar in the area. South street smokehouse is good but the brisket just tastes like roast beef so I gave this place a try. I just had the loaded potato skin thing but my god it was awesome.

reviews.text: Fast service food good. Nice place for a breakfast. Very good service . Food was awesome so happy they had my favorite American fries. Everything hot and delicious will eat here again.

Every once in awhile we like to go here. Food it'self isn't anything amazing just some basic home cooking. I had the breaded tenderloin. It's big enough for 2 buns. It was tough and the breading has no flavor. My husband enjoyed his omelette. He did order. Side of gravy for the home fries because they were dry.
The the safety process was excellent. The coffee was strong and delicious. The breakfast was amazing!

Close to home and the food (breakfast)  and service is consistently good. Omelettes, skillets, everything is good. The food comes out fast, hot and to order. I've dined here for breakfast many many times over three years and avoided leaving a review to keep traffic down. If we have had to wait it was less than 5 minutes. 

I will admit over three years they have improved on a couple staples. Not burning toast! THATS HUGE. My omelette despite the fillings is always served perfectly. For me that's not overcooked and slightly medium inside. Just tell them what you prefer And the magic is they listen.. They are locally owned and employ Purdue and local folks and that means a lot to my family.

I will say the gravy is usually bland and don't bother ordering biscuits and gravy because they serve the sacrifice biscuits with this. This visit the gravy was on spot and I topped my Merican fries with sausage gravy. I usually gauge biscuits and gravy with white pepper gravy just to be clear. ( Bob Evans is my only exception and GD my all time #1 biscuits and original gravy is unbeatable in this area! Xander wasn't feeling well so he just had hash browns and was hungry when he finished them. It was a huge order of perfectly golden hash browns.

We have rarely had an issue that isn't immediately addressed and fixed. You would think the servers are part owners. Not perfect but really solid.

Rest rooms are a wreck so bring Lysol if your are concerned with that.

Clearly a local favorite - pretty packed for a Morning lunch time! 
As a party of 5 we got 
2 skillets
Western omelette (2 small pancakes on the side) [Really enjoyed!!!]
Egg, ham and cheese breakfast sandwich
Turkey bacon, lettuce, and tomato sandwich (chips on the side) 

There are a lot of ways to mix up the side options for the entree. For the omelettes you can get a choice of American fries + toast or two small pancakes. They tasted delicious and honestly were not small to me. My omelette tasted great with a lot of different ingredients - they had a ton of options too to choose from, depending on your tastes, vegetarian options as well. Those in my party enjoyed the skillets dish too. The sandwich was a decent size. Everyone was satisfied with the meal. The service is really sweet and you could tell they're friendly and have a great connection with the locals in Lafayette.

Visited today at around Noon. Sundays are the only day that we have been and it is always busy. We have always been able to find a seat, though.  The staff works very hard to turn the tables over quickly. Portions are alwaya big, food is good and the prices are reasonable.  We always enjoy coming here. I have never had a bad experience here.

This little cafe is a gem that is hidden.  

Our family has been going there to eat for years.
They are the nicest people that own it.  The servers etc are the best!  The food is always great tasting and in abundance.  I cannot say enough good about this Hidden Gem!
Always good food! Best little breakfast secret in town! They have great servers and the food comes out fast! Great food for great price too!
It took 45 minutes for my food to come out, and it was low quality. Understaffed is an understatement.
Good food at a reasonable price and great service.  All a perfect combination for a brief stop during a holiday road trip.
This place is a hidden gem. Great service and great food. Best breakfast I've had in a long time. Will definitely be going back and telling my friends and family about it.

My family and I love this place! I always recommend this place to everyone I know even when I'm at work. They have the best skillets by far! My girlfriend and I get the veggie skillet and biscuits and gravy. We come to country cafe often. Only place I'll eat breakfast you guys are amazing.

Solid spot for breakfast! I imagine this place can get pretty packed on a weekend. Fast and friendly service. I ordered a veggie skillet- potatoes, tomato, onion, mushrooms, green pepper, cheese and two over easy eggs on top. Filling, but not too heavy. Atmosphere is what you would expect from a small family restaurant. Definitely give this place a try.

I had the rodeo skillet for breakfast with a side of gravy and toast.  It was absolutely delicious. Their pancakes are also extremely delicious.  I would recommend this place to everyone. The only wish I had would be that they stay open longer.

My boyfriend and I have found our favorite breakfast spot.  The service and food is exceptional.  The prices are very reasonable and the place is usually really busy!! That usually says something.  I don't mind waiting for a table knowing that the food is worth the wait.  I love their pancakes!

The Country Café is a nice little diner in Lafayette, IN off SR-26 near I-65. I like patronizing small, locally owned businesses as I travel. The Country Café is one of these and gets competition from nearby Denny's, IHOP, Cracker Barrel and McDonalds.

The breakfast we had there was quite good.  I two eggs over-easy, smoked sausage and hash browns with sourdough toast. My wife had two eggs sunny-side up, hash browns and rye toast. The portions were ample and the eggs were cooked just right. Not surprisingly, Country Café doesn't accept AmEx.

The cost was very reasonable and our waitress was attentive. I'd recommend going to the Country Café in you're in Lafayette or traveling on I-65 and looking for some good diner food.

So good I snagged a to-go menu to read for pleasure at home! I got the blueberry pancakes and sadly, I think this is one of the VERY FEW restaraunts in Lafayette that make homemade batter. They didn't absorb all the syrup and fall apart like the instant mix other places use. Fluffy perfection. My friend got an omelette which he said was delicious. Service was awesome. I'm excited to go back and try one of their breakfast skillets!

AVOID THIS PLACE!!! Seated quickly, but menus took a bit to get to us.  25min after we ordered ; Had to ask someone to check on why it's taking so long. They said we would be next. After 10 additional mins and watching food be delivered to MANY others ,we told them we are leaving.
We ordered an Omelet, a hamburger and a kids Mac and cheese...wasn't busy, so not sure what the hold up was. 
We went here because we saw poor reviews for Bob Evans next door; should have went there I guess

A hidden gem in Lafayette! Good tasting pancakes, egg cooked to perfection, and the biscuits and gravy were definitely a hit with our group. There was a bit of a wait when we got there and the ordering took some time, but that was the only minor concern when going there. Also, it was Sunday morning so it's to be expected. One additional benefit is that the breakfast items are cheap and you get a lot for what you pay. Excellent service from the wait staff, they always would say "nice to meet you" and "welcome" if it's your first time there. I think they also try to remember people and make them feel at home. That's a great touch in our age of fast food and other restaurants that just move you in and out as quickly as possible. Will come back for sure!

Greasy spoon with friendly service not a bad place
to eat breakfast. Locals get here early on the weekends....So, come here earlier than 9:00 to get waited on! Food and coffee have always been descent:)

reviews.text: Honestly, this is a good place if you want some good food cheap and quick. I ordered a burger and some loaded fries delivered to my place. They showed up early, and the delivery guy was very nice. The fries came with a generous portion of chili, and the flavor was really good. I had the Boom Boom burger, which could have used a little more sauce, but other than that it was very tasty. I'll definitely give them another try, but I'll definitely ask for more sauce next time.

(Originally posted this review April 2018 on the wrong AJs location's page. Oops!)

Great gyro. One of the best in town. (see updated Lafayette area Gyro ratings at end of review) 

Burgers were just ok - a little well done. Toppings and bun were very good as were the waffle fries. On the whole, it's a good place with reasonable prices and a larger dining room than I expected. Going from memory, I would say they have ~12 tables for four.

"The gyros were good but not the best I ever had. The meat was over cooked. Too many onions" - My parents. talking about the gyros. 

It's decent food but expensive (30 dollars for two gyros and a Italian sausage) and it takes a bit of time to get your food BUT they are open late at night which is nice.

I've been coming to AJ's ever since they opened back in 2008 when I was a Freshman in college. I used to be on their wall of shame for the 1260 challenge back at the River Market location. AJ's specializes in Chicago based food and late night delivery. They are one of the best late night eats along with Fat Franks. They have pivoted from a fast food joint to a fast casual place to essentially a sit down restaurant. Let me start off by saying the new digs were very nice and they had a ton of TVs to watch sports! Also, their beer system is super cool that I've seen on Instagram. But the music was fairly loud and it was club music on a Sunday afternoon with no students...

I stopped by for lunch and it was dead because school's out and COVID-19. The hostess greeted me and had me place an order at the front and then I sat down at a table. I ordered the Chicago dog and mozzarella sticks. I waited for about 20-30 minutes, which was longer than I thought it would be since the place was empty. I did notice that about 2 people came in to pick up orders so maybe that was why. The Chicago looked like a real Chicago dog so presentation was on point. The toppings were excellent, but I think the hot dog may have been slightly undercooked as I felt sick to my stomach after it. The Chicago Dog was $8 so definitely not worth the price. Also, I just checked the menu online and I saw that the Chicago Dog is supposed to come with fries and I definitely did not receive any fries. I don't remember if I was charged $8, but with fries included that makes $8 much more justifiable. Even in Chicago, a Chicago dog is like $5. The breading of the mozzarella sticks were very good, but there was no cheese pull. The marinara sauce was ok, but the ranch was awesome! Also, they gave you a ton of mozzarella sticks for $6. 

I've had a lot of items on their menu over time, but I wanted to try something new. But I would not get the Chicago Dog and mozzarella sticks again. My old go-tos used to be their Italian beefs, burgers, CBRs, gyros, loaded waffle fries, and funnel cake sticks. Their prices are expensive for West Lafayette, but the food quality is usually there. Overall, AJ's is a great late night food option and their new digs are pretty sweet! This was a bad experience, but I would give them another shot in the future.

I hadn't been to AJs since it moved. The new place
Is a great sit down and very open. The food is just amazing per usual! The loaded fries are honestly my favorite thing hands down. Everything on the menu is just pure comfort food. I ordered the spicy gyro and it was just fantastic! Perfectly spicy and the gyro meet was perfectly tender and the pita bread was super soft. I can't wait to go back before a game.

I don't know how AJ's is able to transform a humble hamburger into something so drool-icious it'll send you on a burger kick that will last weeks, but somehow they pull it off.

Any home cook can make a burger that tastes better than 99.9% of the burger joints out there, but AJ's culinary contribution to Tippecanoe County is impossible to duplicate.

I am a teeny little girl, but I can plow through a triple like a Mack Truck. 

They also have loaded waffle fries that are to die for, I'm told, but I'm WAY too fixated on their burgers to experiment. 

But you should! I'm here on a Thursday night, at the campus AJ's, and it's almost completely empty. 

Come on West Lafayette!! It'll be the best burger you ever had in your life, for a rock bottom, bargain price!

Hey Yelp... if you find this review helpful, accurate, amusing or otherwise please follow me. I leave honest reviews with no nonsense. 

This AJ's location 1 of 2 in Lafayette Indiana scores an overall of 2 rounded up from a 1.8.

My wife and I visited AJ's campus location 12/27/19 during lunch. I had heard that this location is very busy when all the students were in town and I wanted to avoid that. We arrived and first thing we noticed were signs on the small trees out front. "When you leave drunk don't break my trunk", I honestly didn't get it at first. Then ahhh haaa... We were greeted by a very friendly hostess who was the only one working the dining room. Perfectly fine because it was slow, very slow. We reminded each other it was Christmas Break. She allowed us to sit where we liked and choose a booth. Once sitting I regretted it. They seem made by the owner or cabinet maker, all wood not comfortable. However the place was nice, clean and everything well kept. 

We were excited about the food. We sat and J ordered sweet tea and I unsweetened, but after the waitress left I realized there was no sweet n low or other sugar substitutes. She returned with the drinks and I asked for sweet n low and she said we don't have non of that but I can throw some sweet on top. I declined but latex subdued because despite my lame attempt to look healthy by ordering unsweetened tea I'm fat and love sweet tea. C'mon I'm from Louisiana what did you expect? We ordered me= Mushroom Swiss with "new fat" onion rings and J had the GCB the garlic butter cheese burger with waffle fries. I was warned about everything being fresh and hot but I burned the F#{£ out of my mouth with the first onion ring. I put it down for lesson learned. However this just tells me the kitchen timing was off. Throwing fried food on tight as it goes out. Waffle fries were just as screaming hot. So maybe wait 5 minutes to eat. IDK? My first bite of the mushroom Swiss burger I tasted Beefiness and mushroom but each one after was drowned in mayo, in fact that was the only moisture left aside from what was trapped in the mushrooms. The GCB was void of Garlic and butter!? Not sure what happened there. The bun reminded me of my younger years, desperate for a burger and buying a frozen prepared burger and toasting the bun to save any self dignity a poor young man when trying to gourmet a frozen gas station burger. It looked nice but it was dry, dense and seemed stale. It had a herb or sprinkling of something on top that added a tear the roof of your mouth off texture but nothing more. Bothe burger patties were overcooked and based on the texture I'm assuming pre made and frozen, they were dense and like a fine grind which to me screams cheap beef. When taking your order you know your at a joint that serves the best beef available if they ask what temp you would like your burger. AJ's does not!

Sides: Onion rings scored a zero, hell I couldn't taste them remember. Seriously I could but they were doughy greasy and just made my stomach turn, in fact it's 6 hours after eating and my stomach is still in knots. Waffle fries were most definitely frozen and prepared as one would expect. 

Here is my assumption great drunken burger joint for game nights and a rushed burger for lunch. I would bet money nothing is made in house from scratch, therefore I place them on a ratings scale with McDonald's. It was not with the $30 we spent for lunch. It's overpriced and we came at a time they should have been blowing people's mind with what they can do. It's a cSh cow on campus for an owner or manager who likely won't throw out stale or bad food! Which is why (as my Cajun uncle would say) my stomach is so torn up I could  through a screen door!

Great alternative burger spot with good sized Chicago style menu items of fat, salt, and calories. Doesn't even try to act like anything is healthy which is a real rare mark of good ole fashioned honesty seems many big chains have lost conscious of (looking at you Wendy's and your silly never frozen beef campaign - like a freezer makes a difference when ya got a day's worth of fat and sodium in one burger!). The burgers here are large and tasty but prices way too high for junk food. Will be back to try more... Eventually.... Near by options with better value/quality burgers: 5 Guys, DT Kirby's, Scotty's, and Pappies.

We used to visit AJ's in the old location when our son was a student at Purdue.  We always liked the food, but the seating and atmosphere left something to be desired.  

Recently, on a trip through W. Lafayette, we were planning to go to another place for lunch, but it was too crowded, so we were going to try AJ's again.  We found out it had moved and changed to table service (a great improvement).  The menu was also changed a bit.

I had the chicken-bacon-ranch sandwich and it was EXCELLENT!  Perfect all the way around.  The battered fries were a great compliment, too!  Hope we can come back for another visit soon!

I am from here, went to Purdue and went here all the time (both drunk and sober). I came back to visit and we of course stopped at all our stopping grounds. I ordered the same thing I always ordered, breaded chicken sandwich, waffle fry and cheese cup.
The waffle fries have not changed (thank god!). The sandwich and cheese cup however did and not for the better. 
Chicken sandwich use to be nice and crunchy breading with great flavor. It also came on a burger bun. The new one was two chicken strips, not a breast and on a sub sandwich and pressed between what looked like a panini press. The breading on the tenders were oil and discussing.
The cheese cup use to be a great nacho cheese, yellow in color and full of flavor. The new one is a synthetic orange tastes like nothing....
Let's go back to the old recipes AJs!

Menu has changed since moving. You can no longer build a burger the way you want. Everything come with fries and there is no option to get it without. This was a good low carb option but not anymore. We won't be back.
Never coming here for carry out or ordering for delivery from here again. The employees are rude and not friendly. Plus, the food is subpar and gave me a stomach ache.

The AJs in Lafayette does an excellent, consistently.  I will tell you that they're not fast like fast food crap, so don't assume it'll be pre made food drying out under a heat lamp.

My favorite is the Breakfast Burger and my boys like The Greek and the CBR.  The loaded waffle fries are exceptional, and definitely not low fat.

AVOID THIS PLACE!!!!  

Update. I left complaint of the below on Twitter, and rather than have them try to straighten this mess out, they deleted my entire post. If you want to know how they treat their customers, read on.

Back in August I went to their previous location and made an order to go. When I got home part of my order was bad. I called and spoke to a manager and she gave me a credit. Earlier tonight I called to verify my credit before placing an order. Once I verified the credit I placed my order. When I arrived to pick up my order the same female manager who originally gave me the credit now claimed there was no credit. I tried to explain,  but when I did the manager began raising her voice claiming she wasn't going to listen to me. This all right as I walked in the door. Even though, i explained the person on the phone confirmed my credit. She replied "No he didn't" and although she was the one who originally gave me the credit, she would not honor it". She explained if the credit isn't listed with my number in the system, it was never there. Meaning that I was lying. What's interesting is my phone records all calls, so not only do I have the original call where she gave me the credit, the counter person confirming my credit, but I was on the phone while she spoke to me like garbage while I tried calmly sort things out. So I have both confirmation of the credit twice, but also the manager treating me like crap all recorded.. This manager decided to beraid me for no reason while continuing to patronize me as well. That said, do not order from here for two simple reasons. One if they screw up your order, forget about them correcting the mistake, your money is gone. And two, Ig the staff decides they feel like it, they will try to make a fool out of you for no reason. In the end, I'm upset with myself for losing my cool after a long drawn out conversation of AJs manager trying her best to upset me and make a fool out of me.  I'm 46 years old and this is the worst abuse of "power" I have ever witnessed.

Been here a couple times now, and I can say is that this place is decent if you're looking for relatively cheap burgers/fries. The burgers can be a little dry, but the chicken sandwich (grilled or crispy) along with the Italian beef sandwich are fenomenal. Can't go wrong with the loaded fries either if you're drunk.

Ordered AJs a few weeks back with one of my buddies. 2 Westerns and a Large Loaded Fry. A tale as old as time. It was a feast and phenomenal as always. The only reason this is a not a 5 star review would be that the delivery time took longer than expected. But all in all AJs is a Purdue staple and a great establishment.

I was excited to try Aj's for the first time but I was disappointed with my meal. I ordered a BBQ grilled chicken sandwich. However, when I got my sandwich it was a complete sloppy mess and just soaked with BBQ sauce. It was so soggy that I had to ditch the bread and eat the chicken by itself. Then, I realized that the chicken inside was breaded instead of grilled and so instead of eating a BBQ grilled chicken sandwich, I ended up eating chicken tenders doused in BBQ sauce. Although the sauce was homemade, it wasn't notable and lacked flavor. I also got the funnel cake fries which were actually quite good. Overall, Aj's is a mixed bag and I don't know if I would go back.
Took a chance and am very glad we did.  The burgwrs were delicious.  My daughter had the chili cheese dog and loved it.  Just passing through but would return if nearby.

This place has amazing burgers! I can't recommend it enough! Me and my friend both got a make your own burger, and had it delivered. There were no issues with delivery and the food was still hot and delicious.
AJ's is the best drunk and sober food on campus. The GCB with pickles and grilled onions is heavenly and honestly changed my life.

reviews.text: Tacos were fantastic!!!!  (And being from California I have an idea what that means). So many fun games and drinks. Bouncers and waitstaff were first class. Can't wait til our next visit!

came here for bottomless mimosas on a SUNDAY. The place SUCKS. you can't even enjoy this place because not only did was the interior fucking awful and looked like it was straight from a reality tv show, but they also had shitty music BLARING at 1pm. Like, it's fun to have music loud for a campus bar at 1am, but it's 1pm and I'm trying to  drink in peace. The staff refused to lower music even 10% so I could hear people at my table because staff reported going for a "Sunday funday Vibe" this place is trash and sucks

Was no line when we showed up but there was no inside seating, bouncer said we said could wait on the patio order drinks and the next open seating would be ours. We waited on the patio for 45 minutes in 45 degree weather while they let a whole line go ahead of us. We confronted them 3 times about it and they said "its not gonna happen" when they told us we would be seated. Terrible customer service, rude bouncers, good servers.  Unorganized establishement who apparently lies to customers will not be coming back.

reviews.text:
Liked that it was fresh tasting, but very little flavor. And the avocado was not ripe yet!!!

Update Jun 2018:
They have worked out their problems (I haven't had an issue with little flavor or unripe avocados since they opened). Increasing my rating to 5 stars due to their great vegetarian and vegan options, reasonable caloric values, and delicious food!

The food is fresh but it is WAY overpriced. I had a delicious cobb salad but definitely not worth the price. The juices, however, are so good and are a really nice pick-me-up to enjoy. This location is super close to the Purdue campus.

Came here on a weekday at noon and was pleased it wasn't busy and no line to wait in.  It was also great to easily find parking within a reasonable walking distance as it was quite cold and windy outside.
The staff that day was super accommodating, kind and helpful.  They answered all of our questions as it was our first time there and offered to help us out initially.  They were quick to offer options and alternatives as well.  In the end I purchased a pricey lunch but worth every penny bc everything in it is what i wanted and ate!  I would come back for sure!  The space itself is bright and roomy, but we took our food to go.  I could for sure eat there next time.  Also warming to know that their containers and utensils are also environmentally friendly.

They got the name wrong...  

This place should be called: Freshii, Healthii, and Yummii.

Yesterday (Tuesday 11/21/2017), I picked-up my son from school for Thanksgiving Break.  I said: "Before we make the trek home, I need to get something to eat".  With Thanksgiving looming, I felt I needed something healthy.  Freshii was the perfect choice.  They offer a nice variety of healthier, fast food options including: bowls, wraps, salads, burritos, soups. smoothies, etc.  OR, grab a clipboard and check-list, and you can totally customize your meal.  Simply check-off the ingredients you want and they will throw them all together for you.  

My son ordered the Tex Mex Burrito.  I decided to customize my meal.  I ordered a bowl of brown rice, chicken, corn, carrots, celery, broccoli, cilantro, sesame seeds, mushrooms, in a spicy peanut sauce (I'm forgetting a few ingredients but you get the idea).  It was delicious!  

Service was excellent, and the restaurant was immaculate.

If you are looking for healthy, fast-food, Freshii is the place!

Freshii is just what it says it is. Healthy salads, wraps, etc., made fresh to order. I ordered a Cobb salad and it was delicious. Freshii is on the fringe of the Village area, near the WL library, but it's worth looking for. All the ingredients were fresh. The service was friendly and prompt. I would definitely go back here for lunch.
This place is fantastic - especially if you are a vegan or vegetarian.  Try the chia seed pudding - it's amazing!

Maybe fresh - maybe Vegetarian - but all Bland!

Servers and staff all friendly, but someone needs to TASTE their food and figure out what obviously needs revision of the menu items. 

The lemon grass soup was bland as water which they tried to correct adding more broth base, but it was just spicy hot bland water. 

The tortilla soup was just tomato juice with stuff put in it. No flavor in this dish either.  

The wrap was also just so bland, I decided to go to another restaurant and order a vegetarian burger. 

Again, great staff and service, but no flavor.

Was excited to try something new, boy was I disappointed!

Warmer outside (52 degrees, in the sun) than inside - so I froze.

Ordered the Buffalo Wrap, added chicken for protein... one sliver of chicken is what I got, and hardly any buffalo sauce.

I will not be coming back.

As far as healthy food goes, I'm not a great one to judge.  However, my burrito thingy is was pretty good even if it was healthy. It left me somewhat confused.  Healthy and tasty?  Does not compute. Does not compute. If you are looking to get filled up with something that I perceive to be healthy, I think I might have stumbled onto something.

Tried Freshli for the first time and ordered the Biiblos Bowl with tofu. The salad was very fresh has great flavor and even a spicy kick but well balanced by spinach and cranberries. 
Definitely will be coming back.

Based solely off of the food and drink I'd give this place a 4.5!

I got a green energy drink and a Cobb salad.
The drink was pre-made in the fridge, I didn't really like that. However it was still good and healthy tasting. 

The Cobb salad was excellent! very fresh and light. They made it fresh, it wasn't in the fridge.

I'm not a huge fan of an 11$ Cobb salad with chicken.. but it's not a terrible price..

Their menu is above the cash register. It doesn't have the calories listed on the menu but I asked for a calorie menu and they had a clean laminated one. (A calorie menu is important for a restaurant selling healthy food, right?)

The only other knock I have on this place is the time it took to make my salad.. It probably took 7 minutes or more.. You may be thinking "that's not too long of a wait". Well I thought it was considering there was only 5 other people in the restaurant and 4 were already eating. In the workers defense, there was only 2 of them.

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who enjoys or needs to eat healthy..

If I'm on the west side and want to eat healthy I will eat there again for sure!
Good quality fresh food; small(ish) portions; high prices, especially on the add-ons.

Healthy, hearty and delicious food! Great to have a place in west Lafayette serving healthy food that tastes fabulous! Lots of options which makes this place a regular weekday/night stop. I have tried most of the menu and have LOVED it all so far! 

Staff is very friendly and the interior of this great food joint is urban and very pretty with lots of natural light!
Service was great and food tasted fresh. Great price for quality food. Bamboo bowl was amazing. Drinks are a little overpriced but nothing crazy.
The most healthy food that you will get near Purdue. Keep it up, folks! I like their Bamboo, Mediterranean bowls.

Freshii is my go-to spot for a healthy meal super close to campus. I run cross country, so finding restaurants that serve high-quality nutritious foods is important to me. Freshii is just that! Their salads and bowls are always very flavorful and filling. There are tons of healthy options that also actually taste GREAT. Plus quick service always. A favorite of mine!
Freshii is awesome. I never dreamed about a nice vegetarian restaurant like freshii. Their food is  so fresh and tasty. It's my new favorite. I recommend the teriyaki twist.
Enjoyed the salads. Tried the Cobb and fiesta. Both were very good, but a bit over priced. 2 salads and tap water was $20. They need music to add a little life to the place.

Food was fresh, and enough portion size. This is a new shop and decor is nice. I think it's on bit expensive side though for the food they served. My entry cost me around $10 with addition of protein.

Fantastic!  It's refreshing to visit the Midwest and not have to eat pizza and fried tenderloin sandwich's daily.  A great healthy option that is tasty filling and good for you. It was nice that the food wasn't syrupy or oily, I had the Mediterranean and my sister had the Teriyaki, so I got to sample it...both delicious but I think the Mediterranean was my favorite, I also had the Mighty Detox and it was also amazing,  this would be my daily GO TO if I lived here, a real must for the fit minded or those with weight to loose

reviews.text:
We heard that a restaurant was starting Dim Sum in Lafayette and had to try it out. 
We stopped by in the afternoon for a late lunch/early supper.  They weren't busy so we had no wait. The place was clean and comfortable. The decor looks updated and is well laid out.
Our waiter was extremely friendly and helpful.  We ordered several different items that we were familiar with and a couple that he suggested.  Our food came fairly quickly and tasted fresh.  We were checked on frequently but not to the point of being a bother.  We ordered some more shrimp dumplings because they were so delicious. 
This is one of the few places I have been tempted to give 5 stars to, but I  will hold off as there were a few items on the menu they didn't have yet.  
Can't wait to come back.
This is decent Korean-Chinese restaurant. You can have good Korean-Chinese foods which you can have in South Korea.

Looking forward to a night of hot pot with some friends .  The restaurant is is tucked away in a quiet plaza. Food and service was great until a cockroach swam in the hot pot.

Update:
The restaurant has informed me that they took this matter seriously and they have engaged professionals to resolved the problem. I wish them luck.

Visiting out of town - my brother took my boyfriend and I to Xin Asian Bistro for a hearty lunch. We ordered the limited hotpot with Sichuan and Kimchi soup base and beef and lamb as our meats. It was delicious and authentic! Quality meat and vegetable offerings (bok choy, enoki and standard mushrooms, glass noodles, cabbage, and tofu, bean curd), as well as superb fixings to customize your own dipping sauce (sesame oil, green onions, garlic, chili sauce, peanut sauce, chinese barbecue sauce). I was not expecting such a nice set up and really enjoyed our meal! The sichuan was spicy as expected while the kimchi was a more neutral complement.

We also ordered the "Snow Ice" which is their delicious take on shaved ice. The pictures on the menu are inaccurate and totally undersell what this dessert ends up being. They advertised flavors that they didn't offer, but we ordered the mango ice with strawberry milk which came out to be strawberry flavored ice with mango bits, mochi and two pocky sticks (see picture) - super fun and actually one of the better shaved ices I've ever had! The consistency of the ice was a lot fluffier than you'd normally find with asian shaved ice.

While there are reviews and perhaps previous experiences of poor service, we actually had a great attentive waitress who appealed to all our extra requests such as additional bowls, spoons, more soup and whatnot. As such, I had no issue with the automatic 18% gratuity and thought Xin Asian Bistro was a gem of a restaurant in Lafayette.

If I can give 0 star I'll not hesitate to do. My friend and I visited Xin during lunch time and had a terrible experience. The food there is normal and ridiculously slow. When we complained about the slow service time, the server said that we should go to faster food restaurants. Rude and stupid.

We went here at about 5:30 on a Friday. There were not many people in the place. Nice modern decor, with some folksy Asian elements. I liked it a lot. 

Our servers were all attentive, quick and overall just good. They more than likely have changed their entire waitstaff since the bad reviews you may see.

We ordered a bottle of Soju, a Spicy Tofu appetizer and two meals: Yusansel (pork, sea cucumbers, onions, bell peppers) & Pepper Galdi (short ribs in Korean bbq sauce)

We really liked the Soju here. Also the spicy tofu appetizer was more like a meal and it came with shredded pork on top and a side of rice. Excellent, excellent dish.

The Yusansel was pretty good, though a tad boring. The short ribs were very good. 

Only complaint is I would have liked the appetizer served first and maybe the meals served about 10 minutes later. The meals came right after the appetizer. 

This place is not cheap. And yes, they charge a 18% mandatory 'tip' (I'll let you figure out why). But for me, I like that - I tip more than 18%, except when it becomes mandatory, in which case the mandate becomes the maximum on principle.

Highly recommend it.

This is the new Asian restaurant in town in the same strip mall as Hana Market and Gaza. They serve Korean-style Chinese food. I tried several dishes and all were very tasty. The Champon/Jampong is a spicy seafood noodle soup, the Jajang mein is noodles in a brown sauce, the tangsoo was Sweet and Sour Pork which was much better than the typical sweet and sour chicken you would get at most Chinese restaurants in town. I also had some vegetable fried rice that was very good. In general, I don't like fried rice because I think it is heavy and greasy, but this was very good and I would order it again.

The portions were huge and the service was friendly.

This is an asian-fusion restaurant owned by Koreans. Among the menu, you will not be gambling if you order chinese-korean menus (black bean sauce/spicy seafood noodles, sweet/sour pork, etc) but I'm not sure about the rest. I only come here to get black bean sauced seafood noodle which they are famous for. 

Some of the complaints saying that they found a cockroach from the hot-pot soup, etc sounded pretty serious. Fortunately I never had that happen in my dish. My only complain is about the mandatory 18% tip - just makes me angry

This review is for hot pot ONLY. 
We got there early (around 6) so it was not so busy. There was only one waiter and he was very helpful. 
Tasty broth and huge amount of meat that comes with the unlimited hot pot deal. 
Downside: dipping sauces are too sweet, wish there were more vegetables

Would like to come back for dim sum

My friend and I dined in here awhile ago and they put up signs saying we were to be charged a mandatory tip of 18% since "foreign students are not used to the gratuity system" so that wasn't pleasant for the quality of service we got. We did enjoy the food though (hence the one star) so we came in on a second occasion to get carry-out (no 18% gratuity) and they charged $2 for a "carry-out" fee that wasn't stated anywhere on any menu or anywhere in the store. Not sure if it's made up and we just got scammed out of $2 or if it's legit. Either way they don't seem very ethical. Avoiding this place for good.

Im a healthy eater so I don't like to eat out often because it's always too salty.  This place is one exception.  Seafood noodle soup is great as long as you don't expect the Udon as listed in the menu.  The noodle is good and tasty but its not udon.   Large portion and its not salty.  The milk tea is bit icy but has a lot of green tea flavor, which I enjoy very much. 
The place is clean and nice, like a cafe. Be aware that 18% tips will be already added to your check.
Hot pot is good，but the service is the most terrible in West Lafayette. Waiting one hour for a beef and rice. Never back here again.
Terrible service, the waiter doesn't gives a damn about guest cause there is a 18% gratitude added automatically. The food here is not bad but not worth the wait and price.

First, the food here is generally pretty good. Good portion size, tasty... Not bad. The service is absolutely awful... Rude, dismissive. Your bill will automatically include a 18% gratuity on it for take out or parties of 2 or more. They will still ask for a tip however. They are not very fast at serving your food. It also seems dirty... First glance, it's cool, hip and chic. Look closer it's sort of gross. I eat here, but only because of a lack of good Asian food close to my home.
Do not come! Their service sucks! 18% mandatory tip has made these people lazy and arrogant! Wish I could give a zero star for this restaurant.
Compulsory 18% tips for horrible service? No, thank you

A pretty good example of what happens when 18% gratuity is automatically added to every order (not just large parties like at other places). Result = utterly pathetic awful (lack of) service. We're talking worse-than-McDonald's service here. Our party of 7 decided to eat here because there was a long line at Gaza, and Xin was mostly empty. To start, they give us 5 menus for 7 people. Then, the waiters weren't familiar with their own menu. I mean, when someone points to one of the pictures and says "this one" shouldn't they know what to write down? One person in our group ordered a coke, which was never refilled until he had to ask. Another guy had hot water, and when he asked for "another water" the waiter brought ice water. Two of the girls ordered the exact same plate of noodles from the menu, but received different things. One of them was so late (over an hour) that the rest of us (6 people!) had all finished eating.

One or two of these little problems can be excused. So many happening in tandem is a big problem. But the really big problem came when we got the check. As a result of the previously mentioned late noodles, they told us that it was on the house, and gave us a bill totaling $92 (after tax and the automatic gratuity). But when we went to the counter to split the check, they rang us up for $108, charging us for the noodles that they said they wouldn't. When I pointed out the discrepancy, the guy's reply was "well you didn't say anything earlier [meaning 10 seconds ago] and now I can't undo the splitting of the checks". He then proceeded to give me a lecture on being honest about how many plates we ordered. After some more arguing, it turned out that he COULD remove the charge for the noodles and split the check again, he just didn't want to. Maybe the customer isn't always right, but when the bill says $92 with the explanation that one order was on the house due to slow service, and you're trying to charge $108 anyways...well, let's just say that Xin won't be missed if it goes out of business.

To top it all off, the food kind of sucked. Mediocre food + bad service + dishonesty = a recipe for failure, especially in a college town where competition among restaurants is fierce.

This restaurant is so horrible. They are so MEAN. I came for my dinner there ALONE today and ordered just only fish roe soup; however, they charged me 18% tip automatically, which is acceptable for me if their service is good. Unfortunately, it was completely not. Their service is same as simple Asian restaurant in town. The server told me that it is the policy of their restaurant. They are just simple restaurant, not fine-dining one. What the heck I have to pay for 18% service charge!!! This gonna be my last time this stupid restaurant. SUCKXin!!!

So I went to check this place, because it has the same name as mine "Xin". I like the food, especially the seafood pancake and jajang noodle, i'd try the kimchi soup next time. The service is not that terrible, but they did forget to bring us spoon, and stuff, and just gave us a big bottle of water so we could refill ourselves, but this is okay for me. The service lady was kinda funny and joking about how my American friends use chopsticks, but not the rude type, my friends seems okay with this. Okay service, if you ask whatever you need, they will bring to you. But they do pre-charge 18% of tips. 
The food taste really like the kind of Korean food you would find in China, it really similar to one of the Korean restaurant near my alma mater in China, so it kinda remind me of my college life. 
For those who are vegetarian, there is only one vegetarian dish, mixed vegetable stir-fry with rice. I think that dish is kind of boring, or plain, just they do not put much effort in designing the vegetarian menu, not too much to be surprised of. Their rice is good though, and they use a cute bamboo-like bowl to hold the rice.

The service was slow and inattentive. I made eye contact with our server multiple times and signaled for her to come over, but multiple times I was ignored, even though she clearly saw me. I ordered the Hawaiian poke bowl and my companion ordered the spicy tuna bowl. Mine was dry and bland, without the rich marinated flavor I expect of a traditional Hawaiian poke. His was not at all spicy, just covered in a pinkish mayo. It was also dry. The quality, however, was not as off-putting as the service. A new server brought out the food and as we began eating with the chopsticks at the table, he came back with spoons we did not ask for and jammed them into our bowls while we were eating from them without even asking if we wanted spoons. Spoiler: we are quite comfortable with chopsticks and did not want spoons, especially not rammed into bowls as we ate. We were never asked how the food was nor if we needed anything. We paid by card at the table with a tablet credit card reader. After he swiped my card and I signed, he grabbed the iPad away at the screen asking if I wanted a receipt. I reached after it but he kept going and hit "no receipt" for me, without asking. I told him I wanted a receipt and he offered to send the receipt of my companion to me instead without apology, apparently not learning his lesson and assuming he did not want his receipt either. Super rude, subpar service with subpar food. I would not recommend this place to anyone.
