reviews.text: This place has the best food, and more importantly the best customer service I have ever encountered at a place like this!! I ordered delivery from here through door dash, and my side of sweet potatoes was missing from my order. I proceeded to email the restaurant, and got a super quick response from the manager that they would set a free meal voucher aside for the next time I come in. Well, I just went over for my free meal and not only left with today's dinner free, but an envelope with free meal vouchers on top of it! This place is great - Corey is the best. Thanks to Corey for fixing my order and for all of your kindness!!
Good food and friendly staff. Love the variety of foods that are actually healthy. That's hard to find when eating out. Their juices are good, too!

I tried one of their green bowls - sriracha ginger tofu with ancient grains (small size). Firstly, not a lot of options for vegetarians/vegans. The tofu salad could have used with a little bit more tofu and dressing, otherwise it just feels a bit dry. I expected it to be packed with flavours but that wasn't really the case. 

If you have a good appetite then the small portion won't suffice. I would suggest going for the bigger bowl. 

Service: excellent - they have curbside pick-up!

I will start this review with the fact that my wife and I LOVE the original menu items here such as the bowls - they ROCK! 

Tonight we decided to try the tacos as we LOVE tacos and eat them at home in various forms of plant-based proteins likely 4-5 times/week and we do them very well. 

These Pita-bread things are NOT tacos and a shouldn't be on the menu as such to mess with folks who love tacos and want them. After my wife saw mine being made she almost asked them to stop and/or ordered something else but she chose to take one for the team... 

Soggy pita-bread in a bowl-shape doesn't make a taco... We had buyers remorse And searched a real taco place on our drive home. 

An hour+ later and I feel like I ate a pile of pita The contents were OK, yet the pita ruined these taco-imposters.

We will go back and will NOT have these taco posers again.
Yum, we love CoreLife and stop in whenever we can. Lots of great choices for everyone, super fresh & healthy. I love the craft drinks.

Whenever I'm feeling for something quick and healthy, I turn to CoreLife Eatery.  It's so refreshing having a healthy option in town! I LOVE their tuna poke grain bowl!! The portions are always so generous and the workers are very friendly.  

I like that when you walk in, you immediately see the fresh produce! I appreciate that you can also see your food as it's being made and they can customize your order as well.  I have yet to try anything other than their poke bowl, because I'm addicted!!! I will be back to try something new! I can't say enough great things about this place ~ give this place a shot if you're in the area, you won't be disappointed!

I'm a huge fan of the CoreLife chain. Every time I go, anywhere I go, it's always good. 

I'm a fan of their tuna poke grain bowl. I always double the protein and add tofu and I'm full for hours. The ingredients are fresh and it's made to order, and always customizable. Service here was great too!

My coworkers and I enjoy coming here often for lunch.  Expect a lunch rush and ordering or building your options takes time.  There is plenty of staff but not all dedicated to fulfilling bowls.

The food is super fresh with abundant choices.  I truly enjoy coming here and having a huge selection of veggies broths light carbs meats etc.  even the juice selection is awesome and unique!  The space is generous like the food servings!  I come back here at least once a week every week.

The only glitch is toppings that are free in the store are considered paid options when ordering online.  Therefore we choose to go there instead of ordering online.

This is by far one of my most favorite spots to grab food from.  If it's food for the wife while she's at work, for a picnic, or a grab and dash food that needs to hit the spot. This place has it. It's fresh, well prepared, and after eating you feel 100% and not all bogged down. Plz check it out. Definitely 5Stars!

I'm sorry to say that I had to leave town to try out a CoreLife (there's one 10 mins. from my house).   That being said, it's the only regret I had!  So many customizable options available here, in addition to vegetarian protein sources...I was in heaven.  The employee who helped me create my bowl was so kind and helpful; he explained that my falafel/hummus as well as the variety of drinks are made in-house, as well.  After some careful consideration I chose the large sized Mediterranean bowl which featured a kale/romaine blend tossed with tomatoes, cucumbers, feta cheese, pickled onions, two falafel, a dollop of hummus with a creamy cucumber basil dressing.  Next time I might elect to purchase more falafel, as these were small but so flavorful!  The basil lemonade was certainly different but after a few sips it had me wondering if I could recreate the flavor at home...lightly sweet, yet very refreshing with an herbal undertone.
Needless to say, I had a fabulous lunch and will certainly visit the Corelife near my house more often!

I must say, I was very impressed by CoreLife . The food portions were huge, fresh and worth the price. The staff was so sweet and very informative!! They seemed happy to be working. 

We ordered the spicy chicken rice bowl. It has purple rice, spinach, red onion, spicy chicken and several other tasty ingredients. It was fresh and hearty! Definitely spicy. We also had a coconut curry chicken broth bowl. It had a lot of noodles and plenty of chicken. The flavor was good, I only wished for a bit more coconut flavor. Another spicy dish, but not too spicy.

So excited that Corelife has TACOS!!! I went there yesterday with my mom and got the Southwest Taco on lettuce! It was so good! The staff was wonderful with my 92 year old mom that just wanted to build her own bowl! Thank you for being so great!

Went for the first time last week.  It was very good!  Lots of healthy options to choose from.  It's sort of like a Subway, but with healthy bowls.  You can create your own bowl from the wide variety of options they have, or choose one of their menu items.  I had the poke bowl and it did not disappoint.  They put a lot of poke in there which was nice as a lot of places skimp on their poke portions.  

There are three sizes you can pick from, a small bowl, large bowl, or there's an even larger plate option.  The large bowl was just a dollar more than the small bowl so I got that.  It was a lot more than it looked like!  I could only finish half of mine and took the rest home for leftovers.  

Prices are a little high, but it's fresh ingredients and large portions so really not too bad when you break it down.

I'll definitely come here again.  I look forward to trying more bowls and their juices next time too!

Great selection of veggie-packed items. I went with the Thai Chicken Noodle bowl. It was a large bowl, and had a good amount of chicken. I appreciated that it was actually spicy and not toned down. It did have a lot of cabbage, but I love cabbage so I was okay with that.

The dining area is styled nicely. Lots of large booths and some tables in the open area. It was freezing when I was there, which was not comforting on a snowy day.

It's no secret that I adore CoreLife for their fresh and healthy gluten free options! We were excited to see this location, which recently opened in May. Thanks to (slightly) cooler weather, we were able to enjoy dinner on the patio. CoreLife is much more than salads (although theirs are delicious) and I recommend trying it out. I love the flank steak bowl and spicy cashew chicken bowl. Check out the falafel too!

This place is amazing! Trendy, quick, and lots of different options! When I first heard about this place I was a little hesitant to try it cause it's "vegetarian", but there are plenty of meat options and add-on possibilities. They have everything from salads, grain bowls, to soups! There are dozens of add on veggies and plenty of dressings to choose from. 

I had the tuna poke salad and it was amazing! Such a big portion size, I only ate half my bowl and I was full. So, 2 meals for $12 - yes!! I've seen reviews for the coconut curry and the ranch steak and I am definitely coming back to try them!

They also have a super mesmerizing juice bar! They have different lemonades, punches, and juice. I tried the watermelon juice and coconut water fruit punch - both amazing. Definitely worth the extra couple bucks since the refills are free! :)

Highly recommend going here! Great "fast food" that's very healthy and very delicious! Amazing option for people who are trying to eat healthy but not very creative (like me lol).

I love that there is a health food place in Lafayette now! Every option sounded delicious, so i I had a difficult time picking, but I'm sure everything is worth a try!

I ended up with the chicken coconut curry soup and it was great.  My husband tried the ranch flank steak with root vegetables and love it as well.  My dad opted for the Poke bowl-I snuck a few bites and know I'll be getting that next time for sure. Our little one got the kids protein plate-chicken, mandarin oranges, rice, corn, and cucumbers with ranch! 

The staff were super friendly, offered samples to us, and were attentive through the entire experience.  

The decor is bright and they offer a ton of fresh juice options as well.  I also saw that if you download the app and made an online order you get $5 off--so I'll have to remember that for next time too.  

It is a tad pricey, but you get what you pay for.  I'll gladly pay a little more for healthy, quality ingredients.

So delicious, but I definitely need to ask for more dressing on our next trip. I can't wait to try everything on the menu!! 

The lemonades, however.... stick to the plain one. Fun to try, but I definitely wouldn't want a full cup of ANY other flavor. 

A little pricy, but I loved seeing the fresh ingredients pulled right off the shelf!

Creative restaurant concept. All your choices are healthy. I built my own green bowl and It came to $8. So its pricey for a salad, but the ingredients were yummy. I loved the balsamic vinegar dressing.

This place rocks!  We did the 'build your own bowl' and made some great salads with romaine, spring mix, kale , chick peas, pickled onions, cucumbers......  and a ginger dressing.   Wife did a spicey bowl of some sorts with kale and lots of veggies.  If your vegan or vegetarian this is THE PLACE to go .   Also tried the gluten free Mac N Cheese and the Roasted Sweet Potatoes!  Everything was excellent!!  Will for sure be back !

reviews.text: We have been patrons of Chumley's for over 10 years. Tonight we ordered carry out (since that's currently the only option) and we had such a pleasant experience! The food was being bagged as I walked in to pay, everything was hot, and tasted delicious when we arrived home! Thanks Chumley's for a great dinner - can't wait to sit at the bar when all goes back to normal!
We love coming here and the staff is always so funny! They have amazing specials everyday and great beer on tap! It's my favorite regular spot

The waitress was very slow and got our order wrong.  When we ordered our food, it was 20 minutes later that she came back and said they didn't have one of 
The things we were ordered.  Then, to top it off, the waitress called my wife a bitch!  One of the managers informed us that she called another patron a bitch too!

To be honest, we stumbled upon this place because Bru Burger down the street was packed. 

Good place for beer and sports - if you're hungry, expect to wait awhile for food.  I went with the fried chicken sandwich and chose lettuce, tomatoes, pickles, and pepper jack cheese as my toppings - I liked how I had the option to choose! My boyfriend went with one of their specialty burgers.  The food was just okay.  I don't think I'll be back.

They are open again!!! New ownership! Extensive beer menu, and a good sized menu with options for everyone... waiters are nice and food comes out fast, but beer takes WAY too long.... fried pickles are good, but the pickles are too big, so they are a little soggy... the cook was new, and messed up a lot of people's orders at my table (not huge, like pork instead of chorizo) but people are still paying for it. They were also out of a bunch of things, and didn't know until like 15 minutes after the orders were placed. It also took 20 minutes to get the bills, and about another 20 for the waitress to come back and pick up the cards.

Probably will go back once in a couple weeks to see if they've worked out the kinks, but otherwise not a must visit restaurant

Visited Chumley's a week ago after it reopened.  No noticeable changed from before it temporarily closed.  Yelp still shows Chumley's as being closed.  I mentioned it to the bartender and she said she would say something to the manager.

Fast forward to a week later and Chumley's still shows up as being 'closed' on Yelp. I mentioned it to the same bartender, again.  

I ordered a sausage and pepperoni pizza and about 20 minutes later, the bartender brings a pepperoni pizza and says "They forgot the sausage.  Do you want them to remake it?".  I said " yes".    

20 minutes later a sausage and pepperoni pizza came out and it was pretty good. The Italian sausage has a little kick to it and I enjoyed it.  I was slightly surprised when my bill came out and there wasn't a least a courtesy 10 percent off or an apology or anything.  

Same Chumley's.   Nothing new.

I work on the same block as Chumley's and I've often popped in to get some wings to go for lunch (these wings are pretty good too) but today's the first day I actually sat down and had a meal there to fully get the atmosphere.

I came in around 11:30 in the morning and the establishment was pretty empty aside from one patron. This is a plus for me because I'm not a huge fan of very crowded restaurants where you feel like you don't have any privacy from other patrons. (I also don't believe in the idea that a restaurant has to be overflowing with customers at all times to be making good food.) You can definitely tell Chumley's is a sports bar with its center focused on Indiana because Colts and Purdue gear decorates the walls. I love the cozy, local spirit of the place! 

I decided to build my own burger using a Beyond Burger because I don't eat red meat anymore (not pictured is that my friend got a regular burger done medium-well and it looked just as tasty) and, as a self-proclaimed toppings man, loaded it up with veggies, hot peppers, guacamole and (trust me on this) pineapple. The heat from the peppers mixed with the charred-sweetness of the pineapple made for a dazzling and intriguing blend of flavors! The chips and dip on the side were a nice, refreshing change of pace every few bites and the pickle spear had a great crunch. I thought the Beyond patty held its weight and really brought all the flavors in the burger together.

I might have to make this burger my go-to instead of the wings!!!

They advertise that they have a wide selection of beer, but don't let this fool you. Two of the beers I picked for my flight they didn't have. The ones I got were warm, kind of flat, and most that are on the beer list aren't quality craft beer; it's stuff like Miller Light, Bud Light and Budweiser. You can't really tell what your ordering since a lot of beers only have "rotating" as their description and they won't write it on the flight board. Our waiter wasn't very informative or prepared either. The Long Island my boyfriend ordered was so sweet he couldn't finish even half of it. The nachos were a big portion, but cold and there was not much guacamole like suggested on the menu. My water cup was dirty and you don't get water unless you ask. We went to watch a basketball game, they do have plenty of TVs that are really nice.

Hi. 0/15/20

Jamie I came to the best restaurant in town. They have so many choices on their food.
We eat here a lot because the taste and the food. The names brands are so unique you get great tips
Get the pretzel sticks!!! They're worth all your money. My husband and I frequent Chumley's--the service isn't the best, but there drink deals are great and apps are amazing.
They finally got their shit together and brought back the (mostly) original menu and quit trying to be another Chipotle copycat. Pics of the current menu posted in photos! Service was good today too.

We decided to try Chumley's for dinner and drinks last night with 5 of my friends.  Two of us decided to go early before the rest showed up and ordered drinks and three appetizers. The drinks did come out in a timely fashion but no appetizers for 45 minutes. We were not in any rush but our waiter did come to let us know, after a extended about of time, they were out of two of our appetizers. The rest of our dining experience was not up to par by any means.  Food was subpar and and beer was rather warm.  I always try to give places the benefit of the doubt, but I will more than likely not be coming back. No help with our bill or acknowledgment that they did a poor job. Wish them the best and hope this was a rare occurrence, but just a lack of awareness for a lackluster dinner experience.

So, we've been here a couple of times in the past few years. A couple of years ago, we visited in the afternoon after a poorly attended Purdue football game. We met a bunch of friends in the back and had a great seating area and great service. The friends we met were local to Lafayette and regulars. The food was fine, regular standard bar food really, but it was good. The drinks were flowing and the service was great. So, overall, we had a good experience.

This past year, we went back, remembering our prior experience. The place was much busier than the last time we'd been there, but we got lucky and got a 4 top booth very quickly - up towards the front of the restaurant. Our server was nice, but the service was VERY slow. The food took forever to come out (we didn't order much - just wings and a burger, and maybe one more item) and we had a tough time getting fresh beers. It was just a completely different experience. The quality of the food felt like it had gone down too. 

It was so different than our first visit. That's when I got on Yelp to see what people were saying. Well, it all made sense because the things that I found less than fantastic were the same things that people had been commenting on as well. Again, I feel like the people that work there are friendly enough. I hate to write it off after one good visit and one terrible visit, but not sure that this would make our list next time around if we weren't already meeting some locals there.

This is no longer the good Chumley's I know. 
The service was not impressive at all and the food came out cold.
We had to wait almost 1 hour to get food. We asked our server to check our food and he said "lots of orders and taking time" but he was not right. When he brought our food, as I mentioned the food was cold.
Fries were completely cold and the burger was barely warm. Very disappointing. We don't go there anymore.

So glad Chumley's is back and better than ever! Food is amazing, I most recently enjoyed the California burger which was big enough for two meals. The upgraded staff is charming, personable, efficient and friendly. Truly appreciate Chumley's generous community spirit.

I'm puzzled about all the negative reviews this place has received. My wife and I found it to be great! The service was wonderful (Thanks Faith G.!) as was the food and drinks. When we first arrived our party wasn't all there so we had a drink at the bar. The bartender was nice and helped accommodate our party of twelve once we all got there. The food came out quickly and was good, especially for the price! I'm sure we will be back!

THE WORST! If I could give this place 0 stars, I would. After forgetting my ID, driving 30 mins to get it and come back, the bouncer still wouldn't believe me that my ID was legit (I was 26 years old at the time) because I'm from out of state and he didn't recognize it, even though there are several security features in my license. (It was even an under 21 license, since it was renewed on my 20th birthday--who would get a fake under 21 license?!) When he demanded a 2nd form of ID, he refused to tell us what would pass for ID even when we asked. He was really awful toward us, and we don't even drink, so definitely not worth the hassle. My husband got the manager when he got in to come look at my ID, who verified it was in fact legit, and let us in to join our friends who had been there for 45 mins at this point. 

Service to our table was extremely slow--a lot of our friends got their first drinks and apps 5-10 mins after I got in, even though it was a Monday night and the place was dead. The manager (who was the only good thing about the place--he was helpful) offered me a free drink or side for our trouble. We ordered a side, and after not getting it for almost an hour, we asked our server about it. Turns out the order was lost. After 45 mins of ID fighting/driving and over an hour in the restaurant, we had no food or drinks to show for it. We left at that point.

Neither I nor my husband never had a more difficult and terrible experience at a restaurant or bar before in our lives. Not only are we never going back, we tell all our friends not to go there either.

A decent enough place, and overall clean, which is always a plus for bars/pubs. I liked the atmosphere - dark and old-timey, in spite of the plasma tellies - and the servers were very courteous - the most courteous I have ever come across, in fact, so that was a very pleasant surprise. 

Everything is very overpriced compared to the other bars/pubs in the vicinity, though - I've only seen 9 Irish Brothers beat their prices for food and drink. 9 Irish, though, gives you a hefty amount of food for the price, such that you do not feel too ripped off. For the $12 I paid for a donut burger, plus something like $2 just to get some real fries instead of the Lays-like potato chips they serve with it for free, I was expecting quite a large, decadent sandwich with a good portion of fries. Instead, I got a pretty average patty on a donut that disintegrated with handling, such that by the end, I was pretty much holding the patty,  while I would say I only got about the equivalent amount of a medium serving of fries at McDonalds. It was good, but I left hungry. I have had meals that were $4-5 cheaper, about the same quality, but with quite a bit more food than what you will get here.

Ate here for a late lunch while I was in town and the daily special was $2 off all burgers. I was not disappointed with the Hawaiian burger and love how many weird options there are. Didn't get to order a beer but they seem to have a good selection. No complaints here.

We went here back In October to see what it was like after all the changes they had made. Terrible since its big change. Service was not great. They obviously need to train or hire better because it seems like this is common.
I asked for a regular margarita. It tasted like it had pumpkin purée in it... meaning the bartender did not wash out the mixer after making the pumpkin margarita they were serving during October. 
Our food was subpar. 
Saw a table come in and sit for awhile. No one greeted them so they left.

reviews.text:
I'm asheamed to admit how long I lived here before trying D & R. I've always wanted to but there was something intimidating about it since it was a longtime local thing. Anyway I couldn't pass up the pork chop and two sides for under $10 any longer. As always, my pros and cons of this visit. 

Pros:
-One of the best pork chops I've ever had. It was huge. Perfectly seasoned. Perfectly cooked.
-Mac and cheese was creamy and delicious. 
-Service I received over the phone and at pickup was phenomenal. Extremely polite. 
-Silverware they supplied actually held up to the chop. 

Cons:
-if I was nitpicking I would say an online ordering and easier pickup feature would be nice but the foods worth a little work. 

I'll be having lunch here  every Thursday now!

Got take out and they were very good with curbside service and the food was delicious.  I particularly recommend the pulled pork and Mac n cheese.  I will definitely be back.  I will say I thought 1 lb of meat and 1/2 lb of each side dish we got sounded like a lot of food, but it wasn't as much as I imagined.  I'm horrible at estimating those things.  1 lb of meat was good for the three of us and 1/2 lb sides are the perfect size for two people to split.
I needed an easy meal for a small group after a memorial service. With just a couple of days notice, on a busy weekend, during a pandemic, I was able to pick up a wonderful meal. Everyone loved it!

I had the brisket dinner for 14.99. A very good serving of meat. Just enough fat. I got 2 sides, 
Baked beans and fancy potato salad, both were very good. The beans were cooked down by the time I arrived but were not dry. The baked potato salad had a solid flavor, no discernible spice.

I have had food from here twice.  Once for catering for a work event and second as take out to bring home for dinner.
Both experiences were delish and the portion sizes are super generous.  The pricing is fair for the area considering there are numerous BBQ options and people here do not hesitate to make their own to forfeit buying pre-made bbq foods.
The people are kind and friendly and quite patient. 
I would come back here again for catering needs or even take out.  They make a good local stop for lunch too for something quick but hearty.
This is the best comfort food in town!  I can't say that we have had one bad meal here; everything is so delicious!

Outstanding BBQ ribs
Great sides prompt service
I will return.....may be the best in the area

Passing through.
Stopped to try it out, per yelp reviews.
Got burnt ends special + 2 sides for 11.99.
Served up luke warm...bad to start...
Burned ends had little carmelization and even less smoke flavor.  Not sure what's going on...
Slaw was tasteless and without effort.  Actually uneatable.  I left it. 

Baked beans (side) were average...if not on the too sweet side.

3 stars is probably too generous.  2.5 stars. 

Summary:  Pass on by.

Decided to try the place with my wife and daughter after moving to Lafayette from Central Texas 3 years ago. I've been very skeptical of all bbq/smokehouses in Indiana as it's just different from what I expect. That said I've learned that it is what it is. Arriving I told my family "think positive"! We arrived around 12:30 and I noticed meat under a heat lamp in a display case and a rather disorganized front end. Then we were greeted with EXTREME hospitality. Very impressed! The gentleman taking our order was very patient with my daughter which is a really big deal for me. She ordered the smoked chicken with sides of Mac n cheese and mash potatoes and gravy. The chicken was pulled from the heat lamp. My wife ordered the sliced brisket plate with baked potato salad and Mac and cheese. I being a Coon Ass (cajun) saw the catfish special, paired it with green beans and corn, I also had to try the "Texas Brisket" so I ordered a half pound. Here is the food break down and then my pet peeve that ruined the whole experience. 0-5 but with a caveat allowing one decimal. 

Smoked Chicken 3.5 (flavorful but dry)
Texas Smoked Brisket 2.9 ( 1 order juicy 1 dry, void of true Texas Smoke Flavor) this is just Indiana brisket which is fine but not Texas smoked brisket as advertised. 
Fried Catfish 5 (absolutely amazing)
Sides - Corn, Green Beans, Baked Potato Salad all rate 5 (seasoned perfect and correct temp and just wonderful) 
Mac n Cheese 2.5 ( step it up guys this was boring fake cheese nonsense and can easily be improved because the pasta was perfect).

Sweet Tea 4.2 was great but mixed in a little regular to cut the sweet for my taste. POP  Rated 3 syrup to carbonation and lemonade was EAH. Maybe switch to single serve options?

The MAJOR problems. A hair in my 1/2 lb. order of sliced mediocre brisket. Black fungus matter in my daughters ice. 

I did not capture a picture of the ice but was at the self serve station but she showed me and I had her discard it. The place was getting busy and I had no intentions of ruining my afternoon and we were basically getting refills but it along with the hair made me sick to my stomach. I would have notified the staff but again a scene was not why I was there but YES I reported this to the health department because it's a health hazard to many restaurants do not pay attention too. The hair is what it is and it happens. I ate half of one slice and closed the styrofoam container and discarded it entirely.

Last comments because I am fully aware these people care about their business. The clutter around the place along with the two old men sitting in the back room by the restroom are a distraction from you business. Eliminate the "TEXAS" phrase unless you can or have passed the test. I'm willing to go brisket for brisket to show you what I mean.  Styrofoam and hot food is not appealing. I guess choose what you want to be great at and do it. Your restaurant could kill South Street Smoke house if you weren't distracted by Catering. Lastly if Yelp allowed my rating would be a 2.9 but with the hair and moldy ice I refuse to round up!
They always have great food but last time I went by they are still only doing curbside service. They will get 5 star when they open for sit down meals

Thanks Yelp - you did it again!!  We stumbled on this BBQ restaurant gem while seeking a quick dinner.  From the moment we stepped thru the front door, we were greeted with genuine friendly hospitality from all employees (thanks to Sara in particular!).  Our food was SO GOOD!  Portions generous.  Decent beer selection was definitely a bonus.  We ended up making a few purchases at sister market next door.   All in all, we cannot wait to return!

Found in a shopping plaza off Creasy LN. by Dollar General it is a very clean and surprisingly large restaurant. 
They provide carry out and dine in. 

You order at the counter and bring your food to the dining room. 

Because I don't eat pork I got the beef brisket. Very tender and mild flavor. The BBQ sauce is sweet, as in Sweet Baby Rays brand.  That was a disappointment. Don't get me wrong that is a good BBQ sauce. I was hopping for something homemade. The next choice was spicy or Carolina with a vinegar flavor. I liked it. No brand stated. 
Caned corn was flavored.  And the mashed potatoes were garlic and did not need the brown gravy.  

Worth eating at. But not the best.

I have used D&R BBQ & Catering for carry-out most of the time so I'm only rating the quality of their food.
My favorite is the broasted chicken.  It is simply delicious.  Broasted chicken is hard to find because the equipment is expensive and each "batch" takes about 15 minutes to prepare. This process produces chicken breasts with a crisp outer later and moist and tender inside. 
They also have a nice selection of "deli" salads. We had the potato salad last time and it was amount the best I've eaten.
Incredible thick pork chop and ribs.  The sides were amazing too.  Great selection, so you can eat Keto friendly (or not, haha).  It was like a home cooked meal.  I will be back.

Last weekend I helped a local elementary school move their library from their old building to a new facility.  The school staff provided lunch.  We had BBQ sandwiches from D&R.  They told us D&R DONATED the food!  It was so great!  Not only did the food taste wonderful but the donation was very thoughtful and kind of them.  Thanks D&R.  You're the best!

Note: marking 3 stars until I'm able to give them another shot per the owner's reply. He was very kind and patient through the process and I look forward to updating my review in the near future. Looks like the menu had an error on the grubhub app which was not caught when they were first contacted. 

Paid $24 on grub hub for the $17 two meat two side chicken meal. They gave us about a breast worth of chicken and a scoop each of Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. The chicken was fine but bland, and accompanied by sweet baby rays. Incredibly disappointed there just because BBQ is in the name of the restaurant but they have to give us little sweet baby rays cups? Mac and cheese was decent but nothing special, and the potatoes and gravy were pretty good. This meal was well over double what it should have cost. It was billed as double meat but that would make one meat less than a kid's portion. How they can continue to get customers with mind boggling prices and low effort food is beyond me, but I've learned my lesson and won't be wasting money here again. I'll be sticking to South Street.

If you are looking for a place to be treated like family in Lafayette, look no further. D&R Market offers amazing barbecue at an affordable price. Their brisket is second to none. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone.

I had such high hopes for this place. The yelp reviews were good, and it had all the makings of a good BBQ hole in the wall. Unfortunately, that's about all it had. I ordered the brisket plate and added a Nashville hot chicken drumstick to it as it was the special of the day. The person helping me was about as friendly as a shoe and although I'm sure he spoke English, he proved that he knew about 3 words during the entire exchange. 

For my sides I ordered Mac-n-chee' and beans. I'm gonna be honest the beans were easily the best thing on the plate. The brisket was over cooked and poorly smoked. The smoke had hardly penetrated the meat and the smoke ring was nonexistent. The meat was tough, and lack luster at best. I actually had to ask for sauce and what I received was pretty much Sweet Baby Ray's sauce with tabasco. Yet again, huge fail. The Mac and cheese was ok, but it's pretty hard to mess that up, so kudos there. The Nashville hot chicken tasted exactly like fried buttermilk batter and nothing else. Not even a hint of hot chicken. Fried chicken, yes. Nashville hot chicken, Hell no.  

All in all, it was mediocre at best. My advice: get your shit together and stop serving brisket if you can't do it justice.  You're not in Texas, so quit acting like it.

I consider myself a foodie. I like food. I like good food. I like good barbecue when it comes around. I appreciate the excellency of institute such as this one because it does not happen overnight. I can imagine yhem spending much time and effort in developing their craft (bbq) and now they are where they are. 
My friend and I had the brisket meal and porkchop meal and 4 different sides. I did not have anything that I did not like. 
I recommand this place if you are around the area. Or even worth driving 20 to 30 minutes. 
Plus, staff are super nice and they know how to serve you right.

Amazingly good 'que for this area. They even have a bbq bacon-wrapped meatloaf. The brisket is fork-tender, no knife needed. The sides are all very good (stay away from the mac and cheese, that's MINE!), with ample portions served. There are also a variety of cold sides available. Ask for the banana pudding. Although not as good as mine, it's pretty good stuff. 

Their gem, though, is broasted chicken. I would come here when I was a student at Purdue for their broasted chicken, on my limited student budget. It is that good. Crispy on the outside, juicy and tender on the inside. Much better chicken than at many of the bbq and chicken shacks I have visited in my travels. 

Although D&R is a bit on the pricy side, it is well worth a try. If you are hankering for some good bbq, then you have to come here. Whenever one of my bosses comes through, I make sure to stop here, and they leave impressed.

reviews.text: Great food and super nice staff. Everyone is very health conscious and kind when we pick up our orders. Quesadillas and tacos are great. The only tip I have is to get the Chile or Tajín on the side so you can choose how much is on your elotes. I got a lot on mine last time and next time I'll ask for it on the side.

What a delightful discovery. Mango Loco marries superb authentic Mexican stand-by's like pupusas, burritos, sopes and tacos with a world of hand-made ice creams and treats. The tacos were among the best we've had. Generous portions and super tasty, this is a family restaurant where you can really feel the love. We had to forego the cabeza because they had several *hours* yet to go in slow cooking them. Your mouth watering yet? The ice creams have seemingly every delicious fruit in Mexico (tequila's a fruit, right?). They're not sure when they're opening for dine-in yet (the place is tiny), but do yourself a favor, and grab some take-out from this absolute treasure of a Mexican restaurant.

You can't dine in but take out is available. The tacos are seasoned perfectly and the portions are more than enough. Their aguas frescas are made to order so they are always fresh and delicious. Try the agua de sandia, you will not regret it. Their homemade paletas and ice cream are tasty and they have unique flavors. One of my new faves is fresa y vainilla---it's like a Mexican creamsicle but with strawberry. Lastly, the owners are super sweet. Call ahead and order since everything is made fresh, it could be a bit of a wait (but definitely worth it!).

This hole in the wall is a great treat! I've never had any Mexican desserts so went here with the goal of trying out Mexican ice-cream. Ended up getting a Mangonada AND Esquites. Definitely very different. The mango ice cream in the mangonada was super yum, creamy, and fresh! And the Esquites definitely had a kick. I've heard they have great tacos too, so will be going back for that :)

This is hands down the best place in Lafayette. The food is delicious, the ice cream is so good, but above all that the people are great. They are so friendly and they are willing to modify anything for you. Example, I love empanadas and especially their empanadas locas, I asked one time if it was possible to get them but without frying them. Sure enough they were able to get me the filling in smaller tortillas. Another example, I like to get the escamocha which is a huge bowl of fresh fruit that is covered in crema, but one day (10 pounds later) I decided I want to have it without the cream. Sure enough I get the beautiful bowl of fresh cut fruit with no cream. The reason I appreciate all that is because I've been to all type of restaurants around here and I don't dare to change a thing. I usually would get the "we can't do that", "we don't do that", "that will be extra but also not the way you want it".

Bottom line, best place and best people ever . The best coconut ice cream too can't forget to say that.

Mango Loco is a pretty nondescript storefront in a small corner strip mall. There are entrances to the parking lot on both Sagamore parkway and Greenbush street.

Given the relative unimpressiveness of the exterior, the inside was very nice. Fresh looking paint. A drop ceiling without stains and holes. A nicely appointed wall splitting the dining are from the kitchen area. Tables that didn't wobble....I gotta be honest, I expected the decor to be "shithole mexican" but it was really nice.

Service was not too fast, but not too slow. Really nice guy serving and I glimpsed a woman who i think was doing the cooking, so having two employees is already a step up on some small Mexican restaurants I've patronized around town.

I ordered Chicharrones Preparados, a mixed (pork and cheese) Pupusa, Steak Tostada, Marinated Pork Sope.

The Chicharrones Preparados was pretty bad. Mind you, I think they did the item right, but I was thinking it was a big pork rind with stuff on top from what I saw on the menu. Turns out it is a big fake pork rind, topped with stuff, that is also topped with pickled/soft pork rinds. The soft pork rinds just did not work for me. Swing and a miss.

Pupusa was very soft, had a good sauce with it and was filling. Pretty bread-y, FYI.

Steak Tostada was the best item. Very crunchy tortilla, nice tomato slice covered in Mexican cheese sprinkles and an avocado slice all with some crema and lettuce. Excellent item.

The sope was also very good. The marinated pork (aka Al Pastor) had pineapple chunks in it which surprised me. I didn't dislike it, just surprising. Overall the item was delicious.

No chips and salsa were served at 11:30 a.m.

Price-wise this place is very cheap. $16 after tax for an appetizer, three small items & and a side.  

My daughter enjoyed her rice, but the beans were pretty weird. A combo of whole pinto beans in a sauce of refried beans. Not good.

Mango Loco is worth a try. I was leaning towards three stars, but because of how cheap their food is, I went with four.
The waitress was very nice but I didn't get a milk shake like I had ordered I had gotta chocolate mink

Amazing authentic Hispanic food. I had a papusa, empanadas, and tostadas. None of the food was greasy. I had a to go order and it was made in a timely manner. The salsas and sauces that come with the food were not too spicy.

this place is by far my favorite Mexican restaurant in Lafayette!!! it don't matter how busy they are since the place is quite small..I will always wait for a table..the owners are so friendly and they cook with love...they've always treated me good every time I go there....Mango Loco you guys rock!

I have been looking for a real Mexican Restaurant in the Lafayette/ West Lafayette area.  I think I have finally found it.  It is almost across the street from Taco Rico's, on the corner of Greenbush and Sagamore Parkway in the strip mall there.

No I can not say that much yet, because I went with my two daughters for their Friday Taco deal.  The tacos are now $1.25, up from $1.00 like they were a year ago.

I had three tacos, a beef, pork and chicken.  The all were very, very good.  In fact they are the best Mexican food I have had anywhere in this area.  My daughter had the enchiladas, and they were good, but not as good as the tacos. One of my daughters had some lemonade which was very good, and the other had a mango milkshake, which was out of this world. 

After being there for a while, I realized I had finally found the right place.  The entire time we were there, we were the only people there who had not been born in Mexico, or some other Hispanic country that had come in. 

I am looking forward to going back, and trying some of the other things they have, but it is going to be hard to stay away on Fridays for their great tacos at a fantastic price.

My Mexican friend recommended me this place a few months ago, and we have been here for several times. The food quality is consistently good, and my friend told me the style is very Mexican. The ice cream there is delicious and homemade.  The price is also very reasonable. The owners are nice persons and we really enjoy our time here!

Authentic Mexican food! I just recently moved to Indiana from NC and I'm sooooo happy I found this place! Good customer service! Everyone is very friendly and they make sure you get your food quick! On top of all that, the food is AMAZING!!!!

Went here for Friday Tacos. Price is no longer $1. They're $1.50, so I opted for the steak burrito ($6.99) and mangonada ($5.99). My boyfriend got the steak torta ($5.50). The burrito was huge and delicious. Better than most Mexican restaurants I've been to. The mangonada had too much chamoy for me but still good flavor. If you're looking for some nice burritos/tortas, this is a nice little place. Service is friendly!

The $6 burrito is both massive and delicious. The rest of the menu is a good value as well. Note that this place is a favorite among the local Mexican community, so the food is probably close to authentic. Service is slow, even when not crowded.

great friendly service
have had tacos burritos
empanadas
and a variety of fruit smoothies
all excellent
may be the best mexican in the state
however i have been sitting in parking lot for half hour past  scheduled opening
no one here.
a lady pulled up in a van and said this is the second time this happened to her?????????????

Went there for the first time today with a friend because they have this special where it is $1 Taco on Fridays. They had chicken, beef, and pork tacos and it comes with a mild sauce and a hot sauce with some limes. I would said these are better tacos than you would get at Taco Bell. It is also freshly cooked. They also have various flavor of ice cream and drinks to serve. I tried this mix with a mix of ice cream, semi-sour sauce, and chill pepper...which is fair...depending on your taste, though I would say the sour sauce kind of drown the taste of the ice cream.

reviews.text: I happened by this place during my daily social-distancing walk. They have a window for to-go baked good pickups! I grabbed a Lafayette Sourdough boule, which isn't the sourest version I've ever had but is great texture and has a nice crunch.

I can't overstate my love for Smitty Bread. It's by far my favorite bakery in Lafayette/West Lafayette. The location is just a bit outside of downtown on 4th street but not too bad if you're used to going to the market downtown on Saturdays. 

The bread here is on point. The sourdoughs are amazing but my go to is the baguette. It's got a great crumb on the outside but nice and chewy on the inside.  At $4 a loaf, it is a great affordable price point.

Don't forget their croissants either. I had the opportunity to have one of their fresh baked almond croissant right out of the oven and it was perfect.

This place is worth making a trip to Lafayette alone and is a great bakery in the community. You can also find them at the the local farmers markets .

I had a delicious sandwich here and amazing chocolate croissants! So excited to have a bakery in town. I look forward to trying out more of their bread--especially their sourdough. 

Bonus: There is a discount on day-old bread and pastries. Still delicious, and will save you a bit of cash!

Two words: almond croissant. This place is delicious. So many pastries and breads literally made while you can watch. They put so much care in each thing they make, which is why it's a little pricey, but worth it.
Bread is amazing! Best sourdough ever. The marquis is our favorite. Pastries are delicious too. Cute little place with big taste.

This place rocks! There aren't enough superlatives to describe how great the breads and pastries are. If you know about this place yet haven't come by, shame on you! If you are just hearing about Smitty Bread, get in here and  see what the hype is.

Stopped in here and I was not disappointed. I got the special of the day. Rueben sandwich, chips, pickle spear and tomato soup. I added a bottle coke and it was only $11 for everything. Defiantly worth every cent. The sandwich is toasted with their rye bread and melted the cheese so perfectly. I got a chocolate croissant for breakfast tomorrow. My co worker I was with had one while we were there and he said it was amazing.

This would be my fave if it were in Paris.  It's very good, particularly in the area of baguettes, sourdough breads, and croissants.  On their bread i suggest that if they don't have what you want in stock, ask about it as they often have some frozen stock (which is just as good).  We often get them to slice the bread for us there, or warm some pastries for us to eat there.  

It's telling that their clientele is often european.  They also sell at area farmer's markets.

Friendly bakery with a great selection of sourdoughs, croissants and pretzels. They also serve sandwiches, toasts, and coffee.

I enjoyed visiting with a friend over cappuccinos. We also picked up some day old bread. The Italian loaf I brought home was a perfect accompaniment to bruschetta.

I need to come back and try their croissants!

I heard about this place from a friend who said that I should stop next time I'm in town. I bought Pain au chocolat, almond croissant, and rye bread. They were all delicious, but I loved the almond croissant.

The best bread in Indiana, bar none. Smittybread is a bakery on par with what you would find in any Hipster capital in the country.

Discovering this bakery absolutely changed my attitude towards living in Indiana, and is a worth the drive from anywhere in the region. Anyone driving through Lafayette should absolutely stop. Those living local should make them their go to for all of your bread needs.

Smittybread specializes in sourdough and has a decidedly French take on bread. Their baguettes are some of the best I've ever had, as good as those I've had in France. My favorite is taking a bite off of still warm baguette before I even make it out the door, a baguette that never even makes it home. Your taste buds, your friends, and your friend's taste buds, will thank you for checking out Smitybread.

A relatively new bakery in Lafayette. Smittybread offers flakey, buttery baked goods. From ham and cheese croissants to reuben sandwiches, they offer a large variety of freshly baked goods. The morning buns are especially good. They also offer baguettes and other freshly baked breads. We haven't tried much of their stuff but everything we have tried was delicious. I look forward to future visits when we can try their lunch sandwiches.

My wife and I are a heavy user of this bakery. We had many kinds of breads from this bakery at the farmer's market in Purdue campus and the store in Lafayette. All breads are decent so you can choose any breads you want. They will not disappoint you. A masterpiece of this bakery is a Croissant, which is the best Croissant in Indiana from my perspective. I strongly recommend it.

We found Smittybread by googling "things to do in Lafayette".  We're always looking for off-the-beaten-path places to go and experience.  Smittys did not disappoint.  The baguette and sour dough bread we bought was very good.  We got sandwiches for later, and they were good as well.  The staff was super friendly and genuine.  We were traveling in our RV, in route from Chicago to Florida.  We would stop here again.
Best bread in town. Amazing! Also, they serve croissants, danishes, burgers etc. Very good coffee as well.

best bread in town! we needed some real baguettes!! 

i've tried every pastry and most of the breads and never been disappointed. favorites are chocolate and plain croissants (& asiago/swiss if i make it in time!). in general the pastries are only as sweet as you'd want them to be. the olive bread is my favorite of the breads but if you want a sample of any bread just ask! everything freezes well but i've had the bread out for a week and it's still plenty tasty.

I am so happy this place is here. I just bought my first (and definitely not last) Smitty baguette today. It is absolutely delicious. Reminiscent of baguettes I've had in France!!

My husband started making baguettes because we couldn't find any decent ones in Lafayette. He can happily put that hobby to rest now that Smittybread is here!!!

It made for delicious sandwiches!! Just perfect!!!!

Best baked goods and bread within a 70 mile radius. As good as anything in San Francisco or Boston. Sourdough or baguettes are fantastic. Brioche morning buns and danish too. Great sandwiches for lunch. Smallish seating area. Prices reasonable.
Great crispy croissant!! All is so good. Now lafayette area has good pastry shop. Almond croissant is superior.
The danish and croissants are some of the best I've ever had! I have to stop in every time I drive by.

reviews.text: Amazing spot for late night hang outs and a good drink. The appetizers are on point and the staff is attentive. Love the location right by the bridge to West Lafayette and they even have outdoor seating, which is awesome in the summertime!

Cozy pub with a lot of locals. 

Staff is good and personable. 

Wings are great, Just be aware buffalo sauce is a soy sauce and they call buffalo sauce "lambo" sauce. Wing Monday is fun.

Great place to eat and get a drink. Very lively atmosphere a bit of a Canadian vibe which usually isn't my style but I really love the restaurant at the same time. Would definitely recommend. Also not a fan of totchos but I would get them here again.

Good food, great service & fair prices. My teenage son and I were looking for a good dinner in downtown Lafayette. Sgt Preston's isn't trendy, but the food is delicious and the servers are very friendly and attentive. We had the black and bleu ribeye special; the steak was perfectly cooked, tender and delicious. We also had the wings which come in three flavors and are really good. There's a large outdoor area and a really old
school bar inside.
If you not a regular service is horrible.   Bartender was great. Our server could care less.   Hard to gain locals with service like this.  Maybe a name tag so I can join the party.
Food is mediocre and people at one table yelled so loud it was unbearable.  Couldn't enjoy my food or talk with the people I was with so left.
Terrible service and customer service is pathetic. Would not recommend anything about this place. It has been this way everything J have tried the place.

Old fashioned in the right ways, nothing fancy, plain white buns, good sized menu with a few neat extras like brisket chili (which I had and got a hankering to get more), festooned interior tidied up like a 50s Canada movie. Am I talking funny? I think it's affected me. Friendly and unhurried staff that brought out food fast for how easy going this place is. We three guys enjoyed small smattering of plates with a fun cheesy app. It's a great balance of predictable fare and slight twists with homemade stuff here and there. Surprising location in the heart of the river city, surely this place gets way busy on weekend but a nice late Sunday night dinner hit the spot. I'll be bringing more friends next time!
Delicious food and friendly, excellent service. The steak sandwich was delightful with the horseradish sauce.

Definitely a four star bar.  Not sure why Sgt Preston's average is at or above.  Unique place in a bar crowded area.  Loved their food and atmosphere.  Marble bar top with a wooden rail.  Large wraparound wooden bar stools that sit over a tiled floor and brass foot rail.  Tiled ceiling and a very interesting, fun back bar with brick, bottle shelves, and a great stained glass header.  Yeah there are lots of choices in the area, but don't skip Sgt Preston's.
reviews.reviewerLocation: Corona Del Mar, Newport Beach, CA

reviews.text:
Came here on a week night with friends and coworkers.

Easy to find tables as the indoor space is large.  Interior is dated but that's the charm.

Menu is quite expansive for a bar and prices reasonable especially with the daily specials offered.

Parking is great as they have their own lot in downtown for free.

Service was quite kind and friendly.  I would come back if the furniture was a bit more comfortable and roomy.  

Nothing too special about it as there are over a dozen bars within a three mile radius.

Great place for drinks. 

Went here for drinks one night. The patio area in the back looks like a fantastic place to sit, except it was chock-a-block full of people. So we ended up sitting by the bar with our drinks. Their strong island is a great drink (and cheap!), servers were friendly and quick with our drinks. Would definitely recommend.
Great local pub where the food is as good as the atmosphere.    Wide variety of both food choices, beer and alcohol.

Nothing fancy. The folks are friendly.  Older building and outside seating overlooking a parking lot and train tracks. 
Very casual.

Sweet place in downtown LaFayette IN. Very chill And cool ambiance sitting outside. (Lots of outdoor spots!). This is pub food and drinks. The food menu and drinks are actually pretty extended and there is plenty of choice of everyone! We were on a business trip and they say 20 of us outside which was perfect. 
Waitresses were very nice, helpful and patient. 
Good downtown spot!
reviews.reviewerLocation: South Jordan, Salt Lake City, UT

reviews.text: Three of us ate before show at Long Civic Theatre.  Two Prime Rib specials which were correctly cooked and very good. The dressings for salad and Horshradish sauce are made in house. Service was attentive, but food a little slow. Was nice day for patio, but it is exposed to western sky (fyi)

I've seen better, but it's not terrible. The decor is very interesting if you are interested in something that looks vaguely old-timey/early-1900s. The outdoor seating area would be nice if you had something to see other than an overpass. 

I don't think they carded anyone - all twenty-something year olds - at my table though we ordered alcohol, which is fine by me, but if I were the owners, I would be a bit concerned about that, because their servers could be easily serving alcohol to minours. 

My main complaint is the food - seems a little overpriced for the portion sizes. I ordered a buffalo burger, rare, but what I got was definitely medium-well - no pink anywhere to be found. Still edible of course, but those things show that there are some issues with service and the kitchen.

Very good experience. The beer choices were good and the food was great. Tried the stuffed shrimp and you can tell they were made in house. Great flavor and it came with several sides and soup. Soup was also homemade.  Well worth the trip!

Who would ever want a conventional buffalo sauce on their chicken wings! Boring! 

Luckily I don't have to worry about that here!
First time here pretty good beer selections variety of food selection from tacos pork tenderloins burgers soups salads.Great service would come back and give it another try

reviews.text: This is the easiest review I have ever written, Tick Tock is the ultimate and easy fun value meals in an unassuming common grounds environment. It's not in a great location but that adds a bit to the country vibes. Us three guys were served up immediately having to take a good moment to look over the huge menu and observe the many creative and fantastic ideas, reuben omelet!? Well ok! We went for the good stuff as my photos show, breakfast burrito and eggs benedict too. I have to commend these people on wonderful attention to giving proper good eats at fair prices that combined with quality easy heating entrees makes for the most universal restaurant in the area. This is the place for anyone, anytime! We will definitely be back for me to sample the whole menu by year's end. I loved the chili, my buddy ravaged the burrito, and the corned beef wasn't messed up at all as too common for small homely spots to do. Made for a mouthwatering original omelet tho we felt the thousand island could better serve a drizzle inside along with the beef and sauerkraut. The atmosphere features the usual TVs for a few games and large bar but twas too early for us to sample. We noticed a good assortment of cars in the parking lot from a newer BMW Z4 with the twin turbo inline 6 to a Smart car further adding to my opinion this is a spot for everyone! Will be back very soon!
Excellent food, great locally owned establishment!!! Highly recommended for any meal.

Nice sized dining area. This is a 21+ only place so there really isn't a bar area - it's the whole place. They stopped allowing smoking in there a while ago, and I couldn't really smell the residue either. They also had a really nice outdoor seating area in front of the bar. Not sure if that's a smoking section or just standard seating. 

I ordered the six buffalo wing appetizer & breaded tenderloin sandwich with waffle fries. 

Food was served on metal trays. I thought that was a great divey touch. Wings tasted pretty good, though very light on the sauce. They are seasoned well so even without much sauce I enjoyed these. Ranch was not great.

Tenderloin sandwich was head-sized as expected. I suspect they marinate it nicely before breading and cooking, because this was very juicy and flavorful. Tiny tomato on top, but again, that's expected. You just don't get many toppings on tenderloin sandwiches. 

Possibly the best (of many) tenderloin I've had in town. Waffle fries were overcooked, but still ok.

If you're interested in eating bar food, this is a good option and I would recommend trying it out. Prices are reasonable. 10% check-in coupon on Yelp right now, though you should mention that to your server when you arrive - mine brought the bill before I could do so.

I like Tick Tock a bunch and given how busy they usually are lots of other folks do too. I visit about once a week or so, usually at lunch.  Menu has lots of midwest diner choices and they have lunch specials pretty much every day.  Nothing fancy, just good food at a fair price.  If you like breaded pork tenderloins they make a pretty good one so give it a try.

I forget this place exists but they serve pretty good bar food. Visited on 08/20/18 later in the evening and was able to sit outside in their new outdoor space. This was nice and the weather was decent. There's just something I love about eating outdoors in nice weather!
Service was quick at first. It wasn't ever bad, just a little slower than I expected. Server was super sweet though!!!!
Did you know you can order breakfast all day here?!?! Yep! That's what my friend ordered. Personally I got a cheeseburger and thought it was a little over cooked. I suppose it's better to have that than undercooked! Absolutely LOVED the fries!!!
I really liked my experience and plan to visit again.

I came here because of the high reviews, and was extremely displeased with the service and food. First, our waitress made it seem like she was too busy or that we were inconveniencing her by coming in. Then, after we placed our order, we waited 40 minutes just to receive our food. 

I asked for hash browns with onions, and I received hash browns with raw onions sprinkled on top? We ordered 1 Bloody Mary and received two, which was fine because I was willing to drink it, but it was made with some cheap vodka and just wasn't that good.

Overall just not as great as I had hoped. Having one server and one person in the kitchen may not be normal, maybe we just came on the wrong day? But I definitely will not be coming back anytime soon.

Awesome pub! Great beer specials! $5 bud pitchers everyday $2 bud light and buds on Monday and Wednesday and half price apps on Monday and Wednesday! Awesome hangout and patio! Also nice that it's smoke free!

The Tick Tock has been around for decades as a dive bar, but it has been expanded, updated, and is now smoke-free. I went there today for what may have been the first time - certainly the first time in as long a time as it takes to forget. I was there with a very large group of close to 20 people. And the Tick Tock was short one server! Remarkably, our server did as well as expected. A couple of minor mix-ups but nothing concerning. I ordered the classic breaded tenderloin sandwich, the barometer by which all dive bars in Indiana are measured. The tenderloin itself was too large for the bun as is required. It came hot and the tenderloin was delicious. It was the rest where the sandwich fell apart, literally. There was one small slice of tomato and a bit of lettuce. I put mayo on the bun and it fell apart immediately when I picked it up. I upgraded to waffle fries with cheese. There really wasn't much cheese to even notice, although the waffle fries were crisp. Luckily it costs only pennies to upgrade the fries. Many of my dining companions ordered the chicken and noodles which comes poured over a scoop of mashed potatoes as most Hoosiers prefer. They raved about the homemade-like noodles. One diner asked for an order to go but it was sold out! It must be a Thursday special because it's not on the menu. Go for lunch on Thursday and go early if you hope to get any. I was happy enough with the food, the company, and the service to consider returning. And the prices are dirt cheap.

I have been coming to Tick Tock for over a year. Each time I visit they live up to my expectations. Their menu is full of classic breakfast options as well as creative dishes, and everything I've tried has been delicious. They even have Triple XXX Root Beer on tap!! This place is a hidden gem of Lafayette!

The breaded mushrooms were really good but the impossible burger was probably one of the worst things I have ever had in my life. Smelled and tasted like mold, could not even finish it. I have had many impossible burgers and veggie burgers in general in this was by far the worst. Disappointed bc once again, mushrooms were great. But that was $10.99 wasted on soggy inedible food.

Great place for breakfast! The tick tock shuffle is $3.95 for a half order with toast (extra for the gravy) but some worth it! It's a pile of food almost a Western skillet with hash browns and sausage added to it! A lot of food for the money! Another dollar gets you a full order. 

Nice staff and a decent bar/ restaurant venue inside. When I come back to Lafayette I have to stop back in for a full order next time!

Got my meal delivered with hungry boiler and it was really not worth it.  The sausage gravy had no flavor except for maybe salt and pepper.  The sausage gave to taste to it.  The  BLT was flavorless also.  How do you make bacon flavorless?  This is my second time trying them and they don't get a third chance.

Awesome breakfast! Not a single complaint- very good! Prices are great! Can't wait to try the tenderloin! 
BONUS: love Dawn the waitress- what a sweetheart!!!!

Update-Tried the tenderloin-omg LOVED it!!!!!  the grinder is awesome too- loaded with meat! My friend got the breakfast burrito and it is HUGE!!!! One request would be to make "homemade" Ranch. Met more of the waitresses the last few times I've been there and all of them are good!

My wife and I are non smokers and have not eaten in a smoking establishment in years.  Unless your senses are numbed from being around it, you'll smell it as soon as you walk in the door.  The more crowded it got, the more smoke we could smell.  We ate quickly and left.  Too bad.  We like to support local diners.  Apparently people come here because they are allowed to smoke.  I thought there was a state law forbidding it, but this place must fit a loophole.  In the plus side, service was fast, friendly and food was cheap but great.

We really like this place.  Food is good, service is fast and friendly, awesome dinner specials, breakfast is phenomenal.  The only complaint I would have is they still allow smoking.  Maybe if they limited smoking to the end of the room where the bar is it might help.  But the good definitely outweighs the bad.  If you absolutely can't handle the smoke, call and order something to go.  You won't regret it!

Tried this place out on advice from people at work. It's in a weird location and they allow smoking. Burgers and onion rings were good, but nothing to write home about. And the atmosphere? Let's just say it was like having dinner at a retirement home. We were the only two in there under 50, awkward.
You have to try the tenderloin! Very affordable, great service! Waitress made me feel right at home. Will return! Smokey at times 21+ only.
Great Food! Breakfast is very good, Best Biscuits & Gravy I've had since moving to Lafayette. Breaded Tenderloin for Lunch is very good, it will not leave you hungry. It is 21+ only, and smokey.

reviews.text:
Yes Yes Yes! 

I have lived in Crawfordsville, IN for 19 years and have been back and forth to Lafayette so many times. I moved to Baltimore, MD over 10 years ago and continue to come back and forth to see family and friends in Indiana. During a visit this past week to Lafayette to see a friend, he took me to the diner. I had no idea it existed and I wish I had a long time ago. 

We walked in, were asked to sit on a specific side of the diner due to COVID. We happily found a booth, sat down, and had one of the diner servers come over, dropped off menus and quickly asked what we wanted to drink. I'm from the east coast now and am very used to quick and rapid service but wasn't ready for that kind of rapid answer. I was thrown off guard, no worries though. I was able to just quickly get a coffee ordered and thumb through the breakfast menu. 

I ordered coffee and a bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich. After about 1 minute, coffee arrived, five minutes later, here comes the sandwich, which was awesome! After about 15 - 20 minutes of enjoying quick breakfast, my friend and I paid our $5.00 for coffee and sandwiches each and headed out. 

BIG take-aways for me:
- Quick service
- COVID friendly (at that time) with masks worn by all
- Spacing out of all customers
- VERY cost friendly with great food! 

Thank you for a positive first experience at the diner. I definitely will be visiting again when I come back.

A great hole in the wall diner!

We love going here for dinner or breakfast food.  I highly recommend the pancakes.  They are by far the best around and even better with adding blueberries.  Sometimes I will even get the breakfast with pancakes for dinner!  They also have very good homemade pies.

The prices are reasonable and wait staff has been very friendly in all my experiences.  It has a great small town diner atmosphere to it.  The seating is a bit limited so they could do with a bigger dining area.  With the current covid precautions, this may even be more apparent.  They do carry out service so that is always an option too.

Next time you have a taste for some pancakes, try out southside diner!

The food is excellent. In fact, it was so good that I wasn't even mad that part of my delivery was missing. I ordered soup, a sandwich, and a slice of pie. Somehow the sandwich was not in the bag nor was it written on the ticket. I essentially paid approximately $25 for soup and pie. And it was so good I wasn't even mad lol

This review is based on COVID handling, which was beyond bad. The food was delicious, but my friend and I should not have stayed to eat here. The place was horribly packed, staff not wearing masks over noses, no social distancing and they were on a wait with people piled up. They took my number to call me when a table was ready. The girl took my number down wrong so we waited for 20 minutes outside for nothing.

They were over ran with Togo and Grubhub orders, so people inside were waiting an hour for food. An hour wait for some over easy eggs is just sad. Server was sweet and apologetic for the slow experience, but total with the wait, we were there for 2 hours. That's insane. Toilet was leaking all over bathroom floor and pie. Awe was filled with uncovered pies that looked nasty. Only reason for two stars was a nice server and food tasted good when we finally got it. Avoid this place during COVID!

Everything was very good - all left full.  Service was friendly and good.
Flat fries were great - burger was also good
Breakfast all day!  Service is fast and servers are friendly. Highly recommend for breakfast, lunch or dinner.

The food is fine, but please welcome your customers, not just "you can sit there" while pointing at the table with your finger and for God's sake CLEAN your high chairs! Do you realize they are for babies/kids? The one we got today had food and old food stains all over it, so disgusting and rude, it's impossible for the waitress not to notice... In most restaurants the waiter or anyone else would clean the high chair to give it to you.

It's the little things that set the stage for a great experience or a lack luster disappointment. For starters the greeting, Southside flunks by leaving costumers waiting awkwardly by the door while the staff bustles around. The "hostess" greeted customers from the back of the room or second seating area with a menu waving come here motion. No good morning, hello, welcome to Southside. Second the booth we were sat at had a tear in the seat that was the size of a small child (picture attached). The booth was positioned where I had 24" between myself and the table edge as was my wife's side which made for an uncomfortable sitting on the edge of the booth. I'm 6'4" and 290lbs and there was room for another me between me and the table. Third, the table had a wobble that spilled our drinks this prompting a sweet and low shimming. The server was very friendly but absent minded. We asked for more cream when we were served our coffee and waters and explained we needed a little more time to peruse the menu. Server returned 10 minutes later to ask for our order, still no cream for my wife to doctor her coffee to her liking. A reminder was provided and she promptly retrieved some.

I had the philly cheese omelette no green peppers with American cheese, home fries and a single biscuit and gravy. My wife ordered the breakfast platter and a single pancake. The food was not bad but nothing to brag about. Home fries void of flavor and came out cold. Omelette was cooked to a rubbery texture and the biscuits and gravy was horrible. Gravy was bland and biscuit seemed stale needing a knife to hack through it. My wife's over easy eggs were cooked well but same home fries and back was cold and chewy. Pancake was good from my wife's perspective, I tried and wouldn't order if we were to return. I salvaged my home fries thanks to the cholula hot sauce which I love. If it was food alone I would rate it a 2.5 out of 5. 

The booth adjacent to ours we learned as we dined was a either a previous employee or a current off duty employee. Her waitress was not ours and neither of them was capable of keeping their tone down or mouths shut as they both openly railed about one of the owners (female). It was very unprofessional to listen to. 

So there you have it. Despite having a friendly but absent minded waitress ourselves the remainder of the staff from my perspective was non attentive to their tables or busy flirting with the bus boy. No one seemed to be in charge. We waited but did not receive. Copy of our tab at any time to review, even at check out it was waiting to get up and not have my back side in someone's face due to the cramped setting. 

My suggestion is whomever owns the Southside should get a full time manager to regain control of the staff and if you were there the morning of 12/21/19 you should be ashamed of your staff.

Came here over the lunch hour, and half the dining area was closed off so they could mop. I sorta get it, cuz the floors everywhere were DISGUSTING. Food, silverware, trash - all over the floors. We were a party of 5, and no table could accommodate us (except the side they closed off). They wanted to cram us into a small booth and pull up a chair. Those tables are barely big enough for 4, let alone a 5th. 

I'll never go here again, in favor of place that isn't a literal garbage dump, who cares about customers and bringing in revenue, and is competent enough to know not to close half the place over a Saturday lunch hour.

Really great food and great service. They were really busy (which is always a good sign), but we never felt like we were waiting. Menu has lots of options; classic favorites as well as interesting choices. I highly recommend the chorizo hash! Also I have a good allergy and they were good about making sure my food didn't have any cross contamination. Really impressed with this place. Will be back soon!
This is the best restaurant I've ever been to, great service. The food was perfect and tasted so good! This is probably my favorite diner in town. Their pies are the best!

I love this place for breakfast. The service is attentive and fast. Your coffee cup won't go empty. Their fried biscuits are delicious. The prices are also very reasonable. It's about the same cost as a fast food breakfast, and this is a hundred times better.

Really good place to go, much larger than you initially realize! Well-priced and quick service! The French toast is done from what looks like baguette bread which threw me off initially, but the omelettes are definitely a selling point! Huge and well-filled!
Good food and fairly fast service considering the large crowd. We sat at the counter. Our food was breakfast omlettes tasty and well cooked I would eat here again.
COFFEE REVIEW: This is the second time I have been here. I love the small home town feel and service is great , the coffee is so so ,but pretty cheap.

It would be so easy to pass by this place and not think much of it because it's mixed in with some other places and easy to miss. You won't want to miss this hidden gem because their food is really good. We especially love the breakfast. If you like omelette be sure to try the spicy omelette - so good! Their French toast isn't traditional style and it is very good so give that a try also!

The atmosphere is a typical diner. Reminds me of Mary Ann's in Normal, IL. We were able to seat ourselves and the place was pretty clean. My booth seat was kind of broken though. I ordered the country fried steak breakfast with a coffee. It was good, but average. The scrambled eggs were flat and not the best I've had. I definitely enjoyed the biscuits and gravy though! The hash browns were good as well. These two were probably my favorite parts of the meal. The waitresses were nice and efficient. Overall, I wasn't blown away and this probably won't be my go-to breakfast spot, but it was nice to try.

Closed off half the dining area to mop during lunch hour and the remaining seating was just too tight for our party of 5. I used to love this place but there was trash and silverware all over the floors and the booth they suggested was a bit filthy. I will not be returning. I will also encourage all of my fellow Subaru associates not to return as well. Disgusting
Great breakfast spot! Reminds me of a small town diner! They have everything!!! My personal favorite is the breakfast steak quesadilla!
Awesome pancakes...best ones in Lafayette. Eggs are good and service is fast; biscuits and gravy is also good. Sausage is kind of chewy, but great place for breakfast food!!
