Photo of Dog N Suds - West Lafayette, IN, United States. Would you just look at that

reviews.text:
I've been wanting to actually go to a Dog-N-Suds drive in for awhile. I've drunk their bottled root beer a lot for a good portion of my life now and it's one of my favorites. So when we were visiting Lafayette, Indiana at Purdue for UC/Purdue game I saw we were close to one and we had to go try it. 

It's actually still an old school drive in. We pulled up, read the menu. Hit a button on the speaker, a girl took our order. Then she ran out on a tray, asked me to roll my window down a decent amount and stuck the tray with all our yummy food on it on my window. 

We ordered a Coney Dog basket and two super Root Beer Floats. Easily the best Root Beer Floats we've ever had. Big frosted mugs. Pure perfection. The Coney was super good too. I actually liked the chili on the Coney a lot. The crinkle fries that came with the basket were typical crinkle fries. They weren't bad at all they just...were crinkle fries. 

We flipped the switch on the speaker and the girl came back out and got our tray. Then we headed back to Cincy with some delicious food in our stomachs. Next time we're back I'll defiantly be stopping back and hitting up Dog-N-Suds again.

Not bad considering the COVID rules. Food was quick, they got it right and gave us an extra sandwich (BONUS). We were disappointed we didn't get our frozen mug root beers and couldn't eat in our cars and had to leave. But we understand the precautions and are just thankful they were still serving food and the same quality we have grown to love!

First time here and it was fast and really good! Only complaint is that the root beer had almost no carbonation which was a bummer but still had good flavor. The burgers and hot dogs are simple which makes them delicious. Will definitely come back!

Talk about hot dogs and yum!

I have been meaning to come to Dog N Suds for way too long and after finally going this afternoon, I am happy to announce that it is worth going to. Similar to a Sonic, you have the option to drive up into a parking spot and order your meal and have it brought out to your car. This is not my favorite way to eat, but for those who enjoy that, Dog N Suds is the place for you in the Greater Lafayette area.

If that doesn't strike your fancy, they have a little pavilion spot for you to sit and eat at if you'd prefer, which is what I will probably do in the future.

The food is what you'd expect. It wasn't mind-blowing or anything, but it was enjoyable for what we wanting and expecting. The service was prompt too in ordering and coming to get your tray if you are eating from your car.

Now get out there and enjoy a tasty hot dog and some delicious root beer while it's hot as heck out here in the Midwest.

Ugh.   I don't understand the attraction of this place.   The service is subpar and the food terrible.    You either eat in your car or on their patio.

You don't even have the option to order face-to-face with someone.   If you're not ordering from your vehicle, you have to walk to the lone ordering station and scream into a fuzzy speaker.

And of course they don't get your order right.   We ordered a cheeseburger that came out with no cheese.    Instead of having one of the cooks remake the burger, the waitress comes back holding a cold square slice of cheese and hands it to us.

?!?

Always a fave when I am able to stop in at one of these. Nostalgia from when I was little with my parents. Had the kraut dog, which was wonderful. The breaded mushrooms disappointed. Soggy and lacking in any flavor. 
The root beer float stole the show as always
You just can't beat the coney cheese dogs- a forever classic!  And that ice-cold root beer........

My family lives close to this restaurant, so we decided to take a trip in and eat under the outside pavilion. It took 8 minutes from the time we pressed the button for orders to get someone to take our order which was not impressive. We got foot longs with coney sauce which were good, but the shrimp basket is nothing but frozen shrimp from Sam's club ( tasting) and then dumped in a basket with mediocre coleslaw. 

Our food while good, was not good enough to warrant another trip anytime soon. Especially if you are ordering outside.

If you haven't had Dog N Suds before you are truly missing out. In high school and a couple years of college I worked at Dog N Suds, I would still eat here every day if I could  I think that says a lot since I worked here and would still eat here. Every time I go back to Lafayette I make sure I stop at Dog N Suds. You have to try a root beer in a mug, make sure to order a Large to get the mug. You can also get baby root beers in a mug too! I would suggest a foot long coney cheese dog, I like to add onions and mustard to mine. Their shrimp basket is delicious. I also enjoy the coney cheese burger. If you get fries or onion rings make sure you ask for the special sauce, it's a mix of mayo and mustard and is sweet and delicious! If you like ice cream you can't go wrong with a root beer float or a freeze, the only difference is they blend the root beer float for a freeze. I love Dog N Suds and will always be a fan!

My first driving experience ever was in the west suburbs of Illinois I was probably seven years old and was fantastic since then no root beer has never matched what dog and suds can provide.  always five stars! I need to order it in the iced mug,  so do not get it to go .  Coney dogs are excellent, they have sort of a chili sauce flavor to them and can't be beat,  burgers are good,  hotdogs are good,  this place is from the past and as I've stated many times I love old Americana how can you beat a drive in? This was a happy find!

I like the setup outside. The picnic area is pretty clean. The other customers were very friendly. I ordered the boilermaker burger and a root beer float. The food was hot and delicious. This was my first time in West Lafayette and Dog N Suds helped make my experience pleasant.

How I miss the smell of chili dogs hitting my face as I roll down the window. It tickles my nostalgic senses when I'm back in my old stomping grounds to make a sentimental stop at my favorite drive-in. I just press the little red button, and get ready to be served. 

My D&S Checklist:
- Start off by ordering some D&S famous root beer in a frosty glass. The stuff that makes you go "Ah!" after taking a big swig. 
- Drink it. 
- Order another one to-go.
- Next, order a footlong coney dog and a tenderloin sandwich. Nothing says "Indiana girl" like a good breaded tenderloin. 
- Eat it. 
- Now, sit back, relax and order a root beer float. 
- Devour it while enjoying to some classic rock radio. 

I'm so sad that there isn't a Dog N' Suds in Indy. There are days I'm half tempted to make the 45 minute drive to get a $3 hotdog. Yes, THAT good.

Dog-n-Suds is fun for the retro gimmick.  

Unfortunately the food is cafeteria grade.  Competing burger joints are drastically better in quality.

This place is a true Lafayette classic. You must try a chili dog! The sauce has a light sweetness to it. It reminds me of a sloppy joe. It's so good! The burgers are also great and fresh tasting. Love the onion rings as they are REAL! If you haven't made a trip this summer, stop in for great food.
I love dog n suds! It's the best place to grab a great coney dog, a burger or a root beer float. I have never had a bad thing on the menu!!!

I grew up in Lafayette.  The Dog and Suds was a favorite place to go in the 50s.  Isn't it great how some things stay the same.  Thanks for preserving a piece of history.  My dad was the chef of Sarge Biltz Restaurant for more than 30 years, but he loved to stop at the Dog & Suds.

Virginia Booher Carpenter
Port Byron, IL

Ummm...  Boilermaker Basket (with onion rings instead of fries) + large Rootbeer in a frosted mug.  Done.  Seriously.  

We used to call Dog 'n' Suds by its affectionate Arf 'n' Barf nickname back in high school...  but it truly is a Lafayette classic, and I am glad it has survived the test of time.

I love the West side location, too.  Less busy and friendly staff.  Thanks for always being there when we're back in town!

Love me some dog n suds. 
Never going wrong with a classic footlong coney dog with cheese, fries and a mug of
Root beer.

This place is pretty cool.  It's like a Sonic drive-in but better.  For the longest time, they didn't accept credit cards so I didn't eat there that often.  The hot dogs are pretty good and so are the sandwiches.  However, the must get item is the root beer float.  This thing was great.  The root beer alone was pretty dang good, but adding their ice cream to it made it delicious.  The prices are fairly reasonable and the service has always been good.  Furthermore, I have never had an issue with any of the items I've ordered.  I would highly recommend coming here on a nice summer evening and enjoying a quick dinner with a root beer float to top it off.
Love it! CharcoBurgers are good for the soul! Only bad part is they've changed the fries...not good at all. Sub onion rings for a treat. Great slaw!

reviews.text: Best Mexican food I've had since moving to Indiana from California! Their red and green hot sauces have amazing flavor. I recommend the pastor huaraches! There's no indoor seating since Covid, but if you're looking for great take-out for the price, this place is it :)
My favorite tacos al pastor in Lafayette! They've been great with carry out during the covid-19 situation! Love this place!

We chose this restaurant after a long hard day. Just one of those we will give it a shot things.
If you are looking for a huge menu this isn't for you, if you are looking for outstanding food, this is for you! 
If you are looking for a bubbly overly nice owner this isn't for you, however if you are looking for a polite good person who genuinely seems to care that you like the food and that you are enjoying yourself, this is for you! 
The tacos and Burritos were AWESOME!!
We will be back!

Looked up tacos place, and this is was one of the top choices in the area. Safe to say it did not disappoint. Not only were the tacos juicy and fresh, but it was super affordable. I got all for four $10. The restaurant requires you to wear a mask upon entering to pick your food but they are also providing seating area for their customers. Will definitely be ordering again

This was a great little hole in the wall. We had the tacos combination plates. The pork (carnitas), steak (asada) and tongue (lengua) and the lengua
Huarache 

The meats were cooked to perfection. Tender and seasoned well. The corn tortillas were freshly made and didn't fall apart while eating them. The rice and beans were flavorful - nothing unique just rice and beans. Not too wet, not too dry. Not under seasoned or too spicy - just right. They offered soda in bottles and cans with no fountain drinks.

In general the restaurant is small as there are six tables for four and a bar like table for four more. It's a place when packed is crammed but the food is good and fairly priced for the generous portions.

The location is in an interestingly odd location, as it is located next to a muffler shop........ That aside, we were happy with our adventure to try this little place away from the Purdue Campus.

The place is right in the corner of the intersection and it was pretty visible. Parking was easy and had quite an amount of availability. The place was used to be a restaurant called mi cabanita which served great tacos for Lafayette standard.

I ordered al pastor, lengua, tripa and steak tacos. I really like them and I would say they are one of the best I have ever tasted in Lafayete, Indiana. I would come back if I crave a taco and defintely on a tuesday since they have a $1 al pastor tac

I wanted to check out this place because of the good reviews.  Looks like it's the spot to check out on Tuesdays for $1 al pastor tacos! 

I was impressed with how clean and modern the restaurant was.  Space is a bit tight, but I really like that they have an open kitchen and you're able to see them cook your food.  You place an order at the front, then they'll bring your food out to you. 

I went with 2 al pastor tacos since they are known for them, and 1 steak taco.  My boyfriend ordered the steak burrito, which came with chips.  Usually when we dine in at a mexican restaurant chips and salsa are provided, but not here.  We paid extra to have something to munch on before our food came out.  I was disappointed that our chips were stale and broken into smaller pieces. The salsa had a good kick to it that I enjoyed!

Luckily, my boyfriend's burrito came with chips that were better! The menu indicated that the al pastor tacos came with a slice of grilled pineapple, so I was disappointed to see that my tacos came with literally the smallest slivers of pineapple LOL it was honestly very sad. The tacos and burrito were just okay in my opinion. I've had better in town! The tortillas were a little dry. 

Verdict: Eh, I'll come back if I'm ever in the area, but there are so many other mexican restaurants I want to try in town first!

Best Al Pastor tacos in town. They are authentic, cut off the spit, just like in Mexico. They have a generous amount of meat, even on $1 Taco Tuesday. Taco Tuesday prices are for dine-in only.

We also had the chori queso, which was good, but did not have near enough chips served with it and expensive. I also didn't like the fact that they only have bottled water and plastic forks. 

The space is nicely updated and modern.

This is the BEST taco restaurant in Lafayette, IN!

My friend took me to this place that he discovered while visiting other nearby businesses. Otherwise, it's pretty hard to know about this place coming from West Lafayette.

I'm from Chicago and I've been to a handful of taco spots in the city, and I can say that these tacos are BETTER than most that I've tasted in Chicago! I've been to a few taco/Mexican restaurants in the Lafayette area and nothing comes even close to Las Brazas Taqueria in how good it is.

Everything that goes into the taco taste exceptionally fresh. The meats are very flavorful and taste as authentic as it gets. To add to that, you have a variety of sauces and hot toppings to give your food a little more kick. The servers are very courteous and helpful. Overall, the energy in the place is great too. They really like their customers too!

An easy 5/5 for this one!

Love the Pastor tacos here. Done on a spit (like gyros), friendly family run place, plus the Pastor Tacos are only $1 on tuesdays. 

You have to pay for chips and salsa (which makes sense when tacos are so cheap). Guacamole is awesome and they have marinated onions and peppers on the tables. 

Also the house made red and green sauces are very good.

This was my first time trying this spot. The previous owners of the space had the best Mexican food in town. 

The atmosphere is certainly better than it used to be! Not busy on a deal night, which shocked me. People must not know about this place! Quick service and food was insanely cheap. 4 tacos and chips and queso was less than $11! Carnitas were good, but not the best I've ever had. Al pastor was $1 each on Tuesday! Get it with the pineapple.

This cozy place is in the former Mi Gabinita space, where it was gutted and opened up. The interior has six 4-tops and a counter that seats five. The owners did a great job with the interior. There are caddys with green (mild) and red (hot) sauces.

I got the asada tacos and asada burrito. The grilled corn tortillas are a bit small, and are piled with ingredients, making a potentially sloppy meal. The asada had a slight seasoning, and was tender. The burrito was stuffed with meat, refried beans, and Mexican rice. Flavor-wise, I believe the menu was tailored for local gringo tastes, so be advised the sauces are not there for looks. Everything was good, but needed more heat. 

The service was good and friendly, with mom going about the dining room bussing and cleaning tables, and talking to the customers. As this place is small, it fills up quickly and can have the perception of being hectic. Plusses for being open late.

One of the safest things about moving from Arizona to Lafayette was the loss of delicious Mexican food. And if you get a taco from Burger King you deserve all of the bad things that will inevitably happen to you.

Months later, a friend bought everyone tacos and I couldn't believe my eyes or my taste buds. Authentic delicious Tacos Pastor,

Since then this is my number one go to spot for Mexican food in Lafayette, nothing compares,

Amazing Carne Asada, retried beans to die for,

Rice is a little bit greasy for my taste, but I'll be damned if it isn't authentic

This is my second time eating here and I am pretty positive that every single time I have to go up to Lafayette, IN for an appointment I will make sure to stop here for food.  
The first time I came here about a week and a half ago.  I was getting gas and the man at the register was eating something that smelled so good!  I asked him where his food came from and he points across the street at this restaurant.
I absolutely had to go. 
Both times now I have ordered a barbacoa burrito. The first time I ate the entire burrito and was absolutely stuffed!  This time I only ate half of it and I feel perfect.
My burrito had shredded beef, pico, letter, cheese, beans and rice with the mild sauce.  The temperature was perfect everything was Fresh and my shredded beef was tender. I really tried to branch out and try something different on the menu that I hadn't had before but I lost that game Barito all the way! From now on I'll just start checking in that way you can see how much I come back!
Terrific! Havent had a bad meal here. Tacos, burritos, tortas, you name it.

You have to get Guacamole and chips! The chicken Quesadilla was yummy could use a little more sour cream since I asked for it on the side.  Only gave about a tsp. But other than that mom said her vegetarian burrito was amazing and it was so big she took 1/2 home. All in all I highly recommend this restaurant will be coming back.
We went because it had good reviews and it is a fantastic environment and they are so nice and if you want true Mexican food this is the place

This is one of my favorite taco places in town! They have a great variety of tacos and I haven't seen one that I don't like. I learned huarache from this place and it is worth a try if you want something besides tacos. The specialties comes with a huge portion which is totally sufficient for two. The staff is always friendly as well. They deserve this high rating.

Stopped in while having my car worked on next door. Ordered a burrito with chicken, and a coke.  Burrito was huge and the coke was a genuine bottled Mexican coke.  Waitress placed two containers of sauce on the table, green and red. Tried the green but preferred the red. Nice smokey flavor, with the right amount of heat. Hadn't been in since the ownership changed, but was really pleased. Took half the burrito home to wife and she thought it was terrific.
Carne asada tacos were spot on!  Meat taste is delicious.  Tostada de Camarón (shrimp tostada) was excellent.   Only thing was the green salsa needs more heat, but tasted good.

reviews.text: Stopped by this little walk up joint because the ice cream looked amazing  and it was.  Started off with a coney dog and rings.  Coney was grilled to perfection, bun was toasted and coney sauce with a tang.  Onion rings were beer battered, but a bit greasy... but expected with most fried food.  Then a banana split for dessert.  Three piles of soft serve with hot fudge, strawberry , and pineapple toppings with a banana and covered in whip cream with nuts.  It didn't last long as it was delicious.
While the ice cream is typical of a drive-in, the malts are the way to go at Budges.  Also, your wallet will be grateful, as the prices are cheaper than a nearby Dairy Queen.

Probably one of my new favorite places in Lafayette for soft serve ice cream!! I got just a vanilla cone with rainbow sprinkles and it was so satisfying! Can't believe I just learned about this place after living in West Lafayette for so long.

An old classic! My fiancé insisted I try this place. We parked and walked on a beautiful day. Tasty burgers, sort of steak-n-shake style. Nothing fancy, but really good. Definitely a Lafayette classic! Tasty chocolate milk shake. Old drive in feel and good quality food. Give it a try!

Visited here mid afternoon today, a Wednesday. It wasn't too busy but there was a steady stream of customers.  There is plenty of parking and it is easy to get in and out of.

Ordered a Nestle Crunch flurry and a Diet Coke w/ cherry.   The service was friendly and quick and my order was just what I needed on a 90 degree day.

This place is my childhood. I don't currently live in Lafayette, so every single weekend that I come back to visit my family, I stop by for my chocolate malt. I have been going here since I was a baby, and 23 years later I still love it with all my heart. This place is the best ice cream Lafayette has to offer. Go. If you like yourself at all, stop by and give yourself some of this greatness.
My fav place for all my ice cream needs they have been around for a long time I have been coming here for 20 some years and I love it every time

Talk about heck yes. 

Established in 1942 in Lafayette and it's clear why they're still around. It's a classic diner/walk-up and order design. So if it's hot outside, be prepared to eat outside in the sweltering heat. But you will be happy you decided to dine here if you like burgers, hot dogs, corn dogs, and ice cream in one convenient place. 

Quit badgering with each other on where to eat and get to Budges, dang it.

Our family's Goto place when the weather heats up.
Two and only two reasons for coming here!
1) " The Milkshakes  "
2) "The Interesting People" from the local neighborhood:)

Best ice cream in town! The style of the drive in is super fun and the variety on the menu is great. I got the traditional chocolate vanilla twist and it was so good. It seems to be very popular around 4pm, most likely when school gets out. Lines can sometimes be long but it's definitely worth the wait!

The best Malts on the planet period. Grew up coming here on summer nights with my grandpa and recently revisited expecting nostalgia to have overhyped the deliciousness in my mind. Not a chance, the malt was every bit as good if not better than I remembered. Food prices are also extremely reasonable for generous portions and the staff couldn't be nicer. Must stop when in Lafayette on a warm evening.
I used to go here when I was little and this place is the best drive in, in Indiana there ice cream really good and there cheese burgers are classic

wow 0_0 please do not get the Walt's Loaded Tots- I want them all for myself!  One of the best things I have ever eaten!  The coating on the soft serve dip tastes more like wax than flavor but I suppose that is just a sign of the times.  Anyhow, I don't think this place will ever do you wrong.  There is a reason Budges has been in business for 75 years now.

This is undeniably one of Lafayette's hidden gems. The food is delicious with large portions and good prices.  Some of the older reviews state that they are cash only but I am happy to announce that they now accept credit cards.  The location was once probably prime but the surrounding area has turned into a high crime area so I would recommend ensuring that you're finished with your meal and out of the area by dark.  I would presume that this is why their seasonal hours have them closing shop around nightfall.  However, go here and give this place a try.  The burgers and malts are a must get.  The fries are also phenomenal; reminiscent of the old Burger King fries before the government stepped in and ruined them. The staff is always friendly and quick with the food preparation.  Your patronage here helps to support an iconic mom and pop establishment which is respectful enough to include an in memoriam on their window for a local fallen firefighter who was killed in the line of duty.  The only thing I am disappointed about is that it took me this long to find this gem and would encourage everyone to give it a try sooner rather than later.

The name is misspelled on this entry, it's Budgee's. And it's awesome! I love this place. I was eating here 10 years ago. Good onion rings, decent burgers. CHEAP. the all time best product here is the the Flavor Burst. They have tons of flavor options, and it's delicious any way you get it. Standard Strawberry Flavor Burst with a cone is my standy by. (The "Sky" size is like 2 bucks and almost too much to consume at once!) they also have the ice cream that gets scooped out of a bucket, delish. you can get it dipped in chocolate, sprinkles, nuts etc. The twinkle toe dip is sprinkles and nuts. worth a try. They have great shakes and sundaes as well. 

CASH ONLY! This is right by St Elizabeth Central hospital and there's always someone there, even on a rainy, cold day in may. =]

Budges (pronounced Budg-eez) Drive In is a local favorite. I love their soft serve ice cream because it is the closest in flavor and creaminess to the ice cream stand I went to when I was a kid. It looks a little run down, but the servers are very friendly, the ice cream is creamy and delicious and the prices are very low. I had a black raspberry flavor twist cone - yum! They have great shakes, too. Try the peach shake.

Thanks to yelp for directing us to this local gem. We've gone several times, and have satisfied on all occasions. The only con is that it is a cash only place, but it's is fairly cheap, so just grab some spare change and check this place out. We can only vouch for their ice cream, as that is all we have had, however they do offer other fast foods (burgers, fries,...) 

I usually get the strawberry flavor burst medium cone ($1.99) and have been delighted by it, so much that it is what I usually get when I go. However, their flurries are a must try, and they come in a variety of flavors, ranging from oreos to snickers to reeses. Best part is that the chocolate brand of your choosing is crushed and is mixed uniformly throughout the ice cream so that you don't have to worry of mixing it yourself as happens when ordering Flurries at other locations.

If it were not for the cash only, I would consider giving Budges five stars, but on second thought, them not accepting cards is probably a good thing for us.

Next time we head over to Budges, we'll take pictures of their menu so that you can get an idea of what to expect.
They do everything right. Appetizers, sandwiches, burgers, desserts, it's all delicious. Their malts are especially great. This is a must visit location, if not a regular stop for people near-by.

I love this business! You can tell that it thrives from the love of the owners keeping it alive all of these years. I am particularly a fan of the Blue Goo ice cream cone as well as the Green Apple ice cream cone.

Good ice cream and frozen treats, but you never really know when it's going to be open. Usually it's when the weather is nice, but you never know. Prices are good and service is usually pretty quick. Bring cash.

reviews.text:
Stopped here for lunch today. Very friendly staff and wonderful Bahn Mi sandwiches!!! I'm not normally a tea drinker, but their unsweetened iced tea has me rethinking that. Their jasmine tea is brewed perfectly. 
Stop in for great food, great service, and support a deserving locally owned business.
You can still dine in with social distancing, this is one of the best restaurants on the east side, their fried rice is flavorful and fresh. Their bubble milk tea was delicious as well

I couldn't pass up stopping here for lunch, being the sucker for sandwiches that I am.
Due to COVID 19 the shop uses their front window for placing and picking up orders which is pretty convenient. I ordered Thai iced tea, a side of fried tofu, and a tofu sandwich with mayo. 
Once my order was placed I waited outside for about 15 minutes - next time I'll order through the YELP app so I dont have to wait. They have a black bench to sit on but no outdoor seating to eat at.
My takeout food came in a nice little brown paper bag and the thai tea had a boba tea lid which made carrying everything so much easier. 
The thai tea was not very sweet. However, what it lacked in sweetness it made up for in creaminess - over all, very yummy. 
The sandwich was soooo good! It's a big sandwich for $7! The bread was toasted, tofu crispy, cilantro gave it a burst of flavor and freshness, and the pickled vegetables brought it all home with just enough acidity to rock your socks off. 
And last but not least was the fried tofu side. So perfectly crispy and the sauce gave it a wonderful tangy flavor. 
Overall I highly recommend this place. Order ahead so you dont have to wait, but even if you have to wait its really worth it.

Like this place so much! Their pho soup is the best around Purdue. The location is little bit far for students, but a descent driving distance. The use Yelp to take out making it more convenient during this pandemic.
Friendly staff and excellent food. Ingredients taste fresh and have lots of flavor. Orders have always been on time.

The atmosphere is nice & clean. 

I ordered the classic and, although I was the only customer, waited 10+ minutes. The taste reminded me of Vietnamese but did not contain the depth of flavor and freshness I've had before. I was disappointed.
Update: their pho is phenomenal!!! I love ordering it with their bahn mi sandwiches! This is my new favorite spot for pho.

I'm from the SF Bay Area and grew up eating yummy pho and banh mi from restaurants out there. I definitely miss it since I don't live there anymore and was so glad to see Lafayette had a place that serves up both. This was my first time ordering here. I got the marinated pork sandwich for pick up. I loved it right away. The first bite alone was full of flavor! 

I think I'd give it five stars if the meat was just a little more savory, there was a little more filling, and if the bread was fresher (felt a little stale). 

All in all, a super satisfying 7 dollar sandwich! I'm definitely coming back to order pho and more sandwiches!

This building has been empty for a long time, and I was so excited when I saw that this restaurant was going in. I finally stopped by and ordered a couple banh mi's to go. I got the classic for my son, and the marinated pork for me. The sandwiches were larger than I thought they would be (very filling), and a great value for the price. There was plenty of meat and vegetables on them, and the baguette was perfect. The marinated pork was so good, the flavor reminded me of my favorite noodle bowl I get at Green Leaf (their sister restaurant).

The interior is very clean and modern, and larger that it looks on the outside. The parking lot is small, but there is plenty of street parking on Owen Street.
This is one of my favorite spots in Lafayette. Food is delicious and fresh. Ordering is quick and easy.
Food is really really good!  I love trying new things here, no actual disappointments yet!  Had some delivered to work.... everything was correct and was a fun change for my coworkers and i!!!
Best vietnamese food I've ever had. The marinated pork banh mi is incredible and so are all of the phos. Fast good service, well priced, and delicious.

We're vegetarians so we got the tofu sandwich and tofu with rice. We also got some veggie dumplings as an appetizer. Everything was delicious. There aren't many places here in town that can get this crispy tofu texture right. The rice had so much flavor on its own but is also delicious when topped with this spectacular sauce it's served with. We'll definitely go back again.
Amazing service great food. I'm a college student and it's just affordable and delicious and filling 10/10

Everything is so deliciously fresh here. I got the crispy tofu rice noodles yesterday and had to get it again today. This, the tofu banh mi, and tofu dumplings are all vegetarian (not sure 'bout vegan). The banh mi is also great and if you get it to go make sure to get a side of hoison sauce. Try the yogurt for dessert!

Ordered an assortment of sandwiches and a rice bowl to go.  Friendly, fast service and the food is amazing!  This place is a true hidden gem!
The marinated pork sandwich was my family's favorite, followed by the chicken.

I had been waiting for Lafayette to have a Banh Mi shop and my wish has finally been granted. 

I've been here twice now, and I have tried the classic and the chicken banh mi. Both of them were delicious. A little Sriracha went a long way to add flavor. I will definitely keep visiting!

This review is mostly for the banh mi, because that was the only item I ordered personally, but I have to comment on the nuoc cham because I tried some! Got the classic /dac biet combo banh mi. I didn't try the meats individually (should have!), but I liked the savoriness and how they tasted. Pickled carrots and radish were a little on the sweet side, but I liked how they were cut (not too thick nor thin), liked how they gave a generous portion of the pickles, and that they used English cucumbers for an actual crunch, and that jalapenos were not omitted! I really enjoyed the shattering and flaky crust on the bread, and that it wasn't TOO crusty or hard to cut the soft palette or to be semi-compressed (in order to eat all components in one bite). My friend got the fried tofu, which she loved, but I tried some of her nuoc cham with some of the tomatoes/cucumbers that came with it, and encouraged her to try some on her rice! She didn't like the nuoc cham, and I was disappointed that it was overwhelmingly fishy and sweet, almost like it was missing the lime juice to balance it out, because I have fond memories of almost drowning my broken rice in nuoc cham. Most definitely will be back for the banh mi, but would wait to order any rice dish because of the off-putting nuoc cham!

The above review was written 3 months ago, after my first visit to BMEatery. 
My 4 star rating that I posted on google is now docked to a 3.5 (but I will round to 4)- had the combo banh mi again today, but also tried the marinated pork to see how their version tastes. It was so sweet that I actually dribbled fish sauce on the pork every 2-3 bites to balance out the sweetness. I could mostly only taste the sugar, and a tiny bit of lemongrass when I bit into a minced piece. Would not recommend the marinated pork for this reason, and also would hesitate further due to the small amount, because the pork didn't appear until several bites of just bread+pickled carrots+radish. 
I noticed that this time they used non-English cucumbers, and all 3 of our sandwiches only had one piece of cucumber about 4 inches long and about 1/2 inch wide :(
Classic sandwich is one of the best I've had and at a really good price ($6!). The Signature Pho was also great.

I've heard a lot of good things about banh mi and living here haven't had a chance to see what all the fuss was about. Thankfully Banh Mi now exists and wow, they are delicious. Even better than the hype. I shared a marinated pork and a classic sandwich. Good meats, fresh toppings, daikon, jalapeno, cilantro..just tons of flavor.

Small menu, Sandwiches are $6, sides are a few bucks. Several tea-like drinks on menu. 

The restaurant is on 4th st away from downtown. Pretty odd place for a restaurant like this. Clean and trendy and bright on the inside. Parking lot is terrible so park on the street if you can...or back in. Otherwise you could be waiting a while to get out of the lot.

images.alt: Photo of Hawaiian Hut - Lafayette, IN, United States

reviews.text:
The most authentic and delicious Hawaiian food I have ever had. Drove an hour and a half (beautiful drive) just to try this spot, though I wish it were closer, I will be making the drive again. 

Call ahead to ensure a quick delivery or if you need any specialty Hawaiian dish made. Extremely nice family, they came in just for me on their day off and custom made a lovely spread of Hawaiian food for me. 

I'm from Los Angeles, home to some of the best Hawaiian restaurants on the west coast, this place HAWAIIAN HUT beats them all.

Worth the drive, definitely stop in to enjoy some authentic delicious Hawaiian food. Best Mac Salad hands down.
Delicious food. Have tried most of the menu and haven't been disappointed yet. Especially love the pineapple and kalua pork. Didn't think I liked macaroni salad until I tried what they have here.

reviews.text: Great new find clean nice patio amazing homemade food awesome service owner and place!

A divr bar in Layfayeete that is good for middle age people. Saw no one near college age and this most probably is a local neighborhood bar. Not  much to choose from and the food served here is Aldis type food anyone can make at home. A bar where chips are available to go with the big American advertising heavy corn beer

Outdoors looks super clean and cute.   Inside doesn't match the outside...like a typical old small town bar.  Very limited menu for a place "now serving lunch".  About 10 items only...Most of which are burgers.
I am a big fan! Always inviting and fun, I know I can always get a cold, local drink at a good price and some excellent food. You can't go wrong, from fried cod to meatloaf they have it going on.

I was travelling through lafayette recently and had their Pierogis and Italian Beef.. Wow were they good!.. As a kid my grandmother made pierogis for christmas dinner.. 
Popp - a -Top's are the real deal!

Photo of John Purdue Room - West Lafayette, IN, United States
Photo of John Purdue Room - West Lafayette, IN, United States. Fireplace in JPR

reviews.text: This restaurant is run entirely by Purdue students who are studying hospitality.  It is definitely an upscale restaurant, located in the Marriott building next to the café. Reservations are not needed - I've been able to get in whenever I wanted to.  Food is good and service is excellent!

Nice sit down full service restaurant on Purdue's campus which is run by Hospitality students. I had s nice experience here with the restaurant. It was nice to sit down to a hot, well made full service meal on a campus full of student food choices. 
I had the Italian special, which was their daily special today. The pasta was well cooked, slightly on the bland side but once I salted it m, it was great. There were a lot of pieces of shrimp and plenty of fresh spinach in the bowl. The serving was a good size and also came with two mini cannoli. The cannoli was the highlight of the meal. Delicious cream, not too sweet loaded with chocolate chips and the perfect size. 
Service was also good, it's nice to be waited on instead of doing a cafeteria style meal. I'd recommend this restaurant if you're looking for a "better" meal at Purdue.
Excellent restaurant the food is prepared and served and the restaurant is run by the hospitality and tourism management students at Purdue. I've been to the Turkish and the Spanish lunches.

reviews.text:
Rusty Taco is a bit pricey, 4 tacos and a drink for $16, but the portions are good. They offer a variety of meats, as well as breakfast tacos, nachos, beer, and margaritas. They offer indoor  and outdoor dining options, as well as to go and Door Dash delivery. 

In the warmer months, the patio is hopping. 

I was intrigued with the fish tacos. As a west coast guy, I frequented Rubio's (known for their fish tacos) fairly often. Rusty's fish tacos pale in comparison. Although Rusty's uses cod, the portions look like fish sticks. They are served with a pinch of red cabbage and a bunch of cilantro - the portioning should be opposite. 

For the price, it's difficult to justify coming here more than once a month (although Rusty's would be a good starting point for a night out with friends).

So excited for a taco specific dining experience in Lafayette. Inside is colorful and allows a bar window feature opening to the outdoor patio. There are lots of taco combinations as well as a few margaritas. A fun place to grab tacos with friends. Would recommend the blank bean taco.

Cool new place in Lafayette. It was too cold to sit outside, but they do have a nice patio area. The staff were friendly and the restaurant had proper COVID-19 procedures in place (i.e. masks, social distancing, etc.). 
I got the Chicken Fajita, Black Bean, and Texican tacos along with chips and queso. The Texican was definitely my favorite. I did think the chicken was dry. The queso was good and had some spice, but I prefer white queso vs yellow. I would come again.

Visit 11/7/2020
Overall 1.7

Keep looking for good breakfast tacos in this town but haven't found any yet. I tried Rusty's after seeing a flyer at a friends house. My critique is based on 20+ years having lived in Texas. Rusty's is TexMex by claim only. The ambiance is a nice little store front with patio seating. 

I over ordered so I could sample several. I also ordered chips and Queso. 

Chips were nice thick warm and crunchy; queso was a tad watery but thickened as it cooled slightly, onions and tomatoes in it were good.

Bacon, Potato, Egg & cheese. Burnt bacon, clumpy precooked scrambled eggs with no flavor on their own. Potatoes were soggy little squares of chewy flavorless bits. The shredded cheese was unmelted and the taco served without enough heat to melt it. Flour tortilla was decent but cold, seemed homemade but most likely just cooked to order pre made rounds. 

Brisket, egg and cheese taco & Chorizo- the same can be said as previously on all parts. The brisket was barely noticeable but had decent flavor added to the taco. The chorizo was burnt as well and very dry. 

The green and red salsa were both very good. That added some moisture to otherwise dry tacos. My favorite was the red, it had a Smokey essence. 

I will continue searching for a taqueria that serves breakfast.

The food is fine. 

Everything else is lacking. The music is SO LOUD that you can't hear the people you're with and the employees can not hear you ordering. You can't social distance based on the way the tables and lines are set up. I observed an employee wash a counter and drop the rag on the floor in a pile of swept up food. She then picked up the rag and continued to wash the counter and then cleaned a table with the same dirty/dropped rag.
Food was okay. Nothing special. Service was a little slow. Good atmosphere. There are better places to eat in town. I wouldn't return for a second time.

It's inviting and open, they offer both indoor and outdoor seating as well as a bar! We got Texaco tacos, the rusty taco, and a FRIED chicken taco...BY FAR THE BEST THING IS THE FREID CHICKEN TACO!!!! We also got the queso and that was pretty good! All of the sauces are fresh and taste wonderful.
We will Come back to enjoy some chips, sides, and of course a chicken taco but as far as everything else it's just simply tacos, fresh and tasty.

We have been looking forward to this place opening for a couple weeks.  It finally did and we decided to have lunch there.  

Overall it was a very positive experience.  I had the Rusty taco, chicken fajita taco and brisket taco.  We also tried the bbq brisket taco and regular beef taco.  The signature  Rusty taco was very good with a spicy pork, pineapple, onion and cilantro on a corn tortilla.  The other tacos were also very good with the chicken fajita taco coming in last place as I felt like it was missing something.  We also got the three dip chip platter that came with chips, salsa, queso and guac for 9.00.  The guac and queso were fantastic but the salsa was a little on the bland side.  We could have used more chips too but perhaps it comes with more chips and we just didn't know it.  It was very busy since it just opened.

The average price of a taco here is about 3.25 which seems to be on par with other taco dining options/food trucks and you pretty much just order a la carte.  They do have a nice little kids menu.

They offer both indoor and outdoor seating with tvs viewable in both locations.  The bar is also available to sit at either indoor or out.  Would be perfect for an evening dinner to watch a football game.   

Inside was a bit noisy but again it was very crowded with just having opened.  Self service fountain drinks for beverages.

Will definitely be back to try more taco versions and re-order some of the favorites!

We kind of accidentally dropped by Rusty Taco on the second day they were open. The place (even during COVID) was swarmed. We just got tacos, so don't have a lot to say about the food. The tacos were a bit on the "meh" side. The hot sauce was the real deal, though. As far as the place itself, the whole vibe seemed like a lot of fun. They have a margarita station ("Just a little crazy"), and a 3 Floyds sign prominently featured. Lots of nice decor. The chips and salsa looked yummy and plentiful (though a bit more expensive than at comparable places). COVID measures were comprehensive and well handled. All in all, a good addition to the Lafayette fast food scene.

We ordered delivery (through DoorDash) so I can't comment on the service or ambiance. The food was pretty good. I had three tacos: the fried chicken "favorite" with queso, the brisket egg and cheese and a black bean egg and cheese. They were all really delicious! The fried chicken on the fried chicken taco was great and so was the brisket. I really like that they offer breakfast tacos all day, since I'm not a huge fan of many traditional taco toppings. My husband was really happy with his tacos too. We'll definitely order from here again.

Love this new little gem! Perfect place to grab a quick bite (our favorite is the fried chicken taco) & even get a churro or warm sopapilla for a sweet finish. We are looking forward to warmer months to enjoy their outdoor seating!

Nickel and dime customers - charging for lettuce? Also took forever and screwed the order up completely. Wasn't worth the wait. Was not that great. Steak was very chewy and other meats just weren't flavorful. I will say, I gave an extra star because management and clerk were very accommodating when the mixup occurred. They also don't label the taco boats when you order separate tacos. We had no clue what was what, neither did the nice woman that assisted us. There were three of us with three tacos each - none labeled. I'll probably not be back. Lots of other quick joints that are delicious.

This new restaurant is a welcome addition to the southside. It is essentially a fast food restaurant. You order your food at the counter, and your name is called to pick up your food at the counter. You clear your own table. The very definition of fast food. However, this is not Taco Bell. There is a nice list of specialty tacos offered along with optional toppings like guac or sour cream. The tacos are served on a white corn tortilla, not a flour tortilla. I had the brisket taco and the signature Rusty Taco. The brisket was nice and tender. The Rusty Taco has pineapple chunks that provide a sweet flavor. I do feel that the fillings are a bit skimpy for a $2.50-$3.75 taco. Carrie got Tex Mex taco which is your basic ground beef taco. She wished she had ordered the extra sour cream. We got the large queso and chips to share, but we got one small boat of chips that were no where near enough to finish off the large container of queso. We used only half the queso, so I think we got shorted on chips. The staff are very friendly, and the food comes out fast. There is indoor and outdoor seating, and the outdoor seating has direct access to the bar serving beer and wine. Overall, a nice experience.

Really good food, but SLOW as heck. Restaurant is way too noisy, can't hear orders called out. Been there twice, but probably won't go back. Oh, and social distancing is virtually non-existent, so steer clear if you have COVID-19 concerns.

On the FB recommendation of a friend we decided to try out this place for lunch. OH MY! The food is so good! We got the Beef Brisket nachos, brisket tacos, black beans, street corn and chips & queso. I was not a fan of the corn but everything else was great!! The service was quick and all the people working there were friendly.  We sat inside but saw they had great outside seating too.  We will definitely be back!

DO NOT GET CARRYOUT!!!! Are entire order was wrong!!' They didn't have flour tortillas.  We didn't order corn.   Nothing on tacos but meat, gristle most of it in every taco.    No fixings at all.    Worst taco place I have ever been to.
Daughter and I got the two vegetarian taco options, chips and queso, and the street corn. Good food, very fresh, and decent prices. Will order again!

I went here with my mom the second day it was open. The atmosphere was 10/10, food came out quick, was hot, flavorful, and tasted good. Great experience all around! Very busy which is what I like to see for a new restaurant. Staff was friendly!
Good breakfast tacos! The queso has a nice spice to it and the churros are to die for.

We tried this for lunch and probably won't be going back. The tacos are sold individually and average $3 - $3.50 each. They're pretty small, think street tacos. The flavors are mediocre and they don't come with chips and salsa - you buy them separately. I've had similar style / quality tacos on $1 Taco Tuesday at many other local restaurants. Don't recommend

reviews.text: This pizza is fantastic! The restaurant itself did a very good job maintaining social distance all while providing great food for its customers. Would definitely recommend for a pizza night.

It's pretty hard to rate Arni's because I like to rate relative to the area, and there really isn't that many great pizza places around (arnies would get a 3 star in most cities). That being said, the staff and workers are very nice people, and the pizza gets the job done as well.

What you get here is either bar pizza if you're from the east coast or tavern style if you're from the Chicago area meaning it's thin crust, crisp bottom, and won't take away stomach room from drinks.

The pizza itself is pretty good depending on what you get for toppings. I haven't had many of their specialty pies, but you get the most bang for ypur buck with sausage or ham. They use crumbled sausage and literally spread it edge to edge which makes it delicious if that's the heartiness you're going for. Value is where this place gets a minus because a large 3 topping pizza is ~$18 which is a little steep in central Indiana for a tavern style especially if you go with veggie toppings.
Top notch pizza!  I love their pizza choices, but you have to try their salad and bread sticks.  Their food is so yummy I want to order the entire menu!

EXCELLENT! LOVE the live train that delivers your drinks to you! This place is CLASSIC and has been around for DECADES!

Suggestion:  Offer 1. Gluten-free pizza options, and 2. VEGAN!

YUMMO!

"Meet you at Arni's" - the hometown phrase of the beloved local yet statewide pizza institution. Generations of kids, families, and geezers flock to Arni's friendly confines for pizza, Stromboli's, various sandwiches, specialty salads, and the iconic Arni's Junior salad. 

It's hard to knock a local place for doing its thing and doing it well. This location is expanded in size and has three different distinct areas: main dining room, take away counter, smaller dining room, and a bar/pub area. I find the food acceptable and the booths very uncomfortable. Get a table for decent seating comfort.

This used to be one of my favorites.  In the last year or so, the quality of their food has declined.  Most times when we get sandwiches, they burn them.  And the last salad I got there, the lettuce was old and wilted.  

Don't let this reflect on all locations.  I am only reviewing Market Square.  While I realize they all get their supplies from the same place, I'm sure the quality served to the customer probably varies from location to location.

Hoping things improve to the standards they used to be.

Arni's may well be the inventor of Hoosier style pizza.  But I can't say it's the best.  The crust seems like an evolutionary step towards Pizza King's.  It tastes similar but isn't as fluffy.   The sauce is also very similar.  The biggest difference is in the toppings.  Arnies aren't chopped nearly as finely as Pizza King's, and I think they are a little lower quality.  The bread sticks are no comparison.   Pizza King's are crusty on the outside and chewy inside and covered in garlic butter.  Arnie's are just normal bread sticks.  This all sounds like I'm hating on Arnie's.  It's not bad pizza by long shot, I'd probably go again (the service was great), but next time Axl wants Hoosier pizza in California, he should ring the King (actually he probably shouldn't be eating pizza at all).

I Had the sandwich crab melt which was Delicious and different. Reasonable prices on this menu can be ordered for take out as well.
My friend had a large chicken Caesar salad. We were both pleased with friendly service and hot food. 
Kelsey was our waitress. Nice lunch and they had lunch specials we may try on another visit.

We were visiting for a youth sporting event from out of town.  We were looking for a place with a little bit of everything.  We ordered a large pizza , salads, sweet potato fries and an order of potato cakes . 
The best thing was the potato cakes ! They are served with  apple sauce and sour cream for dipping.  I swear   when you dip one in the apple sauce it tastes like a home made apple fritter  like you may find in the south !   Not bad dipped in ranch  either !    Service was top notch !  All the staff was friendly and great.  I had the vinegrette with my salad , yummy for sure !  The only thing the kids did not care for was the pizza !  I think it was just a personal preference.  I would definitely go back and try some different items on the menu.  The  full menu was limited due to covid .  But we all understand  and have no qualms about it .

We had some pizza for dinner tonight and our server was Casey she was very nice and polite even helped with the bagging up the left overs for us which was super nice of her now let get to dinner we had 2 pizzas 1 was half cheese and deluxe and the other was bbq chicken pizza both were piping hot when they came out tasted very good and we also had arnis senior salad with 4 different dressings and and also got some extra garlic bread all was made great Casey made sure to even bring out all our food promptly she is a great waitress and great adition to ur team Arni's thanks for the great frendly service and awesome pizza tonight

I've been coming here with family since the late 70s.  There Arni's Junior salads are very good.  They use a white cheese the is delicious.  They have I wide selection of sandwiches - the open faced reuban is good.  Others in family love the pizzas.

Arini's is so much more than their pizza, it's the environment, tradition, and fun that is woven into the Arni's overall experience! 

Arni's pizza is served thin crust with toppings chopped finely and sprinkled on top!! Pair with one of their junior salads to round it out!

I grew up with Arni's so they are "the" local "go to" place in my book!
I have since moved out of Lafayette, actually out of Indiana, but Arni's is my favorite place to go when I am in town, especially for their Arni's Junior and cheese garlic bread.
However, I will say, their pizza is not my favorite, but that is about my taste, not the quality of their pizza. 
The staff has always been pleasant and accommodating, even when they are slammed after a sporting event.
At this location, they have 3 separate eating/drinking areas; the main dinning area, Toys in the Attic and The Loading Dock. 
Also, I have been to the newer locations and none compares with the original Arni's. 
As their motto says, "See you at Arni's".

I know, you gotta have the Arnie's Jr. Salad or maybe a pizza, but I haven't had a submarine sandwich in 30 years.  They didn't disapoint!

Always great to be back, see pictures of the man himself and step back into my youth.  Thank you to the staff for a wonderful experience.

The food was not bad. We got the loaded fries which were very good. We also got a 14 inch pizza with half sausage half pineapple. Pineapple was good but the sausage was too much we couldn't even see the cheese. 8/10 water. The thin crust kind of tastes charcoal-y. Arnis was pretty good and i would come back every once in a while. Ps what is a pizza bag? they have boxes for that.

How in the WORLD did this place get 4 stars on Yelp.  It is a low key family place.  It's clean.  I ordered a side salad with ranch.  Lots of brown lettuce in the salad so I just stopped eating.  I also ordered 1/2 of the veggie stromboli.  It was TERRIBLE.  First of all it was a sandwich, not a Stromboli.  The small smear of sauce was tasteless and sweet.  It had mostly raw vegetables on it, including raw broccoli (seriously?).  

The worst part was the staff.  2 boys bussing tables bantering back and forth with one who kept saying "shut up" over and over.  My server could have cared less I was there.  She was visiting with her sister at another table and when she did talk to me she called me "dear" like 10 times while I was here.  
Steer clear of this place!!!!!

I absolutely love this pizza!!! It is by far my favorite, I have moved out of the area and every time I'm back in Lafayette it is a must. The crust is thin, and the toppings are delicious. (You must try the pepperoni and sausage pizza.) Salads are also great, again, love the toppings!

Classic to visit if you're not a Lafayette native. Best known for their thin crust pizza and Junior salad. The garlic cheese bread is absolutely to die for! While the specialty is pizza, they have a fantastic burger. You can't go wrong with anything on their menu!

Super busy night which tells me it's got to be good...no kids so sat in the bar...2 open seats...bartender a little salty out of the gate but turns out she's awesome just doesn't pull any punches...ordered a pizza without looking at the menu (because we are familiar with their thin crust type of pizza) then asked her what she recommended...without hesitation she said junior salad...added that to our order with no disappointment...our pizza came out faster than the people sitting next to us (which made me a little suspicious because I was wearing IU garb and this is Purdue country)...either they wanted to get rid of me or my pizza was special...no seriously the pizza was awesome and so was the staff...our pizza had crumbled sausage and the people next to us had chunk sausage...theirs looked to be a little more well done than ours which I would recommend...so in a nutshell...crumbled sausage a little more well done is how I'll do it when I go back...and I'll be back (this location is the original which I think there is something to that)

Loved this pizza spot near Purdue! It may not look like much (totally reminded me of an IHOP layout), but the pizza was incredible. Very similar to a Pizza King style with it being thin crust with sweet sauce and diced up toppings. I was very, very pleased! Pricing was reasonable and obviously with any pizza - an easy meal to share. My pizza choice was of course pepperoni, but they had a good variety of other options. Give em' a whirl. 

It's located in a strip mall type set up and I was honestly a little thrown off when I attempted to find it for the first time. I probably just came in the back way - who knows. I'm not from around those parts. :) But! I'll be back. This was the perfect "visit Purdue and take your brother out to eat" spot.

reviews.text: We made our first of many visits to Joe's this morning. The facility was very clean, the food was great and the service was amazing. We can't wait to go back!

Excellent service and excellent food very nice and clean atmosphere hey baby
Excellent pricing couldn't ask for a better place very much enjoyed it

Great breakfast! This place is really clean. Service was ridiculously fast. We had our food within 5 minutes of ordering. It's basically a classic diner. I did not really look at the lunch menu, but it seemed like they had lots of options. Personally, I'd come here for breakfast. I had one egg, 4 strips of bacon, hash browns and wheat toast- all for $5.99! That is a great deal. I will be back.

Joe's Pancake House recently opened in the former Great Wall location, next to Hardees. I have noticed the parking lot of this breakfast and lunch place has been crowded. On the weekends, groups of people gather by the front door greeting each other. 

This morning I had some spare time so I decided to check it out. The interior is clean and bright; it appears they didn't have to do much remodeling after the previous tenant (another Chinese restaurant), even leaving a large Chinese framed print hanging in the wait station. The menu is pretty extensive, with the usual breakfast offerings including pancakes with various toppings, burgers and sandwiches (including a Monte Christo), salads, and desserts. The pricing appears to be comparable to the area, along with a seniors and childrens menu.

The dining room was pretty crowded with customers; servers were circulating topping off coffee and drinks. I ordered my usual breakfast, corned beef hash and eggs (this time sunny-side up). The menu states the corned beef hash is made in-house, and had a nice flavor. The hash browns were the way I make them at home, with par-boiled potatoes. Overall, a tasty meal. 

My only criticism would be the pancake selection. Why call yourself a pancake house without adding some things like a Dutch baby, crepes, aebleskivers, etc?

Ok, the ambience especially on the outside exterior should not scare you away from dining here!
Because the food and the service have been good
Thus far. Pancakes are really good and all the Omelettes are fresh and delicious too....its a hometown diner type of place with decent coffee too!
Quickly becoming discovered by the locals near Union
and north of south street off of Sagamore (52)
Only been in for breakfast so far.  One of our favorites.  But we do intend to go back for other meals.  The menu looks amazing!
Very good food always good service at joe's pancake house restaurant come and check us out thanks

If you're looking for that hometown diner experience, this is a great place. Service was VERY fast and extremely friendly. Special order items were made and served exactly as they were ordered. Portions are large. Definitely not stingy when it comes to the bacon. And let's be honest, everything is is about the bacon. Would have given 5 stars, but the biscuits in the B&G were very meh. Gravy could use a little more sausage as well. To be fair, my family is from TN, so I'm pretty damn picky on my B&Gs. Great place for a good price. We'll definitely come back.

Wait staff was frazzled and there weren't that many people there, atmosphere was diner vibe.  The back if the menu talks about home cooked meals.  My ham tasted like soap and my hash browns were cold.  Huge portion sizes that had more cold hash browns than the meal itself and horrible tasting coffee.

I had read reviews and decided this was the place to visit with my breakfast-loving college student. Reminded us of a diner from home. Friendly and fast. The food portions were generous and really good. Before I knew it I had powered through my French toast not leaving much to save. I didn't expect the strawberries to be in syrup but now I know and will go banana only in the future. We will definitely be back

I noticed a new restaurant had moved in to the old Great Wall Chinese restaurant, and as thankful as I am that it's gone it's new tenant is having an identity crisis! The menu ranges from steak and eggs to spaghetti, as much as I love variety Joe it'd sure be nice to focus on a smaller menu to perfect before branching out! I'm not really sure what this place wants to be but I'm pulling for ya Joe

10/10 would recommend to anyone. Went there for lunch and had the chicken teriyaki special it was the best chicken teriyaki especially for a Pankcake house! MJ was our waitress and always kept my drinks full and table clean. Very fast and professional.
Good breakfast with very friendly staff.  Affordable prices and fast service! The eggs were done just as we ordered. They have a breakfast & lunch menu.

This is actually my first review on Yelp and mind you, I'm honestly hoping this will end up turning into positive feedback for the owners because we are huge supporters of small businesses and restaurants.  Let's start with the good....location is nice since it's close to my home, we were greeted immediately and sat at a comfortable table that sat all 5 of us adults nicely. Our waitress greeted us and took our beverage order promptly.  The restaurant was quite clean and well lit. I liked that I could see into the kitchen and noted how clean it was as well. Well.....I admit, that's where the good ended. I ordered a sweet tea, I'm sure by pure accident was given unsweetened but it was corrected. Then the sweet 'tea' came.....I got not even a hint of tea...just slightly sugary water. Maybe let it steep longer? I ordered a spinach and feta omelet and while it appeared sizable, it was nearly inedible. The spinach appeared to be either frozen or canned and mixed in with the eggs. When I opened it up, I was given 4 sad little crumbles of feta....neither the spinach nor feta had ANY flavor. My omelet was cooked to a brown....most closely resembling the brown paper towels from a restroom. Ok, so I thought let's try my hashbrowns...even tho I originally ordered American fries....the top was pure potatoe white while the bottom was black....not cooked to a nice crisp, just burnt. My son in law ordered the short stack and waited thru nearly 1/2 the meal before any syrup arrived at the table...3 of the 5 had pancakes as part or all of their meal. (In the meantime a poor guy next to us was left to eat his steak and potatoes with a steak knife because he was never brought actual silverware) My husband tried the taco skillet. The salsa legit looked and tasted like they opened up a can of stewed tomatoes with onions. Chunks were too big and the liquid was tomato water. The meat for his taco skillet was clumpy and tasted like they forgot it overnight in the crockpot on high. Last but not least....the pancakes. Ohhhh the pancakes!! Flat, dense, flavorless, and rubbery. For a pancake house I expected so so much more from the pancakes. They wouldn't even absorb any of the syrup. It seemed as tho ALL of our food was overcooked to a point I have never witnessed. I want this place to succeed. I do....but true success can only come with honest feedback. I'm hoping to try this place another time with a better experience and I'm hoping the owners take time and listen to their reviews.....believe me, my father in law owned and ran a restaurant for 7 years...never wanted to listen to critics, only wanted to listen to his "friends" who raved about his food....just cause he was a nice guy and wanted to spare his feelings.

Service was great. The food is just OK. Basic breakfast you can't go wrong. The Biscuits and gravy needs more sausage and seasoning. I've had the corned beef hash twice now. Both times it tasted good but has been undercooked. Potatoes need some crisp. OK enough to keep trying.

Tried this new restaurant & was very pleased. Service was excellent. We ate lunch which was served quickly and the food was hot. My husband had the turkey Manhattan, the turkey was "real", not pressed, sliced stuff. Thumbs up!!

Photo of Arni's - West Lafayette - West Lafayette, IN, United States. Supreme pizza

reviews.text: Friendly service, reasonable prices and a good menu appropriate for a restaurant inside a grocery store. To be sure, this is a satellite Arni's, but it's a great option for a quick meal. They do a good job of virus safety as well.

This is a 5 star pizza review!  The crumbled sausage and pepperoni, sweet red sauce, thin crust is not only one of my favorite childhood food memories but continues to be a hit every time I come through Lafayette.  The salads are great and the deli.  My girls can now have the gluten free pizza and loved it too.  Brad Cohen is one of the great patrons of the city.  West Lafayette is lucky to have him and Arni's.

Cafeteria pizza at best. The box says they've been "serving Indiana for over 50 years." As gawd-awful as this is, I can't believe they've been serving for over 50 minutes. People of greater Lafayette, YOU DESERVE BETTER THAN THIS!!!

I usually love it  but service today was not great.  I told the waitress we were ready to order, she said hold on a second then disappeared.  A few minutes later she brings food to another table then walks by us twice.  Then another waitress decided to take over after she heard us deciding to pay for the appetizer and drinks and leaving.
Every time I come home I have to stop in for a Junior salad.  I have not live in Lafayette for more than 20 years, but Arni's is always my first stop.  Sorry mom.

reviews.text:
The Sagamore restaurant is located inside the Purdue Memorial Union. They're only open for breakfast and lunch. If you end up going to Purdue on a business trip, you'll likely eat at the Sagamore. They offer breakfast-only room service to the Purdue Union Hotel.

The quality and taste of the food is really good, especially considering their prices. If you're looking for a sit-down restaurant on campus, or staying in the campus hotel, I highly recommend the food at the Sagamore.

The Purdue Union is a gem. Public spaces that convey a rich feel of academe. A plethora of noisy food spots in the basement (where Pappy's does a credible breakfast. But every good student union has an enclave where faculty & administrators can hobnob with visiting speakers or court potential donors during breakfast & lunch. Here, that would be the Sagamore.
I'm not sure I would choose the Sagamore for the food, though it's okay. I'm here because it's quiet and I can bill my food to my Union Club Hotel room account. And someone shows up occasionally to fill my coffee. That's worth 4 stars.
