Photo of Legacy Pub - Lafayette, IN, United States. The 100% plant-based Impossible Burger!

reviews.text:
I have recently revisited this restaurant. They have managed to get most all of the kinks worked out! :) Their to-go ordering is GREAT! 

They're very helpful and conscious of food allergies, vegetarians, and vegans! That shows a lot about a restaurant considering most places could care less (especially about food allergies).

I did go in a few weeks ago and the bartender that normally fills my to-go orders is very nice. The waitress we had sucked. Waited 20 minutes for a water. It took her forever to do anything. It was a Sunday afternoon so maybe she was hungover from the night before? Who knows? The other waitresses seemed very attentive to their tables though!

This place really has made a turn around in my opinion. I like the changes!

Some of my favorites include:
The Sinful Sandwich 
Steak Quesadilla 
Broccoli cheddar soup
Catfish 
Classic side salad

This place is less than 10 minutes away from the office and there's a really great local quick lunch stop during the week they also have some drink specials daily
Parking is ample as it is located in a strip mall
Once inside it is great to see some high ceilings it seems very open and airy there is also an outdoor space for dining and drinking the bar is very classic in its style with lots of seating as well
The menu is quite extensive with classic bar and pub foods.  I have been here several times and have tried things from the nachos fries house chips taco salad wraps chicken sandwiches and classic pork tenderloin as well
You cannot go wrong everything is very consistent good quality large generous portions and service has always been very friendly and kind
I keep on coming back because they are consistent clean quick fairly priced considering the area and overall a good experience
Awesome place to come with friends or coworkers. Boom Boom Shrimp Wrap is the bomb. We had a great experience the other week with Kim serving us!

Legacy Pub is nothing fancy or super special, but the staff is attentive and the food is tasty, portions are big. I am not a fan of their drink menu being on a phone and the inside is not the most aesthetically pleasing, looks a bit run down with some tacky decor. I did appreciate the no wait and how they accommodated our large group. They do have a lot of room and it's very spacious.

For a town seemingly in the middle of nowhere I was shocked by their amount of vegan options! We got the impossible burger & the tippe tacos both were great! It wasn't to busy and service was fast. Food and drink were excellent! Definitely a great little a spot for some great food!

Food is good here from past experiences, but we will never go again.  We were asked to wait outside until a table was ready.  No big deal, it was a nice day.  We witnessed 5 groups or individuals go in after us and only 2 of them left with pickup orders.  I walked around back and saw two of the groups after us seated and the third must have been seated before us as well.  No one could have walked 20 steps to get and seat us first, huh?  Rude af.  We got a text message 10 minutes after the 3 groups that arrived after us were seated.  My wife called and was told that those people were ALL carry out orders!  I saw with my own two eyes what happened.  Will never return.

Great staff, great service, great food! Especially for vegetarians and vegans! More than just your typical "black bean burger" options too. They have the new Impossible Burger (amazing by the way!) plus vegan cheese and mayo and additional vegan dressings. They also have Gardein chikn tacos with avocado and vegan rice and beans. Those are the two dishes we order all the time! Apparently they have some other vegan options, but we always get the same things when we go :)

The staff are very nice and know what options there are for veggies..and they don't make you feel like you're totally weird for not eating meat in Indiana! We've even had the owner stop by to chat, and he was so nice. It's definitely a great community atmosphere and good prices.
Always w everything from scratch. Cater to allergies and veg/vegan. Large portions. Nothing not to like!

I've enjoyed going to Legacy Pub ever since it was Hunter's Pub. I particularly like the variety of foods to choose from including Mexican-influenced, burgers and fries, wraps, and other house favorites. I enjoy the way they season their fries. They've also got house made potato chips which are very tasty. I've always had extremely friendly service and the speed of service is great. I go here pretty regularly for lunch. I feel like the portion sizes are just right for the amount that you pay. One of my favorite things they do is provide a to-go soft drink refill to send you on your way after you've paid your bill. I wish more casual sit-down restaurants would do this. I do not drink alcohol, so I can't necessarily speak to drink selection.

Legacy Pub is an unexpected place to find great vegetarian and vegan options, but that is exactly what you'll get with their updated menu. All the favorites are still there but they now have the Impossible Burger--the 100% plant-based burger that will fool meat eaters; the option to sub Gardein Chik'n patties for any sandwich; and Vegan Chik'n tacos. They even have the option to use vegan mayo and vegan cheese. Menu items are clearly labeled with vegan and vegetarian icons. Legacy Pub fills a huge void in the local community--thank you!

Always great food, great selection of tasty beers.  
Tonight was great hot wings.  Beer was tasty, life is good.  They were swamped, but we're regulars, so you have one more beer while waiting.  Thanks Jeremy, thanks Sandy. (Part time worker).

Great place for dinner and drinks, or just drinks :-) They have an extensive menu, great drink selections, outdoor seating, and private party rooms.

This is one of our favorite places to eat in town.  Their fried pickles and ranch are amazing.  They are spears, not chips, and the coating they use is so crunchy and tasty with a little spice. (6/order)

Tonight my husband got the chicken Parmesan sandwich with fries.  This is his usual, so he obviously loves it.  The sandwich comes with lettuce, red onion, and tomato.  

I had their southern chicken sandwich with chips & salsa.  All meals come with fries, but you can substitute it with veggies-chips & salsa-chips-salad-etc.  Their salsa is smoky and has a little heat to it.  For being a pub, they have a pretty wide selection of Mexican food.

We also got a beer & Cosmo to drink.  My Cosmo was STRONG, but I got it down! We'll be back soon, I'm sure.

I was at the Legacy Pub for one of their Meatless Monday meetups; tried their Impossible Burger, and fries (with cajun seasoning). It was really good! The servers and owners are super friendly.
I'd definitely go back there again... and again. :-)
Came into town and my family raves about this place. Ordered a glass of wine and it tasted like it had been opened a week ago  any bar that serves stale wine is definitely one to avoid

Legacy Pub used to be called Hunter's Pub South. After one of the primary owners died unexpectedly, the co-owners took over but couldn't retain the name. So they renamed it Legacy in honor of their partner. The menu is the same - great pub food. On this most recent visit the service has improved and I think it is now entirely non-smoking. There is a patio area that may be smoking, however. I'm not sure. Anyway - it's a nice alternative to Walt's Other Pub which is my usual go-to. Legacy or Walt's - you can't go wrong on the southside.

They have an excellent one-page long menu for vegans/vegetarians!! That's super great since only a few restaurants in the area have a dedicated vegan menu. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. Tried the impossible burger - was amazing! Will visit again!

My family met up here for a late dinner last week. The food was delicious- I had the club sandwich with tomato soup. 

The only thing that made this trip not exactly pleasurable was our waitress. I don't remember her name-maybe she never even gave it to us- but she was just completely unpleasant. She didn't smile once, and seemed to be annoyed.

We were so impressed with our visit to Hunter's Pub! We stopped on our way from Wisconsin to Kentucky. It wasn't exactly off the highway but it wasn't too far a detour- definitely worth it.

We were super thrilled with the service. I believe our server was Michael. He was knowledgable with the extensive menu and wasn't timid when we asked for his personal recommendations. He was kind and outgoing with our kids which is huge.

Food was prompt and accurate.  One thing I noticed (that means so much to me as a mom) is that our waiter handed the kids' plates to my husband, not directly to the kids.  I loved this!  His attention to details was fantastic. 

My husband ordered the Hot Club, I the Reuben, and the kids split fish and chips. Everything was so good! Hot, flavorful. 

We will definitely be back!!

Don't go on customer appreciation night. The $.40 wings are a third of the size that they normally are. Celery and ranch cost extra. Service was horrible. I think they bought a bunch of wings on sale and now they're just trying to get rid of them. Save your money for anything else. Not a good experience compared to past visits.

This was our first visit.  Promptly seated, we were AMAZED at the detailed and lengthy menu!  Wow, so many different dishes!   We both ordered omelettes and loved them.   The waitress was refreshingly polite and prompt.  And prices were very affordable!  We will definitely be going back!

Photo of Señor Tacos - Lafayette, IN, United States. Queso cheese sauce

reviews.text:
Señor Tacos is always a solid choice. You get massive amounts of food for the price and in town I would say it's one of the top 5 Mexican restaurants. The staff is exceptionally friendly and they always go out of their way to make sure that you have everything you need. 

Recently I have been using their pick up service more than anything and the quality is still just as good. Call it in and it's ready 15-20 minutes later at the most. The only real challengers I've experienced recently is the phone line is often busy so it requires multiple calls. I suppose that speaks to their popularity though. 

If you're on the south side of town and need a big lunch for a low price, you're really not going to find a better place. I'd suggest the al pastor burrito covered in queso... it will feed a family of 4 (not really, but you get my point).

I recently became a pescatarian, and most taco places (at least from what I've seen here in town) have limited seafood and vegetarian options. These guys don't have a lot of options in this department either, but they have a fish taco, shrimp taco and a vegetarian (eggplant) taco. The seafood taco's were really good, but nothing to write home about. However, the veg taco was delicious; seasoned beautifully and a scrumptious eat. We were very pleasantly surprised. 

They do curbside which is what we opted for. The restaurant itself was kind of crowded (Saturday afternoon) and not many of the patrons had face coverings. I can't say for certain that social distancing was in place (it didn't look like it?).
All the employees had masks on and hand sanitizer was available at the entrance. The ladies restroom is not in great shape - the doors of both stalls had non-functioning locks and I had to use the bin to prop the door closed. 

Would I go back? Yes - for the veg taco's, but we will most likely stick to curbside pickup for the foreseeable future.

My first time enjoying this place and it was delivery. Really fast, fresh, and good! Even after waiting a while (delivery did not knock and just left at door, so I did not know they had arrived) it was still fresh and tasty! 

The tostada was delicious! Still crisp after sitting. Chicken was diced, which was not what I expected, but it was good. Toppings were tasty and so were the beans. I ordered a ground beef taco and added lettuce, tomatoes and cheese. Very stuffed and still crispy, not at all soggy. Tasty addition to the meal. 

Last, I had to order real tacos. Corn tortillas (doubled) with steak and one carnitas. I got red and green sauce. Both sauces are spicy, delicious, and fresh. Lime is a must! I have not had the steak yet- way too full, but the carnitas were plentiful and on point. Happy with this place and I will order again! Pleasantly surprised.

Yum! First time here and I just did to-go, but I was shocked at how well done the inside is!! I had no idea they offered dine in. I did shrimp tacos and Arroz con pollo. Portions were great- I felt like they gave me a ton of shrimp!! I love that they offer all the tortilla types too. 

Will definitely be back.

I've only ever done take out. They're really quick and conveniently located near where I live so it's been my go-to pick up. The staff is friendly! 

It's been a hit or miss with the steak taco salad. I had it once and it was really good and on a different occasion it was filled with old lettuce and barely any meat. The steak tacos are good. They overload the tacos with meat. You can use the second tortilla and make another taco out of what they give you! The steak was seasoned well and there was plenty of onions and cilantro just how I like it! I've also had the steak torta. The bread could be better. It's kind of chewy, but other than that it's above average. 

Overall this is a pretty decent place and it's convenient in a good location, so that's why I'd rate it pretty high. If I wanted better Mexican food and I had time to sit down, I'd probably visit a different restaurant to be honest.

Although I came in early, just after lunch, the service and food was great. I had 3 different tacos to try them out. I wasn't disappointed. 

The waiter gave me plenty of advice which helped. Needless to say, one should listen to the waiter to guide you. Plenty of flavor and it was nice to have some heat to it .

And, for a strip mall restaurant, the ambiance was nice. Nice soft music and plants all over. 

I think I will do this again.

Moved from the west side of Chicago and had yet to find a good place for Mexican.  Carried out Carne Asada, Enchiladas de Mole, 2 Steak Tacos and Chile Rellenos, plus chips and salsa.  They added a few spicy red and green salsa containers.  Hands down the best Mexican food in the area - everything was delicious!

I'd give this place a negative number if I could. Food is mediocre at best. The service there is AWFUL! They are rude and "slow" would be a compliment. We have had trouble there three out of the four time that we have been there. Take my advice, go to Mexico Lindo and ask for Daniel. You will be richly rewarded.

I'd be willing to bet this is the best Mexican food in town. This is definitely our favorite place for margaritas and tacos. They're usually pretty busy but the staff are friendly and the food is always good, never had a complaint. 
The tacos are so flavorful and the rest of their menu has a great variety, from taco salad bowls to enchiladas you really can't go wrong. Absolutely recommend this place.

Nice clean atmoshphere. Friendly service. 

Good fresh chips. Salsa is was little bland but several hot sauces provided on the table help correct this. Prices were fair. 

My wife got the combination plate- 9.99 for three items- chicken taco for Our youngest- which was large and full of meat. An al pastor taco, which was wonderfully seasoned and cooked properly (not dry or burned) A slightly unique flavor and delicious. She also got a Sope which was also good. beans were flavorful, rice was not dry. 

I got the Molcajete which was amazing. A giant bubbling lava stone full of delight. It included Shrimp, Chicken, Steak, Roasted Pork, Chorizo, Nopales, avocado, grilled onions and jalapeño, and a couple big chunks of cheese in a rich, savory, slightly spicy sauce. It was topped with fresh onions, cilantro and more cheese. It came with some tortillas on the side and was $15.99. Which felt like a bargain based on the amount and quality of the food. 

Also hot sauces that came with the food were wonderful. 

We highly recommend Senior Tacos.

This is my third time here and Señor Tacos is fabulous. Serious competition for Taco Rico on the east side of town. I always get the chorizo tacos. Their red and green sauces are perfect. Asked for the pickled jalapeños and they were given in abundance. 

Wife got the fajita taco salad. She eats keto so she skipped the shell. Their staff also accommodated her by leaving certain toppings out. 

Clean place, nicely decorated. Everyone that works here is nice. 

As we are south siders this will be a regular for us!

Senor Tacos is tucked away in the shopping strip at 18th St. and Veteran's Parkway. The dining area is small but doesn't feel cramped. The menu is typical Mexican fare at the usual prices. I had a combination platter. The enchildas are good but I wasn't a fan of the gordita that was like a dry biscuit filled with meat and toppings. I won't order that again. But I got a lot of food and it was hot and tasted good. I'd like to return and explore the menu some more.
This place is super clean, food is awesome, and service is great - we've been looking for a decent Mexican restaurant in the area for two years, I think we found it !

We have tried all of the Mexican restaurants in town and this one is our favorite; so much that we eat here at least once a week.  We have had everything from their authentic tacos, burritos, and our favorite the fajitas.  The fajitas comes with guacamole, rice, and refried beans, but you can order other sides like shredded cheese, lettuce, etc.  Everything always comes out hot, fresh and delicious!  You can order almost any kind of taco you can think of, mix it up with 1-3 tacos and a side of rice and beans if you choose.  The food is well priced at a low reasonable amount, about $9 for tacos combination plate and about $12 for fajitas.  I've had their large margaritas many times and they pair perfectly with any dish.  Also, if you're gluten free and celiac like my husband, we have never had a problem eating here.    We love their corn tortillas be use they're made homemade and fresh.  Typically corn tortillas are crumbly but they double theirs up and we have had no problems with them breaking apart.  The staff is friendly and very accommodating, which makes it a pleasure to eat here.
Loved this restaurant before covid but now precautions aren't to my standards. Love their food.
Beautifully presented and delicious. All food made onsite. Very clean and friendly staff!  Will be back. Highly recommend!!

First, I will tell you the wait staff are very friendly.

However, they are terribly slow and often forgetful.  The fajita is not substantial with meat - quantity or quality.  Their salsa gets about a 1 star because it's the worst in Indiana, although the chips are pretty decent. 

The tables and environment is clean. In fact they use Fabuloso while still serving food so the aroma is terrible at times later in the evening.

This is our neighborhood Mexican restaurant, and we really wish it was much better. Do not expect 4 star quality and you may be satisfied.

One time while visiting my parents they suggested this place. I'm not the biggest Mexican food fan but I'm a fan of their food. Ceviche tostada is very fresh and light and I really enjoy their chicken taco salad. Nice proportions and service is quite friendly and speedy. Definitely will be coming back when I visit again.

Now this place has "THE BEST" chorizo and adobada tacos I've had. Almost better than the ones in Tijuana Mexico. Very well seasoned and with enough meat, anywhere else their very thin and with double corn tortillas that will not break in your hand. Definitely returning on my next business trip.

This is a pretty great place for Mexican food. I got the steak chimichangas while my mother got the steak burrito. 

Pros: 
- No waiting line even today (Mother's day)
- Food came out pretty fast
- Taste was delectable
- Pretty large portion sizes for a leftover meal
- Cost was worth the price ($10 each option)

Pro/Con Depending on the person:
- Food is definitely on the heavier side, so you won't leave hungry.

Overall, it was a pretty great experience.

reviews.text: I've been looking for a good Indian food restaurant in Lafayette, and I am glad to have found it. Ordered takeout on a snowy day, and it was the perfect warm, spicy dinner. I only have one complaint, that the garlic naan have more garlic- but I say that about literally every garlic themed dish every so that one is on me. Give them a try!!

Parking is kind of hard to get to, but it is well worth it. We ordered the chicken tikka masala and it was flavored so well and it's creamy. The portions are decent sized for take out. We ordered the regular spice level and it was perfect for my husband, but a little spicy for me. But I also have issues with jalapenos sometimes. Will happily go there again.

Moved to Lafayette and needed some good food, with the help of the yelp app i called and ordered some take out from Taste of India. It was a good decision. The food was really good and i have went back several times. Great food and quick service.
We have eaten at this restaurant twice in the last few weeks. Both times the restaurant was clean and service was good. Food was delicious!

Tried this for delivery. Definitely a good value, as I have tons of leftovers. Masala paneer was one of the best I have had. I'd skip the chicken 65 next time. It wasn't bad, just reminded me of a buffalo wing. Naan bread was huge, plenty to share. Paneer dish came with a huge portion if rice. Flavors were really good. Would order again!!

The BEST quality and value! I always look forward to meals from Taste of India because I know it'll be great food for a super reasonable price. My personal favorites are the paneer tikka masala and the garlic naan, but it seems like you really can't go wrong with any item on the menu. As long as I'm in WL, I'll be a regular :)
I love that this Indian food can be ordered in a variety of heat because I love the flavors of Indian food, but can't always handle the heat. Their naan is also so delicious!

We got the vegetable biryani and it was delicious! We also got dal Makhni, which was more like a home cooked style compared to the restaurant style. Would definitely be getting food from here again. :)
Wow we were really impressed with the options and how everything tasted. We loved the naan and the rice dishes.

I want to comment again. My husband, my friend and I had a take-out order for lunch . Contrary to my positive views of the first time, we were not satisfied with both the employee and the meal. The employee was not polite, and the taste of the meal was not as same as our first time  and the service was very sloppy. Most likely I will not come back again.
So I always get carry out or delivery from here. It's good Indian food and I love getting it once a month.

This is a new Indian restaurant near campus. I think it opened quite recently because I hadn't even heard of it until I was browsing Door Dash looking to spend some credits and it popped up as a place that offered delivery to my house. We tried it tonight and it was SO good, by far the best Indian food I've had in the Lafayette area so far (which is a very low bar, but still). I had the butter chicken, which is my favorite Indian dish, and it was perfection. Not overwhelmingly spicy, but very flavorful; very creamy and rich without tasting like tomato sauce mixed with heavy cream. I also had paratha bread and it was great. Prices were quite reasonable ($12 for curries that come with rice). They have a lunch buffet and we look forward to visiting the restaurant in person for that.

Great food, nice service and decent price for the large portions of food. We got Tikka Masala, Lamb Biryani and naan. We asked for medium spicy (4) and it was full of flavor and spice! Not bland like other campus restaurants.

This is the second time I've been here, first for dinner and second for the lunch buffet. 

DINNER: I ordered a lamb curry with a spicy level of 3 out of 6 (assuming halfway was a medium spice, I was wrong). My first bite was exquisite, but oh my goodness was it extremely spicy. I was sweating and sniffling, but kept on eating because it was so flavorful. My friend got a biryani dish with a 1 level spice. I didn't think it was as good as my lamb curry, but it was probably due to my adjusted spice taste. 

LUNCH: The buffet is the biggest bang for your buck Indian deal around the area. There's a lot of variety, but lacks the premium dishes (ex. Lamb curry) for obvious reasons. They do a good job of keeping everything in stock and the buffet line clean (unlike other buffet places). Their butter chicken and mango lassi are definitely worth trying. 

SERVICE: Absolutely phenomenal. For both meals, we were seated almost immediately. For dinner, we had about 2-3 servers serving us and it felt like we were kings. The food came for me and my friend at almost exactly the same time. They checked on us frequently. For lunch, the same quality of service is expected, but might be less attentive due to the more customers and you can't blame them. 

AMBIENCE: Music is great. Lighting is great at night. Everything is very clean as well. 

One note to the owner is the table we sat at for lunch was somewhat wobbly. Didn't mind it at all, but might be an issue for others?

Highly recommended.
The food is absolutely fantastic here. Definitely my new go-to place for Indian food in West Lafayette.

The service is excellent along with the food. This is the I bring people. Their buffet along with their takeout is excellent. Their buffet is incredibly well priced. The decode and atmosphere are great and it is very clean. It opened very recently but I have still been 10+ times. Would recommend as the best Indian food in this area.

Point of reference: my experience took place one of the first weeks restaurants were reopening after covid-19. Sunday right about noon time no one else in the establishment customer-wise. None while we dined and none while leaving. Too bad since everything about this place gets a thumbs up from me. I'm not a fan of curry and therefore tend to not seek out Indian food to begin with but I also know there's more to Indiana menus than curry. I got the lamb rogan josh which is made with a yogurt-based sauce. I went with three other individuals and everyone got something different and none of those dishes were curry either. We also got the garlic naan. We all tried each other's food and we all liked all of them two others thought the rogan josh was their second favorite. I know one of the others was butter chicken. The waiter was so nice and kept my water glass full, which is saying something since I drink a lot while I eat. He thanked us about ten times between his last service and us leaving. I still don't consider myself a "fan" of Indian food, but I'd happily eat there again.

This was my second visit to Taste of India but today I opted for the buffet menu and I have to say I was impressed. It is $10 if you pay cash and $11 if you pay via card. For an unlimited buffet with starters, the main course, dessert and drinks, I think it is one of the best deals on Indian food that you can get in the Greater Lafayette area. 
The owner reached out to me personally after my first review and explained that they were short-handed as they had just opened and told me that he had employed more help and today I was able to witness exactly that. We were seated as soon as we walked in and given a table that we selected.
The whole spread is very comparable to Sharma's Kitchen and at half the price, it is a deal that I cannot pass upon. Some of the food I ate at the buffet today included aloo tikki chaat, tandoori chicken, butter chicken, chicken pakodas, gajar ka halwa, kheer and mango lassi. They had several vegetarian options as well but as an avid meat lover, it was a hard pass for me. I would give the food a 4.5/5 as it was very delicious but I would have loved it if the Naan's were made to order so that they arrived warm instead of sitting out getting cold.
The ambiance of the place get a 5/5 as they have redone the interiors from what India Mahal used to have and it looks better and newer than before.
And finally, the service a 5/5 as they were much more focused on the people inside the restaurant than only giving online orders a priority.
I will be back for the buffet surely but I am also willing to give à la carte a second chance now that they are staffed well.

Absolutely delicious. It's only been open for two weeks but is already part of my weekly routine. The dinner can be a little expensive but it's definitely worth it. The $10 lunch buffet on the other hand, is the best deal you'll find anywhere in West Lafayette. Everyone there takes pride in the food they cook an all the waiters are very helpful. Couldn't recommend this place more

reviews.text:
After getting my wisdom teeth extracted, I wanted to eat/drink some smooth liquids and decided to order some soup from Noodles and Co. They never disappoint with flavors!

I ordered a Tomato Basil Bisque Soup and a Thai Chicken soup. Both were awesome! The pickup was really quick after ordering on Yelp. You walk through the doors and see your bag packed up on the side along with other pick up ordered.

I ordered soup and cauliflower noodles from here, which were both terrific. Social distancing here is not the greatest. They also didn't give me enough plasticware--I just wound up with a spoon for them. It seems like they are overwhelmed.

best noodles & company branch ever! been coming here since a month ago. 
Today I ordered from their app and used my BOGO rewards (get one free small entree with an order of a small entree)--or so I thought. I rechecked the app twice to see if I applied my rewards, and they all checked up. However, when I got home and opened the paper bag, there was only one plate. After I finished eating, I went back to N&C to see what went wrong. Turns out, the reward didn't come through... 
They checked the system and it said that I can't claim the reward then... 
but they gave me a free small entree nonetheless! that's not all, they gave me extra protein!!! (the BOGO reward didn't come with protein.) Make this branch your regular!!! they deserve it.

Really great place to drop by if you're hungry, in the area,  and need it quick. My most important advice for Noodles & Company? To-go portions are always smaller. If you need to go, order it for there, wait a bit, THEN ask for a takeout box. Also, potstickers always seem to be running out (or I'm just supremely unlucky). If they're available, get them. They could be a meal all on their own.

Overall, they serve really good noodles, have plenty of seating (including an outdoor patio for nicer days and booths), and is close to school. Well, being in the Chauncey area, they just have a really good spot. I also found it convenient that you could move around the tables yourself. It certainly works for when there's bigger groups around. 

The main factor that contributes to whether or not you would like the flavor, because the flavor profile does lean towards heavily westernized. Because while I love their Japanese Pan Noodles, the Thai Green Curry with Shrimp, Pad Thai, and potstickers, I'll also be the first to admit that it leans more towards hot-spicy and salty than spices-spicy. However, the fact that they venture into as many different cultural flavors as they could (American, Russian, Japanese, Thai, Mexican, French, etc.) and have a steady flow of new things to try, always makes it interesting.

Order and pay at the cash register, remember to ask for a cup for water there if you need it, and claim a seat for yourself. The booths and the tables along the wall next to those booths have access to sockets if you want to charge your phone or work. Additionally, I found the two sets of doors you have to go through to get in to be very convenient in the winter when you need to shake the snow off your boots and clothes. SUPER casual, opens late, and (let's face it) is mostly a college student hangout. So, you know, lots of noise during the busier hours of the day.

EDIT: Forgot to mention, this place is one of the last resorts of all last resorts for special occasions and/or guests short of McDonald's. A lot of the time, people will take speakers or guests (family or business-oriented) to Triple X or Basil Thai if they're looking for a casual dining experience. This is especially true for when Maru Sushi, which is a few doors down, gets really backed up and the hangries drive people to the next nearest place to eat. However, from experience, it WILL get pretty crowded around graduation or holidays. And during the Superbowl, finals, and midterms they get really busy. The upside is that, if you can't find a suitable place to feed your visiting family during the busier times and you didn't make any reservations? Noodle & Company will definitely have something available, even if it's only take-away.
I'm not sure what this is? I ordered spaghetti and meatballs. This is what I got. How do you forget the sauce?

I got a small Japanese noodle and small shrimp pad Thai, for $13 it was pretty good! Decent sized and had good flavor. The pad Thai is a little on the hotter side which I liked. It was also very quick, I ordered in the store and was out within ten minutes. I went around an off time but I've heard it can get very busy.
Great service, clean environment.  I love the penne pasta with parmesan chicken as well as the tomato soup. Fresh ingredients!

I had mine delivered by Hungry Boiler.  Not the best birthday meal but it is better than nothing.  The alfredo sauce is better than mine and that is saying a lot.  The breadstick was hard and cold.  I paid extra for a side salad and I think it has more croutons than lettuce or cheese.  I also paid extra for extra sauce and got about 1.5 teaspoons of sauce.  I expected more.  Oh well.  At least the pasta and sauce tasted great.

I was very excited to try noodles and company at this location. Yes the wait was short, but they had no soda in their machine and they didn't bother to let me know this before they sold me the cup. When they brought out the food, what I received was something that could be compared to a microwaved food bowl from the grocery store. Not only that, but there was hardly any cheese in one of the mac and cheese bowls I ordered. I would have rather made boxed mac and cheese than eating here again. Not coming back.

Went in last week for lunch and got the tomato bisque and it was literally just spaghetti sauce. Went in again today and ordered the chicken noodle soup with a side Mac and cheese. The Mac and cheese was so dry and the soup noodles were severely over cooked and the chicken wasn't even shredded. To top it off the manager who had dirty blonde hair was so rude to me and every other costumer I saw her interact with.
Average noodles, quick and cheap.  Nothing real special about this place.  You can have your noodles delivered to you, but they don't cross the river -_-

I wasn't super impressed with my first visit to a Noodles & Co (years ago at a different location) but my husband and I had lunch here yesterday and I really enjoyed it.  The regular noodle bowls are only $6, and then it costs a couple bucks more to add meat.  Overall it makes for a pretty filling but not terribly expensive lunch, and my penne rosa noodle bowl was quite tasty (penne with slightly spicy tomato cream sauce, spinach, mushrooms and tomatoes, to which I added parmesan crusted chicken).  My husband really enjoyed his Indonesian peanut saute. There are a lot of things on the menu I'd like to try, including soups and sandwiches.  
You can order online in advance for pickup, which is very convenient if you're in a hurry, although the food came very promptly anyway.
This will definitely go into our regular lunch rotation.
A quick meal option. Portion size is good only for a meal but I its not too expensive so it's alright.

Taste = Not so good. Pad Thai didn't come with the usual sauce and it was very dry. 
Service = Terrible. The cashier didn't even tell me that I could add chicken to my Pad Thai and took the order in a robotic manner.

If everything was as good as the Chicken Velacruz Salad, this would be a five star rating! But let's be honest, it's just Noodles & Company. Better than going to McDonald's but still just a borderline fast food restaurant. But definitely try the Chicken Velacruz Salad!
Decent food with friendly service. This location can be difficult for family eating due to it being so close to campus.

This place is pretty good.  The portions aren't huge but they are satisfying.  This chain reminds me of Panera Bread but cheaper.  Their prices are reasonable and the food is tasty.  Food prep is fairly quick and they bring it to your table in semi-waiter style service.  We have found that we like most of their pasta dishes.  However, the last time we went here we noticed that they started carrying wraps and sandwiches.  We haven't tried that stuff yet but, if it's anything like their pastas, I'm sure it will be good.  The staff at this location is always friendly and I have never had an issue with my food.  The lunch rush can make it pretty busy and cramped for space but that is to be expected.  I would highly recommend coming here for a lunch with your friends.  We used to meet up here all the time and always enjoyed it.

I like dining at this chain restaurant because it is quick and fairly good tasting.

I like most of the dishes and the pasta is consistently cooked properly.  My favorite and goto dish is Penne Rosa, has a nice spicy sauce.  Never get a small bowl, unless its for a child.  The regular bowl is the proper serving.  It can get rather busy and unkept at lunch time or on game day with football season.  Near campus, the Village parking is a pain to find a spot.  Your best move is if you're looking for a quick meal, drive past and see if they're packed.

An bouns here is they've installed new soda machine with a touch screen interface.  This allows you to choose your choice of flavoring.  I think you can mix pops in cool combinations this way.  I dislike soda pop in general so its not as exciting for me.

Food is decent, but don't bother with the veggie additions - not worth it for the very few additional veggies actually added. Gave feedback in private through the app - heard nothing. And since being disappointed with the sparse extras has happened several times, here's the warning on Yelp.

Good food, a step up in price from say the Fiesta or Panda Express nearby. Very popular and always crowded. It can be hard to find a table, let alone a clean one. Patio is nice in summer. Friendly, competent, efficient staff taking orders.

reviews.text:
Their food is great. I got the shrimp with onion and curry....delicious! The vegetables were fresh and not overcooked, shrimp 1.5" in diameter; even the fortune cookies were fresh! 

Super friendly staff that really go above and beyond for their customers. Great food, great service, great price. Give these guys a try. You will NOT be disappointed.

Stopped in for lunch with my four year old. She's a fried rice/egg roll kind of girl. We got egg rolls, General Tso, Pork with mixed vegetables and both white and fried rice.

We planned to eat in, and were lucky there was a table. They only have three tables. Tables are nice, though. There is no table service, so expect to eat a to-go meal on site - plastic utensils, no plates, etc.

Food took maybe 15 minutes during lunch rush. Not bad. 

Start with the good - egg rolls came hot and were pretty good. 4/5 on that item. The mixed vegetables in the pork dish were firm, but cooked. I enjoyed those. The pork and the sauce in that dish was pretty bad. Pork was all red like at some Chinese places. I don't know why, and it was so so so sweet. Crazy sweet. If I ordered "Honey Pork" I would expect super sweet. I ordered "Pork w/ mixed veg". Not great.

General Tso was very bready. Sometimes it's like that. Also very very sweet. No spice at all. Bummer. I don't like sweet Tso. Not a ton of broccoli with it either.

Fried rice was pretty weird. It was very yellow rice with a few onions and peas mixed in. Not what I expect when I get fried rice. It tasted ok - a little plain. But just not what I wanted.

On the whole, the service was good, interior was very clean for a Chinese takeout, egg rolls pretty good, everything else meh. If you're not too picky about Chinese places, you may like this one, so don't let my review sway you to not try it. Just didn't work for me.

It's a clean place for sure, but the service is very minimal. My cashier was a young girl who looked more interested in her phone than my business. I remember smiling and apologizing for taking awhile to place an order, but she looked at me for a few seconds before turning away.

I hoped the food would make up for the lack of personality in this restaurant. Sadly, the beef and broccoli lacked a depth of flavor and was overall bland and unimpressive. The orange chicken was a little better if you were looking to eat ridiculously sweet orange peel slices disguised as pieces of chicken. As for the egg roll - dry and inedible. 

One plus was the cashier's younger sister (I'm assuming). She handed us our food and had a nice bubbly personality.
Ordered this for delivery and they showed up very quickly. Food was decent for Chinese takeout (broccoli beef, orange chicken, fried rice) and you get a lot of food for the cost.
Ordered carry out, didn't receive everything and the food didn't sit well with anyone in the family. We won't be back.

No fortune cookie.
Pork inside the rice was....different.
No fortune cookie.
At least it was warm.

I called in a week ago to order some carry out and the young lady on the phone was extremely rude to me. After screaming "what you want?" and "what size?" I was put off and explained I had never been there before and could she please explain what sizes the food came in, she screamed "extra large or combo!" I told her she was extremely rude and would not be giving her/them my service. I never got the chance to try their food but based on the poor customer service, I'm assuming the food is crap as well. First impressions are everything.

I used to love this place. I don't know what happened. The last time we ordered it, my chickens rejected the left overs. That's how bad it was! The egg drop soup also made my entire living room smell like a fart. Very disappointing!

I was happy to see this place open up so close to where I live. I had yet to find Chinese food in Lafayette that wasn't disgusting. They have a large menu with good prices. They have lunch specials for $5. Definitely the best Chinese food in Lafayette.
Fresh food. However we all thought it was a bit bland. The people working there are VERY friendly! Even gave us 2 free pops with our take out!
Really low quality takeout. Made me and my boyfriend sick and we couldn't even finish our food.

We have been getting carry out from China King since they opened over a year ago. The food is always fresh, burn your mouth hot. It is always ready within 10 - 15 minutes. The fried wonton are the best in town! This is definitely an "American Chinese" restaurant which has all of the standard dishes - General Tso's, lo mein, ect... The place is clean, you can see the entire kitchen. The cashier is usually busy as there are many phone orders coming in but they are always polite.

This was the first Chinese place I found in Lafayette that I would recommend.   Chicken and vegetables,  Mongolian beef, and pork fried rice.   All good.  Staff was super nice.   10 min service time from order to service. I'll be back.
reviews.reviewerLocation: Denali National Park and Preserve, AK

reviews.text: Best american Chinese food in lafayette and west lafayette!!!!!!! They have only 3 tables so not very good to eat in but the quality, freshness, amount, cleanness, taste and price..........they are perfect. Just go and get it!!!!

So we usually go to En Lai on Creasy but they were closed tonight, so we decided to try China King.  SO much better.  The food actually tastes fresh and the place is really clean.  The employees are really nice there too.  This is our new Chinese food place.
This place is incredible. Food is always fresh and flavorful, service and delivery quick. Highly recommend the Four Seasons and the Chicken with Garlic sauce. Egg rolls are great, too!

Best Chinese food ever the freshness is the best and using real fresh ingredients and the orange chicken has the natural flavor of orange and shrimp low mein is fantastic and the rice  5 star quality for the price

Went to my first Chinese buffet since I moved here! I thought everything was good. Until the nexy day! Food poisoning! I was sick all weekend! Throwing up all day night and the next day!  Missed work today because of the nausea! Horrible! Guess chinese isnt good for you after all. This has definitely made my mind up, not ever eating chinese again!!!! If i could have rated no stars i would have!
Their crab rangoon was good. But do not order from this place unless you like some soggy, thick battered meat (if you can find any). Come on. I hate to say this, but Panda express is so much better.

It's not a buffet, just a counter-style Chinese place with a couple of tables inside. They mostly serve takeout, which is what I got. We ordered a variety of things and they were all pretty good. The crab rangoon was really good, and the rest of the Chinese food staples were all as you'd expect. If you're looking for cheap, good Chinese takeout I recommend this place.

reviews.text:
Surprised to see I haven't given Potbelly's a review given how often I come here, but that's going to change!

A real step up from the other nearby sandwich locations, I'm a big fan of the Mediterranean sandwich, especially for those avoiding meat.  I hadn't had a hummus sandwich before but now I find myself trying to replicate it at home as well.

I also need to credit Potbelly's with introducing me to zapps chips which has become one of my favorites, especially the slightly sweet voodoo chips!

I've found that even when there's a line the service is pretty quick and during some of my Sunday lunches there's live music, another treat.

The staff here are so friendly and chatty! I appreciate how efficient they are while also making an effort to getting to know their customers. Sadly, the tuna sandwich (my usual favorite!) I had didn't agree with me, so I'm going to avoid that one in the future.

Don't you love it when you order a sandwich delivered via Grubhub, and when the sandwich arrives, there's no meat on it? This is the third consecutive order they have screwed up, so you call the Potbelly that made the sandwich and the manager tells you "you can either come in and get the sandwich remade (during a pandemic), or call Grubhub for a refund. I've got sandwiches to make, I don't have time for this." No apology. Just nastiness.

Eat somewhere else. It's not worth putting up with the disgusting people who run this place.

The sandwich was pretty good, but the customer service was terrible.  It was my first time and they weren't helpful at all. I ordered an original size and they gave me a big size and charged me for it too. Won't be going back anytime soon

This is the best sub shop experience, clean, friendly, and relaxed urban eatery stuck between the city library and campus with the best Subway, Panera, and Wendy's, a tad of McAllisters too. Menu isn't too big or offering anything all original (like that overly posh CoreLife) but it is familiar and gives fun additions few places offer like Buffalo Chicken and blue cheese. The app is smart - integrating gift cards and mobile payments. Starbucks leads mobile ordering (annoyingly! wish Starbucks would stop hiding hoards of cash off shore to avoid taxes!) and great to see others catching up. Our group of 5 was treated well and did subs and some various small dishes. I had a salad with extra Franks cuz some green and good kick goes a long way for me! The manager was super cool with my dumb gift card not wanting to work (felt bad about that!! guess older gift cards should be left alone). My Uptown salad came out like the photos look! Very surprised at this, everyone seemed happy and will have to come back. Have since been back three times! Salads continue to win big for me tho chili isn't near as tasty or rich as Firehouse. Today got two friends in for their first times. Both seemed real happy, Subway is dead!

DO NOT EAT HERE. Ordered for a group of 60, two days in advance. They proceeded to show up TWO HOURS and 25 minutes late! At one point they lied and said they're finishing up the last sandwich and would be there in ten, and showed up 45 minutes after that. Horrible experience.

Was there a couple of weeks ago.
The place was not clean. The table was so yucky the napkins stuck to the table.
I ordered "The Wreck"
and the wreck was a total wreck. The meat was almost nonexistent and the service was totally crappy/unfriendly.
I was there at 11:40am.
The girl at the front was wearing a Disgustingly soiled soiled attire.
This place is yucky!
Always had a wonderful experience previously but got awful food poisoning and ended up vomiting heavily in the library bathroom. Must have been something wrong with the meat.

Nothing fancy, but I grabbed a tasty chicken and cheddar sandwich with my choice of bun and  ingredients all in a matter of minutes.  The line moved fast, the employees were friendly, and the sandwich was reasonably priced.  I had never heard of this franchise before, but was glad I stopped by when I was on the go and didn't want to take an hour to dine.  

Review #254

I am a very frequent customer here. I always enjoy my food and want to come back. My go to is the chicken salad sandwich with extra mayo. It is very tasty and easy if you need a quick lunch. It's not super fancy or classy, it's just quick and easy. The employees are very nice. The manager is almost always in the trenches helping out the staff. Try one of the milkshakes, it's 100% worth it. I will be back, but I'm sure they could have guested that at this point.
Sandwiches are crazy good. Went in with friends 10 minutes before closing and they didn't shoot us any dirty looks. Staff was really nice

Not at the top of my list for sandwich places but it's still good!! The location is a little hidden, especially if you don't know your way around campus. But I love that they include a little cookie on each smoothie. It's also a bit quieter than other places on campus. I think it's a good place to meet up with friends. They do have limited parking for the actual restaurant but no worries because purdue has a big parking garage only a block away!
Just my opinion, but the food was great and the atmosphere is pretty cool. It's a hidden gem on campus.

I've ordered food from here twice and never disappointed .  The sandwiches are so fresh and the perfect portion size .  Also, the cookies are dangerously delicious .  My favorite is the Italian sandwich and the oatmeal choco chip or chocolate brownie cookie..  Can't make decisions!

Easily the best subs in town. They toast their subs much longer than subway so you'll get a slight crunch when biting into the sandwich. What I like most is how well the flavors come together in all of their subs. Add the hot pepper and pickels, you can thank me later. 

The price for soda is a little high. So is the price of soup. Have not tried the soups so I can't comment. In terms of subs, this place beats subway and jimmy johns hands down.

Potbelly's sandwiches are great.  This place is by far the best bang for your buck when it comes to subs in the area.  It's cheaper than Jimmy Johns and you get more food, they also taste much better than Subway.  The staff here is always friendly and quick when making your sandwich.  They sometimes have a person playing guitar and singing mellow songs which is a nice touch while you're eating.  You can't go wrong with coming here. It's cheap, quick, and the food is good.  I would highly recommend giving it a try.

Potbelly is a good sandwich shop. Personally, I don't find their subs super impressive. They taste like meat and bread. But definitely above Jimmy John's and Subway quality. I like the wide array of items they offer. They have sides of pasta salad, various bottled sofas, and REALLY good shakes. I repeat. The shakes are delicious.
I got the "a wreck" with bacon and all the extras minus mushrooms regular chips and drink it was well worth the stop most likely to return

We ordered a pastrami and an italian sandwich. Toasted nicely, fresh bread. Good quality sandwiches, although I thought they could have used just a little more meat in the sandwiches. Nonetheless, glad we tried them.

As a college student who gets tired of the usual chain restaurants of Panda Express, Chipotle, Taco Bell, Subway, and Jimmy Johns around campus, this place is worth the extra walk down Chauncey for its flavor, price, and atmosphere. It is tucked away around a corner so it is usually never crowded; the sandwiches are hot, flavorful, customizable, and at an affordable price. The vibe and style is something reminiscent of what you'd find along Berkeley. My go-to is always their "Pizza Sandwich!"

reviews.text:
As usual one of my favorite go to pizza places in West Lafayette. 

My sister and I used one of these Thursday deals and got an extra large 20" pizza. That was awesome. I also liked that the employees were wearing masks, ensuring COVID precautions are being taken. 

Definitely try their philly sauce base & jalapeño pepper topping ( if you love some spice - ITS VERY HOT! )
This place is always delicious. Cheesestix are a must!! It's always clean when I come in for pickup, and they deliver to areas of town that are more sparse on options.

This is my favorite pizza place in West Lafayette, and it's mostly because of their crust. It's not quite a new york thin crust, but it's the best and closest thing you'll get out here. Their barbecue chicken pizza with jalapeños is my go-to, and i've never had anything but positive experiences with their staff. 
Waiting outside for my pizza to be done? You got it. They have a really nice outdoor seating area and were more than happy to give me a water while I waited. 10/10 will order pickup again
And as far as parking goes, there's plenty more in the side lot and a little further down the street.

The workers are extremely lost. Forgot half my order. Girl at counter was yelling at the other employees. Been waiting in car ever since.

I do not recommend.

Some of the better pizza in the area especially compared to Pizza Hut and Papa John's, easy to find coupons for Mad Mush (as it gets called) too to make it the all round winner for value and options. Those cheesy stix! I graduated Purdue almost a decade ago and still hear "CHEESE STIX" in my sleep. Great selection of toppings and easy going menu. Quality isn't much better or worse than the big chains but I'd say more Dominos than the casual. For the price and chance for amazing cheeststix (which are truly the best meeting of bread and dairy) I would rather Mad Mushroom over all but Puccini's but I cannot afford that sweet Italy. Mad Mush it is!

IU has Pizza X. It also has Aver's, Mother Bear's, and your staple chains. Visiting Purdue, everyone only talks about Mad Mushroom: it's a staple of sorts, you see, just like Pizza X breadsticks at IU. 

I first had them 5 years ago during a cursory Purdue visit, followed up by a visit the following year where we ordered a potato pizza that we couldn't stop raving about.

When I went back to campus, after my first stop at The Den for my signature Den Pop, we headed to Mad Mushroom. The vibe? Stoner. The scent? Unbelievable. The food? Don't even GET me started.

Most places do cheesestix nowadays- heck, Papa Johns is famous for 'em! But there's something about Mad Mushroom stix that are unique. Perhaps that's just the emotional side of me but hey, it is what it is. They're consistently cheesy without being overwhelming or greasy, and the ranch dipping sauce provided is the perfect accompaniment, although the cheese sauce is a crowd favorite as well. 

I don't think I'll ever be able to visit Purdue without a stop at Mad Mush for some classic cheesestix.

We didn't actually get to eat, the service was just so rude from the get go. Went in and was told to wait a few, server was on the phone - no problem! But then she slammed the phone down, stomped to the kitchen and came back to us and said it was going to be a 45 min wait for food. I told her thanks and we would go since they were so busy (and she obviously did not want us there). Whew!

Very good food. Nice area for outside seating as well. Had the cheese sticks and they were amazing. Pizza was very good and fresh.  Also tried the cheesesteak grinder and that was delicious also. Highly recommend.

While the cheesestix are very good, and I understand that all do the COVID-19 meausurrs are in place...I shouldn't be forced to wait outside in 34° weather for my pizza. If I've already been inside to pay for my order, what good does kicking me out for 10 minutes do? Either I'm in or I'm out.

Very disappointed with the management.

Great place with a fun atmosphere. Lots of televisions to watch the games. Fun restaurant after Purdue beats some other team. Easy to get to. They pizza was delicious, but there were not a lot of seats. They also ran out of ice. Eventually they stopped taking orders because it was so crowded. 

Cheesy bread was good and my teenage daughter says it is worth the wait. It was good, but not worth the 1-1/2 hours we had to wait. Staff was friendly and the bathrooms were clean. I would go back, but not after a game. I could have driven home and eaten a full pizza by the time we finished.
I really love the pizza here! The service and quality is great. Definitely a solid pizza joint for Purdue students!

Came in at 155 and was immediately kicked out even though they don't close until 2. She started yelling at me when I just came in for a water to drink while I ate a pizza I bought from them. She was very rude and did not care about the customer.

I frequently go to Mad Mushroom on campus for lunch. They have a nice variety to choose from. Most of my coworkers get a salad and they are always fresh and appetizing. I've had pizza and cheese sticks from the Lafayette location and that was YUMMY! Mad Mushroom is a nice place near campus to get a quick meal and that's what I like about it. Plenty of seating too! I think the prices are a bit on the high side though. Food is pretty tasty nonetheless. Check it out for lunch or dinner if you're in the area!

Got pizza delivered at work for lunch Friday night and it was awesome!  I had only ever gotten MM from the Underwood store before so I was unsure about service but I was not disappointed.  Driver came EXACTLY on time, even with road construction detours and called me right after he pulled up.  The pizza was hot, fresh, and had a thick outer crust that was awesome dipped in the garlic butter sauce that came with. I will definitely use this as a lunch option again!!!!

I have been here a few times now to get the cheese sticks and it has never disappointed. It's pretty consistently fresh and hits the spot. The ranch dipping sauce is probably my favorite. I think it's a Purdue thing but not sure how people eat cheese sticks with nacho cheese dipping sauce haha. Staff were nice, order was made quick, clean and plenty of seating on the inside. Overall good experience and will probably be back. I want to try the other menu items.
Always have to go here when I'm at Purdue! I love the cheese sticks with cheese sauce.

Despite the reviews they do a pretty good pizza and are generous with the toppings.  We got the chicken Alfredo with artichoke and the tripleonini.  Both were very tasty, however I wish they were cooked a bit more.  The cheese sticks / cheese bread is as good as every other local family pizza chain around the Midwest. Pizza dough slathered in olive oil and garlic then covered in heaping mounds of freash mozzarella cheese.  Served with up to 6 side sauces of cardiac arrest inducing high fat high salt high sugary goodness.

We look forward to visiting again, but I'll ask for a longer cook on my pie next time.
Pretty good pizza for a more than reasonable price. Late hours are great for a college campus!

Food was good would recommend although the women that took our order with pink hair was honestly so rude it made me not want to come back . She was very rude to customers and every employee. I genuinely feel bad for those workers.

I visited this place to redeem a Hooked deal for 25% off any menu item. I ordered a medium formaggi specialty pizza. Their price per additional topping is also much steeper than I expected, I just ordered a few other toppings and it added up to $15. I remember enjoying the taste of their four cheese pizza a lot, so I was very excited. This excitement unfortunately soon dissipated when we received the pizza. 

The crust was completely limp, and there were only sprinklings of toppings sparsely scattered throughout the pie. When we spoke to the manager, he said he was sorry but the toppings are measured and that is how their pizzas are made. I felt as if they were deliberately skimping to maximize profits and cut quality. It looked as if although we ordered black and green olives there were maybe 10 olives on the whole pizza. We definitely ordered tomatoes, and we saw maybe five or six small pieces of tomato as well. With the mushroom topping, I maybe saw only a couple of mushrooms on the whole thing. It was also not cooked well, as it could not even be held because the crust was so limp. I was eagerly looking forward to this, but now unfortunately I must say I am unlikely to return. For a $15 pizza, that was a total rip-off.

images.alt: Photo of Amelia's - W Lafayette, IN, United States

reviews.text:
I've been here twice on my way to work and I've been pleasantly surprised how quickly they made my coffee. Order was correct and tasted great. They have some packaged snacks by the register if you're hungry too. 

Amelia's is located in the basement of Armstrong down the stairs in the middle of the main lobby.

Update: a little before closing, at 4:00 pm, the are quicker 

Coffee and snacks conveniently located in the basement of ARMS.  They have a healthy variety of coffee and sandwich options (all Starbucks based), and the prices are normal for a coffee shop. There's not much seating- students take over the tables wether or not they are customers. The worst part is the wait. There appear to be 6-8 employees at one time, and every single order causes mass confusion. Expect to spend extra ti

This coffeeshop, located in the basement of ARMS, is a great place to grab a quick lunch. They have a number of sandwich options, all of which are good, and are very reasonably priced. They have breakfast items like bagels and muffins/donuts and also serve Seattle's Best Coffee

Photo of Grilled Chicken and Rice - West Lafayette, IN, United States. Outside
Photo of Grilled Chicken and Rice - West Lafayette, IN, United States. Menu
Photo of Grilled Chicken and Rice - West Lafayette, IN, United States

reviews.text: So good! Amazing and authentic taste! Loved the Kibbeh!!!! I have never found a place in town that serves real Kibbeh. Everything was wonderful.

I don't know what the service is like out of the physical restaurant, but I can tell you we won't be buying again after the service from the food truck. 

The food truck was scheduled to be at the local church in Battle Ground and we preordered food two hours ahead. We got confirmation that our pickup time was 5:30. We showed up at 5:20 just to be sure we got good hot food. They told us they were a "running little" behind when we arrived. I didn't get my food until 6:45. (2 Gyros and 2 shawarma shouldn't take more than a few minutes each to make.) I watched people walk up, confused by the lack of a menu on the truck, be told they couldn't order at the window (BTW, what food truck can't take orders right at the window?), had to order using a website, and still get their food before I did. When we did finally receive our food, the shawarma was bland. The hummus had a very thin consistency and was without much flavor. The gyros were passable, but I've had better in town. 

All in all it was a not only disappointing experience, it was an angering expedition at having to wait well over an hour for food that shouldn't have taken more than 10 min to prepare.

This is an up-and-coming business selling Middle Eastern Street food. Happened to come across it after seeing their food truck outside. They only do take-outs and deliveries and are in the process of establishing their kitchen. 

The owner and staff are very friendly and provided us with great service whilst chatting about their new establishment. 

They have a lot of vegan options (hummus, falafel, tabouleh etc) and sandwiches/shawarmas. Whilst waiting for our order, we got to try some of their falafel (complimentary!) which was really delicious and crisp to the touch. The tahini sauce accompaniment was okay, I personally felt the Tahini flavor was a little too overwhelming and may require other flavors/sauces to bring it more into balance. 

To go, we got the Beef (steak) shawarma. This came in a paper box (which I really appreciated, rather than a foam/plastic container). The shawarma was pre-made and then toasted as they are still in the process of setting up their full kitchen. I'm a huge shawarma fan and it is almost always my go-to item when I'm at a Middle Eastern place. I'd have to say their steak shawarma wasn't quite what I hoped but does have the makings of a great shawarma. The beef has good seasoning but could use with some more, and although there were little bits of pickled vegetables in the shawarma, it gets drowned in all the meat. The shawarma was pre-made, and because it was heated up on one of those sandwich toasters, it really flattens out the wrap when technically it should be full and juicy. It came with Tahini sauce on the side & a coleslaw like salad with potato chips.

Prices are very reasonable for take-outs and delivery. 

Would I go back? Yes. I'd like to give their shawarmas another go and see how they come along as they establish themselves.
Some of the best food around! Great grilled chicken and rice (as the name would suggest) and great shawarma. Glad they have a permanent location now to add to the food truck.

I absolutely love this place! Their falafel sandwich is amazing, the hummus is always fresh, and the combos are a pretty good deal. The owners are always super friendly and I've never had a bad experience service wise or food wise in all my visits.

The owners are always incredibly friendly and seem like very genuine people. The food is also very tasty at a good price, and I always feel good after eating it unlike some other restaurants on campus.

reviews.text:
After a day of over doing, all of us wanted something to eat, so I suggested here since they had Monte Christo sandwiches. Not the kind I normally like but worth a try. My brother decided to get the chicken pot pie (southern Ohio boy always) and his friend wanted the chicken strips. While not fancy, a good variety to see how the food was. 

When I picked up the food 25 minutes later, everything was there and the system for pick up was smooth. Got to see the huge fish tank in the wall so I almost wished we felt like eating in. 

My brother and I got the southern style green beans ,made with baconfat. Betty Sue got fries and slaw. We also honey butter croissants with our meal.  All of us agree that everything was some of the best we ever had. The pot pie was huge. 

The Monte Christo was so good it that I wanted to eat it all in one sitting, but at 1440 calories, I saved half for breakfast. The raspberry sauce was perfect with the melted cheese, ham, turkey, and bread deep fried in light batter.

It was even just as good microwaved the next morning. So was the honey butter croissant. I even looked up to see if they had a location in Michigan. This is my last trip to Lafayette but if I have to come back, I would have a meal here.

I took a star off for the VERY small take out pop and ice tea.

Don't remember the last time I went to a Cheddar's. Stopped in for a quick dinner while in town. They were doing a decent job of distancing and most had on masks. Our server wore hers below her nose. She was professional and friendly. When she greeted our table she apologized for the mess on the floor and later came and cleaned it up. The dining room was quite disheveled for the beginning of a dinner shift. The crescent rolls are great! We had chips and cheese with salsa. The cheese had a bit of a congealed layer on top but was good. I ordered the salmon and broccoli. The fish was prepared well with good seasoning. Broccoli was steamed with a good crunch. Overall pleasant experience just need to do better on housekeeping and cleaning throughout the shift.

Not sure why the low ratings, seems the Yelp tendency to get overly dramatic with minor issues holds an unfair cloud over this great place. Have been here three times with different people, each time a good variety of the menu ordered, tasty drinks and food - ended up happy we picked this spot! I'm guessing there might be a problem with some overwhelmed by the (pre-social distancing) massive menu. But in a twist, the current paper-limited menu offers an easy and streamlined way to figure out what to get. I've sampled quite a bit and found nothing wrong with anything so far! Check out my photos, I love the ribs here. Very soft and rich, some of the best in the city! My friend gets the chicken tenders every time he visits a Cheddar's - myself and another both agreed the Monte Cristo is a work of genius. I'm personally happy to see a proper cocktail (the Painkiller) given a decent mix up. It doesn't seem to be perfected with fresh squeezed juices but it goes down real well and has been well balanced both times I got it. This is a refreshing classic chain restaurant without the obnoxious prices of Red Lobster/Longhorn or the iffy consistency of TGI/Olive Garden.
Decent food, great service. The broccoli cheese casserole was delicious.

We all love their croissants with honey butter 
We all had the chicken tenders with the broccoli cheese rice casserole and I had a salad  Good place for lunch when shopping or visiting Purdue

Really nice place, food is good, staff has been nice but the beer selection is trash. Why do you put so much effort in every thing to have dollar general beer on draft. So many times cheddars has missed out on me coming in cause of the beer selection. Fermented rice is not a compliment to a good meal it's an insult.

This place is interesting. Upscale indoor dining atmosphere that says fancy restaurant, but average American diner quality food that says Denny's. That being said, the prices are amazing and there is a good variety to choose from. They have a Monte Cristo sandwich which is so hard to find! Alssoooo their margaritas are HUGE and delicious and only $5.

Good food and a great place to meet family, friends or have a quick business lunch.

There are a couple of large businesses in the Lafayette area. I have to come up here frequently because of work and this is a great meeting point for my co-workers and also to have lunch with customers.

Every time I've been here the staff is always friendly and the food is consistent.

Large menu of items to choose from and I've always enjoyed every meal I've had here. Great lunch specials as well.

Would I go back? Definitely. This seems to be one of my consistent stops when I'm in Lafayette. Look forward to going back.

We went on a Friday night expecting it to be busy, and we were pleasantly surprised that despite being busy our server still took great care of us.  The food was excellent, especially their chicken tenders which they are know for, and their bartender knows how to make a killer margarita.

I gave them a 3 star because the table was dirty that they sat us at, it was only 1100 am so more than likely we were there first customers. The hostess didn't seem to think it was any big deal, however after I mentioned it she did say she would clean it off. And she did! She was also our waitress. 
Limited menu but that is expected with Covid19. Fish was good, but side dishes were just preheated

I am shocked by the 3 star rating for this restaurant. All of their food is made from scratch and tastes delicious. And the prices are lower than most other chain restaurants. I always get the croissants they are delicious. They fall apart and are full of sweet buttery goodness. We always get the homemade onion rings which are out of this world. Today I got the country fried steak dinner and it was filling and delicious. Service was great. And I love the fish tank and the huge paddle fans that are customary to this chain.

This was my late Father in Law's favorite restaurant in Lafayette.  I went here with my Mother in Law after a visit to the Social Security office to apply for Survivor's benefits.

Service was very good, food was very good, lots of menu selections so you can go easy or get a big meal.  Mother in Law loved it, she took her time but no one rushed us.

My only complaint was that the place was very very loud.  I don't know if it was an issue with the clientele that day but seemed like endless screaming and cackling from behind us.

I ordered the ribeye steak (medium) with broccoli and Mac & Cheese. The steak was flavorful but a tad bit dry, the Mac was very bland, and the broccoli was good. 

Service - I left my card at the bar and called back when I noticed. The hostess to me I could come and check to see if I left it. I insisted that she check before I drive back to the restaurant. I was placed on a brief hold for her to tell me they didn't have my card. I knew I left it there so I drove back for the bartender to have it waiting for me. I truly believe the hostess did not even attempt to provide good customer service. 

Overall - the experience was average at best.

Their food is good but I miss the bigger menu they had before Covid-19.  They no longer have the Lite size meals. We ate there today and their yummy croissants were pretty flat. The waitress said they didn't have time to rise before they were baked. They were a 5 star before Covid-19.  Hoping they bounce back once things open back up.

I'm not sure what changed between our first stop and this one, but this round was a bit underwhelming. Cheddar's was sold to the parent company of Olive Garden last year, so perhaps that has something to do with it.

There's lots to like about Cheddar's: the ingredients are fresh and, when they say that their menu is "from scratch", I'm inclined to believe them. The decor and atmosphere are very nice - the big paddle fans and the wall-sized fish tank are nice touches. The service has been consistently great.

On the down side, the beer list, which used to be quite good, and which included several nice local microbrews, has been dumbed down to the point of being truly ignorable. The ribs, which were great on our first visit, were dry and uninteresting this time. I remembered the coleslaw being really good on our first visit, but decidedly "meh" this time around. We were there with a party of five adults, and all ordered different foods. There wasn't really anything on the order that made anyone go "Wow, this is good!"

Another small nit to pick. We were there for a birthday, and mentioned it to both the waitress and the hostess. The response was, "Oh, okay." We went considering switching to Cheddar's as our regular family birthday celebration venue, but all things considered, I think we stick to what we're used to.

I have been here on 4 different occasions for lunch and dinner and during the week and weekend.
The food is made from scratch more so than the usual chain restos like chilis or applebees.  The food selection is vast considering the resto.  It has a southern flair to it and I enjoy that.
The service and staff is always nice but not necessarily attentive.
I only gave it three stars as all the occasions have been quite inconsistent from food quality, temperature and service.  I may return if I have to, but it is not on the top of my list.

We ordered an onion ring tower appetizer, which came quickly & was crunchy & deelish. The cream of broccoli soup had great cheesy flavor but was way to salty for me. I couldn't finish it. I also had the lunch portion of meatloaf & mashed potatoes. It was a healthy size serving but I don't think I would order it again. I thought it was very sweet. I did love the atmosphere of the restaurant & would definitely try it again.

Went last night to dinner with the family lets start with our waitress Darby she was very polite and handled the picky order we had very well she never let our drinks go dry and made sure to get us everything we asked for in a timely matter we had chicken tenders cheese curds and onion rings for appetizers they were all very good for dinner I had a cheese steak it was very good as normal my husband tryed there steak and baked potatoe and he enjiyed it very much my daughter tryed to baked potatoe soup and she loved it she let me try and I have to say defently 1 of my fav potatoe soups I have ever had my son had chicken tenders and it also was very good and juicy not dryed out or anything close to it thanks cheddars

Menu looked great but execution was underwhelming. Had the Wisconsin cheese bites. They were over fried and came out with cheese oozed out and all clumped together. Marina was very thick. Good flavor just thick. Cheese could have been solid if weren't over fried. 

For dinner had the blackened Salmon and shrimp.  It was good and broccoli cheese casserole was good too. Rice benefited from the flavors from the fish. This was probably the best dish we ordered. 

I had the salmon with rice and coleslaw. Bland flavors and over cooked fish. Rice had no flavor. 

Bourbon pork chop was good flavor over cooked. Mashed potatoes were good. Coleslaw was bland. 

Smokehouse burger was good not great.  Flavors just were not very deep. Felt everything was there but it didn't merry together. 

Overall disappointed on our first visit.

I went with a friend who really enjoys eating there.
It was so-so to me. She suggested we start with their honey butter croissants. They were very dry and tasteless. We also had an order of onion rings. They were very good. She took them home to feel the birds, the croissants. Since it was advertised as home cooking, I had the country fried steak. I did not enjoy the breading and it fell off. The steak was ok.
My friend always has the Monte Cristo she loved it 
with extra jam.
I can tolerate any restaurant as long as they serve Diet Coke so I was okay.
Service was very spotty. I like my server to least keep my glass filled or bring me one before I ask.
I may go back and try something else.
