Photo of Panera Bread - West Lafayette, IN, United States. The usual.
Photo of Panera Bread - West Lafayette, IN, United States. Ordered a HALF sandwich and they gave me a quarter??? THIS was $6? THIS?! I'm furious. Panera is the biggest rip off ever, I swear.

Photo of Panera Bread - West Lafayette, IN, United States
Photo of Panera Bread - West Lafayette, IN, United States

reviews.text: Came in and bought a chocolate muffin top (just so I could use the bathroom, if I'm being honest.) they didn't have it, so the manager gave me two gigantic chocolate chip cookies to comp for it. She didn't have to do that, since cookies are more expensive than the muffin tops. Totally made my day! Thank you. (And yes, their bathrooms were very clean!)

My Panera experience is usually limited to bagels, but I was persuaded to meet there for lunch by a colleague. Hardworking staff and fresh food, but I'm just not a fan of the smallish portion sizes. The sandwich tasted good but was about six bites. I'm not sure if that assessment is a reflection of the size of my mouth or the size of the sandwich. The chips now come in even smaller bags (1.0 ounce), next step they will be the size of soup cracker pouches. A skinny pickle spear rounded out the entree.

Four stars for helpful staff and freshness. Two stars for value. Overall three stars.

Went to dinner Friday 7/24/20. Ate in the dining room which was clean and covid set up nice.  EXCEPT: my cup lid was crimped up, went to counter and an employee whose 1st name started with a "C", took my lid and proceeded to use his NON-GLOVED hands and 'fixed" it. He gave it back to me to use, and was miffed when I asked for a new lid cause I pointed out he wasn't wearing gloves, I work in health center, can't afford to get sick. This young kid and his attitude just turned me off...

Tried the new delivery service today. Food was very fast! The French onion soup was good, as always but the corn chowder was jut not tasty. It needed a lot of something to make it not taste like puke. Chicken salad sandwich was so beyond bland. I even added arugula, red onion, spinach, and cucumber. Tasted like nothing.I usually love Panera but felt this was a disappointment. 

Update- the chicken chipotle sandwich is amazing! Also, they forgot my sesame bagel and replaced it with a 6 bagel variety bag! Now that is customer service. Amazing customer service and fast delivery! Broccoli soup was so good.

I like Panera Bread and I've been to all three of Panera Bread locations in Greater Lafayette. This one is particularly busy during the lunch hour due to many Purdue students, faculty and staff who stop here. Surface parking at Wabash Landing is very limited. I've not braved the parallel parking spots along State Street, but it is an option. There is also a parking garage behind the hotel, and it's a few minutes walk to Panera. (Lafayette residents aren't keen on parking garages; I'll leave that rant for another time.) Anyway, Panera is one of my go-to restaurants for lunch. Healthy, fresh ingredients and friendly, fast service. Can't go wrong.

First of all, the food from Panera is always good. Cream of wild rice and chicken is FIRE. I would also like to praise the young lady here who saw me in the bathroom and gave me a free cookie and pastry and a hug. You are too sweet and I will definitely be coming back!!

Haven't had a bad meal here and staff is always friendly. However it's no secret that value is far from Panera Bread's mind. Portion sizes are smaller and less filling than 5 Guys, Panda Express, Moe's, Green Leaf, and Lotsa just to name a few in the close vicinity. Also this location seems nice but there's a lack of open parking spaces during busy weekends. It's a large and well designed place and accommodates small and large groups. Outside seating is great for the summer. Sandwiches and soups are the typical Panera: super excessively salty and expensive but no other fast casual place I know does salads this good - good at helping forget you just dropped $8.50 on some bunny fare. For healthier non-salad food at this price point I highly recommend Town & Gown Bistro just down on River Rd does some amazing pasta, burgers, and breakfast foods, similar prices and way higher quality. If sit-down takes too long, go right up Chauncy for Qdoba, Captian Gyros, 5 Guys, Panda Express, or AJ's - all offer a lot more food for the price. Panera is a weird mix of pretend health (those sandwiches have way too much sodium for real nutrition types) and high prices. I keep hoping they get their act together and stop shipping in the soup from St Louis and offer real ingredients really worth 50% more than Wendys.

You've got to love Panera bread.  They have a little bit of everything - including lots of non-bread items for those in your party for carb conscious or have celiac disease. The soups and salads are excellent.
Coffee is usually great, but today it tasted like hot water was added to leftover coffee instead of brewing a fresh pot.  Also given a green Christmas cup.....which was unusual for March.
Generally dirty over all. Staff not helpful. I'm not giving it one star because the food tasted ok. I don't recommend this place.
Strawberry poppyseed salad is fantastic! Green power smoothie is great too. However, the parking is a catastrophe during holidays...

I love Panera. It's like my go to place when I'm not impressed with the more local choices. Staying in the Hilton it was ideal for brunch/dinner. 

I admit I overdid it a little but... The tomato soup!!!

I'll always keep coming back. The YP2 is epic and fills you right up!

We have been to this Panera two separate times as a large group and both times we left with disappointed. Food poisoning aside (yes, really), I feel the need to point out one specific incident. 

While waiting in line with our large group, the manager opened up a second register. In line was a group of teenagers and a middle-aged man who apparently have not been to Panera enough times to know what they wanted. They briefly left the register to go look at the menu (irritatingly located towards the back of the restaurant). In the meantime, a woman in her 80s walks straight up to register now without a line, and the manager couldn't have been more rude. "Ma'am, MA'AM, do you not see those people over there?? You need to WAIT. HELLOOO LOOK OVER THERE. PLEASE WAIT". She didn't say a thing just simply stepped up to the open register. 

I understand our large group can be stressful, but never in our experiences with nearly 50 different Paneras across the country (I'm not kidding) have we ever experienced a manager so rude and overwhelmed. 

We brought the woman over to our line to get her away from him because she was clearly upset. In fact, she was able to get through our line quicker since the manager clearly lacks competence in more areas than customer service. 

Between missing food in to-go orders, food poisoning, and terrible customer service we will never support this Panera again. There are several other options in West Lafayette for lunch and large groups.

Pros: Short lines, friendly staff, large dining area
Cons: lots of dirty tables

This is a standard issue Panera Bread in terms of menu and food quality.

I like Panera.  Their food is good and it's a decent place to sit and get some work done.  My only issue with this chain is that their prices are kinda high.  Think Starbucks of the sandwich world.  However, it is a decent place to go to eat while you do work or to meet up with a group of people for lunch.  The workers here were always friendly and helpful.  It can get busy during the lunch rush.  During that time it can be very difficult to find a spot in the crappy parking lot that they share with all the other businesses there.  You will likely have to loop around several times before you catch someone leaving and can take their spot.  During lunch it can also be tough to find a table, especially if you are meeting up with a group of people.
Standard Panera food, nice staff and relatively plentiful and clean seating.  Wi-fi works well.  The bathrooms tend to be messy though.
I like the new Asian broth bowls. The soba noodle with edamame is a great new option for vegetarians.

Panera has pretty good food!  They specialize in fresh baked goods including bagels, breads, pastries, and other sweet breads.  Panera also has great soups, salads, and sandwiches. 

The upside: QUALITY - I feel like Panera is a step above other fast food restaurants in terms of food quality.  The ingredients aren't frozen and full of preservatives.  I love the fuji apple chicken salad and french onion soup!  EFFICIENCY - another impressive thing about Panera is the efficiency with which they handle customers.  I've seen lines of customers extending nearly out the door during peak hours, yet the wait time remains relatively short.  

The downside:  PRICE - Panera is twice as expensive as other fast food places.  PARKING - the parking is a nightmare.  I can't stress this enough - you literally cant find a parking spot during lunch hours.  Several other businesses located in the same shopping plaza are vacant and I strongly suspect that's due to the lack of parking.  

Overall, I like Panera!  It fills a niche that exists somewhere between fast-food and sit-down dining by providing freshly made soups, salads, and sandwiches made to order at fast pace.  Your experience will be best if you dine before or after the noon rush.

We stopped at this Panera on our way to Purdue University.   We went there for breakfast!   Normally we stop at Panera Breads for lunch.  I have favorites items that I love at Panera.   So, breakfast at Panera was new to us.

I ordered the Spinach artichoke souffle, and split a bear claw sweet roll with my son.   Both were great!   They also always have very fresh and tasty coffee.   I definitely recommend Panera bread for breakfast stops, now!   We'll be back.   One drawback, however, might be the temptation of ordering more food than you need, just because it looks and tastes so good!
I'm a regular at the state street Panera.  Good atmosphere to meet friends.  The playlist is consistently calm and unobtrusive.  This place enhances friendships.

Photo of Big League Sports Bar & Grill - Lafayette, IN, United States. Sub had way too much bread for the filling but was tasty

reviews.text:
I have had the opportunity to eat here several times, before and during the Covid-19 service limitations, and the food, drinks, ans service continue to be awesome. 

I haven't had anything from the menu that hasn't been outstanding. My favorites are the stuffed burger, boneless wings, and fried mushrooms. Big League Sports Bar and Grill features what I consider the ABSOLUTE BEST lime margarita. Each bartender has their own style, as they do not use a mix. Ask for Mackenzie if you are ready for AWESOME!

Big League Sports Bar and Grill also offers daily specials, such as Taco Tuesdays and White Claw Wednesdays. There are two pool tables and three dart boards and plenty of TVs to keep one busy. 4 of 5 stars due to long service times on burgers, wings, and some apps (they actually cook things here).

Whether you live in Lafayette, or just visiting, Big League Sports Bar and Grill is a definite stop.

Not a shrimp fan.....until.....I tried the Bang Bang Shrimp! Straight fire! We tried Brisket Bites also. Wow! Great service once again! Can't wait until sports returns....these cold brews and good food. Nowhere else we will be! Waiting for that patio to open!

Great Food!! Ordered the beer battered mushrooms, and BBQ brisket bites for appetizers. Both were excellent. Then tried the slider sampler. And the ham and pineapple sliders,  definitely loooved the ham sliders. And we tried the hog wings. Everything was great. Service was excellent as well. Will definitely return again.

Let me preface that I want soooo much to like this place.  I truly do.  It is close to my house and I like the convenience of it.

Again, greatly disappointed.

Firstly, I preface that they appeared to be very understaffed yesterday.  Two bartenders/servers and maybe one or two cooks.  The bar had an engagement party going on one side and 50% (per the guidelines) of the bar side were full.  Essentially, the restaurant was full, for what they are allowed to be.

Pros:  --There are hand written signs on the door advising customers that if they are sick, they should not enter.
--Upon entering, there is hand sanitizer that you are directed to use before being seated. 
--Prior to being seated, our table was fully cleaned and sanitized from the previous customers
--the two servers/bartenders were friendly and attentive

THIS is where the Pros stop.  

Cons:  
--Our server greeted us and gave us our menus and I asked her if the NASCAR Coca Cola 600 could be placed on one of the many TVs.  The best that I could tell, only the Golf Challenge (Tiger/Brady/etc..) was live.  All of the other sports were documentaries or replays (2014 Indy 500).  She said she would check.  20 minutes later we would ask the other server/bartender and he said the same thing.  When we left after an hour of a visit, no channels had been changed. 
--We ordered a pitcher of Mich Ultra and the bartender told us she just emptied the keg and would have to change it.  That was done quickly and our beer was delivered.  Our Ultra looked like a Shandy.  It was cloudy and had a fruity taste to it.  We politely mentioned it to our server/bartender and she agreed it looked cloudy and replaced it with Coors Light with no extra charge.  (our glasses with the bad beer were never cleared from the table and the only reason the pitcher was is because we asked)
--Food was okay.  Nothing spectacular.
--The noise level is still difficult to deal with.  With no soft coverings on the walls or ceilings, this place remains one giant echo chamber.  When someone would loudly laugh at the engagement party, it bounced off of multiple walls.  It was difficult to carry on a simple conversation on the other side of the bar.
--Governor's Covid-19 Guidelines--- Now, I am not a stickler to all of the guidelines and conversations can be had about the legality of them.  That being said, no server/bartender/cook were wearing a face covering, as required.  The bartender/servers had them around their neck and maybe covering their chins, but never across their nose and mouth.  The two workers in the back had no such coverings.
      Also, there was an individual standing at the bar ordering beers.  Following the guidelines, there are no chairs to sit at the bar, however, this individual spent at least 40 minutes standing at the bar watching TV.  At a minimum this violates the spirit of the guidelines.  
--there is a hole punched in the drywall above one of the urinals in the Men's room.  There is a handwritten note next to it, in same handwriting as signs on front door and sanitizer station, that uses an explicative and has multiple people writing their own notes.  Obviously the hole has been there a while. 

Staffing is always a challenging thing and when understaffed, certain things will fall through the cracks like requesting more ketchup and having to remind the employee 15 minutes later that you still need the ketchup.

I want sooooooo greatly to like this place.  I really do.  I have no allegiance to the owners from any other bars so that is not a factor for me.  I just wanted to come in on a Sunday to the sports bar and enjoy some sports, have a beer, a sandwich and be on my way.  Sadly, this place failed again.

This is the best burger option in Lafayette now that Stacked Pickle and Scotty's have sadly gone to the big shiny kitchen in the sky. our group of five was served and taken care of throughout our stay, provided with plenty of unique brews, and had massive success indulging our face holes in the fantastic cheese curds and burgers. My waffle Burger was a truly original creation and I loved every ounce of it except the strawberry aioli was weird and not the best mix - I would have preferred a raspberry jam or similar instead. The others all quote about their burgers and made quick work of them. We will definitely be back soon as great burgers for 10 bucks including fries are hard to come by. they Don't charge extra for Fry's which is beyond wonderful! And curly fries are an option which made me want to kiss the waitress.

The waitress was great. Service is good. Food was just "okay", definitely expected more for the price. The boneless chicken wings aren't chicken wings. They are just cut up pieces of chicken tossed in sauce.

Went here before the COVID thing happened and let's just say.... hmmm- Jon Taffer.... WHERE ARE YOU?! We sat there for at least 5 minutes before anyone approached us.... ONLY to then find out.... no liquor.... ok- understand that.... but THEN- I watched as another couple came in, sat for about 3-5 minutes, weren't approached either, and then... hmmm- guess what?? They left! This was midday, on a Saturday no less, so- I would say- once COVID is over- and maybe in the interim, work on your service technique- and that liquor license would happen in NO TIME.... I, nor any of my friends will be back until then.... the food IS good, service- subpar, at best. 
I will say- we followed bc the owner we knew from his 
'Previous' location and wanted to support him..... and expected much more....
Love the atmosphere here. Pretty busy. Great food. Good place to hangout with friends.

We've been in 3 different times now. All of the food we've tried is really great, absolutely recommend the wings, the brisket, and the bacon egg and cheese burger. 
The service is good, the employees are always smiling in a good mood and taking care of everything you need. 
We'll continue to come back

The food had mixed reviews with the pizza and burger rating the best, 4 of 5. Burger was cooked perfect and daughter loved it but the fires were soggy and bland likely from the takeout serving container. The philly started good but it seemed to be loaded with trimmings from a brisket, like fat and small bits, I expected nice slices throughout. The philly maybe had 3 very thin full slices but was tasty just too much cheese sauce. The fried mushrooms batter was very greasy and the fried pickles seemed fried to long. We will try it again in the future.
A very nice  place. The ONLY complaint is that it gets loud in there..that's all. The servers are nice and the food is fantastic!
horrible bar. save your money, this place sucks. seems like they are trying to compete with end zone for trashiest and worst bar in lafayette.
Great place to watch a game or hang out with friends. Food is tasty and well priced. Friendly service !
Same bartenders from the End Zone, same DJ blasting his obnoxiously loud music (please someone tell him loud doesn't equal good). Bar didn't serve real liquor when I went , wouldn't go again.

Was great for food pickup during quarantine. Really enjoyed everything we ordered. Now that they are open, went on a Friday and had pizza dine in. Was very good. But tonight, Sunday May 24th very different experience. The food was plentiful but there was a party at the side of the bar where we could find a table. Totally ruined our dining experience because it was too loud. Food wasn't as good this time - had the brisket and was very tough. Was expecting thinner slices and tender. Found out they don't have a 3 way license at this time. Men's restroom didn't have paper towels in dispenser or it was malfunctioning (according to husband). I didn't go into the men's restroom.

reviews.text:
Echo is a good experience if you're looking for something different to do near Purdue's campus. Despite being such a large campus, your options can be pretty limited on what to do as far as nightlife- when there's no movies out you want to see, when you've already gone out to the bars more nights than you'd like to admit this week, when you've already ate dinner, it can be difficult to find something to do. With Echo, karaoke is now an option! It's a fun place that you can grab a few of your not-easily-embarrassed friends and sing the night away. 

The rooms here are private, so you don't have to worry about having to perform in front of a group of strangers. The rooms feature leather couches, a table, a TV, microphones, and the touch screen karaoke system. The system, once you learn to operate it, has a massive amount of songs available. Hit songs get added fairly frequently, and many feature the music videos, which is a nice touch. Most genres are represented as well. I'm a huge rap fan, and I had no trouble finding rap hits.

Echo also serves food and drinks. Although you can order alcohol, under 21s are still allowed here, so this is a good option if you're with an under 21 crowd. The food is good, and it's nice to be able to order drinks right to your room. 

There are a few drawbacks. First, the pricing here has gotten pretty steep. On the weekend, you can expect to pay a minimum of $8/hour per person, and that's not including any drinks or food. So if you stay for over two hours, you're approaching $20/person. This is very steep considering the prices of other entertainment in the area. When you add in food/drink, your bill can get very expensive. So I would suggest going during the week if you can. It can also get very hot in the rooms due to the equipment, so don't wear too much heavy clothing if you're going here during the winter.

Overall though, Echo is a great option in the West Lafayette area for some late night entertainment. It's a unique offering and one that is very fun for groups.

I have been to Echo before and I think that having a karaoke bar on campus is a great idea, however, this most recent trip may sadly be my last.

A group of six of my friends and I were craving dumplings and had planned to go on Saturday night. Half of us arrived and ordered appetizers and water. When the other half of our group arrived, we discussed what we wanted and ordered.

First, the waiter did not bring us enough drinks and could not answer questions about the menu. We finally ordered and when it came to repeat the order back to us, he did it in the most complicated way by totaling all of our orders together instead of by pairs we had ordered so we knew it was correct.

After finally sorting out and confirming out order, he returned shortly to say that they did not have the Pork dumplings with chives and eggs, and the members of our group who had ordered them decided to order a different type.

He then returned again to make a funny joke. He said "you know the chef in the back already doesn't like me, but now he hates me since your order is so big!" I was appalled. First of all, we already weren't very happy with his service; second, we are trying to enjoy the company of friends and do not wish to be interrupted for your own personal reasons if it does not pertain to our order; and third, how dare he imply that by bringing this establishment business, we are hurting his work relationship with the chef! If I was the chef, I also would probably not enjoy dealing with this server, since we couldn't stand all of 15 minutes with him.

He came back again and informed us that they did not have a different type of dumpling, the beef and celery ones, and at this point, we needed a minute to discuss what we were going to do.

We ended up cancelling our dumpling order and paid for the appetizers which were delicious. I brought the issue up with the manager and apologized for cancelling our order and she apologized for the poor taste in humor from the server. She mentioned that they were changing ownership thus changing some of the menu, and that the server should have notified us in advance that they did not serve this food.

She was very kind, and the server did apologize. 

I would recommend Echo for their food, although if they are changing owners I do not think I can. I was very disappointed, and if you do decide to venture here one night, I hope you can get a more professional server than we did, and that you also can get all that you order.

This is probably the best place to spend time in Lafayette. They have more songs than you could ever thought about. But the greatest thing about this place is you can have all the delicious Chinese food and beverage here. I would definitely recommend the Chongqing Spicy Noodle, it just arrived on their menu. And popcorn Chicken, just try it, and you will know what I am talking about. 

The owner of Echo is a really nice guy, just ask him to bring their best thing to you.

Never to worry about the price, the price of everything would make you satisfied. 

To be honest, I think their food is better than most of the Chinese restaurants here. 

Just go there and you'll know what I'm talking about.

Echo is truly the best karaoke I have ever been, there are a wide range of song selection, plus the food and beverage is just unbelievably delicious!
You guys!!!!!!! Have to try their new beverage "Yoshi Island" I'm in love with it.
And the snake is tasty and fair priced! I would definitely recommend the popcorn chicken, chongqing spicy noodle and the lamb skewer! I would say it's the most authentic Chinese food in the Tippecanoe county!

WHO SINGS THAT SONG? 

I do! If you walk in and think Taylor Swift is there, it's just me. Come say hello! Haha.

This is a place on campus near Scotty's Brewhouse and Neon Cactus. I don't think many people know of it and I have to spread the joy. 

What is this? A karaoke bar. Yes. Most people close it out thinking, "I am NOT singing in front of people. No way!" However, relax my friends. You and your small group of like 1-12 people get their own PRIVATE room. Hooray. There are three microphones in each room. I truly can't tell the difference between the melody mic and two harmony. I feel they are all equal and how loud is each person singing and how close are they holding the mic to their mouth.

Now, it's not public karaoke and private rooms so it must be expensive, right? ...NOPE! Very affordable. The problem is it's so much fun and they are open until 4am the hourly rate adds up. It's only $6.25 a person per hour in your own private room with comfy black leather couches, "soundproof" walls (how much can it be in the common area-but zero room to room noise), and tv screen with lyrics, 3 microphones to share or pass, two tv remotes, English and I believe Korean. Once you learn the buttons on one (or both of you can read them) they do the same things. I can use the Non-English one for volume changes at the least if the other is across the table with a friend selecting next song with it.

The song list here is incredible and thousands without a doubt. There is like EVERYTHING when you search by artist, band, genre, male, female, and even other languages. You can have a whole list of songs in your queue, or with like 5 people pass the remote on to let the next person pick a song while three others are singing. My friends and I take turns. This is in West Lafayette near Purdue. With that being said we celebrate diversity. Boiler up! There is multiple languages and it's legit. I learned I have two friends that can rap in Korean. That was a totally awesome shocking surprise and impressing to me. I love different and talent. I thought I was with like the coolest people there. But, I got them as my friends that night. Hooray! Lucky jackpot. They even queue'd up: Let it Go (Frozen), Wanna Be (Spice Girls), and Love Story (love my Tay Tay -Taylor Swift). They like knew my musical dreams & think I can actually sing or something. Bahaha! 

Food/Drink: They do have some food from open until a certain time the kitchen closes. I believe it's Asian Fusion food. The menu doesn't look long & I haven't eaten here personally - but my friends tell me it's quite good. They serve a limited alcohol menu but hey, they have some. It's only sake, and alcohol energy drinks called FOUR. It's mostly for hanging out and singing really. I drink before I come (if drinking that night) and have one there during my hour, which quickly turns into two hours easily. 

Tip: The first time you visit, your first half hour is free. After that your $6.25 per hour begins. I have never seen someone leave at 30 minutes not having fun (not in my group! Wink!)

Tip 2: Be aware of the price adding up if on a tight college budget. The cost is not bad at all (for here or ANY private room place) but for the college kids a couple drinks and two hours can add up at this luxury. It's hard to stop when the employees pop in and say 5 minutes left of your hour. They are not putting you on a cut-off timer... But you have to decide to stay or wrap it up. If you are out five minutes late they won't harass you at all. But be respectable humans so the place doesn't need to place timers on its rooms due to inconsiderate people who could spoil it. Like, you CAN finish your song and one more without being cut off mid song... Wouldn't that suck? No one likes that. Echo likes its customers having fun!

Additional fun: There are tables for food and board games out front. Also, they HAVE board games here. It's totally free to come play board games with friends here. You can bring the purchased food & drinks in the karaoke rooms if you want, or you can get food and a drink out front. Also, no purchase necessary to chill and play board games really. Seems like regulars and employees do this the most but all are welcome. 

I totally give this 5 stars because it is something with a little extra to be on a college campus and here in Lafayette/WestLafayette/Purdue. It's the only one of its kind, and it is SO fun. I never thought my friends and I would be able to afford renting out a private room with entire karaoke set up, couches, and a door for the shy friends who open up here very quickly and join in the fun. I love that it is something totally different than anything I have seen or been to before and I can't lie - I love singing & am aware I am tone deaf. My shower head doesn't judge me though and my friends don't mind and laugh and pee their pants almost sometimes. It's all part of the fun. 

I say if you like to sing (not can you, LIKE to), sing your heart out here! Cheers!

I'm from Austin, came up here to visit a few friends.  We have three Karaoke's in Austin and let me tell you I totally did not expect a small midwestern town to have such a nice place comparatively.  The place was CLEAN.  Big selection of music and huge TVs.  It made for a really nice karaoke experience.

I tried the bubble tea and their lamb kebabs and they were pretty good. Hard to find lamb kebabs anywhere here.  I can honestly see myself chilling there all day.
Expensive.. One time we went here and got charge 100+ dollars for an hour. 25 dollars an hour? Ridiculous.

Although the private rooms are kind of nice, the karaoke system in them is disastrous, especially when looking for Korean songs (most of the songs have to be looked up in Chinese and not Hangul). When we asked if they was another way to lookup Korean songs, we were given an old songbook that did not go past 1999. The English selection of songs is okay for pop and RNB but very limited for other genres like rock.
Great place to eat, sing, and hang out! They have a spacious lounge for pool, big karaoke rooms, and amazing food.

Really good place to go either during weekday or weekend! Cause they have a bunch of delicious food! Dumplings, noodles, fried tofu which is my fav.!! ALSO, great karaoke system, a lot of songs, great sound effect!  Go to ECHO with friends! Have a lot of fun!!!
Best bubble tea in the area. I know that a lot of time and effort was spent on perfecting their dumplings, which are delicious as well!

My friends and I were really excited to try the place out. The weekend price is around $6 a person per hour for a private room with nice leather couches and your own computer and TV. We toured the place beforehand and asked how late it'd be open, we were told 4 am. So we all hung out and decided we would come back in the early morning hours and check the place out and we were excited it was open so late. Around 2 AM I called just to make sure and was told it'd be open till 4. We arrived a little before 3 hoping to get in a good hour and it was closed. I don't understand why I was repeatedly told 4 AM and never told that they might close sooner. I wouldn't waste your time with a business that lies to customers.

Great place to sing Karaoke and get bubble milk tea. The owner and servers try very hard to please their customers. They have a great pool table and various board games while customers are waiting for a room. Great place to hangout and pretty much the best Karaoke around the Purdue Campus. I always visit when I'm in the area.

images.alt: Photo of LongHorn Steakhouse - Lafayette, IN, United States. Experience our Grill Master's Legendary Steaks like our center-cut Flo's Filet. Order online and pickup curbside
Photo of LongHorn Steakhouse - Lafayette, IN, United States. Order an exceptionally tender center-cut filet coated in our signature seasoning.
Photo of LongHorn Steakhouse - Lafayette, IN, United States. Not trying it would be a crime! Bone-in, well-marbled, fire-grilled, juicy, and delicious.
Photo of LongHorn Steakhouse - Lafayette, IN, United States. Fire-grilled to enhance flavor and texture, Longhorn's New York Strip is the steakhouse classic to try tonight.
Photo of LongHorn Steakhouse - Lafayette, IN, United States. LongHorn's fire-grilled porterhouse combines a bone-in strip and a tender filet into one thick cut. Try it today.
Photo of LongHorn Steakhouse - Lafayette, IN, United States. LongHorn's Steakhouse Mac & Cheese with smoked bacon and four creamy cheeses takes the perfect side to the next level.
Photo of LongHorn Steakhouse - Lafayette, IN, United States. The Maverick is a juicy 6 oz. ribeye sandwich topped with saute_ed onions and melted Swiss cheese on grilled thick cut bread.
Photo of LongHorn Steakhouse - Lafayette, IN, United States. This isn’t just any chicken sandwich. It’s a Crispy Buttermilk Chicken Sandwich worthy of the biggest appetites for just $7.99.
Photo of LongHorn Steakhouse - Lafayette, IN, United States. Ask for the Longhorn Old Fashioned made with Longhorn Single Barrel Bourbon by Knob Creek and a dash of Angostura bitters.
Photo of LongHorn Steakhouse - Lafayette, IN, United States. Order Parmesan Crusted Chicken. Our juicy grilled chicken topped with creamy, crunchy Parmesan and garlic cheese crust.

reviews.text:
We took advantage of their curbside service today. It was a five star service from the friendly lady who took our order on the phone and brought the food to us to enjoying a good meal at home. The food was ready when we arrived, exactly when they promised. 
.. 
I chose the salmon on greens salad. I always enjoy the way Longhorn chefs prepare salmon. It's moist and not overcooked and dry.  I really liked they way the salmon salad was packaged. The molded tray allowed the salmon was separated from the salad and wrapped in aluminum foil. It was still warm after a 20 minute drive home. The salad greens were still crisp and fresh. 
My wife had the Seasoned Steakhouse chicken wing appetizer and a bowl of the shrimp & lobster chowder. The wings were cooked perfectly and well seasoned.  The soup was "delicious".
Overall an excellent experience.

Somebody put a cone in the sinkhole.  I also noticed I had an old review on there from a bad experience, but their manager made the issue right for me.  I tried to delete the old review but couldn't.  Longhorn really is a nice addition to Lafayette for a steakhouse option.

Typical chain steakhouse experience, which necessarily is not a bad thing. 

I visited on a Sunday afternoon, and it was fairly quiet with the exception of the college and professional football games. The bartender was pretty nice and quick. He didn't really engage in small talk, but that was fine with me. 

For my meal, I had the sirloin and shrimp combo, which was not too bad. I will say that the steak was super salty; however, the grill shrimp tasted pretty nice. Also, the rice pilaf was really good; I could have had an entire bowl of the pilaf. The starter salad was a bit of a struggle. 

The price of my meal was pretty reasonable . I would return.

Came here Wednesday night late dinner service is really good everyone is very attentive small draft beer list ample items on the menu. Be aware that they use a lot of salt spices on their meat products meaning you will have dry mouth later on. The tables are clean place overall look clean.

Great cowboy ribery
Amber and Julie at the bar were outstanding even though many are experiencing an hour wait.
Good job to all

We ordered 4 adult meals and an appetizer. It was done at precisely the time we requested. Even after the drive home, the main entree and sides were still warm. Everything was cooked as requested. The "chicken tenders" were a bit small so be careful intending to share 9 of them. The hostess was very respectful that brought our food out. These are trying times and this restaurant has adapted nicely!
The Long Horn never disappoints!! We have eaten here and at the place in South Dakota. Delicious steaks cooked to perfection.
The visit we had was one of the better experience we have had at longhorn, I would go as far as to say the best experience.  Our server John really made us  feel at home and comfortable.

The food was really good, but the service was terrible! It was my Mom's birthday and we came for lunch. Our server, Gina, was not acceptable. The only reason this place gets 3 stars, is that the food was tasty.

Our server forgot our drinks, after waiting for over 5 minutes she came back and asked what we wanted again. We waited another 5 minutes for our drinks (not alcohol). She literally made excuses every time she came to the table. She never brought us bread, after saying she would, put in the wrong soup and left the birthday girls water in the back because she "had to get Togo boxes."

We literally had a grilled salmon salad, two bowls of soup and a key lime pie cup. Our experience lasted almost 2 hours on a Friday lunch. It was not busy. The food was good, but the service was beyond bad.

Wish you could give a zero star review on this place. They absolutely 100% refuse to accommodate the elderly handicap people. Apparently due to "Covid" they refuse to let people set at the tables and require you to set at a booth. However you can not put a chair at the end of a booth at all. So what are the one that can not set in a booth due to health reasons such as being in a wheel chair or on a walker supposed to do. Oh I know they do not want your business because it isn't convenient for them. I find refusals to accommodate the elderly and handicapped absolutely appalling. I will never be back to this place and hope no one else continues to support them.

First time visiting the new Longhorn Steakhouse in town. 

There was an approximately 30 minute wait so we elected to sit at a high top table in the bar. We walked in and sat down immediately. 

The bar is surprisingly small. For a restaurant attached to a hotel, there are 14 seats at the bar. If i were traveling by myself I would want to sit at the bar and not in the restaurant and it would be tough if the bar is busy.

The rest of the restaurant is mainly booths with only a few independent tables and one corner table for a larger (6-8) group.  

Our server was prompt and polite. 

I ordered a 20oz Yuengling draft that cost $5.49. Not pricey for a chain restaurant near a hotel but pricey for Lafayette. A pint cost $4.49.  

For food, I passed on an appetizer and went straight to the entree.  I ordered the 11oz Renegade Sirloin, medium well, with the house salad and a plain baked potato plus bacon.  The potato listed in their sides comes "loaded", but I don't enjoy that.  

My wife ordered the parmesan crusted chicken with the salad and mashed potatoes as the sides. 

Our food came within 15 minutes and we enjoyed good conversation and the complimentary bread.  

My steak was cooked just right, although I don't like my potato bathing in a plate full of steak juices. If you like that, this won't be an issue for you.  It was tender and juicy and seasoned to the point where I didn't  need to add any. The potato cake plain with bacon, but not a lot of bacon. I would have liked some more on my potato.  My wife's chicken was cooked right and had a good amount of spices on it. She enjoyed it very much. 

Overall, the food was very good. The service was good and the beer was cold. 

The only things I noted were the small bar and the material the bar tables are made of. This is an important thing to think about. It is not a reason to go or to stay away from the restaurant but it is good to know.  The high top tables are made of a composite material and they are "slick" on the top. This becomes an issue when you go to cut your steak because your plate will slide as you cut. My wife had to hold my plate. Just a heads up. 

Overall, good experience.  Will we go back?  I am sure we will. We are partial to Logan's probably because it is more causal and the beer prices are better.

Food: ****
Service: ****
Ambiance: ****

This is a typical good steakhouse.  Multi-grain bread was nice and warm.  House salad was refreshing.  They did serve dressing on the side as ordered.  Ribeye steak was mouth watering with good amount of fat.  Ate most of the fat with meat. Yum.  Happy medium steak ended up with one happy yummy.  I would eat here again.

I've ate here many times in the last year.  The first experience was great, but it keeps going downhill...  There used to be long waits, and the food was great.  However, you walk in now, and it's practically a "ghost town".  

I can only assume that it's because the service and food quality is deteriorating. I have eaten here twice in the last month, and both times the service and food were unacceptable. 

The servers have repeatedly forgotten things, and need to be asked multiple times. Half of the time we'll be waiting while we watch them sit around and talk.  After dealing with the manager, I'm pretty sure I understand why it is the way it is.

On a recent visit, I decided to order a LH (Long Horn) Burger, because the ribs and steaks have been overcooked the past couple of times.  When I took my first bite, I immediately noticed the burger crumbling.  I ordered it medium, but it was so dry and overcooked that I couldn't eat it.

I'm not one to usually send something back, but the place was practically empty and there was no excuse for such a poorly cooked burger.  (I'm pretty sure that I could make a better burger in the microwave.)

Anyhow, after watching our party finish their food, the manager finally brought me out a replacement. He seemed very smug.    I immediately noticed that it was missing bacon, but didn't say anything because everybody else was done eating and I didn't want them to have to wait another 30 minutes for it to be corrected.

Also, again the manager didn't care enough to check the ingredients on his business' signature burger before bringing it out.  I can't expect his staff to care anymore than he does. 

For anybody that's visiting the area, I'd recommend Texas Roadhouse over Long Horn every day of the week.  I've been there many times, and I can't remember a single time that I was as displeased as I am with Long Horn.  

Good thing LH has a great location, because I don't know too many people that would go out of their way for Hot Garbage.

Longhorn is my family's favorite restaurant! We've been to the Lafayette location about once or twice per month since it opened, and we've tried every item on the menu (most of the seasonal items too). Everything is good, but there are a few menu items that are truly great:

*Wild West Shrimp
Chili Cheese Fries (small portion)
Firecracker Chicken Wraps
Loaded Potato Soup
Flat Iron Steak, cooked medium rare
*Boneless Ribeye steak, cooked medium
Flo's Filet, cooked medium rare
Parmesan Crusted Chicken (way better than it sounds!)
*Chocolate Stampede
Key Lime Pie Jar or Chocolate Peanut Butter Jar

If it's your first time, I recommend trying the starred (*) items. For sides, I recommend the side salad with ranch, and if you like mashed potatoes, ask for brown gravy! We've been impressed with the attitude of all the managers and most of the servers, though as you would expect in food service, there are new faces all the time. Don't trust the review of someone who only went once... listen to the person who's ordered every item on the menu!

i was there to dine in but it was just waste of money and time,
i asked medium cook but meat burned outside uncooked inside also very salty, its clear that chef has no experience, even i can cook better then chef

Unfortunately our experience was horrible! Waited 45 minutes for two NY strips and kids sirloin...while waiting my salad was brought out, I ended up spitting it out as the cucumbers tasted like some type of chemical was on them. I asked the server for more warm bread...ended up getting a still frozen in the middle loaf...manager even touched it to confirm. Steaks finally come and as I'm cutting my son's up I taste it and cringed from how salty it was...he's 5 so there was no way I was giving that to him! Tasted the other two steaks and both just as salty. We sent them back but I sure wish we hadn't bc my server comes back 10 minutes later to say "those will be out shortly and I told them NO SEASONINGS" I said no why did you tell them that? There's a difference from seasoning correctly and over seasoning. Smh

We come to longhorn bc they're steaks have more flavor than other chain steakhouses. Not here. The new steaks came out bland and medium instead of medium well. We didn't even complain just left more than half the food sitting there.  The baked potato and loaded mashed were both great! The manager did comp one ny strip meal.

Well.... our waiter/bartender ruined most of our experience. "Travis G" is what it said on my bill. Started off by yelling across the bar (causing most of the customers at the bar to turn and look at us) that we couldn't sit at the table we were sitting at without being seated there! We both said to him that we knew that as the hostess came and gave us our menus. He shook his head and said "okay then" in a very rude way.

As we waited for our waiter, guess who showed up?! The rude bartender...he's our waiter. Ugh! Asked if we had been to a longhorn before. We both said yes. He asked us to be more enthusiastic. I replied in the same tone and said yes. He said, "really?! That's not enthusiastic!" 

Took forever bringing our waters and food. Most of the time he didn't, it was a food runner or other waiter. Didn't even care that we didn't touch some of the food bc we didn't like it, he just took it and left. 

Stuffed mushrooms were very rich but good. Tasted like Alfredo sauce and topped with other cheeses.

French onion soup was very sweet and not much to it. 

My friends salads looked good and fresh. 

My lobster tail was good but the butter had unneeded spices in it. 

Took a bite of my friends steak that she didn't eat bc it was over seasoned and it totally was!!!! One bite and I went to the bathroom to get all of it out of my teeth.

Don't think I'll be returning anytime soon and if I do and I see "Travis G" they better keep him as far away from me as possible!
If they are smart at all, they would terminate someone who represents their company, yet treats customers like crap!

Hope we got them on an off night. Have been to other locations and had a much better experience. Wait staff seemed inexperienced and out of sorts. 
They actually ran out of baked potatoes at 5PM on a Sunday. I suppose things like that happen sometimes. 
Salads were not brought out all together nor were the entrees, or sides. They just didn't seem to have a handle on what they're doing.
The steaks were very greasy, almost like they poured hot oil over them when plating, or dropped them in a fryer to heat them up. Sounds strange but pretty sure that's what it was.
Chicken was good but barely warm, even though it was brought out at least 5 minutes after the other entrees. Pretty sure it sat there cooling off until they found someone to run it to the table.
I plan to give them another chance, but it may take awhile. Maybe they'll get their act together.

Perfect interstate spot to relax and enjoy a quality atmosphere, attentive and enjoyable staff, and predictable minimalist menu - a few non-steak items but mostly the ripe cuts of choice bovine. Our group enjoyed the budget friendly cuts and largest burger. My spaghetti squash side was a tasty surprise and huge, definitely worth the $2 upgrade. Our waitress was on top of her game. It's a new place and shows it, lots of parking, easy access, and beautifully done interior. I personally am not a franchise steak person. I'd rather spend $15 at Sushi-Don, get a huge slice of pan seared salmon at Town & Gown across the river, or even do a drink and entre at TGI Fridays. My favorite steak of all time was actually cooked by a friend at a church retreat. I've realized this: the perfect steaks are often those cooked up by the random guy who knows his stuff. LongHorn may satisfy the casual cow eater but for me dropping $20+ for a real beef cut is silly. Next time I'll try a burger or be thankful someone else is paying for the steak! LongHorn does have a few perks on its side, rich atmosphere featuring an open and Western inspired ambiance. Excellent staff, and experience sorted out well above the average chain.
Kinda greasy and overly salted. Overall is still pretty good. Not too pricey, and definitely going to be full without appetizers.

reviews.text:
I am eating Puccini's for the first time, by way of take out. It's as if I'm tasting food for the first time. I imagine this is how Eve felt wandering the garden of Eden, sampling every exquisite delight paradise had to offer. I thought I hated black olives and onions until tasting them in Puccini's salad with Italian dressing. The breadsticks overcome me with the sweet taste of leavened bread that has sustained my ancestors for thousands of years... Even the tomato sauce carries a heady blend of fresh herbs that transcends mere culinary bliss. 

I cannot even bear to speak of the chicken fettuccine alfredo; let it suffice it to say I wept tears of holy wonder 

Order puccinis only if you dare to look upon the the smiling face of god

TLDR; definitely get their Chocolate Torte, it's awesome! 

Ordered lunch to go from Puccini's and really enjoyed their fast & affordable service. 

I called & placed my order to go. I got a Garlic Cheese bread that I absolutely loved! I also got a Vodka Sauce pasta dinner, which they serve with a side salad. Good flavors as well as quantities! I got the Bar 20 pizza, which is essentially a BBQ Chicken Pizza. Not a big fan of this one; it was slightly over cooked and the chicken pieces were too big. 

Finally for dessert, I got a Tiramisu cake and a chocolate torte. Both of those were absolutely delicious and I devoured the cakes haha. The torte was 100% my favorite ever!!

A big plus: the staff was enforcing masks as well as social distancing, yay!

Puccini's saved the day!! We ordered through GrubHub and there was a slight communication with our order and our birthday girl was super bummed. After calling in, the fixed the mistake and sent a little extra. Awesome customer service, especially during this special time of quarantine!! Thank you Puccini's!!

Stopped for lunch and it was fortunately inexpensive. That was the only plus. 

Son ordered the angel hair & meatballs which didn't indicate meat sauce would be included. The meat sauce had a funky taste and included celery and carrots. 

The pizza lunch special had a nice slice of sausage pizza, but the salad was watery, brown and stuffed in the bowl so tightly that you can't eat it without spilling. 

Not very good at all. Not impressed.

I'm not sure why this place has such a low rating. I've been coming here for years and it's not disappointed me. Yeah it's expensive but it's really good food. The tiramisu is delicious, I would recommend
Yummy pizza, pasta, sandwiches & salads. I love their house made dressings & can never decide between the ranch or honey mustard. Great lunch specials

Came here on a Friday night around 6pm with friends.  We had no reservations and it wasn't needed despite it being a football weekend.

The menu is extensive and even has some carb conscious options too.  A lot can be modified as well which was great.  Prices are fair and reasonable.  Portions are super generous!

The environment is very family friendly the staff is super helpful and very kind as well considering that they are mostly young and or college students from the local university.

I would definitely come back and sad that after living here for almost two years that I only just discovered this place!

Puccini's is a staple in regards to go-to Pizza places. There is a lot of open seating and great for large crowds like birthday parties or events. There is even an event room to help serve large parties. The pizza is absolutely fantastic and includes a lengthy drink menu if you are looking for alcohol. There is a pickup option if you want to carry out your order as well. Puccini's is reasonably priced so you won't bust your wallet eating out although the service is pretty slow most times I've been here so I would not come if you're in a rush or looking for a quick bite to eat. Overall, a great experience with friends and family.

Wish the chicken piccata was better than it was, it didn't have a lot of chicken or that classic strong lemon flavor. The chicken piccata was lacking but still pretty okay. However, the tiramisu was incredible. A little heavy on the cream side, but not overly sweet and was made with coffee. A very well made classic.

Overall: Just like any other Puccini's, this location is the perfect spot for your pizza, calzone, or pasta fix.

The good: If you've been to other Puccini's in the state, you know what's up. The food is king here - No matter what you get, it's going to be well-portioned, tasty, and fresh. The salads are heaping in size (get the buttermilk ranch) and the pizzas, calzones, and pastas are all great in their own way. I won't go into details, but I've never had a bad meal and it continued at this location as well.

The not-so-good: If you've never been to a Puccini's before, the atmosphere can be somewhat bland. And, for whatever reason, out of all the Puccini's I've been to (4 between Indy, Bloomington, and here), for whatever reason this one didn't have the same charm.

Food: 8.5/10
Atmosphere: 7.5/10
Service: 8.5/10
Really not sure why this place doesn't have higher ratings, but the food is delicious. Ordered a couple pizzas and a calzone and everything was delicious!

If I could I would have given it 2.5.

This was my first time gettting food from here and there was potential and we might try it again some day but there was a lot that was frankly not good.

The breadstick was horrible. The bottom was rock hard, the top barely cooked and all I could taste was flour. Complete waste of money. I would eat them if they were free.

The vodka sauce was so strange I still am not sure how to feel about it. The pasta was over cooked and it was hardly at room temp. There was an awkward sweet flavor to it. Will never try it again. 

The two pizzas we got were pretty good but extremely greasy. Looking at their menu are are other pizzas I am interested in trying. The sauce tasted homemade and they both had a lot of flavor. 

The cheesecake was great except for the crust again it tasted like flour.

The pizza was worth it but I wouldn't order anything else. I ordered carry out so that might have been a factor.

I really like this restaurant, and the close location to Purdue. Having a large parking lot is also a perk! We ordered a couple pizzas, and they were good. The only negative was, one pizza had potatoes and they were hard and needed to be cooked further. They have an extensive menu for gluten free options, and can accommodate other food allergies. The waitress was great, and really knowledgeable about food allergies, and the dynamics of the kitchen.

Puccini's has become a favorite date night spot for us. Servers are all amazing! The food is delish and we love the atmosphere as well. You MUST try the Sweet lil Razorback pizza. They will also customize some of the menu items your liking if you feel like getting creative. Great job guys!

I ordered through Door Dash, and my order was incorrect, now for the second time in the past few months. It's not Door Dash's fault. The staff at Puccini's entering orders obviously wasn't trained or never learned to enter orders correctly. I called Puccini's (West Lafayette) and asked to speak with the manager. A lady answered and was very, very rude to me when I expressed concern that this was now the second time my order was entered/made incorrectly. I informed her I would never do business with her restaurant again. A manager should never speak to a customer like that and she should be fired. I've never had any issues with any other restaurants using Door Dash.

Arrived at opening on Friday morning. Was greeted by Rachel. Very pleasant lady. Obtained my drink quickly. Explained menu and lunch menu. Place was clean with comfortable seating. I had the BBQ Chicken Pizza and bread sticks both to order and tasty.

Now I have to say I am from NJ. So pretty tough critic of pizza. This place was ok. There were far too many people cutting their pizza with a fork and knife. What's that about? No fault of the place though. My waitress was sweet and did a great job. Pizza was ehh.

Return visit and some more comments. Still overall decent. The pizza, calzones, and appetizers are good. The booths are a little close together, not a huge problem unless you encounter a loud talker. Patio seating is an option. 

I love the gluten-free menu items - they make a big effort in that dept, which is great! Decent wine and craft beer options: Sun King 16oz and Three Floyds 12oz for $4. Cook time is spotty - sometimes super fast, other times painfully slow. I think the carry out and delivery orders impact this factor quite a bit.

This is second time I've been to Puccini's and so happy to say that service and food continues great. We had chicken marsala, fettuccini with rosemary cream sauce, chicken piccata with tiramisu for dessert. All were great.  Be prepared also for a great house salad with black olives in addition to regular veg.
reviews.reviewerLocation: Town N Country Alliance, Tampa, FL

reviews.text: This used to be one of my favorite restaurants. Last night the pizza was AWFUL. I really want my money back. They changed their crust and now it tastes so blah. We live about 25 minutes away and drove for good food. Very very disappointing. We do not plan on going back. Messaged below to customer service, but never heard back.

reviews.text: I am Leary going into restaurants with the spike of COVID19 cases.  No need to worry here they keep you safe!  Stay in car until your table is ready.  Spacing tables far apart!  We had a great server,TJ, and the meal-steak was perfect.  Watched how everything was cleaned tables, menus, seats.  Nothing left on table like sauces,salt,pepper- you have to ask for condiments- even the peanuts are in little bags.  Thank you Texas Roadhouse!

The service was good.  The prime rib was one of the worst I've had in my life.  I guess you pay for what you get. Prime rib is under $20 here, but definitely taste it. The meat was VERY tough and chewy. It did not have much flavor.  

They did a good job with the sides. The sweet potato is served with cinnamon butter and a side of brown sugar. The cinnamon butter was all I needed on my sweet potato. The broccoli and carrots were freshly steamed. The loaded baked potato comes with a salted skin.

 The onion appetizer was a good size to share among 4 people for the price.  The rolls are AMAZING.  They walk you to your table with a fresh warm basket of rolls and cinnamon butter.  You can request more complimentary rolls.  

While you wait there are peanuts to eat and you throw the shells on the floor. They have more peanuts in a tub at your table.  You will not go home hungry here!  

We did call ahead seating. They lost our name after we arrived and thought we were already seated. This delayed our seating by 15 minutes from the originally quoted time. 

If I return, I would not order prime rib and try another dish.

Please fix your curbside estimation times and ineffective auto response text system. Our order was over 20 minutes late and they claimed they couldn't find our vehicle when I text them the space number. Don't waste your time or tip money on this disorganized, teenage run, unapologetic establishment. Love TRH, but this location is a joke - save your money!!!!!!!

Texas Roadhouse is one of my favorite stops when I'm traveling. I LOVE their sweet rolls and the cinnamon butter spread. Their salads are also top-notch, huge, and super fresh. I typically enjoy the rotisserie chicken here with a side of veggies and salad. While everything here was delicious, I think they may have changed up how they serve the chicken. They used to do a nice chicken on the bone but my usual order arrived as a chicken breast instead. I'm going to order a different menu item if this is now the case.

Went to this place on a Saturday afternoon. When we were seated, there are a whole lot of peanut shells under our seats. At first the waitress were nice to us when she took the drink order. After I politely asked her to get someone to clean the peanut shells, she immediately made a rude face and since then the attitude has gone far off. We even observed as she served other tables and she was nice all along. I cannot tolerate such attitude difference when I came here for an at least okay dining experience. She did eventually clean the peanut shells though. She might have mistaken that we threw those shells on the ground but thats not a reason for rudeness. I would praise the food but sadly theres no separate rating.

Went to dinner after a long day..... hour and half sitting at the table watching people served around us.  I finally asked a random person to find a manager..,. Immediately the waitress came over realizing she never entered our meal.  She brought our chili over.... it was severely over cooked.  The meat was rubbery.

Our food arrived, steak was undercooked.  My husband ordered an unsweetened tea and was served a sweet tea.  We were unable to find a server to fix the mistake.  I walked up to the one person around, a hostess walking around looking for empty tables.  I asked for her help and her response was "I am not taking your tea."

In response, the manager showed up with a free appetizer and discounted one meal.  No need for the free appetizer, we won't be back.

This is the budget dining spot for the day's dose of sodium in one massive overload of an entree! Fantastic service even with our poor waitress having to put up with some major immature baby adults near us - what a solider, she treated us so well despite the battle she couldn't win. We five enjoyed all our foods from steak cutlets to chicken and sandwiches, chili is tasty, and salads are nice to start out with after the bread and onion of course! But why do you guys put so much salt in everything? I don't get restaurants on that, preserving the sauces for their trip over? I've noticed this with all mainstream chains, fast food, sodium everywhere. It's not good for nutrition at all and often leaves out better flavors for the familiar salty vibes. Would love to see a big national chain like Texas show up with better ways to flavor and preserve food that aren't making health magazine headlines (as refined salt) being a nasty rising issue along with good ole white sugar. Lots of space here, great location, very noisy and engaging atmosphere but I felt awkwardly perched on the end of our table with my own 5th wheel chair - not sure why we got that? Could hardly fit all our food on the table too, need to make sure bigger groups have space.

Great service!  My steak was a tad over-cooked, but I got a replacement (with side!) and a sincere apology, genuinely seemed to care about my satisfaction. Food was good, proper temp and seasoning. Thanks for a great meal!

For the most part, I was let down. I've been coming to this location for years, and I have always had either very good service, or it was horrendous. Yes, I know it's my fault for continuing to go back to a place I will most likely be complaining about. But it's a convenient location. 

I'll start with the waitress. I don't remember her name, but her name tag said she had been there for 7 years. I don't know if it's because she had to work New Years Eve, or she was having a bad day or what, but I have never felt more like an inconvenience to anyone in my entire life. She smiled -literally- zero times. Her voice was low, annoyed, and monotone, even after myself and friends seemed to be over friendly to her. 

I ordered a Long Island. It came quickly... watered down and sad. Now, I know it's hard to taste liquor in a Long Island (or is that just me?), but I swear to you there didn't seem to be a drop. It tasted like watered down coke with a splash of toilet water. I quickly finished it so it would not water itself down anymore, and I could just get it off the table. I was so disappointed, but didn't say anything to our waitress because she was obviously having a bad day. 

I ordered the steak. It was good. Delicious actually. I wanted prime rib, but they were either out or weren't serving it that day, because when I asked if they had prime rib, she shortly replied "No." 

My boyfriend ordered the appetizer sampler, and What. A. Joke. The wings had obviously been microwaved. They were barely hot, chewy, and looked like plastic. The poppers, he said, were "not bad", and the potato skins were about as average looking and tasting as they come. 

I was so sad and will probably stick to the Texas Roadhouse in Avon from now on. The wait times are usually less, and the staff is *always* friendly.

Came here on my birthday. I hadn't been to any Texas Roadhouse in over a decade. The server was fantastic. The knife that came with my napkin was a little dirty and she was apologetic about that. I ordered the combo that included an 8oz sirloin and half rack of ribs. I found the steak nicely seasoned (not too salty) and close enough to the medium I had ordered. It may have been a little closer to medium-rare, but it was good. Unfortunately, the ribs were pretty dry. The sauce helped. And the rolls! Yummy!  I kinda hoped I'd get a complimentary birthday dessert, but oh well. I was full. I wish they'd play something other than country music.

I just ordered on line to get a steak dinner. As I drove into parking lot. First stop checked in with worker at entrance, she pulled up my order directed me to pull into space 12, then shortly after I was handed my steak dinner and in addition a bag of peanuts ( nice jester) . Just wanted to say everything went very smoothly. Thank you, Texas Roadhouse.. it was delicious as always! Just like dining in.

Consistently great food and service.  We have been to this location many times.  Even when the restaurant is full, I know that I can count on good service and top notch food.  If it's not, I know the management will take care of it quickly.  You'll see managers regularly walking through the restaurant, checking on guests.

Keep up the good work!

Texas Roadhouse is all about steak, and they do it very well. Their early-bird specials are a good deal. On the few occasions when they haven't gotten the steak done the way I ordered it, they were gracious about redoing it, without the attitude that sometimes accompanies a slip up at other restaurants. Their beer selection is adequate, though could benefit from some improvement. We always appreciate the peanuts, and have never (that we remember) had a waiter or waitress who was anything but great. The decor is well-themed, with all sorts of little odds and ends to keep younger kids entertained on their way to the table. Texas Roadhouse has earned a spot in our family as our go-to place for birthday dinners and celebrations.

We waited for 10 minutes for our server to greet us. My husband and 18 month old were sat without a highchair or booster, my daughters food was cold, the blossom was gross and my husband ribs tasted horrible. 

The best part of the meal, the rolls.
I love that I can visit Texas Roadhouse, order my favorites, and they will be just as delicious as the previous visit.

I've to roadhouses all over the country and this is one of the better ones. Staff is friendly, always smiling and check up on us. Drinks never stayed empty.

I've had most of the food on the menu and my favorites are the steak salad, fried pickles, steaks and fries.

Steaks have always been cooked perfectly. 

My daughter's favorites hotdog and cup of chili so she can maker her own chili dog ;-)

I absolutely love this place me and my family enjoy coming here for family dinners and we are never disappointed from there ribs to there steaks to the chicken it's all good and u won't go wrong here the owners r very nice come around and greet u at dinner it's just a nice place and a great time with wonderful food and people

The condensation from the duct work was dripping on our table.  The food was mediocre.  The waitress was snappy and was talking to other waiters about our table behind our back. The shift manager was not qualified to be any sort of leader.

I am very happy to update my previous (12/9/18) review of the Lafayette, Indiana Texas Roadhouse.   After our not so happy, experience in December and review, the manager called and discussed the reasons we did not enjoy our meal and he sent a certificate for us to use and give the Roadhouse another try.   The document had instructions to show it to the server when ordering, but I felt it might influence our service and I wanted to have a completely fresh and unbiased experience.   Our server, Matilyne, was great.   Everything was clean and orderly.   Our food was outstanding.   This was a "game-changing" experience.   We will definitely recommend Texas Roadhouse and we will be back for more great service and delicious food.   Everything was seasoned well and excellently prepared.   There were plenty of peanuts to keep us busy until our order arrived ( which was quick ) and our drinks were replenished often.   It was just the experience I would expect and a quality restaurant.   A Stetson Hat-tip to Texas Roadhouse for a completely excellent meal!

I know this is another chain restaurant but everything has always been good, every time I've gone.

Their food choices are made up of homey, steakhouse and or southern style. I've had and liked the house salad, catfish, country-fried chicken, skewered shrimp, filet medallions, & ribs. Their sides have always been good too.

Supposedly, they're also known for their margaritas? I've ordered one in the past and it was pretty average. 

Service has always been hit or miss. Nothing awful just....meh.

This place is always busy so I recommend calling ahead! The waits for a table can be very long.

images.alt: Photo of Cafe Giorno - Lafayette, IN, United States
Photo of Cafe Giorno - Lafayette, IN, United States
Photo of Cafe Giorno - Lafayette, IN, United States

reviews.text:
VERY delighted with my custom drink. She tailored my iced mocha blend to my requests. The baristas clearly know what they're doing and it just feels so easy to be here. Will likely be back too many times. Competitive prices. Have yet to try the wraps but looking forward to them. 

Heard mention that Saturday mornings they will stream sports, if you're into that.

Stopped in to get a hot chocolate for my boys during the Christmas parade. Girl at the counter (she was like 12) was nice and that's why we have 2 stars. The Hot chocolate was terrible. It was thin, watery and didn't taste remotely good. Seemed like they charged me $5 for a single packet of Swiss miss in lukewarm water in a 16oz cup.

What a delicious lunch my colleagues and I just enjoyed! Tasty sandwiches, I had the Reuben which was fantastic... fresh hot & delicious, along w a fresh salad. I would highly recommend this wonderful specialty coffee cafe!
Stopped by for a quick work lunch. Great sandwich, the ladies were awesome at helping me out. I'll have to stop by again and see what goodies they have to take home.

This was my first time in The Weathered Plow Farmers Market and it certainly won't be my last - heading there after I get off of work today! :) I tried their ham salad and will tell you that it is hands down, my favorite ham salad ever! I definitely couldn't make it better than they did even if I tried - and I have tried. I'm very picky about things like this, ham salad, potato salad etc. I don't like a lot of extra stuff in it - ham salad doesn't need grapes, celery, onion, walnuts etc. if it's good ham salad and that is what this is. Very simple but very delicious. The service was excellent as well and they have some really yummy looking homemade items in their refrigerated section that I will be trying as well. I hope that you give them a try and enjoy their store as much as I do!

We stumbled upon this place after getting off the highway. What a great little place! I got a veggie sandwich and it was the freshest most delicious veggie sandwich I have ever had! Tomatoes were ripe and perfect. We'd highly recommend!

I love this place!  I am originally from Northern Indiana around Amish country so this place makes me feel not so homesick. (even though the owners are German Baptist)  Awesome produce, meats, and dry goods and their subs are OUTSTANDING! Sometimes it is hard to get there because Schuyler is so crazy busy all the time, but if you approach from the South on Schuyler you don't have to make a left turn into the parking lot, or if you take Underwood down to 24th Street you can come in through the back.  A little known fact is that Axl Rose's childhood home is just about a half block away down 24th Street.  Also check out the crafted wood items and soaps.
