reviews.text:
In stark contrast to to the other food trucks that have been in our area lately. This one was fantastic. The food, which admittedly is comfort type food, was awesome. I had a mac and cheese grilled cheese sandwich, g-fries, and the jalapeno poppers and the food was excellent. It was ready super quick. It was hot and cooked perfect. And the staff and service was really nice and courteous.

In fact we liked the food so much we went back and got some more 45 minutes later. It was that good. I hope they come back to the area again real soon.

What a fabulous concept with great people. This truck is vegetarian and has vegan options. I had my first ever Beyond Burger! It way over exceeded my expectations. This dish was so good. The zucchini pickles made it pop! Try it with Secret Munchie sauce on the side. This was a special, but they should have it all year. Seriously one of the best burgers I've had in a long time and it was not even meat. Thanks to them for bringing it hard! The lemonade is also always delicious and the Mac bites are great too. Props to them for the concept, seasonal food, and delicious ideas. Can't wait for my next one!
Great fresh food! They always have lots of options to choose from. I always choose this truck when we are at food truck events!

SUPER local food truck and proud of it! I bookmarked their page a while back, and it's actually quite interesting. I'm not vegan or vegetarian in the least, but I've bought my lunch from them on more than one occasion. And it was good for that. Fortunately for me, I worked on campus, so when I got out of class, I'd make a short detour to where it was parked next to RAWL (one of their stops at the time), and pick up up something to eat. At that time, it tended to be the the grilled cheese and tater tots.

Actually, it's hard for me to write anything about their food because they're so good about changing up their menu and having new things. They're really big on creativity and using local ingredients. For example, they got a boatload of millet sometime back and start asking around what people thought they should make from it to sell. Said webpage will also tell you their schedule, menus, and whatnot. Overall, it's typically American comfort food, but I've seen items with the occasional Mexican or Italian or Greek influence. Great prices, fun, and carefully thought out dishes.

Prepare yourself to wait for a bit after ordering. Staff are super friendly and open about any questions you have about the food. In general, they tend to be very responsive about feedback and ideas you may have. Mostly though, VIEW THEIR WEBSITE (as provided above). They provide the menu for each event on Facebook, announce special events and where they're going to be on Twitter, and their website (emtfoodtruck.com) has a calendar summarizing where they'll be and what kind of weather that day will be having. Speaking as someone who had dropped by one day without realizing that it was going to rain? This is very convenient. 

Like a number of noteworthy local restaurants, there are a number of local food trucks that you'll find at pretty much every big local event (festivals and such). This is one of them. If they're in your area, I'd highly recommend you to try it at least once.

Delicious vegetarian/vegan food. I've tried their burgers & fries, chili, and so many specials. I've never been disappointed! A friend once tried their sandwich and did not believe it came from a food truck. They offer vegan cheeses/vegan dips; if you want a vegan option, just ask... they usually have many to choose from!

I wish they had a permanent location, though. I miss the food through winter.

We hired EMT Food Truck as one of two food trucks to cater our wedding this summer and are so glad we did! Amber was incredibly easy to work with throughout the process and very flexible on menu choices. The food was delicious and while we don't have a lot of friends or family that are vegetarians, most people didn't even realize that they were only serving vegetarian food. They also got food out quickly to our guests and were reasonable priced. I would without a doubt recommend EMT for a quick bite around Lafayette or for your next event. Thank you, Amber and the rest of the team!

Just had one of the best tasting grilled cheese sandwich I have ever had.

I will definitely look for them again.

I LOVE THIS FOOD TRUCK! I've ate their food at least a dozen times in the last few years and have never once been disappointed. The food truck is completely vegetarian with several vegan options as well. That being said however, I think even the most avid meat eater will find anything from this truck delicious and satisfying. Their fry dipping sauce is amazing, and I'll even dip my burger in it. This is definitely the best place (and one of the ONLY places) in town to get a veggie burger. The savory waffles they use as bread/buns may seem a little strange at first but once you eat them you'll never want a sandwich on regular bread again. This is comfort food at its best, I just can't say enough nice things about this food truck! I wish they weren't closed during the winter :( but it gives me one more thing to look forward to in the spring.

So good!  We got food from them today at the West Lafayette Farmers Market.  I had the GC&T (grilled cheese and tomato), which had the freshest, juiciest heirloom tomatoes ever.  My husband had a black bean burger & fries, which he really liked.  Both sandwiches came on delicious, crispy homemade waffles.  Prices are pretty reasonable, especially for my sandwich which was only $5.  I think most if not all of their food is vegetarian but its very appealing even to non-vegetarians like us.  We will definitely be stalking them in the future!

The EMT food truck is excellent!  We've been there twice - once, when it was parked outside of People's. We had the mac and cheese nuggets and the pretzel sticks, and both were great.  We returned when the truck was parked at Mosey Down Main Street, and our group all had sandwiches.  All of the sandwiches they had that day were vegetarian - mine was a grilled mac and cheese sandwich, and everyone else had a black been burger with mac and cheese and buffalo sauce on top.  Everything was amazing! The sandwiches have waffles as bread, which sounds weird, but is really good.  They also had the option of regular or sweet potato fries (the sweet potato fries were awesome).  The truck moves around town and is open for lunch and sometimes dinner - you have to go to their website to see where they will be.

My only complaint is that they don't come to campus during the week.  Since that's where I work, it's hard to get downtown or somewhere else during lunch time, and I am sure that is true for many Purdue employees.

Let me start off stating I am NOT vegan or vegetarian.  What a surprise, found the truck on our first visit to People's Brewing and tried several items with my wife.  We used to love the food trucks in Chicago and San Diego and really missed having the trucks when we moved back. We will be following EMT, the food is fantastic even without my usual protein preferences.  Can't wait to catch up to them again to try the rest of their menu!
The Mac bites are super with secret dressing.  Also the mozzarella tomato salad with chipotle dressing!  To say nothing about the sweet, sweet potato fries!  Yum. Reasonably priced too!

My friend and I stopped by for a quick lunch... Which wasn't that quick for a food truck. I ordered the Triple B burger with fries and my friend ordered the Gburger with chips. My burger was below average, soft waffles, pretty dry and lacking some crunch from a veggie or two. The 'secret sauce' that comes with the fries is NOT spicy so I recommend adding some Sriracha to it. My friends' burger was ok, she had trouble finishing it because it was so dense and bland. For the prices they charge, we had higher expectations. Also, bottled water for $1.50?! Puh-lease, this is Lafayette, Indiana.

reviews.text:
This is a perfect place to come hang out with friends in a very chill environment. There's plenty of seating, including a more private booth area. They can easily accommodate a large group.

The prices are more than fair. For a group of four people, choosing the most expensive Hookah option, you're only paying $5 per person. We split one and hung out there for a few hours.

The food is also very good. The hummus appetizers are also very affordable and delicious. It's a great change of pace from the chain places all around. There are great drink specials as well! 

The employees are all extremely nice and helpful. They gave us a lot of good tips on what to try. When we left, one of my friends left his card on the table, and one of the employees sprinted down the street after us to return it. 

I highly recommend giving this place a try. You won't regret the unique experience and the relaxing vibe you get from them!

Service 5/5
Food 3/5

Due to the COVID-19 situation, we've been avoiding going out to eat, instead preferring to get food delivered to our place or avail of curbside delivery. These guys were really helpful and were more than happy to cater to our preferences of contactless payment and dropped the food off in our car trunk. Service is quick. 

Food was a little disappointing. The paneer sandwich/wrap in tzatziki sauce was lacklustre. The paneer in itself was pretty bland. It just seemed like they had thrown in some paneer cubes and dripped some sauce over it. Definitely needs more work. The Egyptian spicy fries were very good. The vegetarian samosas were also tasty. Falafel was ok.

First time stepping into this place even though I have lived in the area for nearly 15 years, realized I should not have waited this long! Us quattro of guys was hankering for gyros and got treated well from the moment we stepped in, wish I got the skinny guy's name, very polite chap and took our orders tho spread across 10 minutes as two showed up later and weren't sure what they wanted. The menu is a great size and gives many reasons to come back! The only issues are frustrating parking with only 1 hour slots typically impossible to find during the semester; a more serious problem for sensitive types, the Arabian inspired atmosphere is lightly smothered in hookah smells and holds to clothing. Thankfully we were taking food to go and noticed the hookah aura less as we were this proper food takes about 20 minutes. Good to know a quick dip in for "fast food" isn't realistic here. We broke open the gyros and burrito to discover them Mediterranean spices turned up to 11! My friend's raved about the fries and nothing edible in the wraps was left after a few minutes for one aggressive eater. For $7, this place is a no duh option for value, quality, and flavors!

I was excited to come here, but it left a lot to be desired.  It's a campus restaurant/bar.  Walking in, it had a good vibe and staff (and I think an owner) were friendly.  It was the food that was disappointing.

We ordered a falafel bowl and a lamb bowl.  The falafel bowl really fell short.  The falafel was fried far too much.  It was almost black it was so fried and I could barely cut into it.  Dry and not very flavorful.  I was disappointed that the olives used in the bowl weren't fresh, they were just plain black canned olives.  At the very least use a better quality canned olive like a kalmata.  The lamb was good, much better than the falafel, but it was missing one of the ingredients, onion, that was supposed to come with the bowl.

It was pretty disappointing.  I'm not sure I'll bother coming back to try something else.

TL;DR food is very poorly made and the meat is extremely dry. The service is worse.

Before I get to the food, I have been at Purdue for over 3 years and this place consistently disappoints. I ordered from this place via GrubHub. Now there were issues with GrubHub having a shortage of drivers, so my order got canceled after the food was already made. 

I called GrubHub and they informed me that they paid the restaurant (because they had already made the food) and refunded me for my order. I asked if I could walk to the restaurant and pick up the food because it was already paid for, and GrubHub told me that it was alright for me to go pick up the food. 

When I got to the restaurant, they told me that they could not give me the food for free because they weren't paid. I proceeded to get GrubHub on the phone in front of them and had them talk to GrubHub directly where they were told that they had indeed been paid for the food. After that (20+ minute) conversation, the staff told me that I couldn't get the food for free since GrubHub had refunded me, which made no sense since they had already been paid for the food. After another half hour back and forth (usually I would've let it go by this point, but I was extremely frustrated), they changed their story and told me that they legally cannot give me food that had been sitting out for over 40 minutes (the duration of our back and forth) and then tried to get me to pay for a new order. 

So service wise, this place would get a 0/5 if possible.

Food wise, it's okay. Nothing special, and rather bland. But you really shouldn't expect much from such a place.

Overall, I have yet to have anyone go there and actually recommend it. You're better off going to Chipotle down the street.
I'm leaving Purdue so I have to tell ppl to come to this place, it's just so chilling there. And their food and drinks are always incredible. Don't miss out.

We ordered two of the bowls for a pickup order, one was falafel and the other chicken. I arrived 10 minutes before the time I had requested and the meals were already sitting on the counter, not under a heat lamp. 

The rice was cold and clumpy, while the chicken was tasteless. We had to mix in our own spices to get any semblance of taste.

I really enjoyed my first experience in hookah with my girlfriend(newbies). Our experience was great. I love the way the staff help us pick out a our flavors and explain on how to use. We also order food, which was the fried platter and it was delicious. We will definitely be back, can't wait to experience this with warmer weather.

Egyptian goes mobile. 

I'd always wanted to try the Egyptian so what better place then The Taste of Tippecanoe event. I strolled up to their tent and saw the gyro spinning,  so I went for the gyro sandwich. 

The gyro sandwich had been prewrapped, so it wasn't very warm or super fresh tasting but still pretty decent.  The bread may have been sitting out too long so it was sort of dry,  but we were at a festival. Big chunks of tomato and chopped onions, simple and decent. 

Overall, I would try out the brick and mortar restaurant  to get a real feel for their food and try out their hookha. But so far I'd rate the food average. 

Amanda out.

We had lunch here on a pleasant Friday afternoon in October. The front wall was open and we sat right next to it and watched people walk by. Great setting. 

There were a few people smoking the hookahs but I didn't notice too much since the wall was open and I was right next to it. This place is 21+ only.

Drink menu was extensive and they had some great tropical cocktail options. They also have drink specials every day. I had a Tutti Fruity drink. Felt like I could have been relaxing on a beach somewhere. Very good drink.

I ordered the lamb sandwich with salad instead of fries. Lamb was cooked correctly, but the sandwich was bland. At a Middle Eastern place, that is a mortal sin. Bland middle eastern food is another way of saying backyard, amateurishly-cooked american food. If the seasonings and the sauce aren't tasty, it's pointless. They did use the very thin style of pita which is not that common, but is better than the thick, bready ones for sandwiches.

The salad was chopped iceberg lettuce, diced red onions, diced tomatoes and a sprinkling of some type of white cheese. No dressing. Had to ask for some. Dressing was not impressive.

The real crime was that the menu said their homemade "tzatziki" sauce was on this lamb sandwich. Calling that tzatziki should be offensive to any Greek person in the world. It was sauce. I will give them that. But it had no cucumber flavor, didn't even taste like yogurt. So what the heck was that? It was bad, that's what it was.

Service was pretty good. Nice guy served us. But a flavorless lamb sandwich at a middle eastern place is unforgivable.

After having been to many hookah bars from California, and the Middle-East; this establishment left a lot to be desired. I could understand this being a prime spot for kids that have never smoked hookah, and are finally experiencing something new like this. But for anyone that has smoke previously, there were some issues that presented themselves up front. They use quick light coals which do not last long, and require a regular refresh. Even for quick lights, these seemed sub-par as you are unable to rotate the coals since they disintegrate. Yes, standard coal takes more effort to light, get to temperature, and maintain. But it smokes more evenly, and ultimately would require less product since 3-coals can last well over an hour. The flavors sound nice, however when we received ours, it was clear that they didn't add the flavor, which was validated by the server when we complained. We received a new flavor at no charge. The service was fine, but the food options we wanted were out, so we stuck to coffee and an iffy tiramisu. I would not come back, but I do think this would be a pretty awesome spot if I was a new college kid, and had never tried hookah before!
Would not recommend the shawarma sandwich. The garlic hummus was not good. Fries were good and delivery was fast! I just didn't like the sandwich.

We went here for lunch and it was pretty good. I liked their bowl and kabobs better than sandwiches. Food took around 20 minutes, but quality was good. It's good spot for leisure lunch. I didn't try Hookah, so can't comment on that. Overall service was good. I recommend this place.

Went here while visiting some friends at Purdue. 

3 stars for the food, 3 for the drinks, 3 for the hookah, and 5 for the service. We went in with a group of about 10 people relatively late on a night that was snowing pretty hard. We ordered drinks and several of the appetizers including falafel, hummus, samosas, and the spicy fries. I can't really complain about any of them, they were pretty much what I was expecting. My favorite was probably the spicy fries.

The hookah set up was okay. I won't lie, our group was full of people who are a bit of hookah snobs. I'm used to smoking out of my KM with a Lotus and Dream Hose at home. The hookah we smoked out of seemed kind of cheap and the hose was the thin washable plastic kind. They also use quick-light coals which I am not a huge fan of. With that being said, the flavor was good, the clouds were thick, and the bowl never got harsh despite how long our session was. The staff was super attentive about bringing us more coals and seemed friendly and knowledgeable.

If I am ever in the area, I will definitely come back!

I was greeted by a young man who got me seated, and I told them I'd never done hookah before. He got pretty excited and explained a lot about what they can do - he seemed really excited about his job. 

After a bit of chit chat he let me have the menu, and I had a margarita, the plain fries (my decision, but under the urging of the server as well, evidently the Egyptian fries are not very good) and straight strawberry hookah. 

He mixed a lot of different things to make it, and told me he put in some things to make the strawberry taste really come out, and man, it did. It was really good! Great smoking experience, and the coals were very consistently shifted. 

The fries ended up being fantastic, with just the right amount of crunchiness. They weren't greasy, but I do think they could have been salted more, but then again, that's what a shaker is for. The margarita was well mixed and flavorful. I also ended up having a buttery nipple - the alcohol ended up overpowering the other tastes on that one, but I wasn't disappointed by it by any means. 

If I'm in the area again, I would definitely come here again. I'd love to make it a hangout spot for me and my friends. The waitstaff was really friendly and the service was fast and efficient.

Our first experience at the Egyptian Café. It's been very pleasurable. Our server was tremendous, a super senior at Purdue University!  

I enjoyed the next grill bowl, the rest of our party had dinner plates with me next grill.

Overall very enjoyable experience. I would recommend it, and plan to come back!
Go to this place only for hookah. It takes very long for the food to arrive. The main course  was served before the appetizer. The food is okayish.

Ordered via the online delivery service, which was pricy for the food and the lack of quality. First of all- the lamb sandwich was made w beef. The fries were soggy and too greasy. 

We also ordered the chicken shawarma bowl and it was very bland, the rice was clumped together and the cucumber sauce was so bland it tasted like plain yogurt w a hint of cucumber. The Stuffed grapes leaf appetizer, while nice amount of them was provided, it mostly went to the trash as it tested like like warm mushy bland rice w a bit of meat. 

We won't be ordering from here again. Many other places in the area have similar cuisines and are much tastier.

Very relaxed atmosphere during the day, a great spot to shoot the shit with friends and relax. We asked them to "mix a fruity flavor" instead of choosing one off of their list, and it was pretty good - they know their hookah for sure. 

Food was also great, not sure why they've gotten such shitty review on that count. Uh, maybe don't order delivery from a hookah lounge? I had the grilled veggie bowl which was delish, and the man-friend gives 4.7 stars to the gyro. 

Minus one star for pretty slow food service, although we had hookah to keep us busy. Also had a weirdly, excessively attentive server who just tried too hard to be our friend.

I've tried Buttered Chicken Masala and Chicken Tiki Masala everywhere in town, this is the absolute best that there is. I generally order it delivered as I work nights, and it's ALWAYS piping hot, portioned very generously, and always cooked just like the previous time I ordered it. I always get a side of fries subbed in for the salad. The sauce is absolutely divine, and mixed with their rice it's even better. Seriously, this is their most expensive dinner item, but its the absolute best in town, and the only one worth ordering.

reviews.text: This gas station is conveniently located and is always clean. Don't get me wrong- it's a typical average gas station, but has a boost from its friendly staff and other patrons.

reviews.text: It's nice to have another dining option on this side of campus, this location is located in the new Griffin residence hall. There are several 15 minute parking spots right in front, perfect for grabbing takeout. The employees are friendly and polite, just like every Chick-fil-a I've been to. Can't go wrong with a Spicy Chicken sandwich!

reviews.text: Picked up takeout of South Indian fast food (poori), chaat, and chicken tikka masala. The flavors and spices were great. I wish I had ordered the dosa or other South Indian food.

We placed an order in the restaurant and had our food ready to carry out within 10 minutes. The service was good and fast, and the food was delicious! We got the chicken tikka masala and lamb biriyani. Both were delicious. This wil become a regular spot from now on

Tried this place for the first time last night. I tried a combo plate with paneer masala and butter chicken. Both dishes were really delicious. For $12, you do not get a ton of food, but I wanted to try two items.

When I used to visit LaLa in 2012-2016, making trips from IU to see my best friend, we never got Indian food. That was mostly because we knew the best Indian food was made in our houses, but also because there wasn't anything great to try.

When I visited my cousin, an undergraduate at Purdue, last fall, I was surprised to see that she wanted to go to Dakshin. After all, there was so much on campus now, and I'd just brought her a truckload of Indian goodies from home! Not to mention that Purdue is supposed to have some of the best dining hall food in the country.

But away we went, to grab her gobi manchurian, and after a few bites I saw why - it's undeniably spicy, evoking the level of spice you get with dishes in India. The place is also canteen-like in nature: customer service is a non-parameter, and the food speaks for itself.

I took my parents a few months later during a visit and they stuck to their typical North Indian orders (despite Dakshin offering South Indian food): chole bhatura for dad, parotta-kurma for mom, and chili paneer for me. All three lived up, with my father even buying extras for later in the week! When an Indian dad willingly pays for extra Indian food to take to a household where cooking is a daily occurrence, you know you have a win on your hands.

I've tried quite a few Indian restaurants in the Lafayette and West Lafayette area and this one trumps them all!!! Amazing flavor, fast preparation, and great service! This is the place I would recommend if looking for tasty Indian cuisine in the Lafayette area!!

I ordered the paneer tikka masala and it was delicious! I found that the serving size was appropriate and I was even left with extra! The naan tastes fresh as well. I would come here again and would recommend this place to others (:

This food is pretty good for the food it has although some improvements on customer service and food presentations would be good. They made faces when I was taking time to order. Although the food came quickly but the daal seemed like it was just reheated and did not seem fresh. They didn't even give any onions with it. They could've also been polite while taking/ giving the order. Overall above average but needs improvement on areas. Thanks!

Pathetic food. I got a diarrhea from the veg Manchurian. It must be stale or something. The taste was below average. I can make better food at home than what I will pay for here. Staff is rude and when I called for an order, he kept me on hold and started talking with someone else in the shop even without telling. Please don't waste your money here. Instead, just watch some recipe videos and make food at home!

Well first things first, food was good and tasty. However, for the price... serving size was small, naan was half the size of what you get in N.california. 

Knocked off a star as service was really bad, it felt like most customers are floating population so the owner/cashier didn't really care to serve customers in a friendly manner. 
Not sure if the gratuity is included or because it is fast food style they dont expect people to tip them. Just felt that I need not have tipped looking at the service or rather dullness of it.

Their food is sickening! I just pointed something pretty randomly on the menu and it turned out good. However, the girl at the cashier gave me this nasty attitude that just made me didn't even stay one more sec in their restaurant. She was being extremely unfriendly to me and my friend the whole time, at the end when I was asking a punch on the punch card, she literally lied to me that I could only get punches for one specific dish, which was being said very differently from what was being printed on the paper. During the entire visit, my friend and I was polite, and nice, so I really had no idea where this girl's nasty attitude came from. The food is really good, but I'd definitely say get take out instead of intaking that cold face and unfriendly environment there.

somebody at this location STOLE MY CREDIT CARD number and used it to get pizza delivered there from hot box pizza in town. i know this from the credit card alert i got. I DONT LIVE ANYWHERE NEAR INDIANA and have never heard of dakshin. i trust the owner isn't the culprit (but dont worry, the authorities have already been alerted) so whoever did it needs to be fired. warning to the locals, PAY CASH IF YOU COME HERE.

It is a small place with good food. There are certain things which can be worked upon to make it better. I feel that the quantity is less as compared to other places (based on price) and the guy on the counter is pretty rude. I have been to this place for 3 times and it was always the same. The service is sometimes delayed.
The new owners and management made lots of improvements. Very tasty food, good spice level as requested.  And food reached tables quicker.

I had order Idli Sambhar since the ownership has been changed, and believe me it was the best Sambhar I could taste, I am really happy that the new owners are Doing real amazing job only thing always bother me is the quantity of Sambhar please if you guys can work on that it wasn't good enough for 4 idli's Please keep this good consistent taste in your food.

reviews.text: Cute coffee shop location in WL, just blocks away from campus. They make a good iced coffee but also offer up food options like crepes and gelato. Indoor and outdoor seating available.
Cool vibe... great coffee! Was surprised at the interior space and high quality menu! Looks like fun place to "hang"!

Love love love Greyhouse!! Stopped by this morning for a lil coffee/brunch date while visiting some Purdue friends (such a nice location from campus, by the way). 
The aesthetic of the coffeehouse was perfect. Classy, cozy, cool - perfect for getting some work done or just hanging out. I also loved all the merch and coffee/tea accessories they sell by the counter!!
It was busy this morning, but not terrible. We got our drinks relatively fast and enjoyed them as we waited for our crepés. Those took a little bit of a wait, but that was expected. 
I ordered the Cardamom Mint Tea latte from their seasonal menu, and while the flavor was delicious, I definitely wish I had ordered something more hearty. It was a very light latte, and not exactly what I was looking for. I also ordered the Sundrenched Veggie crepé + added an egg and WOW - it was so so yummy. A perfect savory brunch. I do have to say that the egg was a little bit nonexistent, but I didn't mind too much because the crepé was so good anyways. 
Overall, I LOVE the concept of the crepery. Such a simple delight that pairs so well with their extensive coffee and tea menu. I can't wait to come back to try their gelato (I was eyeing the Blue Moon gelato!).

Greyhouse is elite W. LaLa. That's the best way I can describe it: it's the place you study at and feel like you'r a student at an Ivy League. It's the dessert and coffee spot you meet a professor at. It's where you take your parents to say 'look guys, I'm an adult! Now, buy me my fancy latte please.' It's the anti-college, and beautifully so.

I'll be the first to admit I've actually never had the food there: I'd heard meh things and there was always too much else to try. Crepes overwhelm me, but I've heard the ones here are worth trying.

My companion and I rounded out our evening with Greyhouse gelato and as a tiramisu aficionado I must say: this did NOT disappoint. It played a symphony, of sorts, and when I revisited for coffee a few weeks later, I realized why Greyhouse is a Purdue favorite.

It is nurturing, comforting, and inspiring, all in the same cup (pardon the pun). Is it expensive? Most definitely. But it teaches you to grow up and embrace the finer things in life, even if for only a moment.
Great coffee and tea.  Long waits at times, but this is not a pour and go place so it is worth it.  Just wait and you won't be disappointed.  If you are lucky you get a nice day and sit outside.
I love going here every time I'm in need of a little pick me up. Everything I have ordered here has been delicious from the coffee to the smoothies to the crepes.

Cute coffee shop located off the main trip by Purdue's campus. I was in town for a wedding and stopped in to get a latte. I went with an iced vanilla bean latte with oat milk. They have lots of dairy substitutes which I appreciate. It was very busy on a Saturday morning so I had to wait about 10 minutes for my drink. The man who took my order at the counter gave me a heads up which was nice. Lots of great looking menu items. Stop by if you're in the area!

This is the ideal college town coffee shop. It is trendy, with plenty of space to find a seat. The menu is fantastic, with seasonal options to keep things fresh. The food offered is tasty, and the drinks are top notch. The staff is also super knowledgeable about their products. I've come here twice and have been super impressed. This will be a regular stopping point for us when we come to West Lafayette.
Loved this coffee house! Great drinks and light breakfast options! Crepes were delicious!

I'm not a big coffee person but there's tea, crepes, smoothies, doughnuts, gelato, and more at Greyhouse. The environment is perfect and the remodel added so much space. I love the idea of events in the side room, be it kids book reading or graduate student talks. 

Greyhouse is located in the first floor of the historic Miller Building, now owned by Muinzer Management team. I recommend the London Fog tea served hot and a savory crepe of your choice. Greyhouse is perfect for meeting friends, doing group work, or cocooning yourself into study or relaxation mode. A favorite spot near Purdue.

I have been to Greyhouse Coffee twice, first time I ordered their Berries and cream crepes and second time I got The Hen breakfast crepe. I would say both times have been quite the disappointment. The berry crepe hardly had any berries, there was maybe half a strawberry and one blueberry, it was just filled with jam. The Hen crepe was full of cheese and potatoes; I kept digging until the very center to find any sign of eggs but no luck!! Considering the prices of their crepes it is unacceptable. I got the regular size medium roast coffee which was average. The ambience was above average for a coffee shop, hence the two stars.

I love their matcha and other tea drinks! Their matcha is ceremonial grade, so it's more expensive but well worth it. 
They also have fresh smoothies, pastries, and a gelato bar (if I'm not mistaken)

Still love the coffee, but my most recent visit left me kind of disappointed. The prices are really high especially for college students. I got a regular small coffee for over $3! Which is the highest price of all the coffee places in the area, coffee shop and chain--actually the highest I've ever seen and I've been a barista. It's a shame I can't go here as often because of how busy the location is and how expensive it is. I recognize this place is high quality, but it becomes difficult to support a business when it is so pricey. If you're planning on going here for a date...start saving.

Two issues I've discovered: $1+ for non-dairy milk - please stop. The menu is already overpriced and hounding dairy sensitives with extra cost on top of the San Fran bistro prices is a nasty trick. My sister and I randomly went for a small cheesecakes, crepe, and drink. $22! That is bonkers! Did I buy a small steak? I graduated out of the Purdue system a decade ago but when did college kids collect copious cash in their cashmere coats just to consider conducting coffee commerce?! Speaking of prices, you'd think there's decent reasons. Again, nope and please stop. The large size only gets more milk, not more syrup or coffee! (my sister discovered this and seems to be true from my recent samplings) This is quite the caffeinated mafia setup. Thankfully the beverages have the effects. Dreamy even, syrups are made in house and offer fantastic tantalizing flavors. Greyhouse has many right elements, cool and friendly staff, attempts at a mobile app and rewards program, quality beverages, Marsala chai, Dr. Strangelove latte, and frozen hot cocoa are the essential temptations. Crepes (tasty), gelato (more so), evil deserts, plenty of teas, and an occasional avo toast pop ups on the menu. It all adds up to a too frequently lack of space amidst their alternative urban atmosphere. The recent remodel improved traffic flow but some of the food items don't feel as right as they used to be. Not to mention I'm still on those two issues. I've had friends tell me they love Greyhouse but often don't buy anything because it is so overpriced! Hello, earth to Greyhouse! Take a hint. Make it easier to add rewards when I don't purchase in the app like a normal coffee shop linking rewards to my card (Toast, Square). Show some love and ensure fair discounts are pushed through the mobile app, not just eventually showing up after I've taken out a small loan. But until then, we all can hit up Fuel near the engineering mall, Vienna next door, and Copper Moon over yonder. I love Sacred Grounds the most of all the area coffee drips tho they sadly close at 4 without weekend hours. Greyhouse needs to fair up prices and/or ensure loyal buyers (hopeful one here) are given due love and perks; maybe go the extra step for us all and ensure my $7.50 cup has a place to sit among those taking space without buying anything.
Busy and packed with students and non students alike. Coffee is delicious and so is their hot chocolate.
This Is a great spot to meet up with friends, study for class, or just take a break from your busy day. Very comfortable atmosphere with great customer service. Awesome food and drinks.

Great campus stop without the infuriating line and wait at the "cult coffee shop" in the union. They are awesome with service and coffee. The owner donates coffee to Northview church as well. Nice, quiet seating for an informal meeting. Although parking could be a challenge, its a great place.

Glad I gave this place a second chance.  Don't get me wrong, the drinks are delicious.  The last time I came here I felt like I got attitude, like the student workers were too cool for this alumnus.  Today's staff was much friendlier.  I feel like it's a little pricey for a college campus.  I know I wouldn't have been able to afford it when I was a student.

Friendly service, cool vibe with a variety of teas, sweets, and coffee. I think here is a good place to study, meet with friends or grab a bite to eat.  However, depending on what time you get here you could be waiting in quite the line and table. But, I'd like to visit again.

Always a wonderful experience here! Best coffee, polite workers & customers, and amazing crepes/donuts! 
If you enjoy good company & a place to catch up with a friend or work on your laptop- this is a perfect spot for either. The owner is also incredible and spoke with us at our table last time we were there, very kind hearted people!
